analyzed: avinābhāva niyamāt iti asya prakāra antareṇa vyākhyānam
translated: is explained in a different way as due to the rule of invariable concomitance.

original: athavā tridhaiva saḥ' iti sa pakṣadharmas triprakāra eva svabhāvakāryānupalambhākhyas tadaṃśena vyāpto nānyaḥ /
analyzed: athavā tridhā eva saḥ iti sa pakṣa dharmaḥ tri prakāraḥ eva svabhāva kārya anupalambha ākhyaḥ tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ na anyaḥ
translated: Or else, it is threefold only. That property of the subject is only of three kinds, known as natural, effect, and non-apprehension, and is pervaded by that part, not any other.

original: sa triprakāras
analyzed: sa tri prakāraḥ
translated: That threefold

original: p / / tadaṃśena vyāpta eveti sambhandhaḥ /
analyzed: tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ eva iti sambhandhaḥ
translated: is connected with being pervaded by that part only.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /🔽avinābhāvaniyamāt /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam  avinābhāva niyamāt
translated: What is the reason?🔽Because of the rule of invariable concomitance.

original: avinābhāvasya vyāpteḥ /
analyzed: avinābhāvasya vyāpteḥ
translated: Because of the pervasion of invariable concomitance.

original: trividha eva pakṣadharme niyamāt /
analyzed: trividhe eva pakṣa dharme niyamāt
translated: Only in the three kinds of property of the subject is there a rule.

original: trividhasya ca pakṣadharmasyāvinābhāvaniyamāt /🔽tena ca svabhāvakāryānupalambhātmakatrividhapakṣadharmavyatiriktā T / / na tadaṃśena vyāptā iti /
analyzed: trividhasya ca pakṣa dharmasya avinābhāva niyamāt  tena ca svabhāva kārya anupalambha ātmaka trividha pakṣa dharma vyatiriktā na tad aṃśena vyāptā iti
translated: And because of the rule of invariable concomitance of the three kinds of property of the subject.🔽And because of that, it is said that what is excluded from the threefold property of the subject consisting of nature, effect, and non-apprehension is not pervaded by that part.

original: trividhaś ca kāryasvabhāvānupalabdhirūpaḥ pakṣadharmas tadaṃśena vyāpta eveti na tasyāhetutvam ity uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: trividhaḥ ca kārya svabhāva anupalabdhi rūpaḥ pakṣa dharmaḥ tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ eva iti na tasya ahetu tvam iti uktam bhavati
translated: And it is said that the threefold property of the subject in the form of effect, nature, and non-apprehension is pervaded by that part only, so it is not a non-cause.

original: tatas trividhahetubāhyeṣv avinābhāvābhāvād dhetuvyavahāraṃ kurvantaḥ /
analyzed: tatas trividha hetu bāhyeṣu avinābhāva abhāvāt hetu vyavahāram kurvantaḥ
translated: Therefore, those who make the designation of a reason in what is external to the threefold reason,

original: trividhe ca hetāv avinābhāvasyāvaśyam bhāvābhāvād ahetutvam ācakṣāṇānirastā bhavati / S / /
analyzed: trividhe ca hetau avinābhāvasya avaśyam bhāva abhāvāt ahetu tvam
translated: and those who declare non-causality in the threefold reason because of the absence of the necessary presence of invariable concomitance, are refuted.

original: cārvākāḥ
analyzed: cārvākāḥ
translated: The Cārvākas

original: hetvābhāsālakṣaṇānabhidhānepi tatsūcanam /🔽tatraitat syāt hetvābhāsānām api lakṣaṇam abhidhānīyaṃ tatra śiṣyāṇāṃ hetuvyavahāranivṛttaya ity āha hetvābhāsās tato 'para iti /
analyzed: tatra etat syāt hetvābhāsānām api lakṣaṇam abhidhānīyam tatra śiṣyāṇām hetu vyavahāra nivṛttayaḥ iti āha hetvābhāsāḥ pare iti
translated: Even without stating the definition of fallacious reasons, they are indicated.🔽Here this may be said: The definition of fallacious reasons should also be stated, so that students may refrain from using them as reasons. Therefore, he says, Fallacious reasons are different from that.

original: tataḥ pakṣadharmas tadaṃśena vyāpta iti hetulakṣaṇād apare anye tallakṣaṇavikalā hetvābhāsā gamyanta eveti na tallakṣaṇam ucyate /
analyzed: tatas pakṣa dharmaḥ tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ iti hetu lakṣaṇāt apare anye tad lakṣaṇa vikalāḥ hetvābhāsāḥ gamyante eva iti na tallakṣaṇam ucyate
translated: Other than that, from the definition of a reason as the property of the subject, pervaded by that in part, those lacking that definition, the fallacious reasons, are understood to be different. Therefore, their definition is not stated.

original: tathā hi pakṣadharmaḥ ity ukte yatra pakṣadharmatā nāsti na sa hetuḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi pakṣa dharmaḥ iti ukte yatra pakṣa dharma tā na asti na sa hetuḥ
translated: For example, when it is said the property of the subject, that which lacks the property of the subject is not a reason.

original: tadaṃśena vyāptaḥ iti vacane yatra tadaṃśavyāptiviraho viparyayavyāpter vyāpakasya vā tatrāvaśyam bhāvābhāvāt /
analyzed: tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ iti vacane yatra tad aṃśa vyāpti virahaḥ viparyaya vyāpteḥ vyāpakasya vā tatra avaśyam bhāva abhāvāt
translated: When it is said pervaded by that in part, where there is a lack of pervasion by that in part, due to the pervasion of the opposite or the pervaded,

original: te heturūpavikalatayā hetvābhāsāḥ asiddhaviruddhānaikāntikā gamyanta eva /
analyzed: te hetu rūpa vikala tayā hetvābhāsāḥ asiddha viruddha anaikāntikāḥ gamyante eva
translated: those are understood to be fallacious reasons, due to lacking the form of a reason, such as being unestablished, contradictory, or inconclusive.

original: tathā hi yallakṣaṇoyo 'rthaḥ śiṣyasya vyutpāditaḥ tallakṣaṇavirahite na tadvyavahāraṃ
analyzed: tathā hi ṛthaḥ śiṣyasya vyutpāditaḥ tad lakṣaṇa virahite na tad vyavahāram
translated: For example, an object that has been explained to a student with a certain definition is not treated as having that definition when it lacks that definition.

original: svayam eva pravartayiṣyati atadrūpaparihārenaiva tadrūpapratipattor iti na tatra🔽yatnaḥ phalavān bhavati /
analyzed: svayam eva pravartayiṣyati a tad rūpa parihārena eva tad rūpa pratipattoḥ iti na tatra  yatnaḥ phalavān bhavati
translated: It will itself operate by the mere exclusion of that which is not of that form, because of the understanding of that form. Therefore,🔽effort is not fruitful in that case.🔽🔽

original: S / / yat tv anyatra hetvābhāsavyutpādanaṃ tanmandabuddhīnadhikṛtya /
analyzed: yat tu anyatra hetvābhāsa vyutpādanam tat manda buddhīn adhikṛtya
translated: [The author] himself will explain [the definition of a logical reason] by avoiding a form that is not [a logical reason] and by establishing a form that is [a logical reason]. Therefore, effort in that [definition] is not fruitful.

original: idaṃ tu prakaraṇaṃ vipulamatīn uddiśya praṇītam saṃkṣepataḥ
analyzed: idam tu prakaraṇam vipula matīn uddiśya praṇītam saṃkṣepataḥ
translated: [The author] has composed this treatise for the sake of those of vast intellect,

original: iti vacanāt /🔽T / / ta eva hi saṃkṣepoktaṃ yathāvad avagantuṃ kṣamāḥ na mandamatayaḥ /
analyzed: iti vacanāt  t te eva hi saṃkṣepa uktam yathāvat avagantum kṣamāḥ na manda matayaḥ
translated: as stated [in the opening verse].🔽For only they are able to understand the meaning as it is when it is stated concisely, not those of dull intellect.

original: teṣāṃ vistarābhidhānam antareṇa yathāvad arthapratipatter abhāvāt /
analyzed: teṣām vistara abhidhānam antareṇa yathāvat artha pratipatteḥ abhāvāt
translated: For they are unable to understand the meaning as it is without an extensive explanation.

original: ata evārthākṣiptopanyāsapūrvakam eva hetvābhāsalakṣaṇaṃ tatropavarṇitam iti /
analyzed: atas eva artha ākṣipta upanyāsa pūrvakam eva hetvābhāsa lakṣaṇam tatra upavarṇitam iti
translated: For this very reason, the definition of fallacious reasons is stated there only after introducing [the definition of a logical reason] by implication.

original: tadatra vyākhyāne hetulakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: tat atra vyākhyāne hetu lakṣaṇam
translated: Therefore, in this explanation, the definition of a logical reason

original: p / / hetusāmkhyāniyamaḥ tasya ca trividhasya hetutvāvadhāraṇaṃ tadubhayakāraṇaṃśliṣṭanirdeśāt
translated: is the rule regarding the number of logical reasons, and the determination of the nature of those three kinds of logical reasons, because they are taught together as the cause of both.

original: hetvābhāsalakṣaṇānabhidhānakāraṇaṃ ceti ṣaḍarthāḥ śloke 'tra nirdiṣṭā iti /
analyzed: ca iti ṣaṣ arthāḥ śloke nirdiṣṭāḥ iti
translated: And the reason for not stating the definition of fallacious reasons. These are the six meanings indicated in this verse.

original: kiñcid idam api sādhu dṛśyate tridhaiva kāryasvabhāvānupalabdhibhedabhinnaḥ sa hetuḥ /
analyzed: kiñcid idam api sādhu dṛśyate tridhā eva kārya svabhāva anupalabdhi bheda bhinnaḥ sa hetuḥ
translated: Moreover, this much is also seen to be correct: that reason is divided only into three kinds, as distinguished by the difference of effect, nature, and non-apprehension.

original: tathā / tridhaiva pakṣadharmānvayavyatirekarūpabhedāt triprakāra eva trirūpa eva /
analyzed: tathā tridhā eva pakṣa dharma anvaya vyatireka rūpa bhedāt tri prakāraḥ eva tri rūpaḥ eva
translated: Similarly, it is only of three kinds, only of three forms, due to the difference of the form of the property of the subject, positive concomitance, and negative concomitance.

original: S / / tadaṃśavyāptivacanenānvayavyatirekayor abhidhānāt /
analyzed: tad aṃśa vyāpti vacanena anvaya vyatirekayoḥ abhidhānāt
translated: Because positive and negative concomitance are stated by the statement of pervasion of that part.

original: nābādhitaviṣayatvādirūpāntarayogy api sa hetuḥ /
analyzed: na abādhita viṣaya tva ādi rūpa antara yogī api sa hetuḥ
translated: That reason is not fit to have another form such as having an unobstructed domain, etc.

original: kutaḥ / yataḥ hetvābhāsās tato 'pare tataḥ trividhāt savabhāvādeḥ /
analyzed: kutas yatas tatas pare trividhāt
translated: Why? Because the fallacious reasons are different from that, from that threefold nature, etc.

original: pakṣadharmādirūpatrayayogino vā apare anye saṃyogyādayo 'bādhitaviṣayatvādivyatiriktarūpavanto vā /
analyzed: pakṣa dharma ādi rūpa traya yoginaḥ vā apare anye saṃyogi ādayaḥ bādhita viṣaya tva ādi vyatirikta rūpavantaḥ vā
translated: Or, others such as conjunction, etc. have the three forms such as the property of the subject, etc., or have a form other than having an unobstructed domain, etc.

original: kasmād / /
analyzed: kasmāt
translated: Why?

original: avinābhāvasya atraiva trividha eva trirūpa eva ca hetau niyamād anyatra svabhāvādivyatiriktakte
analyzed: avinābhāvasya atra eva trividhe eva trirūpe eva ca hetau niyamāt anyatra
translated: Because invariable concomitance is restricted only to that threefold and threefold reason, not elsewhere, in what is possible to have another form apart from nature, etc.

original: rūpāntarasambhavini vā avinābhāvābhāvād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: rūpa antara sambhavini vā avinābhāva abhāvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because there is no invariable concomitance in what is possible to have another form.

original: na hi svabhāvādivyatirikte pratibandhanibandhanasyā 'vinābhāvasya saṃbhavaḥ tadvati vā rūpāntarasya /
analyzed: na hi svabhāva ādi vyatirikte pratibandha nibandhanasya a vinābhāvasya saṃbhavaḥ tadvati vā rūpa antarasya
translated: For invariable concomitance, which is based on restriction, is not possible apart from nature, etc., or in what has that, in another form.

original: tathā cāca satyevāvinābhāve rūpāT / /ntarasya na sambhavas tathā ṣaḍlakṣaṇa ityādinā vakṣyati /
analyzed: tathā sati eva avinābhāve rūpāt na sambhavaḥ tathā ṣaṣ lakṣaṇaḥ ityādinā vakṣyati
translated: And thus, when there is indeed invariable concomitance, there is no possibility of anything other than form, as will be stated by having six characteristics and so on.

original: yadrūpa
analyzed: yadrūpa
translated: That form

original: tasyomayasya hetusaṃkhyāniyamasya hetutvāvadhāraṇasya kāraṇaṃ avinābhāvaniyama ity eta / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: tasya umayasya hetu saṃkhyā niyamasya hetu tva avadhāraṇasya kāraṇam avinābhāva niyamaḥ iti eta
translated: of which the restriction of the number of reasons and the ascertainment of the cause of the reason is the cause, that is the restriction of invariable concomitance. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: diṅnāgānusāreṇa pakṣaśabdasya dharmimātraparatvam /🔽pakṣadharmaḥ ity atra hetulakṣaṇe 'pi kriyamāṇe yadi samudāyaḥ pakṣekṣo
analyzed: pakṣa dharmaḥ iti atra hetu lakṣaṇe kriyamāṇe yadi samudāyaḥ pakṣa īkṣaḥ
translated: In accordance with Dinnāga, the word paksa refers only to the subject.

original: gṛhyate yo 'numānaviṣayas tadā sarvo hetur asiddhaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhyate yaḥ numāna viṣayaḥ tadā sarvaḥ hetuḥ asiddhaḥ
translated: Even if the definition of the reason is made in the phrase the property of the subject here, if the aggregate which is the object of inference is grasped as the subject, then all reasons are unestablished.

original: siddhau vā 'numānavaiyarthyam ity āha pakṣo dharmī iti /
analyzed: siddhau vā numāna vaiyarthyam iti āha pakṣaḥ dharmī iti
translated: Or if established, inference is pointless. Thus he says the subject is the property-possessor.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ samudāyavacanaḥ S / / pakṣaśabdo dharmimātre vartata iti cet /
analyzed: katham punar samudāya vacanaḥ pakṣa śabdaḥ dharmi mātre vartate iti ced
translated: But how can the word paksa which denotes an aggregate be used for the property-possessor alone? If this is asked,

original: avayave samudāyopacārāt /
analyzed: avayave samudāya upacārāt
translated: because the aggregate is figuratively used for its part.

original: pakṣākhyasya hi samudāyasya dvāv avayavau dharmī / dharmaś ca /
analyzed: pakṣa ākhyasya hi samudāyasya dvau avayavau dharmī dharmaḥ ca
translated: For the aggregate called subject has two parts: the property-possessor and the property.

original: tad atra dharmimātre samudāyopacārāt pakṣaśabdo vartate /
analyzed: tat atra dharmi mātre samudāya upacārāt pakṣa śabdaḥ vartate
translated: Here, the word subject is used figuratively for the property-possessor alone because the aggregate is figuratively used for its part.

original: tadekadeśatvaṃca samudāyopacāranimittam iti na sādhyadharmiṇo 'nyatra tatprasaṅgaḥ / taduktam
analyzed: samudāya upacāra nimittam iti na sādhya dharmiṇaḥ nyatra tad prasaṅgaḥ tat uktam
translated: And being a part of that is the basis for the figurative use of the whole, so it does not follow that it is elsewhere than the subject of the probandum. As it has been said:

original: samudāyasya sādhyatvāt dharmamātre ca dharmiṇi /
analyzed: samudāyasya sādhya tvāt dharma mātre ca dharmiṇi
translated: Because the whole is the probandum, and the property-possessor is merely a property,

original: amukhye 'py ekadeśatvāt sādhyatvam upacaryate //
analyzed: amukhye pi eka deśa tvāt sādhya tvam upacaryate
translated: even in the non-primary [case], because it is a part, it is figuratively said to be the probandum.

original: iti / PS III cf / HBtransl
analyzed: iti  ps iii
translated: Thus.

original: yasya hi ya ekadeśas tatra tādrūpyopacāraḥ /
analyzed: yasya hi yaḥ eka deśaḥ tatra tādrūpya upacāraḥ
translated: For that which is a part of something, there is figurative use of that form.

original: na hi paṭasyaikadeśe dagdhe kambalo dagdha ity upacāraḥ
analyzed: na hi paṭasya eka deśe dagdhe kambalaḥ dagdhaḥ iti upacāraḥ
translated: For when one part of a cloth is burned, there is no figurative use [saying] the blanket is burned.

original: p / / / diṅnāgavyākhyāne īśvarasenākśepas taduddhāraś ca /
translated: ... in the commentary of Dignāga, the reproach of Īśvarasena and its resolution.

original: tad etadācāryīyaṃvyākhyānamīśvarasenenākṣiptaṃ parihartuṃ pūrvapakṣayann āha prayojanety ādinā /
analyzed: tat etat ācāryīyam vyākhyānam īśvarasenena ākṣiptam parihartum pūrvapakṣayan āha prayojana iti ādinā
translated: In order to refute and answer this commentary of the master, [Dharmakīrti] takes up the prima facie view, beginning with purpose and so on.

original: na rtte prayojanādiṣṭraṃṣṭaṃ
analyzed: na ṛ te prayojana ādiḥ ṭraṃṣṭam
translated: The purpose, etc. are not stated,

original: mukhyaśabdārthalaṅghanam /
analyzed: mukhya śabda artha laṅghanam
translated: because of transgressing the primary meaning of the word.

original: PS III cf / HBtransl
analyzed: ps iii
translated: Thus.

original: ity asati prayojane nopacāro yuktaḥ /
analyzed: iti asati prayojane na upacāraḥ yuktaḥ
translated: When there is no purpose, figurative use is not appropriate.

original: tato dharmidharma ity evāstv itiparaḥ/
analyzed: tatas dharmi dharmaḥ iti eva astu iti paraḥ
translated: Therefore, let it be just property of the property-possessor, says the opponent.

original: na prayojanābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na prayojana abhāvaḥ
translated: There is no absence of purpose.🔽...

original: kutaḥ / sarvaś cāsau vivādāśrayo 'nyo dharmī yas tasya pratiṣedho 'rthaḥ prayojanaṃ
analyzed: kutas sarvaḥ ca asau vivāda āśrayaḥ nyaḥ dharmī yaḥ tasya pratiṣedhaḥ rthaḥ prayojanam
translated: Why? Because all that is the subject of dispute, and the negation of that is the purpose,

original: yasyopacārasya tadbhāvas tasmāt sarvadharmidharmapratiṣedhārthatvād upacārasya iti
analyzed: yasya upacārasya tad bhāvaḥ tasmāt sarva dharmi dharma pratiṣedha ārtha tvāt upacārasya iti
translated: the object, of the figurative expression. Because of that, due to the figurative expression having the purpose of negating all properties of the subject,

original: prayojanābhāvād ity asiddho hetuḥ /
analyzed: prayojana abhāvāt iti asiddhaḥ hetuḥ
translated: the reason is not established due to the absence of such a purpose.

original: ka evaṃ sati guṇa iti ced āha S / / T / / evaṃhi upacāre sati cākṣuṣatvādi
analyzed: kaḥ evam sati guṇaḥ iti ced āha t t evam hi upacāre sati cākṣuṣa tva ādi
translated: If it is asked how this is a virtue, he says: For thus, when there is figurative expression, audibility, etc.

original: ādigrahaṇāt kākasya kārṣṇyāt' ityādi vyadhikaraṇāsiddhaṃ parihṛtaṃ hetutvena nirastaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: ādi grahaṇāt kākasya kārṣṇyāt ityādi vyadhikaraṇa asiddham parihṛtam hetu tvena nirastam bhavati
translated: By the word etc., the reason that is avoided, refuted as a reason, by because a crow is black, etc., which is not established in the same substratum, is refuted.

original: dharmidharma iti tu sāmānyenābhidhānāt teṣām api hetutā syāditi /
analyzed: dharmi dharmaḥ iti tu sāmānyena abhidhānāt teṣām api hetu tā
translated: But because it is stated in a general way as property of the subject, those [reasons] would also be reasons.

original: asaty upacāre dharmigrahaṇād apy etatsidhyati /
analyzed: asati upacāre dharmi grahaṇāt api
translated: But even without figurative expression, this is established by the statement of the subject.

original: tato 'narthaka evopacāra ity āha paraḥ dharmavacanenāpi na kevalaṃ dharmivacanena /
analyzed: tatas narthakaḥ evā upacāraḥ iti āha paraḥ dharma vacanena api na kevalam dharmi vacanena
translated: Therefore, the opponent says that the figurative expression is indeed meaningless, not only by the statement of the subject, but also by the statement of the property.

original: dharmyāśrayasiddhau dharmiṇa āśrayaṇam āśrayaḥ parigrahas tasya siddhis tasyāṃ satyām /
analyzed: dharmi āśraya siddhau dharmiṇaḥ āśrayaṇam āśrayaḥ parigrahaḥ tasya siddhiḥ tasyām satyām
translated: When the substratum of the subject is established, the substratum, the support, the adoption, of the subject, when that is established.

original: kiṃ punar ddharmasya dharmyākṣepanimittam iti cet /
analyzed: kim punar ddharmasya dharmya ākṣepa nimittam iti
translated: If it is asked what is the reason for the implication of the property-possessor by the property,

original: parāśrayatvāt dharmiparatantratvāt dharmasya avaśyam asau dharmiṇam ākṣipati /
analyzed: para āśraya tvāt dharmi paratantra tvāt dharmasya avaśyam asau dharmiṇam ākṣipati
translated: [the answer is:] because the property is dependent on another, i.e., because the property is dependent on the property-possessor, it necessarily implies the property-possessor.

original: tato dharmivacanam atiricyamānaṃ viśiṣṭaṃ sādhyadharmiṇam eva pratipādayati /
analyzed: tatas dharmi vacanam atiricyamānam viśiṣṭam sādhya dharmiṇam eva pratipādayati
translated: Therefore, the word 'property-possessor', being redundant, indicates only the qualified property-possessor to be proven.

original: na dharmimātram /🔽syān matam dharmigrahaṇād viśiṣṭo 'tra dharmī kaścid abhipreta iti gamyate /
analyzed: na dharmi mātram  syāt matam dharmi grahaṇāt viśiṣṭaḥ tra dharmī kaścid abhipretaḥ iti gamyate
translated: Not just the property-possessor in general.🔽It may be thought that from the mention of the property-possessor, it is understood that a particular property-possessor is intended here.

original: sa tu sādhyadharmīti kuta ity āha pratyāsatter nyāyāt /🔽pratyāsattiś cātra dharmivacanasāmarthyād abhipreteti gamyate /
analyzed: sa tu sādhya dharmī iti kutas iti āha pratyāsatteḥ nyāyāt  pratyāsattiḥ ca atra dharmi vacana sāmarthyāt abhipretā iti gamyate
translated: But how is it known that it is the property-possessor to be proven? He says: by the rule of proximity.🔽And here, it is understood that proximity is intended by the power of the word 'property-possessor'.

original: vyāptautu nyāye dharmavacanenāpi dharmimātrākṣepātdharmigrahaṇavaiyarthyam /
analyzed: nyāye dharma vacanena api
translated: But in the case of the rule of pervasion, even by the mention of the property, there is the implication of just the property-possessor, so the mention of the property-possessor is pointless.

original: S / / pratyāsannatā ca sādhyadharmiṇa eva / tatra
analyzed: pratyāsanna tā ca sādhya dharmiṇaḥ eva tatra
translated: And the proximity is only of the property-possessor to be proven. There

original: p / / prathamaṃ hetūpadarśanāt /
analyzed: prathamam hetu upadarśanāt
translated: first, because the reason is shown.

original: na pratyāsatteḥ sādhyadharmiparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: na pratyāsatteḥ sādhya dharmi parigrahaḥ
translated: The property-possessor to be proven is not included by proximity.

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

original: dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇo 'pi na kevalaṃ sādhyadharmiṇaḥ pratyāsatteḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇaḥ pi na kevalam sādhya dharmiṇaḥ pratyāsatteḥ
translated: Not only of the property-possessor to be proven, but also of the property-possessor in the example, by proximity.

original: kadācidvyāptidarśanapūrvake prayoge dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇy api prathamaṃ hetusadbhāvopadarśanāt /
analyzed: prayoge dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi api prathamam hetu sadbhāva upadarśanāt
translated: Sometimes, in an inference where the pervasion is shown first, the presence of the reason is shown first even in the example-subject.

original: yadi na pratyāsatteḥ sādhyadharmisiddhiḥ pāriśeṣyāt tarhi bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadi na pratyāsatteḥ sādhya dharmi siddhiḥ pāriśeṣyāt tarhi bhaviṣyati
translated: If the establishment of the property-possessor to be inferred is not from proximity, then it will be by elimination.

original: yataḥ tadaṃśavyāptyā hetubhūtayā dṛṣṭāntadharmini dharmasya satvattvasiddheḥ /
analyzed: yatas tad aṃśa vyāptyā hetu bhūtayā dṛṣṭānta dharmini dharmasya satvat tva siddheḥ
translated: Because by the pervasion of that part, which is the reason, the existence of the property in the example-subject is established.

original: na hi T / / dṛṣṭāntam antareṇa hetoḥ sādhyena vyāptiḥ pradarśayituṃ śakyata iti manyate /
analyzed: na hi t dṛṣṭāntam antareṇa hetoḥ sādhyena vyāptiḥ pradarśayitum śakyate iti manyate
translated: He thinks that without the example, it is not possible to show the pervasion of the reason by the probandum.

original: tato dharmigrahaṇād vyatiricyamānāt sādhyadharmiṇa eva parigrahaḥ /
analyzed: tatas dharmi grahaṇāt vyatiricyamānāt sādhya dharmiṇaḥ eva parigrahaḥ
translated: Therefore, the property-possessor, which is excluded from the property-possessor mentioned, is included.

original: tadaṃśena iti ca tacchabdena dharmavacanākṣipto dharmī sambhantsyata iti tatsambhandhanārtham api dharmigrahaṇaṃ nāśaṅkanīyam /
analyzed: tad aṃśena iti ca tad śabdena dharma vacana ākṣiptaḥ dharmī sambhantsyate iti tad sambhandhana artham api dharmi grahaṇam na āśaṅkanīyam
translated: And the property-possessor, which is implied by the word that in by that part, will be referred to by the word that. Therefore, the mention of the property-possessor should not be suspected to be for the purpose of connecting it.

original: yatra prayojanāntaraṃ na sambhavati sa pāriśeṣyaviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: yatra prayojana antaram na sambhavati sa pāriśeṣya viṣayaḥ

original: dharmivacanasya tv anyad api prayojanaṃ sambhāvyate /
analyzed: dharmi vacanasya tu anyat api prayojanam sambhāvyate
translated: But for the mention of the property-possessor, another purpose is also possible.

original: tat kutaḥ pāriśeṣyāt dharmivacanāt sādhyadharmiparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: tat kutas pāriśeṣyāt dharmi vacanāt sādhya dharmi parigrahaḥ
translated: So how can the inclusion of the property-possessor to be inferred be from the mention of the property-possessor by elimination?

original: iti manyamānaḥsiddhāntavādy āha siddhe tadaṃśavyāptyādṛṣṭāntadharmiṇi satvattve
analyzed: iti manyamānaḥ siddhāntavādī āha siddhe tad aṃśa vyāptyā adṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi satva tve
translated: The proponent of the established conclusion says: When the existence of the property in the example-subject is established by the pervasion of that part,

original: punar ddharmiṇo S / / vacanaṃdṛṣṭāntadharmiṇa eva yo dharmaḥsa hetur iti niyamārthamāśaṅkyeta /
analyzed: punar vacanam dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇaḥ eva yaḥ dharmaḥ sa hetuḥ iti niyama artham āśaṅkyeta
translated: the statement of the subject again might be suspected to have the purpose of restricting that the property of the example-subject alone is the reason.

original: tataśca cākṣuṣatvādaya eva hetavaḥsyuḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca cākṣuṣa tva ādayaḥ eva hetavaḥ syuḥ
translated: And then only audibility, etc. could be the reasons.

original: na kṛtakatvādaya iti aniṣṭam eva syāt tasmād upacāraḥkartavyaḥ iti /
analyzed: na kṛtaka tva ādayaḥ iti aniṣṭam eva syāt tasmāt upacāraḥ kartavyaḥ iti
translated: Not fabricatedness, etc. So it would be undesirable. Therefore, figurative usage must be made.

original: kiṃ punastarkkaśāstre dṛṣṭaṃ kvacit niyamārthavacanam ity ata āha dṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: kim punar tarkka śāstre dṛṣṭam kvacid niyama artha vacanam iti atas āha dṛṣṭam
translated: But what is the seen restriction-purpose statement somewhere in the science of logic? Therefore it is said: seen

original: sajātīya eva ityādi /
analyzed: sajātīyaḥ eva ityādi
translated: in the homogeneous alone, etc.

original: tatra yaḥ san sajātīye NMu ity atrā ''cāryīye hetulakṣaṇe sajātīya eva satvattva
analyzed: tatra san  iti atra ā cāryīye hetu lakṣaṇe sajātīye eva
translated: There, in the teacher's definition of the reason, that which exists in the homogeneous alone, by the restriction existence in the homogeneous alone,

original: m' ity avadhāraṇena siddhe 'pi hetor vyatireke /
analyzed: iti avadhāraṇena siddhe pi hetoḥ vyatireke
translated: even though the absence of the reason in the dissimilar is established,

original: kutra / /🔽sādhyābhāve yadetat asaṃstadatyaye NMu iti asatvattva
analyzed: kutra  sādhya abhāve yat etat asat tat atyaye iti
translated: where?🔽In the absence of the probandum, the statement that which does not exist in the absence of that

original: vacanaṃ tanniyamārthamācāryeṇa vyākhyātam asatyeva nāstitā yathā syāt nānyatra na viruddha iti /
analyzed: vacanam tad niyama artham ācāryeṇa vyākhyātam na astitā yathā syāt na anyatra na viruddhaḥ iti
translated: is explained by the teacher to have the purpose of restriction: Non-existence should be only in the absence, not elsewhere, not in the contradictory.

original: tathehāpi dharmivacanaṃtatraiva bhāvaniyamārtham āśaṅkyeta /
analyzed: tathā iha api bhāva niyama artham āśaṅkyeta
translated: Similarly, here too, the word 'subject' might be suspected to have the purpose of restricting the presence [of the reason] to that [subject].

original: kadā / siddhe 'pi dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇi satvettve / kutaḥ /
analyzed: kadā siddhe pi dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi sattva ittve kutas
translated: When? Even when the existence of the example-subject is established. Why?

original: p / / tadaṃśavyāptivacanāt /
analyzed: tad aṃśa vyāpti vacanāt
translated: Because of the statement of pervasion of that part.

original: kva bhāvaniyamārtham /
analyzed: kva bhāva niyama artham
translated: Where is the purpose of restricting the presence [of the reason]?

original: tatraiva dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇi /🔽T / / sati cāśaṅkāsambhave /
analyzed: tatra eva dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi  t sati ca āśaṅkā asambhave
translated: In that very example-subject.🔽And when the possibility of suspicion is present,

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: why?

original: pāriśeṣyāt sādhyadharmiparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: pāriśeṣyāt sādhya dharmi parigrahaḥ
translated: By elimination, the probandum-subject is included.

original: S / / nanu apakṣadharmasyāhetutvāt na niyamārthāśaṅkā /
analyzed: nanu apakṣa dharmasya ahetu tvāt na niyama artha āśaṅkā
translated: But since a property of the non-subject is not a reason, there is no suspicion for the purpose of restriction.

original: tathā hi sādhyadharmeṇa vyāpto 'pi dharmo yadi kvacid dharmiṇy upalabhyeta tadā tatraiva svavyāpakapratītiṃ janayet nānyatra pratyāsattiviprakarṣābhyāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi sādhya dharmeṇa vyāptaḥ api dharmaḥ yadi kvacid dharmiṇi upalabhyeta tadā tatra eva sva vyāpaka pratītim janayet na anyatra pratyāsatti viprakarṣābhyām
translated: Because even if a property is pervaded by the probandum property, if it is perceived in some subject, then it would generate the cognition of its own pervader only there, not elsewhere, due to proximity and distance,

original: yathākramam /
analyzed: yathākramam
translated: respectively.

original: anupalabdhas tu kvacid dharmiṇi kathaṃ gamakaḥ / /
analyzed: anupalabdhaḥ tu kvacid dharmiṇi katham gamakaḥ
translated: But if it is not perceived in any subject, how can it be an inferential mark?

original: tathābhāvevā sarvatra svavyāpakaṃ gamayet pratyāsattiviprakarṣābhāvād evety ata āha tasmāt sāmarthyāt ityādi /
analyzed: sarvatra sva vyāpakam gamayet pratyāsatti viprakarṣa abhāvāt eva iti atas āha tasmāt sāmarthyāt ityādi
translated: If it were so, then it would always convey its own pervader, because of the absence of proximity and distance. Therefore, he says by implication and so on.

original: yad idam anantaraṃ sāmarthyaṃ samupavarṇitam asmāt sāmarthyād arthasya sādhyadharmiparigrahalakṣaṇasya bhavati pratītir paṭudhiyāṃ śrotṝṇām /
analyzed: yat idam anantaram sāmarthyam samupavarṇitam asmāt sāmarthyāt arthasya sādhya dharmi parigraha lakṣaṇasya bhavati pratītiḥ paṭu dhiyām śrotṝṇām
translated: The meaning, which is characterized by the inclusion of the subject to be proven, is understood by the sharp-witted listeners from this capability that has just been described.

original: kintv aśabdakam arthaṃ svayam anusaratāṃ pratipattigauravaṃ syāt /
analyzed: kintu aśabdakam artham svayam anusaratām pratipatti gauravam syāt
translated: But for those who follow the meaning by themselves without words, there would be difficulty in understanding.

original: tadupacāramātrāt svayam aśabdakārthābhyūharahitād dharmidharma ity anena pakṣadharma iti samānirddeśāt
analyzed: tad upacāra mātrāt svayam aśabdaka artha abhyūha rahitāt dharmi dharmaḥ iti anena pakṣa dharmaḥ iti
translated: From that mere figurative expression, which is devoid of the speaker's own expression of word-meaning, by the expression property of the subject,

original: pratipattigauravaṃca parihṛtaṃbhavati /
analyzed: pratipatti gauravam ca parihṛtam bhavati
translated: the difficulty in understanding is removed, due to the common designation as property of the subject.

original: pratipattigauravaṃca iti caśabdenaitad āha ye paropadeśam ākāṅkṣanti /
analyzed: iti caśabdena etat āha ye para upadeśam ākāṅkṣanti
translated: And by the word and in difficulty in understanding, he says this: For those who desire the instruction of others,

original: tair ayam artho lakṣaṇavacanād boddhavya iti /S / /
analyzed: taiḥ ayam arthaḥ lakṣaṇa vacanāt
translated: this meaning should be understood from the statement of the definition.

original: yathālakṣaṇaṃ pratīter apakṣadharmo na hetur iti kutaḥ /
analyzed: yathālakṣaṇam pratīteḥ apakṣa dharmaḥ na hetuḥ iti kutas
translated: How is it that when there is understanding according to the definition, the property of the subject is not the reason?

original: iyam āśaṅkā /
analyzed: iyam āśaṅkā
translated: This is the doubt.

original: tatas teṣāṃlakṣaṇānusāriṇāṃ niyamāśaṅkāparihārārthaṃ copacārakaraṇam iti /
analyzed: tatas niyama āśaṅkā parihāra artham ca upacāra karaṇam iti
translated: Therefore, the figurative expression is made in order to remove the doubt about the restriction for those who follow the definition.

original: ghaṭakākādidharmidharmatvāṭ teṣām🔽vyadhikaraṇāsiddhanirasanam
analyzed: ghaṭa kāka ādi dharmi dharma tvāt teṣām
translated: Because they are the properties of the subject pot, crow, etc.,

original: ced āha parā T /
analyzed: ced āha parā t
translated: if it is said that they are refuted as being inconclusive due to being about a different subject, he says from the other.

original: yasya kasyacid dharmiṇo dharmasya hetutvam iti vyāptinyāyaḥ /
analyzed: yasya kasyacid dharmiṇaḥ dharmasya hetu tvam iti vyāpti nyāyaḥ
translated: The rule of pervasion is that any property of a subject is the reason.

original: sa yady abhipretaḥ syāt tadā
analyzed: sa yadi abhipretaḥ syāt tadā
translated: If that is intended, then

original: dharmimātrākṣepaś ca dharmiparatantratvāt dharmasya🔽dvividho hi prayogaḥ vyāptipurassarapakṣadharmatopasaṃhāravān /
analyzed: dharmi mātra ākṣepaḥ ca dharmi paratantra tvāt dharmasya  dvividhaḥ hi prayogaḥ vyāpti purassara pakṣa dharmatā upasaṃhāravān
translated: and the projection of the subject alone, because the property is dependent on the subject.🔽For there are two kinds of argument: one that has the property of the subject as a conclusion preceded by pervasion,

original: pakṣadharmatopasaṃhārapūrvakavyāptivāṃś ca /
analyzed: pakṣa dharma tā upasaṃhāra pūrvaka vyāptivān ca
translated: and one that has pervasion as a conclusion preceded by the property of the subject.

original: yat kṛtakaṃ tad anityam /
analyzed: yat kṛtakam tat anityam
translated: Whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: yathā ghaṭaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ghaṭaḥ
translated: Like a pot.

original: kṛtakaś ca śabda i / / / / / / / /
analyzed: kṛtakaḥ ca śabdaḥ i
translated: And sound is produced.

original: yaḥ san sajātīye sapakṣe san vidyamānas tadatyaye sādhyasyābhāve vipakṣe ca dvedhā'san sad asan yadi na bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ san sajātīye sapakṣe san vidyamānaḥ tad atyaye sādhyasya abhāve vipakṣe ca dvedhā asan sat asan yadi na bhavati
translated: If it exists in the similar class, i.e., in the sapaksa, and is absent in the two ways, i.e., as existent and as non-existent, in the absence of the probandum, i.e., in the vipaksa,

original: kintv asann eva vipakṣe yadi bhavati tadaiva samyag ghetur iti bhāvaḥ
analyzed: kintu asan eva vipakṣe yadi bhavati tadā eva samyak hetuḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: but if it is only absent in the vipaksa, then it is indeed a correct reason. This is the meaning.

original: yaḥsan sajātīye 'san tadatyaya itidignāgācāryīyaṃsūtraṃ vyākhyātam atra
analyzed: yaḥ san sajātīye san tad atyayaḥ iti dignāga ācāryīyam sūtram vyākhyātam atra
translated: The aphorism of Dignāga, That which exists in the similar class and does not exist in the absence of that, is explained here.

original: abhāvarūpa anyarūpe viruddharūpe vā nāstitā yasya sa hetur ity arthaḥ
analyzed: abhāva rūpa anya rūpe viruddha rūpe vā na astitā yasya sa hetuḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: a reason is that which does not exist in the form of non-existence, another form, or contradictory form.

original: dharmidharmavaca T /
analyzed: dharmi dharma vacaḥ t
translated: It expresses the property of the subject.

original: anupalabdhasyāpi gamakatve
analyzed: anupalabdhasya api gamaka tve
translated: Even if non-apprehension is an indicator,

original: paropadeśākāṅkṣiṇām🔽pakṣadharma ity atra niyamavyavasthā /
analyzed: para upadeśa ākāṅkṣiṇām
translated: For those who desire instruction from others,🔽In the phrase property of the subject, there is a restriction.

original: iha vyavacchedaphalatvāt śabdaprayogasyāvaśyam evāvadhārayitavyam /
analyzed: iha vyavaccheda phala tvāt śabda prayogasya avaśyam eva avadhārayitavyam
translated: Here, since the use of words has the result of exclusion, it must be ascertained.

original: ṣaṣṭhīsamāsāc ca pakṣadharma ity atra nānyaḥ samāsaḥ sambhavati /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhī samāsāt ca pakṣa dharmaḥ iti atra na anyaḥ samāsaḥ sambhavati
translated: And from the genitive compound, in the phrase property of the subject, no other compound is possible.

original: tathā ca pakṣasyaiva dharma ity evam avadhāraṇāt tadaṃśavyāptir virudhyata iti viruddhalakṣaṇatām udbhāvayann āha T / / pakṣasya
analyzed: tathā ca pakṣasya eva dharmaḥ iti evam avadhāraṇāt tad aṃśa vyāptiḥ virudhyate iti viruddha lakṣaṇa tām udbhāvayan āha pakṣasya
translated: And thus, because of the restriction property of the subject only, the pervasion of its part is contradicted. Pointing out the contradiction in the definition, he says: The property of the subject

original: pakṣaṃviśeṣaṇam anyato vyavacchedakam apekṣata iti tadviśeṣaṇāpekṣasya dharmasya anyatra pakṣīkṛtād anyasmin sapakṣe ananuvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: pakṣam viśeṣaṇam anyatas vyavacchedakam apekṣate iti tad viśeṣaṇa apekṣasya dharmasya anyatra pakṣīkṛtāt anyasmin sapakṣe ananuvṛttiḥ
translated: The subject requires a distinguishing feature that excludes it from others. Therefore, a property that depends on that distinguishing feature does not continue in the similar instance, which is different from what has been made the subject.

original: tathā hi yaḥ pakṣeṇa viśeṣyate sa pakṣasyaiva bhavati nānyasya /
analyzed: tathā hi yaḥ pakṣeṇa viśeṣyate sa pakṣasya eva bhavati na anyasya
translated: This is because what is qualified by the subject belongs to the subject only, not to another.

original: yathā yo devadattasya putraḥ sa tasyaiva putro na yajñadattasyāpi /
analyzed: yathā yaḥ devadattasya putraḥ sa tasya eva putraḥ na yajñadattasya api
translated: Just as one who is the son of Devadatta is the son of him only, not also of Yajnadatta.

original: p / / tato 'nyatrānanuvṛtteḥ asādhāraṇatā sādhāraṇatā na syāt /
analyzed: tatas nyatra ananuvṛtteḥ asādhāraṇa tā sādhāraṇa tā na syāt
translated: Therefore, because of not continuing in what is different from that, there would be no commonality, i.e., it would not be common.

original: tadaṃśavyāptivirodha iti yāvat /
analyzed: tad aṃśa vyāpti virodhaḥ iti yāvat
translated: This is as far as the contradiction in the pervasion of its part.

original: sādhāraṇatāyāstvayāś ca
analyzed: ca
translated: But for you, there is

original: tadaṃśavyāptyā pratipādanāt /
translated: Because it is taught by the pervasion of that part.

original: tato yadi pakṣadharmo na tadaṃśena vyāptiḥ /🔽S / / atha tadaṃśavyāptir na pakṣadharma iti vyāhataṃ lakṣaṇam iti /🔽nanu ca tadaṃśavyāptir nāma sādhyadharmasya vyāpakasya tatra hetau sati tadādhāradharmiṇi bhāva eva /
analyzed: tatas yadi pakṣa dharmaḥ na tad aṃśena vyāptiḥ  atha tad aṃśa vyāptiḥ na pakṣa dharmaḥ iti vyāhatam lakṣaṇam iti  nanu ca tad aṃśa vyāptiḥ nāma sādhya dharmasya vyāpakasya tatra hetau sati tad ādhāra dharmiṇi bhāvaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, if the subject is not pervaded by that part,🔽then if there is pervasion by that part but not the subject, the definition is contradicted.🔽But isn't pervasion by that part said to be the mere presence of the predicate to be proven, which is the pervader, in the reason, which is its basis?

original: vyāpyasya vā hetos tatraiva vyāpake sādhyadharme saty eva bhāva iti svasādhyāvinābhāvalakṣaṇā vakṣyate /
analyzed: vyāpyasya vā hetoḥ tatra eva vyāpake sādhya dharme sati eva bhāvaḥ iti sva sādhya avinābhāva lakṣaṇā vakṣyate
translated: Or the mere presence of the pervaded reason in the predicate to be proven, which is the pervader? This will be said to be the characteristic of invariable concomitance with one's own probandum.

original: na cānayā 'vaśyaṃ pakṣīkṛtād anyatra vṛttir ākṣipyate /
analyzed: na ca anayā vaśyam pakṣīkṛtāt anyatra vṛttiḥ ākṣipyate
translated: And by this, the occurrence elsewhere than in the subject is not necessarily implied,

original: yatolakṣaṇavyāghāta āśaṅkyeta /
analyzed: āśaṅkyeta
translated: from which a contradiction with the definition might be suspected.

original: tathā hi tatraiva pakṣīkṛte saty eva sādhyadharme hetur varttamānas tadaṃśavyāptiṃ pratipadyata eva /
analyzed: tathā hi tatra eva pakṣīkṛte sati eva sādhya dharme hetuḥ varttamānaḥ tad aṃśa vyāptim pratipadyate eva
translated: For in that very subject, when the reason is present only in the predicate to be proven, it does indeed establish the pervasion by that part.

original: yaiva cāsya sādhyadharmiṇi svasādhyāvinābhāvitā saiva gamakatve nibandhanaṃ nānyadharmiṇi /
analyzed: yā eva ca asya sādhya dharmiṇi sva sādhya avinābhāvi tā sā eva gamaka tve nibandhanam na anya dharmiṇi
translated: And that very invariable concomitance with one's own probandum in the subject to be proven is the basis for being an inferential mark, not in another subject.

original: sa ca svasādhyāvinābhāvaḥ pratibandhasādhakapramāṇanibandhanaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca sva sādhya avinābhāvaḥ pratibandha sādhaka pramāṇa nibandhanaḥ
translated: And that invariable concomitance with one's own probandum is based on the evidence that establishes the relation.

original: na sapakṣe kvacid bahulaṃ vā sahabhāvamātradarśananibandhanaḥ /
analyzed: na sapakṣe kvacid bahulam vā sahabhāva mātra darśana nibandhanaḥ
translated: Nor is it based on the mere perception of co-existence in many cases in similar instances.

original: na hi lohalekhyaṃ vajram pārthivatvāt kāṣṭhādivat iti tadanyatra pārthivatvasya T / / lohalekhyatā 'vinābhāvo 'pi tathābhāvo bhavati S /
analyzed: na hi loha lekhyam vajram pārthiva tvāt kāṣṭha ādi vat iti tad anyatra pārthiva tvasya loha lekhya tā tathābhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: For it is not the case that a diamond is to be cut by iron, because it is earth, like wood etc., for the non-existence of the property of being cut by iron in the other, i.e., in earth, is not invariably concomitant with that state.

original: yadi ca pakṣīkṛtād anyatraiva vyāptir ādarśayitavyeti niyamas tadā satvaṃttvaṃ🔽kathaṃ kṣaṇikatāṃ
analyzed: yadi ca pakṣīkṛtāt anyatra eva vyāptiḥ ādarśayitavyā iti niyamaḥ tadā  katham kṣaṇika tām
translated: And if there is a rule that the pervasion must be shown only in what is different from the subject, then how could existence

original: bhāveṣu pratipādayet / /
analyzed: bhāveṣu pratipādayet
translated: establish momentariness in things?

original: yo hi sakalapadārthavyāpinīm akṣanīṃ kṣa
analyzed: yaḥ hi sakala padārtha vyāpinīm akṣanīm
translated: For one who wishes to establish the momentariness which pervades all existent things,

original: ṇikatām icchati taṃ prati kasyacit sapakṣasyaivābhāvāt /
analyzed: ṇika tām icchati tam prati kasyacid sapakṣasya eva abhāvāt
translated: for him, because there is no similar instance at all,

original: yad api kaiścit jvālādeḥ kṣaṇikatvam abhyupagamyate tad api na pratyakṣataḥ /
analyzed: yat api kaiścid jvālā ādeḥ kṣaṇika tvam abhyupagamyate tat api na pratyakṣataḥ
translated: Even that which is accepted by some as the momentariness of a flame etc., that also is not perceived by sense perception.

original: kṣaṇavivekasyātisūkṣmatayā 'nupalakṣaṇāt /
analyzed: kṣaṇa vivekasya ati sūkṣma tayā n upalakṣaṇāt
translated: Because the distinction of moments is very subtle, it is not perceived.

original: anyatraiva ca vyāptir ādarśanīyā na sādhyadharmiṇy apīti ko 'yaṃ nyāyaḥ / /
analyzed: anyatra eva ca vyāptiḥ ādarśanīyā na sādhya dharmiṇī api iti kaḥ yam nyāyaḥ
translated: And what is this principle that the pervasion must be shown only elsewhere, not even in the subject of the probandum?

original: evaṃ hi kālpanikatvaṃ hetulakṣaṇasyapratipannaṃ syāt /
analyzed: evam hi kālpanika tvam syāt
translated: For in this way, the definition of the reason would be understood to be figurative.

original: na vastubalapravṛttatvam /
analyzed: na vastu bala pravṛtta tvam
translated: Not that it operates by the power of reality.

original: tasmāt svasādhyapratibandhād hetus tena vyāptaḥ sidhyati /
analyzed: tasmāt sva sādhya pratibandhāt hetuḥ tena vyāptaḥ sidhyati
translated: Therefore, the reason is established as pervaded by its own probandum through the relation of the probandum.

original: sa ca viparyaye bādhakapramāṇavṛttyā sādhyadharmiṇy api sidhyatīti na kiñcid
analyzed: sa ca viparyaye bādhaka pramāṇa vṛttyā sādhya dharmiṇī api sidhyati iti na kiñcid
translated: And that is established even in the probandum through the operation of the proof that contradicts the contrary. Thus, nothing is

original: p / / anyatrānuvṛttyapekṣyā /
analyzed: anyatra anuvṛtti apekṣyā
translated: depended upon elsewhere for the universal.

original: ata evānyatroktam S / / yatkvacid dṛṣṭaṃ tasya yatra pratibandhaḥtadvidhaḥ tasya tad gamakaṃtatreti
analyzed: ro-0
translated: For this very reason, it is said elsewhere: What is seen somewhere, if it is related to that in that way, it is the indicator of that there.

original: vastugatiḥ iti /
analyzed: vastu gatiḥ iti
translated: This is the actual course of events.

original: vṛtteḥ
analyzed: vṛtteḥ
translated: Due to the operation

original: anvayavyatirekātmakasya
analyzed: anvaya vyatireka ātmakasya
translated: of the nature of positive and negative concomitance

original: viniścaye
analyzed: viniścaye
translated: in the ascertainment

original: liṅgam
analyzed: liṅgam
translated: the logical mark

original: pradeśe
analyzed: pradeśe
translated: in the region

original: niścitam
analyzed: niścitam
translated: is ascertained

original: liṅgasya
analyzed: liṅgasya
translated: of the logical mark

original: vahnyādau
analyzed: vahni ādau
translated: in fire and so on

original: pratibandhavidaḥ
translated: by one who knows the relation

original: vahneḥ
analyzed: vahneḥ
translated: of fire

original: liṅgam
analyzed: liṅgam
translated: the logical mark

original: yatra dṛṣṭaṃ tatraiva nānyatra
analyzed: yatra dṛṣṭam tatra eva na anyatra
translated: where it is seen, there only, not elsewhere

original: yad api anumeye 'tha tattulye sadbhāvaḥ ityādi lakṣaṇaṃ tatrāpi sādhyadharmavāneva sapakṣa ucyate /
analyzed: yat api anumeye tha tad tulye sadbhāvaḥ lakṣaṇam tatra api sapakṣaḥ ucyate
translated: Even the definition stated as existence in the inferable and in what is similar to that and so on, there also a similar instance is said to be that which has the property to be proved.

original: tataḥ satyeva sādhyadharme vā 'stīty evaṃ param etat /
analyzed: tatas sati eva sādhya dharme vā sti iti evam param etat
translated: Therefore, when the property to be proved is present, it is said to exist in that way.

original: tataś ca taddharmaṇaḥ sādhyadharmiṇo 'pi vāstavaṃ sapakṣatvaṃ na vyāvarttate /
analyzed: tatas ca tad dharmaṇaḥ sādhya dharmiṇaḥ vāstavam sapakṣa tvam na vyāvarttate
translated: And from that, the real similarity of the subject of that property, which has the property to be proved, is not excluded.

original: sādhyatveneṣṭayecchāvyavasthitalakṣaṇena pakṣatvena tasya nirākarttum aśakyatvāt /
analyzed: sādhya tvena iṣṭayā icchā vyavasthita lakṣaṇena pakṣa tvena tasya nirākarttum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because it cannot be denied that what is to be established by the reason is the probandum, which is characterized by the invariable concomitance with the desire to prove, which is the subject.

original: tasmāt tadaṃśavyāptivacanena svasādhyāvinābhāvitvasya pratibandhanibandhanasyānyathā tadayogādabhidhānān nāvaśyaT / /m anyatra vṛttir
analyzed: tasmāt tad aṃśa vyāpti vacanena sva sādhya avinābhāvi tvasya pratibandha nibandhanasya anyathā anyatra vṛttiḥ
translated: Therefore, by stating the pervasion of that part, the invariable concomitance with one's own probandum, which is based on the restriction, is necessarily stated, because it is not possible otherwise.

original: katham idam āśaṅkitam / /
analyzed: katham idam āśaṅkitam
translated: How is this suspected?

original: satyam / naivedam āśaṅkanīyam /
analyzed: satyam na eva idam āśaṅkanīyam
translated: It is true. This should not be suspected at all.

original: yadi sarvasya hetoḥ pakṣīkṛte eva dharmiṇi svasādhyapratibandhaḥ pramāṇato niścetuṃ śakyeta /
analyzed: yadi sarvasya hetoḥ pakṣīkṛte eva dharmiṇi sva sādhya pratibandhaḥ pramāṇataḥ niścetum śakyeta
translated: If the restriction of one's own probandum could be ascertained by means of a valid cognition in the subject alone that is the locus of the reason,

original: S / / yathā sattvalakṣaṇasya svabhāvahetoḥ kṣaṇikatāyāṃ sādhyāyāṃ tādātmyaṃ viparyaye bādhakapramāṇavṛttyā /
analyzed: yathā sattva lakṣaṇasya svabhāva hetoḥ kṣaṇikatāyām sādhyāyām tādātmyam viparyaye bādhaka pramāṇa vṛttyā
translated: just as the identity in the case of a reason based on nature, such as the characteristic of existence, when the probandum is momentariness, by the operation of a valid cognition that contradicts the opposite,

original: kāryahetos tu pakṣīkṛtadharmiṇā /
analyzed: kārya hetoḥ tu pakṣīkṛta dharmiṇā
translated: but in the case of a reason based on effect, by the subject that is the locus of the reason,

original: kasyacit svabhāvahetoḥ pratyakṣānupalambhasādhanaḥ pratibandhaḥ
analyzed: kasyacid svabhāva hetoḥ pratyakṣa anupalambha sādhanaḥ pratibandhaḥ
translated: in some cases, the restriction of a reason based on nature is established by perception and non-apprehension,

original: kathaṃ parokṣe sādhyadharme gṛhyeta / /
analyzed: katham parokṣe sādhya dharme gṛhyeta
translated: how can it be grasped in a probandum that is imperceptible?

original: tasmāt tasyānyatraivaprasiddhir iti tadviśeṣaṇāpekṣasya tatra apekṣaṇāt anyatrānanuvṛtteḥ asādhāraṇatā sambhavamātreṇāśaṅkitā /
analyzed: tasmāt iti tad viśeṣaṇa apekṣasya tatra apekṣaṇāt anyatra ananuvṛtteḥ asādhāraṇa tā sambhava mātreṇa āśaṅkitā
translated: Therefore, its well-knownness elsewhere, since the qualifier requires that [well-knownness] there, and does not continue elsewhere, the uncommonness is suspected merely as a possibility.

original: tadā hy anytrāvartamānaḥ sādhyaviparītavyatireka / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: tadā hi anytrā vartamānaḥ sādhya viparīta vyatireka
translated: Then, not occurring elsewhere, the vyatireka (negative concomitance) opposite to the probandum...

original: tadubhayabahirbhāvāyogāt taddharmiṇaḥsādhyavṛttivyavacchedābhyāṃ sarvasaṃgrahāt
analyzed: tad ubhaya bahirbhāva ayogāt sarva saṃgrahāt
translated: ... due to the impossibility of being outside both of those, because all are included by the exclusions of the probandum occurring in the substratum of those [two].

original: tatra saṃśayahetur bhavati /
analyzed: tatra saṃśaya hetuḥ bhavati
translated: There, it becomes the cause of doubt.

original: syānmatam kvacid āśraye sattāyāḥ prākpravṛttapūrvagṛhītavismṛtapratibandhasādhakapramāṇasmṛtaye 'nyatravṛttir apekṣaṇīyā /
analyzed: syāt matam kvacid āśraye sattāyāḥ prāk pravṛtta pūrva gṛhīta vismṛta pratibandha sādhaka pramāṇa smṛtaye apekṣaṇīyā
translated: It may be thought: In some substratum, for the existence of the previously arisen, previously apprehended, forgotten relation-establishing valid cognition, the occurrence elsewhere is to be depended upon.

original: S / / etat pariharati /
analyzed: etat pariharati
translated: He answers this.

original: na ityādi /
analyzed: naḥ ityādi
translated: No, etc.

original: nānyatrānanuvṛttiḥ / kutaḥ /
analyzed: na anyatra ananuvṛttiḥ kutas
translated: There is no non-occurrence elsewhere. Why?

original: p / / ayogo 'sambandhaḥ tadvyavacchedena viśeṣaṇāt pakṣasya /
translated: Because of impossibility, i.e., lack of connection, by the exclusion of that [otherness], the subject is qualified.

original: na hy anyayogavyavacchedenaiva viśeṣaṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na hi anya yoga vyavacchedena eva viśeṣaṇam bhavati
translated: For qualification does not occur only by the exclusion of connection with another.

original: kintu ayogavyavacchedenāpi /
analyzed: kintu ayoga vyavacchedena api
translated: But also by the exclusion of lack of connection.🔽...

original: yatra dharmiṇi dharmasya sadbhāvaḥ saṃdihyate tatrā 'yogavyavacchedasya nyāyaprāptatvāt /
analyzed: yatra dharmiṇi dharmasya sadbhāvaḥ saṃdihyate tatra yoga vyavacchedasya nyāya prāpta tvāt
translated: Where the existence of a property in a subject is doubted, there the exclusion of non-connection is logically implied.

original: atra ca dṛṣṭāntaḥ yathācaitro dhanurdhara iti /
analyzed: atra ca dṛṣṭāntaḥ yathā a caitraḥ dhanuḥ dharaḥ iti
translated: And here the example is: Just as 'Caitra is a bowman'.

original: caitre hi dhanurdharatvaṃ saṃdihyate kim asti nāsti iti /
analyzed: caitre hi dhanurdhara tvam saṃdihyate kim asti na asti iti
translated: For in Caitra, the state of being a bowman is doubted: whether it exists or not.

original: tataś caitro dhanurddhara iti tatsadbhāvapratipādikā śrutiḥ T / / pakṣāntaram adhanurdharatvaṃ śrotur āśaṅkopasthāpitaṃ nirākarotīty
analyzed: tatas caitraḥ dhanurddharaḥ iti tad sadbhāva pratipādikā śrutiḥ pakṣa antaram a dhanurdhara tvam śrotuḥ āśaṅkā upasthāpitam nirākaroti iti
translated: And therefore, the statement Caitra is a bowman, which conveys the existence of that [state of being a bowman], excludes the alternative of not being a bowman, which is presented by the doubt of the listener.

original: ayogavyavacchedo 'tra nyāyaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: a yoga vyavacchedaḥ tra nyāya prāptaḥ
translated: So the exclusion of non-connection is logically implied here.

original: S / / parābhimatavyavacchedanirācikīrṣayā ''ha na /
analyzed: para abhimata vyavaccheda nirācikīrṣayā ha na
translated: But [the opponent] says, No, with the desire to deny the exclusion accepted by the other party.

original: anyayogavyavacchedena viśeṣaṇāt anyatrānanuvṛtter asādhāraṇateti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: anya yoga vyavacchedena viśeṣaṇāt anyatra ananuvṛtteḥ asādhāraṇa tā iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The connection is: Because of the qualification by the exclusion of connection with another, and because of the non-occurrence elsewhere, [the state of being a bowman] is not common.

original: atrāpi dṛṣṭānto yathāpārtho dhanurddhara iti /🔽sāmānyaśabdo 'py ayaṃ dhanurdharaśabdaḥ sāmarthyādinā prakṛṣṭaguṇavṛttiḥ /
analyzed: atra api dṛṣṭāntaḥ yathā pārthaḥ dhanurddharaḥ iti  sāmānya śabdaḥ api ayam dhanurdhara śabdaḥ sāmarthya ādinā prakṛṣṭa guṇa vṛttiḥ
translated: And here too the example is: Just as 'the son of Pritha is a bowman'.🔽This word 'bowman' is a general word, but by implication it applies to one of superior qualities.

original: iha pārthe hi dhanurddharatvaṃ siddham eveti nāyogāśaṅkā /
analyzed: iha pārthe hi dhanurddhara tvam siddham evā iti na ayoga āśaṅkā
translated: For in this case, the state of being a bowman is already established in the son of Pritha, so there is no doubt about non-connection.

original: tādṛśaṃ tu sātiśayaṃ kim anyatrāsti
analyzed: tādṛśam tu sa atiśayam kim anyatra asti
translated: But what else can be so extraordinary?

original: nāstīty anyayogaśaṅkāyāṃ śrotuḥ yadā pārtho dhanurdhara iti ucyate tadā 'nyayogavyavacchedo nyāyaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: na asti iti anya yoga śaṅkāyām śrotuḥ yadā pārthaḥ dhanuḥ dharaḥ iti ucyate tadā nya yoga vyavacchedaḥ nyāya prāptaḥ
translated: When it is said that Arjuna is a bowman, the exclusion of other connections is logically implied, because the two alternatives presented by the doubt of the hearer are mutually contradictory.

original: pratipādyāśaṅkopasthāpitayor eva pakṣayoḥ parasparaṃ virodhāt ekanirdeśena anyayogavyavacchedasya nyāyabalāyātatvāt /
analyzed: pratipādya āśaṅkā upasthāpitayoḥ eva pakṣayoḥ parasparam virodhāt eka nirdeśena anya yoga vyavacchedasya nyāya bala āyāta tvāt
translated: For the exclusion of other connections is logically implied by the single statement, because the two alternatives presented by the doubt of the person to be instructed are mutually contradictory.

original: tad iha pakṣe 'sty ayaṃ dharmo na veti saṃśītau pakṣadharma ity ukte pakṣasya dharma eva S / / nādharmaḥ /
analyzed: tat iha pakṣe sti ayam dharmaḥ na vā iti saṃśītau pakṣa dharmaḥ iti ukte pakṣasya dharmaḥ eva na adharmaḥ
translated: Here, when there is doubt as to whether this property belongs to the subject or not, when it is said the property of the subject, it is not that the subject has a property and also a non-property.

original: dharmaś ca āśritatvād viśeṣaṇaṃ tenāyogo vyavacchidyate nānyayogas tadaṃśavyāptyā tasya pratipāditatvena dṛṣṭānte saṃdehābhāvāt /
analyzed: dharmaḥ ca āśrita tvāt viśeṣaṇam tena ayogaḥ vyavacchidyate na anya yogaḥ tad aṃśa vyāptyā tasya pratipādita tvena dṛṣṭānte saṃdeha abhāvāt
translated: And the property is a qualifier because it is dependent. By that, disconnection is excluded, not connection with something else, because its pervasion by that part has been presented, and there is no doubt in the example.

original: tadaṃśaḥ taddharma iti /
analyzed: tad aṃśaḥ tad dharmaḥ iti
translated: That part means that property.

original: tacchabdena pakṣaḥ parāmṛśyate na dharmaḥ /
analyzed: tad śabdena pakṣaḥ parāmṛśyate na dharmaḥ
translated: By the word tat (that), the subject is referred to, not the property.

original: dharmasya dharmāsambhavāt /
analyzed: dharmasya dharma asambhavāt
translated: Because a property cannot have another property.

original: aṃśaś ca dharmo naikadeśaḥ /
analyzed: aṃśaḥ ca dharmaḥ na eka deśaḥ
translated: And part means a property, not a part.

original: pakṣaśabdena dharmimātravacanāt /
analyzed: pakṣa śabdena dharmi mātra vacanāt
translated: Because the word subject denotes only the possessor of the property.

original: na tadaṃśaḥ tasya ca ekadeśābhāvād iti /
analyzed: na tad aṃśaḥ tasya ca eka deśa abhāvāt iti
translated: It is not that part, because it has no parts.

original: anumeye 'tha tattulye sadbhāvo nāstitā'vipakṣe sati /
analyzed: anumeye tha tad tulye sadbhāvaḥ nāstitā vipakṣe sati
translated: Existence in the inferable and in what is similar to it, and non-existence in the absence of the probandum,

original: niścitā'nupalambhātmakāryākhyāhetuvas trayaḥ//
analyzed: trayaḥ
translated: are ascertained by non-apprehension, effect, and nature, which are the three kinds of reasons.

original: sa sādhyo dharmo yasya sādhyadharmiṇaḥ
analyzed: sa sādhyaḥ dharmaḥ yasya sādhya dharmiṇaḥ
translated: That property which is to be proved is of the subject to be proved.

original: svasādhyāvinābhāva
analyzed: sva sādhya avinābhāva
translated: The invariable concomitance of its own probandum🔽of the effect reason and the nature reason.

original: kāryahetoḥ svabhāvahetoś ca tasya / / / / / / / / / /🔽sa cāsau dharmī ceti samāsaḥ /
analyzed: kārya hetoḥ svabhāva hetoḥ ca tasya  sa ca asau dharmī ca iti samāsaḥ
translated: And that is the property, thus the compound.

original: taddharmaṇaḥ iti pāṭhāntaram /
analyzed: tad dharmaṇaḥ iti pāṭha antaram
translated: The reading of that property is different.

original: tatra ca so 'sādhāraṇo dharmo yasya tasyeti vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: tatra ca saḥ sādhāraṇaḥ dharmaḥ yasya tasya iti vyākhyeyam
translated: And there, it should be explained that it is the uncommon property of that.

original: sa cāsau dharmī ca /
analyzed: sa ca asau dharmī ca
translated: And that is the property,

original: tasya /
analyzed: tasya
translated: of that.

original: sādhyadharmiṇa ity arthaḥ
analyzed: sādhya dharmiṇaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is of the subject to be proved.

original: prāk pravṛttaṃ ca tat gṛhītaṃ tad vismṛtaṃ ca tat pratibandhasādhakapramāṇaṃ ca tasya smṛtaya iti samāsaḥ🔽vyāpter vyāpyavyāpakobhayadharmatvam /🔽tasya pakṣadharmasya sato vyāptiḥ yo vyāpnoti yaś ca vyāpyate tadubhayadharmatayāpratīteḥ /
analyzed: prāk pravṛttam ca tat gṛhītam tat vismṛtam ca tat pratibandha sādhaka pramāṇam ca tasya smṛtayaḥ iti samāsaḥ             tasya pakṣa dharmasya sataḥ vyāptiḥ yaḥ vyāpnoti yaḥ ca vyāpyate
translated: And that is the means of knowledge which establishes the relation, and that is remembered, thus the compound.🔽The pervasion is the property of both the pervader and the pervaded,🔽because it is not apprehended as the property of both that which pervades and that which is pervaded, when the property of the pervader is intended to be expressed.

original: yadā vyāpakadharmatayā vivakṣyate tadā vyāpakasya gamyasya/
analyzed: yadā vyāpaka dharma tayā vivakṣyate tadā vyāpakasya
translated: Then the pervasion of that which is to be proved is of the subject to be proved.

original: tatreti T / / sat saptamy arthapradhānam etat nādhārapradhānam /
analyzed: tatra iti t sat saptamī artha pradhānam etat na ādhāra pradhānam
translated: There, the locative case is primary, not the substratum.

original: dharmāṇāṃ dharmādhāratvā saṃbhavāt /
analyzed: dharmāṇām dharma ādhāra tva ā saṃbhavāt
translated: Because it is not possible for dharmas to be the substratum of dharmas.

original: p / / tenāyam arthaḥ yatra dharmiṇi vyāpyam asti tatra sarvvatra bhāva evavyāpakasya svagato dharmo vyāptiḥ /
analyzed: tena ayam arthaḥ yatra dharmiṇi vyāpyam asti tatra sarvatra bhāva svagataḥ dharmaḥ vyāptiḥ
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: Where the pervaded exists, its mere presence is the pervasion of the property belonging to the pervader.

original: tataś ca vyāpakabhāvāpekṣayā vyāpyasyaiva vyāptatāpratītiḥ S / / /
analyzed: tatas ca vyāpaka bhāva apekṣayā vyāpyasya eva vyāpta tā pratītiḥ
translated: And from that, the cognition of the pervaded as pervasion is in relation to the existence of the pervader.

original: na tv evam avadhāryate /
analyzed: na tu evam avadhāryate
translated: But it is not determined in this way.

original: vyāpakasyaiva tatra bhāva iti /
analyzed: vyāpakasya eva tatra bhāvaḥ iti
translated: That only the pervader exists there.

original: hetvabhāvaprasaṅgādavyāpakasyāpi mūrttatvādes tatra bhāvāt /
analyzed: mūrtta tva ādeḥ tatra bhāvāt
translated: Because the absence of the reason would follow, and because even the non-pervading, like materiality, exists there.

original: nāpi tatraive'ti ahetutāpatteḥ/
analyzed: na api
translated: Nor is it that it exists only there, because that would lead to the fault of being a non-reason.

original: sādhāraṇaś ca hetuḥ syāt /
analyzed: sādhāraṇaḥ ca hetuḥ syāt
translated: And the reason would be common,

original: nityatvasya prameyeṣv eva bhāvāt /
analyzed: nitya tvasya prameyeṣu eva bhāvāt
translated: because eternality exists only in objects of knowledge.

original: yadā tu vyāpyadharmatā rmatayā🔽vivakṣā vyāptes tadā vyāpyasya vā gamakasya tatraiva vyāpake gamye sati /
analyzed: yadā tu vyāpya dharma tā  vivakṣā vyāpteḥ tadā vyāpyasya vā gamakasya tatra eva vyāpake gamye sati
translated: But when the intention is to express pervasion as the nature of the pervaded property,🔽then, when the pervaded, which is the indicator, exists only in the pervaded, which is the object of indication,

original: yatra dharmiṇi vyāpako 'sti tatraiva bhāvo /
analyzed: yatra dharmiṇi vyāpakaḥ sti tatra eva bhāvaḥ
translated: its existence is only where the pervader exists in the substratum.

original: na tadabhāve 'pi vyāptir iti /
analyzed: na tad abhāve pi vyāptiḥ iti
translated: Not even in its absence is there pervasion.

original: atrāpi vyāpyasyaiva tatra bhāva ity avadhāraṇaṃ hetvabhāvaprasaktereva nāśritam /
analyzed: atra api vyāpyasya eva tatra bhāvaḥ iti avadhāraṇam na āśritam
translated: Here also, the restriction that the pervasion is only there [in the similar instance] is not resorted to because of the possibility of the absence of the reason.

original: avyāpyasyāpitatra bhāvāt /
analyzed: bhāvāt
translated: Because even what is not pervaded can exist there.

original: nāpi vyāpyasya tatra bhāva eveti sapakṣaikadeśavṛtterhetutvaprāpteḥ/🔽sādhāraṇasya ca hetutvaṃ syāt /
analyzed: nā api vyāpyasya tatra bhāvaḥ eva iti  sādhāraṇasya ca hetu tvam syāt
translated: Nor is the restriction that what is pervaded exists only there resorted to, because then a reason occurring in part of the similar instance would be obtained.🔽And a common reason would be possible.

original: prameyatvasya nityeṣv avaśyaṃ bhāvād iti /
analyzed: prameya tvasya nityeṣu avaśyam bhāvāt iti
translated: Because the quality of being an object of knowledge necessarily exists in the permanent [entities].

original: vyāpyavyāpakadharmatāsaṃvarṇanaṃ
translated: But the description of the relation of pervaded and pervader

original: tu vyāpter ubhayatra S / / tulyadharmatayaikākārā pratītiḥ saṃyogivat mā bhūd iti pradarśanārtham /
analyzed: tu vyāpteḥ ubhayatra tulya dharma tayā eka ākārā pratītiḥ saṃyogi vat mā bhūt iti pradarśana artham
translated: is for the purpose of showing that the cognition of pervasion as having the same form in both [the similar and dissimilar instances] should not be like that of the conjoined [entities], because of the equality of the property.

original: tathā hi pūrvatrāyogavyavacchedenāvadhāraṇam T / / uttaratrānyayogavyavacchedeneti kuta ubhayatraikākāratā vyāpteḥ / / taduktam
analyzed: tathā hi pūrvatra ayoga vyavacchedena avadhāraṇam t uttaratra anya yoga vyavacchedena iti kutas ubhayatra eka ākāra tā vyāpteḥ tat uktam
translated: For thus, in the former case, the restriction is by the exclusion of the impossible, and in the latter case, by the exclusion of the connection with another. How then can there be the same form in both cases of pervasion? It is said:

original: liṅge liṅgībhavaty eva liṅginy evetarat punaḥ/
analyzed: liṅge liṅgībhavati eva liṅgini eva itarat punar
translated: The inferential mark becomes the inferable object, but the other [i.e., the inferable object] is only the inferential mark.

original: niyamasya viparyāse 'sambandho liṅgaliṅgino // iti /
analyzed: niyamasya viparyāse sambandhaḥ liṅga liṅginoḥ iti
translated: If there is a reversal of the restriction, there is no connection between the inferential mark and the inferable object.

original: etenācāryeṇa saṃyogabalāt gamakatve yo doṣa uktaḥ
analyzed: saṃyoga balāt gamaka tve yaḥ doṣaḥ uktaḥ
translated: By this, the fault stated by the teacher regarding the fact of being an indicator due to the power of conjunction

original: na ca kenacid aṃśena na saṃyogīhutāśanaḥ/
analyzed: na ca kenacid aṃśena na saṃyogī hutāśanaḥ
translated: is refuted: Fire is not at all non-conjoined with smoke, nor is smoke non-conjoined with fire.

original: dhūmo vāsarvathā tena prāptaṃdhūmāt prakāśanam // iti /
analyzed: tena prāptam dhūmāt prakāśanam iti
translated: Smoke is not in any way obtained by that, the manifestation from smoke.

original: sa iha nāvataratīty ākhyātaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ iha na avatarati iti ākhyātam bhavati
translated: Thus it is stated that it does not enter here.

original: tathā hi saṃyogasya ubhayatrāviśeṣāt eṣa prasaṅgo na tu vyāpteḥ /🔽na hi yādṛśī
analyzed: tathā hi saṃyogasya ubhayatra aviśeṣāt eṣa prasaṅgaḥ na tu vyāpteḥ  na hi yādṛśī
translated: For thus, this consequence is from the non-distinction of conjunction in both, but not from the pervasion.

original: p / / vyāpakadharme vyāptiḥ tādṛśy eva vyāpyadharma iti / tathā cāha
analyzed: eva
translated: For it is not that the pervasion of the pervader is just like that of the pervaded property. Thus he says:

original: sambandho yady api dviṣṭhaḥsahabhāvyaṅgaliṅginoḥ/
analyzed: sambandhaḥ yadi api dviṣṭhaḥ saha bhāvi aṅga liṅginoḥ
translated: Although the relation is indeed reciprocal between the concomitant and the marked,

original: ādhārādheyavad vṛttis tasya saṃyogivan na tu // iti / S / /
analyzed: ādhāra ādheya vat vṛttiḥ tasya saṃyogi vat na tu iti
translated: its occurrence is like that of the supported and the supporter, not like that of the conjoined.

original: tena vyāpako vyāpyo na bhavati vyāpyaś ca na vyāpaka iti /
analyzed: tena vyāpakaḥ vyāpyaḥ na bhavati vyāpyaḥ ca na vyāpakaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the pervader is not the pervaded, and the pervaded is not the pervader.

original: tadaṃśena vyāpto hetuḥ iti vacanāt na saṃyogipakṣokto doṣaḥ /
analyzed: tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ hetuḥ iti vacanāt na saṃyogi pakṣa uktaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: Because of the statement the reason is pervaded by a part of that, the fault stated by the opponent of the conjoined is not there.

original: nā 'py ubhayor ggamyagamakatāprasaṅgaḥ /🔽yathoktād hetulakṣaṇād vyāpakasyaiva gamyatvapratīteḥ /
analyzed: nā pi ubhayoḥ ggamya gamaka tā prasaṅgaḥ  yathā uktāt hetu lakṣaṇāt vyāpakasya eva gamya tva pratīteḥ
translated: Nor is there the consequence of both being the object of inference and the means of inference.🔽Because it is understood that only the pervader is the object of inference from the stated definition of the reason.

original: vyāpyasyaiva gamakatāsampratyayādīti /🔽vyāpyavyāpaka
analyzed: vyāpyasya eva gamaka tā sampratyaya ādi iti  vyāpya vyāpaka
translated: And because it is understood that only the pervaded is the means of inference.

original: bhāva eveti sambandhaḥ🔽vyāpakasyeti🔽sarvathoccheda
analyzed: bhāvaḥ eva iti sambandhaḥ  vyāpakasya iti  sarvathā uccheda
translated: The relation is only between the pervaded and the pervader.🔽The pervader

original: hetau
analyzed: hetau
translated: is in every way the reason for the complete destruction

original: avadhāryate
analyzed: avadhāryate
translated: of the pervaded.🔽is ascertained.

original: vyāpakasyānityatvāder aprayatnānantarīyeṣv api vidyudādiṣu bhāvāt
analyzed: vyāpakasya anitya tva ādeḥ aprayatna anantarīyeṣu api vidyut ādiṣu bhāvāt
translated: Because impermanence, which is the pervader, is present in lightning, etc., which are not preceded by effort.

original: uccheda
analyzed: uccheda
translated: Annihilation

original: anityatvāder vyāpakasyety arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: of impermanence, which is the pervader.

original: prayatnānantarīyakatvād
analyzed: prayatna ānantarīyaka tvāt
translated: Because of being preceded by effort.

original: anityeṣv api vidyudādiṣu vyāpyasya prayatnānantarīkatvasyābhāvāt
analyzed: anityeṣu api vidyut ādiṣu vyāpyasya prayatna ānantarīka tvasya abhāvāt
translated: Because the pervaded property of being preceded by effort is absent in impermanent things like lightning, etc.

original: kāraṇena
analyzed: kāraṇena
translated: By the reason

original: sarvathā gamyagamakabhāvaḥ prāptaḥ /
analyzed: sarvathā gamya gamaka bhāvaḥ prāptaḥ
translated: The relation of the inferred and the inferential mark is obtained in every way.

original: agneḥ sāmānyadharmavad viśeṣadharmo api tārṇapārṇādayo gamyāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ sāmānya dharma vat viśeṣa dharmaḥ api tārṇa pārṇa ādayaḥ gamyāḥ syuḥ
translated: Like the general property of fire, the specific properties of being made of grass, wood, etc. would also be inferred.

original: dhūmasyāpi dhūmatvapaṇḍutvādiviśeṣadharmavad dravyatvapārthivatvādayo 'pi sāmānyadharmāḥ gamakā bhaveyuḥ saṃyogasyobhayatrāpi tulyatvāt
analyzed: dhūmasya api dhūma tva paṇḍu tva ādi viśeṣa dharma vat dravya tva pārthiva tva ādayaḥ api sāmānya dharmāḥ gamakāḥ bhaveyuḥ saṃyogasya ubhayatra api tulya tvāt
translated: Like the specific property of smoke being smoky and pale, the general properties of being a substance and being earthy would also be the inferential marks, because the relation of inherence is the same in both cases.

original: vyāpter anvayavyatirekarūpayos sūcanam /
translated: The indication of the two forms of pervasion, positive and negative,

original: yadi tarhi pakṣadharmas tadaṃśena vyāptaḥ ity etad dhetulakṣaṇaṃ tataḥ pakṣadharmatvaṃ tadaṃśavyāptiś ceti dvirūpo hetuḥ syāt /
analyzed: yadi tarhi pakṣa dharmaḥ tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ iti etat hetu lakṣaṇam tatas pakṣa dharma tvam tad aṃśa vyāptiḥ ca iti dvirūpaḥ hetuḥ syāt
translated: If the definition of a logical reason is a property of the subject that is pervaded by a part of it, then the logical reason would have two forms: being a property of the subject and being pervaded by a part of it.

original: anyatra ca trirūpa uktaḥ tat kathaṃ na vyāghātaḥ /
analyzed: anyatra ca trirūpaḥ uktaḥ tat katham na vyāghātaḥ
translated: And elsewhere, it is said to have three forms. How then is there no contradiction?

original: ity āha etena tadaṃśavyāptivacanena anvayo vyatireko vāuktaḥ veditavya iti sambandhaḥ T / / /
analyzed: iti āha etena tad aṃśa vyāpti vacanena anvayaḥ vyatirekaḥ veditavyaḥ iti sambandhaḥ
translated: This is what is said: by this statement of pervasion by a part, the positive and negative concomitance should be understood to be stated. The relation is:

original: anvayavyatirekarūpatvād vyāpter iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: anvaya vyatireka rūpa tvāt vyāpteḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that pervasion is of the nature of positive and negative concomitance.

original: tathā hi yaeva yenānvitoyannivṛttau ca nivṛttate saeva tenavyāpta ucyata iti tadātmakatvād vyāpter vyāptivacanenānvayavyatirekābhidhānam
analyzed: tathā hi   ucyate iti tad ātmaka tvāt vyāpteḥ vyāpti vacanena anvaya vyatireka abhidhānam
translated: This is because that which is invariably concomitant with something is said to be pervaded by it, and when that [something] ceases, it also ceases. Thus, pervasion is of the nature of that [positive and negative concomitance], and by stating pervasion, positive and negative concomitance is stated.

original: tato vyāptivacanena rūpadvayābhidhānāt na vyāghāta iti / S / /
analyzed: tatas vyāpti vacanena rūpa dvaya abhidhānāt na vyāghātaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, because pervasion is stated to have two forms, there is no contradiction.🔽Smoke🔽by fire

original: dhū dhūmaḥ🔽va vahninā🔽va vahniṃ
analyzed: dhū dhūmaḥ  va vahninā  va vahnim
translated: by fire🔽smoke

original: dhū dhūmaḥ🔽va vahninā
analyzed: dhū dhūmaḥ  va vahninā
translated: by fire

original: vyāpteḥ pratyakṣeṇānumānena vā niścayaḥ /🔽tau ca jñāpakahetvadhikārāt niścitau /
analyzed: tau ca jñāpaka hetu adhikārāt niścitau
translated: The ascertainment of pervasion is by perception or inference.🔽And those two are ascertained because of the topic of the reason that indicates.

original: niścayaśca tayor naikenaiva pramāṇena api tu yathāsvam /
analyzed: niścayaḥ ca tayoḥ na ekena eva pramāṇena api tu yathāsvam
translated: And the ascertainment of those two is not by only one means of knowledge, but by each one's own.

original: yasya yad ātmīyaṃ pramāṇaṃ niścāyakaṃ tena /
analyzed: yasya yat ātmīyam pramāṇam niścāyakam tena
translated: By that by which each one's own means of knowledge is determinative.

original: yasya ca yat niścāyakaṃ pramāṇaṃ tad uttaratra vakṣyati /
analyzed: yasya ca yat niścāyakam pramāṇam tat uttaratra vakṣyati
translated: And that means of knowledge which is determinative of which, that will be stated later.

original: anvayo vyatireko vā iti tulyakakṣatāsūcanārtho vā'śabdaḥ /
analyzed: anvayaḥ vyatirekaḥ vā iti tulya kakṣa tā sūcana arthaḥ vā śabdaḥ
translated: The word or is to indicate equality of status between positive and negative concomitance.

original: tena sādharmyavaidharmyavatoḥ prayogayor ekenaiva dvitīyagater vidhipratiṣedharūpatayā vyāvṛttibhede 'pi paramārthatas tādātmyāt nobhayopadarśanam
analyzed: tena sādharmya vaidharmyavatoḥ prayogayoḥ ekena eva dvitīya gateḥ vidhi pratiṣedha rūpa tayā vyāvṛtti bhede pi paramārthataḥ tādātmyāt na ubhaya upadarśanam  /
translated: Therefore, in the case of the two arguments with common and uncommon properties, only one is sufficient, because the other is implied, and although there is a difference in the form of affirmation and negation due to the difference in exclusion, in reality, because of identity, both are not shown.

original: iti sūcitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: iti sūcitam bhavati
translated: Thus it is indicated.

original: vyatireko hi sādhyanivṛttau liṅgasya nivṛttidharmakatvaṃsvabhāvabhūto dharma ity anvayarūpatā vastuto 'sya na virudhyate /
analyzed: vyatirekaḥ hi sādhya nivṛttau liṅgasya dharmaḥ iti anvaya rūpa tā vastutas sya na virudhyate
translated: For the vyatireka is the property of the reason's cessation when the probandum is absent, which is a property that is its nature. This form of concomitance is not contradicted in reality.

original: pakṣadharmaśca /
analyzed: pakṣa dharmaḥ ca
translated: And it is a property of the subject.

original: kiṃ / /
analyzed: kim
translated: What?

original: yathāsvaṃpramāṇena niścitaḥ
analyzed: yathāsvam pramāṇena niścitaḥ
translated: Determined by one's own means of knowledge.

original: p / / ukta iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: uktaḥ iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The connection is stated.

original: niścayaprasaṅgena so 'py atra pratipādyate /
analyzed: niścaya prasaṅgena saḥ u pi atra pratipādyate
translated: By the occurrence of determination, that is also taught here.

original: niścitasya gamakatvam ākhyātum /
analyzed: niścitasya gamaka tvam ākhyātum
translated: To teach the suggestiveness of the determined.

original: S / / iti pradarśanārtho vā'śabdaḥ /
analyzed: iti pradarśana arthaḥ vā śabdaḥ
translated: The word 'and' is used for the purpose of indicating.

original: pratyakṣeṇa ca svayaṃsvalakṣaṇākāratve 'py anantarasāmānyavikalpajananāt prasiddhiḥ
analyzed: ca svayam sva lakṣaṇa ākāra tve pi anantara sāmānya vikalpa jananāt prasiddhiḥ
translated: And although in perception the form is that of its own particular characteristic, there is recognition because it subsequently produces a conceptual construction of the universal.

original: upacārato niścaya ucyate pratyakṣapṛṣṭhabhāvino vikalpasyānadhigatārthādhigantṛtvābhāvaṃ darśayituṃ /
analyzed: upacārataḥ niścayaḥ ucyate pratyakṣa pṛṣṭha bhāvinaḥ vikalpasya anadhigata artha adhigantṛ tva abhāvam darśayitum
translated: The ascertainment is said to be figurative in order to show that the conceptual construction that occurs after perception does not apprehend an object that has not been apprehended.

original: tena yady api sāmānyarūpaṃ liṅgam avasthāpyate tathāpi svalakṣaṇapratītir eva tadvyavasthānibandhanam iti pratyakṣataḥ pakṣadharmasya sādhyadharmiṇi
analyzed: tena yadi api sāmānya rūpam liṅgam avasthāpyate tathā api sva lakṣaṇa pratītiḥ eva tad vyavasthā nibandhanam iti pratyakṣataḥ pakṣa dharmasya sādhya dharmiṇi
translated: Therefore, although a general form of the reason is stated, still the cognition of the individual characteristic itself is the basis for establishing that. Thus, the property of the subject is said to be well-known in the subject to be proved

original: prasiddhir ucyate /
analyzed: prasiddhiḥ ucyate
translated: through perception.

original: etac cānantaram eva vyaktīkariṣyate /🔽anumānato vāsādhyadharmini pakṣadharmasya prasiddhir niścayaḥ
analyzed: etat ca anantaram eva vyaktīkariṣyate  anumānataḥ vā a sādhya dharmini pakṣa dharmasya prasiddhiḥ niścayaḥ
translated: And this will be made clear immediately after.🔽Or the well-known certainty of the property of the subject in the subject to be proved is through inference.

original: pramāṇaphalabhedācca anumānataḥ anumānena niścayaḥ iti āha /
analyzed: anumānataḥ anumānena niścayaḥ iti āha
translated: And because of the difference in the result of the means of knowledge, it is said that the certainty is through inference, by inference.

original: atrodāharaṇe yathākramaṃ yathāpradeśe Tt / / dhūmasya dhūmasāmānyasya pratyakṣato niścayaḥ iti /
