analyzed: atra udāharaṇe yathākramam yathā pradeśe dhūmasya dhūma sāmānyasya pratyakṣataḥ niścayaḥ iti
translated: In this example, the certainty of smoke, the generality of smoke, is through perception, in the place where it occurs, in order.

original: na tu nivṛttimātraṃ tuccharūpam
analyzed: na tu nivṛtti mātram tuccha rūpam
translated: But not mere cessation, which is of the nature of emptiness.

original: nanu nirvikalpakena pratyakṣeṇa kathaṃ sāmānyātmano liṅgasya grahaṇam / ity āha
analyzed: nanu nirvikalpakena pratyakṣeṇa katham sāmānya ātmanaḥ liṅgasya grahaṇam iti āha
translated: But how can the general form of the reason be grasped by non-conceptual perception? He says:

original: bauddhamate na pramityātmakaṃ pramāṇaphalaṃ bhinnaṃ kiñcid asti /
analyzed: bauddha mate na pramiti ātmakam pramāṇa phalam bhinnam kiñcid asti
translated: According to the Buddhist view, there is no separate result of the means of knowledge that is of the nature of knowledge.

original: kintu bhedam abhyupagamya anumānena niścaya iti ucyate /
analyzed: kintu bhedam abhyupagamya anumānena niścaya iti ucyate
translated: But, accepting the difference, it is said that the certainty is through inference.

original: atra hy ayaṃ bhramo / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / paryāyaḥ🔽uddyotakaramataṃ nirasya deśādyapekṣakāryahetor gamakatvoktiḥ /
analyzed: atra hi ayam paryāyaḥ       nirasya
translated: Here this confusion...🔽... is a permutation.🔽Having refuted the opinion of Uddyotakara, it is said that the effect reason which depends on place etc. is an indicator.

original: yas tu manyate yaḥ pradeśo 'gnisambandhī so 'pratyakṣo yas tu pratyakṣo nabhobhagarūpa🔽ālokādyātmādhūmavat tayā dṛśyamāno na so 'gnimān ataḥ kathaṃ pradeśe dhūmasya🔽pratyakṣataḥ prasiddhiḥ /🔽S / / tasmād dhūma eva dharmī yuktaḥ /🔽sāgnir ayaṃ dhūmaḥ dhūmatvāt ity evaṃ sādhyasādhanabhāvaḥ' iti tasyāpi sāgneḥ dhūmāvayavasyā 'pratyakṣatvāt /🔽paridṛśyamānasya corddhvabhāgavartino 'gninā sahāvṛtteḥ /🔽kathaṃ dhūmasāmānyasya sādhyadharmiṇi pratyakṣataḥ prasiddhiḥ / /🔽dhūmāvayavī pratyakṣa iti cet / na /🔽avayavavyatirekeṇa T / / tasyābhāvāt /
analyzed: yaḥ tu manyate yaḥ pradeśaḥ gni sambandhī saḥ pratyakṣaḥ yaḥ tu pratyakṣaḥ nabhaḥ bhaga rūpa 🔽tayā dṛśyamānaḥ na saḥ gnimān atas katham pradeśe dhūmasya 🔽pratyakṣataḥ prasiddhiḥ 🔽tasmāt dhūmaḥ eva dharmī yuktaḥ 🔽sa agniḥ ayam dhūmaḥ dhūma tvāt iti evam sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ iti tasya api sa agneḥ dhūma avayavasya ā pratyakṣa tvāt 🔽paridṛśyamānasya ca ūrddhva bhāga vartinaḥ gninā saha āvṛtteḥ 🔽katham dhūma sāmānyasya sādhya dharmiṇi pratyakṣataḥ prasiddhiḥ 🔽dhūma avayavī pratyakṣaḥ iti ced na 🔽avayava vyatirekeṇa t

original: lokādhyavasāyatas tasyaikatve vā pradeśasyāpi
analyzed: loka adhyavasāyataḥ tasya eka tve vā pradeśasya api
translated: If it is one due to the determination of the world, then even in the case of a part,

original: p / / tāvataḥ kalpitam ekatvaṃ na nivāryate /
analyzed: tāvataḥ kalpitam eka tvam na nivāryate
translated: the imagined oneness of that much is not prevented.

original: pradeśe eva ca loko 'gniṃ pratipadyate / na dhūme /
analyzed: pradeśe eva ca lokaḥ gnim pratipadyate na dhūme
translated: And the world understands fire only in the place, not in smoke.

original: deśakālādyapekṣayaivaca kāryahetur ggamakaḥ / yad āha
analyzed: kārya hetuḥ ggamakaḥ yat āha
translated: And the effect-reason is the probans only in relation to place, time, etc., as it is said:

original: iṣṭaṃ viruddhakārye 'pi deśakālādyapekṣaṇam /
analyzed: viruddha kārye pi deśa kāla ādi apekṣaṇam
translated: Even in the case of contradictory effects, the dependence on place, time, etc. is accepted.

original: śabde vākṛtakatvasya pratyayabhedabheditvādinānumāneneti /
analyzed: śabde vā akṛtaka tvasya pratyaya bheda bhedi tva ādinā anumānena iti
translated: Or in the case of sound, by inference of non-production, etc. due to the difference of cognition, etc.

original: ā lokatam asī nabhaḥ
analyzed: ā lokatam asī nabhaḥ
translated: You are as far as the world, O sky

original: dhūmakāle eva cāgniḥ sādhyate na bhasmakāle
analyzed: dhūma kāle eva ca agniḥ sādhyate na bhasma kāle
translated: And fire is proved only at the time of smoke, not at the time of ashes

original: na kevalaṃ kāryahetau
analyzed: na kevalam kārya hetau
translated: And not only in the case of effect-reason,

original: nirvikalpaṃ kathaṃ sāmānyagrāhīti kumārilākṣepasyottaram /
translated: How can the apprehension of the universal be non-conceptual? This is the answer to Kumārila's objection.

original: atra yathopavarṇitaṃ pratyakṣataḥ S / / pakṣadharmasya sādhyadharmiṇi prasiddhāv abhiprāyam apratipadyamānaḥkumārilaḥ kathaṃ pratyakṣeṇaṇā
analyzed: atra yathā upavarṇitam pratyakṣataḥ pakṣa dharmasya sādhya dharmiṇi prasiddhau abhiprāyam a pratipadyamānaḥ kumārilaḥ katham
translated: Here, not understanding the intention of the establishment of the property of the subject by perception as described, Kumārila asks how by perception,

original: vikalpena sāmānyātmano liṅgasya dhūmādeḥ svrūpagrahaṇam api tāvad yujyate /
analyzed: vikalpena sāmānya ātmanaḥ liṅgasya dhūma ādeḥ sva rūpa grahaṇam api tāvat yujyate
translated: how is it possible to apprehend even the form of the inferential mark such as smoke, which has a universal nature, by a conceptual cognition?

original: dharmiṇo vā kuta eva tatsambandhagrahaṇam' iti pratyavatasthe /
analyzed: dharmiṇaḥ vā kutas eva tad sambandha grahaṇam iti pratyavatasthe
translated: How much less can there be a cognition of the connection of that with the subject?

original: tena hi pratyakṣapūrvakatvāc cānumānāder ddharmaṃpratyanimittatvam ŚBh / / / ity etadbhāṣyam
analyzed: tena hi pratyakṣa pūrvaka tvāt ca anumāna ādeḥ iti etat bhāṣyam
translated: To this, the following commentary was composed: Because inference etc. are preceded by perception, they are not the cause of the cognition of dharma.

original: kathaṃ pratyakṣapūrvatvam anumānādino bhavet / /
analyzed: katham pratyakṣa pūrva tvam anumāna ādinaḥ bhavet
translated: How can inference etc. be preceded by perception?

original: yadā smṛtyasamarthatvān nirvikalpendriyasya dhīḥ//
analyzed: yadā smṛti asamartha tvāt nirvikalpa indriyasya dhīḥ
translated: When the intellect of the sense organ is incapable of recollection due to being non-conceptual,

original: na cāvikalpyaliṅgasya dharmisambandhayos tathā/🔽gṛhītiḥ ŚV pp / /
analyzed: na ca avikalpya liṅgasya dharmi sambandhayoḥ tathā  gṛhītiḥ śv pp
translated: and the mark, the subject, and their connection are not conceptualized in the same way,🔽how can there be a cognition of them?

original: ity ākṣipya 🔽pratyakṣāgrahaṇaṃ yat tu liṅgāder avikalpanāt /
analyzed: iti ākṣipya  pratyakṣa agrahaṇam yat tu liṅga ādeḥ avikalpanāt
translated: Having raised this objection,🔽the non-mention of perception is because the mark etc. are not conceptualized.

original: tan neṣṭatvād vikalpasyāpy artharūpopakāriṇaḥ//
analyzed: tat na iṣṭa tvāt vikalpasya api artha rūpa upakāriṇaḥ
translated: This is not so, because conceptualization is accepted as assisting in the form of the object.

original: asti hyālocanājñānaṃprathamaṃnirvikalpakam /
analyzed: asti hi ālocanā jñānam prathamam nirvikalpakam
translated: There is indeed the initial non-conceptual perceptual cognition,

original: bālamūkādivijñānasadṛśaṃśuddhavastujam //
analyzed: bāla mūka ādi vijñāna sadṛśam śuddha vastu jam
translated: which is like the cognition of a child or mute, and arises from the pure object.🔽After that,

original: tataḥT / / paraṃpunarvastu dharmair jātyādibhir yayaḥ/
analyzed: tatas param punar vastu dharmaiḥ jāti ādibhiḥ yayaḥ
translated: when the object is determined by the intellect along with its attributes like genus etc.,

original: buddhyāvasīyate sā'pi pratyakṣatvena sammatā//
analyzed: buddhyā avasīyate sā api pratyakṣa tvena sammatā
translated: that too is accepted as being of the nature of perception.

original: ŚV pp / / /
analyzed: ro-0
translated: [The opponent says:]

original: p / /iti bruvatā saugatānām evāyaṃ liṅgadharmitatsambandhāgrāhaṇalakṣaṇo doṣo yeṣām avikalpakam eva pratyakṣaṃ /
analyzed: bruvatā eva ayam liṅga dharmi tad sambandha agrāhaṇa lakṣaṇaḥ doṣaḥ yeṣām avikalpakam eva pratyakṣam
translated: By saying this, it is said: This fault, which consists in the non-apprehension of the mark, the marked, and their relation, belongs only to the Buddhists, for whom perception is non-conceptual.

original: nāsmākaṃ savikalpam api pratyakṣam icchatām' S / / ity uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na asmākam sa vikalpam api pratyakṣam icchatām
translated: Not for us, who maintain that perception is also conceptual.

original: tatas tadupavarṇitadoṣapratividhānāyā ''ha sadhūmaṃhi Tt / / ityādi /
analyzed: tatas tad upavarṇita doṣa pratividhānāyāḥ ha ityādi
translated: Therefore, in order to refute the fault described by him, he says Because it is with smoke, etc..

original: ayam atra samudāyārthaḥ pratyakṣaṃ hi purovasthitam auttarādharyeṇa dhūmapradeśādikaṃ
analyzed: ayam atra samudāya arthaḥ pratyakṣam hi purovasthitam auttarādharyeṇa dhūma pradeśa ādikam
translated: The general meaning here is this: Perception, indeed, of the region of smoke, etc., which is present in front, in an ascending and descending order,

original: vidhirūpeṇa dhūmādisvalakṣaṇaṃ sakalasajātīyavijātīyavyāvṛttaṃ ca svasvabhāvavyavasthiteḥ
analyzed: vidhi rūpeṇa dhūma ādi sva lakṣaṇam sakala sajātīya vijātīya vyāvṛttam ca sva svabhāva vyavasthiteḥ
translated: in the form of injunction, the particular characteristic of smoke, etc., and also distinguished from all homogeneous and heterogeneous [objects], by the establishment of its own nature,

original: sarvāsāmarthamātrāṇāṃ parasparam asaṃkīrṇarūpatvāt yathāsthānamanukurvat
analyzed: sarvāsām artha mātrāṇām parasparam asaṃkīrṇa rūpa tvāt tad sāmarthya bhāvi
translated: because all mere potencies have an unmixed form with respect to each other, conforming to their respective places,

original: pāścāttyavidhipratiṣedhavikalpadvayaṃ janayati yena dhūmapradeṣākhyau dharmadharmiṇau
analyzed: pāścāttya vidhi pratiṣedha vikalpa dvayam janayati yena dhūma pradeṣa ākhyau dharma dharmiṇau
translated: generates the two subsequent alternatives of injunction and prohibition, by which the two, the property and the possessor of the property, called the region of smoke,

original: tayoś cauttarādharyam evam etat nānyathā' iti vikalpayati /
analyzed: tayoḥ ca auttarādharyam evam etat na anyathā iti vikalpayati
translated: and their ascending and descending order, are conceptualized as follows: This is so, not otherwise.

original: yathānubhavam abhyāsapāṭavādipratyayāntarasahakāriṇāṃ vikalpānām udayāt /
analyzed: yathānubhavam abhyāsa pāṭava ādi pratyaya antara sahakāriṇām vikalpānām udayāt
translated: Because conceptual cognitions arise from the repetition of experience, the vividness of the cognition, and other contributory factors.

original: tato dharmadharmiṇoḥ svarūpaniścayaḥ sambandhaniścayaś ca pratyakṣanibandhanaḥ
analyzed: tatas dharma dharmiṇoḥ svarūpa niścayaḥ sambandha niścayaḥ ca pratyakṣa nibandhanaḥ
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the nature of the property and the property-possessor, and the ascertainment of the relation, are based on perception.

original: sampadyate /
analyzed: sampadyate
translated: They are accomplished.

original: tathā hi ayam eva dhūmapradeśayoḥ sambandhasya niścayo yaḥ ātrāyam' ity adhyavasāyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi ayam eva dhūma pradeśayoḥ sambandhasya niścayaḥ yaḥ ātrāyam iti adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: For this is the ascertainment of the relation between the region of smoke and the hill: the determination that 'this is on that'.

original: sa cāvikalpenāpi pratyakṣeṇa yathoktena prakāreṇa sampādita eva /
analyzed: sa ca avikalpena api pratyakṣeṇa yathā uktena prakāreṇa sampāditaḥ eva
translated: And that is accomplished even by non-conceptual perception in the manner described.

original: na cauttarādharyāvasthitād vastudvayād anya S / / eva kaścid ādhārādheyabhāvalakṣaṇaḥ sambandhaḥ yataḥ tasya T / / pratyakṣeṇānanubhūtatvāt🔽vikalpanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: na ca auttarādharya avasthitāt vastu dvayāt anyaḥ eva kaścid ādhāra ādheya bhāva lakṣaṇaḥ sambandhaḥ yatas tasya t pratyakṣeṇa ananubhūta tvāt  vikalpanam syāt
translated: And there is no other relation characterized by the relation of container and contained between the two things situated above and below, from which there could be conceptualization due to its not being experienced by perception.

original: vastubhūtasya tasyānyatra niṣedhāt /
analyzed: vastu bhūtasya tasya anyatra niṣedhāt
translated: Conceptualization would be due to the negation of that which is a real entity elsewhere.

original: tasmād ayaṃ tad eva tathāvasthitamarthadvayamāśritya kalpanāsamāropita eva /
analyzed: tasmāt ayam tat eva kalpanā samāropitaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, this relation is superimposed by conceptualization, relying on just those two things situated thus.

original: tena sambandhaḥ sambandhīti bhedāntarapratikṣepāpratikṣepābhyāṃ dharmadharmitayā vyavahāro loke na tu pāramārthikaḥ /
analyzed: tena sambandhaḥ sambandhi iti bheda antara pratikṣepa apratikṣepābhyām dharma dharmi tayā vyavahāraḥ loke na tu pāramārthikaḥ
translated: The usage as property and property-possessor through the exclusion and non-exclusion of other differences is in the world, but not ultimately.

original: sāmānyavyavahāro 'pi vijātīyavyāvṛttāneva bhāvānāsṛśri🔽tya kalpanāsamāropita eva pratanyate /
analyzed: sāmānya vyavahāraḥ pi vijātīya vyāvṛttān eva bhāvān āsṛśri  kalpanā samāropitaḥ eva pratanyate
translated: The usage of universals is also extended by superimposition of imagination, taking as its basis only things that are excluded from what is of a different kind.

original: teṣām eva bhinnānām apy anubhavadvāreṇa vijātīyavyāvṛttatayā prakṛtyaivaikākāraparāmarśapratyayahetutvāt tathā cāha
analyzed: teṣām eva bhinnānām api anubhava dvāreṇa vijātīya vyāvṛtta tayā prakṛtyā eva eka ākāra parāmarśa pratyaya hetu tvāt tathā ca āha
translated: Even though those [particulars] are different, they are by nature the cause of a cognition that reflects on a single form, by virtue of being excluded from what is of a different kind, through the door of experience. Thus he says:

original: ekapratyavamarśārthajñānādyekārthasādhane /
translated: When the object of a single cognition is accomplished by a single thing,

original: bhede 'pi niyatāḥkecit svabhāvenendriyādivat // PV / iti /
analyzed: bhede pi niyatāḥ kecid svabhāvena indriya ādi vat  iti
translated: some, even though different, are restricted by nature, like the senses and so on.

original: puro 'vasthitārthasāmarthyabhāvipratyakṣa
analyzed: puras
translated: The perception that arises from the power of the object present in front,

original: auttarādharyāvasthitam
analyzed: auttarādharya avasthitam
translated: existing in a sequential order,

original: dhūmapradeśalakṣaṇa
analyzed: dhūma pradeśa lakṣaṇa
translated: having the characteristic of the region of smoke,

original: p / / tataḥ sāmānyavikalpajananadvārā S / / tatpratibhāsino dhūmākārasya vijātīyavyāvṛttarūpasya sāmānyarūpatayā pratyakṣeṇaiva
analyzed: tatas sāmānya vikalpa janana dvārā tad pratibhāsinaḥ dhūma ākārasya vijātīya vyāvṛtta rūpasya sāmānya rūpatayā pratyakṣeṇa eva
translated: then, through the door of generating the conceptual cognition of the universal, the form of smoke that appears in that [conceptual cognition], which has the nature of being excluded from what is of a different kind, is by the very perception itself

original: na hi vijātīyavyāvṛttir vyāvṛttād anyaiva kācid yasyāḥ pratyakṣeṇāgrahaṇaṃ syāt /
analyzed: na hi vijātīya vyāvṛttiḥ vyāvṛttāt anyā eva kācid yasyāḥ pratyakṣeṇa agrahaṇam syāt
translated: For exclusion from what is of a different kind is not something else apart from what is excluded, of which there could be a non-apprehension by perception.

original: tasmād yathāparidṛṣṭaṃ dhūmādisvalakṣaṇam evānyato vyāvṛttātmanā vikalpyata iti pratipattradhyavasāyavaśāt smṛtir eva /
analyzed: tasmāt yathā paridṛṣṭam dhūma ādi sva lakṣaṇam eva anyatas vyāvṛtta ātmanā vikalpyate iti pratipattṛ adhyavasāya vaśāt smṛtiḥ eva
translated: Therefore, the universal is only memory, because it is imagined as the individual characteristic of smoke etc., as it is perceived, with a nature excluded from other things, by the power of the determination of the cognizer.

original: dvividho vikalpaḥ pratyakṣapṛṣṭhabhāvī vastutaḥ punar nirviṣaya eva /
analyzed: dvividhaḥ vikalpaḥ pratyakṣa pṛṣṭhabhāvī vastutaḥ punar nirviṣayaḥ eva
translated: Imagination is of two kinds: that which arises after perception, and that which arises from memory. But in reality, it is objectless.

original: tato yad āha sāmānyasyānanubhūta tathā
analyzed: tatas yat āha tathā
translated: Therefore, what he says about the universal not being experienced in that way,

original: smārttam etad abhedena vijñānam iti yo vadet /
analyzed: smārttam etat abhedena vijñānam iti yaḥ vadet
translated: and that this cognition is non-different, is only memory.

original: anumānagrāhyam eva /🔽tatra cānavasthā liṅgagrāhiṇo 'py anumānasya tadanyaliṅgabalenotpatteḥ /
analyzed: anumāna grāhyam eva  tatra ca anavasthā liṅga grāhiṇaḥ pi anumānasya tad anya liṅga balena utpatteḥ
translated: It is only to be grasped by inference.🔽And there is an infinite regress, because inference grasping the reason also arises by the power of another reason,

original: tasya ca sāmānyarūpatayā S / / tadanyānumānamānaviṣayatvāt tathā tadanyasyāpīti kasyacid ekasyāpi liṅginaḥ pratipattiḥ yugasahasrair api 🔽na sambhavati /
analyzed: tasya ca sāmānya rūpa tayā tad anya anumāna māna viṣaya tvāt tathā tad anyasya api iti kasyacid ekasya api liṅginaḥ pratipattiḥ yuga sahasraiḥ api  na sambhavati
translated: and that also has the form of a universal, and is the object of another inference, and so on, so the cognition of any single thing to be inferred is not possible even in thousands of aeons,🔽let alone by a single human lifetime.

original: kim aṅga punar ekena puruṣāyuṣkeṇeti / tathā cāha 🔽sāmānyaṃnānumānena vināyasya pratīyate /🔽na ca liṅgavinirmuktam anumānaṃpravarttate //
analyzed: kim aṅga punar ekena puruṣa āyuṣkeṇa iti tathā ca āha  sāmānyaṃna anumānena vinā ayasya pratīyate  na ca liṅga vinirmuktam anumānam pravarttate
translated: Thus he says:🔽That which is not cognized without inference cannot be a universal.🔽And inference does not operate without a reason.

original: asāmānyasya liṅgatvaṃna ca kenacid iṣyate /
analyzed: asāmānyasya liṅga tvam na ca kenacid iṣyate
translated: And no one accepts a non-universal as a reason.

original: na cānavagataṃliṅgaṃkiñcid asti prakāśakam //
analyzed: na ca anavagatam liṅgam kiñcid asti prakāśakam
translated: And there is no unperceived mark that is a revealer.

original: tasyāpi cānumānena syād anyena gatiḥpunaḥ/
analyzed: tasya api ca anumānena syāt anyena gatiḥ punar
translated: And that too would be cognized by another inference.

original: ity āśaṅkyāha S / / sadhūmaṃhi ityādi /
analyzed: iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: Fearing this, he says Because it has smoke, etc.

original: evaṃ manyate /
analyzed: evam manyate
translated: He thinks this:

original: yasyānumānam antareṇa sāmānyaṃ na pratīyate bhavatu tasyāyaṃ doṣaḥ /
analyzed: yasya anumānam antareṇa sāmānyam na pratīyate bhavatu tasya ayam doṣaḥ
translated: If one does not perceive a universal without inference, let that be a fault for him.

original: p / / asmākaṃ tu pratyakṣapṛṣṭhabhāvinā 'pi vikalpena prakṛtivibhramāt sāmānyaṃ pratīyate /
analyzed: asmākam tu pratyakṣa pṛṣṭha bhāvinā vikalpena prakṛti vibhramāt sāmānyam pratīyate
translated: But for us, a universal is perceived even by a conceptual cognition that arises after perception, because of the natural error [of conceptual cognition].

original: liṅgavikalpasya ca svalakṣaṇadarśanāśrayatvāt T / / paramparayā vastupratibandhād avisaṃvādakatvam /
analyzed: liṅga vikalpasya ca sva lakṣaṇa darśana āśraya tvāt paramparayā vastu pratibandhāt avisaṃvādaka tvam
translated: And because the conceptual cognition of the mark has the perception of the particular as its basis, it is non-deceptive by a remote connection with the real thing.

original: maṇiprabhāyām iva maṇibhrānteḥ /
analyzed: maṇi prabhāyām iva maṇi bhrānteḥ
translated: Like the error of a jewel in a jewel's radiance.

original: kāryahetutvam api vikalpāvabhāsino dhūmasāmānyasya liṅgatayā 'vasthāpyamānasya kāryadarśanāśrayatayā tadadhyavasāyāc ca /
analyzed: kārya hetu tvam api vikalpa avabhāsinaḥ dhūma sāmānyasya liṅga tayā avasthāpyamānasya kārya darśana āśraya tayā tad adhyavasāyāt ca
translated: The universal of smoke, which appears in conceptual cognition and is established as the mark by the relation of effect to cause, is also the effect of fire because it is based on the perception of the effect.

original: na hi dhūmasvalakṣaṇasya liṅgatā 'vasthāpayituṃ yuktā /🔽tasyāsādhāraṇasya sapakṣe vṛttyabhāvāt /
analyzed: na hi dhūma sva lakṣaṇasya liṅga tā avasthāpayitum yuktā  tasya asādhāraṇasya sapakṣe vṛtti abhāvāt
translated: For it is not proper to establish the particular of smoke as the mark.🔽Because the uncommon [particular] does not occur in a similar instance.

original: tadaṃśavyāptyayogāt /
analyzed: tad aṃśa vyāpti ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible for it to pervade a part [of the similar instance].

original: sādhyasādhanasaṃkalpe vastudarśanāsambhavāc ceti /
analyzed: sādhya sādhana saṃkalpe vastu darśana asambhavāt ca iti
translated: and because it is impossible to perceive an object when there is a conceptual construction of what is to be established and the means of establishing it.

original: yat tūktam S / / sāmānyalakṣaṇaviṣayam anumānam' iti tatra naivam avadhāryate sāmānyalakṣaṇaviṣayam anumānam eveti /
analyzed: yat tu uktam s sāmānya lakṣaṇa viṣayam anumānam iti tatra na evam avadhāryate sāmānya lakṣaṇa viṣayam anumānam eva iti
translated: As for what was said, Inference has a universal characteristic as its object, it is not determined there that inference only has a universal characteristic as its object.

original: pratyakṣapṛṣṭhabhāvino vikalpasyāpi tadviṣayatvāt tadanyasyaca vikalpasya /
analyzed: pratyakṣa pṛṣṭha bhāvinaḥ vikalpasya api tad viṣaya tvāt vikalpasya
translated: Because a conceptual cognition that arises after perception also has that as its object, and because there is another kind of conceptual cognition.

original: kintu sāmānyalakṣaṇaviṣayam evānumānam ity avadhāryate svalakṣaṇaviṣayatvaniṣedhārtham iti /
analyzed: kintu sāmānya lakṣaṇa viṣayam eva anumānam iti avadhāryate sva lakṣaṇa viṣaya tva niṣedha artham iti
translated: But it is determined that inference only has a universal characteristic as its object, in order to negate that it has an individual characteristic as its object.

original: tatra saha dhūmena vartata iti sadhūmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra saha dhūmena vartate iti sa dhūmaḥ
translated: There, it is said having smoke, meaning it exists together with smoke.

original: pakṣadharmatāpratipādanārtham evam uktam /
analyzed: pakṣa dharmatā pratipādana artham evam uktam
translated: This is stated only to establish that it is a property of the subject.

original: vidhivikalpasya caitad eva bījam /
analyzed: vidhi vikalpasya ca etat eva bījam
translated: And this is the seed of the optative construction.

original: taṃ sadhūmaṃpradeśaṃdṛṣṭavataḥ pratyakṣeṇeti sambhandhaḥ /
analyzed: tam sa dhūmam pradeśam dṛṣṭavataḥ pratyakṣeṇa iti sambhandhaḥ
translated: The relation is: for one who has seen that place as having smoke by perception.

original: kīdṛśam arthāntaraviviktarūpam arthāntaraiḥ sajātīyavijātīyair viviktam asaṅkīrṇaṃ rūpam asyeti vigrahaḥ /
analyzed: kīdṛśam artha antara vivikta rūpam artha antaraiḥ sajātīya vijātīyaiḥ viviktam asaṅkīrṇam rūpam asya iti vigrahaḥ
translated: The analysis is: it has a form that is distinguished from other objects, meaning it has a form that is unmixed, distinguished from other objects, both of the same and different kinds.

original: sarvabhāvānāṃ svasvabhāvavyavasthiteḥ svabhāvasāṅkaryābhāvāt /
analyzed: sarva bhāvānām sva svabhāva vyavasthiteḥ svabhāva sāṅkarya abhāvāt
translated: Because all things are established in their own nature, there is no mixing of natures.

original: anyathā sarvasya sarvatropayogād atiprasaṅgaḥ /🔽S / / anena pratiṣedhavikalpasya nimittam ākhyātam /
analyzed: anyathā sarvasya sarvatra upayogāt atiprasaṅgaḥ  anena pratiṣedha vikalpasya nimittam ākhyātam
translated: Otherwise, there would be the absurdity of everything being useful everywhere.🔽By this, the cause of the exclusion of negation is stated.

original: sāmānyotprekṣāyāś ca bījam / taduktam
analyzed: sāmānya utprekṣāyāḥ ca bījam tat uktam
translated: And the seed of the general imagination is stated. That is said:

original: itaretarabhedo 'ntyasya
analyzed: itaretara bhedaḥ ntyasya
translated: The difference of each other is the seed of the last

original: bījaṃsaṃjñāyadarthakāT / /
analyzed: bījam saṃjñā yad arthakāt
translated: from that which has the meaning of a name.

original: PV / iti /
analyzed: pu iti
translated: Thus.

original: tathā hi arthāntaravyāvṛttiṃ parasparavyāvṛttānām api samānām utpaśyato bhinnam eṣāṃ rūpaṃ tirodhāyā 'bhinnaṃ svabhāvam kalpanotpadyate/
analyzed: tathā hi artha antara vyāvṛttim paraspara vyāvṛttānām api samānām utpaśyataḥ bhinnam eṣām rūpam tirodhāyāḥ bhinnam svabhāvam āropayantī
translated: For, one who sees the exclusion of other objects even of the similar things that are mutually exclusive, imagines a non-different nature, concealing their different forms.

original: asādhāraṇātmanā iti arthāntaravyāvṛttena svabhāvena /
analyzed: iti artha antara vyāvṛttena svabhāvena
translated: By the nature that is not common, i.e., by the nature that excludes other objects.

original: na tu yathākumārilo manyate arthāntaraviveko 'bhāvapramāṇagrāhyo na pratyakṣāvaseyaḥ' iti /
analyzed: na tu yathā kumārilaḥ manyate artha antara vivekaḥ bhāva pramāṇa grāhyaḥ na pratyakṣa avaseyaḥ iti
translated: But not as Kumārila thinks, that the distinction from other objects is to be grasped by the means of knowledge of negation, not to be inferred by perception.

original: na hi vastubalabhāvinā pratyakṣeṇa anyathādarśanasambhavo bhrāntatāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: na hi vastu bala bhāvinā pratyakṣeṇa anyathā darśana sambhavaḥ bhrānta tā prasaṅgāt
translated: For, it is not possible for perception, which arises by the power of the object, to see otherwise, because that would lead to error.

original: p / / tenātmanādṛṣṭavataḥ sataḥ puṃso 'nantaraṃ smārttaṃliṅgajñānam utpadyata iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: sataḥ puṃsaḥ nantaram smārtam liṅga jñānam utpadyate iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The connection is that for a person who exists but does not see by that nature, the knowledge of the mark based on memory arises immediately after.

original: smṛtir eva smārttam /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ eva smārttam
translated: Memory itself is based on memory.

original: liṅgapratibhāsi jñānaṃ liṅgajñānam /
translated: The cognition that appears as the mark is the cognition of the mark.

original: anena pratyakṣapṛṣṭhabhāvini vikalpe yatsāmānyamābhāti tasya liṅgavyavasthām āha /
analyzed: anena pratyakṣa pṛṣṭha bhāvini vikalpe yat sāmānyam ābhāti tasya liṅga vyavasthām āha
translated: By this, he states the determination of the mark for the universal that appears in the conceptual cognition that arises after perception.

original: paramārthataḥ kiṃ viṣayam /
analyzed: paramārthataḥ kim viṣayam
translated: What is its ultimate object?

analyzed: yathā dṛṣṭa bheda parama artha viṣaya
translated: It has as its object the ultimate difference as seen.

original: darśanavidhipratiṣedavikalpeṣu prāmāṇyāprāmāṇyavyavasthā /
translated: The determination of the validity and invalidity of the conceptual cognitions of perception, injunction, and prohibition.

original: smṛtyādeḥ
analyzed: smṛti ādeḥ
translated: Of memory, etc.

original: sāmānyasya
analyzed: sāmānyasya
translated: Of the universal.

original: yan vikalpa utpa T /
analyzed: yan vikalpe utpa t
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises.

original: S / / darśanavidhipratiṣedhavikalpānāṃ pramāṇāpramāṇacintām ārabhate / tatra teṣu darśanavidhipratiṣedhaT / /vikalpeṣu / tad ādyaṃ
analyzed: darśana vidhi pratiṣedha vikalpānām pramāṇa apramāṇa cintām ārabhate tatra teṣu darśana vidhi pratiṣedhat tat ādyam
translated: He begins the consideration of the validity and invalidity of the conceptual cognitions of perception, injunction, and prohibition. Among them, in those conceptual cognitions of perception, injunction, and prohibition, that first one

original: yad etat 🔽asti hy ālocanājñānaṃ prathamam ŚV pratyakṣapariccheda iti
analyzed: yat etat  asti hi ālocanā jñānam prathamam
translated: which is this🔽For there is a first cognition of mere seeing, as stated in the first chapter on perception.

original: ādau vikalpapravṛtter bhavam iti ādyam ākhyātam asādhāraṇaviṣayaṃ svalakṣaṇaviṣayaṃ darśanam /
analyzed: ādau vikalpa pravṛtteḥ bhavam iti ādyam ākhyātam asādhāraṇa viṣayam sva lakṣaṇa viṣayam darśanam
translated: Since the operation of conceptual cognition begins with that, it is called the first. It is perception with an uncommon object, with a particular as its object.

original: tad eva pramāṇam /
analyzed: tat eva pramāṇam
translated: That alone is valid knowledge.

original: na vidhipratiṣedhavikalpāv api /🔽tasyaiva pramāṇalakṣaṇayogād itarayoś ca tadasambhavāt / tathā hi anadhigataviṣayatvam arthakriyāsādhanaviṣayatvaṃ ca pramāṇalakṣaṇam /tad
analyzed: na vidhi pratiṣedha vikalpau api  tasya eva pramāṇa lakṣaṇa yogāt itarayoḥ ca tad asambhavāt tathā hi anadhigata viṣaya tvam arthakriyā sādhana viṣaya tvam ca
translated: Nor are they the alternatives of injunction and prohibition.🔽Because only that has the character of a means of valid knowledge, and the other two do not have that possibility. Thus, the character of a means of valid knowledge is: having an unknown object and having an object that is a means of accomplishing a practical purpose.

original: tatra ādyam ity apūrvārthavijñānatvam ākhyātam asādhāraṇaviṣayam iti arthakriyāsādhanaviṣayatvam /
analyzed: tatra ādyam iti apūrva artha vijñāna tvam ākhyātam asādhāraṇa viṣayam iti artha kriyā sādhana viṣaya tvam
translated: Among them, the first is said to be the nature of the cognition of a new object, and the second is said to be having an uncommon object, which is having an object that is a means of accomplishing a practical purpose.

original: svalakṣaṇasyaivārthakriyāsādhanatvāt /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇasya eva arthakriyā sādhana tvāt
translated: Because only the particular has the nature of being a means of accomplishing a practical purpose.

original: pratiṣedhavikalpasyāprāmāṇyasthāpanam /
translated: The establishment of the invalidity of the alternative of prohibition.

original: prathamaviśeṣaṇāt pratiṣedhavikalpasyā'dhyavaseyārthakriyāsādhanaviṣayatve 'pi na prāmāṇyam /
translated: Even though the alternative of prohibition has as its object a thing to be accomplished that is to be ascertained, it is not a means of valid knowledge, because of the first qualification.

original: dvitīyāt tu dhidhivikalpasyānadhigatasāmānyaviṣayatve 'pi na prāmāṇyam
analyzed: dvitīyāt tu dhi dhi vikalpasya anadhigata sāmānya viṣaya tve pi na prāmāṇyam
translated: But because of the second, even though the alternative of injunction has as its object a universal that is not yet known, it is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: tatra pratiṣedhavikalpasya tāvat pratyakṣagṛhītārthaviṣayatayā smṛtitvaṃ pratipādayann
analyzed: tatra pratiṣedha vikalpasya tāvat pratyakṣa gṛhīta artha viṣaya tayā smṛti tvam pratipādayan
translated: There, first establishing that the alternative of prohibition has as its object a thing already apprehended by perception, it is said to be memory.

original: āha tasmin asādhāraṇe tathābhūte arthāntarair asaṅkīrṇaS / /rūpe darśanena
analyzed: āha tasmin asādhāraṇe tathābhūte artha antaraiḥ asaṅkīrṇaḥ darśanena
translated: He says: In that uncommon thing, which is of that nature, the form that is not mixed with other things, in the appearance of that,🔽the cognition that arises is the alternative of prohibition.

original: asaṅkīrṇarūpasāmarthyabhāvinā dṛṣṭe adhigate sati / tathā hi vyatiriktam api bhāvāṃśād
analyzed: asaṅkīrṇa rūpa sāmarthya bhāvinā dṛṣṭe adhigate sati tathā hi vyatiriktam api bhāva aṃśāt
translated: When the object is seen and known to be produced from a capacity that is not mixed with another form,

original: abhāvāṃśam icchatā bhāvāṃśaḥ svabhāvenāsaṅkīrṇarūpaḥ kalpanīyaḥ /
analyzed: abhāva aṃśam icchatā bhāva aṃśaḥ svabhāvena asaṅkīrṇa rūpaḥ kalpanīyaḥ
translated: then one who desires the aspect of non-existence separate from the existent part must imagine the existent part to have a form that is not mixed with its own nature.

original: anyathāsa evābhāvāṃśo na sidhyet / na ca
analyzed: eva abhāva aṃśaḥ na sidhyet na ca
translated: Otherwise, that very aspect of non-existence would not be established. And

original: p / / svabhāvenāsaṅkīrṇarūpatāyām asatyāṃ pṛthagbhūtābhāvāṃśasadbhāve 'pi sāyuktimatī /
analyzed: svabhāvena asaṅkīrṇa rūpa tāyām asatyām pṛthak bhūta abhāva aṃśa sadbhāve pi
translated: if there is no form that is not mixed with its own nature, then even if the existent of the separate aspect of non-existence exists, it is not reasonable.

original: svahetubalāyātasya saṅkīrṇarūpasyākiñcitkarābhāvāṃśasambhave 'pi tyāgāyogāt / naca tenaiva tadvināśanam /
analyzed: sva hetu bala āyātasya saṅkīrṇa rūpasya akiñcitkara abhāva aṃśa sambhave tyāga ayogāt tena eva tad vināśanam
translated: Because when the form that has come from the power of its own cause is mixed, even if the aspect of non-existence that does nothing is possible, it cannot be abandoned. And it is not🔽destroyed by that itself.

original: vināśahetvayogasya pratipādayiṣyamāṇatvāt / tena saṅkīrṇarūpavināśane ca varaṃ svahetor eva svabhāvato 'saṅkīrṇarūpāṇāmudayo 'stu kiṃ parivrāṅmoT /
analyzed: vināśa hetu ayogasya pratipādayiṣyamāṇa tvāt tena saṅkīrṇa rūpa vināśane ca varam sva hetoḥ eva svabhāvataḥ saṅkīrṇa rūpāṇām udayaḥ astu kim
translated: Because the impossibility of a cause of destruction will be explained. And when the mixed form is destroyed by that, it is better that the arising of those with a form that is not mixed by nature from its own cause alone should be. What is the use of a wandering ascetic?

original: tasmāt svabhāvata eva bhāvānāṃ abhāvāṃśaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt svabhāvataḥ eva bhāvānām para rūpa vikala tvam
translated: Therefore, the aspect of non-existence of existents is by nature itself.

original: nānyaḥ / sa ca tathābhūto darśanena gṛhīta eva / tasmiṃs tathābhūte S / / dṛṣṭe
analyzed: na anyaḥ sa ca tathābhūtaḥ darśanena gṛhītaḥ eva tasmin tathābhūte dṛṣṭe
translated: And it is not another. And that which is of such a nature is grasped by seeing itself. When that which is of such a nature is seen,

original: sa padārtho yena vastunā asādhāraṇaḥ samānasvabhāvo na bhavati tadrūpavikalasvabhāvatvāt🔽tadasādhāraṇatāṃ tena tenātadrūpeṇāsamānasvabhāvatāṃ etad eva vyanakti /
analyzed: sa padārthaḥ yena vastunā asādhāraṇaḥ samāna svabhāvaḥ na bhavati tad rūpa vikala svabhāva tvāt  tad asādhāraṇa tām tena tena a tad rūpeṇa asamāna svabhāva tām etat eva vyanakti
translated: That object is different from another object, because it lacks the nature of that [other object], due to having a nature deficient in the form of that [other object].🔽This very [fact] is explained by [the statement] its difference from that [other object] by that [other object], its lack of the same nature by that [other object] which is not of that [other object's] form.

original: tataḥ arthāntarād bhedaṃ vailakṣaṇyam anyarūpam idaṃ na bhavatīti abhilapantī abhimukhayantī
analyzed: tatas artha antarāt bhedam vailakṣaṇyam anya rūpam idam na bhavati iti abhilapantī abhimukhayantī
translated: Speaking, i.e., presenting, [the fact] that this [object] is not of the form of another, i.e., is different, i.e., has a different nature, from another object.

original: dṛṣṭavailakṣaṇye pravartamānatayā smṛtir utpannāpratyakṣabalena /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa vailakṣaṇye pravartamāna tayā smṛtiḥ utpannā apratyakṣa balena
translated: Memory arises by the power of perception, operating on the difference that is seen.

original: yadi tu liṅgabalenotpadyeta vyavacchedaviṣayāpi smṛtirna syād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yadi tu liṅga balena utpadyeta vyavaccheda viṣayā api syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But if it were to arise by the power of an inferential mark, then memory would not have an object of exclusion, this is the idea.

original: kiṃ viṣayā / atadavyāvṛttiviṣayā / tacchabdena darśanaviṣayasya vastunaḥ parāmarśaḥ kṛtaḥ / na tat atat vijātīyam /
analyzed: kim viṣayā a tad avyāvṛtti viṣayā tad śabdena darśana viṣayasya vastunaḥ parāmarśaḥ kṛtaḥ na tat a tat vijātīyam
translated: What is its object? The object of non-exclusion of that. By the word that, reference is made to the object of perception. That is not that, i.e., is not of a different kind.

original: atasmād vyāvṛttiḥ atadvyāvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: a tasmāt vyāvṛttiḥ a tad vyāvṛttiḥ
translated: Exclusion from that is non-exclusion of that.

original: sā viṣayo yasyāḥ sā tathā /
analyzed: sā viṣayaḥ yasyāḥ sā tathā
translated: That which has that as its object is so.

original: yathādṛṣṭa evārthāntarebhyo bhedo mayā 'pi kalpyata iti pratipatrattra
analyzed: yathādṛṣṭe eva artha antarebhyaḥ bhedaḥ mayā pi kalpyate iti
translated: The difference from other objects is imagined by me just as it is seen.

original: dhyavasāyāc caivam uktam /
analyzed: dhī avasāyāt ca evam uktam
translated: And because of the determination, it is stated thus.

original: paramārthato nirviṣayatvāt /
analyzed: paramārthataḥ nirviṣaya tvāt
translated: In reality, because it has no object.

original: S / / sā na pramāṇaṃ nābhāvapramāṇaphalamity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sā na pramāṇam arthaḥ
translated: It is not a means of valid knowledge, nor is it the result of the means of valid knowledge of non-existence, this is the meaning.

original: na hi smṛtijanakatvena pramāṇatā yuktā /
analyzed: na hi smṛti janaka tvena pramāṇa tā yuktā
translated: For it is not proper that it should be a means of valid knowledge by producing memory.

original: kasmāt na pramāṇam / /
analyzed: kasmāt na pramāṇam
translated: Why is it not a means of valid knowledge?

original: yathādṛṣṭasyākāro 'bhyāsapāṭavādipratyāyāntarasāpekṣo viśeṣas tasya grahaṇāt /
analyzed: yathā dṛṣṭasya ākāraḥ bhyāsa pāṭava ādi pratyāya antara sāpekṣaḥ viśeṣaḥ tasya grahaṇāt
translated: Because it grasps the particular of that, which is the form as seen, dependent on other means of cognition such as practice and clarity.

original: na hi dṛṣṭam ity eva vikalpena gṛhyate /
analyzed: na hi dṛṣṭam iti eva vikalpena gṛhyate
translated: For it is not grasped by conceptual cognition merely as seen.

original: darśanāviśeṣāt sarvākāreṣu vikalpodayaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: darśana aviśeṣāt sarva ākāreṣu vikalpa udaya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the non-distinction in seeing, there would be the arising of conceptual cognition in all forms.

original: api tu kaścid evābhyāsādipratyayāpekṣa ity ākāragrahaṇenācaṣṭe /
analyzed: api tu kaścid eva abhyāsa ādi pratyaya apekṣaḥ iti ākāra grahaṇena ācaṣṭe
translated: But rather it is said by the word 'form' that it is dependent on some other means of cognition such as practice.

original: yathādṛṣṭāT / /kāragrahaṇam/
analyzed: bhavatu yathādṛṣṭāt
translated: The word 'form' is used for 'as seen'.

original: pramāṇam tu kasmān na bhavatīti parasyataduktapramāṇalakṣaṇavirahaṃ darśayann āha prāg
analyzed: pramāṇam tu kasmāt na bhavati iti darśayan āha prāk
translated: But why is it not a means of valid knowledge? Showing the absence of the means of valid knowledge stated by the opponent, he says:

original: p / / / ālocanājñānodayakāle asādhāraṇam asaṅkīrṇarūpaṃ dṛṣṭvā asādhāranam arthāntararūpaṃ
analyzed: ālocanā ajñāna udaya kāle asādhāraṇam asaṅkīrṇa rūpam dṛṣṭvā asādhāranam artha antara rūpam
translated: Before the arising of the perceptual cognition, having seen the uncommon, unmixed form,

original: na bhavatīti abhilapataḥ vikalpayataḥ pratiṣedhavikalpasyāpūrvārthādhigamābhāvād
analyzed: na bhavati iti abhilapataḥ vikalpayataḥ pratiṣedha vikalpasya apūrva artha adhigama abhāvāt
translated: when one says it is not the uncommon form of another object, when one conceptually differentiates, because there is no cognition of a new object for the conceptual differentiation of negation,

original: apūrvārthvijñānatāvirahāt S / / /
analyzed: apūrva artha vijñāna tā virahāt
translated: because there is no cognition of a new object, the conceptual cognition is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: apūrvārthavijñānaṃ ca pramāṇaṃ bhavatocyata iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: apūrva artha vijñānam ca pramāṇam bhavatā ucyate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the knowledge of a new object is said to be a means of valid knowledge by you.

original: vidhivikalpasyāpy aprāmāṇyavyavysthāpanam /
translated: The establishment of the invalidity of the option of injunction also.

original: svabhāvena saṃkīrṇatve
analyzed: svabhāvena saṃkīrṇa tve
translated: In the case of being mixed with the nature,

original: asaṃkīrnnaṇṇarūpatā
analyzed: a saṃkīrnnaṇṇa rūpa tā
translated: The form of non-mixing

original: nākiñcitkaro 'bhāvāṃśaḥ tenaiva saṃkīrṇarūpatāvināśanāt iti ced āha
analyzed: na akiñcitkaraḥ bhāva aṃśaḥ tena eva saṃkīrṇa rūpa tā vināśanāt iti ced āha
translated: If it is said that the part of non-existence does not do anything, because it destroys the mixed form itself, he says

original: pararūpasya kalpitatvād abhāvāṃśaḥ T /
analyzed: para rūpasya kalpita tvāt abhāva aṃśaḥ t
translated: The part of non-existence is because the form of another is imagined.

original: api tv anumānaṃ syā
analyzed: api tu anumānam syā
translated: But it would be inference.

original: parair vastudarśanasyaiva nāstitāvikalpajanakatvenābhāvapramāṇatayoktvāditthaṃ vyākhyātam
analyzed: paraiḥ vastu darśanasya eva nāstitā vikalpa janaka tvena abhāva pramāṇatayā uktvāt ittham vyākhyātam
translated: It has been explained thus by others, saying that the mere seeing of an object is the means of valid knowledge of non-existence by producing the option of non-existence.

original: bhavatāpi yathā T /
analyzed: bhavatā api yathā
translated: Even by you, as it is.

original: ālocanājñānād uttarasya /
analyzed: ālocanā ajñānāt uttarasya
translated: After the knowledge of perception.

original: kumārilasya vā
analyzed: kumārilasya vā
translated: Or of Kumārila.

original: yadyuktena prakāreṇa pratiṣedhavikalpo na pramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: yadi uktena prakāreṇa pratiṣedha vikalpaḥ na pramāṇam
translated: If the option of negation is not a means of valid knowledge in the manner stated,

original: vidhivikalpas tarhi pramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati / na hi tasyāpūrvārthavijñānatvābhāvaḥ sambhavati /
analyzed: vidhi vikalpaḥ tarhi pramāṇam bhaviṣyati na hi tasya apūrva artha vijñāna tva abhāvaḥ sambhavati
translated: then the option of injunction will be a means of valid knowledge. For it is not possible that it does not have the nature of knowing a new object.

original: tatpratibhāsino 'nugatasya sāmānyākārasyāsādhāranarūpāv alambinā darśanenānadhigamāt tat kuto 'syāprāmāṇyam / tad uktam
analyzed: tad pratibhāsinaḥ nugatasya sāmānya ākārasya asādhārana rūpau alambinā darśanena anadhigamāt tat kutas sya aprāmāṇyam tat uktam
translated: Because the universal form that appears in it is not apprehended by the perception that does not have the uncommon form as its object. How then can it be invalid? It is said:

original: tataḥ paraṃpunar vastuŚV pratyakṣa
analyzed: tatas param punar pratyakṣa
translated: Then again, the object is directly perceived,

original: ityādi / tad etatkumārilavacanam āśaṅkya vidhivikalpasyāpi prāmāṇyam anupam apa🔽nudann āha arthakriyāsādhanasya svalakṣaṇasya ālocanājñānena darśanād adṛṣṭasya
analyzed: ityādi tat etat kumārila vacanam āśaṅkya vidhi vikalpasya api prāmāṇyam anupam apa  nudan āha artha kriyā sādhanasya sva lakṣaṇasya ālocanā ajñānena darśanāt adṛṣṭasya
translated: and so on. Anticipating this statement of Kumārila, and rejecting the validity of the optative vikalpa even,🔽he says: Because the means of accomplishing a practical effect, the particular, is seen by the cognition of perception, and because the means of accomplishing that practical effect, the nature of which was not seen,

original: punas tatsādhanasya arthakriyāsādhanasya svabhāvasya vikalpenāpratipatteḥvidhivikalpo na pramāṇam /
analyzed: punar tad sādhanasya arthakriyā sādhanasya svabhāvasya vikalpena apratipatteḥ vidhi vikalpaḥ na pramāṇam
translated: is not apprehended by the vikalpa, the optative vikalpa is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: apitenānadhigataṃ sāmānyam adhigamyata iti varṇyate /
analyzed: yadi sāmānyam adhigamyate iti varṇyate
translated: But it is described as apprehending the universal which was not apprehended by that.

original: tathāpi tad arthakriyāsādhanaṃ na bhavati iti tad adhigantā taimirikādijñānaprakhyo vidhivikalpo na pramāṇam / S / /
analyzed: tathā api tat arthakriyā sādhanam na bhavati iti tat adhigantā taimirika ādi jñāna prakhyaḥ vidhi vikalpaḥ na pramāṇam
translated: Even so, that is not a means of accomplishing a practical effect, so the optative vikalpa, which apprehends that, is not a means of valid knowledge, like the cognition of one with an eye disease.

original: tataḥ paraṃpunar vastu dharmair jātyādibhir yayā/
analyzed: param punar vastu dharmaiḥ jāti ādibhiḥ yayā
translated: Then again, by which [the object] is apprehended as having the properties of universals and so on,

original: adhigame 'pi keśādijñānasyeva na prāmāṇyam /
analyzed: adhigame pi keśa ādi jñānasya iva na prāmāṇyam
translated: even though apprehended, it is not a means of valid knowledge, like the cognition of hair [in the sky].

original: ata evārthakriyāsāmarthyavirahiṇā sāmānyenendriyāṇāṃ samprayogābhāvāt pratyakṣatā 'py asambhavinī /
analyzed: atas eva artha kriyā sāmarthya virahiṇā sāmānyena indriyāṇām samprayoga abhāvāt pratyakṣa tā pi asambhavinī
translated: For this very reason, because of the absence of contact of the senses with the universal which is devoid of the capacity for practical effect, perception is also impossible.

original: cakāreṇa smṛtitvāc ceti pūrvoktakāraṇasamucayaḥ /
analyzed: cakāreṇa smṛti tvāt ca iti pūrva ukta kāraṇa samucayaḥ
translated: The word 'ca' (and) includes the previously mentioned reasons.

original: smṛtitvaṃ cāsyottaratra pratipādayiṣyate /
analyzed: smṛti tvam ca asya uttaratra pratipādayiṣyate
translated: And the fact that it is memory will be explained later.

original: anumānavad
analyzed: anumāna vat
translated: Like inference.

original: p / / iti vaidharmyadṛṣṭāntaḥ / yathā pratyakṣeṇārthakriyāsādhane pradeśākhye dharmiṇy🔽adhigate 'py anadhigatasyāgner arthakriyāsādhanasyāsāmānyākāreṇaparokṣasya svalakṣaṇākāreṇa🔽pratipattum aśakyatvāt pratipattiḥ /
analyzed: iti vaidharmya dṛṣṭāntaḥ yathā pratyakṣeṇa artha kriyā sādhane pradeśa ākhye dharmiṇi  adhigate pi an adhigatasya agneḥ sva lakṣaṇa ākāreṇa  pratipattum aśakya tvāt
translated: This is the example of dissimilarity. Just as when a particular object that accomplishes a function is cognized by perception,🔽the unknown fire that accomplishes a function, which is imperceptible due to its general form, cannot be cognized by the form of its specific characteristic.

original: naivaṃ vidhivikalpena sāmānyākāreṇānadhigatam arthakriyāsādhanam adhigamyate /🔽tasyālocanājñānenaivādhigamāt / S / / tasmiṃsmin
analyzed: na evam vidhi vikalpena sāmānya ākāreṇa anadhigatam arthakriyā sādhanam adhigamyate  s tasmin smin
translated: But a function-accomplishing object that is not cognized by the conceptual cognition in the form of a universal is not cognized by that.

original: smṛtir evāsāv iti na pramāṇam iti /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ eva asau iti na pramāṇam iti
translated: Because it is cognized by the initial cognition itself. That is just memory, so it is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: arthakriyāsādhanaviṣayajñānasyaiva prāmāṇyasamarthanam /
translated: Only the knowledge of an object that accomplishes a function is established as a means of valid knowledge.

original: sāmānyamātraṃ vā vidhivikalpena gṛhyate tadviśiṣṭaṃ vā svalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: sāmānya mātram vā vidhi vikalpena gṛhyate tad viśiṣṭam vā sva lakṣaṇam
translated: Either a mere universal is grasped by the conceptual cognition in the form of an injunction, or a specific characteristic qualified by that.

original: gatyantarābhāvāt /🔽tatra pūrvapakṣe āha yady api ity ādi
analyzed: gati antara abhāvāt  tatra pūrvapakṣe āha yadi api iti ādi
translated: Because there is no other way.🔽Regarding the prima facie view, he says: Although...

original: uttarasmin pakṣe āha
analyzed: uttarasmin pakṣe āha
translated: Regarding the latter view, he says:

original: dhanasya sāmā T /
analyzed: dhanasya sāmā t
translated: The wealth of that...

original: anumāneneti śeṣaḥ
analyzed: anumānena iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The rest is by inference.

original: vastunaḥ
analyzed: vastunaḥ
translated: Of an object

original: arthakriyāsādhanaviṣayam eva pramāṇam /
analyzed: arthakriyā sādhana viṣayam eva pramāṇam
translated: A means of valid knowledge has as its object only that which is capable of effective action.

original: netarad iti kuta etat iti cet arthakriyārthīhi puruṣo yasmāt hitāhitaprāptiparihārārthī sarvo na kākatālīyanyāyena kaścid eva /
analyzed: na itarat iti kutas etat iti ced arthakriyā arthī hi puruṣaḥ yasmāt hita ahita prāpti parihāra arthī sarvaḥ na kākatālīya nyāyena kaścid eva
translated: Not anything else. If it be asked, how is this? Because all men who seek to attain an end, who seek to obtain the beneficial and avoid the harmful, and not anyone by chance,

original: pakṣāvān buddhipurvakārī pramāṇam apramāṇaṃvā pramānād eva sarvadā pravartarte
analyzed: pakṣāvān buddhi purva kārī pramāṇam apramāṇam vā pramānāt eva sarvadā pravartarte
translated: The one who has a position, who acts with forethought, engages in a means of valid knowledge or a non-means of valid knowledge only from a means of valid knowledge, always,

original: ya apramāṇāt mā kadācit /
analyzed: ya apramāṇāt mā kadācid
translated: And never from a non-means of valid knowledge.

original: vipralambhasambhavād /
analyzed: vipralambha sambhavāt
translated: Because of the possibility of deception.

original: ubhayam anveṣate na vyasanitayā /
analyzed: ubhayam anveṣate na vyasani tayā
translated: He seeks both, not out of addiction.

original: tato 'yam arthakriyāsādhanaviṣayam eva pramāṇam bravīti /
analyzed: tatas yam artha kriyā sādhana viṣayam eva pramāṇam bravīti
translated: Therefore, he declares that a means of valid knowledge has as its object only that which is capable of effective action.

original: tasyārthakriyāsādhane pravṛttyaṅgatvāt /
analyzed: tasya artha kriyā sādhane pravṛtti aṅga tvāt
translated: Because that is a means of engaging in activity towards what is capable of effective action.

original: netarat / tadviparītatvāt /
analyzed: na itarat tad viparīta tvāt
translated: Not anything else. Because it is the opposite of that.

original: tathā hi pramāṇam avisaṃvādakam apratārakam ucyate loke 'pi /
analyzed: tathā hi pramāṇam avisaṃvādakam apratārakam ucyate loke
translated: For thus, even in the world, a means of valid knowledge is said to be non-deceptive, not misleading.

original: T / / yac cārthakriyāsādhanam anadhigacchan na tatra pravartayati /
analyzed: t yat ca arthakriyā sādhanam anadhigacchān na tatra pravartayati
translated: And that which, not finding what is capable of effective action, does not engage in it,

original: kuta eva tat prāpayet tat katham avisaṃvādakatayā prekṣāpūrvakārī pramāṇam ācakṣīta / /
analyzed: kutas eva tat prāpayet tat katham avisaṃvādaka tayā prekṣā pūrva kārī pramāṇam ācakṣīta
translated: How could it ever bring that about? How then could one who acts with forethought call a means of valid knowledge non-deceptive?

original: sāmānyasya vistareṇāvastutvasādhanam /
translated: The proof that universals are unreal in detail.

original: S / / yady evaṃ sāmānyam apy arthakriyāsādhanam eva tatas tadviṣayo vidhivikalpaḥ pramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīti ced /
analyzed: api                bhaviṣyati iti ced
translated: If it is so, then a universal also is the means of accomplishing an object. Therefore, the positive cognition which has a universal for its object will be a means of right knowledge.

original: āha na ca naiva sāmānyaṃkāñcit tatsādhyatayopagatām abhinnajñānābhidhānalakṣaṇām anyāṃ vā vyaktisādhyām arthakriyām upakalpayati /
analyzed: āha na ca nā eva tad sādhyatayā upagatām abhinna jñāna abhidhāna lakṣaṇām anyām vā vyakti sādhyām arthakriyām upakalpayati
translated: He says: No, a universal does not bring about any such object as is characterized by the knowledge and verbal expression which are not different (from each other) and which is to be accomplished by it, or any other object which is to be accomplished by an individual.

original: kīdṛśam / / svalakṣaṇapratipatteḥ vyaktipratipatter ālocanājñānasaṃjñitāyā ūrddhvam uttarakalāṃ tatsāmarthyotpannavikalpavijñānagrāhyam iti /
analyzed: kīdṛśam sva lakṣaṇa pratipatteḥ vyakti pratipatteḥ ālocanā jñāna saṃjñitāyāḥ ūrddhvam uttara kalām tad sāmarthya utpanna vikalpa vijñāna grāhyam iti
translated: What kind of object is it? It is the object which is grasped by the determinate perception that arises from the capacity of the object which is perceived by the indeterminate perception called the perception of the object.

original: tacchabdena svalakṣaṇapratipattiḥ sambadhyate /
analyzed: tad śabdena sva lakṣaṇa pratipattiḥ sambadhyate
translated: The word 'tat' (that) refers to the perception of the object.

original: tataḥ paraṃ punar vastu' ityādiparair abhidhānād evaṃ bravīti darśanapṛṣṭhabhāvino vikalpasya pratyakṣapramāṇatāṃ nirākartum /
analyzed: tatas param punar vastu abhidhānāt evam bravīti darśana pṛṣṭha bhāvinaḥ vikalpasya pratyakṣa pramāṇa tām nirākartum
translated: He says this in order to refute the view that the determinate perception which arises after the indeterminate perception is a means of right knowledge.

original: sarvam eva tu sāmānyaṃ na kāñcid arthakriyām upakalpayati /
analyzed: sarvam eva tu sāmānyam na kāñcid arthakriyām upakalpayati
translated: But a universal does not bring about any object at all.

original: p / / yat tu sāmānyam anumānavikalpagrāhyam /
analyzed: yat tu sāmānyam anumāna vikalpa grāhyam
translated: But a universal which is grasped by the determinate perception of inference,

original: tat kāraṇavyāpakasambaddhaliṅganiścayadvārāyātaṃ sambaddhasambandhād anadhigatārthakriyāsādhanaviṣayām arthakriyām upakalpayatīti tadviṣayo
analyzed: tat kāraṇa vyāpaka sambaddha liṅga niścaya dvāra āyātam sambaddha sambandhāt anadhigata arthakriyā sādhana viṣayām arthakriyām upakalpayati iti tad viṣayaḥ
translated: That [inference] generates the cognition of the object's function, which is not previously known, through the connection of the inferential mark that is the cause or the pervader. Thus, the conceptual cognition that has that [object] as its object

original: vikalpaḥ pramāṇam /
analyzed: vikalpaḥ pramāṇam
translated: is a means of valid cognition.

original: S / / idaṃ tu naivam /
analyzed: idam tu na evam
translated: But this [perception] is not so.

original: adhigatatvād arthakriyāsādhanasyālocanājñāneneti /🔽atrodāharaṇam yathā nīlaṃdṛṣṭvānīlam iti jñāne pratibhāsamānam iti śeṣaḥ /
analyzed: adhigata tvāt arthakriyā sādhanasya ālocanā jñānena iti  atra udāharaṇam yathā nīlam dṛṣṭvā nīlam iti jñāne pratibhāsamānam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Because the means of accomplishing the object's function is already known through the initial cognition.

original: na sāmānyaṃ kāñcid arthakriyām upakalpayatīti prakṛtena sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: na sāmānyam kāñcid arthakriyām upakalpayati iti prakṛtena sambandhaḥ
translated: Here is an example: Just as when one sees blue and has the cognition blue, what appears [in the cognition] is not a universal that can generate any function of the object. This is connected to the main point.

original: nanu ca liṅgavikalpapratibhāsi T / / sāmānyaṃ prakṛtam tat kim anyad udāhriyate / /
analyzed: nanu ca liṅga vikalpa pratibhāsi t sāmānyam prakṛtam tat kim anyat udāhriyate
translated: But isn't the universal that appears in the conceptual cognition of the inferential mark the subject? Why is something else being exemplified?

original: sarvasya darśanapṛṣṭhabhāvino vikalpasya paropagatāṃ pratyakṣapramāṇatāṃ tulyanyāyatayā nirākartum /
analyzed: sarvasya darśana pṛṣṭha bhāvinaḥ vikalpasya para upagatām pratyakṣa pramāṇa tām tulya nyāya tayā nirākartum
translated: In order to refute, by the same reasoning, the claim by others that all conceptual cognitions that arise after perception are a means of valid cognition.

original: kāṃ punar nīlam iti vikalpajñāne darśanapṛṣṭhabhāvini pratibhāsamānaṃ sāmānyam arthakriyāṃ nopakalpayati / /
analyzed: kām punar nīlam iti vikalpa jñāne darśana pṛṣṭha bhāvini pratibhāsamānam sāmānyam arthakriyām na upakalpayati
translated: But what function of the object does the universal that appears in the conceptual cognition blue, which arises after perception, not generate?

original: yadi vyaktisādhyām /
analyzed: yadi vyakti sādhyām
translated: If it is one that is accomplished by the individual.

original: tadā 'nyo 'pi padārtho 'nyadīyām arthakriyāṃ nopakalpayatīti tasyāpy anarthakriyāsādhanatvād avastutvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tadā nyaḥ pi padārthaḥ nyadīyām arthakriyām nā upakalpayati iti tasya api anartha kriyā sādhana tvāt avastu tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Then, since another object cannot perform the function of another, it would follow that it too is not a means of accomplishing an effect and therefore is not a real entity.

original: atha svasādhyām /
analyzed: atha sva sādhyām
translated: If it is said that it performs its own function,

original: tad asiddham /
analyzed: tat asiddham
translated: that is not established.

original: abhinnajñānābhidhānalakṣaṇāyāḥ svasādhyāyāḥ karaṇād ity āśaṅkyāha tad eva hi Tt /
analyzed: abhinna jñāna abhidhāna lakṣaṇāyāḥ sva sādhyāyāḥ karaṇāt iti āśaṅkya āha tat eva hi
translated: Because it performs its own function, which is characterized by a single cognition and expression, he says that itself is that.

original: yat tadālocanājñānenopalabdhaṃ S / / nīlasvalakṣaṇam nīlavyaktiḥ tathāvidhasādhyārthakriyākāri /
analyzed: yat tad ālocanā jñānena upalabdham nīla sva lakṣaṇam nīla vyaktiḥ tathāvidha sādhya artha kriyā kāri
translated: That blue particular, which is the blue particular that is perceived by that perception, performs the function of accomplishing an object of that kind.

original: tathāvidhaśabdena sāmānyam atrābhipretam /🔽tādṛśaparyāyatvād asya /
analyzed: tathāvidha śabdena sāmānyam atra abhipretam  tādṛśa paryāya tvāt asya
translated: By the word that kind, a universal is intended here.🔽Because it is of that kind, being a synonym for that.

original: sādhāraṇarūpasya ca tādṛśatvāt /
analyzed: sādhāraṇa rūpasya ca tādṛśa tvāt
translated: And because a universal of that kind is of that kind.

original: tena tathāvidhasādhyāṃ nīlasāmānyasādhyām abhinnajñānābhidhānalakṣaṇām
analyzed: tena tathāvidha sādhyām nīla sāmānya sādhyām abhinna jñāna abhidhāna lakṣaṇām
translated: Therefore, it performs the function of accomplishing that kind, which is characterized by a single cognition and expression, and which is to be accomplished by a blue universal.

original: arthakriyāṃ kartuṃ śīlam asya svalakṣaṇasyeti tat tathoktam /
analyzed: arthakriyām kartum śīlam asya sva lakṣaṇasya iti tat tathā uktam
translated: It has the tendency to perform that function, therefore the particular is said to be that.

original: evaṃ manyate yathā bhinnā api vyaktyaḥ kayācit pratyāsattyā tadekakāryapratiniyamalakṣaṇayā tadekam abhinnaṃ sāmānyam upakurvanti /
analyzed: evam manyate yathā bhinnāḥ api vyaktyaḥ kayācid pratyāsattyā tad eka kārya pratiniyama lakṣaṇayā tat ekam abhinnam sāmānyam
translated: He thinks: Just as particulars, even though different, assist a single, undifferentiated universal through some kind of association characterized by the restriction of being the cause of a single effect,

original: tadaparasāmānyayogam antareṇāpi /
analyzed: tad apara sāmānya yogam antareṇa api
translated: Even without the connection of a separate universal.

original: anyathā 'navasthāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyathā navasthā prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise there would be an infinite regress.

original: tathā 'bhinnajñānābhidhānātmikām apy arthakriyāṃ sādhayiṣyanti /
analyzed: tathā bhinna jñāna abhidhāna ātmikām api arthakriyām sādhayiṣyanti
translated: In the same way, they will accomplish the function of cognition and expression, which are not different.

original: kim apramāṇakena pramāṇabādhitena ca sāmānyenopagatena / /
analyzed: kim apramāṇakena pramāṇa bādhitena ca sāmānyena upagatena
translated: What is the use of accepting a universal that is not established by valid cognition and is contradicted by valid cognition?

original: T / / tathā hi anumānādike jñāne yathāvidham asyāspaṣṭaṃ rūpaṃ pratibhāsate na tathāvidhaṃ vyaktiṣu dṛśyamānās upalakṣayāmaḥ /
analyzed: t tathā hi anumāna ādike jñāne yathāvidham asya aspaṣṭam rūpam pratibhāsate na tathāvidham vyaktiṣu dṛśyamānāḥ upalakṣayāmaḥ
translated: For example, in the cognition produced by inference, etc., the form of the universal does not appear clearly as it does in the individual things that are seen.

original: ekam eva hi vyaktidarśanakāle spaṣṭam nīlādirūpaṃ vibhāvayāmaḥ / S / /
analyzed: ekam eva hi vyakti darśana kāle spaṣṭam nīla ādi rūpam vibhāvayāmaḥ
translated: We perceive only one clear form of blue, etc. at the time of seeing an individual.

original: p / / tat katham adṛṣṭakalpanayā ''tmānaṃ svayam eva vipralabhe mahi / /
analyzed: tat katham adṛṣṭa kalpanayā tmānam svayam eva vipralabhe mahi
translated: So how can one deceive oneself by imagining what has not been seen?

original: vyaktirūpasaṃsargād ayogolakavahnivad avibhāvanamiti cet / na /
analyzed: vyakti rūpa saṃsargāt ayaḥ golaka vahni vat ced na
translated: If it is argued that the universal is not perceived because it is connected with the form of the individual, like a lump of iron, that is not so.

original: sarvatra bhedābhedavyavasthāyā abhāvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: sarvatra bheda abheda vyavasthāyāḥ abhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the absence of the distinction between difference and non-difference everywhere.

original: asyottarasyānyatrāpi sulabhatvāt /
analyzed: asya uttarasya anyatra api sulabha tvāt
translated: Because this answer can be applied elsewhere as well.

original: na ca sāmānyasya dve rūpe staḥ spaṣṭam aspaṣṭaṃ ca /
analyzed: na ca sāmānyasya dve rūpe staḥ spaṣṭam aspaṣṭam ca
translated: And the universal does not have two forms, clear and unclear.

original: yenaikena darśane pratibhāseta anyenānumānādijñāne /
analyzed: yena ekena darśane pratibhāseta anyena anumāna ādi jñāne
translated: By which one would appear in perception, and the other in inferential cognition, etc.

original: padārthadvayopagamaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: padārtha dvaya upagama prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the absurd conclusion that there would be two objects.

original: pratibhāsabhedasyaiva sarvatra bhāvabhedavyavasthānibandhanatvāt /
analyzed: pratibhāsa bhedasya eva sarvatra bhāva bheda vyavasthā nibandhana tvāt
translated: Because the difference in appearance is the basis for determining the difference in entities everywhere.

original: sāmānyasyāparasāmānyaprasakterniḥsāmānyasya cāsyopagamāt /
analyzed: ca asya upagamāt
translated: Because a universal cannot have another universal, and because this [appearance] is accepted as being without a universal.

original: kriyāviśeṣaṇamadaḥ
analyzed: kriyā viśeṣaṇam adaḥ
translated: It is a qualification of action.

original: anupakṛtasya tadādheyatvābhāvāt
analyzed: anupakṛtasya tad ādheya tva abhāvāt
translated: Because what is not benefited does not have that [universal] as its substratum.

original: sāmānyasya
analyzed: sāmānyasya
translated: Of the universal.

original: dūṣaṇāntaram āha
analyzed: dūṣaṇa antaram āha
translated: He states another criticism.

original: kumāriloktadvyātmakabuddher nirasanam /
translated: The refutation of the dual nature of cognition stated by Kumārila.

original: etenaitad api nirastam yad āha
analyzed: etena etat api nirastam yat āha
translated: By this, this is also refuted: What he says

original: sarvavastuṣu buddhiś ca vyāvṛttyanugamātmikā /
analyzed: sarva vastuṣu buddhiḥ ca vyāvṛtti anugama ātmikā
translated: The cognition of all things has the nature of exclusion and inclusion.

original: jāyate dvyātmakatvena vinā sā ca na yujyate // ŚV ākṛti
analyzed: jāyate dvi ātmaka tvena vinā sā ca na yujyate
translated: And that is not possible without a dual nature.

original: na cātrānyatarā bhrāntirūpacāreṇa ceṣyate /
analyzed: na ca atra anyatarā bhrāntiḥ upacāreṇa ca iṣyate
translated: And here, one of them is not accepted as being erroneous due to the appearance of error.

original: dṛḍhatvātsarvadā buddher bhrāntis tadbhrāntivādinām // ŚV ākṛti
analyzed: buddheḥ bhrāntiḥ tad bhrānti vādinām ākṛti
translated: Because the cognition is firm at all times, the error is of those who speak of that as error.

original: abādhyamānatvāt
analyzed: a bādhyamāna tvāt
translated: Because it is not contradicted.

original: S / / iti / yato yadīndriyabuddhim abhipretyocyate /
analyzed: iti yatas yadi indriya buddhim abhipretya ucyate
translated: Thus. Because if it is stated with reference to the cognition of the sense faculties,

original: tadāsiddham /
analyzed: tad āsiddham
translated: then it is not established.

original: aspaṣṭasya nīlādy ākārasya spaṣṭanīlādyābhāsāyāṃ tatrānupalakṣaṇāt /
analyzed: aspaṣṭasya nīla ādi ākārasya spaṣṭa nīla ādi ābhāsāyām tatra anupalakṣaṇāt
translated: Because the indistinct form of blue, etc. is not indicated there in the appearance of the distinct blue, etc.

original: spaṣṭasyāpi ca dvitīyasyānuyāyinaḥ /
analyzed: spaṣṭasya api ca dvitīyasya anuyāyinaḥ
translated: And also because the distinct second [cognition] is continuous.

original: tadbhāveca vyaktidvayāntarālam apy āpnuvataḥ kathaṃ T / / tadanugamaḥ / /
analyzed: vyakti dvaya antarālam api āpnuvataḥ katham
translated: And how can it be perceived in that [universal] when it occupies the space between two individuals?

original: vyāptauvyaktau
analyzed: vyāptau vyaktau
translated: In the case of pervasion,

original: copalabhyasya sataḥ tatrānupalakṣaṇaṃ kutaḥ / /
analyzed: ca upalabhyasya sataḥ tatra anupalakṣaṇam kutas
translated: how can what is perceived exist there without being perceived?

original: na hi tasya vyaktāvyaktarūpasambhavaḥ /
analyzed: na hi tasya vyakta avyakta rūpa sambhavaḥ
translated: For it cannot have the nature of being both manifest and unmanifest.

original: ekatvāt / tathā cāha
analyzed: eka tvāt tathā ca āha
translated: Because it is one. As it is said:

original: vyaktāv ekatra sā vyaktā 'bhedāt sarvatragā yadi /
analyzed: vyaktau ekatra sā vyaktā bhedāt sarvatragā yadi
translated: If that [universal] is manifest in one manifest [individual], it would be present everywhere due to non-difference.

original: jātidṛśyeta sarvatra sāpi na vyaktyapekṣiṇī // PV /
analyzed: jātiḥ dṛśyeta sarvatra sā api na vyakti apekṣiṇī
translated: That [universal] would be seen everywhere, but it is not dependent on the individual.

original: iti / ekatrāpi ca vyaktāv upalabhyamānāyāṃ sakalatrailokyavyāpi rūpaṃ sakalasvāśrayavyāpi vā dṛśyeta / /
analyzed: iti ekatra api ca vyaktau upalabhyamānāyām sakala trailokya vyāpi rūpam sakala sva āśraya vyāpi vā dṛśyeta
translated: And even when one manifest [individual] is perceived, its form would be seen as pervading the entire three worlds or pervading the entire substratum.

original: na hy ekasyāḥ kiñcid dṛṣṭam adṛṣṭaṃ vā nāma kṣaṇikatādivad /
analyzed: na hi ekasyāḥ kiñcid dṛṣṭam adṛṣṭam vā nāma kṣaṇika tā ādi vat
translated: For nothing of the one [universal] is either seen or unseen, like momentariness.

original: dṛṣṭāyām apy ekatraivāśraye darśanāvasāyo na sarvatreti cet / na /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāyām api ekatra eva āśraye darśana avasāyaḥ na sarvatra iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even when one substratum is seen, the perception is ascertained only there, not everywhere, that is not so.

original: vikalpena taddarśanābhyupagamāt /
analyzed: vikalpena tad darśana abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the perception of that [universal] is accepted through conceptualization.

original: na hi niścayaviṣayīkṛtaṃ cāniścitaṃ ceti yuktam /
analyzed: na hi niścaya viṣayīkṛtam ca aniścitam ca iti yuktam
translated: For it is not proper to say that what is the object of a determinate cognition is both ascertained and unascertained.

original: tataḥ sarvagatarūpadarśane sarvārthānāṃ darśanaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sarvagata rūpa darśane sarva arthānām darśana prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Therefore, when the form present everywhere is seen, it would follow that all objects are seen.

original: na hi S / / taddarśane
analyzed: na hi s
translated: For when that [universal] is seen,

original: p / / tatsahacāriṇaupalabhyasya tadabhinnasvabhāvasyacānupalambho yuktaḥ /
analyzed: yuktaḥ
translated: The non-apprehension of what is concomitant with that and of what has an inseparable nature from that is proper.

original: tataḥ katham indriyabuddher dvyātmakatā / /
analyzed: tatas katham indriya buddheḥ dvi ātmaka tā
translated: How then is the sense-perception twofold?

original: tasyām api svalakṣaṇāpratibhāsanāt kuto dvyātmakatvam / /
analyzed: tasyām api sva lakṣaṇa apratibhāsanāt kutas dvi ātmaka tvam
translated: Even in that [sense-perception], because the specific characteristic does not appear, how can it be twofold?

original: na hi nāsu sāmānyagrāhiṇīṣv spaṣṭo vyaktyākāra iva lakṣyamāṇaḥ svalakṣaṇapratibhāsaḥ /
analyzed: na hi nāsu sāmānya grāhiṇīṣu spaṣṭaḥ vyakti ākāraḥ iva lakṣyamāṇaḥ sva lakṣaṇa pratibhāsaḥ
translated: For in those [sense-perceptions] that do not apprehend universals, the appearance of the specific characteristic is not clearly perceived, as in the case of an individual.

original: tadbhāve 'pi tāsāṃ bhāvāt /
analyzed: tad bhāve pi tāsām bhāvāt
translated: Because they exist even when that [specific characteristic] exists.

original: ākārāntareṇaḥ ca svajñāne 'pratibhāsanāt anekākārāyogād ekasya /🔽tasmān neyaṃ bhinnārthagrāhiṇyabhinnā sāmānyabuddhiḥ pratibhāti svalakṣaṇodbhāva satī /
analyzed: ākāra antareṇa ca sva jñāne pratibhāsanāt aneka ākāra ayogāt ekasya  tasmāt nā iyam bhinna artha grāhiṇī abhinnā sāmānya buddhiḥ pratibhāti sva lakṣaṇa udbhāva satī
translated: And because it does not appear in one's own cognition by a different form, and because one cannot have many forms.🔽Therefore, this non-different universal cognition, which appears as apprehending a different object, does not appear as manifesting the specific characteristic.

original: kintv anādivitathaT / /vikalpābhyāsavāsanājanitā satī tathā 'vabhāsate /
analyzed: kintu satī tathā vabhāsate
translated: But it appears thus, being produced by the habitual tendencies of beginningless false conceptualization.

original: dṛḍhatvaṃ ca buddher nāvināśitvam /
analyzed: dṛḍha tvam ca buddheḥ na avināśi tvam
translated: And the firmness of cognition does not mean indestructibility.

original: kṣaṇikatvābhyupagamāt kintv abādhyamānatvam /
analyzed: kṣaṇikatva abhyupagamāt kintu abādhyamānatvam
translated: Because momentariness is accepted, but rather being unobstructed.

original: na cāsyās tat sambhavati /
analyzed: na ca asyāḥ tat sambhavati
translated: And this is not possible for it.

original: leśato bādhakasyoktatvāt /
analyzed: leśataḥ bādhakasya ukta tvāt
translated: Because the refutation of it is stated in part.

original: vistaratas tusyādvādabhaṅgād yathāvasaram ihaiva tatra tatra vidhāsyamānād bādhakam avadhāryam /
analyzed: vistarataḥ tusyā dvāda bhaṅgāt yathāvasaram iha eva tatra tatra vidhāsyamānāt bādhakam avadhāryam
translated: But the refutation of this [view] will be set forth in detail in the course of [the discussion of] the Sāṃkhya refutation [in the chapter on the Sāṃkhya], and should be understood from there.

original: tasmād yathā vyaktyaḥ sāmānyāntaram antareṇa tad ekam upakurvanti tathā 'bhinnajñānābhidhāne api pravartayiṣyantīti tad eva nīlasvalakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: tasmāt yathā vyaktyaḥ sāmānya antaram antareṇa tat ekam upakurvanti tathā bhinna jñāna abhidhāne api pravartayiṣyanti iti tat eva nīla sva lakṣaṇam
translated: Therefore, just as individuals serve that [universal] without another universal, so they will cause [the cognition and expression] of the non-different [universal] as well. Thus that very particular blue [is the object of cognition and expression].

original: kumāriladattasya doṣasya saugatabuddyabādhakatvadarśanam /
translated: The demonstration that the objection of Kumārila is not a refutation for the Buddhist.

original: yastu S / /🔽sāmānyaṃ nānyad iṣṭaṃ cet tasya vṛtter niyāmakam /
analyzed: ro sāmānyam na anyat iṣṭam ced vṛtteḥ niyāmakam
translated: But he [Kumārila] says:🔽If a universal is not accepted as different, then what determines its occurrence?

original: viśeṣād anyad icchanti sāmānyaṃ tena tad dhruvam //
analyzed: viśeṣāt anyat icchanti sāmānyam tena tat dhruvam
translated: They accept a universal as different from the particulars, therefore it is certainly so.

original: tā hi tena vinotpannā mithyā syur viṣayād ṛte /
analyzed: tāḥ hi tena vinā utpannāḥ mithyā syuḥ viṣayāt ṛte
translated: For those [particulars] would be false if produced without it, like an object,

original: na tv anyenavinā vṛttiḥ sāmānyasyeha duṣyati //ŚV ākṛti /
analyzed: na tu vṛttiḥ sāmānyasya iha duṣyati
translated: but the occurrence of a universal without another [universal] is not faulty here. [The opponent says:] The form [of the universal] is different from the particulars.

original: p / / iti mithyātvaprasaṅgadoṣa ukto nāsautathāgatasamayanayāvadātabuddhīn bādhate /
analyzed: iti mithyātva prasaṅga doṣaḥ uktaḥ na asau tathāgata samaya naya avadāta buddhīn bādhate
translated: Thus the fault of the consequence of falsity is stated. But that does not refute those whose minds are well-instructed in the way of the Tathāgata's doctrine.

original: sāmānyabuddhīnāṃ bādhakapratyayanibandhanasya mithyātvasyopagatatvāt / tathā hi
analyzed: sāmānya buddhīnām bādhaka pratyaya nibandhanasya mithyātvasya upagata tvāt tathā hi
translated: Because falsity, which is the basis for the refuting cognition of the cognitions of universals, is accepted. For thus:

original: kasmāṭ sāsnādimatsv eva gotvaṃ /
analyzed: kasmāt sāsnādimatsu eva go tvam
translated: Why is cowness in only those that have a dewlap, etc.?

original: yasmāt tadātmakam /
analyzed: yasmāt tad ātmakam
translated: Because it has that as its nature.

original: tādātmyam asya kasmāt cet /🔽svabhāvāditi gamyatām //ŚV ākṛti
analyzed: tādātmyam asya kasmāt ced  svabhāvāt iti gamyatām ākṛti
translated: If it is asked why it has that as its nature,🔽it should be understood that it is due to its own nature.

original: iti vacanāt T / / vyaktisvabhāvaṃ ca sāmānyam /
analyzed: iti vacanāt t vyakti svabhāvam ca sāmānyam
translated: Because of the statement The universal is the nature of the individual, and the universal has the nature of the individual.

original: na cāsādhāraṇam vyaktyudayavināśayor dhyāyoś ca
analyzed: na ca asādhāraṇam vyakti udaya vināśayoḥ dhyāyoḥ ca
translated: And the non-common cannot be the cause of the arising and destruction of the individual,

original: nodayavyayayogi' ity ayuktam /
analyzed: na udaya vyaya yogi iti ayuktam
translated: because it is not connected with arising and destruction. This is not correct.

original: viruddhadharmādhyāsato bhedaprasaṅgād iti / āha ca
analyzed: viruddha dharma adhyāsataḥ bheda prasaṅgāt iti āha ca
translated: Because of the consequence of difference due to the superimposition of contradictory properties. And it is said:

original: tādātmyaṃcen mataṃjāter vyaktijanmanyajātatā/
analyzed: tādātmyam ced matam jāteḥ vyakti janmani ajāta tā
translated: If the universal is considered to have the same nature as the individual, it would be unborn when the individual is born,

original: nāśe 'nāśaśca keneṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: nāśe nāśaḥ ca
translated: and undestroyed when it is destroyed. By whom is this accepted?

original: tadvac cā'nanvayo na kim / //
analyzed: na kim
translated: And why is there no non-concomitance with that?

original: vyaktijanmanyajātā S / / cedāgatānāśrayāntarāt /
translated: If it is said that the universal is unborn when the individual is born, because it has come from another substratum,

original: prāgāsīn na ca taddeśe sātayāsaṅgatākatham / //
analyzed: prāk āsīt na ca tad deśe
translated: how is it not connected with the past, which existed before in that place?

original: vyaktināśe na cen naṣṭāgatāvyaktyantaraṃna ca /
analyzed: vyakti nāśe na ced naṣṭa āgata avyakti antaram na ca
translated: If it is said that the universal is not destroyed when the individual is destroyed, because another individual has not come,

original: tarhy adhigacchan vikalpaḥ pramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīty āha tac ca nīlasvalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: tarhi adhigacchan vikalpaḥ pramāṇam bhaviṣyati iti āha tat ca nīla sva lakṣaṇam
translated: then the conceptual cognition apprehending it will be a valid means of knowledge. He says: And that blue particular,

original: tenātmanā nīlasādhyārthakriyākāriṇā svabhāvena dṛṣṭam eva ālocanāpratyayena /
analyzed: tena ātmanā nīla sādhya artha kriyā kāriṇā svabhāvena dṛṣṭam eva ālocanā pratyayena
translated: which is seen by the initial cognition as having the nature of accomplishing the blue-contingent activity,

original: tato niṣpāditakriye karmaṇy aviśeṣādhāyi vikalpajñānaṃ kathaṃ pramāṇaṃ syāt / /
analyzed: tatas niṣpādita kriye karmaṇi aviśeṣa ādhāyi vikalpa jñānam katham pramāṇam syāt
translated: Then, when the action has been accomplished, how can the conceptual cognition that superimposes the non-distinction of the action be a means of valid knowledge?

original: athamatam sāmānyam eva tarhy adhigacchan nīlavikalpaḥ pramāṇam astu /
analyzed: sāmānyam eva tarhi adhigacchan nīla vikalpaḥ pramāṇam astu
translated: If it is argued that then let the conceptual cognition of blue, which apprehends the universal, be a means of valid knowledge,

original: tac ca sāmānyam arthakriyākāri /
analyzed: tat ca sāmānyam arthakriyā kāri
translated: and that universal performs the action,

original: yato nīlasādhyam evārthakriyāṃ nīlena saha sambhūya kariṣyati /
analyzed: yatas nīla sādhyam evā arthakriyām nīlena saha sambhūya kariṣyati
translated: because it will jointly perform the action to be accomplished by blue, along with blue.

original: vyaktisvabhāvāny eva hi sāmanyānīty āha S / / na ca naiva tat svalakṣaṇagrahaṇottarakālabhāvino nīlavyaktidarśanottarakālaṃ bhavanaśīlasya
analyzed: vyakti svabhāvāni eva hi sāmanyāni iti āha s na ca na eva tat sva lakṣaṇa grahaṇa uttara kāla bhāvinaḥ nīla vyakti darśana uttara kālam bhavana śīlasya
translated: For the universals are indeed of the nature of the particulars. And that [universal] does not exist after the apprehension of the specific property, which is inclined to arise after the perception of the blue particular.
