original: liṅgagrahaṇottarakālabhāvinas tu pūrvoktena prakāreṇa vyaktisādhyārthakriyā sāmānyasya kalpitasya
analyzed: liṅga grahaṇa uttara kāla bhāvinaḥ tu pūrva uktena prakāreṇa vyakti sādhya artha kriyā sāmānyasya kalpitasya
translated: But in the case of the apprehension of the inferential mark, the action to be accomplished by the particular, of the imagined universal, can be established by the previously mentioned method.

original: p / / vyavasthāpayituṃ śakyata iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: vyavasthāpayitum śakyate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

original: nīlavikalpasya viṣayeṇa nīlasāmānyena T / / nīlasādhyārthakriyā rañjanādikā kriyate /
analyzed: viṣayeṇa nīla sāmānyena nīla sādhya artha kriyā rañjana ādikā kriyate
translated: The action to be accomplished by blue, such as dyeing, is done by the object of the conceptual cognition of blue, by the universal blue.

original: tasya vyaktisvābhāvyāyoge sati kalpitarūpasya tadasambhavāt /
analyzed: tasya vyakti svābhāvya ayoge sati kalpita rūpasya tad asambhavāt
translated: Because, being impossible as the nature of the particular, it is impossible for that imagined form.

original: na ca nityasvabhāvatāmābibhrāṇena nīlavikalpasya viṣayeṇa nīlasādhyā 'nyā vā 'rthakriyā kriyate /
analyzed: na ca nitya svabhāva tām ābibhrāṇena nīla vikalpasya viṣayeṇa nīla sādhyā nyā vā rthakriyā kriyate
translated: And when [the cognition] bears the nature of being eternal, the object, the cognition of blue, does not perform any action that is accomplished by blue or any other [object].

original: kramayaugapadyavirodhād iti manyate /
analyzed: krama yaugapadya virodhāt iti manyate
translated: [The Naiyāyikas] think that this is because [the cognition] is incompatible with [the object] being sequential or simultaneous.

original: mīmāṃsakasamatapramāṇalakṣaṇe doṣadarśanam /🔽tad evaṃ nīlaṃ dṛṣṭvā nīlam iti jñāne pratibhāsamānaṃ sāmānyaṃ na kāñcid arthakriyām
analyzed: tat evam nīlam dṛṣṭvā nīlam iti jñāne pratibhāsamānam sāmānyam na kāñcid arthakriyām
translated: [The Naiyāyikas] point out the fault in the definition of valid cognition of the Mīmāṃsakas.

original: upakalpayatīti prasādhya anarthakriyākāriviṣayasyāpi vikalpasya pratyakṣapṛṣṭhabhāvinaḥ
analyzed: upakalpayati iti prasādhya anartha kriyā kāri viṣayasya api vikalpasya pratyakṣa pṛṣṭhabhāvinaḥ
translated: Having thus established that the universal that appears in the cognition blue when one sees blue does not accomplish any action, [the author] shows that, because the fault of over-extension would arise due to the consequence that even the conceptual cognition that has as its object what does not accomplish any action, which arises after perception,

original: prāmāṇyaprasaṅgād ativyāptir iti tatrāpūrvārthavijñānam iti S / / pramāṇalaksaṇemīmāṃsakair
analyzed: prāmāṇya prasaṅgāt ativyāptiḥ iti tatra apūrva artha vijñānam iti
translated: would be valid, the Mīmāṃsakas should adopt the qualification knowledge of a previously unknown object in their definition of valid cognition.

original: viśeṣaṇam upādeyam iti darśayann āha tasmāt / yata evam anarthakriyāsādhanaviṣayatayā🔽darśanapṛṣṭhabhāvino vikalpasya prāmāṇyam ayuktam /🔽tasmādasmadabhimataṃ pramāṇam avisaṃvādi jñānam iti pramāṇalakṣaṇaṃ vyudasya /
analyzed: viśeṣaṇam upādeyam iti darśayan āha tasmāt yatas evam anartha kriyā sādhana viṣaya tayā  darśana pṛṣṭhabhāvinaḥ vikalpasya prāmāṇyam ayuktam  tasmāt asmad abhimatam pramāṇam avisaṃvādi jñānam iti pramāṇa lakṣaṇam vyudasya
translated: [The author] says therefore, because in this way it is not proper for the conceptual cognition that arises after perception to be valid due to having as its object what does not accomplish any action.🔽Therefore, setting aside the definition of valid cognition valid cognition is non-deceptive cognition, which is accepted by us,

original: anadhigatārthaviṣayaṃpramāṇam /
analyzed: anadhigata artha viṣayam pramāṇam
translated: [the author] says valid cognition is that which has as its object a previously unknown object.

original: tatrāpūrvārthavijñānaṃ pramāṇam ity api /
analyzed: tatra apūrva artha vijñānam pramāṇam iti api
translated: And there, the cognition of a new object is also a means of valid knowledge.

original: etasminn apy āhopuruṣikayā 'nyasmin pramāṇalakṣaṇe kriyamāṇe ativyāptiparihārāya
analyzed: etasmin api āhopuruṣikayā nyasmin pramāṇa lakṣaṇe kriyamāṇe ativyāpti parihārāya
translated: Even when this other definition of a means of valid knowledge is being made out of bravado, in order to avoid overextension,

original: viśeṣaṇīyaṃ viśeṣaṇam upādeyam / kathaṃ viśeṣaṇīyam anadhigate svalakṣaṇa iti / anena
analyzed: viśeṣaṇīyam viśeṣaṇam upādeyam katham viśeṣaṇīyam anadhigate sva lakṣaṇe iti anena
translated: a distinguishing feature that distinguishes it should be added. How should it be distinguished? As when one's own specific characteristic is not apprehended.

original: hi viśeṣaṇenānumānavikalpasya ca prāmāṇyaṃ sidhyati /
analyzed: hi viśeṣaṇena anumāna vikalpasya ca prāmāṇyam sidhyati
translated: By this distinguishing feature, the validity of inferential conceptual cognition is established.

original: ālocanājñāna
analyzed: ālocanā ajñāna
translated: And the validity of the conceptual cognition that arises after the perceptual cognition

original: pṛṣṭhabhāvinaś ca vikalpasya prāmāṇyaṃ vyudasyata iti sarvaṃ sustham /🔽tad evaṃ vidhivikalpasyānarthakriyāsādhanaviṣayatayā 'nadhigatasāmānyādhigame 'pi🔽prāmāṇyaṃ nirākṛtya T / / ca śabdasamuccitaṃ smṛtitvaṃ pratiṣedhavikalpena sādhāraṇam
analyzed: pṛṣṭhabhāvinaḥ ca vikalpasya prāmāṇyam vyudasyate iti sarvam sustham  tat evam vidhi vikalpasya anartha kriyā sādhana viṣaya tayā nadhigata sāmānya adhigame pi  prāmāṇyam nirākṛtya ca śabda samuccitam smṛti tvam pratiṣedha vikalpena sādhāraṇam
translated: is rejected. Thus everything is well-established.🔽Having thus refuted the validity of the determinative conceptual cognition, which has as its object what does not accomplish a function, even when it cognizes a universal that was not cognized before,

original: prāmāṇyakāraṇaṃ S / / darśayann āha adhigate tu svalakṣaṇe ālocanājñānena
analyzed: prāmāṇya kāraṇam s darśayan āha adhigate tu sva lakṣaṇe ālocanā jñānena
translated: he shows the common cause of validity for the negative conceptual cognition, which is connected with the words that and is, and for memory, by saying But when one's own specific characteristic is apprehended by the perceptual cognition,

original: tatsāmarthyajanmā svalakṣaṇādhigamabalabhāvī vikalpas tadanukārī sākṣād anutpatter
analyzed: tad sāmarthya janmā sva lakṣaṇa adhigama bala bhāvī vikalpaḥ tad anukārī sākṣāt anutpatteḥ
translated: the conceptual cognition that arises from the power of that, which is conditioned by the apprehension of the specific characteristic, which imitates it, does not arise directly,

original: darśanasaṃskārādheyarāvedha
analyzed: darśana saṃskāra ādheya rāvedha
translated: because of the impression of perception,

original: vaśāc cāspaṣṭanīlasvalakṣaṇākārānukārī dṛśyavikalpyayoś caikīkaraṇād evam ucyate /
analyzed: vaśāt ca aspaṣṭa nīla sva lakṣaṇa ākāra anukārī dṛśya vikalpyayoḥ ca ekīkaraṇāt evam ucyate
translated: And because it is similar to the form of the indistinctly blue particular characteristic, and because it unifies the seen and the imagined, it is said to be so.

original: vastutas tu p / na kiñcid asāv anukaroti /
analyzed: vastutas tu p na kiñcid asau anukaroti
translated: But in reality, it does not imitate anything at all.

original: sa smṛtir eva /
analyzed: sa smṛtiḥ eva
translated: It is just memory.

original: kutaḥ / kāryatas tadviṣayatvāt na paramārthataḥ /
analyzed: kutas kāryataḥ tad viṣaya tvāt na paramārthataḥ
translated: Why? Because it has that as its object in terms of effect, not in reality.

original: kāryamatra svalakṣaṇe puruṣasya pravartanam /
analyzed: kāryam atra sva lakṣaṇe puruṣasya pravartanam
translated: Here, the effect is a person's engagement with the particular characteristic,

original: tadadhyavasāyaś ca /
analyzed: tad adhyavasāyaḥ ca
translated: and the ascertainment of that.

original: yataś ca kāryataḥ tadviṣayatvāt smṛtir evāto na pramāṇam darśanabalotpanno vikalpaḥ /
analyzed: yatas ca kāryataḥ tad viṣaya tvāt smṛtiḥ eva atas na pramāṇam darśana bala utpannaḥ vikalpaḥ
translated: And because it has that as its object in terms of effect, it is just memory, therefore it is not a means of valid knowledge. The conceptual cognition that arises from the power of perception.

original: tathā hi smṛter apy anubhūtasvalakṣaṇāṃśaviṣayāyā na paramārthatas tadviṣayatvam
analyzed: tathā hi smṛteḥ api anubhūta sva lakṣaṇa aṃśa viṣayāyāḥ na paramārthataḥ tad viṣaya tvam
translated: For example, even memory, which has as its object the particular characteristic that was experienced, does not have that as its object in reality.

original: svalakṣaṇasyendriyabuddhāv iva sphuṭarūpatayā smṛtāv apratibhāsanāt /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇasya indriya buddhau iva sphuṭa rūpa tayā smṛtau apratibhāsanāt
translated: Because the particular characteristic does not appear in memory in a clear form, as it does in the cognition produced by the sense faculties.

original: kintu yathoktāt kāryata eva /
analyzed: kintu yathā uktāt kāryataḥ eva
translated: But it is so only in terms of effect, as explained.

original: tac ca vidhivikalpe 'pi samānam iti katham asau smṛtir na syād iti /
analyzed: tat ca vidhi vikalpe samānam iti katham asau smṛtiḥ na syāt iti
translated: And that is the same in the case of affirmative conceptual cognition. So how could that not be memory?

original: anumānasya vidhivikalpavailakṣaṇyena prāmāṇyasamarthanam /
translated: The establishment of the validity of inference by its difference from affirmative conceptual cognition.

original: tatraitat syāt nanv anumānavikalpaḥ smṛtirūpo 'pi pramāṇam iṣyate /
analyzed: tatra etat syāt nanu anumāna vikalpaḥ pramāṇam iṣyate
translated: In this regard, this may be said: Is not inferential conception, though of the nature of memory, accepted as a means of valid knowledge?

original: S / / tathā hi yad evānagnivyāvṛttaṃ vastumātraṃ mahānasādāv anubhūtam āsīt /
analyzed: tathā hi yat eva anagni vyāvṛttam vastu mātram mahānasa ādau anubhūtam āsīt
translated: For instance, that very thing which is merely the exclusion of non-fire, which was previously experienced in the kitchen,

original: tad eva pradeśaviśeṣe dhūmadarśanāt smaryate / tadvad vidhivikalpo 'pi pramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīty ata āha anādhigatasya vastuno rūpasya anadhigater 🔽iti /
analyzed: tat eva pradeśa viśeṣe dhūma darśanāt smaryate tadvat pramāṇam bhaviṣyati iti atas āha anādhigatasya vastunaḥ rūpasya anadhigateḥ  iti
translated: is remembered by seeing smoke in a particular place. In the same way, the conception of affirmation will also be a means of valid knowledge. To this he says: Because of the non-apprehension of the form of a thing not already apprehended.

original: evam manyate yat mahānasādāv anagnivyāvṛttaṃ vastumātraṃ prāganubhūtaṃ na tat🔽taddeśādisambandhitayaivānumānavikalpena T / / smaryate kintu yatra pradeśe
analyzed: evam manyate yat mahānasa ādau anagni vyāvṛttam vastu mātram prāk anubhūtam na tat  tad deśa ādi sambandhi tayā eva anumāna vikalpena t smaryate kintu yatra pradeśe
translated: This is what is thought: That thing which is merely the exclusion of non-fire, which was previously experienced in the kitchen, is not

original: prāgananubhūtaṃ tatsambandhitayā /
analyzed: prāk ananubhūtam tad sambandhi tayā
translated: remembered by the inferential conception as connected with that place, etc., but as connected with that which was not previously experienced in that place.

original: tataḥ sādhyadharmidṛṣṭāntadharmigrāhidarśanadvayānadhigatasyānagnivyāvṛttasya vasturūpasyāyogavyavacchedenādhigamād yuktam asya prāmāṇyam /
analyzed: tatas sādhya dharmi dṛṣṭānta dharmi grāhi darśana dvaya anadhigatasya anagni vyāvṛttasya vastu rūpasya ayoga vyavacchedena adhigamāt yuktam asya prāmāṇyam
translated: Therefore, because of the apprehension by exclusion of non-connection of the form of a thing not already apprehended by the two perceptions grasping the subject of the probandum and the subject of the example, it is proper that this [inferential conception] be a means of valid knowledge.

original: na tu darśanapṛṣṭhabhāvino vikalpasya /
analyzed: na tu darśana pṛṣṭhabhāvinaḥ vikalpasya
translated: But not for the conception that arises after perception.

original: tadviparītatvād iti / S / /
analyzed: tad viparīta tvāt iti
translated: Because it is the opposite of that.

original: hetunā
analyzed: hetunā
translated: By the reason,

original: vyaktir iva
analyzed: vyaktiḥ iva
translated: like manifestation,

original: ananuvṛttiḥ🔽jātiḥ
analyzed: ananuvṛttiḥ  jātiḥ
translated: Universality

original: sāṅkhyamatam ākuṭṭayann āha
analyzed: sāṅkhya matam ākuṭṭayan āha
translated: Tearing apart the Sāṃkhya view, he says

original: na ca' ity anena sambandhaḥ
analyzed: na ca iti anena sambandhaḥ
translated: The connection is with 'not' and so on.

original: pramāṇavyavasthāyāḥ vastvadhiṣṭhānatvaṃ /
translated: The basis of the determination of means of valid knowledge is an entity.

original: svalakṣaṇasyaiva ca vastutvam /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇasya eva ca vastu tvam
translated: And only the specific characteristic is an entity.

original: yadi nāmānadhigataṃ vasturūpaṃ nādhigacchati /
analyzed: yadi nāma anadhigatam vastu rūpam na adhigacchati
translated: If indeed a means of valid knowledge does not reach an entity's form that has not been reached,

original: pramāṇaṃ tu kasmān na bhavatīti ced āha vastvadhiṣṭhānatvāt ityādi /
analyzed: pramāṇam tu kasmāt na bhavati iti ced āha vastu adhiṣṭhāna tvāt ityādi
translated: why is it not a means of valid knowledge? If it is asked this, he says 'because the basis of the determination of means of valid knowledge is an entity' and so on.

original: vastvadhiṣṭhānatvaṃ ca pramāṇavyavasthāyāḥ pramāṇavyāpāraviṣayamabhipretyocyate nālambhanalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: vastu adhiṣṭhāna tvam ca pramāṇa vyavasthāyāḥ
translated: And the fact that the determination of means of valid knowledge has an entity as its basis is said with reference to the object of the operation of a means of valid knowledge, not with reference to the characteristic of apprehension.

original: anyathā 'numānasya parikalpitasāmānyālambhanatayā vastvadhiṣṭhānatvābhāvād avyāpinī pramāṇavyavasthā syād /
analyzed: anyathā numānasya parikalpita sāmānya ālambhana tayā vastu adhiṣṭhāna tva abhāvāt avyāpinī pramāṇa vyavasthā syāt
translated: Otherwise, since inference has as its object an imagined universal, there would be no pervasiveness of the determination of means of valid knowledge due to the absence of having an entity as its basis.

original: yadi vastvadhiṣṭhānā pramāṇavyavasthā kathaṃ p / / viprakṛṣṭaviṣayāyāanupalabdheḥ prāmāṇyam iti cet /
analyzed: yadi vastu adhiṣṭhānā pramāṇa vyavasthā katham prāmāṇyam iti ced
translated: If the determination of means of valid knowledge has an entity as its basis, how is there validity of non-apprehension which has a remote object? If it is asked this,

original: tatrāpi pradhānādivikalpasyaivabhāvānupādānatayā sādhyatvāt tasyā api vastvadhiṣṭhānatā 'sty evety adoṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra api sādhya tvāt tasyāḥ api vastu adhiṣṭhāna tā sti evā iti adoṣaḥ
translated: there also, since the conceptualization of primordial matter and so on is to be accomplished because of the non-acceptance of its existence, that also certainly has an entity as its basis. Therefore there is no fault.

original: athā vatvadhiṣṭhānaiva pramāṇavyvasthe 'ti kuta etad /
analyzed: atha kutas etat
translated: Now, if the determination of the means of valid knowledge is based on the object alone, where does this come from?

original: ity āha arthakriyāyāṃ sukhaduḥkhalakṣaṇāyāṃ yad S / / yogyaṃ śaktaṃ tadviṣayatvāt tadarthinām arthakriyārthināṃ pravṛtteḥ prāptityāgalakṣaṇāyāḥ
analyzed: iti āha arthakriyāyām sukha duḥkha lakṣaṇāyām yat yogyam śaktam tad viṣaya tvāt tad arthinām arthakriyā arthinām pravṛtteḥ prāpti tyāga lakṣaṇāyāḥ
translated: He says: Because those who seek a purpose, who seek to accomplish a purpose, engage in activity characterized by attainment and abandonment, because of the object's being the content of what is capable of effective action characterized by pleasure and pain.

original: yadi nāmārthakriyāyogye tadarthināṃ pravṛttis tathāpi kathaṃ vastvadhiṣṭhānā pramāṇavyavasthā /
analyzed: yadi nāma artha kriyā yogye tad arthinām pravṛttiḥ tathā api katham vastu adhiṣṭhānā pramāṇa vyavasthā
translated: Even if there is engagement of those who seek a purpose in what is capable of effective action, how then is the determination of the means of valid knowledge based on the object?

original: arthakriyāyogyādhiṣṭhānā hi tathā sati syāt iti cet /
analyzed: arthakriyā yogya adhiṣṭhānā hi tathā sati syāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it would be based on what is capable of effective action,

original: āha arthakriyāyāṃ yad yogyaṃ tallakṣaṇam eva hi vastu /
analyzed: āha arthakriyāyām yat yogyam tad lakṣaṇam eva hi vastu
translated: he says: Because that which is capable of effective action is indeed characterized as an object.

original: tato 'rthakriyāyogyādhiṣṭhānatvena vastvadhiṣṭhānatvaṃ kathaṃ na syāt iti bhāvaḥ / T / /
analyzed: tatas rthakriyā yogya adhiṣṭhāna tvena vastu adhiṣṭhāna tvam katham na syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, how could it not be based on the object, since it is based on what is capable of effective action? This is the point.

original: idaṃ ca vastvāśrayeṇa pramāṇavyavasthāpratipādanam anadhigate svalakṣaṇa ity ukte kadācit paro brūyāt vastumātranibandhanā hi pramāṇavyavasthā
analyzed: idam ca vastu āśrayeṇa pramāṇa vyavasthā pratipādanam anadhigate sva lakṣaṇe iti ukte kadācid paraḥ brūyāt vastu mātra nibandhanā hi pramāṇa vyavasthā
translated: And this explanation of the determination of the means of valid knowledge based on the object is stated when it is said that it is not understood in one's own specific characteristic. Someone might say: The determination of the means of valid knowledge is indeed based on objects alone,

original: na svalakṣaṇāśrayaiva /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa āśrayā eva
translated: not only based on one's own specific characteristic.

original: tato yady apy anadhigataṃ svalakṣaṇaṃ nādhigacchati tathāpy anadhigatavasturūpam
analyzed: tatas yadi api anadhigatam sva lakṣaṇam na adhigacchati tathā api anadhigata vastu rūpam
translated: Therefore, even though it does not apprehend the unapprehended particular characteristic, still,

original: adhigacchato vikalpasya prāmāṇyaṃ bhaviṣyatīti tadasiddhatodbhāvanārtham uktam
analyzed: adhigacchataḥ vikalpasya prāmāṇyam bhaviṣyati iti tad asiddha tā udbhāvana artham uktam
translated: the conceptual cognition that apprehends the unapprehended form of an object will be valid. To point out the non-establishment of that, it is said:

original: anadhigatavasturūpety ādi /
analyzed: anadhigata vastu rūpa iti ādi
translated: The unapprehended form of an object, etc.

original: S / / tadasiddhatodbhāvane cānadhigatavasturūpādhigantur eva prāmāṇyaṃ netarasyeti kutaḥ /
analyzed: tad asiddha tā udbhāvane ca anadhigata vastu rūpa adhigantuḥ eva prāmāṇyam na itarasya iti kutas
translated: And when pointing out the non-establishment of that, how can there be validity only for one who apprehends the unapprehended form of an object, and not for another?

original: iti paryanuyoge arthakriyāyogyety ādi uktam /
analyzed: iti paryanuyoge artha kriyā yogyā iti ādi uktam
translated: Thus, when questioned, it is said: Capable of effective action, etc.

original: tathā ca vastuviṣayam api prāmāṇyaṃ bruvatā svalakṣaṇaviṣayam evoktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tathā ca vastu viṣayam api prāmāṇyam bruvatā sva lakṣaṇa viṣayam evā uktam bhavati
translated: And thus, even when stating that validity has an object, it is said to have the particular characteristic as its object.

original: tasyaivārthakriyāsāmarthyalakṣaṇatvāt /
analyzed: tasya eva artha kriyā sāmarthya lakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Because only that [particular characteristic] has the characteristic of being capable of effective action.

original: sāmānyasya ca tadviparītatvāt iti manyate /
analyzed: sāmānyasya ca tad viparīta tvāt iti manyate
translated: And because the universal is the opposite of that. This is what is thought.

original: punar apy anubhavottarakālabhāvino nīlavikalpasya prāmāṇyam apanetum upacayahetum
analyzed: punar api anubhava uttara kāla bhāvinaḥ nīla vikalpasya prāmāṇyam apanetum upacaya hetum
translated: Again, to deny the validity of the blue conceptual cognition that arises after experience, a reason for accumulation is

original: āha tato 'pi yathoktād vikalpād na kevalaṃ nīlasvalakṣaṇānubhavād vastuny eva
analyzed: āha yathā uktāt vikalpāt na kevalam nīla sva lakṣaṇa anubhavāt vastuni eva
translated: stated: From that also, from the conceptual cognition as described, not only from the experience of the blue particular characteristic, but also in the object itself,

original: svalakṣaṇa eva tadadhyavasāyena svalakṣaṇādhyavasāyena anyathā tatra pravṛttyayogāt
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇe eva tad adhyavasāyena sva lakṣaṇa adhyavasāyena anyathā tatra pravṛtti ayogāt
translated: Because otherwise, there would be no possibility of activity in that [object].

original: puruṣasya pravṛtteḥ adhigate svalakṣaṇe tatsāmarthyajanmā vikalpo na pramāṇam iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: puruṣasya pravṛtteḥ adhigate sva lakṣaṇe tad sāmarthya janmā vikalpaḥ na pramāṇam iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The compound is: When a person has cognized the particular characteristic, the conceptual cognition born from its capacity is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: pūrvam anadhigatavasturūpānadhigater aprāmāṇyam uktam /
analyzed: pūrvam anadhigata vastu rūpa anadhigateḥ aprāmāṇyam uktam
translated: Previously, it was said that [conceptual cognition] is not a means of valid knowledge because it does not cognize the form of an object not already cognized.

original: adhunā tv adhigatasyaivādhigamād iti S / / p / / vidhipratiṣedharūpatayopapattyorbhedaḥ /🔽yad vā kāryatas tad viṣayatvāt iti yad uktaṃ tad evopacayahetuvyājena sphutīkṛtam /
analyzed: adhunā tu adhigatasya eva adhigamāt iti  yat vā kāryataḥ tat viṣaya tvāt iti yat uktam tat eva upacaya hetu vyājena sphutīkṛtam
translated: Now, it is said that [conceptual cognition] is not a means of valid knowledge because it cognizes only what has already been cognized. Thus, there is a difference between the two [types of cognition] in terms of their nature as affirmation and negation.🔽Or, what was said earlier as because it has that as its object in terms of effect, that itself is made clear through the pretext of an additional reason.

original: pravartakatva
analyzed: pravartaka tva
translated: [The additional reason is:] because it is the instigator.

original: grāhya
analyzed: grāhya
translated: [The additional reason is:] because it is the apprehender.

original: nāsti pradhānam /🔽upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasyānupalabdheḥ
analyzed: na asti pradhānam  upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya anupalabdheḥ
translated: There is no primordial matter.🔽Because what is perceptible by nature is not perceived.

original: pradhānavikalpo vastukāraṇo na bhavati /
analyzed: pradhāna vikalpaḥ vastu kāraṇaḥ na bhavati
translated: The conceptual cognition of primordial matter does not have an existent thing as its cause.

original: tadabhāve 'pi bhāvāt /
analyzed: tad abhāve pi bhāvāt
translated: Because it exists even when that [primordial matter] is absent.

original: kharaviṣāṇādivikalpavat
analyzed: khara viṣāṇa ādi vikalpa vat
translated: Like the conceptual cognition of a barren woman's child and so on.

original: yuktyoḥ
analyzed: yuktyoḥ
translated: [The additional reason is:] because of the two reasonings.

original: vikalpasya darśanāt pṛthak prāmāṇyābhāvaḥ /
translated: Because conceptual cognition is seen to be different [from perception], it is not a means of valid knowledge separately [from perception].

original: T / / yadi nāma tadadhyavasāyena vastuny eva puruṣasya pravṛttis tathāpy anadhigatasāmānyagrāhiṇo 'sya darśanāt pṛthak prāmāṇyaṃ kim iti
analyzed: api                                    iti
translated: If, in spite of the fact that a man's activity is directed towards the object by the ascertainment of that [sameness], how is it that it [i.e. the ascertainment] has a separate validity, since it apprehends a universal which is not apprehended by perception?

original: iti cet / āha pravṛttau svalakṣaṇa eva satyāṃ pratyakṣeṇa ālocanājñānākhyena abhinnayogakṣematvāt /
analyzed: iti ced āha pravṛttau sva lakṣaṇe eva satyām pratyakṣeṇa ālocanā jñāna ākhyena abhinna yogakṣema tvāt
translated: If this is asked, [Dharmakīrti] says: In activity, when it is directed towards the particular, [the ascertainment] is not different from perception, which is called the cognition of mere seeing, because [the ascertainment] has the same fate as [perception].

original: yogaḥ aprāptasya viṣayasya paricchedalakṣaṇā prāptiḥ /🔽kṣemaḥ tadarthakriyānuṣṭhānalakṣaṇaṃ paripālanam /
analyzed: yogaḥ aprāptasya viṣayasya pariccheda lakṣaṇā prāptiḥ
translated: Fate is the attainment, which is characterized by the apprehension of an object that has not been attained.🔽Preservation is the protection, which is characterized by the performance of the function of that [object].

original: abhinnau yogakṣemāvastheti sa tathoktaḥ /
analyzed: abhinnau yogakṣema avasthā iti sa tathā uktaḥ
translated: [The ascertainment] has the same fate as [perception], because the two, fate and preservation, are the same.

original: tatra vikalpasya nirvikalpapratyakṣeṇābhinno yogaḥ svalakṣaṇādhyavasāyataḥ /
analyzed: tatra vikalpasya nirvikalpa pratyakṣeṇa abhinnaḥ yogaḥ sva lakṣaṇa adhyavasāyataḥ
translated: In that [ascertainment], the fate of the conceptual cognition is not different from that of non-conceptual perception, because it ascertains the particular.

original: abhinnaḥ kṣema ālocanāvijñānād iva vikalpād api svalakṣaṇa eva pravṛtteḥ /
analyzed: abhinnaḥ kṣemaḥ ālocanā vijñānāt iva vikalpāt api sva lakṣaṇe eva pravṛtteḥ
translated: The preservation is not different, because the activity is directed towards the particular, just as it is for the conceptual cognition, like the cognition of mere seeing.

original: ayam asyābhiprāyaḥ yadi vikalpo nirvikalpacetasaḥ prameyāntaraviṣayas tadā tatraiva puruṣaṃ pravartaya tu tatsādhyām arthakriyām adhigantum
analyzed: ayam asya abhiprāyaḥ yadi vikalpaḥ nirvikalpa cetasaḥ prameya antara viṣayaḥ tadā tatra eva puruṣam pravartaya tu tad sādhyām arthakriyām adhigantum
translated: This is his intention: If the conceptual cognition has a different object from the non-conceptual cognition, then it should direct the person towards that [different object] in order to attain the function of that [object] which is to be accomplished.

original: naiva vā pravartayet /
analyzed: na eva vā pravartayet
translated: Or it should not direct [the person] at all.

original: tadviṣayatvābhimatasya sāmānyasyābhinnajñānalakṣaṇāyā evārthakriyāyā upagamād S / / vikalpodayād eva ca tatsiddheḥ
analyzed: tad viṣaya tva abhimatasya sāmānyasya abhinna jñāna lakṣaṇāyāḥ eva arthakriyāyāḥ upagamāt vikalpa udayāt eva ca tad siddheḥ
translated: Because the object of that [determinate cognition] is accepted to be only the same effect of cognition characterized by non-difference, and because it is established by the arising of that [determinate cognition] itself.

original: na hi nīlānubhavāt prameyāntaraviṣayāḥ pītādipratyayāḥ puruṣaṃ nīlavastuni pravartayanti /
analyzed: na hi nīla anubhavāt prameya antara viṣayāḥ pīta ādi pratyayāḥ puruṣam nīla vastuni pravartayanti
translated: For determinate cognitions of yellow, etc., which have a different object than the cognition of blue, do not cause a person to engage with the blue object.

original: sādhitārthakriyā vā kvacid apīti /
analyzed: sādhita artha kriyāḥ vā kvacid api iti
translated: Nor does [determinate cognition] accomplish any other effect anywhere.

original: tasmād ālocanājñānān naivāyaṃ prameyāntaraviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt ālocanā ajñānāt na eva ayam prameya antara viṣayaḥ
translated: Therefore, this [determinate cognition] does not have a different object than the cognition of perception.

original: viśeṣeṇa yair evaṃ vyākhyāyate
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa yaiḥ evam vyākhyāyate
translated: Those who explain it in this way with a distinction say:

original: nirvikalpakabodhena dvyātmakasyāpi vastunaḥ/🔽prahaṇam ŚV p /
analyzed: dvi ātmakasya api vastunaḥ  prahaṇam śv p
translated: Even by non-conceptual cognition, a thing with a dual nature is apprehended.

original: iti/ tato nīladarśanasyaiva nirvikalpasya prāmāṇyaṃ yuktam /
analyzed: tatas nīla darśanasya eva nirvikalpasya prāmāṇyam yuktam
translated: Thus, it is proper that only the non-conceptual seeing of blue is valid cognition.

original: na tadabhinnopayogasya T / / smṛter iva vikalpasyāpi darśanāt pṛthageva /
analyzed: na tad abhinna upayogasya t smṛteḥ iva vikalpasya api darśanāt
translated: Even for conceptual cognition, which has the same use as that [non-conceptual cognition], it is separate from seeing, like memory.

original: anyathā niṣphalāṃ pramāṇāntarakalpanāṃ kurvataḥ smṛtīcchādveṣaprayatnādi pramāṇam anuṣajyata iti pramāṇānām iyattā viśīryeteti /
analyzed: anyathā niṣphalām pramāṇa antara kalpanām kurvataḥ smṛti icchā dveṣa prayatna ādi pramāṇam anuṣajyate iti pramāṇānām iyat tā viśīryeta iti
translated: Otherwise, for one who posits another means of valid cognition that is fruitless, memory, desire, aversion, effort, etc. would be a means of valid cognition, and the limit of means of valid cognition would be destroyed.

original: atra na' kārasyopari pratāv eva ' iti likhitaṃ vartate
analyzed: atra na kārasya upari pratau eva iti likhitam vartate
translated: Here, the word not is written above the word only.

original: viśeṣeṇa teṣāṃ mate naivāyaṃ prameyāntaraviṣaya iti saṃbedhaḥ
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa teṣām mate na eva ayam prameya antara viṣayaḥ iti saṃbedhaḥ
translated: The point is that, especially in their opinion, this is not the subject matter of another pramāṇa.

original: prāmāṇyaṃ yuktam
analyzed: prāmāṇyam yuktam
translated: It is proper to say that.

original: p / / / dhārāvāhikajñāneṣu yogitaditarāpekṣayā prāmāṇyāprāmāṇye /
translated: In the case of a series of cognitions, the validity and invalidity of the cognitions depend on whether they are of yogis or others.

original: yadaikasminn eva nīlādivastuni S / / dhārāvāhīnīndriyajñānāny utpadyante tadā pūrveṇābhinnayogakṣematvād uttareṣām indriyajñānānām aprāmāṇyaprasaṅgaḥ
analyzed: yadā ekasmin eva nīla ādi vastuni dhārā vāhīni indriya jñānāni utpadyante tadā pūrveṇa abhinna yogakṣema tvāt uttareṣām indriya jñānānām aprāmāṇya prasaṅgaḥ
translated: When a series of sense cognitions arises regarding a single object like blue, then the later sense cognitions would be as secure as the former one, and hence there would be the undesirable consequence of their invalidity.

original: na caivam / ato 'nekānta iti pramāṇasaṃplavavādī darśayann āha pūrvapratyakṣakṣaṇena ityādi /
analyzed: na ca evam atas na ekāntaḥ iti pramāṇa saṃplava vādī darśayan āha pūrva pratyakṣa kṣaṇena ityādi
translated: But it is not so. Therefore, there is no universal concomitance. The proponent of the combination of pramāṇas shows this by saying by the first moment of perception and so on.

original: etat pariharati na /
analyzed: etat pariharati na
translated: He answers this, saying No.

original: uttareṣāṃ prāmāṇyaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: uttareṣām prāmāṇya prasaṅgaḥ
translated: There would be the undesirable consequence of the later ones being valid.

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi pratikṣaṇaṃ viṣayaparicchedalakṣaṇo yogaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi pratikṣaṇam viṣaya pariccheda lakṣaṇaḥ yogaḥ
translated: Because thus, the yoga characterized by the ascertainment of the object varies from moment to moment.

original: tadarthakriyānuṣṭhānalakṣaṇaś ca kṣemaḥ paripālanarūpo bhidyate /
analyzed: tad artha kriyā anuṣṭhāna lakṣaṇaḥ ca kṣemaḥ paripālana rūpaḥ bhidyate
translated: And the kṣema characterized by the performance of its function, which is in the form of preservation, varies.

original: tato vipakṣe vṛttyabhāvāt na hetur anaikāntikaḥ /🔽kadā nānāyogakṣematvam / /
analyzed: tatas vipakṣe vṛtti abhāvāt na hetuḥ anaikāntikaḥ  kadā nānā yogakṣema tvam
translated: Therefore, since there is no occurrence in the contrary case, the reason is not inconclusive.🔽When is there a difference in yoga and kṣema?

original: kṣaṇaviśeṣasādhyārthavāñchāyām /
analyzed: kṣaṇa viśeṣa sādhya artha vāñchāyām
translated: When there is a desire to accomplish an object by a particular moment.

original: yadā kṣaṇaviśeṣasādhye 'rthe hitāhitalakṣaṇe vāñchā prāptiparihārec chā yogināṃ paropakāram uddiśya bhavati kasyacitkathañcit kvacid upayogāt
analyzed: yadā kṣaṇa viśeṣa sādhye rthe hita ahita lakṣaṇe vāñchā prāpti parihārā id chā yoginām para upakāram uddiśya bhavati kvacid upayogāt
translated: When there is a desire for a thing to be accomplished by a particular moment, or for what is beneficial or harmful, to obtain or avoid it, for some yogis, for the sake of helping others, it occurs in some way, somewhere, because of being useful.

original: yathā darśanamārggeduḥkhedharmajñānakṣāntir damār
analyzed: yathā
translated: For example, the receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering on the path of seeing produces the subduing of the afflictions.

original: tadviruddhāśayotpādanāt /
analyzed: tad viruddha āśaya utpādanāt
translated: Because it produces a mind opposed to that.

original: duḥkhe dharmajñānaṃkleṣaviviktatālakṣaṇāṃ nirvāṇaprāptim utpādayati /
analyzed: duḥkhe nirvāṇa prāptim utpādayati
translated: The knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering produces the attainment of nirvana, which is characterized by being free from afflictions.

original: S / / anuśayaviruddhāśayadārḍhyotpādanāt /
analyzed: anuśaya viruddha āśaya dārḍhya utpādanāt
translated: Because it produces the firmness of a mind opposed to the latent tendencies.

original: tata eṣāṃgrāhakāṇi paracittajñānānipṛthag eva pramāṇāni /
analyzed: tatas eva pramāṇāni
translated: Therefore, the knowledges of others' minds that are their instruments are separate valid cognitions.

original: T / / parahitādhānadīkṣāvatāṃ ca samastavastuvistaravyāpijñānālokāvabhāsitāntarātmanāṃ
analyzed: para hita ādhāna dīkṣāvatām ca samasta vastu vistara vyāpi jñāna āloka avabhāsita antarātmanām
translated: And for those who are devoted to promoting the welfare of others, whose inner selves are illuminated by the light of knowledge that pervades all things in their entirety,

original: bhagavatāṃ kaścid evārthakṣaṇaḥ kasyacid eva parārthasyānugrāhakovibandhako
analyzed: bhagavatām kaścid eva artha kṣaṇaḥ kasyacid eva
translated: for the Blessed Ones, some particular moment of meaning is helpful for some particular purpose of others, or obstructive.

original: veti sarvabhāvān pratikṣaṇaṃ vīkṣamāṇānām adhyakṣa cetasām tadviṣayakṣaṇānāṃ bhinnārthakriyāsūpayogato nānāyogakṣematvāt /
analyzed: vā iti sarva bhāvān pratikṣaṇam vīkṣamāṇānām adhyakṣa cetasām tad viṣaya kṣaṇānām bhinna artha kriyāsu upayogataḥ nānā yogakṣema tvāt
translated: Thus, for those whose minds directly perceive all things moment by moment, the moments of objects that are their domain are useful in different ways for different actions, because they have different benefits and risks.

original: tad yadi pratiksaṇaṃksaṇavivekadarśino 'dhikṛtyocyate tadā bhinnopayogitayā pṛthak prāmāṇyāt nānekāntaḥ /
analyzed: tat yadi adhikṛtya ucyate tadā bhinna upayogi tayā pṛthak prāmāṇyāt na anekāntaḥ
translated: If it is said with reference to those who perceive the difference of each moment, then there is no inconclusiveness, because of the separateness of the means of valid knowledge due to the difference in their application.

original: atha sarvapadārtheṣv ekatvā 'dhyavasāyinaḥ sāṃvyavahārikān puruṣānabhipretyocyate tadā sakalam eva S / / p / / nīlasantānam ekam arthaṃ 🔽sthirarūpaṃ tadsādhyāṃ
analyzed: atha sarva padārtheṣu eka tvāt dhyavasāyinaḥ sāṃvyavahārikān puruṣān abhipretya ucyate tadā sakalam eva nīla santānam ekam artham  sthira rūpam tad sādhyām
translated: But if it is said with reference to ordinary people who conceive of all things as one, then the entire continuum of blue is one object,

original: cārthakriyām ekātmikām adhyavasyantīti prāmāṇyam apy uttareṣām aniṣṭam eveti kuto 'nekāntaḥ /
analyzed: ca arthakriyām eka ātmikām adhyavasyanti iti prāmāṇyam api uttareṣām aniṣṭam evā iti kutas nekāntaḥ
translated: having a stable nature, and they conceive of the function of the object as having a single nature. Thus, the validity of the later [cognitions] is also undesirable, so how can there be inconclusiveness?

original: iti darśayann āha sādhāraṇe hi iti /
analyzed: iti darśayan āha sādhāraṇe hi iti
translated: Showing this, he says For in the case of a common object...

original: tatsantānavarttināṃ sarvakṣaṇānām ekatvenādhyavasitānāṃ vyavahartṛbhir yat sādhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: tad santāna varttinām sarva kṣaṇānām eka tvena adhyavasitānām vyavahartṛbhiḥ yat sādhāraṇam
translated: For the ordinary people who conceive all the moments occurring in that continuum as one, the common

original: pratikṣaṇam anyānyakāraṇatayā vibhinnam api paramārthato viparyāsād ekatayā 'bhiniviṣṭaṃ
analyzed: pratikṣaṇam anya anya kāraṇa tayā vibhinnam api paramārthataḥ viparyāsāt eka tayā bhiniviṣṭam
translated: object, which is different in reality due to having different causes in each moment, is conceived as one by error,

original: rañjanādikaṃ nīlādikakāryaṃ tatra na teṣām uttareṣāṃ jñānakṣaṇānāṃ sāmarthyasyārthaprāpaṇaśakterbhedaḥ /
analyzed: rañjana ādikam nīla ādika kāryam tatra na teṣām uttareṣām jñāna kṣaṇānām sāmarthyasya artha prāpaṇa śakteḥ bhedaḥ
translated: and the effect such as coloring, etc., which is blue, etc., is produced by that. There is no difference in the power of those later moments of cognition, i.e., in their ability to bring about the object.

original: pūrvapratyakṣakṣaṇaviṣaya eva tebhyo 'pi pravṛtter ādyasyaiva tatraprāmāṇyam /
analyzed: pūrva pratyakṣa kṣaṇa viṣayaḥ eva pravṛtteḥ ādyasya eva
translated: Because they operate only with regard to the object of the first moment of perception, the first alone is valid in that case.

original: tathā hi arthakriyārthināṃ tatsādhanaprāpaṇasamarthe jñāne pramāṇavyavahāraṃ T /
analyzed: tathā hi artha kriyā arthinām tad sādhana prāpaṇa samarthe jñāne pramāṇa vyavahāram t
translated: For those who seek to accomplish a purpose, when they engage in the practice of pramāṇa with regard to knowledge that is capable of leading to the means of accomplishing that purpose,

original: kurvatām aviklavadhiyām arthakriyāsādhanabhedād eva prāmāṇyabhedavyavahāro
analyzed: kurvatām aviklava dhiyām artha kriyā sādhana bhedāt eva prāmāṇya bheda vyavahāraḥ
translated: it is proper for those with undeluded minds to engage in the practice of distinguishing the validity of cognitions based on the difference in the means of accomplishing a purpose.

original: jñāneṣu yuktaḥ S / / anyathā smṛtyāder api prāmāṇyaprasaṅgaḥ katham apākriyeta /
analyzed: jñāneṣu yuktaḥ anyathā smṛti ādeḥ api prāmāṇya prasaṅgaḥ katham apākriyeta
translated: Otherwise, how could one avoid the consequence that even memory and so on would be valid cognitions?

original: ādriyeta vā niṣphalā pramāṇavyavasthā prekṣāvatā iti / /
analyzed: ādriyeta vā niṣphalā pramāṇa vyavasthā prekṣāvatā iti
translated: Or one should respect the establishment of pramāṇa, which is fruitless for the wise.

original: keṣām iva sādhāreṇe kārye na sāmarthyabhedaḥ /
analyzed: keṣām iva sādhāreṇe kārye na sāmarthya bhedaḥ
translated: Like what? In the case of a common effect, there is no difference in capacity.

original: āhaaparāpare ca te dhumāś ca taiḥ pramitāś ca te sannikṛṣṭāgnayaś ca teṣv
analyzed: ca te dhumāḥ ca taiḥ pramitāḥ ca te sannikṛṣṭa agnayaḥ ca teṣu
translated: He says: Those are distant and near, and those are inferred by those, and those are the nearby fires, in those

original: iva tadviṣayāṇām iva anumānjñānānām agnimātrasādhye 'rthe sandhukṣaṇādike vāñchite
analyzed: iva tad viṣayāṇām iva anumān jñānānām agni mātra sādhye rthe sandhukṣaṇa ādike vāñchite
translated: like the objects of those inferential cognitions, when the desired purpose to be accomplished by mere fire, such as kindling, etc.,

original: tadarthakriyāsādhanaprāpaṇavyaktibhedābhāvāt tathā prāmāṇyabhedo na yukto viduṣāṃ tathā 'trāpi /
analyzed: tad artha kriyā sādhana prāpaṇa vyakti bheda abhāvāt tathā prāmāṇya bhedaḥ na yuktaḥ viduṣām tathā
translated: is not accomplished, there is no difference in the means of accomplishing that purpose, therefore the difference in validity is not proper for the wise, so also here.

original: yadā tu pañcatapas taptukāmo bhavati tadā 'parāparadhūmapramitasannikṛṣṭāgniviṣayāṇāṃ apy anumānānāṃ sāmarthyabhedāt prāmāṇyam anivāritam eva
analyzed: yadā tu pañcatapaḥ taptu kāmaḥ bhavati tadā para apara dhūma pramita sannikṛṣṭa agni viṣayāṇām api anumānānām sāmarthya bhedāt prāmāṇyam a nivāritam eva
translated: But when one desires to perform the five austerities, then even for inferences with objects of fire that are proximate due to the succession of smoke, the difference in capacity does not prevent their validity.

original: yogijñānāni kṣaṇavivartalakṣakāṇīti kṛtvā na ekyogakṣemāṇi /
analyzed: yogi jñānāni kṣaṇa vivarta lakṣakāṇi iti kṛtvā na eka yogakṣemāṇi
translated: The cognitions of yogins are indicators of the momentariness of transformations, so they are not mutually exclusive.

original: vivakṣitadavadattādeḥ prathamaḥ kṣaṇo dharmāyogyaḥ dvitīyas tu manāgayogyaḥ tṛtīyas tu yogya iti jñāyate yoginā /
analyzed: vivakṣita davadatta ādeḥ prathamaḥ kṣaṇaḥ dharma ayogyaḥ dvitīyaḥ tu manāk ayogyaḥ tṛtīyaḥ tu yogyaḥ iti jñāyate yoginā
translated: The first moment of the desired object is not suitable for dharma, the second is slightly suitable, and the third is known to be suitable by the yogin.

original: tataś ca kṣaṇāḥ bhinnāḥ arthakriyā ca bhinnā
analyzed: tatas ca kṣaṇāḥ bhinnāḥ arthakriyā ca bhinnā
translated: And from that, the moments are different and the practical efficacy is different.

original: jñānakṣaṇasya
analyzed: jñāna kṣaṇasya
translated: of the moment of cognition

original: yogini
analyzed: yogini
translated: of the yogin

original: bauddhamate
analyzed: bauddha mate
translated: in the Buddhist view

original: avajñākāriṇi mlecchādau saṃsāriskandhe
analyzed: avajñā kāriṇi mleccha ādau saṃsāri skandhe
translated: in the worldly aggregates of barbarians etc. who act with contempt

original: dharmajñā nena kṣāntiḥ /
analyzed: dharma jñā nena kṣāntiḥ
translated: patience is known through knowledge of dharma.

original: samarthena yat sahyata ity arthaḥ
analyzed: samarthena yat sahyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: what is endured by one who is capable.

original: kleśajananaśaktim
translated: the power to generate afflictions

original: vairāgyajñānam
translated: knowledge of dispassion

original: dharmajñānakṣāntyādicittānām
analyzed: dharma jñāna kṣānti ādi cittānām
translated: of the minds beginning with the receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas

original: yoginaḥ satkāni
analyzed: yoginaḥ satkāni
translated: of the yogin are real

original: kañcit paracittakṣaṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā bhagavān tasyaivānugrahāya pravartate /
analyzed: kañcid para citta kṣaṇam dṛṣṭvā bhagavān tasya eva anugrahāya pravartate
translated: Having seen a certain moment of another's mind, the Blessed One proceeds for the benefit of that very [person].

original: kañcit tu dṛṣṭvā audāsīnyam ālambate /
analyzed: kañcid tu dṛṣṭvā audāsīnyam ālambate
translated: But having seen a certain [person], he remains indifferent.

original: kañcit tv avabodhya nigrahāya🔽pratyakṣaṇām T /
analyzed: kañcid tu avabodhya nigrahāya  pratyakṣaṇām t
translated: But having instructed some for the purpose of restraint,🔽he should be watched.

original: kārye
analyzed: kārye
translated: In the matter of

original: ity āha aparāparadhūma iti /
analyzed: iti āha apara apara dhūmaḥ iti
translated: he says: By the successive smoke, etc.

original: aparāpare ca T /
analyzed: apara apare ca t
translated: And those successive

original: vikalpaprāmāṇyanirāsasya phalitārthaḥ /
translated: is the result of the negation of the validity of conceptual cognition.

original: tad evaṃ yathā nīlaṃ dṛṣṭvā nīlam iti jñānam
analyzed: tat evam yathā nīlam dṛṣṭvā nīlam iti jñānam
translated: Thus, having negated the validity of the conceptual cognition of blue in the example having seen blue, one knows 'blue',

original: ' ity udāharaṇe nīlavikalpasya prāmāṇyaṃ nirākṛtya prakṛte yojyann āha etena nīlasvalakṣaṇadarśanottarakālabhāvino nīlavikalpasya prāmāṇyanirākareṇa
analyzed: iti udāharaṇe nīla vikalpasya prāmāṇyam nirākṛtya prakṛte yojyan āha etena nīla sva lakṣaṇa darśana uttara kāla bhāvinaḥ nīla vikalpasya prāmāṇya nirākareṇa
translated: having negated the validity of the conceptual cognition of blue that arises after seeing the particular characteristic of blue, he applies it to the present case, saying: By this negation of the validity of the conceptual cognition of blue that arises after seeing the particular characteristic of blue,

original: tan neṣṭatvād vikalpasyāpy artharūpopakāriṇaḥ/ ŚV p /
analyzed: tat na iṣṭa tvāt vikalpasya api artha rūpa upakāriṇaḥ
translated: because that conceptual cognition, which assists in the form of the object, is not accepted,

original: iti bruvatākumārilena pradeS / /śādidarśanottarakālabhāvino p / / dharmivikalpasya /🔽tathā sambandhapratipattikāle 'gnisvalakṣaṇadarśanasāmarthyabhāvino 'gnisāmānyaviṣayasya sādhyadharmavikalpasya /
analyzed: iti bruvatā ākumārilena dharmi vikalpasya  tathā sambandha pratipatti kāle gni sva lakṣaṇa darśana sāmarthya bhāvinaḥ gni sāmānya viṣayasya sādhya dharma vikalpasya
translated: by saying this, Kumārila negates the conceptual cognition of the subject that arises after seeing the particular characteristic of the subject, etc.🔽Similarly, at the time of understanding the relation, the conceptual cognition of the probandum that has the universal of fire as its object, which arises from the capacity of seeing the particular characteristic of fire,

original: dhūmālocanājñānapṛṣṭhabhāvino dhūmasāmānyāvabhāsino liṅgavikalpasya /
analyzed: dhūma ālocanā ajñāna pṛṣṭha bhāvinaḥ dhūma sāmānya avabhāsinaḥ liṅga vikalpasya
translated: and the conceptual cognition of the reason that appears as the universal of smoke, which arises after the cognition of seeing smoke,

original: ādigrahaṇād dharmaT / /dharmisambandhavikalpasya ca pramāṇapṛṣṭhabhāvino dharmyādisvarūpamātraviṣayālocanākhyapratyakṣapūrvakasya
analyzed: ādi grahaṇāt ca pramāṇa pṛṣṭha bhāvinaḥ dharmya ādi sva rūpa mātra viṣaya ālocanā ākhya pratyakṣa pūrvakasya
translated: By the word 'ādi' (in the sūtra), the relation of the subject and the property is also included. The relation of the subject and the property, which arises after the means of knowledge, is preceded by the perception called 'ālocana', which has only the form of the subject as its object.

original: na cāvikalpyaliṅgasya dharmisambandhayos tathā🔽gṛhītiḥ ŚV p /
analyzed: na ca avikalpya liṅgasya dharmi sambandhayoḥ tathā  gṛhītiḥ śv p
translated: And the apprehension of the subject and the relation in that way of the inferential mark which is not conceptualized is not possible.

original: ity ākṣepabhayād yad abhyupagataṃ prāmāṇyaṃ tat pratyuktaṃ pratyākhyātam /
analyzed: iti ākṣepa bhayāt yat abhyupagatam prāmāṇyam tat pratyuktam pratyākhyātam
translated: This is the objection. Out of fear of this, the validity that is accepted is refuted, i.e. rejected.

original: pūrvakam eva svalakṣaṇaviṣayaṃ darśanaṃ yat pareṇālocanājñānam iti vyavahṛtaṃ tat
analyzed: pūrvakam eva sva lakṣaṇa viṣayam darśanam yat pareṇa ālocanā jñānam iti vyavahṛtam tat
translated: The previous [perception] alone, which has the specific particular as its object, which is designated by the opponent as 'ālocana-jñāna',

original: pramāṇaṃ na tu tadbalabhāvī vikalpo yathoktena nyāyeneti sthitam etat pakṣadharmasya
analyzed: pramāṇam na tu tad bala bhāvī vikalpaḥ yathā uktena nyāyena iti sthitam etat pakṣa dharmasya
translated: is the means of valid knowledge, but the conceptual cognition that arises from its power is not a means of valid knowledge, according to the stated reasoning. This is the established position.

original: sādhyadharmiṇi pratyakṣato 'numānato vāprasiddhiḥ niścaya iti /
analyzed: sādhya dharmiṇi pratyakṣataḥ numānataḥ vā aprasiddhiḥ niścayaḥ iti
translated: The non-establishment of the property of the subject in the probandum by perception or inference is ascertainment.

original: tad evaṃ pratyakṣataḥ pakṣadharmaniścayaṃ bruvatā prasaṅgena darśanapṛṣṭhabhāvino vikalpasya prāmāṇyanirākaraṇāt /
analyzed: tat evam pratyakṣataḥ pakṣa dharma niścayam bruvatā prasaṅgena darśana pṛṣṭha bhāvinaḥ vikalpasya prāmāṇya nirākaraṇāt
translated: Thus, by stating the ascertainment of the property of the subject by perception, the denial of the validity of conceptual cognition that arises after perception is incidentally accomplished.

original: pratyakṣaṃkalpanāpoḍham PV /
analyzed: pratyakṣam kalpanā apoḍham
translated: Perception is free from conceptual construction.

original: iti pratipāditam /
analyzed: iti pratipāditam
translated: This is what has been taught.

original: anumānaprādhānyajñāpanam /
translated: Indication of the primacy of inference.

original: yady evaṃ kasmād anumānavyutpādanārtham idamārabhyate S / / ity uktam na sāmānyena samyagjñānavyutpādanārtham' iti / /
analyzed: yadi evam kasmāt anumāna vyutpādana artham idam ārabhyate iti uktam na sāmānyena samyak jñāna vyutpādana artham iti
translated: If that is so, why is it said that this is begun for the purpose of teaching inference? It is said that it is not for the purpose of teaching valid cognition in general.

original: saṅkhyādivipratipattir apy atra tadviṣayā nirastaiva /
analyzed: saṅkhyā ādi vipratipattiḥ api atra tad viṣayā nirastā eva
translated: The disagreement about number is also refuted here with regard to that [valid cognition].

original: parokṣārthapratipatter anumānam evāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: parokṣa artha pratipatteḥ anumānam eva āśrayaḥ
translated: The basis of the understanding of a hidden object is inference alone.

original: kasmād / yataḥ pakṣadharma eva tadaṃśena vyāpta eva ca hetuḥ kāraṇaṃ tasyāḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt yatas pakṣa dharmaḥ eva tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ eva ca hetuḥ kāraṇam tasyāḥ
translated: Why is that? Because the reason is the cause of that [understanding] only when it is a property of the subject and pervaded by that [hidden object].

original: nānya ity abhidhānāt parokṣārthaviṣayaṃ sarvaṃ pramaṇam anumāne 'ntarbhāvitam iti saṅksepataḥ saṅkhyāvipratipattiḥ samyagjñānaviṣayā nirastā
analyzed: na anyaḥ iti abhidhānāt parokṣa artha viṣayam sarvam pramaṇam anumāne ntar bhāvitam iti saṅksepataḥ saṅkhyā vipratipattiḥ samyak jñāna viṣayā nirastā
translated: Not otherwise. Because of this statement, all valid cognition with regard to hidden objects is included in inference. Thus the disagreement about number with regard to valid cognition is refuted in brief.

original: tathā / vyāpakāṃśasyagamyatvapratīteḥ tadaṃśavyāptivacanena sāmānyaviṣayam anumānaṃ na svalakṣaṇaviṣayam ity ākhyātam T / / tasyāsādhāraṇatvāt /🔽asādhāraṇasya ca vyāpakatvāyogāt /
analyzed: tathā tad aṃśa vyāpti vacanena sāmānya viṣayam anumānam na sva lakṣaṇa viṣayam iti ākhyātam t tasya asādhāraṇa tvāt  asādhāraṇasya ca vyāpaka tva ayogāt
translated: Similarly, it is stated that inference has a universal for its object, not an individual characteristic, by the statement that it is pervaded by that part [of the reason which is a property of the subject]. Because that [individual characteristic] is unique.🔽And because what is unique cannot be a pervader.

original: vikalpāviṣayatvāc ca /
analyzed: vikalpa aviṣaya tvāt ca
translated: And because it is not the object of conceptual thought.

original: tatra tadādyamasādhāraṇaviṣayam ity ācakṣāṇena svalakṣaṇaviṣayam eva pratyakṣam uktam /
analyzed: tatra tad ādyam asādhāraṇa viṣayam iti ācakṣāṇena sva lakṣaṇa viṣayam eva pratyakṣam uktam
translated: Of these, the first is said to have an uncommon object, and by this it is said that perception has a particular as its object.

original: p / / darśanam eva pramāṇam ity ākhyānāt pramāṇam eva phalam iti sūcitam /
analyzed: darśanam eva pramāṇam ākhyānāt pramāṇam eva phalam iti sūcitam
translated: By the statement that seeing itself is the means of valid knowledge, it is indicated that the means of valid knowledge itself is the result.

original: S / / tasyārthapratītirūpatvāt /
analyzed: tasya artha pratīti rūpa tvāt
translated: Because it has the form of the cognition of the object.

original: tathā / tasya dvidhā prayoga iti vakṣyamāṇatvāt parārthānumānaṃ kathayiṣyate /
analyzed: tathā tasya dvidhā prayogaḥ iti vakṣyamāṇa tvāt parārtha anumānam kathayiṣyate
translated: Similarly, because it will be said that its application is twofold, inference for the sake of others will be explained.

original: tasya trirūpaliṅgākhyānarūpatvāt /
analyzed: tasya trirūpa liṅga ākhyāna rūpa tvāt
translated: Because it has the form of stating a reason with three characteristics.

original: saṅkṣepataś cānumānavyutpādanam apy abhimatam /
analyzed: saṅkṣepataḥ ca anumāna vyutpādanam api abhimatam
translated: And the teaching of inference is also desired in brief.

original: tac ca sarvatrāstyeveti kasmāt anumānavyutpādanārtham ity uktam / /
analyzed: tat ca kasmāt anumāna vyutpādana artham iti
translated: And that exists everywhere, so why is it said that the teaching of inference is for that purpose?

original: satyam / prādhānyāt tu tadgrahaṇam /
analyzed: satyam prādhānyāt tu tad grahaṇam
translated: It is true, but it is mentioned because it is primary.

original: tathā hi pradhānapuruṣārthopayoginas tattvasya caturāryasatyalakṣaṇasyānumānataeva niścayāt tasya prādhānyam /
analyzed: tathā hi pradhāna puruṣa artha upayoginaḥ tattvasya niścayāt tasya prādhānyam
translated: For thus, the four noble truths, which are the reality that is useful for the principal human goal, are ascertained only by inference, so it is primary.

original: tathā pratyakṣe 'pi viṣaye vivādasambhave /
analyzed: tathā pratyakṣe viṣaye vivāda sambhave
translated: Similarly, when there is a possibility of dispute even in the case of perception,

original: nānumānād anyan nirṇayanibandhanam ity ato 'py asya prādhānyam /
analyzed: na anumānāt anyat nirṇaya nibandhanam iti atas pi asya prādhānyam
translated: there is no basis for certainty other than inference, so it is primary for that reason also.

original: pravartakatvāc ca prādhānyam asya /
analyzed: pravartaka tvāt ca prādhānyam asya
translated: And because it is the instigator, it is primary.

original: tathā hi yadanubhūtaphalaṃ sukhaduḥkhasādhanam /
analyzed: tathā hi yat anubhūta phalam sukha duḥkha sādhanam
translated: For example, that which is the means of producing experienced pleasure or pain,

original: anubhūyamānaphalaṃ vā dṛśyamānaṃ na tatpravṛttiviṣayo niṣpannatvāt phalasya /
analyzed: anubhūyamāna phalam vā dṛśyamānam na tad pravṛtti viṣayaḥ niṣpanna tvāt phalasya
translated: or that which is seen to have experienced results, is not the object of instigation, because the result is accomplished.

original: tasmād yadanāgataphalaṃ sukhaduḥkhasādhanaṃ pratyakṣam api tatrāpy anumānam eva pravartakam /
analyzed: tasmāt yat anāgata phalam sukha duḥkha sādhanam pratyakṣam api tatra api anumānam eva pravartakam
translated: Therefore, even in the case of that which is perceptible but has a future result, it is inference alone that instigates.

original: na hi tasyānāgate sukhaduḥkhe prati yogyatāṃ pratyakṣaṃ nirddhārayati /
analyzed: na hi tasya anāgate sukha duḥkhe prati yogyatām pratyakṣam nirddhārayati
translated: For perception does not determine the suitability of that for future pleasure or pain.

original: phalasya S / / parokṣatvāt /
analyzed: phalasya parokṣa tvāt
translated: Because the result is hidden.

original: taduktam na hy apratyakṣe kārye kāraṇabhāvagatiḥ iti /
analyzed: tat uktam na hi apratyakṣe kārye kāraṇa bhāva gatiḥ iti
translated: As it is said: The cognition of the nature of a cause in a non-perceived effect is not possible.

original: tasmāt pūrvānubhūtasukhaduḥkhasādhanaT / /sādharmyāt pratyakṣaviṣayasyāpi vastuno 'nāgataphalayogyatāniścayaḥ na pratyakṣataḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt pūrva anubhūta sukha duḥkha sādhanat pratyakṣa viṣayasya api vastunaḥ na agata phala yogya tā niścayaḥ na pratyakṣataḥ
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the suitability of a perceptible object for future results is not from perception, but from the similarity to the previously experienced means of producing pleasure or pain.

original: tathā cāha tadyathādṛṣṭasādharmyāt tathāprasādhitaṃ nānumeyatām atipatati iti /
analyzed: tathā ca āha    na anumeya tām atipatati iti
translated: As it is said: It does not go beyond being an inference because of the similarity to what is seen in that way.

original: kathaṃ tarhi dvayor api pravartakatvam /
analyzed: katham tarhi dvayoḥ api pravartaka tvam
translated: How then is there instigation by both?

original: na hyābhyām arthaṃparicchidya pravartamāno 'rthakriyāyāṃvisaṃvādyata ity uktam /
analyzed: na hi ābhyām artham paricchidya pravartamānaḥ rthakriyāyām visaṃvādyate iti uktam
translated: For it has been said that one who acts after determining the object by these two is not deceived in the functioning of the object.

original: sukhaduḥkhasādhanasyajalānalādeḥ svarūpasya pratyakṣataḥ prasiddheḥ /
analyzed: sva rūpasya pratyakṣataḥ prasiddheḥ
translated: Because the nature of the means of attaining pleasure and pain, such as water and fire, is well-known through perception.

original: phalam anāgataṃ prati yogyatāyā anumānata ity ubhayor api pravartakatvam /
analyzed: phalam anāgatam prati yogyatāyāḥ anumānataḥ iti ubhayoḥ api pravartaka tvam
translated: And because the fitness for the future result is inferred, both of them are the instigators.

original: samyagjñānapūrvakatvaṃ ca hitāhitaprāptiparihārayor uktam na tv anāgataphalaṃ prati yogyatāyāḥ pratyakṣato 'niścayāt /
analyzed: samyak jñāna pūrvaka tvam ca hita ahita prāpti parihārayoḥ uktam na tu anāgata phalam prati yogyatāyāḥ pratyakṣataḥ niścayāt
translated: And it has been said that the attainment of the beneficial and the avoidance of the harmful are preceded by right knowledge, but not because the fitness for the future result is ascertained through perception.

original: S / / na hy arvāgdarśināṃ bhāviphalayogyatāyās tato niścayaḥ /
analyzed: na hi arvāk darśinām bhāvi phala yogya tāyāḥ tatas niścayaḥ
translated: For those who see only the present, there is no certainty about the future fitness for results.

original: tataḥ prādhānyād anumānagrahaṇam ity alam ativistareṇeti /
analyzed: tatas prādhānyāt anumāna grahaṇam iti alam ati vistareṇa iti
translated: Therefore, because of its importance, inference is mentioned. That is enough of this extensive discussion.

original: agni
analyzed: agni
translated: fire

original: pratyakṣādau
analyzed: pratyakṣa ādau
translated: in perception, etc.

original: saṅkṣepeṇaiva pratyakṣavyutpādanaṃ na vistarataḥ' ity āśaṅkyāha
analyzed: saṅkṣepeṇa eva pratyakṣa vyutpādanam na vistarataḥ iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: fearing that perception will be explained only briefly, not in detail, he says

original: duḥkhasamudayamārganirodhāḥ
analyzed: duḥkha samudaya mārga nirodhāḥ
translated: the truths of suffering, origin, path, and cessation

original: vastu
analyzed: vastu
translated: entity

original: anyatra
analyzed: anyatra
translated: elsewhere

original: sukhaduḥkhahetutayā
analyzed: sukha duḥkha hetutayā
translated: as the cause of pleasure and pain

original: uttaram
analyzed: uttaram
translated: reply

original: p / / / svabhāvahetāv anvayaniścayaḥ svapramāṇāyattaḥ /
translated: In the case of essential inference, the ascertainment of concomitance depends on one's own means of knowledge.

original: tatra svabhāvakāryānupalambhānāṃ pakṣadharmaniścayas tulyopāyasādhyatayā 'bhedenaivoktaḥ
analyzed: tatra svabhāva kārya anupalambhānām pakṣa dharma niścayaḥ tulya upāya sādhya tayā bhedena eva uktaḥ
translated: Of these, the ascertainment of the property of the subject by the methods of agreement and difference is stated without distinction, because it is accomplished by the same means.

original: anvayavyatirekaniścayasya tu bhinnopāyasādhyatayā bhedenaiva nirddeśaḥ kārya iti
analyzed: anvaya vyatireka niścayasya tu bhinna upāya sādhya tayā bhedena eva nirddeśaḥ kāryaḥ iti
translated: But the ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance is to be stated with distinction, because it is accomplished by different means.

original: svabhāvahetau tāvad anvayaniścayaṃ svapramāṇanibandhanaṃ darśayann āha anvayaniścayo
analyzed: svabhāva hetau tāvat anvaya niścayam sva pramāṇa nibandhanam darśayan āha anvaya niścayaḥ
translated: Now, showing the ascertainment of positive concomitance based on one's own means of knowledge in the case of an inference based on essential identity, he says:

original: 'pi na kevalaṃ pakṣadharmaniścaya uktaḥ kintv anvayaniśayo 'pi svabhāvahetau ucyata iti śeṣaḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam pakṣa dharma niścayaḥ uktaḥ kintu anvaya niśayaḥ svabhāva hetau ucyate iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The ascertainment of positive concomitance is also stated, not only the ascertainment of the property of the subject, but the ascertainment of positive concomitance is also stated in the case of an inference based on essential identity. This is the remainder.

original: sādhanadharmasya yad bhāvamātraṃ sattāmātraṃ mudgarādinimittāntarānapekṣaṃ tasya anubandho anugamanaṃ vyāptiḥ tasya siddhiḥ yā sa svabhāvahetāv 🔽anvayaniścayaḥ /
analyzed: sādhana dharmasya yat bhāva mātram sattā mātram mudgara ādi nimitta antara anapekṣam tasya anubandhaḥ anugamanam vyāptiḥ tasya siddhiḥ yā sa svabhāva hetau
translated: The mere existence, the mere being, of the property to be established, which is independent of other causes such as a hammer, is its connection, its pervasion. The establishment of that is the ascertainment of positive concomitance in the case of an inference based on essential identity.

original: kasya T / / sādhanadharmabhāvamātrānubandhasiddhiḥ / /
analyzed: kasya t sādhana dharma bhāva mātra anubandha siddhiḥ
translated: What is that? The establishment of the connection of the mere existence of the property to be established.

original: sādhyadharmasya S / / sādhyaś cāsau asiddhatvāt dharmadharmisamudayaikadeśatvāt dharmaś ceti tathoktaḥ /
analyzed: sādhya dharmasya sādhyaḥ ca asau asiddha tvāt dharma dharmi samudaya eka deśa tvāt dharmaḥ ca iti tathā uktaḥ
translated: And the property to be established is so called because it is not yet established and because it is a part of the aggregate of property and possessor of the property.

original: yatra yatra sādhanadharmasya bhāvaḥ tatra tatra sādhyadharmasyāpi nimittāntarānapekṣo bhāva ity etasyārthasya siddhiḥ svabhāvahetāv anvayaniścayaḥ
analyzed: yatra yatra sādhana dharmasya bhāvaḥ tatra tatra sādhya dharmasya api nimitta antara anapekṣaḥ bhāvaḥ iti etasya arthasya siddhiḥ svabhāva hetau anvaya niścayaḥ
translated: The ascertainment of the positive concomitance in the inference based on identity is the establishment of the meaning that wherever there is the presence of the property to be established, there is also the presence of the property to be proved, without dependence on any other cause.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ sādhyadharmaḥ sādhanadharmabhāvamātram anubadhnāti /
analyzed: katham punar sādhya dharmaḥ sādhana dharma bhāva mātram anubadhnāti
translated: How is it that the property to be proved necessarily follows from the mere presence of the property to be established?

original: tadbhāvatayā sa sādhanadharmo bhāvaḥ svabhāvo yasya tasya bhāvatayā tadbhāvatayā /
analyzed: tad bhāva tayā sa sādhana dharmaḥ bhāvaḥ svabhāvaḥ yasya tasya bhāva tayā tad bhāva tayā
translated: The property to be established is the nature, i.e., the essence, of the property to be established. It is the nature, i.e., the essence, of that which has that nature.

original: yo hi sādhanadharmaḥ sādhyadharmasya svabhāvaḥ sakathaṃ taṃnānubadhnīyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ hi sādhana dharmaḥ sādhya dharmasya svabhāvaḥ
translated: How could that which is the nature of the property to be established not necessarily follow from it?

original: nīrūpatvaprasaṅgāt / /🔽sādhyadharmaḥ
analyzed: nīrūpa tva prasaṅgāt  sādhya dharmaḥ
translated: Because it would then be without form.🔽property to be proved

original: sādhanadharmam
analyzed: sādhana dharmam
translated: property to be established

original: svabhāvahetāvaikyepi sādhyasādhanabhāvavyavasthā /
translated: Even in the case of identity, the relation of probandum and probans is established in the inference based on identity.

original: nanu tatsvabhāvatve bhedābhāvāt kathaṃ sādhyasādhanabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: nanu tad svabhāva tve bheda abhāvāt katham sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ
translated: But if it is of the same nature, how can there be the relation of probandum and probans, since there is no difference?

original: ity āha vastutaḥ paramārthataḥ /
analyzed: iti āha vastutas paramārthataḥ
translated: To this he says: in reality, ultimately.

original: sādhyasādhanasaṃkalpakāletu paramparayā tat tadvyāvṛttapadārthanibandhanāyāṃ kalpanābuddhau S / / bhedena pratibhāsanāt sādhyasādhanabhāvo
analyzed: paramparayā tat tad vyāvṛtta padārtha nibandhanāyām kalpanā buddhau s bhedena pratibhāsanāt sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ
translated: But at the time of conceiving the relation of probandum and probans, in the conceptual cognition that is dependent on the exclusion of this and that, the relation of probandum and probans appears as different,

original: na vihanyate /
analyzed: na vihanyate
translated: [The relation of inherence] is not obstructed.

original: na hy asaupāramārthikaṃ sādhyasādhanadharmayor ddharmiṇaś ca kṛtakatvādau bhedam avalambhate /
analyzed: na hi sādhya sādhana dharmayoḥ ca kṛtaka tva ādau bhedam
translated: For this [cognition] does not apprehend the difference between the properties to be established and the means of establishment, and the substratum, in the case of [properties] such as being produced, which are not ultimate.

original: sambandhābhāvena sādhyasādhanabhāvāyogāt /
analyzed: sambandha abhāvena sādhya sādhana bhāva ayogāt
translated: Because the relation of what is to be established and the means of establishment is not possible without a relation.

original: ekārthasamavāyaḥ kṛtakatvānityatvādeḥ sambandhaḥ iti cet / na /
analyzed: eka artha samavāyaḥ kṛtaka tva anitya tva ādeḥ sambandhaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the relation of being produced and impermanent, etc. is the inherence in one meaning, [we say] no.

original: tasyāpi tato'rthāntaratve ayam anayor asminn arthe samavāyaḥ' iti p / / sambandhābhāvasya tadavasthatvāt /
analyzed: tasya api ayam anayoḥ asmin arthe samavāyaḥ iti sambandha abhāvasya tad avastha tvāt
translated: Because even for that, if it is different from that, the relationlessness remains as it is, thinking this inherence of these two is in this meaning.

original: sambandhāntarakalpanāyāṃ cānavasthāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: sambandha antara kalpanāyām ca anavasthā prasaṅgāt
translated: And if another relation is imagined, there would be the fault of infinite regress.

original: samavāyād vṛttikalpanāyāṃ ca kṛtakatvādayo nityābhimateṣv apy ātmādiṣu varteran /
analyzed: samavāyāt vṛtti kalpanāyām ca kṛtaka tva ādayaḥ nitya abhimateṣu api ātma ādiṣu varteran
translated: And if the occurrence of being produced, etc. is imagined to be due to inherence, then being produced, etc. would occur even in the self, etc. which are considered to be eternal.

original: ya eva hi kṛtakatvādeḥ śabde samavāyo T / / yadbalāt tatraiva tad vartate sa eva nityābhimateṣv api /
analyzed: yaḥ eva hi kṛtaka tva ādeḥ śabde yad balāt tatra eva tat vartate saḥ eva nitya abhimateṣu api
translated: For that very inherence of being produced, etc. in sound, by the power of which it occurs there alone, that very [inherence] occurs even in what is considered to be eternal.

original: tasyaikatvenopagatatvāt ity ātmādau vṛttiḥ kṛtakatvādeḥ kena nivaryeta / /
analyzed: tasya ekatvena upagata tvāt iti ātma ādau vṛttiḥ kṛtaka tva ādeḥ kena nivaryeta
translated: Because that [inherence] is accepted as one. Thus, by what is the occurrence of being produced, etc. in the self, etc. prevented?

original: atha ya evābhūtvā bhavanadharmā bhūtvā cābhavanadharmā 'sthirarūpo bhāvaḥ tatraiva kṛtakatvādayo dharmā vartante' iti vyavasthāpyate /🔽saiva tarhy abhūtvā bhavanasvabhāvatā bhūtasya cāsthirasvabhāvatā tadviparītarūpasamāropavyavacchedaviṣayayāyāḥ kalpanābuddher nibandhanaṃ
analyzed: atha yaḥ eva a bhūtvā bhavana dharmā bhūtvā ca a bhavana dharmā sthira rūpaḥ bhāvaḥ tatra eva kṛtaka tva ādayaḥ dharmāḥ vartante iti vyavasthāpyate  sā eva tarhi a bhūtvā bhavana svabhāva tā bhūtasya ca asthira svabhāva tā tad viparīta rūpa samāropa vyavaccheda viṣayayā āyāḥ kalpanā buddheḥ nibandhanam
translated: But if it is established that the properties of being produced, etc. exist only in that entity which, having the nature of not existing and then existing, and having the nature of existing and then not existing, has an unstable form,

original: kiṃ neṣyate / /
analyzed: kim na iṣyate
translated: then why is it not accepted that very nature of not existing and then existing, and of the existing having an unstable nature, is the basis for the conceptual cognition that has as its object the exclusion of the superimposition of a form that is contrary to that?

original: S / / tayaivaparamārthābhedavator ddharmayoḥ sādhyadharmiṇi vṛtteḥ kim antarālagaḍunā kṛtakatvādinā
translated: What is the use of an intervening lump, such as being produced, etc.,

original: tathā hi na sattāmātreṇa kṛtakatvādayo dharmāḥ sādhyadharmapratipattinibandhanam /
analyzed: tathā hi na sattā mātreṇa kṛtaka tva ādayaḥ dharmāḥ sādhya dharma pratipatti nibandhanam
translated: For it is not that the properties of being produced, etc. are the basis for the ascertainment of the property to be proved by mere existence.

original: teṣāṃ sadā sannihitatvenānavarataṃ taddharmapratītiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: teṣām sadā sannihita tvena anavaratam tad dharma pratīti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if they were always present, there would be the consequence of the constant ascertainment of that property.

original: kintu vikalpapratibhāsina eva /
analyzed: kintu vikalpa pratibhāsinaḥ eva
translated: But rather, [it is the properties of being produced, etc.] that appear in a conceptual cognition.

original: sa ca vikalpaḥ svapratibhāsinamevākāraṃ bahīrūpatayā 'dhyavasitam anusaran kṛtakānityādirūpatāṃ vastunaḥ pratipadyate /
analyzed: sa ca vikalpaḥ bahī rūpatayā dhyavasitam anusaran kṛtaka anitya ādi rūpa tām vastunaḥ pratipadyate
translated: And that conceptual cognition, following the form that appears to itself, which is determined as having the nature of an external object, ascertains the nature of the entity as being produced, impermanent, etc.

original: paramārthato 'saṃsparśe 'pi tadrūpasya /
analyzed: paramārthataḥ saṃsparśe pi
translated: Even though in the ultimate sense, it is not in contact with that form.

original: paramparayā tadupādānatvāt /
analyzed: paramparayā tad upādāna tvāt
translated: Because it is the material cause of that indirectly.

original: vyatiriktās tu dharmās tadutpattinimittamātratayāparikalpyante /🔽tad varaṃ yadeva tatkalpanānibandhanaṃtad eva tathāvidhavikalpaprasavanimittam astu /
analyzed: vyatiriktāḥ tu dharmāḥ  tat varam eva tathāvidha vikalpa prasava nimittam astu
translated: But the separate dharmas are imagined to be merely the cause of its arising.🔽It is better that which is the basis for that imagination should be the cause of the production of such a conceptual differentiation.

original: tadabhyupagame ca caritārthā vyatirekavanto dharmā ity alaṃ tatkalpanayā /
analyzed: tad abhyupagame ca caritārthāḥ vyatirekavantaḥ dharmāḥ iti alam tad kalpanayā
translated: And when that is accepted, the separate dharmas with distinctions have served their purpose, so it is enough to imagine them.

original: avaśyaṃ ca vyatiriktā 'nityatādvāreṇāpi vastuna evānavasthāyinam ātmānaṃ pratipadyatente
analyzed: avaśyam ca vyatiriktāḥ nitya tā dvāreṇa api vastunaḥ evā anavasthāyinam ātmānam
translated: And necessarily, even through the door of separate impermanence, they understand the self of the thing itself to be non-abiding.

original: S / / T / / tadanurūpārthakṛkri
translated: They perform actions in accordance with that.

original: anyathāvyatiriktā 'nityatayā nityatvāttadavagamārthatvenāyam anityasādhyārthakriyārthīnityaṃ
analyzed: nitya tayā
translated: Otherwise, due to being separate from impermanence, they would understand it to be permanent, and this consideration of impermanence would be for the purpose of understanding that impermanent thing.

original: śabdādikam āśaṅkamānaḥ anityatāvicāraṃ prati āhitāsthaḥ //
analyzed: śabda ādikam āśaṅkamānaḥ kim anitya tā vicāram prati
translated: Fearing that the permanent sound etc. would be the object of that, he is intent on the consideration of impermanence.

original: p / / vyatiriktāyāṃ cānityatāyām avagatāyāṃ tatraiva pravartatām /
analyzed: vyatiriktāyām ca anitya tāyām avagatāyām tatra eva pravartatām
translated: And when separate impermanence is understood, let them engage in that alone.

original: kim iti nitye śabdātmani / /
analyzed: kim iti nitye śabda ātmani
translated: Why in the permanent essence of sound?

original: tadvāddvāreṇapratipatteḥ iti cet /
analyzed: iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is because of understanding through that door,

original: tat kim anena vyavadhinā / /
analyzed: tat kim anena vyavadhinā
translated: Then what is the use of this interruption?

original: varam avyavahitasyaiva pratipattir astu /
analyzed: varam avyavahitasya eva pratipattiḥ astu
translated: It is better that there should be understanding of only what is not interrupted.

original: tenaivārthatvād iti /
analyzed: tena eva artha tvāt iti
translated: Because that itself is the meaning.

original: tadetad atipracarccyamānamatigahanaṃ sampadyata ity āstāṃ tāvat /
analyzed: tat etat sampadyate iti āstām tāvat
translated: This, being greatly discussed, becomes very obscure. Let it be so for now.

original: ye 'pijaiminīyāmanyante yeṣām atyantavyatirekavanto dharmāḥ teṣām evāyaṃnaiyāyikādīnāṃ doṣaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi jaiminīyā manyante yeṣām atyanta vyatirekavantaḥ dharmāḥ teṣām eva ayam naiyāyika ādīnām doṣaḥ
translated: Those who think like Jaimini, for whom the dharmas are absolutely distinct, for them this is the fault of the Naiyāyikas and others.

original: asmākaṃ tu kathañcid bhedābhedavatāṃ dharmāṇāṃ tatsvabhāvatayā naiṣa doṣaḥ' iti /
analyzed: asmākam tu kathañcid bheda abhedavatām dharmāṇām tad svabhāva tayā na eṣa doṣaḥ iti
translated: But for us, whose dharmas are somehow different and non-different, this is not a fault because they are of that nature.

original: teṣām api vastutaḥ sādhanadharmarūpatopagame sādhyadharmasya /
analyzed: teṣām api vastutas sādhana dharma rūpa tā upagame sādhya dharmasya
translated: Even for them, if the form of the proving dharma is accepted as real, then of the dharma to be proved,

original: kathañcid bhedābhyupagame na kiñcit S / / phalam utpaśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: kathañcid bheda abhyupagame na kiñcid phalam utpaśyāmaḥ
translated: if difference is somehow accepted, we do not see any result.

original: sādhyasādhanabhāvasya kalpitabhedadvāreṇāpy upapatteḥ /
analyzed: sādhya sādhana bhāvasya kalpita bheda dvāreṇa api upapatteḥ
translated: Because the relation of probandum and probans is possible even through a conceptual difference.

original: na caikātmye kathañcid api bhedo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na ca aikātmye kathañcid api bhedaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: And in identity, difference is not appropriate in any way.

original: ekasmāt svabhāvād abhedāt /
analyzed: ekasmāt svabhāvāt abhedāt
translated: Because of non-difference from a single nature.

original: tato 'pi tayoḥ kathañcid bhedābhedau sta eveti cet / na /
analyzed: tayoḥ kathañcid bheda abhedau staḥ evā iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that difference and non-difference exist somehow even from that, no.

original: anavasthāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anavasthā prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the contingence of infinite regress.

original: tathā hi dharmayos tadekasvabhāvādapi bhedavatos tena svabhāvena kathañcid abhedanimittam abhinno 'paraḥ svabhāvo 'bhyupagantavyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi dharmayoḥ bhedavatoḥ tena svabhāvena kathañcid abheda nimittam abhinnaḥ paraḥ svabhāvaḥ bhyupagantavyaḥ
translated: For, in the case of two properties which are different from each other, though they are of the same nature, some sort of non-difference must be admitted to be the cause of non-difference, in the form of a third property which is different from the former two.

original: tathā tenā 'py aparaḥ ity anantaiva T / / bhinnābhinnasvabhāvaparamparā syāt /
analyzed: tathā tena a pi aparaḥ iti anantā eva bhinna abhinna svabhāva paramparā syāt
translated: And in the same way, that [third property] also [must have a further property of non-difference from the former two, and so on ad infinitum].

original: na ca kalpanābuddhāv anantobhayarūpasvabhāvaparamparā pratibhāsata iti kim iti tatkalpanayā ''tmānaṃ vipralabhante bhavantaḥ / /
analyzed: na ca kalpanā buddhau ananta ubhaya rūpa svabhāva paramparā pratibhāsate iti kim iti tad kalpanayā tmānam vipralabhante bhavantaḥ
translated: And since an infinite series of properties, both different and non-different, does not appear in the conceptual cognition, why do you deceive yourselves by imagining it?

original: kathañcit ca bhedopagamāt
analyzed: kathañcid ca bheda upagamāt
translated: And since difference is admitted in some way,

original: kathaṃ bhedapakṣabhāvināṃ doṣāṇāṃ anavasaraḥ / /
analyzed: katham bheda pakṣa bhāvinām doṣāṇām anavasaraḥ
translated: how can there be no scope for the faults that arise in the position of difference?

original: yaṃ cātmānaṃ purodhāya imau dharmāu /
analyzed: yam ca ātmānam purodhāya imau dharmau
translated: And the self which is the substratum of these two properties,

original: ayaṃ dharmī' iti vyavasthāpyateyadi tena bhedas tadā bheda eveti kuto 'nekāntavādaḥ / /
analyzed: ayam dharmī iti tena bhedaḥ tadā bhedaḥ eva iti kutas nekāntavādaḥ
translated: and is established as the subject of the properties, if it is different from them, then it is simply difference. How can there be the doctrine of the middle way?

original: athābhedaḥ /🔽tadā ayaṃ sādhanadharmaḥ /
analyzed: atha abhedaḥ  tadā ayam sādhana dharmaḥ
translated: But if it is non-different,🔽then this is the property to be established,

original: ayaṃ sādhyadharmaḥ /🔽dharmī cāyam' iti kathaṃ pāramārthikaṃ tṛtri
analyzed: ayam sādhya dharmaḥ  dharmī ca ayam iti katham pāramārthikam
translated: this is the property to be proved,

original: tayaṃ sidhyet / /
analyzed: sidhyet
translated: and this is the subject. How can these three be ultimately established?

original: S / / tasmāt tattatpararūpavyāvṛttisamāśrayāyāṃ kalpanābuddhau bhedavatām iva dharmadharmiṇāṃ pratibhāsanāt sādhyasādhanabhāvaḥ /
