analyzed: tad nimittam anusarati iti kaḥ yam pratipatteḥ kramaḥ paripāṭiḥ
translated: the inferential mark [i.e., the reason] follows as the reason for that [object of knowledge]. What is this sequence, this order, of understanding?

original: tathā hi prathamaṃ liṅgānusaraṇam /
analyzed: tathā hi prathamam liṅga anusaraṇam
translated: For example, first there is the following of the inferential mark.

original: tataḥ sādhyapratipattir iti vipaścitāṃ kramaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sādhya pratipattiḥ iti vipaścitām kramaḥ
translated: Then there is the understanding of the probandum. This is the sequence for the wise.

original: ayaṃ tv apūrvo 'numātā yas tadviparyayam āśrayata iti upahasati /
analyzed: ayam tu apūrvaḥ numātā yaḥ tad viparyayam āśrayate iti upahasati
translated: But this is a new kind of inferential knower who relies on the opposite of that [sequence]. Thus he is ridiculed.

original: yattalloke gīyate śiro muṇḍayitvā nakṣatraṃ pṛcchatīti tattulyatvād asya kramasya /
analyzed: yat tat loke gīyate śiraḥ muṇḍayitvā nakṣatram pṛcchati iti tat tulya tvāt asya kramasya
translated: This sequence is similar to what is sung in the world: Shaving one's head and then asking about the stars.

original: tasmāt pakṣadharmagrahaṇavyāptismaraṇasāmarthyād eva svayaṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: tasmāt pakṣa dharma grahaṇa vyāpti smaraṇa sāmarthyāt eva svayam pratipadyate
translated: Therefore, by the power of grasping the property of the subject and remembering the pervasion, one understands by oneself.

original: tac ca pratipādakaṃ kathitam eveti na kiñcit prameyanirddeśena /
analyzed: tat ca pratipādakam kathitam evā iti na kiñcid prameya nirddeśena
translated: And that which is to be taught has already been stated, so there is nothing to be taught by stating the object of knowledge.

original: yadi nāma svārthānumānakāle svayam eva sādhyaṃ T / b / pratipadyate tad yuktam eva /
analyzed: yadi nāma sva artha anumāna kāle svayam eva sādhyam pratipadyate tat yuktam eva
translated: Even if one understands the probandum by oneself at the time of an inference for oneself, that is proper.

original: liṅgasyāpi tatra svayam eva pratipatteḥ /
analyzed: liṅgasya api tatra svayam eva pratipatteḥ
translated: Because even the inferential mark is understood by oneself there.

original: parārthānumāne tu parato yathā liṅgaṃ pratyeti tathā prameyam api parata S / / eva pratyetavyam /🔽ato yukta eva pratijñāprayoga ity ata āha pareṇāpi na kevalaṃ svayam eva prāg
analyzed: parārtha anumāne tu paratas yathā liṅgam pratyeti tathā prameyam api paratas eva pratyetavyam  atas yuktaḥ eva pratijñā prayogaḥ iti atas āha pareṇa api na kevalam svayam eva prāk
translated: But in inference for others, just as the inferential mark is understood from others, so too the object to be inferred must be understood from others.

original: vyavasthāpyamānaṃ plavate pareṇāpi vādinā tat prameyam ucyamānaṃplavata eva tadvacanasya🔽sandigdhārthābhidhāyakatayā sādhyaniścayānaṅgatvāt prameyagāmbhīryānavagāhinaḥ paramparayā
analyzed: vyavasthāpyamānam plavate pareṇa api vādinā tat prameyam ucyamānam plavate eva tad vacanasya  sandigdha artha abhidhāyaka tayā sādhya niścaya anaṅga tvāt prameya gāmbhīrya anavagāhinaḥ paramparayā
translated: Therefore, the use of the thesis is indeed proper. Thus, he says: Not only by oneself, but also by the opponent, when the object to be inferred is being established first, it floats. Even when that object to be inferred is being stated by the proponent, it still floats, because his statement🔽expresses a doubtful meaning and is not a means of ascertaining the probandum. One who does not understand the profundity of the object to be inferred establishes it only superficially, based merely on his own intention, even though it is not actually connected with that,

original: 'py atatsambaddhasya vivakṣāmātranibandhanatayoparyevāvasthāpanāt /
analyzed: pi a tad sambaddhasya vivakṣā mātra nibandhana tayā upari eva avasthāpanāt
translated: through a series of inferences.

original: kasmāt plavate /🔽iti cet / upayogābhāvāt nāsya sādhyapratītiṃ prati kaścid upayogaḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt plavate  iti ced upayoga abhāvāt na asya sādhya pratītim prati kaścid upayogaḥ
translated: If it is asked Why does it float?,🔽it is because of the absence of any use. It has no use at all in the cognition of the probandum.

original: tatpratyāyanasamarthasyānabhidhānād iti yāvat /
analyzed: tad pratyāyana samarthasya anabhidhānāt iti yāvat
translated: In other words, because it does not express what is capable of proving that.

original: p / / paras tūpayogamātraṃ kadācid brūyād ity āśaṅkyāha viṣayopadarśanaṃ hetor yo viṣayaḥ sādhyaṃ tadupadarśanaṃ pratijñāvacanasyopayogaḥ
analyzed: paraḥ tu upayoga mātram kadācid brūyāt iti āśaṅkya āha viṣaya upadarśanam hetoḥ yaḥ viṣayaḥ sādhyam tad upadarśanam pratijñā vacanasya upayogaḥ
translated: But it is possible that someone might say that the purpose is merely the statement of the subject. Fearing this, he says: The purpose of the statement of the proposition is to state the subject, which is the probandum, of the reason.

original: cet matam /
analyzed: ced matam
translated: But the opponent might say that the purpose of the statement of the proposition is merely to mention the subject. To anticipate this objection, he says: If it is thought that the purpose of the statement of the proposition is to mention the subject, which is the object of the reason,🔽then this is said:

original: atrāha tenaiva viṣayeṇa /
analyzed: atra āha tena eva viṣayeṇa
translated: By that very subject.

original: tāvac chabdaḥ krame /🔽viṣayasyopadarśyamānasyārthavattāyāṃ tadupadarśanaṃ pratijñāvacanasya prayojanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tāvat śabdaḥ krame  viṣayasya upadarśyamānasya arthavat tāyām tad upadarśanam pratijñā vacanasya prayojanam bhavet
translated: The word only is in sequence.🔽If the subject being mentioned has a purpose, then mentioning it would be the purpose of the statement of the proposition.

original: viṣayeṇaiva tu darśyamānena ko 'rthaḥ kiṃ S / / prayojanam / /
analyzed: viṣayeṇa eva tu darśyamānena kaḥ rthaḥ kim prayojanam
translated: But what is the purpose of the subject being shown by that very subject? What is the purpose of the statement of the proposition?

original: nanu sādhyapratītiḥ sādharmyavatprayogādipratītiś ca viṣayopadarśanasyārthaḥ /
analyzed: nanu sādhya pratītiḥ sādharmyavat prayoga ādi pratītiḥ ca viṣaya upadarśanasya arthaḥ
translated: Isn't the purpose of mentioning the subject the understanding of the probandum and the understanding of the use of the example with similarity?

original: tatas tadupadarśanaṃ pratijñāvacanasya prayojanam /
analyzed: tatas tad upadarśanam pratijñā vacanasya prayojanam
translated: Therefore, mentioning that is the purpose of the statement of the proposition.

original: tathā hi asati sādhyanirdeśe yat kṛtakaṃ tad anityam' ity ukte kim ayaṃ sādharmyavān prayogaḥ /🔽T / / uta vaidharmyavān /
analyzed: tathā hi asati sādhya nirdeśe yat kṛtakam tat anityam iti ukte kim ayam sādharmyavān prayogaḥ  t uta vaidharmyavān
translated: For example, if the probandum is not stated, when it is said Whatever is produced is impermanent, it is not known whether this is an example with similarity

original: ' iti na jñāyeta /
analyzed: iti na jñāyeta
translated: or with dissimilarity.

original: ubhayaṃ hy atrāśaṅkhyate kṛtakatvenānityatve sādhye sādharmyavān /
analyzed: ubhayam hi atra āśaṅkhyate kṛtaka tvena anitya tve sādhye sādharmyavān
translated: For both are suspected here. When impermanence is to be proved by being produced, there is one with similarity.

original: nityatvenākṛtakatve vā vaidharmyavān iti /
analyzed: nitya tvena akṛtaka tve vā vaidharmyavān iti
translated: If it is eternal or uncreated, then it has a contradictory property.

original: anityaḥ śabdaḥ' akṛtako vā' iti tu pratijñāvacane saty ubhayam asandigdham avagamyate /
analyzed: anityaḥ śabdaḥ akṛtakaḥ vā iti tu pratijñā vacane sati ubhayam asandigdham avagamyate
translated: But when the proposition is stated as Sound is impermanent or Sound is uncreated, both [the property to be proved and the reason] are understood without doubt.

original: hetuviruddhānaikāntikapratītiś ca na syāt /
analyzed: hetu viruddha anaikāntika pratītiḥ ca na syāt
translated: And there would be no understanding of a contradictory reason or an inconclusive reason.

original: pratijñāpūrvake tu prayoge anityaḥ śabdaḥ /🔽kṛtakatvāt' iti hetubhāvaḥ pratīyate /
analyzed: pratijñā pūrvake tu prayoge anityaḥ śabdaḥ  kṛtaka tvāt iti hetu bhāvaḥ pratīyate
translated: But in a syllogism preceded by a proposition, the state of being a reason is understood as in Sound is impermanent.🔽Because it is created.

original: nityaḥ /🔽kṛtakatvāt' iti viruddhatā /
analyzed: nityaḥ  kṛtaka tvāt iti viruddha tā
translated: [If the reason is stated as] Because it is created, it is eternal, [it is contradictory].

original: prayatnānantarīyakaḥ kṛtakatvāt' ity anaikāntikatvam /
analyzed: prayatna ānantarīyakaḥ kṛtaka tvāt iti anaikāntika tvam
translated: [If the reason is stated as] Because it is created, it is an effect of a conscious effort, [it is inconclusive].

original: hetoś ca trairūpyaṃ na gamyate /
analyzed: hetoḥ ca trairūpyam na gamyate
translated: And the threefold nature of the reason is not understood.

original: tasya sādhyāpekṣayā vyavasthānāt /
analyzed: tasya sādhya apekṣayā vyavasthānāt
translated: Because it is determined in relation to what is to be proved.

original: sati pratijñāvacane avayave samudāyopacārāt sādhyadharmī pakṣa iti tatra S / / vṛttasya kṛtakatvasya pakṣadharmatvaṃ /
analyzed: sati pratijñā vacane avayave samudāya upacārāt sādhya dharmī pakṣaḥ iti tatra s vṛttasya kṛtaka tvasya pakṣa dharma tvam
translated: When there is a statement of the proposition, the subject is figuratively called the subject because of the figurative use of the whole for its parts. Thus, the property of being created, which occurs there [in the subject], is the property of the subject.

original: sādhyadharmasāmānyena
analyzed: sādhya dharma sāmānyena
translated: And an object that is the same as the general property to be proved

original: ca samāno 'rthaḥ sapakṣa iti tatra varttamānasya sapakṣe sattvam /
analyzed: ca samānaḥ rthaḥ sapakṣaḥ iti tatra varttamānasya sapakṣe sattvam
translated: is a similar instance. Thus, the presence [of the reason] in a similar instance is understood.

original: na sapakṣo 'sapakṣa iti sādhyadharmavirahiṇy avṛttasyāsapakṣe 'py asattvaṃ pratīyeta
analyzed: na sapakṣaḥ sapakṣaḥ iti sādhya dharma virahiṇi avṛttasya asapakṣe pi asattvam pratīyeta
translated: A dissimilar instance is that which lacks the property to be proved. Thus, the absence [of the reason] in a dissimilar instance is understood as that which does not occur in that [dissimilar instance].

original: ity āśaṅkyāha yadi pratītiḥ sādhyasya niścayalakṣaṇā sādharmyavat prayogādeś ca
analyzed: iti āśaṅkya āha yadi pratītiḥ sādhyasya niścaya lakṣaṇā sādharmya vat prayoga ādeḥ ca
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he says: If the cognition of the probandum is characterized by ascertainment, then the use of similarity and so on,

original: svarūpāvadhāraṇātmikā /🔽anyathā pratijñāvacanam antareṇa na syāt tadā yaduktaṃ sādhyasiddhyarthaṃ sādharmyavat
analyzed: anyathā pratijñā vacanam antareṇa na syāt tadā yat uktam sādhya siddhi artham sādharmya vat
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he says: If the cognition of the probandum is characterized by ascertainment, and is of the nature of the determination of its own form, from the use of the example with similarity,

original: prayogādijñānārthaṃ ca viṣayopadarśanam iti tat sarvaṃśobheta yāvatā svārthānumānakāle🔽pratijñāvacanam antareṇāpi pakṣadharmagrahaṇaT / /sambandhasmaraṇataḥ sādhyasiddhilakṣaṇā
analyzed: prayoga ādi jñāna artham ca viṣaya upadarśanam iti tat sarvam śobheta yāvatā svārtha anumāna kāle  pratijñā vacanam antareṇa api sādhya siddhi lakṣaṇā
translated: then otherwise, without the statement of the proposition, it would not be. Then what was said - for the sake of establishing the probandum, and for the sake of knowing the use of the example with similarity, etc., the indication of the object - all that would be splendid, since at the time of inferring for oneself,

original: bhavaty eva pratītiḥ ity ākhyātam eva /
analyzed: bhavati eva pratītiḥ iti ākhyātam eva
translated: even without the statement of the proposition, the cognition characterized by the establishment of the probandum occurs by the apprehension of the property of the subject and the recollection of the relation. This has already been stated.

original: tadvat parārthe 'py anumāne p / / bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tadvat para arthe pi anumāne p bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, it will be so in inference for the sake of others also.

original: yata evaṃ tasmāt eṣa pratijñāprayogavādī yadā svayaṃ sādhyaṃ pratyeti tadā
analyzed: yatas evam pratijñā prayoga vādī yadā svayam sādhyam pratyeti tadā
translated: Since it is so, therefore, when the proponent of the use of the proposition himself cognizes the probandum,

original: svayaṃ sādhyasya S / / pratītau viṣaya upasthāpyate yena pratijñāvacanadvāreṇa
analyzed: svayam sādhyasya pratītau viṣayaḥ upasthāpyate yena pratijñā vacana dvāreṇa
translated: in the cognition of the probandum by himself, the object is presented by some person through the statement of the proposition,

original: puṃsā kenacit tena vināpi
analyzed: puṃsā kenacid tena
translated: without that, even without the statement of the proposition,

original: pratiyan sādhyaṃ niścinvan liṅgasāmarthyād eva /
analyzed: sādhyam niścinvan liṅga sāmarthyāt eva
translated: cognizing the probandum, ascertaining it, by the power of the reason alone.

original: yadā 'smābhiḥ pratipādyate tadā asmān kāryiṇo dṛṣṭvāvyaktaṃpratijñāprayogalakṣaṇaṃ mūlyaṃmṛgayate /
analyzed: yadā smābhiḥ pratipādyate tadā asmān kāryiṇaḥ dṛṣṭvā avyaktam pratijñā prayoga lakṣaṇam mūlyam mṛgayate
translated: When we state it, then seeing us as the plaintiff, he demands a fee in the form of the statement of the proposition, which is not clear.

original: ka iva / parvabrāhmaṇa iva /
analyzed: kaḥ iva parvabrāhmaṇaḥ iva
translated: What is he like? Like a Brahmin on a festival day.

original: yathā dakṣiṇām antareṇāpy anyadā aurdvarathiko brāhmaṇo bhuñjāno 'nyadā śrāddhādiparvaṇy
analyzed: yathā dakṣiṇām antareṇa api anyadā aurdvarathikaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhuñjānaḥ nyadā śrāddha ādi parvaṇi
translated: Just as a Brahmin who lives on alms, even though he does not receive it at other times, on a festival day such as a Shraddha ceremony,

original: arthinaṃ śraddhāluṃ bravīti yadi me ghṛtapūraṃ ghṛtapūraṃ prati rūpakaṃ dadāsi
analyzed: arthinam śraddhālum bravīti yadi me ghṛta pūram ghṛta pūram prati rūpakam dadāsi
translated: he says to a supplicant who has faith, If you give me a gold coin for every spoonful of ghee,

original: tato 'haṃ bhuñje nānyatheti /
analyzed: tatas ham bhuñje na anyathā iti
translated: then I will eat, not otherwise.

original: tena tulyo bhavān apīti /
analyzed: tena tulyaḥ bhavān api iti
translated: You are also like him.

original: kiñca / yad api bravīṣi parārthānumānakāle yathā liṅgaṃ pareṇānabhidhīyamānaṃ na pratyeti pratipādyas tathā sādhyam apīti /
analyzed: kiñca yat api bravīṣi para artha anumāna kāle yathā liṅgam pareṇa anabhidhīyamānam na pratyeti pratipādyaḥ tathā sādhyam api iti
translated: Moreover, what you say, that at the time of inferring for another, just as the reason is not understood by the other unless stated, so too is the probandum,

original: tadaitad yujyate yady asau vādivacanamātreṇa liṅgam api niścitya tadanusāreṇa sādhyam avagacchet /
analyzed: tadā etat yujyate yadi asau vādi vacana mātreṇa liṅgam api niścitya tad anusāreṇa sādhyam avagacchet
translated: that is appropriate if he were to ascertain the reason merely by the speaker's statement and understand the probandum in accordance with that.

original: parapratītyarthinaś ca tadā vayam api pratijñāṃ kin na prayuñjmahe liṅgavacanarahitām / /
analyzed: para pratīti arthinaḥ ca tadā vayam api pratijñām kin na prayuñjmahe liṅga vacana rahitām
translated: And then, why do we not use a proposition alone, devoid of the statement of the reason, when we too are seeking to make the other understand?

original: S / / asmadvacanasyaiva taṃ prati pramāṇatayā /
analyzed: asmad vacanasya eva tam prati pramāṇa tayā
translated: Because our statement itself is the means of knowledge for him.

original: tata evānumeyapratīteḥ /
analyzed: tatas eva anumeya pratīteḥ
translated: Because the object to be inferred is cognized from that alone.

original: na caitad asti /🔽yataḥ asmadvacanād api na kevalaṃ svārthānumānakāle 'smadvacanam antareṇa ity api śabdaḥ /
analyzed: na ca etat asti  yatas asmad vacanāt api na kevalam svārtha anumāna kāle smad vacanam antareṇa iti api śabdaḥ
translated: And this is not the case.🔽Because even from our statement, not only at the time of inferring for oneself, but also without our statement. The word 'api' (also) is used.

original: kintu T / / yadāpy asmadvacanaṃ pravṛttaṃ tadāpi naiva asmadvacanāt liṅgam api pratyeti /
analyzed: kintu t yadā api asmad vacanam pravṛttam tadā api na eva asmad vacanāt liṅgam api pratyeti
translated: But even when our statement is in operation, then also he does not infer the reason even from our statement.

original: kuta eva sādhyasiddhaye 'nusariṣyati / /
analyzed: kutas eva sādhya siddhaye nusariṣyati
translated: How much less will he follow it for the sake of establishing the conclusion?

original: api tu svayam asya yadi talliṅgaṃ kutaścit pramāṇataḥ siddhaṃ bhavati asmadvacanena tu kevalaṃ tatra smṛtisamādhānamātra kriyate /
analyzed: api tu svayam asya yadi tat liṅgam kutaścid pramāṇataḥ siddham bhavati asmad vacanena tu kevalam tatra smṛti samādhānam ātra kriyate
translated: But if his reason is established by some means of knowledge, then by our statement only the recollection is arranged there.

original: tadā svayaṃ siddham eva liṅgam anusṛtya sādhyaṃ pratyeti /
analyzed: tadā svayam siddham eva liṅgam anusṛtya sādhyam pratyeti
translated: Then he infers the conclusion by following the reason which is established by himself.

original: nāsmadvacanāt
analyzed: na asmad vacanāt
translated: Not from our statement.

original: pānīyam api pibatīti /
analyzed: pānīyam api pibati iti
translated: He drinks water also.

original: tasmāt ko 'nayoḥ pratijñāvacanāvacanātmikayoḥ avasthayor viśeṣaḥ /
translated: Therefore, what is the difference between these two states, one with the statement of the proposition and one without?

original: ubhayatra svayaṃsiddhaliṅgasāmarthyād eva sādhyapratīter na kaścit /
analyzed: ubhayatra svayam siddha liṅga sāmarthyāt eva sādhya pratīteḥ na kaścid
translated: In both cases, the conclusion is cognized only by the power of the reason established by oneself, so there is no difference at all.

original: tataḥ svaparārthānumānayoḥ svayaṃsiddhaliṅgānusaraṇam /
analyzed: tatas sva para artha anumānayoḥ svayam siddha liṅga anusaraṇam
translated: Then, in the case of inference for oneself and for others, the logical mark is ascertained by oneself.

original: tataḥ sādhyapratītiṃ ca prati viśeṣābhāvāt pratijñopanyāsaḥ parārthānumāne 'pi vyartha S / / eva /
analyzed: tatas sādhya pratītim ca prati viśeṣa abhāvāt pratijñā upanyāsaḥ parārtha anumāne eva
translated: Then, since there is no difference in the cognition of the probandum, the statement of the proposition is also useless in inference for others.

original: liṅgam api hi tāvad atra nābhidhīyate yadi tat p / / pūrvaprasiddhaṃ svayam anusmaret kim aṅgaḥ sandigdhārthābhidhāyakaṃ pratijñāvacanam
analyzed: liṅgam api hi tāvat atra na abhidhīyate yadi tat pūrva prasiddham svayam anusmaret kim aṅgaḥ sandigdha artha abhidhāyakam pratijñā vacanam
translated: If the logical mark is not stated here, if one would remember it oneself as previously known, then why is the statement of the proposition, which expresses a doubtful meaning,

original: upādīyate / /
analyzed: upādīyate
translated: accepted?

original: syānmatam yadi nāma sādhyasiddhau pratijñāvacanasya nopayogas tadartho 'sya prayogo mā bhūt /
analyzed: syāt matam yadi nāma sādhya siddhau pratijñā vacanasya na upayogaḥ sya prayogaḥ mā bhūt
translated: It may be thought: If the statement of the proposition is of no use in establishing the probandum, let its employment for that purpose be abandoned.

original: sādharmyavat prayogādijñānārthaṃ tu tadupādānam avasthitam eva /
analyzed: sādharmya vat prayoga ādi jñāna artham tu tat upādānam avasthitam eva
translated: But its acceptance is established for the purpose of knowing the employment based on similarity and so on.

original: tasyānyathā pratīty abhāvāt ity ata āha dṛṣṭāca sādharmyavat prayogādeḥpratijñāvacanam antareṇāpi pratītiḥ /
analyzed: tasya anyathā pratīti abhāvāt iti atas āha sādharmya vat prayoga ādeḥ pratijñā vacanam antareṇa api pratītiḥ
translated: Because it is not apprehended otherwise. To this he says: The apprehension of the employment based on similarity and so on is seen even without the statement of the proposition.

original: tatas tadartho 'pi pratijñopanyāso na śobhate /
analyzed: tatas pratijñā upanyāsaḥ na śobhate
translated: Therefore, the statement of the proposition for that purpose also does not shine.

original: kutaḥ punaḥ sādharmyavat prayogāder asati sādhyanirdeśe pratītiḥ /
analyzed: kutas punar sādharmya vat prayoga ādeḥ asati sādhya nirdeśe pratītiḥ
translated: But how is the apprehension of the employment based on similarity and so on possible in the absence of the statement of the probandum?

original: T / / ity āha pakṣadharmasambandhavacanamātrād iti /
analyzed: t iti āha pakṣa dharma sambandha vacana mātrāt iti
translated: He says, merely by stating the property of the subject and the relation.

original: evaṃ manyate naiva hi kaścit yat kṛtakaṃ tad anityam' etāvan mātram abhidhāyā ''ste /
analyzed: evam manyate na eva hi kaścid yat kṛtakam tat anityam etāvat mātram abhidhāyāḥ āste
translated: He thinks: No one indeed remains after stating only this much, 'Whatever is produced is non-eternal.'

original: sādhananyūnatayaivāsya parājayāt /
analyzed: sādhana nyūna tayā eva asya parājayāt
translated: Because he is defeated by the mere deficiency of the proof.

original: kintv avaśyaṃ hetor ddharmiṇy upasaṃhāraṃ karotīti /
analyzed: kintu avaśyam hetoḥ upasaṃhāram karoti iti
translated: But he must necessarily apply the reason to the subject.

original: tatra yadi kṛtakaś ca śabdaḥ' iti brūyāt tadā S / / sādhydha🔽rmyavat prayogapratītiḥ /
analyzed: tatra yadi kṛtakaḥ ca śabdaḥ iti brūyāt tadā  rmya vat prayoga pratītiḥ
translated: If he were to say, 'And sound is produced,' then it would be a valid argument with the property of the subject.

original: atha nityaś ca' ity abhidadhyāt tadā vaidharmyavata iti sambandhavacanapūrvakāt pakṣadharmavacanāt prayogadvayāvagatiḥ /
analyzed: atha nityaḥ ca iti abhidadhyāt tadā vaidharmyavataḥ iti sambandha vacana pūrvakāt pakṣa dharma vacanāt prayoga dvaya avagatiḥ
translated: If he were to state, 'And it is eternal,' then it would be a valid argument with the contrary property. The understanding of the two types of arguments comes from the statement of the property of the subject preceded by the statement of the relation.

original: hetuviruddhānaikāntikā api pakṣadharmavacanamātreṇa na pratīyante /
analyzed: hetu viruddha anaikāntikāḥ api pakṣa dharma vacana mātreṇa na pratīyante
translated: Even contradictory and inconclusive reasons are not understood merely by the statement of the property of the subject.

original: yadā tu sambandhavacanam api kriyate tadā katham apratītiḥ / /
analyzed: yadā tu sambandha vacanam api kriyate tadā katham apratītiḥ
translated: But when the statement of the relation is also made, how can there be no understanding?

original: tathā hi yat kṛtakaṃ tad anityam' iti pakṣadharmavacane saty ukte hetur avagamyate /
analyzed: tathā hi yat kṛtakam tat anityam iti pakṣa dharma vacane sati ukte hetuḥ avagamyate
translated: For example, when the statement of the property of the subject is made, 'Whatever is produced is non-eternal,' the reason is understood.

original: vidhīyamānenānūdyamānasya vyāptaḥ /
analyzed: vidhīyamānena anūdyamānasya vyāptaḥ
translated: The pervaded is referred to by what is being enjoined.

original: yat kṛtakaṃ tan nityam' ity abhidhāne viruddhaḥ /
analyzed: yat kṛtakam tat nityam iti abhidhāne viruddhaḥ
translated: In the statement, 'What is produced is eternal,' there is contradiction.

original: viparyayavyāpteḥ /
analyzed: viparyaya vyāpteḥ
translated: Because of the pervasion by the opposite.

original: yat kṛtakaṃ tat prayatnānantarīyakam' iti pradarśane vyabhicārād anaikāntikādhyavasāyaḥ /
analyzed: yat kṛtakam tat prayatna ānantarīyakam iti pradarśane vyabhicārāt anaikāntika adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: In the demonstration, 'What is produced is invariably subsequent to effort,' there is the ascertainment of the inconclusive due to the fallacy of accident.

original: trairūpyam api hetor gamyata eva /🔽yato vyāptipradarśanakāle vyāpako dharmaḥ sādhyatayā 'vagamyate /
analyzed: trairūpyam api hetoḥ gamyate eva  yatas vyāpti pradarśana kāle vyāpakaḥ dharmaḥ sādhya tayā avagamyate
translated: The threefold nature of the reason is also understood.🔽Because when the pervasion is demonstrated, the pervading property is understood as the probandum.

original: yatra ca vyāpyo dharmo dharmiṇy upasaṃhriyate sa vyāpakadharmaviśiṣṭatayā 'vagamyamānaḥ sādhyasamudāyaikadeśatayā pakṣa ity upasaṃhṛtasya vyāpyadharmasya
analyzed: yatra ca vyāpyaḥ dharmaḥ dharmiṇi upasaṃhriyate sa vyāpaka dharma viśiṣṭa tayā avagamyamānaḥ sādhya samudāya eka deśa tayā pakṣaḥ iti upasaṃhṛtasya vyāpya dharmasya
translated: And where the pervaded property is applied to the subject, it is understood as qualified by the pervading property, and as a part of the totality of the probandum, it is the subject. The pervaded property that is applied

original: S / / sā ca vyāptir yatra dharmiṇy upadarśyate sa sādhyadharmasāmānyena samāno 'rthaḥ sapakṣaḥ pratīyata iti sapakṣe p / / sattvam
analyzed: sā ca vyāptiḥ yatra dharmiṇī upadarśyate sa sādhya dharma sāmānyena samānaḥ rthaḥ sapakṣaḥ pratīyate iti sapakṣe sattvam
translated: And that pervasion is demonstrated on the subject, that object which is similar to the general probandum is understood to be the similar instance. Thus, the presence in the similar instance

original: sāmarthyāc ca T / / vyāpakanivṛttau vyāpyanivṛttir yatrāvasīyate so 'sapakṣa ity asapakṣe 'py asatvattva
analyzed: sāmarthyāt ca t vyāpaka nivṛttau vyāpya nivṛttiḥ yatra avasīyate saḥ sapakṣaḥ iti a sapakṣe pi
translated: And by implication, where the cessation of the pervaded is ascertained upon the cessation of the pervader, that is the dissimilar instance. Thus, the absence in the dissimilar instance

original: m api niścīyata iti /
analyzed: api niścīyate iti
translated: is also ascertained.

original: yadi pakṣādibhir api jñātaiḥ kiñcit prayojanaṃ /
analyzed: yadi pakṣa ādibhiḥ api jñātaiḥ kiñcid prayojanam
translated: If there is some purpose in knowing the thesis etc. as well,

original: na tu vyavahartaṇāṃ pakṣādisaṅketāpekṣā parokṣārthagatir bhavati /
analyzed: na tu vyavahartaṇām pakṣa ādi saṅketa apekṣā parokṣa artha gatiḥ bhavati
translated: but the cognition of a hidden object does not depend on the convention regarding the thesis etc. of the disputants.

original: tathā hi yat kvacit dṛṣṭaṃ tasya yatra pratibandhaḥ tadvidas tasya tad gamakaṃ tatra iti hi loke vastugatir bhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi yat kvacid dṛṣṭam tasya yatra pratibandhaḥ tad vidaḥ tasya tat gamakam tatra iti hi loke vastu gatiḥ bhavati
translated: For in this way, in the world, the cognition of an object occurs thus: That which is seen somewhere, if it is related to something else, then for one who knows that, that is the indicator of that there.

original: na pakṣādisaṅketagrahaṇāpekṣā /🔽tatra yatheṣṭaṃśāstrakārāgamakarūpapratipattaye svasaṅketenānyathā
analyzed: na pakṣa ādi saṅketa grahaṇa apekṣā  tatra yathā iṣṭam śāstra kāra āgamaka rūpa pratipattaye sva saṅketena anyathā
translated: It does not depend on grasping the convention regarding the thesis etc.

original: vā lakṣaṇaṃ praṇayantu /
analyzed: vā lakṣaṇam praṇayantu
translated: There, in order to understand the form of the indicator as desired by the authors of the treatise, they may formulate the definition in their own convention or otherwise.

original: na tu vyavahārakāle tadanusaraṇaṃ kvacid upayujyate /
analyzed: na tu vyavahāra kāle tad anusaraṇam kvacid upayujyate
translated: But at the time of usage, following that is not useful anywhere.

original: tatsaṅketapratipāditam eva tu yathoktaṃ gamakaṃ rūpam upayogi vyavahartṛṛṇām /
analyzed: tad saṅketa pratipāditam eva tu yathā uktam gamakam rūpam upayogi vyavahartṛṛṇām
translated: But for the disputants, only the form of the indicator as presented by that convention is useful.

original: tac cet pratipannaṃ tāvataiva sādhyasiddhiḥ sañjātā iti pakṣasapakṣādisaṅketāparijñāne 'pi S / / na kiñcit plūyate /
analyzed: tat ced pratipannam tāvatā eva sādhya siddhiḥ sañjātā iti pakṣa sapakṣa ādi saṅketa aparijñāne pi s na kiñcid plūyate
translated: And if that is understood, then by that alone the establishment of the probandum has occurred. So even if the convention regarding the thesis, similar instance etc. is not known, nothing is lost.

original: ata evācāryapādair nnāntarīyakāryadarśanaṃ tadvido 'numānam' iti gamakarūpamātram eva pakṣādisaṅketānapekṣaṃ pratipāditam /
analyzed: atas eva ācārya pādaiḥ tad vidaḥ numānam iti gamaka rūpa mātram eva pakṣa ādi saṅketa anapekṣam pratipāditam
translated: For this very reason, the venerable teacher (Dharmakīrti) has taught that inference is merely the form of a probans which is invariably concomitant with the probandum, and which is independent of the convention (of the pakṣa, etc.).

original: svaprajñāparādhāstuttu
analyzed: sva prajñāparādhāḥ tu tu
translated: But the faults are due to one's own lack of wisdom.

original: tatrāpi kaiścid asanta eva doṣāḥ prakīrtyanta iti kim atra brūmaḥ / /
analyzed: tatra api kaiścid asantaḥ eva doṣāḥ prakīrtyante iti kim atra brūmaḥ
translated: And even there, some proclaim faults that do not exist. What can we say about that?

original: tasmāt sādharmyavat prayogādijñānārtham api pratijñāvacanaṃ pakṣadharmasambandhavacanamātra
analyzed: tasmāt sādharmya vat prayoga ādi jñāna artham api pratijñā vacanam pakṣa dharma sambandha vacana mātra
translated: Therefore, even for the purpose of knowing the employment, etc. of the argument based on similarity, the statement of the proposition, which is merely a statement of the property of the subject and the relation,

original: T / / eva yathoktena prakāreṇa pratīter ayuktam iti kas tasya pratijñāvacanasya
analyzed: t eva yathā uktena prakāreṇa pratīteḥ ayuktam iti kaḥ tasya pratijñā vacanasya
translated: is not appropriate, because it is understood in the manner stated. What then is the use of that statement of the proposition?

original: upayogaḥ naiva kaścit /
analyzed: upayogaḥ na eva kaścid
translated: It is not anything at all.

original: svayaṃ cāyaṃ vādī yena krameṇānumeyaṃ pratipannavāms tamullaṅghya parapratipattaye kramāntaram āśrayan paravañcakatayā dhūrtta eva pratīyate /
analyzed: svayam ca ayam vādī yena krameṇa anumeyam pratipannavām tam ullaṅghya para pratipattaye krama antaram āśrayan para vañcaka tayā dhūrttaḥ eva pratīyate
translated: And this proponent, transgressing the sequence by which he himself has understood the inferable object, and resorting to a different sequence for the understanding of others, is perceived as a deceiver of others, and thus

original: na saddhṛtta ity upadarśayann āha svaniścayavat ityādi /
analyzed: na sat hṛttas iti upadarśayan āha sva niścayavat ityādi
translated: is not a true proponent. Demonstrating this, he says like his own ascertainment, etc.

original: yathā ''tmano niścayasyotpādanaṃ kṛtaṃ tathaiva anyeśām api niścayotpādāda
analyzed: yathā tmanaḥ niścayasya utpādanam kṛtam tathā eva anya īśām api
translated: Just as he has produced his own ascertainment, in the same way, he should produce the ascertainment of others also, by stating the three-featured probans.

original: nāya ca parahitanirataiḥ sādhanam ucyate /
analyzed: ca para hita nirataiḥ ucyate
translated: And this is not said to be the means of accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: tatra etasmiṃsmin
analyzed: etasmin smin
translated: In this matter,

original: nyāye sati svayam ayaṃ vādī prameyasyopadarśanena upadarśakena vacanena vinā'pi svārthānumānakāle
analyzed: nyāye sati svayam ayam vādī prameyasya upadarśanena upadarśakena vacanena vinā api sva artha anumāna kāle
translated: when this principle is present, this proponent, even without a statement that shows the object to be known, at the time of his own inferential knowledge,

original: pratipadya prameyaṃ paraṃ saṃśayitādikaṃ pratipādayan svapratipannaṃ prameyam avabodhayan
analyzed: pratipadya prameyam param saṃśayita ādikam pratipādayan sva pratipannam prameyam avabodhayan
translated: having understood the object to be known, makes others, such as those in doubt, understand the object to be known that he himself has understood,

original: apūrvaṃ svapratipattikāle pūrvaṃ S / / yaḥ prameyapratipattau kramaḥ upāyo 'nubhūtas
analyzed: apūrvam sva pratipatti kāle pūrvam yaḥ prameya pratipattau kramaḥ upāyaḥ nubhūtaḥ
translated: and he resorts to a different sequence in making others understand the object to be known, which was previously experienced at the time of his own understanding.

original: tasmād anyam āśrayata iti kim atra kramāntarāśrayeṇa kāraṇam /
analyzed: tasmāt anyam āśrayate iti kim atra krama antara āśrayeṇa kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason for resorting to a different sequence in this case?

original: naiva kiñcit paravyāmohanaṃ muktvā /
analyzed: na eva kiñcid para vyāmohanam muktvā
translated: There is no reason at all, except to deceive others.

original: tathā hi yadi svapratipattikramaḥ p / pratītinibandhanaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi yadi sva pratipatti kramaḥ pratīti nibandhanam
translated: This is because if the sequence of one's own understanding is the basis for understanding,

original: kiṃ tatparityāgena kramāntarāśrayaṇam /
analyzed: kim tad parityāgena krama antara āśrayaṇam
translated: why resort to a different sequence by abandoning that?

original: kathaṃ tena svayaṃ pratipannavānasīti / /
analyzed: katham tena svayam pratipannavān asi iti
translated: How can one say You yourself have understood it in that way?

original: yata evaṃ tasmān na prameyasya sādhyasya vacanena pratijñākhyena kiñcit prayojanam /
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt na prameyasya sādhyasya vacanena pratijñā ākhyena kiñcid prayojanam
translated: Since this is so, therefore there is no purpose at all in the statement called the thesis for the object to be known, which is to be established.

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

original: anyathāpi' T / / vinā 'pi tena pratipatteḥ sādhyapratīteḥ utpatter ity upasaṃhāraḥ /
analyzed: anyathā api t vinā pi tena pratipatteḥ sādhya pratīteḥ utpatteḥ iti upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: The conclusion is: even without that, i.e., even without the probans, there is the arising, i.e., the cognition of the probandum.

original: vyavasthāpayiṣyati T /
analyzed: vyavasthāpayiṣyati t
translated: He will establish it.

original: liṅga
analyzed: liṅga
translated: Probans

original: upanayanigamanāder api sādhanavākyānaṅgatvam /🔽evaṃ pratijñāṃ sādhanavākyād apanīyāparam apy upanayanigamanādikaṃ paraparikalpitaṃ🔽sādhanavākyād apanetum uktam eva nyāyam atidiśann āha etena anyathā 'pi pratipatter
analyzed: evam pratijñām sādhana vākyāt apanīya aparam api upanaya nigamana ādikam para parikalpitam  sādhana vākyāt apanetum uktam eva nyāyam atidiśan āha etena anyathā pi pratipatteḥ
translated: The application and conclusion are also not parts of the proof statement.

original: utpatteḥ' iti nyāyena upanayanigamanādikaṃ ādigrahaṇāt saṃśayajijñāsādikaṃ pratyuktaṃ pratyākhyātam /
analyzed: utpatteḥ iti nyāyena upanaya nigamana ādikam ādi grahaṇāt saṃśaya jijñāsā ādikam pratyuktam pratyākhyātam
translated: Having thus removed the thesis from the proof statement, he states the same reasoning to remove the other things imagined by others, such as the application, conclusion, etc., by extending it. He says: By this reasoning, even without that, there is the arising of the cognition of the probandum, the application, conclusion, etc., and the doubt, inquiry, etc., indicated by the word etc., are refuted, i.e., rejected.

original: S / / tatra udāharaṇāpekṣaḥtathā' ity upasaṃhāro na tathe'ti vāsādhyasyopanayaḥ NSū / / /🔽pratijñāyāḥpunarvacanaṃnigamanam NSū / / ity anayor lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: tatra udāharaṇa apekṣaḥ tathā iti upasaṃhāraḥ na tathā iti vā asādhyasya upanayaḥ  iti anayoḥ lakṣaṇam
translated: There, the application is the statement of the probandum in the form it is thus or it is not thus. The conclusion is the restatement of the thesis.🔽The definition of these two is: The application is the statement of the probandum. The conclusion is the restatement of the thesis.

original: sādhyanirddeśaḥpratijñā NSū / / iti tu pratijñāyāḥ /
analyzed: sādhya nirddeśaḥ pratijñā iti tu pratijñāyāḥ
translated: The definition of the thesis is: The statement of what is to be established is the thesis.

original: etenety etad eva darśayati etāv ataiva pakṣadharmasambandhavacanamātraiva upanayādirahitena sādhyapratīteḥbhāvāt utpatter iti /🔽atrodyoddyo
analyzed: etena iti etat eva darśayati etau pakṣa dharma sambandha vacana mātrā eva upanaya ādi rahitena sādhya pratīteḥ bhāvāt utpatteḥ iti  atra udya uddyaḥ
translated: By this he shows just that: by the mere statement of the property of the subject and the relation, the conclusion is understood, because of the existence of the origination, as stated by 'from that'.

original: takaraḥprāha pratijñā tāvad viṣayanirddeśārtham avaśyakarttavyā /
analyzed: takaraḥ prāha pratijñā tāvat viṣaya nirddeśa artham avaśya karttavyā
translated: Here, Uddyotakara says: The thesis should first of all be necessarily stated for the purpose of indicating the subject.

original: yato lokaḥ prathamaṃ karma cchedyādikaṃ nirūpayati /
analyzed: yatas lokaḥ prathamam karma chedya ādikam nirūpayati
translated: Because people first determine the action to be performed, such as cutting, etc.

original: tataḥ kuṭhārādikaṃ sādhanaṃ vyāpārayati /
analyzed: tatas kuṭhāra ādikam sādhanam vyāpārayati
translated: Then they employ the means, such as the axe, etc.

original: upanayenāpi yāvad dṛṣṭānte dṛṣṭasāmarthyo hetur ddharmiṇi nopasaṃhriyate tāvat kutaḥ sādhyapratītiḥ / /
analyzed: upanayena api yāvat dṛṣṭānte dṛṣṭa sāmarthyaḥ hetuḥ dharmiṇi na upasaṃhriyate tāvat kutas sādhya pratītiḥ
translated: And until the reason whose capacity has been observed in the example is applied to the subject by the application, how can the conclusion be understood?

original: svārthānumānadṛṣṭaś ca pratyavamarśapratyayārtho 'nena darśyate /
analyzed: svārtha anumāna dṛṣṭaḥ ca pratyavamarśa pratyaya arthaḥ nena darśyate
translated: And the meaning of the reflective cognition, which is seen in one's own inference, is shown by this.

original: tathā hi svārthānumāne prathamaṃ pradeśe dhūmaṃ paśyati /🔽tato yatra yatrāhaṃ dhūmamadrākṣaṃ tatra tatrāgnim api' iti vyāptiṃ T / / smarati /
analyzed: tathā hi svārtha anumāne prathamam pradeśe dhūmam paśyati  tatas yatra yatra aham dhūmam adrākṣam tatra tatra agnim api iti vyāptim t smarati
translated: For thus, in one's own inference, one first sees smoke in a place.🔽Then one remembers the pervasion: 'Wherever I have seen smoke, there I have also seen fire.'

original: tato dhūmaś cātra' iti punaḥ pratyavamṛśati /
analyzed: tatas dhūmaḥ ca atra iti punar pratyavamṛśati
translated: Then one reflects again: 'And there is smoke here.'

original: sa pratyavamarśārthaḥ parārthānumāne upanayenocyate /
analyzed: sa pratyavamarśa arthaḥ para artha anumāne upanayena ucyate
translated: That which has the meaning of reflection is stated by the conclusion in inference for the sake of others.

original: S / / nigamanam apy avaśyābhidhānīyam /
analyzed: nigamanam api avaśya abhidhānīyam
translated: The summary is also necessarily to be stated.

original: yato yady api pūrvaṃ anityaḥ śabda ity uktam /
analyzed: yatas yadi api pūrvam anityaḥ śabdaḥ iti uktam
translated: For although it was previously stated that sound is impermanent,

original: na tu tāvatā 'sya niścayo jātaḥ /🔽samprati tu pramāṇabalāyāto 'rthaḥ tatsampratyayārtham anena nigamyate /
analyzed: na tu tāvatā sya niścayaḥ jātaḥ  samprati tu pramāṇa bala āyātaḥ rthaḥ tad sampratyaya artham anena nigamyate
translated: the ascertainment of that has not yet arisen by that alone.🔽But now the meaning that has come by the force of the means of knowledge is summarized by this for the purpose of producing the ascertainment of that.

original: aśeṣapramāṇavyāpāraś cānenopasaṃhriyate /
analyzed: aśeṣa pramāṇa vyāpāraḥ ca anena upasaṃhriyate
translated: And the activity of all the means of knowledge is concluded by this.

original: tathā hi āgamaḥ pratijñā /
analyzed: tathā hi āgamaḥ pratijñā
translated: For thus, the scripture is the thesis.

original: hetur anumānaṃ /
analyzed: hetuḥ anumānam
translated: The reason is inference.

original: p / / dṛṣṭāntaḥ pratyakṣam upamānam upanayaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāntaḥ pratyakṣam upamānam upanayaḥ
translated: The example is perception, analogy, and the conclusion.

original: tadetasya pramāṇacatuṣṭayasyāpi vyāpāro nigamanenopasaṃhriyate iti katham asya na sāphalyam /🔽ity etad āśaṅkyāha ḍiṇḍikarāgaṃparityajya ḍiṇḍikāḥ nagnācāryāḥte niṣphalam upary
analyzed: tat etasya pramāṇa catuṣṭayasya api vyāpāraḥ nigamanena upasaṃhriyate iti katham asya na sāphalyam  iti etat āśaṅkya āha ḍiṇḍika rāgam parityajya ḍiṇḍikāḥ nagna ācāryāḥ te niṣphalam upari
translated: And the activity of this entire set of four means of knowledge is concluded by the summary. So how can it not be fruitful?

original: upari nāmalekhane prasaktāḥ tatas teṣām iva pareṇokte tasyopari mayā 'vaśyam ayuktatayā
analyzed: upari nāma lekhane prasaktāḥ tatas teṣām iva pareṇa ukte tasya upari mayā vaśyam ayukta tayā
translated: Fearing this, he says: Abandoning the passion for the scroll, the scroll-addicts are naked teachers who are attached to writing more and more names on top of each other. Then, like them, what is necessarily stated by me on top of what is stated by another as being illogical,

original: niṣphalam apy abhidhānīyam' ity asthānābhiniveśaṃ tyaktvā akṣiṇīnimīlya bahirvikṣepam🔽upasaṃhṛtya cintaya tāvat kim iyatā pakṣadharmasambandhavacanamātrakeṇa
analyzed: niṣphalam api abhidhānīyam iti asthāna abhiniveśam tyaktvā akṣiṇī nimīlya bahis vikṣepam  upasaṃhṛtya tāvat iyatā pakṣa dharma sambandha vacana mātrakeṇa
translated: Having abandoned attachment to non-existent things, having closed the eyes, having withdrawn external distractions,🔽and having withdrawn, think for a moment whether the probandum would be understood by a statement that merely expresses the property of the subject and the relation,

original: vākyena sādhyasya pratītiḥsyāt na vā / iti /
analyzed: vākyena sādhyasya pratītiḥ syāt na vā iti
translated: or not.

original: yāvatā yāvān eva S / / parārthānumāne 'rtho 'bhidhānīya ity asmābhir anujñāyate tāvān evānyūnānatiriktaḥ svārthānumāne 'pi pratītihetur
analyzed: yāvatā yāvān eva parārtha anumāne rthaḥ bhidhānīyaḥ iti asmābhiḥ anujñāyate tāvān eva anyūna anatiriktaḥ svārtha anumāne pi pratīti hetuḥ
translated: For as much as we allow that in an inference for others as much of the meaning as is to be stated should be stated, just that much, neither less nor more, is the cause of understanding even in an inference for oneself.

original: tasya ka iha śakter vyāghāt /
analyzed: tasya kaḥ iha śakteḥ vyāghāt
translated: What contradiction of ability is there for it here?

original: yenāsau parārthānumāne 'pi pratītiṃ na kuryāt /🔽bhāve pratīteḥ kiṃprapañcamālayā
analyzed: yena asau para artha anumāne pi pratītim na kuryāt  bhāve pratīteḥ kiṃprapañca mālayā
translated: By which it would not bring about understanding even in an inference for others.🔽What is the use of a garland of verbosity

original: pratijñopanayanigamanalakṣaṇayā T / / /🔽tathā hi ḥ pratijñopanayanigamanaprayoge 'pi yadi pramāṇaniścitā svasādhyavyāptiḥ sādhanadharmasya na syāt /
analyzed: pratijñā upanaya nigamana lakṣaṇayā t  tathā hi pratijñā upanaya nigamana prayoge yadi pramāṇa niścitā sva sādhya vyāptiḥ sādhana dharmasya na syāt
translated: in the form of proposition, application, and conclusion, when the thing is understood?

original: sādhyadharmiṇi vā sadbhāvas tadā 'syanaiva pratītihetutā /
translated: For thus, even in the application of proposition, application, and conclusion, if the property to be proven of the reason would not be ascertained by a means of knowledge, or if its existence would not be in the subject to be proven, then it would not be the cause of understanding in that case.

original: tatsambhavetu pratijñādyabhāve 'pi svārthānumāna iva gamakarūpāvaikalyāt sāna nivāryata iti kim asthānanirbandhena iti / /
analyzed: pratijñā ādi abhāve pi sva artha anumāne iva gamaka rūpa avaikalyāt nivāryate iti kim asthāna nirbandhena iti
translated: But if it is possible, then even in the absence of the thesis etc., like in one's own inference, it is not to be prevented due to the completeness of the form of the probans. So what is the point of insisting on what is not the case?

original: na hi sādhyadharmākṣepaṇasāmarthyavirahe sādhanadharmasya vādivacanamātrāt sādhyaniścayo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na hi sādhya dharma ākṣepaṇa sāmarthya virahe sādhana dharmasya vādi vacana mātrāt sādhya niścayaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: For when there is an absence of the capacity to project the property to be proved, it is not proper to ascertain the probandum merely from the speaker's statement of the property to be proved.

original: hetūpanyāsavaiyarthyaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: hetu upanyāsa vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the absurdity of the futility of stating the reason.

original: tasya tadākṣepasāmarthye vā pratijñāvacanasyeti/
analyzed: tasya tad ākṣepa sāmarthye vā
translated: Or if that has the capacity to project it, then of the statement of the thesis.

original: yat tūktam viṣayapradarśanāya pratijñā' ity atraśāstrakṛtaiva dattam uttaram /🔽yaś ca sādhanaṃ prayuṃkte tena aham anena S / / sādhanenāmuṣmiṃṣmin
analyzed: yat tu uktam viṣaya pradarśanāya pratijñā iti atra śāstra kṛtā eva dattam uttaram  yaḥ ca sādhanam prayuṃkte tena aham anena sādhanena amuṣmin
translated: And as for what was said - The thesis is for the purpose of presenting the subject matter - the author of the treatise himself has given the answer to that.

original: sādhye pratītiṃ sādhayiṣyāmi' iti karma nirūpyaiva tatprayuktam iti na laukikanyāyātikramaḥ /
analyzed: sādhye pratītim sādhayiṣyāmi iti karma nirūpya eva iti na laukika nyāya atikramaḥ
translated: And one who employs the proof, by him the action is determined only after having determined I shall bring about the understanding of this in that to be proved by this proof, so there is no transgression of worldly logic.

original: anyathā yadi sādhanād yasya sādhyapratītir upajāyate tenaiva karma nirūpaṇīyam kathaṃ tadabhāve svārthānumāne T / / sādhyasiddhiḥ p /
analyzed: anyathā yadi sādhanāt yasya sādhya pratītiḥ upajāyate tena eva karma nirūpaṇīyam katham tad abhāve svārtha anumāne sādhya siddhiḥ
translated: Otherwise, if the understanding of the probandum arises from the proof for someone, then by him alone the action is to be determined. How then, in the absence of that, is the establishment of the probandum in one's own inference?

original: sādhananibandhanā syāt / /
analyzed: sādhana nibandhanā syāt
translated: It would be dependent on the proof.

original: yaś cāgnidhūmayoḥ sambandhaṃ cetasi vyavasthāpya kvāgniḥ kvāgniḥ /🔽' ity agniṃ sa pradeśe dhūmadarśanamātrādevāgniṃ pratipadyata iti kathaṃ svārthānumāne pratyavamarśapratyayaḥ syāt / /
analyzed: yaḥ ca agni dhūmayoḥ sambandham cetasi vyavasthāpya kva agniḥ kva agniḥ  iti agnim paryeṣate sa pradeśe pratipadyate iti katham svārtha anumāne pratyavamarśa pratyayaḥ syāt
translated: And when one, having established in his mind the relation between fire and smoke, infers fire from the mere perception of smoke in a place where there is smoke, thinking 'where there is smoke, there is fire', how could there be a reflective awareness of the object in inference for oneself?

original: atha kadācid asau dṛṣṭas tatretiparārthe 'py asyopādānaṃ tadā dadhyādikam api bhuktvā kadācid dhūmād agniṃ pratipannavān iti kin na dadhibhojanāder
analyzed: atha kadācid asau dṛṣṭaḥ pi asya upādānam tadā dadhi ādikam api bhuktvā kadācid dhūmāt agnim pratipannavān iti kin na dadhi bhojana ādeḥ
translated: If it is argued that it is mentioned in inference for others because it was seen there at some time, then it should also be mentioned in inference for others that one has inferred fire from smoke after having eaten curd and so on at some time.

original: api kādācit kasyopādānam / /
analyzed: api kādācid kasya upādānam
translated: Why is the occasional mention of curd and so on not accepted?

original: yat punaruktam āgamaḥ pratijñā' iti /🔽tatra yadi vādivacanam evāgamas tadā tata eva sādhyasiddher hetvādyupādānam anarthakam /
analyzed: yat punar uktam āgamaḥ pratijñā iti  tatra yadi vādi vacanam eva āgamaḥ tadā tatas eva sādhya siddheḥ hetu ādi upādānam anarthakam
translated: As for what was said that the scripture is the thesis,🔽if the scripture is just the statement of the proponent, then since the conclusion is established from that alone, the statement of the reason and so on is pointless.

original: atha pratijñārthasyāgame pāṭhād āgamaḥ pratijñā /
analyzed: atha pratijñā arthasya āgame pāṭhāt āgamaḥ pratijñā
translated: If the scripture is the thesis because the meaning of the thesis is stated in the scripture,

original: tadā na kvacid āgame paṭhyate atra pradeśe 'gnir iti S / / katham āgamatvaṃ pratijñāyāḥ / /
analyzed: tadā na kvacid āgame paṭhyate atra pradeśe gniḥ iti s katham āgama tvam pratijñāyāḥ
translated: then since it is not stated anywhere in the scripture that there is fire in this place, how can the thesis be a scripture?

original: hetur anumānam' ity apy ayuktam /
analyzed: hetuḥ anumānam iti api ayuktam
translated: It is also incorrect to say that inference is the reason.

original: na hi pakṣadharmatvamātraṃ hetuḥ /
analyzed: na hi pakṣa dharma tva mātram hetuḥ
translated: For the reason is not merely the property of the subject.

original: tasya trirūpatvāt /
analyzed: tasya tri rūpa tvāt
translated: Because it has three aspects.

original: dṛṣṭānto 'pi na sarvaḥ pratyakṣa iti kathaṃ dṛṣṭāntaḥ pratyakṣam' bhavet / /
analyzed: na sarvaḥ pratyakṣaḥ iti katham dṛṣṭāntaḥ pratyakṣam bhavet
translated: And since not all examples are perceptible, how can an example be perceptible?

original: upamānaṃ tu pramāṇam eva na bhavati /
analyzed: upamānam tu pramāṇam eva na bhavati
translated: But comparison is not a means of valid knowledge at all.

original: kathaṃ tadvyāpāra upasaṃhriyeta nigamanena / /
analyzed: katham tad vyāpāraḥ upasaṃhriyeta nigamanena
translated: How can its operation be included by a conclusion?

original: yadi cāvaśyaṃ dṛṣṭānte dṛṣṭasāmarthyo hetur ddharmiṇy upaneyaḥ tadopanaya evāstu kiṃ kṛtakatvāṭ' iti pakṣadharmanirddeśena /
analyzed: yadi ca avaśyam dṛṣṭānte dṛṣṭa sāmarthyaḥ hetuḥ ddharmiṇi upaneyaḥ tadā upanayaḥ eva astu kim iti pakṣa dharma nirddeśena
translated: And if the reason whose efficacy has been seen in the example must necessarily be applied to the subject, then let there just be the application. What is the use of stating the property of the subject with because it is produced?

original: sa eva dṛṣṭasāmarthyaṃ hetum upasaṃhariṣyati pakṣadharmatāṃ ca darśayiṣyatīti na kiñcit tena /
analyzed: saḥ eva dṛṣṭa sāmarthyam hetum upasaṃhariṣyati pakṣa dharma tām ca darśayiṣyati iti na kiñcid tena
translated: That [application] alone will include the reason whose efficacy has been seen and will show the property of the subject. So there is no point in [stating the property of the subject separately].

original: tato yatra ca pratijñāyāḥ prathamata eva prayogo neṣyate tatra tasyāḥ punarvacanaṃ kuto nigamanaṃ bhaviṣyati / /
analyzed: tatas yatra ca pratijñāyāḥ prathamatas eva prayogaḥ na iṣyate tatra tasyāḥ punarvacanam kutas nigamanam bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, where the statement of the proposition is not accepted even at the beginning, how can its repetition there be a conclusion?

original: ity āha iti tasmād iyān eva pakṣadharmasambhandhavacanamātrātmakaḥ T / / sādhanavākye prayogo jyāyān na pañcāvayavātmaka iti sthitam
analyzed: iti āha iti tasmāt iyān eva pakṣa dharma sambhandha vacana mātra ātmakaḥ sādhana vākye prayogaḥ jyāyān na pañca avayava ātmakaḥ iti sthitam
translated: Thus, it is said: Therefore, this much alone - consisting of the mere statement of the property of the subject and the relation - is the best use in a proof statement. It is not five-membered. This is established.

original: pratijñādi
analyzed: pratijñā ādi
translated: proposition, etc.

original: hetoḥ
analyzed: hetoḥ
translated: of the reason

original: vyāptyādisambhave🔽pratī tihetutā
translated: when there is pervasion, etc.🔽the status of a reason for the opponent

original: upanyāsavaiyarthyaprasaṅgāt
analyzed: upanyāsa vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the uselessness of the statement.

original: sādhanam🔽ṣate sadhūmapradeśadarśana T /
analyzed: sādhanam  sa dhūma pradeśa darśana t
translated: The proof🔽When there is the perception of a place with smoke.

original: svārthānumāne
analyzed: svārtha anumāne
translated: In an inference for oneself

original: nyāyavākye hetudṛṣṭāntavacanayoḥ kramasyāniyamaḥ /
translated: In a logical statement, there is no fixed order for the statement of the reason and example.

original: atra sādhanavākye na kevalaṃ pratijñādiprayogo na yuktaḥ paropagataḥ S / / pūrvaṃ hetuḥ prayoktavyaḥ paścād dṛṣṭāntaḥ' iti kramaniyamo 🔽'pi na kaścit /
analyzed: atra sādhana vākye na kevalam pratijñā ādi prayogaḥ na yuktaḥ para upagataḥ pūrvam hetuḥ prayoktavyaḥ paścāt dṛṣṭāntaḥ iti  pi na kaścid
translated: Here, in the statement of the proof, not only is the use of the thesis, etc. not proper, but also the fixed order of The reason should be stated first, then the example is not proper.

original: kutaḥ / sarvathā yadi pūrvaṃ hetuḥ paścād vyāptiḥ atha pūrvaṃ vyāptiḥ paścāt pakṣadharmaḥ prayujyate /
analyzed: kutas sarvathā yadi pūrvam hetuḥ paścāt vyāptiḥ atha pūrvam vyāptiḥ paścāt pakṣa dharmaḥ prayujyate
translated: What is the reason? If the reason is stated first and then the pervasion, or if the pervasion is stated first and then the property of the subject,

original: tathāpi gamakatvāt /
analyzed: tathā api gamaka tvāt
translated: then also it is indicative.

original: p / / / hetos tridhāprayogasya khaṇḍinam /
translated: The opponent's view is refuted by the threefold statement of the reason.

original: nanu tasya dvidhā prayoga ity ayuktam uktam /🔽yatas trividho hetuḥ anvayī vyatirekī anvayavyatirekī cetinaiyāyikāḥ /
analyzed: nanu tasya dvidhā prayogaḥ iti ayuktam uktam  yatas trividhaḥ hetuḥ anvayī vyatirekī anvaya vyatirekī ca iti naiyāyikāḥ
translated: But it is said that it is not proper to say that its statement is twofold,🔽because the Naiyāyikas say that there are three kinds of reasons: positive, negative, and positive-negative.

original: tatas tasya tridhā prayogaḥ sādharmyeṇa vaidharmyeṇa sādharmyavaidharmyābhyāṃ
analyzed: tatas tasya tridhā prayogaḥ sādharmyeṇa vaidharmyeṇa sādharmya vaidharmyābhyām
translated: Therefore, its statement is threefold: by similarity, by dissimilarity, and by both similarity and dissimilarity.

original: ceti vaktavyam ity ata āha sambandhavacane 'pi na kevalaṃ kramaniyamo na yuktaḥ
analyzed: ca iti vaktavyam iti atas āha sambandha vacane na kevalam krama niyamaḥ na yuktaḥ
translated: It should be said and so on. Therefore, he says: Even in the statement of the relation, not only is the restriction of sequence not appropriate,

original: kintu artha bhedo 'pi na kaścid ubhayatrāpi trirūpasadbhāvāt /
analyzed: kintu na kaścid ubhayatra api tri rūpa sadbhāvāt
translated: but also no difference in meaning is possible, because in both cases the three characteristics are present.

original: tataḥ sarva eva hetur anvayavyatirekī /
analyzed: tatas sarvaḥ eva hetuḥ anvaya vyatirekī
translated: Therefore, all reasons are affirmative and negative.

original: na tv anvayī vyatirekī vā kaścid dhetur astīti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tu anvayī vyatirekī vā kaścid hetuḥ asti iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The point is that there is no reason that is only affirmative or only negative.

original: tat kutas traividhyaṃ prayogasya syāt /
analyzed: tat kutas traividhyam prayogasya syāt
translated: So how could there be a threefold division of the syllogism?

original: iti manyate /
analyzed: iti manyate
translated: This is what is thought.

original: kutaḥ punararthabhedo nāstīti /🔽cet / āha ubhayathā sādharmyeṇa vaidharmyeṇa ca prayoge yady api vidhipratiṣedharūpatayā
analyzed: kutas punar artha bhedaḥ na asti iti  ced āha ubhayathā sādharmyeṇa vaidharmyeṇa ca prayoge yadi api vidhi pratiṣedha rūpa tayā
translated: If it is asked How is there no difference in meaning?,🔽he says: Even though in the employment of similarity and dissimilarity, the difference of properties is understood in the form of affirmation and negation,

original: dharmabhedaḥ T / / pratīyate tathāpi tadbhāvasyaiva sādhanadharmasya sādhyasvabhāvatāyāḥ
analyzed: dharma bhedaḥ pratīyate tathā api tad bhāvasya eva sādhana dharmasya sādhya svabhāva tāyāḥ
translated: nevertheless, the mere existence of the property to be established, which is the nature of the probandum,

original: eva sādharmyavaidharmyaprayogābhyāṃ khyāpanāt /🔽nanu sādharmyaprayoge hetubhāve S / / sādhyasya bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: eva sādharmya vaidharmya prayogābhyām khyāpanāt  nanu sādharmya prayoge hetu bhāve s sādhyasya bhāvaḥ
translated: is made known by both the employment of similarity and dissimilarity.🔽But in the employment of similarity, the existence of the probandum is understood from the reason,

original: vaidharmye ca sādhyābhāve hetvabhāvaḥ śabdād avagamyate /
analyzed: vaidharmye ca sādhya abhāve hetu abhāvaḥ śabdāt avagamyate
translated: and in dissimilarity, the non-existence of the reason is understood from the non-existence of the probandum.

original: na tādātmyam /
analyzed: na tādātmyam
translated: [But] not identity.

original: tat kim ucyate tadbhāvasyaiva khyāpanāt' /
analyzed: tat kim ucyate tad bhāvasya eva khyāpanāt
translated: What is said then? Because the existence of that [reason] is stated.

original: ity ata āha na hi ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha na hi ityādi
translated: To this he says For, if... and so on.

original: yadi sādharmyaprayoge tadbhāvo nākṣipyeta tadā sādhanasya atatsvabhāvasya bhāve kim iti ekāntena avaśyan tayā sādhyasya bhāvaḥ / /
analyzed: yadi sādharmya prayoge tad bhāvaḥ na ākṣipyeta tadā sādhanasya atatsvabhāvasya bhāve kim iti ekāntena avaśyan tayā sādhyasya bhāvaḥ
translated: If in the case of a reason based on similarity, that existence were not implied, then when the probandum exists, how is it that the probandum necessarily exists?

original: kādācit kas tu bhavatu nāma / /
analyzed: kādācid kaḥ tu bhavatu nāma
translated: Let it exist sometimes.

original: yat kṛtakaṃ tad anityam' ity ekāntabhāvaś ca hetau sati sādhyasya vyāptyā sādharmyaprayoge 'bhidhīyate /
analyzed: yat kṛtakam tat anityam iti ekānta bhāvaḥ ca hetau sati sādhyasya vyāptyā sādharmya prayoge bhidhīyate
translated: But when the reason exists, the invariable concomitance of the probandum is stated in the case of a reason based on similarity, as in What is produced is impermanent.

original: saca tādātmyam antareṇānarthāntarasya na sambhavatīti sāmarthyāt tadākṣipati /
analyzed: tādātmyam antareṇa anartha antarasya na sambhavati iti sāmarthyāt tat ākṣipati
translated: And that [invariable concomitance] is not possible without identity, so it implies that [identity] by implication.

original: katham ivātatsvabhāvasya bhāve na ekāntenānyabhāva iti āha kṛtakatvety ādi /
analyzed: katham iva a tad svabhāvasya bhāve na ekāntena anya bhāvaḥ iti āha kṛtaka tva iti ādi
translated: How is it that when something exists that is not of that nature, the existence of another is not invariably [of that nature]? He says If produced... and so on.

original: yadi prayatnānantarīyakatvām antareṇāpi kṛtakatvasya bhāvād atatsvabhāvatvam anityatve'py ayam eva vṛttāntaḥ /
analyzed: yadi antareṇa api kṛtaka tvasya bhāvāt atatsvabhāva tvam ayam eva vṛttāntaḥ
translated: If the existence of being produced were not due to being subsequent to effort, then the same would be the case for impermanence, as it is not of that nature.

original: tataś ca tādātmyavirahāt prayatnānantarīyakatvasyānityatvenānvayo na syāt /
analyzed: tatas ca tādātmya virahāt prayatna ānantarīyaka tvasya anitya tvena anvayaḥ na syāt
translated: And because of the absence of identity, the invariable concomitance of being subsequent to effort with impermanence would not be possible.

original: tannivṛttauvā nivṛttiriti kathaṃ tatastatS / / p / / pratīyate / /
analyzed: katham p pratīyate
translated: If that [fire] ceases, then [smoke] ceases. How is that [smoke] known to be from that [fire]?

original: naiṣa doṣaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: tatra ca tādātmyasadbhāvād anvayavyatirekāv anivāritau anityatvakṛtakatvamātrāpekṣayāT / / tu tādātmyaviraho 'syābhihitaiti
analyzed: tatra ca tādātmya sadbhāvāt anvaya vyatirekau anivāritau tu
translated: And there, because of the existence of identity, concomitance and non-concomitance are not excluded. But the absence of identity of this [smoke] is stated in relation to mere impermanence and being produced.

original: nanv agninivṛttāv atatsvabhāvasyāpi dhūmasya nivṛttir dṛṣṭā 'nvayaś cety āha kāryasya iti /
analyzed: nanu agni nivṛttau atatsvabhāvasya api dhūmasya nivṛttiḥ dṛṣṭā nvayaḥ ca iti āha kāryasya iti
translated: But it is seen that when fire ceases, smoke, which is not of the nature of that [fire], also ceases, and there is concomitance. Therefore, he says of the effect.

original: anvayavyatirekayor hi pratibandho nibandhanam /
analyzed: anvaya vyatirekayoḥ hi pratibandhaḥ nibandhanam
translated: For the relation of concomitance and non-concomitance is the basis.

original: tena tayoḥ vyāpteḥ /
analyzed: tena tayoḥ vyāpteḥ
translated: Therefore, they are pervasion.

original: tadabhāve tayor apy abhāvāt /
analyzed: tad abhāve tayoḥ api abhāvāt
translated: Because when that [relation] is absent, they [concomitance and non-concomitance] are also absent.

original: tatrārthāntarasya dhūmasyāgnau tadutpattilakṣaṇaḥpratibando 'nvayavyatirekanimittam astīti bhavetāṃ tau/
analyzed: tatra artha antarasya dhūmasya agnau tad utpatti lakṣaṇaḥ pratibandaḥ nvaya vyatireka nimittam asti iti bhavetām
translated: There, for smoke, which is different from the object [fire], the relation in the form of its arising from that [fire] is the cause of concomitance and non-concomitance. Therefore, they [concomitance and non-concomitance] exist.

original: yatra tv anarthāntarasya tāv ucyete tatrāvaśyaṃ tādātmyena bhavitavyam ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: yatra tu anartha antarasya tau ucyete tatra avaśyam tādātmyena bhavitavyam iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: But where they are stated for something that is not different from the object, there it is necessarily the case that they exist by identity. This is the idea.

original: atrodāharaṇam yathā anayor eva kṛtakatvaprayatnānantarīyakatvayor viparyayeṇa naikanivṛttāv
analyzed: atra udāharaṇam yathā anayoḥ eva kṛtaka tva prayatna ānantarīyaka tvayoḥ viparyayeṇa
translated: Here is an example: As in the case of these two, being produced and being subsequent to effort, when one ceases, the other does not cease.

original: anyanivṛttiḥ yat prayatnānantarīyakaṃ na bhavati S / / tat kṛtakam api
analyzed: yat prayatna ānantarīyakam na bhavati s tat kṛtakam api
translated: The exclusion of another is of the form: 'What is not invariably concomitant with effort is not produced,

original: na bhavati' ity evaṃrūpā /
analyzed: na bhavati iti evaṃrūpā
translated: and what is produced is not non-existent.'

original: yata evaṃ tasmād anvayavyatirekayor yathālakṣaṇaṃ hetubhāve sādhyasyāvaśyaṃ bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt anvaya vyatirekayoḥ yathā lakṣaṇam hetu bhāve sādhyasya avaśyam bhāvaḥ
translated: Since it is so, therefore, in the relation of concomitance and non-concomitance, as defined, the presence of the probandum is necessarily in the presence of the probans,

original: sādhyābhāve ca hetor avaśyam abhāvaḥ ity eko 'pi sādharmyamukheṇa vaidharmyamukheṇa vā prayukto dvitīyam ākṣipati /
analyzed: sādhya abhāve ca hetoḥ avaśyam abhāvaḥ iti sādharmya mukheṇa vaidharmya mukheṇa vā prayuktaḥ dvitīyam ākṣipati
translated: and the absence of the probans is necessarily in the absence of the probandum. Thus, even one employed by way of similarity or dissimilarity implies the other.

original: tasmād ubhayatra trairūpyapratīter
analyzed: tasmāt ubhayatra trairūpya pratīteḥ
translated: Therefore, since the three aspects are understood in both cases,

original: ekasya śabdebda
analyzed: ekasya
translated: one is expressed by the word,

original: to 'parasyārthata iti sambandhavacane 'pi prayoga eva vidhimukhena pratiṣedhamukhena vā bhidyate nārtha iti siddhiṃ tatas tasya dvidhā prayogaḥ
analyzed: parasya arthataḥ iti sambandha vacane pi prayogaḥ eva vidhi mukhena pratiṣedha mukhena vā bhidyate na arthaḥ iti siddhim tatas tasya dvidhā prayogaḥ
translated: and the other is understood by the meaning. Thus, even when the relation is stated, the employment is divided into affirmation and negation, but not the meaning. Therefore, its employment is twofold:

original: sādharmyeṇa vaidharmyeṇa ca /
analyzed: sādharmyeṇa vaidharmyeṇa ca
translated: by way of similarity and by way of dissimilarity.

original: na tu sādharmyavaidharmyābhyām api /
analyzed: na tu sādharmya vaidharmyābhyām api
translated: But not by both similarity and dissimilarity.

original: tadarthasyānyatareṇaiva T / / prakāśanāt /
analyzed: tad arthasya anyatareṇa eva t prakāśanāt
translated: Because its meaning is illuminated by either one.

original: sarvo hetur anvayavyatireky eva vastuto na kaścid anvayī vyatirekī vā nāmety etad
analyzed: sarvaḥ hetuḥ anvaya vyatirekī eva vastutas na kaścid anvayī vyatirekī vā nāma iti etat
translated: In reality, all reasons are both concomitant and counter-concomitant. There is no such thing as a reason that is only concomitant or only counter-concomitant.

original: upasaṃharann āha iti naikatrānvayamukhena vyatirekamukheṇa S / / vā sādhanavākye
analyzed: upasaṃharan āha iti na ekatra anvaya mukhena vyatireka mukhena vā sādhana vākye
translated: Concluding, he says: Thus, in a single proof statement, the employment of both concomitance and non-concomitance is not directly by the method of positive and negative concomitance.

original: dvayor anvayavyatirekayoḥ prayogaḥ sākṣāc chabdena pratipādanam iṣyate /
analyzed: dvayoḥ anvaya vyatirekayoḥ prayogaḥ sākṣāt śabdena pratipādanam iṣyate
translated: The employment, i.e., the direct teaching by words, of both concomitance and non-concomitance is not desired in a single proof statement.

original: vaiyarthyāt pratītapratyāyane prayojanābhāvāt /
analyzed: vaiyarthyāt pratīta pratyāyane prayojana abhāvāt
translated: Because it is useless. There is no purpose in teaching what is already known.

original: p / / tām evārthato 'parasya pratītiṃ sphuṭayann āha tatsvabhāvatayā ityādi /
analyzed: tām parasya pratītim sphuṭayan āha tad svabhāva tayā ityādi
translated: To make that meaning clear, he says by that nature and so on.

original: yadi tatsvabhāvatayā sādhyena hetor anvayaḥ sidhyati tata eva tadabhāve 'bhāvo 'pi sidhyaty eva /
analyzed: yadi tad svabhāva tayā sādhyena hetoḥ anvayaḥ sidhyati tatas eva tad abhāve bhāvaḥ sidhyati eva
translated: If the concomitance of the reason with the probandum is established by its nature, then the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum is also established by that alone.

original: tatsvabhāvasya tadabhāve svayaṃ nairātmyena bhāvāyogāt /🔽tathā tatsvabhāvatayā sādhyābhāve sādhanasyābhāvasiddhau ca satyāṃ tata eva sādhyena hetoḥ anvayasyāpi siddher iti /
analyzed: tad svabhāvasya tad abhāve svayam nairātmyena bhāva ayogāt  tathā tad svabhāva tayā sādhya abhāve satyām tatas eva sādhyena hetoḥ anvayasya api siddheḥ iti
translated: Because that which has that nature cannot exist without it, being essentially selfless.🔽And when the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum is established in that way, then the concomitance of the reason with the probandum is also established by that alone.

original: yais tu vyākhyāyate sādharmyavatiprayoge tadabhāva eva vipakṣe hetor abhāvakhyātir
analyzed: yaiḥ tu vyākhyāyate    tad abhāve eva vipakṣe hetoḥ abhāva khyātiḥ
translated: But those who explain it in this way: In a proof statement with similarity, the absence of the reason in the dissimilar instance is stated as

original: yathā syāt nānyatra vipakṣe viruddhe vā hetvabhāvaprasaṅgāt viruddhataeva vyavacchedaprasaṅāc
analyzed: yathā syāt na anyatra vipakṣe viruddhe vā hetu abhāva prasaṅgāt vyavaccheda prasaṅāt
translated: Because it would not be so in the case of a dissimilar instance or a contradictory [reason], since the absence of the reason would follow, and there would be the fault of contradiction itself.

original: ceti niyamakhyāpanārtho vyatirekaprayogaḥ iti /
analyzed: ca iti niyama khyāpana arthaḥ vyatireka prayogaḥ iti
translated: The negative formulation is for the purpose of showing the restriction.

original: sa tadartho 'py ayuktaḥ /
analyzed: sa tad arthaḥ pi a yuktaḥ
translated: That purpose of it is also improper.

original: kutaḥ / anyaviruddhayor api na kevalaṃ tadabhāvasya vipakṣatvāt yasya hi anya eva vipakṣo 'nyadharmayogī vā 'nyo /
analyzed: kutas anya viruddhayoḥ api na kevalam tad abhāvasya vipakṣa tvāt yasya hi anyaḥ eva vipakṣaḥ nyadharma yogī vā
translated: Why? Because the dissimilar instance is of the absence of that, not only of the other and the contradictory. For that which has a dissimilar instance that is connected with another property, or is different,

original: na vivakṣitadharmānāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: na
translated: is not the basis of the intended property.

original: S / / viruddha eva vā sahānavasthānalakṣaṇenaivaT / / virodhena /
analyzed: viruddhaḥ eva vā virodhena
translated: Or it is contradictory itself, by the very contradiction of non-coexistence,

original: na parasparaparihārasthitalakṣaṇatayāpi vipakṣaḥ tasyānityatvād anyānātmādidharmavatiarthe /
analyzed: na paraspara parihāra sthita lakṣaṇa tayā api vipakṣaḥ tasya anitya tvāt
translated: and is not a dissimilar instance by the characteristic of being mutually exclusive, even in a thing that has the property of impermanence, non-self, etc., other than that.

original: kṛtakatvādivṛtteḥ /
analyzed: kṛtaka tva ādi vṛtteḥ
translated: Because [the reason] operates in what is produced, etc.

original: hetvabhāvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: hetu abhāva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: There would be the fault of the absence of the reason.🔽And if heat is to be proved, the reason characterized by fire would not be excluded from the contradictory heat alone, but also from non-hot and cold, because of the fault of the absence of the reason following.

original: auṣṇye ca sādhye'gnilakṣaṇasya hetor viruddhād eva śītāt nānuṣṇaśītād apy anyato vyavacchedaprasaṅgāt naikāntenauṣṇyam agnir grasayed
analyzed: auṣṇye ca hetoḥ viruddhāt eva śītāt na anuṣṇa śītāt api anyatas vyavaccheda prasaṅgāt na ekāntena auṣṇyam agniḥ grasayet
translated: Fire would not completely include heat,

original: iti tasyāyaṃ doṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: iti tasya ayam doṣaḥ syāt
translated: if this were its fault.

original: taṃ pratyācāryeṇoktam yady ekasyavipakṣatvam iṣyate tadā tadabhāvasyaiveṣyatām /
analyzed: tam yadi iṣyate tadā
translated: To him, the teacher has said: If the absence of one [property] is accepted as the counter-instance, then let the absence of that [property] alone be accepted.

original: na viruddhasya anyasya vā /
analyzed: na viruddhasya anyasya vā
translated: Not of a contradictory [property] or any other [property].

original: tasyānyatrāpivivakṣitadharmānāśraye viruddhe ca bhāvāt /
analyzed: viruddhe ca bhāvāt
translated: Because that [absence] exists even in other [properties] not based on the property to be proved, and in contradictory [properties].

original: na tv asmākaṃtrividham api vipakṣam icchatām /
analyzed: na tu api vipakṣam
translated: But for us, who accept the counter-instance in all three ways,

original: vivakṣitadharmānāśrayaṃ cā 'nyam iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: vivakṣita dharma anāśrayam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: and also another [property] not based on the property to be proved, this is the idea.

original: ekāntabhāvaḥ
analyzed: ekānta bhāvaḥ
translated: Absolute existence

original: prayatnānantarīyakatvam antareṇāpi anityatvasya bhāvāt
translated: Because impermanence exists even without being subsequent to effort,

original: sādhya🔽hetoḥ
analyzed: sādhya  hetoḥ
translated: probandum🔽of the reason

original: hetoḥ
analyzed: hetoḥ
translated: of the reason

original: sādhyam
analyzed: sādhyam
translated: probandum

original: na tu samagrapadārthasvabhāvasya
analyzed: na tu samagra padārtha svabhāvasya
translated: but not of the nature of the complete set of terms

original: prayatnānantarīyakatvena
analyzed: prayatna ānantarīyaka tvena
translated: by being subsequent to effort

original: prayatnānantarīyakaḥ śabdaḥ /
analyzed: prayatna ānantarīyakaḥ śabdaḥ
translated: sound is subsequent to effort.

original: kṛtakatvāt anityatvāc ca
analyzed: kṛtaka tvāt anitya tvāt ca
translated: because it is produced and because it is impermanent

original: prayatnānanta🔽anvayavyati
analyzed: prayatna ananta  anvaya vyati
translated: subsequent to effort🔽positive and negative concomitance

original: prayatna
analyzed: prayatna
translated: effort

original: hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: reason

original: rūpāvyatireka /
analyzed: rūpa avyatireka
translated: non-difference in form.

original: pratibandhasya
analyzed: pratibandhasya
translated: of the relation

original: anvayena vyatirekeṇa vā
analyzed: anvayena vyatirekeṇa vā
translated: by positive or negative concomitance

original: vaidharmye tu tadabhāve 'bhāvasya pratītatvān na śaṅkā
analyzed: vaidharmye tu tad abhāve bhāvasya pratīta tvāt na śaṅkā
translated: but in the case of negative concomitance, since the absence is cognized in the absence [of the reason], there is no doubt

original: r eva sakāśād vyāvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: R eva sakāśāt vyāvṛttiḥ
translated: exclusion is from that very [reason].

original: anityatvaṃ
translated: impermanence

original: śītavahnivat
analyzed: śīta vahni vat
translated: like cold and fire

original: niravayavatvādi
translated: indivisibility, etc.

original: uṣṇo 'yaṃ padārthaḥ / agnitvāt
analyzed: uṣṇaḥ yam padārthaḥ agni tvāt
translated: This thing is hot. Because it is fire.

original: dignāgena
analyzed: dignāgena
translated: By Dignāga

original: sādhyābhāve tadabhāvānyaviruddhalakṣaṇāt tritayān madhyād ekasya
analyzed: sādhya abhāve tad abhāva anya viruddha lakṣaṇāt tritayāt madhyāt ekasya
translated: Out of the three [types of reasons], which are the absence of the probandum, the absence of the reason in the dissimilar instances, and the presence of the reason in the similar instances,

original: sādhyābhāve sādhanābhāvasya
analyzed: sādhya abhāve sādhana abhāvasya
translated: The absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum

original: tadabhāvasya
analyzed: tad abhāvasya
translated: The absence of that [probandum]

original: sādhyābhāvam
analyzed: sādhya abhāvam
translated: The absence of the probandum

original: anya / viru
analyzed: anya viru
translated: Other, contradictory

original: doṣaḥ
analyzed: doṣaḥ
translated: Fault

original: yaś ca yujyate etanmadhyāt sa grahīṣyate
analyzed: yaḥ ca yujyate etad madhyāt sa grahīṣyate
translated: And which is appropriate among these, that will be accepted

original: sattvasya kṣaṇikatvasvabhāvatāyāḥ samarthanam /🔽yadi svabhāvahetāv anvayavyatirekayoḥ sādhanadharmasya sādhyasvabhāvatā nibandhanam
analyzed: yadi svabhāva hetau anvaya vyatirekayoḥ sādhana dharmasya sādhya svabhāva tā nibandhanam
translated: The proof of the nature of existence as momentary.🔽If in the reason based on nature, the establishment of the presence and absence of the reason is based on the property to be proven having the nature of the probandum,

original: ity anvayena vyatirekeṇa vā sādharmyavaidharmyavatoḥ p / / prayogayor abhidhīyamānena
analyzed: iti anvayena vyatirekeṇa vā sādharmya vaidharmyavatoḥ p prayogayoḥ abhidhīyamānena
translated: then when the presence and absence [of the reason] are stated by the statement

original: tādātmyākṣepadvāreṇārthād itarākṣepa ucyate /
analyzed: tādātmya ākṣepa dvāreṇa arthāt itara ākṣepaḥ ucyate
translated: through the door of the implication of identity, the implication of the other is stated by implication.

original: tadā pramāṇasiddhaiva tatsvabhāvatā tayor nibandhanaṃ S / / na śabdamātrataḥ pratīyamānety abhiprāyavān āha idamityādi
analyzed: tadā pramāṇa siddhā eva tad svabhāva tā tayoḥ nibandhanam na śabda mātrataḥ pratīyamānā iti abhiprāyavān āha  /
translated: Then the nature of those two, which is established by valid cognition, is the basis for them, not merely being understood from words. With this intention, he says this and so on.

original: yeneti sato naśvarasvabhāvatvena /
analyzed: yena iti sataḥ naśvara svabhāva tvena
translated: By which means by the nature of destruction of what exists.

original: satvattvalakṣaṇasya hetoḥ kṣaṇikatvasvabhāvatveneti yāvat /
analyzed: satvattva lakṣaṇasya hetoḥ kṣaṇikatva svabhāva tvena iti yāvat
translated: The reason characterized by existence has the nature of momentariness, that is, it is said to be the nature of momentariness.

original: pṛcchataś cāyam abhiprāyaḥ iha T / / dvividhāḥ santaḥ kṛtakāś ca ghaṭādayaḥ akṛtakāś cākāśādayaḥ /
analyzed: pṛcchataḥ ca ayam abhiprāyaḥ iha t dvividhāḥ santaḥ kṛtakāḥ ca ghaṭa ādayaḥ akṛtakāḥ ca ākāśa ādayaḥ
translated: And this is the intention of the questioner: Here, existent things are of two kinds: created, such as pots, etc., and uncreated, such as space, etc.

original: tatra ye tāvad akṛtakās te sadakāraṇavat nityam VaiSū / / / iti nityalakṣaṇayogād anityā eva na bhavanti kuta eva kṣaṇikāḥ /
analyzed: tatra ye tāvat akṛtakāḥ te sat akāraṇavat nityam iti nitya lakṣaṇa yogāt anityāḥ eva na bhavanti kutas eva kṣaṇikāḥ
translated: Of those, first, those that are uncreated, like the eternal self, etc., are eternal because they are not produced from causes. Thus, because they possess the characteristic of the eternal, they are not non-eternal at all, much less momentary.

original: iti na satvattva
analyzed: iti na sa tva tva
translated: Thus, existence

original: sya kṣaṇikatvasvabhāvatā /
analyzed: sya kṣaṇika tva svabhāva tā
translated: does not have the nature of momentariness.
