original: ye 'pi santaḥ kṛtakās teṣām api mudgarādyanvayavyatirekānuvidhāyitayā vināśasya sahetukatvāt taddhetvasannidhāv
analyzed: ye pi santaḥ kṛtakāḥ teṣām api mudgara ādi anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyi tayā vināśasya sa hetuka tvāt tad hetu asannidhau
translated: Even those existent things that are created, their destruction follows the presence and absence of a hammer, etc., because it has a cause. In the absence of that cause,

original: vināśāt kṛtakātmano 'pi satvattva
analyzed: vināśāt kṛtaka ātmanaḥ pi satvat tva
translated: because of destruction, even the created self

original: sya kṣaṇikatvasvabhāvatā na samasty eveti nānvayavyatirekayoḥ sambhava iti /
analyzed: sya kṣaṇika tva svabhāva tā na samasti evā iti na anvaya vyatirekayoḥ sambhavaḥ iti
translated: does not have the nature of momentariness. Thus there is no possibility of positive and negative concomitance.

original: avaśyaṃ ca vināśo daṇḍādyanvayavyatirekānuvidhāyī /
analyzed: avaśyam ca vināśaḥ daṇḍa ādi anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyī
translated: And destruction must follow the presence and absence of a stick, etc.

original: dṛṣṭatvāt / tathā hi
analyzed: dṛṣṭa tvāt tathā hi
translated: Because it is seen. For thus:

original: vināsaṃsarggitāṃyāti na vināśo ghaṭādibhiḥ// S / /
analyzed: vinā saṃsarggi tām yāti na vināśaḥ ghaṭa ādibhiḥ
translated: Destruction does not come into contact with destruction through pots, etc.

original: anyatrāpicānvayavyatirekānuvidhānam eva hetumattāvyavahāranibandhanam abhyupeyatesaugatair api /
analyzed: eva hetumat tā vyavahāra nibandhanam abhyupeyate saugataiḥ api
translated: And elsewhere also, the mere fact of conformity with the presence and absence (of the probans) is admitted to be the basis of the notion of probans.

original: tad ihāpyastīti kin na tadvyavahāraḥ pravarttyate / iti /
analyzed: tat kim na tad vyavahāraḥ pravarttyate iti
translated: So, why should not that notion be applied here also?

original: nanu cānvayaniścayaṃ pratipādayatā bādhakapramāṇavṛttivaśāt tatsvabhāvatā pūrvam eva pratipāditā anvayaniścayo 'pi svabhāvahetau' ityādi vicanāt
analyzed: nanu ca anvaya niścayam pratipādayatā bādhaka pramāṇa vṛtti vaśāt tad svabhāva tā pūrvam eva pratipāditā svabhāva hetau ityādi
translated: But it has been shown by the statement that the ascertainment of concomitance is itself the probans, that the ascertainment of concomitance is itself the probans, as has been stated in the words The ascertainment of concomitance is also the probans in the case of essential property.

original: tat kuto 'sya pūrvapakṣasyāvasaraḥ / /🔽satyam / kintupūrvācāryaiḥkṛtakatvasya kṣaṇikatāyāṃ sādhyāyāṃ paraiḥ kṛtakānām ante
analyzed: tat kutas sya pūrvapakṣasya avasaraḥ  satyam kintu pūrva ācāryaiḥ kṛtaka tvasya kṣaṇika tāyām sādhyāyām paraiḥ kṛtakānām ante
translated: So, how can there be an occasion for this prima facie view?🔽True, but the earlier teachers, when the probandum was momentariness, stated that the probandum was momentariness, the opponents accepted that the destruction of what is produced must be due to a cause at the end.

original: 'vaśyaṃ hetunibandhanavināśopagamāt taddhetvayogapratipādanenānapekṣā vināśaṃ prati🔽viparyaye bādhakaṃ pramāṇaṃ tādātmyaprasādhakam uktaṃ tat prasaṅgamukhenakṛtakalakṣaṇasyaiva
analyzed: vaśyam hetu nibandhana vināśa upagamāt tad hetu ayoga pratipādanena anapekṣā vināśam prati  viparyaye bādhakam pramāṇam tādātmya prasādhakam uktam tat
translated: Therefore, by showing the impossibility of that cause, they stated that destruction is independent.

original: sattvasya tadātmatāmgamayati nānyasya T / / iti darśayitum /
analyzed: sattvasya na anyasya t iti darśayitum
translated: The proof that refutes the contrary establishes identity. That, by way of reductio ad absurdum, shows that the existence characterized by being produced is itself the nature of that, not of anything else.

original: arthakriyāvirodhalakṣaṇaṃtu sarvasya sattvasya iti vastumātreṇap / / prāg uktam api vipañcayituṃ pūrvapakṣopanyāsaḥ /
analyzed: sarvasya sattvasya iti prāk uktam api vipañcayitum pūrvapakṣa upanyāsaḥ
translated: Although stated before, the statement of the prima facie view is to elaborate.

original: akṛtakalakṣaṇaṃ tu sattvaṃ na sambhavaty eva /
analyzed: akṛtaka lakṣaṇam tu sattvam na sambhavati eva
translated: But the characteristic of being produced does not exist at all.

original: niyāmakaṃ hetum antareṇa deśakālasvabhāvaniyamāyogāt /
analyzed: niyāmakam hetum antareṇa deśa kāla svabhāva niyama ayogāt
translated: Because without a determining cause, restriction by place, time, and nature is not possible.

original: tataḥpūrvācāryair na S / / tasyaikāṅgavaikalyād eva sadakāraṇavat nityam VaiSū / / / iti nityatāsambhava
analyzed: tatas pūrva ācāryaiḥ tasya eka aṅga vaikalyāt eva sat akāraṇavat nityam iti
translated: Therefore, the earlier teachers did not consider it. Because of the deficiency of one part, like an eternal thing without a cause, it is not possible to be eternal.

original: iti na tadātmatāṃprati yatnaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: iti na yatnaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Thus, no effort was made to establish its nature.

original: śāstrakāras tu sāmānyenasattvasya kṣaṇikasvabhāvatāṃ /
analyzed: śāstra kāraḥ tu kṣaṇika svabhāva tām
translated: But the author of the treatise, in general, will establish the momentary nature of existence,

original: kṛtakalakṣaṇasya api ca /
analyzed: kṛtaka lakṣaṇasya api ca
translated: And even of what has the characteristic of being produced,

original: deśakālasvabhāvaviprakṛṣṭasyāpi vastusthityaiva tadātmatām arthakriyāvirodhena /
analyzed: deśa kāla svabhāva viprakṛṣṭasya api vastu sthityā eva tad ātmatām artha kriyā virodhena
translated: By the contradiction of effective action, the nature of being that [momentary] by the very existence of things, even though distant in place, time, and nature.

original: na paropagatāvaśyam bhāvivināśasyāhetukatayā viśeṣābhāvāt utpannamātrasyābhāvaprasaṅgenapratipādayiṣyati /🔽paraḥ
analyzed: na para upagata avaśyam bhāvi vināśasya ahetuka tayā viśeṣa abhāvāt  paraḥ
translated: Because of the absence of distinction by the inevitable destruction accepted by the other, being without a cause, he will demonstrate by the consequence of the non-existence of what is just produced.🔽The other

original: eva
analyzed: eva
translated: himself

original: aṅkurādau
analyzed: aṅkura ādau
translated: in the case of a sprout, etc.

original: vināśe
analyzed: vināśe
translated: in destruction

original: āpatti
analyzed: āpatti
translated: to be accepted

original: kṣaṇika🔽pramāṇam
analyzed: kṣaṇika  pramāṇam
translated: momentary🔽means of valid cognition

original: sāmānyena
analyzed: sāmānyena
translated: in general

original: kṣaṇikatva
analyzed: kṣaṇika tva
translated: momentariness

original: kṛtakā 'kṛtakaviśeṣaviraheṇa
analyzed: kṛtakā kṛtaka viśeṣa viraheṇa
translated: Because of the absence of a distinction between the produced and the unproduced,

original: vināśasya
analyzed: vināśasya
translated: of destruction,

original: sahetukaṃ vināśaṃ nirasituṃ tasya bhāvasvabhāvatāyāḥ samālocanam /
translated: in order to refute the production of destruction with a cause, he examines the nature of the existence of that [destruction].

original: tatrapūrvācāryoktaṃ sarvasya sataḥ kṛtakasyāvaśyamante hetukṛto vināśa iti' yaḥ parair iṣyate taṃ pratyanapekṣatvaṃ kyāpayitum upakramate
analyzed: tatra pūrva ācārya uktam sarvasya sataḥ kṛtakasya avaśyam ante hetu kṛtaḥ vināśaḥ iti yaḥ paraiḥ iṣyate tam prati anapekṣa tvam kyāpayitum upakramate
translated: There, in response to the statement by the earlier teachers that all existing produced things must necessarily be destroyed in the end by a cause, he begins to refute the independence of that [destruction] in response to those who assert it,

original: vināśahetvayogād iti /
analyzed: vināśa hetu ayogāt iti
translated: saying because of the impossibility of a cause for destruction.

original: yadi tarhi nāśasya hetur nāsti /
analyzed: yadi tarhi nāśasya hetuḥ na asti
translated: If, then, there is no cause for destruction,

original: sa teṣāṃ kṛtakānāṃ satām avaśyam bhāvī vināśaḥ kutaḥ / /
analyzed: sa teṣām kṛtakānām satām avaśyam bhāvī vināśaḥ kutas
translated: how can that destruction of those existing produced things be inevitable?

original: na hy ākasmikaḥ kaścit svabhāvo yukta ity āha svabhāvata eva /
analyzed: na hi ākasmikaḥ kaścid svabhāvaḥ yuktaḥ iti āha svabhāvataḥ eva
translated: For it is not proper that any nature be accidental. Therefore he says by its own nature.

original: bhavaty asmāt kāryam iti bhāvaśabdo hetuvacanaḥ /🔽tena svahetubhya eva naśvarāḥ naśanaśīlāḥ /
analyzed: bhavati asmāt kāryam iti bhāva śabdaḥ hetu vacanaḥ  tena sva hetubhyaḥ eva naśvarāḥ naśana śīlāḥ
translated: The word bhāva [in the compound svabhāvabhāva] means cause, [meaning] an effect arises from this.🔽Therefore, things that are perishable, that have the nature of perishing, are produced from their own causes.

original: sūcyagre sarṣapā ivānavasthāyinaḥ svātmani bhāvājāyante /
analyzed: sūci agre sarṣapāḥ iva anavasthāyinaḥ sva ātmani
translated: Like mustard seeds on the tip of a needle, they are not stable in their own nature.

original: naiṣāṃ kṛtakalakṣaṇānāṃ satāṃ bhāvānāṃ svahetubhyo niṣpannānāṃanyataḥ abhighātāder vināśotpattiḥ /
analyzed: kṛtaka lakṣaṇānām satām bhāvānām abhighāta ādeḥ vināśa utpattiḥ
translated: For those existing things that have the characteristic of being produced, that are accomplished from their own causes, there is no production of destruction from another, such as an impact.

original: kutaḥ / S / / T / / tasyābhighātāgnisaṃyogādes taddhetutayopagatasya asāmarthyāt /
analyzed: kutas t tasya abhighāta agni saṃyoga ādeḥ tad hetu tayā upagatasya asāmarthyāt
translated: Why? Because of the incapacity of that cause of destruction, such as contact with fire, which is accepted as such.

original: tathā hi agnisaṃyogādikāle tritayaṃ lakṣayāmaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi agni saṃyoga ādi kāle tritayam lakṣayāmaḥ
translated: For thus, at the time of contact with fire, etc., we observe a triad:

original: tad eva kāṣṭhādikaṃ vināśyam /🔽aṅgārādikam avasthāntaram /
analyzed: tat eva kāṣṭhā ādikam vināśyam  aṅgāra ādikam avasthā antaram
translated: That very wood, etc., which is to be destroyed;🔽The different state, such as charcoal, etc.;

original: kāṣṭhādinivṛttilakṣaṇaṃ cābhāvaṃ tuccharūpaṃ /
analyzed: kāṣṭha ādi nivṛtti lakṣaṇam ca abhāvam tuccha rūpam
translated: And the absence characterized by the cessation of wood, etc., which has the form of a void.

original: nāparaṃ yatrāgnisaṃyogāder vyāpāraḥ cintyeta / etāvat
analyzed: na aparam yatra agni saṃyoga ādeḥ vyāpāraḥ cintyeta etāvat
translated: There is nothing else where the operation of contact with fire, etc. could be imagined. This much

original: yāṃ ca vastugatau na kvacid atra vināśahetoḥ sāmarthyaṃ yujyate /
analyzed: yām ca vastu gatau na kvacid atra vināśa hetoḥ sāmarthyam yujyate
translated: And in the case of an existent thing, the capacity of a cause of destruction is not appropriate anywhere.

original: yato na hi vināśahetur bhāvasyendhanādeḥ svahetubhyaḥ sthirarūpasyotpannasya svabhāvam evāsthirātmatālakṣaṇaṃ karoti /
analyzed: yatas na hi vināśa hetuḥ bhāvasya indhana ādeḥ sva hetubhyaḥ sthira rūpasya utpannasya svabhāvam eva asthira ātmatā lakṣaṇam karoti
translated: For a cause of destruction does not make the nature of an existent thing, such as fuel, which has arisen from its own causes as stable, have the nature characterized by instability.

original: kutaḥ / tasyendhanādeḥ svahetubhya eva nirvṛtteḥ /
analyzed: kutas tasya indhana ādeḥ sva hetubhyaḥ eva nirvṛtteḥ
translated: Why is that? Because that fuel, etc., is produced from its own causes alone.🔽For what has been produced cannot be made otherwise.

original: na hi p / / nirvṛttasyānyathābhāvaḥ /🔽tadātmāśakyate kartum /🔽tasya hetvantarāt paścād bhavato 'rthāntaratvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: na hi p sthira ātmanaḥ  kartum  tasya hetu antarāt paścāt bhavataḥ ṛtha antara tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Its nature cannot be made otherwise.🔽Because if it were to exist later from another cause, it would follow that it is a different thing.

original: tasyaivānyathātvāyogāt /
analyzed: tasya eva anyathātva ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible for that very thing to be otherwise.

original: tatra hetuvyāpārasya kalpayitum aśakyatvāt /
analyzed: tatra hetu vyāpārasya kalpayitum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because the operation of the cause there cannot be imagined.

original: athavā tritaye samīkṣyamāṇe yat tāvat vināśyaṃ kāṣṭhādi na tatsvabhāvamevāgnisaṃyogādir vināśahetuḥ karoti tasya svahetubhya eva nirvṛtter 🔽iti /
analyzed: athavā tritaye samīkṣyamāṇe yat tāvat vināśyam kāṣṭha ādi na vināśa hetuḥ karoti tasya sva hetubhyaḥ eva nirvṛtteḥ  iti
translated: Or rather, when the three are examined, that which is to be destroyed, such as wood, is not of that very nature. The cause of destruction, such as contact with fire, does not make it. Because it is produced only from its own causes.

original: asthirasvabhāvatā
analyzed: asthira svabhāva tā
translated: The impermanent nature

original: no 'nivṛttasyānyathā 'bhāva Tib /
analyzed: naḥ nivṛttasya anyathā bhāva tip
translated: of what has not ceased is not non-existence.

original: sthirātmā
analyzed: sthira ātmā
translated: A permanent self

original: kāṣṭhatvam
analyzed: kāṣṭha tvam
translated: The state of being wood

original: kumārileṣṭabhāvāntarasvabhāvapakṣasya samālocanam /
translated: The examination of Kumārila's view that the nature of another entity is the nature of an existent.

original: kumārilas tu manyate nāgnisaṃyogādinā bhāvasvabhāva eva kriyate kintv indhanādeḥ S / / pradhvaṃsābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: kumārilaḥ tu manyate na agni saṃyoga ādinā bhāva svabhāvaḥ eva kriyate kintu indhana ādeḥ pradhvaṃsa abhāvaḥ
translated: But Kumārila thinks that the nature of an existent is not made by contact with fire, etc., but rather the non-existence of destruction of fuel, etc.

original: sa cendhanādirūpavikalam aṅgārādikam uttaraṃ bhāvāntaram eva / taduktam
analyzed: sa ca indhana ādi rūpa vikalam aṅgāra ādikam uttaram bhāva antaram eva tat uktam
translated: And that, lacking the form of fuel, etc., is a subsequent different entity such as charcoal. That is said:

original: nāstitāpayaso dadhni pradhvaṃsābhāvalakṣaṇam
analyzed: nāstitā payasaḥ dadhni
translated: The characteristic of the non-existence of destruction in curd is non-existence.

original: ŚlV abhāva iti /
analyzed: ślu abhāve iti
translated: The non-existence of what is not.

original: tathāvidhasya cābhāvasya hetumattopagamo naiva virudhyate /
analyzed: tathāvidhasya ca abhāvasya hetumat tā upagamaḥ nā eva virudhyate
translated: And the acceptance that such a non-existence has a cause is not contradictory.

original: tathā cāha kaścit
analyzed: tathā ca āha kaścid
translated: Thus someone says:

original: bhāvāntaravinirmukto bhāvo 'trānupalambhavat /
analyzed: bhāva antara vinirmuktaḥ
translated: An existent here, free from another entity, is like what is not perceived.

original: abhāvaḥsammatas tasya hetoḥkinna samudbhavaḥ / // iti
analyzed: abhāvaḥ sammataḥ tasya hetoḥ kin na samudbhavaḥ iti
translated: Why should not the non-existence of the effect be produced from the cause?🔽This is the view of the followers of Kaṇāda.

original: tad etatkaumārilaṃT / / darśanam apanudann āha nāpi ityādi /
analyzed: tat darśanam apanudan āha na api ityādi
translated: Refuting this, the author says: Nor is the effect a positive entity.

original: yady uttaraṃ kāryātmakaṃ bhāvāntaram eva abhāvas tadā 'gnisaṃyogādayo 'ṅgaṅgā🔽rādijanmani vyāpṛpri🔽yanta itīṣṭam evāsmākam /
analyzed: ra ādi janmani vyāpṛpri  yantaḥ iti iṣṭam eva asmākam
translated: If non-existence is a positive entity, a different thing that comes later, then it is accepted that things like contact with fire are operative in the production of charcoal, etc.

original: kintu bhāvāntarakaraṇe abhyupagamyamāne 'gnyādīnām indhanādāv avyāpārāt tadavastham evendhanādikam /
analyzed: kintu bhāva antara karaṇe abhyupagamyamāne gni ādīnām indhana ādau avyāpārāt tad avastham evā indhana ādikam
translated: But when it is accepted that it produces a different positive entity, since fire, etc. are not operative on fuel, etc., fuel, etc. remain as they were.

original: tataś ca yathā 'gnisaṃyogāt prāg indhanāder upalabdhiḥ anyā ca tatsādhyā 'rthakriyā tathā 'ṅgārādyutpattāv apy upalabdhyādeḥ prasaṅgaḥ /🔽nanu bhāvāntarasya pradhvansādhvaṃsā
analyzed: tatas ca yathā gni saṃyogāt prāk indhana ādeḥ upalabdhiḥ anyā ca tad sādhyā rthakriyā tathā ṅgāra ādi utpattau api upalabdhi ādeḥ prasaṅgaḥ  nanu bhāva antarasya pradhvansa adhvaṃsā
translated: And therefore, just as fuel, etc. are perceived before contact with fire, and other effects are accomplished, in the same way, there would be the undesirable consequence of perception, etc. even after the production of charcoal, etc.

original: bhāvarūpatāyāṃ tadutpattāv indhanādīnāṃ S / / pradhvas tatvādasatāṃ kathaṃ tathopalabdhyādiprasaṅgaḥ / /
analyzed: bhāva rūpa tāyām tad utpattau indhana ādīnām katham tathā upalabdhi ādi prasaṅgaḥ
translated: But when the nature of a different positive entity is that of the destruction of what was before, and when it is produced, since fuel, etc. are destroyed, how can there be the undesirable consequence of their perception, etc. when they are non-existent?

original: satyam / evaṃ manyate sarvasyendhanāder anyasya gavāder api tathābhāvo mā bhūt ity aṅgārādeḥ dhvaṃsavyavasthāyāṃ nibandhanam p / / abhidhānīyam
analyzed: satyam evam manyate sarvasya indhana ādeḥ anyasya gavādeḥ api tathābhāvaḥ mā bhūt iti aṅgāra ādeḥ dhvaṃsa vyavasthāyām nibandhanam abhidhānīyam
translated: True, [we reply]. He thinks thus: Let there be no such state of being for anything else like fuel, etc., or even for a cow, etc. Therefore, a reason for establishing the destruction of charcoal, etc., should be stated.

original: tasmiṃsmin
analyzed: tasmin smin
translated: In that and that,

original: sati tannivṛttir iti cet /
analyzed: sati tad nivṛttiḥ iti ced
translated: if it is said that there is cessation due to that,

original: aho vacanakauśalam yato nivṛttes tucchasvabhāvatānaṅgīkaraṇāt tad eva bhāvāntaram aṅgārādikaṃ nivṛttiṃ brūṣe /
analyzed: aho vacana kauśalam yatas nivṛtteḥ tuccha svabhāva tā an aṅgīkaraṇāt tat eva bhāva antaram aṅgāra ādikam nivṛttim brūṣe
translated: oh, what skill in speech! Since the emptiness of the nature of cessation is not accepted, you call that very other entity, the charcoal, etc., cessation.

original: tad ayam arthaḥ sampannaḥ aṅgārādibhāve 'ṅgārādibhāvād aṅgārādikaṃ dhvaṃsaḥ kāṣṭhāder iti /
analyzed: tat ayam arthaḥ sampannaḥ aṅgāra ādi bhāve ṅgāra ādi bhāvāt aṅgāra ādikam dhvaṃsaḥ kāṣṭha ādeḥ iti
translated: This meaning is accomplished: In the state of charcoal, etc., from the state of charcoal, etc., the charcoal, etc. are the destruction of the wood, etc.

original: na cāṅgārādibhāve tadbhāvaḥ svātmani hetubhāvāyogāt /
analyzed: na ca aṅgāra ādi bhāve tad bhāvaḥ sva ātmani hetu bhāva ayogāt
translated: And in the state of charcoal, etc., that state is not [possible] because it is not possible for it to be the cause of itself.

original: agnyādibhyaś ca tadutpādavacanād indhanādyupamarddenāṅgārādiT / /bhāvāt asya dhvaṃsarūpateti cet /
analyzed: agni ādibhyaḥ ca tad utpāda vacanāt indhana ādi upamarddena aṅgārāt it asya dhvaṃsa rūpa tā iti ced
translated: And because it is said that it is produced from fire, etc., and because the state of charcoal, etc. is due to the suppression of fuel, etc., it is said that it has the nature of destruction. If it is said that this is so,

original: ko 'yam upamarddo nāma / /
analyzed: kaḥ yam upamarddaḥ nāma
translated: what is this called suppression?

original: yadi nivṛttiḥ sā 'ṅgārādilakṣaṇaiveti na pūrvasmād viśiṣyate /
analyzed: yadi nivṛttiḥ sā ṅgāra ādi lakṣaṇā evā iti na pūrvasmāt viśiṣyate
translated: If cessation is just that characterized by charcoal, etc., it is not distinguished from the previous [state].

original: tasmāt S / / svarasato nivarttate kāṣṭhādiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt s svarasataḥ nivarttate kāṣṭha ādiḥ
translated: Therefore, the wood, etc. cease by their own nature.

original: agnyādibhyas tv aṅgārādijanma ity eva bhadrakam /
analyzed: agni ādibhyaḥ tu aṅgāra ādi janma iti eva bhadrakam
translated: But it is all right to say that charcoal and so on arise from fire and so on.

original: anyathā kāṣṭhādes tathopalabdhyādiprasaṅgaḥ kathaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: anyathā kāṣṭha ādeḥ tathā upalabdhi ādi prasaṅgaḥ katham na syāt
translated: Otherwise, how could it not follow that wood and so on are perceived in that way?

original: api ca yadi bhāvāntaraṃ pradhvaṃsābhāvo ya ete 'nupajātavikārāḥ pradīpabuddhyādayo dhvaṃsante teṣāṃ katarad bhāvāntaraṃ pradhvansodhvaṃso🔽vyavasthāpyate / /
analyzed: api ca yadi bhāva antaram pradhvaṃsa abhāvaḥ ye ete n upajāta vikārāḥ pradīpa buddhi ādayaḥ dhvaṃsante teṣām katarat bhāva antaram  vyavasthāpyate
translated: Moreover, if the destruction of an existent is a separate existent, then which of these things that are not yet produced as different, such as the light of a lamp and cognition, is the separate existent that is the destruction that is posited as destruction?

original: te 'py avyaktatāmātmabhāvaṃca vikāram eva dhvaṃsaṃ samālambanta iti cet /
analyzed: te pi vikāram eva dhvaṃsam samālambante iti ced
translated: If it is argued that they all have the nature of the imperceptible and the transformation is just the destruction,

original: na / pradīpāder bhāvarūpāvyaktatābhāve pramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: na pradīpa ādeḥ bhāva rūpa avyakta tā bhāve pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: no. Because there is no evidence for the light of a lamp and so on having the nature of the imperceptible which is an existent.

original: yadi hi śaktirūpatāpattir avyaktatā tadā śakteḥ kāryadarśanonnīyamānarūpatvāt tadabhāvekathaṃ pradīpādayaḥ śaktyātmanā 'vasthitāḥ kalperan /
analyzed: yadi hi śakti rūpa tā āpattiḥ avyakta tā tadā śakteḥ kārya darśana unnīyamāna rūpa tvāt pradīpa ādayaḥ śakti ātmanā vasthitāḥ
translated: For if the attainment of the form of potentiality is the imperceptible, then since the form of that is inferred from the perception of the effect, how could the light of a lamp and so on be imagined to exist in the form of potentiality when that does not exist?

original: athopalabdhiyogyatāvikalātmatāpattir avyaktiḥ /
analyzed: atha upalabdhi yogyatā vikala ātma tā āpattiḥ avyaktiḥ
translated: Or if the imperceptible is the attainment of the nature that is deficient in the capacity for being perceived,

original: atrāpi tadātmanā 'vasthitau naiva pramāṇam asti /
analyzed: atra api tad ātmanā vasthitau na eva pramāṇam asti
translated: even in this case there is no evidence for their existing in that nature.

original: na cāpramāṇakamādriyante vaco vipaścitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca apramāṇakam ādriyante vacaḥ vipaścitaḥ
translated: And the words of the wise are not valued without evidence.

original: ātmanaś cāsattvāt kathaṃ tadbhāvobuddhyādīnāṃ S / / vikāraḥ pariṇāmaś ca / /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca asattvāt katham
translated: And since the self does not exist, how can there be the state of the intellect, etc.? How can there be modification or transformation?

original: anyatra vihitapratikriyatvāt neha pranyata ity alaṃ prasaṅgena /
analyzed: anyatra vihita pratikriya tvāt na iha iti alam prasaṅgena
translated: Since a remedy has been prescribed elsewhere, it is not sought here. Enough of digression.

original: syānmatam bhāvāntareṇāṅgārādinā ''vṛtatvāt indhanādes tathopalabdhyādayo na bhavantīty ata āha nāpi ityādi /
analyzed: syāt matam bhāva antareṇa aṅgāra ādinā vṛta tvāt indhana ādeḥ tathā upalabdhi ādayaḥ na bhavanti iti atas āha nā api ityādi
translated: It may be thought that because it is covered by another substance like charcoal, fuel, etc. are not perceived in that way. Therefore it is said that even the covering is not proper.

original: svabhāvāntaram anyasyendhanāder āvaraṇam api na yujyeta tadavasthe avicalitaT / /rūpe tasminn indhanādau satyāvaraṇasyāpi na kevalam 🔽anupalabdhyāder ayogāt /
analyzed: svabhāva antaram anyasya indhana ādeḥ āvaraṇam api na tasmin indhana ādau sati āvaraṇasya api na kevalam  anupalabdhi ādeḥ ayogāt
translated: A different nature of another, even the covering of fuel, etc., is not proper when it remains in that unmoving form. When that fuel, etc. exists, even the covering is not proper, not only non-perception, etc. are not proper.

original: sābhāva iṣyate ŚlV
analyzed: sābhāvaḥ iṣyate
translated: Non-existence is accepted.

original: pradīpa
analyzed: pradīpa
translated: lamp

original: buddhiḥ
analyzed: buddhiḥ
translated: intellect

original: kārya
analyzed: kārya
translated: effect

original: kalpyeran Tib /
analyzed: kalpyeran tip
translated: should be imagined

original: ātmatā
analyzed: ātma tā
translated: self

original: p / / / bhāvābhāvapakṣasyāpi samālocanam /
translated: ... of existence and non-existence is also considered.

original: na kevalaṃ bhāvasvabhāvo bhāvāntaraṃ vā vināśahetunā na kriyate bhāvābhāvo 'pi na kriyata ity āha nāpi ityādi /
analyzed: na kevalam bhāva svabhāvaḥ bhāva antaram vā vināśa hetunā na kriyate na kriyate iti āha nā api ityādi
translated: Not only is the nature of existence or another existence not produced by the cause of destruction, even existence and non-existence are not produced. Therefore it is said that even the covering is not proper, etc.🔽If it is asked why,

original: kutaḥ / iti cet /
analyzed: kutas iti ced
translated: If it is asked why,🔽

original: abhāvasya vidhinā paryudāsena vivakṣitād bhāvādanyatayā kāryatvopagame kriyamāṇe kim indhanādirūpa evāsau /
analyzed: abhāvasya vidhinā paryudāsena vivakṣitāt bhāvāt anya tayā kārya tva upagame kriyamāṇe kim indhana ādi rūpaḥ evā asau
translated: When the non-existence is accepted as an effect by being different from the existent thing that is intended to be excluded by the affirmation, is it of the form of fuel etc.?

original: athārthāntaram /
analyzed: atha artha antaram
translated: Or is it something else?

original: iti vyatirekāvyatirekavikalpānatikramāt /
analyzed: iti vyatireka avyatireka vikalpa anatikramāt
translated: Thus, because it does not go beyond the alternatives of identity and difference,

original: tatra cokta eva doṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca uktaḥ eva doṣaḥ
translated: and the fault stated earlier applies to that.

original: nanu prasajyapratiṣedhātmā tuccharūpo 'sāv agnyādijanyo 'bhyupeyate /
analyzed: nanu prasajya pratiṣedha ātmā tuccha rūpaḥ sau agni ādi janyaḥ bhyupeyate
translated: But it is accepted that it has the nature of a mere negation, being produced by fire etc.

original: tadbhāve cendhanādīnāṃ naiḥsvābhāvyāt kutaḥ pūrvadoṣāvasaraḥ / /
analyzed: tad bhāve ca indhana ādīnām naiḥsvābhāvyāt kutas pūrva doṣa avasaraḥ
translated: And if it exists, since fuel etc. are without intrinsic nature, how can there be an occasion for the previous fault?

original: sa cāvaśyam agnyādibhāvābhāvānuvidhāyitayā S / / tatkāryas tadbhāvavyavahārasyānyatrāpi tannibandhanatvāt / taduktam
analyzed: sa ca avaśyam agni ādi bhāva abhāva anuvidhāyi tayā tad kāryaḥ tad bhāva vyavahārasya anyatra api tad nibandhana tvāt tat uktam
translated: And that must necessarily be the effect of that, because the usage of existence is based on that even in other cases, as stated:

original: san bodhagocaraprāptas tadbhāve nopalabhyate /🔽naśyan bhāvaḥkathaṃtasya na nāśaḥkāryatāmiyāt //
analyzed: san bodha gocara prāptaḥ na upalabhyate  naśyan na nāśaḥ kārya tām iyāt
translated: That which has become the object of cognition, is not perceived when it exists.🔽How can the destruction of an existing thing become its effect?

original: prāg abhūtvābhavan bhāvo hetubhyo jāyate yathā/
analyzed: prāk a bhūtvā abhavan bhāvaḥ hetubhyaḥ jāyate yathā
translated: Just as an existent thing is produced from causes, having not existed before,

original: bhūtvā'pi na bhavaṃs tadvaddhetubhyo na bhavaty ayam //
analyzed: bhūtvā api na bhavan tadvat hetubhyaḥ na bhavati
translated: in the same way, this [non-existence] does not exist from causes, even though it exists.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: ata āha bhāvapratiṣedhety ādi /
analyzed: atas āha bhāva pratiṣedha iti ādi
translated: Therefore he says in the negation of existence and so on.

original: ayam abhiprāyaḥ yady anapekṣitabhāvāntarasaṃsarggaś cyutimātram eva tuccharūpaṃ dhvaṃsaḥ tadā tatra kārakavyāpāro naiva sambhavati bhavanadharmiṇy 🔽eva tatsambhavāt /
analyzed: ayam abhiprāyaḥ yadi an apekṣita bhāva antara saṃsarggaḥ cyuti mātram eva tuccha rūpam dhvaṃsaḥ tadā tatra kāraka vyāpāraḥ na eva sambhavati bhavana dharmiṇi  / eva tad sambhavāt
translated: The idea is this: If mere falling away, which is devoid of any connection with another existent, is mere nothingness, then an operation of a causal agent is not possible in that case, because it is possible only in regard to that which has the nature of coming into existence.

original: tasyāpy T / / abhūtvā bhāvopagamāt kāryatā na virudhyata iti cet / na /
analyzed: tasya api t a bhūtvā bhāva upagamāt kārya tā na virudhyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the state of being an effect is not contradictory, because it is the attainment of existence after non-existence, it is not so.

original: bhavanadharmaṇo bhāvarūpatāprāpter abhāvatvahāneḥ /
analyzed: bhavana dharmaṇaḥ bhāva rūpa tā prāpteḥ abhāva tva hāneḥ
translated: Because that which has the nature of coming into existence attains the nature of existence, there is the loss of being a non-existent.

original: yato bhavatīti bhāvo maṇyate /
analyzed: yatas bhavati iti bhāvaḥ maṇyate
translated: Because it is considered to be an existent because it comes into existence.

original: nāparam aṅkurāder api bhāvaśabdapravṛttinimittam /🔽arthakriyāsāmarthyam iti cet /
analyzed: na aparam aṅkura ādeḥ api bhāva śabda pravṛtti nimittam  arthakriyā sāmarthyam iti ced
translated: There is no other reason for the application of the word 'existent' to a sprout etc.

original: sarvasāmarthyavirahiṇastarhy asya kathaṃ pratītiviṣayatā / /
analyzed: asya katham pratīti viṣaya tā
translated: If it is argued that it is the capacity for effective action, then how can it be the object of cognition, being devoid of all capacities?

original: na hy akāraṇaṃ pratītiviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: na hi akāraṇam pratīti viṣayaḥ
translated: For what is not a cause is not the object of cognition.

original: atiprasaṅgāt /🔽tadaviṣayasya vā kathaṃ hetumattāvagatiḥ /
analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt  tad aviṣayasya vā katham hetumat tā avagatiḥ
translated: Because of the absurdity of the consequence.

original: vastutā vā /
analyzed: vastu tā vā
translated: Or how can there be the cognition of its being a cause, or its being a real entity,

original: yenocyate tuccharūpam eva tad vastu' iti /
analyzed: yena ucyate tuccha rūpam eva tat vastu iti
translated: by which it is said that it is a real entity which is mere nothingness?

original: pratītijanakatve vā kathaṃ na S / / sāmarthyasambandhitā / /
analyzed: pratīti janaka tve vā katham na
translated: Or if it is the producer of cognition, how is it not related to capacity?

original: sad iti pratyayā 'viṣayasya kathaṃ bhāvateti cet /
analyzed: sat iti pratyayāḥ viṣayasya katham bhāva tā iti ced
translated: If it is asked how that which is not the object of the notion of existence can exist,

original: kāryatā 'py asya katham / /
analyzed: kārya tā pi asya katham
translated: how can it be an effect?

original: svahetubhāve bhāvāt iti cet /
analyzed: sva hetu bhāve bhāvāt iti ced
translated: If it is said that it exists because it exists when its own cause exists,

original: kathaṃ tarhi satpratyayā 'viṣayatā / /
analyzed: katham tarhi sat pratyayā viṣaya tā
translated: then how can it be not the object of the notion of existence?

original: p / / tathā hi yadi svahetubhāve bhavatīti
analyzed: tathā hi yadi sva hetu bhāve bhavati iti
translated: For thus, if it is understood that it exists when its own cause exists,

original: pratīyate sad ityādi pratīyeta /
analyzed: pratīyate sat ityādi pratīyeta
translated: it would be cognized as existent and so on.

original: yato 'stīti sad iti vadanti vidvāṃsaḥ /
analyzed: yatas sti iti sat iti vadanti vidvāṃsaḥ
translated: Because the wise say it exists is existent,

original: na cāsti / bhavati /
analyzed: na ca asti bhavati
translated: but it does not exist, it becomes.

original: bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: bhāvaḥ
translated: It is an existent.

original: śabdānāmarthabhedaḥ paramārthaḥ kaścit /
analyzed: san iti parama arthaḥ kaścid
translated: The ultimate meaning of words is some kind of distinction in meaning.

original: abhāvātmakatayaiva bhavaty asāv iti cet / na /
analyzed: abhāva ātmaka tayā eva bhavati asau iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it exists only by having the nature of non-existence, no.

original: vyāhatatvāt /
analyzed: vyāhata tvāt
translated: Because it is contradictory.

original: yato na bhavatīty abhāva ucyate sa kathaṃ bhavatīti vyapadiśyate / /
analyzed: yatas na bhavati iti abhāvaḥ ucyate sa katham bhavati iti vyapadiśyate
translated: For how can that which is said to be non-existent because it does not exist be designated as it becomes?

original: pratiṣṭhitena kenacid rūpeṇa svajñānātmany apratibhāsanāt na bhāva iti cet /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhitena kenacid rūpeṇa sva jñāna ātmani apratibhāsanāt na bhāvaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that it is not an existent because it does not appear in the form of something established in its own cognition,

original: atyantaparokṣāṇāṃ cakṣurādīnām abhāvatāprasaṅgaḥ / na /
analyzed: atyanta parokṣāṇām cakṣuḥ ādīnām abhāva tā prasaṅgaḥ na
translated: then it follows that eyes and so on, which are extremely imperceptible, are non-existents. No.

original: teṣāṃ jñānaheturūpatayā pratibhāsanāt iti cet / na /
analyzed: teṣām jñāna hetu rūpa tayā pratibhāsanāt iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it is because they appear as the cause of cognition, no.

original: asyāpi bhavitṛrūpatayā 'vabhāsanāt /
analyzed: asya api bhavitṛ rūpa tayā vabhāsanāt
translated: Because this also appears as the form of that which becomes.

original: T / / sarvarūpavivekasya ca kathaṃ bhūtyā sambandhaḥ / /
analyzed: sarva rūpa vivekasya ca katham bhūtyā sambandhaḥ
translated: And how is the discrimination of all forms related to existence?

original: kenacid rūpeṇonmajjanaṃ hi bhavanam /
analyzed: kenacid rūpeṇa unmajjanam hi bhavanam
translated: For to appear in some form is to exist.

original: jñānaviṣayatayā 'syāpi ca taddheturūpatayā 'vabhāsanasya tulyatvāt /
analyzed: jñāna viṣaya tayā ca tad hetu rūpa tayā vabhāsanasya
translated: And because the appearance of this [non-existence] as the cause of knowledge is the same [as the appearance of existence as the cause of knowledge].

original: ahetoṣ ca viṣayatvāyogāt /
analyzed: ahetoḥ ca viṣaya tva ayogāt
translated: And because it is not possible for a non-cause to be an object.

original: asmākaṃ tv abhāvabuddhayaḥ svavāsanāparipākānvayā nirviṣayā eva /
analyzed: asmākam tu abhāva buddhayaḥ sva vāsanā paripāka anvayāḥ nirviṣayāḥ eva
translated: But for us, the cognitions of non-existence are themselves objectless, arising from the maturation of our own tendencies.

original: abhāvasya ca bhavitṛtve kathaṃ paryudāsāt prasajyapratiṣedho bhidyeta /🔽asadrūpasya vidhānena paryudāsāt S / / sa bhidyata
analyzed: abhāvasya ca bhavitṛ tve katham paryudāsāt prasajya pratiṣedhaḥ bhidyeta  asat rūpasya vidhānena paryudāsāt s sa bhidyata
translated: And if non-existence were to exist, how could the exclusion [of non-existence] be distinguished from the negation of what is implied [by the negation of existence]?

original: iti cet / na / asadrūpasya bhavanavirodhāt /
analyzed: iti ced na asat rūpasya bhavana virodhāt
translated: If it is argued that [the exclusion] is distinguished from the exclusion [of non-existence] by the affirmation of the form of non-existence, [we reply:] no. Because the existence of what has the form of non-existence is contradictory.

original: bhavatīti hi bhūtyā sattayā 'bhisambadhyate /
analyzed: bhavati iti hi bhūtyā sattayā bhisambadhyate
translated: For what is called existent is connected with existence, with being.

original: tatra kathaṃ sadrūpasya vidhānam / /
analyzed: tatra katham sat rūpasya vidhānam
translated: How then can there be the affirmation of what has the form of existence in that [exclusion]?

original: paryudāsa evaiko nañarthaś ca syāt /
analyzed: paryudāsaḥ eva ekaḥ nañ arthaḥ ca syāt
translated: And the meaning of the negative particle would be only exclusion.

original: sarvatra vidheḥ prādhānyāt /
analyzed: sarvatra vidheḥ prādhānyāt
translated: Because in all cases the affirmation is primary.

original: so 'pi vā na bhavet /
analyzed: saḥ pi vā na bhavet
translated: Or that [exclusion] also would not be.

original: yadi hi kiñcit kutaścitnivartyeta tadā tadvyatirekisaṃspṛśyeta tatparyudāsena /
analyzed: yadi hi kiñcid tadā tad paryudāsena
translated: For if something were excluded from something, then it would be touched by the exclusion of that [existence], which is different from that [non-existence].

original: tac ca nāsti /
analyzed: tat ca na asti
translated: But that is not the case.

original: sarvatra nivṛttir bhavati ity ukte vastvantarasyaiva kasyacit vidhānāt /
analyzed: sarvatra nivṛttiḥ bhavati iti ukte vastu antarasya eva kasyacid vidhānāt
translated: When it is said that there is cessation everywhere, it is because another thing is affirmed.

original: tathā 'nena vastvantaram evoktaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tathā nena vastu antaram eva uktam syāt
translated: In the same way, it would be said that another thing is affirmed by this [word].

original: na tayor vivekaḥ /🔽aviveke ca na paryudāsaḥ /
analyzed: na tayoḥ vivekaḥ  a viveke ca na paryudāsaḥ
translated: There is no distinction between the two.🔽And if there is no distinction, it is not a preclusion.

original: aprastutābhidhānaṃ ca syāt /
analyzed: a prastuta abhidhānam ca syāt
translated: And it would be a statement of what is not relevant.

original: bhāvanivṛttauprastutāyāṃ asadātmano vastvantarasyaiva vidhānāt /
analyzed: asat ātmanaḥ vastu antarasya eva vidhānāt
translated: Because in the context of the cessation of existence, another thing which is of the nature of non-existence is affirmed.

original: na cāsya svarūpeṇāsadātmakatvam /
analyzed: na ca asya svarūpeṇa asat ātmaka tvam
translated: And this [non-existence] is not of the nature of non-existence by its own nature.

original: svarūpeṇāpy asataḥ kāryatvavirodhāt /
analyzed: sva rūpeṇa api asataḥ kārya tva virodhāt
translated: Because it is contradictory for what is non-existent by its own nature to be an effect.🔽But everything that is an entity is of the nature of non-existence by another nature, so there is no difference between this [non-existence] and a pot, etc.

original: pararūpeṇa tu sarvam eva vastvasadātmakam iti nāsya ghaṭādeḥ kaścid viśeṣaḥ T / / bhavatu vā 'yam abhāvo 'gnyādibhyas tadbhāve kim iti
analyzed: para rūpeṇa tu sarvam eva vastu asat ātmakam iti na asya ghaṭa ādeḥ kaścid viśeṣaḥ bhavatu vā yam abhāvaḥ gni ādibhyaḥ tad bhāve kim iti
translated: Or let this non-existence be from fire, etc. What is the point of

original: nopalabhyante kāṣṭhādayaḥ / /
analyzed: na upalabhyante kāṣṭha ādayaḥ
translated: not perceiving firewood, etc. when that [fire, etc.] exists?

original: tathā hi agnyādīnām anyakriyāyāṃ caritārthatvād anivṛttā eva tebhyaḥ p / / S / / indhanādayaḥ prāgvad upalabhyeran /🔽tadupamarddena
analyzed: tathā hi agni ādīnām anya kriyāyām caritārtha tvāt anivṛttāḥ eva tebhyaḥ s indhana ādayaḥ prāgvat upalabhyeran  tad upamarddena
translated: Because fire, etc. have accomplished their purpose in another action, the firewood, etc. would be perceived as before, without ceasing from them.

original: dhvaṃsasyotpatteḥ iti cet /
analyzed: dhvaṃsasya utpatteḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the destruction arises by suppressing that [firewood, etc.],

original: kathaṃ tadupamarddaḥ / /
analyzed: katham tad upamarddaḥ
translated: how is there the suppression of that [firewood, etc.]?

original: na tāvat pradhvaṃsābhāvena /
analyzed: na tāvat pradhvaṃsa abhāvena
translated: First of all, not by the non-existence of destruction.

original: indhanasattākāle tasyābhāvāt /
analyzed: indhana sattā kāle tasya abhāvāt
translated: because it does not exist at the time of the existence of fuel.

original: nāgnyādibhiḥ /
analyzed: na agni ādibhiḥ
translated: [It is not by fire, etc.]

original: dhvaṃsāvirbhāva eva teṣāṃ vyāpāropagamāt /
analyzed: dhvaṃsa āvirbhāve eva teṣām vyāpāra upagamāt
translated: Because it is accepted that their operation is just the manifestation of destruction.

original: na cotpannaḥ pradhvaṃsābhāva indhanādīn vihanti /
analyzed: na ca utpannaḥ pradhvaṃsa abhāvaḥ indhana ādīn vihanti
translated: And a produced destruction does not destroy fuel, etc.

original: yaugapadyaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: yaugapadya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the consequence of simultaneity.

original: dhvaṃsena vināśane ca vikalpatrayasya tadavasthatvāt /
analyzed: dhvaṃsena vināśane ca vikalpa trayasya tad avastha tvāt
translated: And because the three alternatives remain as they were in the case of destruction by destruction.

original: tataś cānavasthā /🔽sa eva dhvaṃsa indhanāder agnyādijanmā nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca anavasthā  saḥ eva dhvaṃsaḥ indhana ādeḥ agni ādi janmā nivṛttiḥ
translated: And from that, there is an infinite regress.

original: ato 'syānupalabdhir iti cet /
analyzed: atas syā anupalabdhiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that that very destruction of fuel, etc., which is produced by fire, etc., is the cessation [of fuel, etc.],

original: katham anyo 'nyasya nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: katham anyaḥ nyasya nivṛttiḥ
translated: then [we reply:] how can one thing be the cessation of another?

original: atiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the absurdity [of the consequence].

original: yadi cāyaṃ hetumāṃs tadbhedād ātmabhedaṃ kiṃ nānubhavati / /
analyzed: yadi ca ayam hetumān tad bhedāt ātma bhedam kim na anubhavati
translated: And if this [destruction] has a cause, why does it not experience a difference in itself due to the difference in that [cause]?

original: śāliyavāṅkurādayo 'pi kāraṇabhedād evātmabhedam atyantavilakṣaṇam anubhavanto 'dhyakṣata evāvasīyante /
analyzed: śāli yava aṅkura ādayaḥ pi kāraṇa bhedāt eva ātma bhedam atyanta vilakṣaṇam anubhavantaḥ dhyakṣataḥ eva avasīyante
translated: Even rice, barley, sprouts, etc., are definitely perceived by direct perception to experience a difference in themselves that is extremely different just due to the difference in their causes.

original: na tv evam anapekṣitabhāvāntarasaṃsarggaḥ cyutimātralakṣaṇo dhvaṃsaḥ /
analyzed: na tu evam an apekṣita bhāva antara saṃsarggaḥ cyuti mātra lakṣaṇaḥ dhvaṃsaḥ
translated: But destruction, which is merely characterized by falling away without regard to the connection with another existent, is not like this.

original: tasyābhighātāgnisaṃyogādikāraṇabhede 'pi tuccharūpatayaikarūpasya svajñānātmany avabhāsanāt /
analyzed: tasya abhighāta agni saṃyoga ādi kāraṇa bhede pi tuccha rūpa tayā eka rūpasya sva jñāna ātmani avabhāsanāt
translated: Even though there is a difference in the causes such as a blow or contact with fire, it appears in the form of mere absence, which is of the same form, in its own cognition.

original: na hi bhāvaśūnyatāṃ vihāyāparaṃ tatra kiñcid rūpam īksāmahe /
analyzed: na hi bhāva śūnyatām vihāya aparam tatra kiñcid rūpam īksāmahe
translated: For, apart from the emptiness of existence, we do not see any other form there.

original: vistarataś caitatkṣaṇabhaṅgasiddhau vicāritam
analyzed: vistarataḥ ca etat kṣaṇa bhaṅga siddhau vicāritam
translated: And this has been discussed in detail in the Proof of Momentary Destruction.

original: ity āstāṃ tāvād iha /
analyzed: iti āstām tāvāt iha
translated: So let that be for now.

original: S / / tasmād agnyādisaṃyogakāle na tasya kiñcid bhavati na bhavaty eva kevalam ity evopagantuṃ yuktam /
analyzed: tasmāt agni ādi saṃyoga kāle na tasya kiñcid bhavati na bhavati eva kevalam iti eva upagantum yuktam
translated: Therefore, it is proper to accept that at the time of contact with fire, etc., it has no existence at all, it simply does not exist.

original: yato nāyaṃ kasyacid T / / bhāvena naṣṭo nāma kintu yataḥ svayam asthirarūpatayā bhūtas tato naṣṭo nāma /
analyzed: yatas na ayam kasyacid bhāvena naṣṭaḥ nāma kintu yatas svayam asthira rūpa tayā bhūtaḥ tatas naṣṭaḥ nāma
translated: Because this is not called destroyed by the existence of anything, but rather it is called destroyed because it itself has a nature that is not stable.

original: tena nāsyā 'bhavanam anyad vā kiñcid bhavati /
analyzed: tena na asyāḥ bhavanam anyat vā kiñcid bhavati
translated: Therefore, its non-existence or anything else does not exist.

original: tathā ca bhavanadharmaṇaḥ kasyacid abhāvād bhāvaṃ bhavantaṃ kutaścin na karotīti kriyāpratiṣedha evāgnisaṃyogādeḥ syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca bhavana dharmaṇaḥ kasyacid abhāvāt bhāvam bhavantam kutaścid na karoti iti kriyā pratiṣedhaḥ eva agni saṃyoga ādeḥ syāt
translated: And thus, because there is no existence of anything that has the nature of existence, it does not make an existent thing exist from anything. Therefore, the negation of action alone would be from contact with fire, etc.

original: eva ca sati karttā agnisaṃyogādiḥ na bhavati ity akartur ahetutvam iti tasmān na vināśahetuḥkaścit /🔽agniḥ
analyzed: eva ca sati karttā agni saṃyoga ādiḥ na bhavati iti akartuḥ ahetu tvam iti tasmāt na vināśa hetuḥ kaścid  agniḥ
translated: And when that is so, the agent, contact with fire, etc., does not exist. Therefore, the non-causality of the non-agent is due to that. Therefore, there is no cause of destruction at all.🔽fire

original: agnyādeḥ
analyzed: agni ādeḥ
translated: of fire, etc.

original: bhāvaḥ
analyzed: bhāvaḥ
translated: existence

original: bhāvaśabdapravṛttinimittaṃ abhāvasyāpi yadi sāmarthyam asti tadā bhāvatvam atha nāsti tatrāha
analyzed: bhāva śabda pravṛtti nimittam abhāvasya api yadi sāmarthyam asti tadā bhāva tvam atha na asti tatra āha
translated: If non-existence also has the capacity to be the reason for the application of the word 'existent', then it is an existent. If not, he says:

original: sanniti sāmānyaśabdānām Tib /
analyzed: san iti sāmānya śabdānām tip
translated: 'existent' is a general term.

original: cakṣurādībhiḥ
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ādībhiḥ
translated: by the eye and so on

original: brāhmaṇādi prathamaṃ ṭippaṇam
analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādi prathamam ṭippaṇam
translated: Brahmin, etc. first footnote

original: kṣatriyā dvi / ṭi /
analyzed: kṣatriyā dvi ṭi
translated: Kshatriya, etc. second footnote

original: nivartyavyatireki
translated: excluded from what is to be turned away from

original: tuccharūpāyām🔽vaiyarthyād api vināśe hetvayogaḥ /
analyzed: tuccha rūpāyām  vaiyarthyāt api vināśe hetu ayogaḥ
translated: in a form that is empty🔽Even because of futility, there is no connection with a cause of destruction.

original: na kevalam asāmarthyād vināśahetvayogaḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam asāmarthyāt vināśa hetu ayogaḥ
translated: Not only is there no connection with a cause of destruction because of incapacity,

original: kintu vaiyarthyāc ca /
analyzed: kintu vaiyarthyāt ca
translated: but also because of futility.

original: tad evāha yadi svabhāvato naśvaro naśanaśīlaḥ svātmany anavasthāyī sthātum aśakto yathā sūcyagre sarṣapaḥ tasya na kiñcinnāśakāraṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tat eva āha yadi svabhāvataḥ naśvaraḥ naśana śīlaḥ sva ātmani anavasthāyī sthātum aśaktaḥ yathā sūci agre sarṣapaḥ tasya na kiñcid nāśa kāraṇaiḥ
translated: He says just that: If it is perishable by nature, inclined to perish, not abiding in its own nature, unable to remain, like a mustard seed on the tip of a needle, then there is nothing for the causes of destruction to do to it.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: tatsvabhāvatayaiva asthirasvabhāvatayaiva /
analyzed: asthira svabhāva tayā eva
translated: Because of its very nature, because of its unstable nature.

original: na hi prakṛty eva sthātum aśakte sūcyagre sarṣape tadasthitaye prayāsaḥ phalavān bhavet /
analyzed: na hi prakṛti eva sthātum aśakte sūci agre sarṣape tad asthitaye prayāsaḥ phalavān bhavet
translated: For if a mustard seed on the tip of a needle is incapable of remaining by its very nature, then the effort to make it not remain would not be fruitful.

original: p / / atraiva vyāptim ādarśayati yo hi ityādi /
analyzed: atra eva vyāptim ādarśayati yaḥ hi ityādi
translated: Here he illustrates the pervasion with 'For one who' and so on.

original: na punaḥtadbhāve tatsvabhāvatve janakāt S / / hetor hetvantaram apekṣate /
analyzed: na punar tad bhāve tad svabhāva tve janakāt hetoḥ apekṣate
translated: But when it has that nature, when it has that essence, it does not depend on another cause, from a cause that produces it.

original: na hi prakāśādayaḥ ityādinā dṛṣṭāntavivaraṇam /
analyzed: hi prakāśa ādayaḥ ityādinā dṛṣṭānta vivaraṇam
translated: The explanation of the example beginning with not from light, etc.

original: tadātmatāyā hetvantarānapekṣaṇena vyāptiṃ tādātmyasādhakena pramāṇena darśayati
analyzed: tad ātma tāyāḥ hetu antara anapekṣaṇena vyāptim tādātmya sādhakena pramāṇena darśayati
translated: He shows the pervasion by the means of knowledge that proves identity with that nature, by not depending on another cause.

original: tadātmano yo yasya svabhāvaḥ tatsvabhāvasya tādātmyābhāve hetvantaram apekṣamāṇasya
analyzed: tad ātmanaḥ yaḥ yasya svabhāvaḥ tad svabhāvasya tādātmya abhāve hetu antaram apekṣamāṇasya
translated: For one who has that nature, whose nature is such, if that nature is absent, if it depends on another cause,

original: svahetor niṣpannasyāpi tatsvabhāvatvābhāve nairātmyasya niḥsvabhāvatāyāḥ prasaṅgāt /
analyzed: sva hetoḥ niṣpannasya api tad svabhāva tva abhāve nairātmyasya niḥsvabhāva tāyāḥ prasaṅgāt
translated: even though produced from its own cause, if it lacks that nature, it would follow that it is without self, without essence.

original: tadvat prakāśādivat na punaḥ paścāt T / / tadātmatāyāṃ asthitidharmātmatāyāṃ hetvantaram apekṣata iti pramāṇaphalam /🔽asthitidharmācet naśvarasvabhāvaś cet /
analyzed: tadvat prakāśa ādi vat na punar paścāt t tad ātmatāyām asthiti dharma ātmatāyām hetu antaram apekṣate iti pramāṇa phalam  a sthiti dharmā ced naśvara svabhāvaḥ ced
translated: Like that, like light, etc., it does not depend on another cause for that nature, for the nature of impermanence, later. This is the result of the means of knowledge.🔽If it has the nature of impermanence, if it has the nature of destruction,

original: svabhāvataḥsvahetubhyo niṣpanno bhāva iti pakṣadharmopasaṃhāraḥ /
analyzed: svabhāvataḥ sva hetubhyaḥ niṣpannaḥ bhāvaḥ iti pakṣa dharma upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: the property of the subject is stated: an entity produced from its own causes.

original: viruddhavyāptopalabdhiś ceyam /
analyzed: viruddha vyāpta upalabdhiḥ ca iyam
translated: And this is the apprehension of a contradictory pervasion.

original: hetvantarāpekṣānapekṣayoḥ parasparaparihārasthitalakṣaṇatayā
analyzed: hetu antara apekṣā anapekṣayoḥ paraspara parihāra sthita lakṣaṇa tayā
translated: Because dependence on another cause and independence are mutually exclusive characteristics,

original: virodhāt / hetvantarānapekṣayā ca tatsvābhāvatāyā vyāptatvāt /
analyzed: virodhāt hetu antara anapekṣayā ca tad svābhāva tāyāḥ vyāpta tvāt
translated: Because of contradiction. And because the pervasion of that nature by the non-dependence on another cause is established.

original: svato vinaśvaratvasādhakahetāv anekāntadoṣoddhāraḥ /
translated: The removal of the fault of inconclusiveness in the reason proving self-destruction.

original: atra ca parasya vacanāv akāśam āśaṅkyāha bījādivat / ityādi /
analyzed: atra ca parasya vacanau akāśam āśaṅkya āha    ityādi
translated: And here, anticipating the opponent's statement, he says like a seed, etc.

original: syād etat ityādinā etad eva vibhajate kevalāna janayanti iti /
analyzed: syāt etat ityādinā etat eva vibhajate janayanti iti
translated: He analyzes this very thing beginning with It may be so, etc. with They only generate the non-existent.

original: kutaḥ / iti cet /
analyzed: kutas iti ced
translated: If it is asked Why?

original: salilakṣityādeḥ svahetuvyatiriktasyāṅkurādijananasvabhāvānām api S / / bījādīnāṃ tadātmatāyām apekṣaṇāt /
analyzed: salila kṣiti ādeḥ sva hetu vyatiriktasya aṅkura ādi janana svabhāvānām api bīja ādīnām tad ātmatāyām apekṣaṇāt
translated: Because even seeds, etc., which have the nature of generating sprouts, etc., depend on that nature of being the self of water, earth, etc., which are different from their own causes.

original: tataś ca na punas tadbhāve hetvantaram apekṣanta ity anekāntaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca na punar tad bhāve hetu antaram apekṣante iti anekāntaḥ
translated: And therefore, they do not depend on another cause for that existence again. Thus there is no inconclusiveness.

original: tadvad bhāvo 'pīndhanādiḥ svahetor naśvarātmā niṣpanno 'pi vināśe vinaśvarātmatāyāṃ syād iti dārṣṭāntikam /
analyzed: tadvat bhāvaḥ pi indhana ādiḥ sva hetoḥ naśvara ātmā niṣpannaḥ pi vināśe vinaśvara ātma tāyām syāt iti dārṣṭāntikam
translated: In the same way, even an existent thing like fuel, which is produced from its own cause as having the nature of destruction, would have the nature of being destructible in destruction. This is the conclusion.

original: na bījādivad anekāntaḥ /
analyzed: na bīja ādi vat anekāntaḥ
translated: There is no inconclusiveness like in the case of a seed.

original: kutaḥ / tatsvabhāvasya aṅkurādijananasvabhāvasya bījāder aṅkurādijananāt /
analyzed: kutas tad svabhāvasya aṅkura ādi janana svabhāvasya bīja ādeḥ aṅkura ādi jananāt
translated: Why? Because a seed, etc., which have the nature of generating a sprout, etc., generate a sprout, etc.

original: tadātmatāyāṃ hetvantarānapekṣaṇāt /
analyzed: tad ātma tāyām hetu antara anapekṣaṇāt
translated: Because they do not depend on another cause for that nature.

original: yaś ca kṣityādikam apekṣamāṇo na janayati kuśūlādyavasthaḥ tasya ajanakasya ca atatsvabhāvatvāt aṅkurādijananasvabhāvatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kṣiti ādikam apekṣamāṇaḥ na janayati kuśūla ādi avasthaḥ tasya ajanakasya ca atatsvabhāva tvāt aṅkura ādi janana svabhāva tva abhāvāt
translated: And that which, in need of earth etc., does not produce, being in the state of a stubble-field etc., of that non-producer, because of not having that nature, because of the absence of the nature of producing sprouts etc.,

original: tatra tadātmatālakṣaṇo hetuḥ na vartata eveti na tenānekāntaḥ /
analyzed: tatra tad ātma tā lakṣaṇaḥ hetuḥ na vartate eva iti na tena anekāntaḥ
translated: there the reason characterized by the nature of that self does not operate at all. Therefore there is no inconclusiveness due to that.

original: pratyakṣeṇa bādhāt na pratyabhijñayā sthiraikabhāvasiddhiḥ /
translated: Because of contradiction by perception, the establishment of a permanent, single entity is not by recognition.

original: nanu pratyabhijñāpratyakṣata eva bījādir ekasvabhāvo lakṣyate /
analyzed: nanu pratyabhijñā pratyakṣataḥ eva bīja ādiḥ eka svabhāvaḥ lakṣyate
translated: But is not a single nature of seed etc. perceived just by the perception of recognition?

original: tatra kuto 'yaṃ jananasvabhāvatvājananasvabhāvatvalakṣaṇo bhedaḥ /
analyzed: tatra kutas yam janana svabhāva tva a janana svabhāva tva lakṣaṇaḥ bhedaḥ
translated: Then how is this difference characterized by the nature of producing and the nature of not producing?

original: p / / yato 'nekānto T / / na syāt /
analyzed: yatas na ekāntaḥ t na syāt
translated: From which there would be no inconclusiveness in that?

original: na cāpramāṇaṃ pratyabhijñā /🔽tatrāpūrvārthavijñānam ityādi pramāṇalakṣaṇayogāt /
analyzed: na ca apramāṇam pratyabhijñā  tatra apūrva artha vijñānam ityādi pramāṇa lakṣaṇa yogāt
translated: And recognition is not a non-validating cognition.🔽Because of the connection with the characteristics of a validating cognition, such as the cognition of a previously unknown object etc.

original: satsamprayogeṇendriyāṇāṃ bhāvataś ca pratyakṣam eva pratyabhijñānam /
analyzed: sat samprayogeṇa indriyāṇām bhāvataḥ ca pratyakṣam eva pratyabhijñānam
translated: Recognition is perception itself, because of the contact of the existent and the sense faculties.

original: na ca pratyakṣād gariṣṭhaṃ pramāṇam asti /
analyzed: na ca pratyakṣāt gariṣṭham pramāṇam asti
translated: And there is no validating cognition more authoritative than perception.

original: yatas tadviṣayasya bhedasiddhyā bādhām anubhavad apramāṇam etat S / / syāt ity
analyzed: yatas tad viṣayasya bheda siddhyā bādhām anubhavat apramāṇam etat syāt iti
translated: From which, by the establishment of the difference of its object, it would experience contradiction and be a non-validating cognition.

original: āśaṅkyāha ata eva' janakatvājanakatvād eva viruddhadharmādhyāsāt tayor avasthayoḥ'
analyzed: āśaṅkya āha atas eva janaka tva ajanaka tvāt eva viruddha dharma adhyāsāt tayoḥ avasthayoḥ
translated: Anticipating this, he says: “For this very reason, due to the contradiction of the superimposition of mutually contradictory properties, those two states,”

original: janakājanakāvasthayoḥ bījādeḥ vastubhedaḥ svabhāvabhedo niśceyaḥ adhyavasātavyaḥ /
analyzed: janaka ajanaka avasthayoḥ bīja ādeḥ vastu bhedaḥ svabhāva bhedaḥ niśceyaḥ adhyavasātavyaḥ
translated: the states of being a producer and not being a producer, “of the seed etc., the difference in the nature of the thing, the difference in its essence, should be ascertained, should be concluded.”

original: yathā hi śālibījaṃ tadaṅkurajananasvabhāvaṃ tadbhāve śālyaṅkurabhavadarśanāt pratyakṣato 'vagamyate /🔽yavabījaṃ cātajjananasvabhāvam tadbhave śālyaṅkurānupalabdhyāT / / tadviviktayavabījagrāhipratyakṣarūpayā
analyzed: yathā hi śāli bījam tat aṅkura janana svabhāvam tad bhāve śāli aṅkura bhava darśanāt pratyakṣataḥ vagamyate  yava bījam ca a tad janana svabhāvam tad bhave tad vivikta yava bīja grāhi pratyakṣa rūpayā
translated: For just as the rice seed is understood by perception to have the nature of producing its sprout, because the rice sprout is seen to arise in its presence,

original: pratīyate tathā 'trāpy avasthādvaye śālibījasya tadaṅkuraviviktāviviktāvasthāgrāhipratyakṣabalād eva svāṅkurajanakājanakasvabhāvatā kinna niścīyate /
analyzed: pratīyate tathā avasthā dvaye śāli bījasya tad aṅkura vivikta avivikta avasthā grāhi pratyakṣa balāt eva sva aṅkura janaka ajanaka svabhāva tā kin na niścīyate
translated: and the barley seed is understood to have the nature of not producing that, because the rice sprout is not perceived to arise in its presence, in the same way, here too, due to the power of perception alone, which grasps the states of the rice seed as being distinct from and not distinct from its sprout in the two states, why is the nature of producing and not producing its own sprout not ascertained?

original: iṣyata evāvasthayor bhedo 'vasthāvatas tv abheda iti cet / na /
analyzed: iṣyate eva avasthayoḥ bhedaḥ vasthāvataḥ tu abhedaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the difference between the states is indeed accepted, but the non-difference of the one possessing the states, that is not so.

original: tasyāvasthārūpavivekinā rūpāntareṇa pratyakṣe pratibhāsanaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: tasya avasthā rūpa vivekinā rūpa antareṇa pratyakṣe pratibhāsana prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow that it would appear in perception in a form distinct from the form of the states.

original: na hi yadanātmarūpavivekena svajñāne na pratibhāsate tasya pratyakṣatā yuktā /
analyzed: na hi yat anātma rūpa vivekena sva jñāne na pratibhāsate tasya pratyakṣa tā yuktā
translated: For it is not proper that what does not appear in its own cognition by being distinguished from what is not the self should be perceptible.

original: avasthātadvatoḥ svabhāvabhedābhāvāt S / / kathaṃ rūpāntareṇa pratibhāsanam / iti cet /
analyzed: avasthā tadvatoḥ svabhāva bheda abhāvāt s katham rūpa antareṇa pratibhāsanam iti ced
translated: If it is asked how there can be appearance in another form when there is no difference in the nature of the state and the possessor of the state,

original: nanv avasthābhyo 'navāptarūpabhedasyāvasthānām ivātmanas tadbhede saty abhedo na saṅgacchate /
analyzed: nanu avasthābhyaḥ nava āpta rūpa bhedasya avasthānām iva ātmanaḥ tad bhede sati abhedaḥ na saṅgacchate
translated: then, indeed, for one who has not attained a difference in form from the states, like the self, the non-difference does not make sense when there is a difference in them.

original: T / / tataś cāsyāvasthānām ivātmabhedam anubhavataḥ katham avasthātṛtvam / /
analyzed: t tatas ca asya avasthānām iva ātma bhedam anubhavataḥ katham avasthātṛ tvam
translated: And then, how can there be the state of being the experiencer for one who experiences the difference of the self like the states?

original: avasthābhede 'py abhinnarūpasya tathā vyavasthānāt kathañcidbhedasyāpi bhāvād adoṣa iti cet /🔽yadi yam ātmānaṃ purodhaya ayam avasthātā /
analyzed: avasthā bhede pi abhinna rūpasya tathā vyavasthānāt kathañcid bhedasya api bhāvāt adoṣaḥ iti ced  yadi yam ātmānam purodhaya ayam avasthātā
translated: If it is said that there is no fault because of the establishment in that way of an undifferentiated form even in the difference of states, and because of the existence of some kind of difference,

original: avasthāś cemāḥ' iti bhaṇyate tenāvasthātadvator bhedas tadā bheda eveti kathañcit' ity andhapadam etat /🔽tato 'sya pratyakṣatāyāṃ anātmarūpavivekinā
analyzed: avasthāḥ ca imāḥ iti bhaṇyate tena avasthā tadvatoḥ bhedaḥ tadā bhedaḥ evā iti kathañcid iti andha padam etat  tatas sya pratyakṣa tāyām anātma rūpa vivekinā
translated: if it is said this is the self that is worshipped, and these are the states, then the difference of the states and the possessor of the states is just difference. Therefore, the phrase in some way is blind.

original: rūpāntareṇāvabhāsanaprasaṅgo na nivarttate /
analyzed: rūpa antareṇa avabhāsana prasaṅgaḥ na nivarttate
translated: Therefore, in its perceptibility, the occurrence of appearance in another form, distinguished from what is not the self, is not averted.

original: atha tenātmanā 'bhedaḥ/
analyzed: atha tena ātmanā
translated: But if there is non-difference by that self,🔽then the occurrence of appearance in another form, distinguished from what is not the self, is not averted.

original: avasthāvad bhedaprasaṅgo 'vasthātuḥ /
analyzed: avasthā vat bheda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If there is difference of the possessor of the states, there would be the undesirable possibility of difference of the states.

original: tadvad avasthānām abhedasya vā /🔽tayor api kathañcid bhedābhedāv iti cet /
analyzed: tadvat avasthānām abhedasya vā  tayoḥ api kathañcid bheda abhedau iti ced
translated: Or, if there is non-difference of the states, there would be the undesirable possibility of non-difference of the possessor of the states.🔽If it is argued that those two [states and possessor of states] have some kind of difference and non-difference,

original: tayos tarhy avasthātadvad ātmanor bhedavatoḥ kathañcid abhedanimittaṃ rūpāntaram iṣṭaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tayoḥ tarhi avasthā tadvat ātmanoḥ bhedavatoḥ kathañcid abheda nimittam rūpa antaram iṣṭam syāt
translated: then it would be accepted that there is some other form as the cause of non-difference of those two, the states and the possessor of states, which have difference.

original: p / / tathā ca tasyāpi tābhyāṃ kathañcidbhedaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca tasya api tābhyām kathañcid bhedaḥ
translated: And in that case, there would be some kind of difference of that [form] from those two [states and possessor of states].

original: anyathā tadekasvabhāvād atyantam abhedād avasthātadvatoḥ atyantaṃ bhedābhedau prasajyeyātām/
analyzed: anyathā tad eka svabhāvāt atyantam abhedāt avasthā tadvatoḥ parasparam atyantam bheda abhedau
translated: Otherwise, due to absolute non-difference from that single nature, there would be the undesirable possibility of absolute difference and non-difference of the states and the possessor of states.

original: rūpāntarasya kathañcidbhede S / / tannibandhanam aparaṃ rūpam /
analyzed: rūpa antarasya kathañcid bhede tad nibandhanam aparam rūpam
translated: If there is some kind of difference of another form, there would be another form based on that.

original: tathā 'syāpi tadanyad ity aparimitarūpataivaikaikasya vastunaḥ samāsajyeta /
analyzed: tathā sya api tat anyat iti aparimita rūpa tā eva ekaikasya vastunaḥ samāsajyeta
translated: And in that case, there would be another form of that [form], so the single entity would be limited to having an unlimited number of forms.

original: na cāparimitarūpapratibhāsi pratyakṣam anubhavāmaḥ /
analyzed: na ca aparimita rūpa pratibhāsi pratyakṣam anubhavāmaḥ
translated: And we do not experience any perception that appears with an unlimited number of forms.

original: ananubhavantaś ca kathaṃ tatkalpanayā ''tmanaivātmānaṃ vipralabhemahi / /
analyzed: an anubhavantaḥ ca katham tad kalpanayā tmanā evā ātmānam vipralabhemahi
translated: And not experiencing that, how could we deceive ourselves by imagining it?

original: tasmād avasthārūpavivekenopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasyānupalambhād aparimitarūpatāprasaṅgāc ca kathañcid bhedābhedavato 'vasthātur asattvam eva
analyzed: tasmāt avasthā rūpa vivekena upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya anupalambhāt aparimita rūpa tā prasaṅgāt ca kathañcid bheda abhedavataḥ vasthātuḥ asattvam eva
translated: Therefore, because of the non-apprehension of what is perceptible by the characteristic of perception due to the distinction of states, and because of the consequence of an infinite number of forms, the existent of the one that remains with some distinction and non-distinction is itself non-existence.

original: tāś cāvasthā janakājanakasvabhāvabhedavatyaḥ
analyzed: tāḥ ca avasthāḥ janaka ajanaka svabhāva bhedavatyaḥ
translated: And those states have the distinction of the nature of producing and not producing.

original: T / / pratyakṣata evāvagamyanta iti tadekatvādhyavasāyi pratyabhijñānaṃ tadbādhāmanubhavat kathaṃ pramāṇaṃ syāt /
analyzed: eva avagamyante iti
translated: Since they are understood by perception itself, how can the recognition that determines their oneness, experiencing the contradiction of that, be a valid means of knowledge?

original: yato bījādīnāṃ aṅkurādijananasvabhāvānām api tadātmatāyāṃ hetvantarāpekṣaṇāt prāktanasyahetor anaikāntikatā bhavet /
analyzed: yatas bīja ādīnām aṅkura ādi janana svabhāvānām api tad ātmatāyām hetu antara apekṣaṇāt anaikāntika tā bhavet
translated: Because even seeds etc., which have the nature of producing sprouts etc., depend on other causes for their essential nature, the previous reason would be inconclusive.

original: bhavatu vā 'vasthātā kaścit /
analyzed: bhavatu vā vasthātā kaścid
translated: Or let there be some enduring entity.

original: tasyāpy etadeva bhedaṃ sādhayati /🔽tathā hi tayoḥ T / / janakājanakāvasthayor iti saptamīdvivacanam etat tadā bhavati /
analyzed: tasya api bhedam sādhayati  tathā hi tayoḥ janaka ajanaka avasthayoḥ iti saptamī dvivacanam etat tadā bhavati
translated: That very thing establishes its distinction.🔽For this is the dual locative case in the two states of producing and not producing.

original: tad ayam artho janakāvasthāyām ajanakāvasthāyāṃ ca vastunaḥ dharmilakṣaṇasya bheda svabhāvanānātvam ata evaHBṬĀ /
analyzed: tat ayam arthaḥ janaka avasthāyām ajanaka avasthāyām ca vastunaḥ dharmi lakṣaṇasya bheda svabhāva nānātvam atas
translated: This is the meaning: the distinction of the characterized entity in the state of producing and in the state of not producing is the difference in its nature. For that very reason, it is said.

original: janakājanakasvabhāvatvād eva pratyakṣāvasitāt niśceyaḥ /
analyzed: janaka ajanaka svabhāva tvāt eva pratyakṣa avasitāt
translated: Because of the very nature of being a producer or non-producer, it should be ascertained from perception.

original: niścayalakṣaṇas tatra vyavahāraḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: niścaya lakṣaṇaḥ tatra vyavahāraḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: The activity characterized by ascertainment should be performed there.

original: viṣayasya S / / viruddhadharmādhyāsalakṣaṇasya darśanād iti /
analyzed: viṣayasya viruddha dharma adhyāsa lakṣaṇasya darśanāt iti
translated: Because of seeing the characteristic of the superimposition of contradictory properties on the object.

original: na ca śakyate vaktum avasthā evāṅkurādijananasvabhāvā nāvasthātā iti /
analyzed: na ca śakyate vaktum avasthā eva aṅkura ādi janana svabhāvā na avasthātā iti
translated: And it cannot be said that the states themselves have the nature of producing sprouts, etc., not the non-state.

original: tasya sarvasāmarthyavirahalakṣaṇasyāsattvaprasaṅgāt /🔽T / / tato yad ekarūpatayā pratyabhijñānaṃ bhaveṣu tat pūrvottarakālayor janakājanakasvabhāvabhedavyavasthāpakapratyakṣanibandhanām anubhavadbādhāṃ
analyzed: tasya sarva sāmarthya viraha lakṣaṇasya asattva prasaṅgāt  t tatas yat eka rūpa tayā pratyabhijñānam bhaveṣu tat pūrva uttara kālayoḥ janaka ajanaka svabhāva bheda vyavasthāpaka pratyakṣa nibandhanām anubhavat bādhām
translated: Because that would entail the consequence of non-existence, characterized by the absence of all capacity.

original: katham iva pramāṇaṃ syāt / /
analyzed: katham iva pramāṇam syāt
translated: Therefore, the recognition that occurs as a single form in the case of the selves, experiencing the basis of perception that establishes the difference in the nature of the producer and non-producer in the earlier and later times, how could it be a valid cognition, being contradicted?

original: tatpratibhāsinaś cābhinnarūpasyālīkatve 'kṣasamudbhavām api vṛttim anubhavato 'sya satsamprayogajatvābhāvāt taimirikādidhiyām iva kutaḥ pratyakṣatā /
analyzed: tad pratibhāsinaḥ ca abhinna rūpasya alīka tve kṣa samudbhavām api vṛttim anubhavataḥ sat samprayoga ja tva abhāvāt taimirika ādi dhiyām iva kutas pratyakṣa tā
translated: And even if the cognition arising from the sense organs experiences the appearance of that as a non-different form, because it lacks being produced from a real conjunction, how can it be perception, like the cognition of one with cataracts, etc.?

original: na p / / cārthakriyānibandhanaṃ rūpamapāsya bījāder aparaḥ paramārthataḥ svabhāvo 'sti /
analyzed: na ca artha kriyā nibandhanam rūpam apāsya bīja ādeḥ aparaḥ paramārthataḥ svabhāvaḥ sti
translated: And apart from the form that is the basis of practical efficacy, there is no other ultimate nature of the seed, etc.

original: yasyādhigamāt pratyabhijñānaṃ pramāṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yasya adhigamāt pratyabhijñānam pramāṇam bhavet
translated: From the cognition of which there would be recognition as a means of valid knowledge.

original: arthakriyāsāmarthyalakṣaṇatvāt paramārthasataḥ /
analyzed: artha kriyā sāmarthya lakṣaṇa tvāt paramārtha sataḥ
translated: Because what is ultimately real is characterized by the ability to perform a function.

original: tasmāt sadṛśāparabhāvanibandhana evāyaṃ keśakadalīstambādiṣv ivākārasāmyatāmātrāpahṛtahṛdayānāṃ bhrānta S / / eva tattvādhyavasāyo mantavyaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt sadṛśa apara bhāva nibandhanaḥ eva ayam keśa kadalī stamba ādiṣu iva ākāra sāmya tā mātra apahṛta hṛdayānām bhrāntaḥ eva tattva adhyavasāyaḥ mantavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, this ascertainment of reality should be considered as mistaken, based only on the appearance of similar things, like in the case of hair, a plantain tree, etc., for those whose hearts are carried away by mere similarity of appearance.

original: tataḥ sato 'pi pratikṣaṇaṃ bhedasyānupalakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: tatas pratikṣaṇam bhedasya anupalakṣaṇam
translated: Therefore, even though there is difference from moment to moment, it is not perceived by the ignorant.

original: bālānām / yadā tu vidhurapratyayopanipātād visadṛśāparabhāvaprasavaḥ tadā 'sya tattvādhyavasāyī pratyabhijñāpratyayo na bhūtim avalambate /
analyzed: bālānām yadā tu vidhura pratyaya upanipātāt visadṛśa apara bhāva prasavaḥ tadā tattva adhyavasāyī pratyabhijñā pratyayaḥ na bhūtim avalambate
translated: But when the production of a dissimilar subsequent thing occurs due to the combination of contradictory conditions, then this ascertainment of reality, the cognition of recognition, does not rely on existence.

original: na ca tadekākāraparāmarśapratyayajanakatvād aparaṃ sādṛśyam /
analyzed: na ca tad eka ākāra parāmarśa pratyaya janaka tvāt aparam sādṛśyam
translated: And there is no other similarity than the production of a cognition with a single form.

original: bhedā 'viśeṣe 'pi ca svahetubalāyāt aprakṛtivaśāt kecidevaikākāraparāmarśapratyayalakṣaṇām
analyzed: bhedāḥ viśeṣe ca aprakṛti vaśāt
translated: And even in the absence of difference, some, due to the power of their own causes, due to the power of their nature, perform the function of an object, characterized by the cognition of an object, etc.,

original: arthajñānādilakṣaṇāṃ vā 'rthakriyāṃ kurvanti nāpara iti vipañcitaṃpramāṇavārtika
analyzed: artha jñāna ādi lakṣaṇām vā rthakriyām kurvanti na apare iti
translated: or the function of an object characterized by a cognition of an object, etc., and not others. This has been discussed in the Pramana-vartika.

original: evaśāstrakṛteti neha prapañcyate /
analyzed: eva śāstra kṛtā iti na iha prapañcyate
translated: So it is not elaborated here by the author of the treatise.

original: In Tib / this passage anupalabdhyā to tayoḥ p / / line
analyzed: in tip this passage anupalabdhyā ta tayoḥ p
translated: In Tibetan, this passage from not perceived to of the two is

original: is read after svabhāvaḥ p / / line /
analyzed: is read after svabhāva p line
translated: read after nature in the Sanskrit.

original: tadā
analyzed: tadā
translated: Then,

original: parasparayātyantaṃ bhedābhedau vastvantare prasajye T /
analyzed: parasparayā atyantam bheda abhedau vastu antare prasajye
translated: the absolute difference and non-difference between each other would result in another entity.

original: pratyakṣa
analyzed: pratyakṣa
translated: Perception

original: yo hi yatsvabhāvaḥ ityādinā kathitasya /
analyzed: yaḥ hi yad svabhāvaḥ ityādinā kathitasya
translated: The one who is of such a nature, etc., is what was stated.

original: pratyakṣam
analyzed: pratyakṣam
translated: Perception

original: rūpālokādayaḥ
analyzed: rūpa āloka ādayaḥ
translated: Form, light, and so on

original: anumānenāpi pratyabhijñāyā bādhāt na tataḥ sthirabhāvasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: api
translated: Because recognition is also contradicted by inference, the establishment of a permanent entity is not from that.

original: avaśyaṃ ca bījāder janakājanakāvasthayor vastubhedo yathokto 'vagantavya iti darśayitum
analyzed: avaśyam ca bīja ādeḥ janaka ajanaka avasthayoḥ vastu bhedaḥ yathā uktaḥ vagantavyaḥ iti darśayitum
translated: And in order to show that the difference of entities of a seed, etc., in the states of producing and not producing must necessarily be understood as stated,

original: anumānam abhedasya T / / bādhakam āha bhāvānāṃ bījādīnāṃ svakāryajanako yaḥ
analyzed: anumānam abhedasya t bādhakam āha bhāvānām bīja ādīnām sva kārya janakaḥ yaḥ
translated: he states the inference that contradicts non-difference: The nature of entities such as seeds that produces its own effect,

original: svabhāvaḥ tasya teṣu satsu anyathātvābhāvāt /
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ tasya teṣu satsu
translated: because of the absence of any other state of those when they exist.

original: kadācid ajanakatvāsambhavāt S / / tatsvabhāvasya aṅkurādijanakasvabhāvasya
analyzed: kadācid ajanaka tva asambhavāt t tad svabhāvasya aṅkura ādi janaka svabhāvasya
translated: Because it is impossible for it to not produce at some time, that nature, the nature of producing a sprout, etc.,

original: paścād iva salilādikāraṇasannidhāna iva prāg api kuśūlādyavasthitikāle 'pi svakāryajananaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: paścāt iva salila ādi kāraṇa sannidhāne iva prāk api kuśūla ādi avasthiti kāle pi sva kārya janana prasaṅgāt
translated: would be connected to producing its own effect even before, at the time of remaining in a sheath, etc., as if the presence of water, etc., were later.

original: tatha hi salilādisannidhāne 'pi bījādiḥ svarūpeṇaiva kāryaṃ karoti /
analyzed: hi salila ādi sannidhāne bīja ādiḥ sva rūpeṇa eva kāryam karoti
translated: For, even in the presence of water etc., a seed etc. produces its effect by its own nature,

original: na pararūpeṇa /
analyzed: na para rūpeṇa
translated: not by the nature of another.

original: yaś cāsya tadā T / / kāryajanakaḥ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca asya tadā kārya janakaḥ svabhāvaḥ
translated: And if that nature of it which produces the effect at that time

original: sa cet prāg apy asti /
analyzed: sa ced prāk api asti
translated: existed previously,

original: sa evāyam' iti pratyabhijñāyāṃ puro 'vasthāyino janakasvabhāvasya prācyarūpābhedādhyavasāyāt /
analyzed: saḥ eva ayam iti pratyabhijñāyām puras janaka svabhāvasya prācya rūpa abheda adhyavasāyāt
translated: then it would be recognized as 'this is the same', because it is ascertained that the nature which produces the effect in front is not different from the previous form.

original: tataḥ kim iti prāg api tatkāryaṃ na kuryād iti / /
analyzed: tatas kim iti prāk api tad kāryam na kuryāt iti
translated: Then what? It should not produce that effect previously either.

original: prayogaḥ yad yadā yajjananasvabhāvaṃ tat tadā tajjanayaty eva /
analyzed: prayogaḥ yat yadā yad janana svabhāvam tat tadā tat janayati eva
translated: The argument is: Whatever has the nature of producing something at a certain time, it produces that at that time,

original: ajanakasya janakatvasvabhāvavirodhāt /
analyzed: ajanakasya janaka tva svabhāva virodhāt
translated: because it is contradictory for that which does not produce to have the nature of producing.

original: anyasyāpi vā tatsvabhāvatāpatteḥ
analyzed: anyasya api vā tad svabhāva tā āpatteḥ
translated: Or because another would also come to have that nature,

original: yathā tad eva bījādikaṃ salilādisannidhikāle /
analyzed: yathā tat eva bīja ādikam salila ādi sannidhi kāle
translated: just as that same seed etc. at the time of the presence of water etc.

original: kuśūlādyavasthāsv api cedaṃ bījādikaṃ svakāryajananasvabhāvam p / / eva pratyabhijñayā vyavasthāpyata iti svabhāvahetuprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: kuśūla ādi avasthāsu api ca idam bīja ādikam sva kārya janana svabhāvam eva pratyabhijñayā vyavasthāpyate iti svabhāva hetu prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And if it is established by recognition that this seed etc. has the nature of producing its own effect even in the states of the threshing floor etc., then it is a logical consequence of the reason based on nature.

original: na ca janayati /
analyzed: na ca janayati
translated: And it does not produce.

original: tasmān na tajjananasvabhāvam iti /
analyzed: tasmāt na tad janana svabhāvam iti
translated: Therefore it does not have the nature of producing that.

original: viparyayaprayogaḥ yad yadā yajjananasvabhāvaṃva
analyzed: viparyaya prayogaḥ yat yadā yad janana svabhāvam vai
translated: The contrary argument is: Whatever has the nature of producing something at a certain time,
