original: nahi yo yasya svabhāvo na bhavati sa tenātmanā svagrāhiṇi jñāne pratibhāsate /
analyzed: yaḥ yasya svabhāvaḥ na bhavati sa tena ātmanā sva grāhiṇi jñāne pratibhāsate
translated: For that which is not the nature of something does not appear in the cognition that apprehends it as having that nature.

original: rūparasavat /
analyzed: rūpa rasa vat
translated: Like form and taste.

original: jñānaṃ vā tadrūpavikalārthasāmarthyenotpadyamānaṃ tadrūpam anukartuṃ yuktam /
analyzed: jñānam vā tad rūpa vikala artha sāmarthyena utpadyamānam tad rūpam anukartum yuktam
translated: Or it is proper for cognition, arising with the capacity for an object lacking that form, to imitate that form.

original: p / / bhrāntatāprasaṅgena tadvaśād arthavyavasthānābhāvaprasakteḥ /
analyzed: bhrānta tā prasaṅgena tad vaśāt artha vyavasthāna abhāva prasakteḥ
translated: because of the consequence of the non-existence of the establishment of meaning due to that.

original: tasmāt mṛtsaṃsthānayor ekātmataiveti T / / na kāraṇānekatvāt kāryasyānekātmakatā aikāntikī /
analyzed: tasmāt mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ eka ātma tā eva iti na kāraṇa aneka tvāt kāryasya aneka ātmaka tā aikāntikī
translated: Therefore, the form and clay are of the same nature, so the multiplicity of the effect is not absolute due to the multiplicity of causes.

original: yato bhinnasvabhāvebhyaś cakṣurādibhyaḥ sahakāribhyaḥ ekakāryotpattivirodhād
analyzed: yatas bhinna svabhāvebhyaḥ cakṣuḥ ādibhyaḥ sahakāribhyaḥ eka kārya utpatti virodhāt
translated: Because it is contradictory for a single effect to arise from different inherently different cooperating factors such as the eye, etc.

original: ekarūpatayā teṣāṃ sādhāraṇaikakāryakriyā /
analyzed: eka rūpa tayā teṣām sādhāraṇa eka kārya kriyā
translated: They perform a single common effect in the form of unity.

original: bhinnarūpatayā vā sādhāraṇakāryakaraṇam iyeta /
analyzed: bhinna rūpa tayā vā sādhāraṇa kārya karaṇam iyeta
translated: Or they would perform a common effect in the form of difference.

original: S / / etac caikasāmagryapekṣayaikakāryakartṛtvam ucyate /
translated: And this is said to be the performance of a single effect in relation to a single assemblage.

original: paramārthatas tu tatsāmagryantarggatānāṃ sajātīyasyā 'pi kṣaṇāntarasyārambhāt sāmagryantarāvayavatvena
analyzed: paramārthataḥ tu tad sāmagrī antarggatānām sajātīyasya a pi kṣaṇa antarasya ārambhāt sāmagrī antara avayava tvena
translated: But in reality, because a subsequent moment of the same type is produced within that assemblage, and because it is a part of another assemblage,

original: ca kāryāntarasyāpi yathā ekapratyayajanitaṃ kiñcid ekaṃ nāsti tathā 'nekapratyayajanitam
analyzed: ca kārya antarasya api yathā eka pratyaya janitam kiñcid ekam na asti tathā neka pratyaya janitam
translated: and because another effect is also produced, just as something produced by a single condition does not exist as a single thing, so also what is produced by many conditions.

original: apīti kāraṇānekatvāt kāryānekatvopagame 'pi na kācit kṣatiḥ /
analyzed: api iti kāraṇa aneka tvāt kārya aneka tva upagame pi na kācid kṣatiḥ
translated: Thus, even when the multiplicity of effects is accepted due to the multiplicity of causes, there is no harm at all.

original: tata ekakāryāpekṣayā 'nekatvaprasañjane sandigdhavyatirekatā /
analyzed: tatas eka kārya apekṣayā neka tva prasañjane sandigdha vyatireka tā
translated: Therefore, when multiplicity is urged in relation to a single effect, there is doubt about the vyatireka.

original: sāmānyena sādhane siddhasādhyateti ca /
analyzed: sāmānyena sādhane siddha sādhya tā iti ca
translated: And the proof is superfluous if it is meant in a general way.🔽The negative example is

original: śaktiviśeṣaviṣayasya🔽vyatirekī
analyzed: śakti viśeṣa viṣayasya  vyatirekī
translated: for one who has a special capacity for it.

original: ahrīkādisaṃmatasya dravyaparyāyayoḥ bhedābhedapakṣasya nirāsaḥ /
translated: The refutation of the view that there is difference and non-difference between substance and attribute, which is accepted by the shameless and others.

original: nanu ca mṛtsaṃsthānaviśeṣayor ekasvabhāvatve 'pyahrīkādibhiḥ saṅkhyādibhedād bheda iṣyate tat katham anekapratyayajanitasyaikatve etad udāharanām 🔽syāt / /
analyzed: nanu ca mṛd saṃsthāna viśeṣayoḥ eka svabhāva tve pi ahrīka ādibhiḥ saṅkhyā ādi bhedāt bhedaḥ iṣyate tat katham aneka pratyaya janitasya ekatve etat  syāt
translated: But even if the clay and the particular shape are of the same nature, the shameless and others consider them to be different because of the difference in number and other properties. How then can this be cited as an example for the oneness of what is produced by many conditions?

original: sarvatraiva hi dravyaparyāyayoḥ saṅkhyāsaṃjñālakṣaṇakāryabhedād bhedo deśakālasvabhāvābhedāc cābheda iṣyate /
analyzed: sarvatra eva hi dravya paryāyayoḥ saṅkhyā saṃjñā lakṣaṇa kārya bhedāt bhedaḥ deśa kāla svabhāva abhedāt ca abhedaḥ iṣyate
translated: For in every case, difference is accepted between substance and attribute because of the difference in number, name, definition, and function, and non-difference because of the non-difference in place, time, and nature.

original: yathā ghaṭasya rūpādīnāṃ ca /
analyzed: yathā ghaṭasya rūpa ādīnām ca
translated: Just as between a pot and its color and other properties.

original: tathā hi eko ghaṭaḥ rūpādayo bahava iti saṅkhyābhedaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi ekaḥ ghaṭaḥ rūpa ādayaḥ bahavaḥ iti saṅkhyā bhedaḥ
translated: For thus, the pot is one, while color and other properties are many - this is the difference in number.

original: ghataḥ rūpādayaḥ iti saṃjñābhedaḥ /
analyzed: ghataḥ rūpa ādayaḥ iti saṃjñā bhedaḥ
translated: The pot, color and other properties - this is the difference in name.

original: anuvṛttilakṣaṇaṃ dravyavan nityaṃ ca /🔽vyāvṛttilakṣaṇā S / / bhedāḥ kṣaṇikāś ca /
analyzed: anuvṛtti lakṣaṇam dravyavat nityam ca  vyāvṛtti lakṣaṇā s bhedāḥ kṣaṇikāḥ ca
translated: The definition of the universal is that it is like a substance, eternal.🔽The definitions of the particulars are that they are different, momentary.

original: jaiminīyasya tu T / / kecit kālāntarasthāyino 'pīti lakṣaṇabhedaḥ /
analyzed: jaiminīyasya tu kecid kāla antara sthāyinaḥ pi iti lakṣaṇa bhedaḥ
translated: But for the followers of Jaimini, some of them last for a while, so there is a difference in definition.

original: ghaṭenodakāharaṇaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: ghaṭena udaka āharaṇam kriyate
translated: Water is carried by the pot.

original: rūpādibhiḥ punarvasturāga iti kāryabhedaḥ /
analyzed: rūpa ādibhiḥ punar vastu rāgaḥ iti kārya bhedaḥ
translated: But the difference in effect is that there is attachment to a substance through form etc.

original: evaṃ sarvatra dravyaparyāyayoḥ saṅkhyādibhir bhedaḥ deśādibhis tv abheda iti mṛtsaṃsthānayoḥ kathañcit bhedāt mṛtkulālābhyāṃ janitasya kāryasyānekatā 🔽'sty eva /
analyzed: evam sarvatra dravya paryāyayoḥ saṅkhyā ādibhiḥ bhedaḥ deśa ādibhiḥ tu abhedaḥ iti mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ kathañcid bhedāt mṛd kulālābhyām janitasya kāryasya aneka tā  / sti eva
translated: Thus everywhere, the difference between substance and attribute is through number etc., but the non-difference is through space etc. Since there is some difference between clay and shape, the effect produced by clay and potter is indeed manifold.

original: yathā tv ekatātathā tābhyāṃtasya abhinnātmajanyataiveti
analyzed: yathā tu abhinna ātma janya tā eva iti
translated: But it is as one. Thus, it is produced by an undifferentiated self by those two.

original: yad anekakāraṇaṃ tad anekam eva /
analyzed: yat aneka kāraṇam tat anekam eva
translated: Therefore, what has many causes is indeed manifold.

original: yat punar ekaṃ tat sahakāriṇām abhinnarūpajanyatayaikakāraṇam eveti na vyabhicāra iti /
analyzed: yat punar ekam tat sahakāriṇām abhinna rūpa janya tayā eka kāraṇam eva iti na vyabhicāraḥ iti
translated: But what is one is produced by causes having an undifferentiated form, and has only one cause. Thus there is no fallacy.

original: p / / tad ayuktam /
analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is not correct.

original: svabhāvato bhedānabhyupagame anyathābhedāsiddheḥ anekasmād ekakāryotpatter abhādhanāt /
analyzed: svabhāvataḥ bheda an abhyupagame anekasmāt eka kārya utpatteḥ
translated: Because if the difference is not accepted as inherent, the difference is not established otherwise, and because the production of a single effect from many is not contradicted.

original: svabhāvato bhedopagame vā 'parasparātmatayā mṛtsaṃsthānayoḥ saṃsthānamṛtsvabhāvaviśeṣābhyāṃ tayor apratibhāsanaṃ durnnivāram /
analyzed: svabhāvataḥ bheda upagame vā paraspara ātma tayā mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ saṃsthāna mṛd svabhāva viśeṣābhyām tayoḥ a pratibhāsanam durnnivāram
translated: Or if the difference is accepted as inherent, it is difficult to avoid the non-appearance of clay and shape as having mutually different natures, due to the difference in the nature of shape and clay.

original: yadi hi svabhāvato na bhedo dharmadharmiṇoḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi svabhāvataḥ na bhedaḥ dharma dharmiṇoḥ
translated: For if there is no difference in nature between the attribute and the possessor of the attribute,

original: saṅkhyādibhedād api naiva bhedaḥ /
analyzed: saṅkhyā ādi bhedāt api nā eva bhedaḥ
translated: there would be no difference even due to the difference in number etc.

original: na hi pararūpāḥ bhidyamānā api saṅkhyādaya ātmabhūtam abhedaṃ bādhituṃ samarthāḥ /
analyzed: na hi para rūpāḥ bhidyamānāḥ api saṅkhyā ādayaḥ ātma bhūtam abhedam bādhitum samarthāḥ
translated: For even when the number etc. are differentiated in the form of others, they are not able to negate the non-differentiation which is their own nature.

original: saṅkhyābhedas tāvad asamarthaḥ /
analyzed: saṅkhyā bhedaḥ tāvat asamarthaḥ
translated: First, the difference in number is not able [to negate non-differentiation].

original: ekasminn api dravye bahutvena vyavahāradarśanāt /
analyzed: ekasmin api dravye bahu tvena vyavahāra darśanāt
translated: Because even in one substance, usage as many is seen,

original: yathā gurava iti /
analyzed: yathā guravaḥ iti
translated: like in the heavy ones.

original: na ca bahuvacanasya niyamenādarśanād rūpādayo 'tra nimittam /
analyzed: na ca bahuvacanasya niyamena adarśanāt rūpa ādayaḥ nimittam
translated: And it is not that form etc. are the cause here because the plural is not seen to be restricted.

original: rūpādinimittatve hi guruḥ iti na kadācit ekavacanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: rūpa ādi nimitta tve hi guruḥ iti na kadācid ekavacanam syāt
translated: For if form etc. were the cause, the heavy one would never be in the singular.

original: S / / sambhavi dharmirūpamātram abhidheyatvena vivakṣitam iti cet / na /
analyzed: sambhavi dharmi rūpa mātram abhidheya tvena vivakṣitam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that only the form of the substance which is possible is intended to be denoted as the object, it is not so.

original: tasyaikatvena vivakṣāyāṃ kārtsnyagauravayor apratītiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: tasya eka tvena vivakṣāyām kārtsnya gauravayoḥ apratīti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if it is intended to be one, the whole and heaviness would not be understood.

original: vrīhaya iti ca jātivacane T / / dharmiṇo rūpādīnāṃ cānabhidhānāt na kiñcid uttaram /
analyzed: vrīhayaḥ iti ca jāti vacane t dharmiṇaḥ rūpa ādīnām ca anabhidhānāt na kiñcid uttaram
translated: And because in the word rice, which denotes a class, the form etc. of the substance are not denoted, there is no answer at all.

original: ubhayarūpasya ca vastuno guruśabdavācyatvāt kathaṃ sambhavino dharmirūpasyaikatvena vivakṣā / /
analyzed: ubhaya rūpasya ca vastunaḥ guru śabda vācya tvāt katham sambhavinaḥ dharmi rūpasya eka tvena vivakṣā
translated: And because a thing which is of both forms is denoted by the word heavy, how is it that the form of the substance which is possible is intended to be one?

original: tataś caiko gurur iti sāmānādhikaraṇy adarśanāt paryāyā apy ekasaṃkhyāviṣayāḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca ekaḥ guruḥ iti sāmānādhikaraṇī adarśanāt paryāyāḥ api eka saṃkhyā viṣayāḥ
translated: And because of the non-appearance of co-reference in one heavy one, the synonyms are also the objects of the number one.

original: te ca paryāyarūpeṇa bhidyante /
analyzed: te ca paryāya rūpeṇa bhidyante
translated: And they are distinguished by their synonymity.

original: tat kathaṃ saṃkhyābhedād bhedasiddhiḥ / iti /
analyzed: tat katham saṃkhyā bhedāt bheda siddhiḥ iti
translated: So how is the establishment of difference by the difference in number?

original: saṃjñā 'pi saṅketanibandhanā /
analyzed: saṃjñā pi saṅketa nibandhanā
translated: And the name is based on convention.

original: sa cecchāyattavṛttir iti kutas tato 'rthabhedaḥ / /
analyzed: sa ca icchā āyatta vṛttiḥ iti kutas tatas rtha bhedaḥ
translated: And that operates dependent on desire. So how is the difference of meaning from that?

original: ekasminn api saṃjñābhedadṛṣṭeḥ katham asya bhedanimittatā / /
analyzed: ekasmin api saṃjñā bheda dṛṣṭeḥ katham asya bheda nimitta tā
translated: And how is this the cause of difference when the difference of name is seen even in one thing?

original: yathā indraḥ śakraḥ purandaraḥ iti /
analyzed: yathā indraḥ śakraḥ purandaraḥ iti
translated: As Indra, Shakra, Purandara.

original: atrāpi indanāt śakanāt dāraṇāc ca śaktibhedo gamyata iti cet / na /
analyzed: atra api indanāt śakanāt dāraṇāt ca śakti bhedaḥ gamyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that here also the difference in power is understood from shaking, being able, and splitting, it is not so.

original: samastasya kāryakartṛtvāt /
analyzed: samastasya kārya kartṛ tvāt
translated: Because the whole is the agent of the action.

original: na hi śaktir eva indati śaknoti dārayati ca /
analyzed: na hi śaktiḥ eva indati śaknoti dārayati ca
translated: For power alone does not shake, is able, and splits.

original: kiṃ tarhi / /
analyzed: kim tarhi
translated: Then what?

original: dharmirūpam api /
analyzed: dharmi rūpam api
translated: The nature of the possessor also.

original: tayor ekasvabhāvopagamāt /🔽śaknotyādipadais tadvācināṃ sāmānādhikaraṇy adarśanāc ca /
analyzed: tayoḥ eka svabhāva upagamāt  śaknoti ādi padaiḥ tad vācinām sāmānādhikaraṇī adarśanāt ca
translated: Because they are accepted as having the same nature.🔽And because the co-reference is not seen with words expressing that beginning with is able.

original: nacāskhaladvūttipratyayaviṣayatvād upacārakalpanā yukteti /
analyzed: upacāra kalpanā yuktā iti
translated: And the assumption of figurative usage is not proper because of being the object of a non-erroneous cognition.

original: yeṣāṃ ca paryāyāṇāṃ na kācid arthānugamamātrā tatra kiṃ vaktavyam / /
analyzed: yeṣām ca paryāyāṇām na kācid artha anugama mātrā tatra kim vaktavyam
translated: And what need be said about those synonyms which have no meaning at all?

original: lakṣaṇabhedo 'py ahetuḥ asiddhatvāt /
analyzed: lakṣaṇa bhedaḥ pi ahetuḥ asiddha tvāt
translated: The difference in definition is also not a reason because it is unestablished.

original: na hy eko bhāvaḥ kvacid apy anvayī siddha iti /
analyzed: na hi ekaḥ bhāvaḥ kvacid api anvayī siddhaḥ iti
translated: For no single entity is established as connected with anything anywhere.

original: tathā hi na kūṭasthanityatayā nityaṃ p / / dravyamahrīkair iṣyate /
analyzed: tathā hi na kūṭastha nitya tayā nityam dravya mahrīkaiḥ iṣyate
translated: Thus, the substance is not accepted as eternal by the shameless ones through immutable eternality.

original: pariṇāmaS / /nityatopagamāt /
analyzed: pariṇāmaḥ
translated: It is accepted as eternal through transformation.

original: sā ca pūrvottarakṣaṇaprabandhavṛttyā /
analyzed: sā ca pūrva uttara kṣaṇa prabandha vṛttyā
translated: And that [transformation] occurs through the continuity of moments before and after.

original: na hy asya paryāyāṇām ivocchedaḥ tadrūpeṇa /
analyzed: na hi asya paryāyāṇām iva ucchedaḥ
translated: For this [substance] is not destroyed in the form of its parts, like the parts.

original: paryāyā T / / eva paryāyarūpeṇa nirudhyante na tu dravyam iti nityam abhyupagamyate /
analyzed: paryāyāḥ t eva paryāya rūpeṇa nirudhyante na tu dravyam iti nityam abhyupagamyate
translated: The parts are indeed ceased in the form of the parts, but the substance is not, thus it is accepted as eternal.

original: na kūṭasthanityatā vā dravye sambhavati /
analyzed: na vā dravye
translated: Or immutable eternality is not possible for a substance.

original: paryāyavyatiriktasya dravyasyāsiddheḥ tasyopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasya tadvivekānupalakṣaṇāt /
analyzed: paryāya vyatiriktasya dravyasya asiddheḥ tasya upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya tad viveka anupalakṣaṇāt
translated: Because a substance separate from the parts is not established, and that [substance] is not perceived as distinct from them, being perceptible.

original: paryāyeṣv eva tulyarūpakāryakartṛṣu dravyābhimāno mandamatīnām /
analyzed: paryāyeṣu eva tulya rūpa kārya kartṛṣu dravya abhimānaḥ manda matīnām
translated: The notion of substance arises in the slow-witted regarding the parts themselves, which perform similar functions.

original: na punas tat tato vilakṣaṇam upalakṣyate /
analyzed: na punar tat tatas vilakṣaṇam upalakṣyate
translated: But it is not perceived as distinct from them.

original: kāryabhedas tv asmān prati asiddha eva /
analyzed: kārya bhedaḥ tu asmān prati asiddhaḥ eva
translated: But the difference in effects is not established for us.

original: rūpādīnām eva keṣāñcit tatkāryakartṛtvāt/
analyzed: rūpa ādīnām eva keṣāñcid
translated: Because only some of the forms, etc. perform that effect.

original: tathāpy abhyupagyamyocyate kāryaṃ hi dvividham /
analyzed: tathā api abhyupagyamya ucyate kāryam hi dvividham
translated: Even so, it is said while accepting: An effect is of two kinds.

original: bhinnakālam abhinnakālaṃ ca /
analyzed: bhinna kālam a bhinna kālam ca
translated: [The difference is] between what is of different times and what is of the same time.

original: tatra pūrvaṃ bhavati bhedanibandhanam yadīha sambhavet /
analyzed: tatra pūrvam bhavati bheda nibandhanam yadi iha sambhavet
translated: Of these, the former is the basis of difference if it could exist here.

original: tat tu na sambhavati dharmadharmiṇos tulyakālatvāt /
analyzed: tat tu na sambhavati dharma dharmiṇoḥ tulya kāla tvāt
translated: But that is not possible, because the property and the possessor of the property are of the same time.

original: abhinnakālas tu kāryabhede 'naikāntikaḥ /🔽vibhaktapariṇāmeṣu paṭādiṣu sambhavāt /
analyzed: abhinna kālaḥ tu kārya bhede na aikāntikaḥ  vibhakta pariṇāmeṣu paṭa ādiṣu sambhavāt
translated: But in the case of difference in effect, [the reason] is inconclusive,🔽because it is possible in the case of cloth, etc., which are differentiated transformations.

original: paṭādayo 'pi hi vibhaktapariṇāmā anekaṃ kāryaṃ kurvanto dṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: paṭa ādayaḥ pi hi vibhakta pariṇāmāḥ anekam kāryam kurvantaḥ dṛṣṭāḥ
translated: For cloth, etc., which are differentiated transformations, are seen to perform many effects.

original: na ca dharmirūpeṇa bhidyante /
analyzed: na ca dharmi rūpeṇa bhidyante
translated: And they are not differentiated by the form of the possessor of the property.

original: ekasyānekakiyāvirodhābhāvāc ca /
analyzed: ekasya aneka kiyā virodha abhāvāt ca
translated: And because there is no contradiction in one thing performing many actions.

original: na hy atra kāraṇam eva kāryātmatām upaiti /
analyzed: na hi atra kāraṇam eva kārya ātma tām upaiti
translated: For here the cause itself does not assume the nature of the effect,

original: yata ekasya kāraṇātmanaḥ ekakāryarūpatopagame tadanyarūpābhāvāt tadanyakāryātmatopagatir na syāt /
analyzed: yatas ekasya kāraṇa ātmanaḥ eka kārya rūpa tā upagame tad anya rūpa abhāvāt tad anya kārya ātma tā upagatiḥ na syāt
translated: because when one cause is accepted as having the form of one effect, due to the absence of another form, the acceptance of the nature of another effect would not be possible.

original: kintv apūrvam eva kasyacid bhāve prāgavidyamānaṃ bhavat tatkāryam /
analyzed: kintu apūrvam eva kasyacid bhāve prāk a vidyamānam bhavat tat kāryam
translated: But rather, when something comes into existence, a new thing that did not exist before becomes its effect.

original: tatra viṣayendriyamanaskārāṇām itaretaropādānāhitarūpabhedānāṃ S /
analyzed: tatra viṣaya indriya manaskārāṇām itaretara upādāna āhita rūpa bhedānām s
translated: In that case, the objects, sense faculties, and mental factors, which have forms produced by mutual dependence, are the causes of the cognition of the object.

original: sannidhau viśiṣṭasvetarakṣaṇabhāve pratyekaṃ tadbhāvābhāvānuT / /vidhānād anekakriyopagamo
analyzed: sannidhau viśiṣṭa svetara kṣaṇa bhāve pratyekam tad bhāva abhāva
translated: When something is present, and there is the existence of its own superior and other moments, the non-occurrence of each of those is not determined. Therefore, the acceptance of multiple actions

original: na virudhyate /
analyzed: na virudhyate
translated: is not contradictory.

original: yata ekakriyāyām api tasyatadbhāvabhāvitaiva nibandhanam /
translated: Because even in a single action, that is the basis for its existence.

original: sā cānekakriyāyām api samāneti /
analyzed: sā ca aneka kriyāyām api samānā iti
translated: And that is the same even in multiple actions.

original: nanu ca tatsannidhau vijñānalakṣaṇakāryasambhavāt tajjananasvabhāvataivaiṣām avadhriyate /
analyzed: nanu ca tad sannidhau vijñāna lakṣaṇa kārya sambhavāt tad janana svabhāva tā eva eṣām avadhriyate
translated: But isn't it that their nature to generate that is determined from the possibility of the effect characterized by consciousness in its presence?

original: kāryasvabhāvāpekṣayā kāraṇasya janakarūpatāvasthānāt /
analyzed: kārya svabhāva apekṣayā kāraṇasya janaka rūpa tā avasthānāt
translated: Because the cause remains in the form of a generator in relation to the nature of the effect.

original: tato vijñānajananasvabhāvebhyaḥ pratyekaṃ kataṃ p / / tadanyakāryasambhavaḥ / /
analyzed: tatas vijñāna janana svabhāvebhyaḥ pratyekam tad anya kārya sambhavaḥ
translated: Then, how is the possibility of other effects from each of those with the nature to generate consciousness?

original: tadbhāve vā teṣāṃ tadanyajananasvabhāvatā syāt /
analyzed: tad bhāve vā teṣām tad anya janana svabhāva tā syāt
translated: Or if it exists, their nature to generate other things would be that.

original: tataś ca vijñānam eva na kuryuḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca vijñānam eva na kuryuḥ
translated: And from that, they would not produce consciousness itself.

original: tadanyajananasvabhāvatvāt /
analyzed: tad anya janana svabhāva tvāt
translated: Because of having the nature to generate other things.

original: naiṣa doṣaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: teṣām anekakāryakriyāsvabhāvatvāt /
analyzed: teṣām aneka kārya kriyā svabhāva tvāt
translated: Because they have the nature to perform multiple effects.

original: tathā hi te tadavasthāyāṃ pratyekaṃ viśiṣṭasajātīyetarakṣāṇajananātmakāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi te tad avasthāyām pratyekam viśiṣṭa sajātīya itara kṣāṇa janana ātmakāḥ
translated: Thus, in that state, each of them has the nature to generate its own superior homogeneous and other moments.

original: teṣāṃ tatsattānantaryadarśanāt /
analyzed: teṣām tad sattā ānantarya darśanāt
translated: Because their existence is seen immediately after that.

original: tatra vijñānajananasvabhāvataiveti tasyājananasvabhāvatā vyavacchidyate tasyā eva pratiyogitvāt nānyajananasvabhavatā /
analyzed: tatra vijñāna janana svabhāva tā eva iti tasya a janana svabhāva tā vyavacchidyate tasyāḥ eva pratiyogi tvāt na anya janana svabhava tā
translated: There, the very nature of generating consciousness is excluded from the nature of not generating it, because that [nature of not generating] is its counter-correlate, not the nature of generating something else.

original: na cātas teṣām anekātmatā syāt /
analyzed: na ca atas teṣām aneka ātma tā syāt
translated: And from this, they [the atoms] would not have multiple natures.

original: ekasyaivātmātiśayasyānekakāryahetutvāt /
analyzed: ekasya eva ātma atiśayasya aneka kārya hetu tvāt
translated: Because a single special nature is the cause of multiple effects.

original: na hi tadanyāpekṣayā viparyayavyāvṛttim upādāyānekena śabdenābhidhīyamānaṃ vastu anekarūpatāṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: na hi tad anya apekṣayā viparyaya vyāvṛttim upādāya anekena śabdena abhidhīyamānam vastu aneka rūpatām pratipadyate
translated: For a thing that is designated by multiple words, in dependence on the exclusion of the opposite in relation to something else, does not acquire multiple forms.

original: prativiśiṣṭasyaikasyaivātmanas tathābhidhānāt /
analyzed: prativiśiṣṭasya ekasya eva ātmanaḥ tathā abhidhānāt
translated: Because a single distinguished nature is designated in that way.

original: yathā S / / rūpaṃ sanidarśanaṃ sapratigham iti /
analyzed: yathā s rūpam sa nidarśanam sa pratigham iti
translated: Like form is visible and resistant.

original: na hy atra svabhāvabhedanibandhanā dhvanayaḥ /
analyzed: na hi atra svabhāva bheda nibandhanāḥ dhvanayaḥ
translated: For here, the denotations are not based on the difference of intrinsic nature.

original: sāmānādhikaraṇyābhāvaprasaṅgāt /🔽tannimittānāmekatrabhāvāt adoṣa iti cet /
analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya abhāva prasaṅgāt  adoṣaḥ iti ced
translated: Because of the consequence of the absence of co-reference.🔽If it is said that there is no fault because the causes of that [co-reference] exist in one [thing],

original: apekṣāyāṃ vā katham ekam anekaT / /kāryaṃ na syāt / /
analyzed: apekṣāyām vā katham ekam an ekat na syāt
translated: then how can one be the effect of many, if it is said [that one is the effect of many] because the nature is useful to many?

original: anekenaivātmanopayogāt iti cet / na / na /🔽sāmānādhikaraṇyābhāvadoṣasya tādavasthyaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anekena eva ātmanā upayogāt iti ced na na  sāmānādhikaraṇya abhāva doṣasya tādavasthya prasaṅgāt
translated: No, because the fault of the absence of co-reference would follow as before.

original: na ca nīlādīnām ātmabhedam adhyakṣam īkṣāmahe/
analyzed: na ca nīla ādīnām ātma bhedam adhyakṣam
translated: And we do not perceive a difference in the nature of blue, etc. by direct perception.

original: nāpi kāryabhedād evātmabhedānumānam /
analyzed: nā api kārya bhedāt eva ātma bheda anumānam
translated: Nor can the difference of souls be inferred from the difference of effects,

original: pratibandābhāvāt /
analyzed: pratibandā abhāvāt
translated: because there is no invariable concomitance.

original: tadgrāhakapramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: tad grāhaka pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no means of knowing that.

original: pratyakṣato 'nekakāryāṇām api bhāvānām ekātmatayaivopalakṣaṇāt pradīpādīnām /
analyzed: pratyakṣataḥ neka kāryāṇām api bhāvānām eka ātma tayā eva upalakṣaṇāt pradīpa ādīnām
translated: Because even many effects are observed to be of the same nature by perception, like a lamp and so on.

original: tatrāpi viparyaye bādhakapramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: tatra api viparyaye bādhaka pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no means of refutation in the case of that.

original: ekasyānekakriyā 'nabhyupagame ca yo 'yaṃ rūparasagandhasparśaviśeṣāṇāṃ kvacit sahabhāvaniyamaḥ pramāṇaparidṛṣṭaḥ sa na syāt /
analyzed: ekasya aneka kriyā an abhyupagame ca yaḥ yam rūpa rasa gandha sparśa viśeṣāṇām kvacid sahabhāva niyamaḥ pramāṇa paridṛṣṭaḥ sa na syāt
translated: And if one does not accept the many actions of one, then this restriction of the simultaneous existence of color, taste, smell and touch in some place, which is seen by valid cognition, would not exist.

original: bhinnanimittānāṃ sahabhāvaniyamāyogāt /
analyzed: bhinna nimittānām sahabhāva niyama ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible for different causes to have a restriction of simultaneous existence.

original: tannimittānāmapi tadekakāraṇānāyattajanmanāṃ S / / niyatasāhityāsambhavāt /
analyzed: tad eka kāraṇa anāyatta janmanām niyata sāhitya asambhavāt
translated: And because it is not possible for the causes of that, which are dependent on the birth of that one cause, to have a fixed association.

original: tadekadharmisvabhāvatayaikatra sahabhāvaniyama iti cet / na /
analyzed: tad eka dharmi svabhāva tayā ekatra sahabhāva niyamaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the restriction of simultaneous existence in one place is due to the nature of being the same substance, that is not so.

original: ekasyānekasvabhāvatāyā eva cintyatvāt /
analyzed: ekasya aneka svabhāva tāyāḥ eva cintya tvāt
translated: Because the nature of one being many is itself to be considered.

original: anekenaikasvabhāvatāṃ cānubhavataḥ tadvadanekatāyā durnivāratvāt anyathā dharmadharmiṇāṃ kathaṃ p / / naikāntiko bhedaḥ / /
analyzed: anekena eka svabhāva tām ca anubhavataḥ durnivāra tvāt anyathā dharma dharmiṇām katham na aikāntikaḥ bhedaḥ
translated: And because the impossibility of multiplicity in that way is hard to avoid for one who experiences the nature of one being many, otherwise how could the relation of attribute and substance be absolutely different?

original: tathā hi yam ātmānaṃ purodhāyā 'yaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi yam ātmānam purodhāyāḥ yam
translated: Thus, this [soul] which is in front,

original: dharmī paryāyāś caite iti vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: dharmī paryāyāḥ ca ete iti vyavasthāpyate
translated: It is established that these are the properties and the synonyms.

original: yadi tasya bhedas tadā bheda eveti /
analyzed: yadi tasya bhedaḥ tadā bhedaḥ eva iti
translated: If there is difference in that [property], then there is only difference.

original: anekasyāpyekakāryatā na syāt/
analyzed: na
translated: Many things would not have a single effect.

original: na hi parasparopādānakṛtopakārānapekṣā viṣayendriyamanaskārāḥ sahaikakāryārambhiṇo yuktāḥ /
analyzed: na hi paraspara upādāna kṛta upakāra anapekṣāḥ viṣaya indriya manaskārāḥ saha eka kārya ārambhiṇaḥ yuktāḥ
translated: For it is not reasonable that sense objects, sense faculties, and attention, which do not depend on mutual assistance produced by each other, should together produce a single effect.

original: na caikam eva kiñcit kvacit janayati /
analyzed: na ca ekam eva kiñcid kvacid janayati
translated: And nothing produces anything anywhere by itself.

original: tataś ca sarvatra kāryakāraṇabhāva evotsīdet /
analyzed: tatas ca sarvatra kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ eva utsīdet
translated: And from that, the relation of cause and effect would perish everywhere.

original: anekasyaikasyacaikānekakriyāvirahāt prakārāntarābhāvāc ca /
analyzed: prakāra antara abhāvāt ca
translated: Because many and one do not have the activity of one or many, and because there is no other mode.

original: nāpy ahetukam eva viṣvam /
analyzed: na api ahetukam eva viṣvam
translated: Nor is the universe causeless.

original: T / / deśakālaprakṛtiniyamāt/
analyzed: t
translated: Because of the restrictions of place, time, and nature.

original: tasmād ekasāmagryadhīnajanmanāmeva sahabhāvaniyamo bhāvānām ekakāryakriyāniyamo vā /
analyzed: tasmāt eka sāmagrī adhīna janmanām eva sahabhāva niyamaḥ bhāvānām eka kārya kriyā niyamaḥ vā
translated: Therefore, only things whose birth depends on the same assemblage have the restriction of simultaneous existence, or the restriction of producing a single effect.

original: tataś ca svasantānakṣaṇam itaropādānaṃca yugapad upakurvataḥ katham ekasyānekakāryatā na syāt / /
analyzed: tatas ca sva santāna kṣaṇam yugapad upakurvataḥ katham ekasya aneka kārya tā na syāt
translated: And from that, how could a single thing not have many effects, when it assists its own continuum and the other material causes simultaneously?

original: tataḥ kathaṃ kāryabhedād bhedaḥ kalpyeta / /
analyzed: tatas katham kārya bhedāt bhedaḥ kalpyeta
translated: Then how could difference be imagined due to the difference of effects?

original: dravyaparyāyāṇāṃ caikasvabhāvatām ācakṣāṇa S / / ekasyānekakāryatāṃ pratikṣipatīti kathaṃ nonmattaḥ /
analyzed: dravya paryāyāṇām ca eka svabhāva tām ācakṣāṇa ekasya aneka kārya tām pratikṣipati iti katham
translated: And by asserting the identity of substance and attributes, he rejects the fact that one [entity] can have multiple effects. How is he not insane?

original: anyathā tasya niḥsvabhāvatāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyathā tasya niḥsvabhāva tā prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it has no nature of its own.

original: ekasvabhāvatve ca dravyaparyāyāṇāṃ tatkāryabhedaekavastunibandhana eveti kāryabhedād bhedam abhidadhānaḥ sphuṭam ahrīka evāyam ity upekṣām
analyzed: eka svabhāva tve ca dravya paryāyāṇām eva iti kārya bhedāt bhedam abhidadhānaḥ sphuṭam ahrīkaḥ eva ayam iti upekṣām
translated: And if substance and attributes have a single nature, then the difference in their effects is based on a single entity. Therefore, by asserting difference based on the difference in effects, he is clearly shameless. Thus, he deserves to be ignored.

original: arhati /🔽mṛtsaṃsthānayor deśādibhiḥ
analyzed: arhati  mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ deśa ādibhiḥ
translated: He deserves to be ignored.🔽By place, etc., of clay and shape.

original: mṛtkulālābhyām
analyzed: mṛd kulālābhyām
translated: By clay and potter.

original: saṃkhyādibhiḥ
analyzed: saṃkhyā ādibhiḥ
translated: By number, etc.

original: śaktyor bhede 'pi tadādhārasyaikyād aupacārikaṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyam ity āśaṅkyāha na ca ityādi //
analyzed: śaktyoḥ bhede pi tad ādhārasya aikyāt aupacārikam sāmānādhikaraṇyam iti āśaṅkya āha na ca ityādi
translated: Even though the two potencies are different, the identity of their basis is the basis for the conventional co-reference. Fearing this, he says not and so on.

original: dravyarūpeṇa
analyzed: dravya rūpeṇa
translated: In the form of substance.

original: pariṇāmanityatā
analyzed: pariṇāma nitya tā
translated: The impermanence of transformation.

original: yaṃ pariṇāminityatā kūṭasthanityatāvat sambha T /
analyzed: yam pariṇāmi nityatā kūṭastha nitya tā vat
translated: The impermanence of transformation is possible, like the eternal.

original: dravyakāryakartṛtvāt
analyzed: dravya kārya kartṛ tvāt
translated: Because it is the agent of the effect of substance.

original: The order of the Tib / Fol / should be / /
analyzed: the order of the tib fol should be
translated: The order of the Tibetan folios should be

original: and according to the S / Mss /
analyzed: and according to the
translated: and according to the Sanskrit manuscripts.

original: dravyasya
analyzed: dravyasya
translated: Of the substance.

original: śabda
analyzed: śabda
translated: Sound.

original: avayavini
analyzed: avayavini
translated: In the whole.

original: nimittānām
analyzed: nimittānām
translated: Of the causes.

original: ekatra samavāyāyogāt
analyzed: ekatra samavāya ayogāt
translated: Because the inherence of one is impossible.

original: yathā bhavati
analyzed: yathā bhavati
translated: As it happens.

original: kāryabhedasyātmabhede pratibandha ity apekṣyate
analyzed: kārya bhedasya ātma bhede pratibandhaḥ iti apekṣyate
translated: The difference in effects is restricted to the difference in selves, this is required.

original: rūpādipāścātyakṣaṇānām
analyzed: rūpa ādi pāścātya kṣaṇānām
translated: Of the subsequent moments of form and so on,

original: rūpādivat
analyzed: rūpa ādi vat
translated: Like form and so on.

original: prakṛte dūṣaṇāntaram āha🔽ekasyānekakriyā 'nabhyupagame ceti pūrveṇa yogaḥ
analyzed: ekasya aneka kriyā ca iti pūrveṇa yogaḥ
translated: In the present context, he states another fault.🔽And in the non-acceptance of one thing having many actions, it is connected with the previous.

original: pratyekam ekānekakriyāvirahaḥ
translated: The absence of one or many actions individually.

original: kṛtipratiniya T /
analyzed: kṛti pratiniyaḥ t
translated: Determined by the act.

original: itara upādānaṃ yasya
analyzed: itaraḥ upādānam yasya
translated: The other is the material cause of which.

original: notpannaḥ T /
analyzed: na utpannaḥ t
translated: Not arisen.

original: svabhāvasyaiva bhedo vastuna iti ced āha
analyzed: svabhāvasya eva bhedaḥ vastunaḥ iti ced āha
translated: If it is said that the difference in substance is the difference in the thing itself, he says:

original: dravyaparyāyakāryabhedaḥ
analyzed: dravya paryāya kārya bhedaḥ
translated: The difference in substance, modification, and effect.

original: vaiśeṣikakṛto 'py ekasyānekakāryakāritvākṣepo na yuktaḥ /
translated: The objection that one thing produces many effects, made by the Vaiśeṣika, is also not proper.

original: vaiśeṣiko 'pi dravyasyaikasya dravyaguṇakarmaṇāṃ samavāyikāraṇatāṃ bruvāṇaḥ karmaṇaś
analyzed: vaiśeṣikaḥ pi dravyasya ekasya dravya guṇa karmaṇām samavāyi kāraṇa tām bruvāṇaḥ karmaṇaḥ
translated: The Vaiśeṣika also, saying that one substance is the inherent cause of substance, quality, and action, and that one action

original: caikasya saṃyogavibhāgasaṃskāranimittatāmekasyānekakāryakriyāṃ pratikṣipan svakṛtāntakopenaiva pratihataḥ /
analyzed: ca ekasya pratikṣipan sva kṛtānta kopena eva pratihataḥ
translated: is the cause of conjunction, disjunction, and modification, rejecting the production of many effects by one, is struck down by his own internal contradiction.

original: na cātra śaktibhedo nibandhanam /
analyzed: na ca atra śakti bhedaḥ nibandhanam
translated: And here the difference in power is not the basis.

original: yatas tadekopakāranirapekṣāḥ katham etāḥ śaktayo niyatārthādhārāḥ /
analyzed: yatas tad eka upakāra nirapekṣāḥ katham etāḥ śaktayaḥ niyata artha ādhārāḥ
translated: Because how can these powers, independent of the help of that one, be the substrata of determined meanings?

original: na punar anavayavenavyaktīr vā 'śnuvīran / /
analyzed: na punar vā śnuvīran
translated: And they would not again enjoy the individuals without parts.

original: tato yataevāsyā''tmātiśāyād anekaśaktyupakāra p / / tata evānekakāryakriyā 'pi /
analyzed: tatas
translated: Therefore, it also performs many effects.

original: ity alam ativistāriṇyā kathayeti /🔽gaviśeṣasaṃ T /🔽kārtsnyena🔽ekasyā T /🔽dravyasya
analyzed: iti alam ati vistāriṇyā kathaya iti  ga viśeṣasam t  kārtsnyena  ekasyāḥ t  dravyasya
translated: Thus, enough of this very extensive discussion.

original: deśakālasvabhāvābhedasyābhedasādhakatvanirāsaḥ /
translated: The refutation of the argument that the non-difference of substance is established by the non-difference of place, time and nature.

original: deśakālasvabhāvābhedād abhedas tu yo 'bhyupagamyate so 'py anupapanna eva /
analyzed: deśa kāla svabhāva abhedāt abhedaḥ tu yaḥ bhyupagamyate saḥ pi anupapannaḥ eva
translated: But the non-difference that is accepted as being due to the non-difference of place, time and nature is also not logically possible.

original: tathā hi deśakālayor abhede 'pi rūparasagandhasparśāḥ paryāyarūpeṇa bhidyante tataḥkatham abhedasiddhiḥ / /
analyzed: tathā hi deśa kālayoḥ abhede pi rūpa rasa gandha sparśāḥ paryāya rūpeṇa bhidyante abheda siddhiḥ
translated: For instance, even when there is no difference of place and time, form, taste, smell and touch are differentiated in the form of synonyms. How then is non-difference established?

original: svabhāvo 'pi yadi dravyaparyāyayor dvayor api pratyekam anuvṛttivyāvṛttirūpatā /
analyzed: yadi dravya paryāyayoḥ dvayoḥ api pratyekam anuvṛtti vyāvṛtti rūpa tā
translated: And if the nature of both substance and attribute is the form of universal and particular, each,

original: tadā padārthadvayaṃ T / / S / / syād ghaṭapaṭavad /
analyzed: tadā padārtha dvayam s syāt ghaṭa paṭa vat
translated: then there would be two categories, like pot and cloth.

original: na tv ekaṃ dvirūpam iti kathan tasmād abhedasiddhiḥ / /
analyzed: na tu ekam dvi rūpam iti kathan tasmāt abheda siddhiḥ
translated: But one cannot have two forms. How then is the establishment of non-difference from that?

original: na cānuvṛttivyāvṛttī svabhāvo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na ca anuvṛtti vyāvṛttī svabhāvaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: And the universal and particular are not logically possible as nature.

original: tayor anuvarttamānavyāvarttamānādhīnatvāt /
analyzed: tayoḥ anuvarttamāna vyāvarttamāna adhīna tvāt
translated: Because they depend on the universal and particular that are being followed and excluded.

original: tataś cānuvarttamānavyāvarttamānayoḥ svabhāvo 'nyo vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca anuvarttamāna vyāvarttamānayoḥ svabhāvaḥ nyaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: And therefore, the nature of the continuing and the ceasing must be said to be different.

original: na tu tayor anuvṛttivyāvṛttī eva svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tu tayoḥ anuvṛtti vyāvṛttī eva svabhāvaḥ
translated: But the continuing and the ceasing are not the nature of those two.

original: na hi smṛtiḥ smarttuḥ svabhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: na hi smṛtiḥ smarttuḥ svabhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: For memory is not the nature of the one who remembers.

original: anuvṛttivyāvṛttyoś ca svabhāvatvelakṣaṇāt svabhāvasya bhedo vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: anuvṛtti vyāvṛttyoḥ ca svabhāvasya bhedaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: And because the nature of the continuing and the ceasing is defined, the difference of the nature must be stated.

original: mṛdādirūpatā svabhāva iti cet /
analyzed: mṛd ādi rūpa tā svabhāvaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that the nature is the form of clay, etc.,🔽here too it is said that there is no difference.

original: atrāpy abheda iti yadi sādṛśyam ucyate /
analyzed: atra api abhedaḥ iti yadi sādṛśyam ucyate
translated: If similarity is meant,

original: tad bheda eva sambhavati /
analyzed: tat bhedaḥ eva sambhavati
translated: that is possible only in difference.

original: sādṛśyasya sadṛśādhikaraṇatvāt /
analyzed: sādṛśyasya sadṛśa adhikaraṇa tvāt
translated: Because similarity has as its basis what is similar.

original: tataś ca padārthadvayam
analyzed: tatas ca padārtha dvayam
translated: And therefore,

original: eva syāt na tv ekaṃ dvirūpam iti /
analyzed: eva syāt na tu ekam dvirūpam iti
translated: there would be only two things, not one with two forms.

original: athaikyaṃ dvitīyarūparahitatā 'bhedo 'ṅgīkriyate kathaṃ tarhi dvirūpatā / /
analyzed: atha aikyam dvitīya rūpa rahita tā bhedaḥ ṅgīkriyate katham tarhi dvi rūpa tā
translated: But if oneness, the absence of a second form, is accepted as non-difference, then how can there be a two-fold form?

original: rūpaśabdena hy atra svabhāvo 'bhidhīyate /
analyzed: rūpa śabdena hi atra svabhāvaḥ abhidhīyate
translated: For in this case, the word form denotes nature.

original: tasya caikye kathaṃ dvirūpatā / /
analyzed: tasya ca aikye katham dvi rūpa tā
translated: And if that is one, how can there be a two-fold form?

original: vipratiṣiddhaṃ hy etat ekasvabhāvatā dvirūpatā ceti /
analyzed: vipratiṣiddham hi etat eka svabhāva tā dvi rūpa tā ca iti
translated: For this is contradictory: being of one nature and having a two-fold form.

original: atha punaḥ svabhāvata aikyaṃ nopeyate /
analyzed: atha punar svabhāvataḥ aikyam na upeyate
translated: But if oneness is not accepted,

original: kathaṃ tarhi sa eka ity ucyate anekaḥ san / /
analyzed: katham tarhi saḥ ekaḥ iti ucyate anekaḥ san
translated: then how can it be said to be one, being many?

original: na tāvad ekakāraṇajanyatvāt /
analyzed: na tāvat eka kāraṇa janya tvāt
translated: Not first, because of being produced from one cause.

original: sarvatropādānanimittakāraṇabhedena hetubhedasiddheḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra upādāna nimitta kāraṇa bhedena hetu bheda siddheḥ
translated: Because in every case the difference of causes is established by the difference of material and instrumental causes.

original: nāpy ekakāryakartṛtvāt /
analyzed: na api eka kārya kartṛ tvāt
translated: Nor is it because of being the agent of one effect.

original: ekasyāpi vibhaktapariṇāmāvibhaktapariṇāmakāryabhedā 'bhyupagamāt /
analyzed: ekasya api vibhakta pariṇāma avibhakta pariṇāma kārya bheda abhyupagamāt
translated: Because even one is accepted as having different effects, with transformation divided and with transformation undivided.

original: ekābhidhānābhidheyatvād api naikatvam /
analyzed: eka abhidhāna abhidheya tvāt api nā eka tvam
translated: Nor is oneness because of being the object of one expression.

original: ekasyāpy anekaparyāyasambhavāt /
analyzed: ekasya api aneka paryāya sambhavāt
translated: Because even one has many synonyms.

original: yogyatvāc ca viśvasya kṛtākṛtānāmekābhidhānābhidheyatvasya kvacid asambhavāt śaktibhedāc ca viṣayabhedaṃ bruvāṇaṃ S / / prati abhihitam/
analyzed: yogya tvāt ca viśvasya kvacid asambhavāt śakti bhedāt ca viṣaya bhedam bruvāṇam s prati
translated: And because of fitness, since the object of one expression and one object is not possible in some cases, and because of the difference in power, it has been said to the one who speaks of the difference in objects.

original: nāpy ekavijñānaviṣayatvād ekam /
analyzed: na api eka vijñāna viṣaya tvāt ekam
translated: Nor is it one because of being the object of one consciousness.

original: ekatrāpy anekavijñānaprasūteḥ /
analyzed: ekatra api aneka vijñāna prasūteḥ
translated: Because even one produces many consciousnesses.

original: tathā hi śaśāṅkodayaṃbahavo nirīkṣante T / / tasya katham p / / ekatvam abhyupagatam / /
analyzed: tathā hi nirīkṣante t tasya katham p ekatvam abhyupagatam
translated: Thus, many see the rising of the moon. How can it be accepted as one by you?

original: bahūnāṃ caikavijñānaviṣayatvasambhavāt
analyzed: bahūnām ca eka vijñāna viṣaya tva sambhavāt
translated: And because many can be the object of one consciousness,

original: nīlapītādīnām ekatāprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: nīla pīta ādīnām eka tā prasaṅgaḥ
translated: there would be the consequence of the oneness of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: sarvathedaṃ na kathañcid api saṅgacchate yaduta ekasya dvairūpyam iti /
analyzed: sarvathā idam na kathañcid api saṅgacchate yat uta ekasya dvairūpyam iti
translated: In no way at all does this make sense, namely the duality of one thing.

original: vijñānaṃ tu nīlapraticchāyatayotpadyamānaṃ pītādipratibhāsavyavacchedena prativiśiṣṭam khyāpyate /
analyzed: vijñānam tu nīla praticchāya tayā utpadyamānam pīta ādi pratibhāsa vyavacchedena prativiśiṣṭam khyāpyate
translated: But consciousness, arising with the appearance of blue, is proclaimed to be distinguished by the exclusion of the appearance of yellow, etc.

original: na punar asya bhāvatodve rūpe staḥ /
analyzed: na punar asya rūpe staḥ
translated: Moreover, it does not have two forms in reality.

original: atha punar dravyaparyāyayoḥ sammūrcchitatvāt narasiṃhavad ekaṃ śabalarūpatvāt dvirūpam ucyate /
analyzed: atha punar dravya paryāyayoḥ sammūrcchita tvāt narasiṃha vat ekam śabala rūpa tvāt dvi rūpam ucyate
translated: But if it is said that it has two forms because the substance and the modification are mixed together, like a man-lion, because it has a variegated form,

original: tad ayuktam /
analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: that is not correct.

original: narasiṃghahasya śabalarūpatvāsiddheḥ /
analyzed: narasiṃghahasya śabala rūpa tva asiddheḥ
translated: Because the form of a man-lion is not established as variegated.

original: sa hy anekaparamāṇusaṅghātarūpaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi aneka paramāṇu saṅghāta rūpaḥ
translated: For that [form] is the form of an aggregate of many atoms.

original: te ca paramāṇavaḥ pratyekaṃ narasiṃharūpā na bhavanti /
analyzed: te ca paramāṇavaḥ pratyekam narasiṃha rūpāḥ na bhavanti
translated: And those atoms do not each have the form of a man-lion.

original: ūrdhvabhāgas tasya siṃharūpaḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhva bhāgaḥ tasya siṃha rūpaḥ
translated: The upper part of that [form] has the form of a lion.

original: aghobhāgas tu nararūpaḥ /
analyzed: aghobhāgaḥ tu nara rūpaḥ
translated: But the lower part has the form of a man.

original: jātyantaraṃ ca sa eva narasiṃhābhyāṃ syāt /
analyzed: jāti antaram ca saḥ eva narasiṃhābhyām syāt
translated: And that [form] would be a different species from both a man and a lion.

original: na śabalarūpaḥ /
analyzed: na śabala rūpaḥ
translated: It is not a variegated form.

original: vicitraṃ hi rūpaṃ śabalam ucyate / S / /
analyzed: vicitram hi rūpam śabalam ucyate
translated: For a variegated form is said to be a diverse form.

original: vicitratā ca nānāsvabhāvatā /
analyzed: vicitra tā ca nānā svabhāva tā
translated: And diversity is having many natures.

original: nānāsvābhāvye caikatvaṃ kutaḥ /
analyzed: nānāsvābhāvye ca ekatvam kutas
translated: And how can there be oneness when there are many natures?

original: iti kevalam anekatve 'pi bahuṣv ekakāryadarśanāt senādivadekavyavahāradarśanakṛto 'yaṃ viparyāso jaḍamatīnām /
analyzed: iti kevalam aneka tve pi bahuṣu eka kārya darśanāt
translated: Thus, this is a delusion of the dull-witted, who see a single usage like an army, etc., even when there are many, due to seeing a single effect.

original: tad evaṃ tāvat pratyekam ahetutvaṃ deśakālasvabhāvānām ekatvaprasādhane /
analyzed: tat evam tāvat pratyekam ahetu tvam deśa kāla svabhāvānām eka tva prasādhane
translated: Thus, in this way, individually, the place, time and nature are not causes in establishing oneness.

original: samuditānām api vyabhicāritvaṃ paryāyaiḥ /
analyzed: samuditānām api vyabhicāri tvam paryāyaiḥ
translated: Even when combined, they are inconclusive due to the synonyms.

original: tathā hi paryāyā abhinnadeśakālasvabhāvāś ca paryāyarūpeṇa ca bhidyante pūrvoktāc ca dharmadharmiṇor niṣedhānnobhayavādasambhava iti
analyzed: tathā hi paryāyāḥ abhinna deśa kāla svabhāvāḥ ca paryāya rūpeṇa ca bhidyante pūrva uktāt ca dharma dharmiṇoḥ iti
translated: Because the synonyms are of undifferentiated place, time and nature, and are differentiated by the form of the synonyms, and because of the negation of the property and property-possessor stated earlier, the theory of both is not possible.

original: deśakālābhedāt
analyzed: deśa kāla abhedāt
translated: Due to the non-difference of place and time,🔽due to the nature of action,

original: kriyātvena🔽tvena la T /
analyzed: kriyā tvena  tvena la t
translated: due to the nature of action,

original: saṃketitāsaṃketitānām
analyzed: saṃketita a saṃketitānām
translated: of those designated and not designated,

original: saṃjñābhedād bheda ity asya dūṣaṇāvasare
analyzed: saṃjñā bhedāt bhedaḥ iti asya dūṣaṇa avasare
translated: the difference is due to the difference in names, at the time of refuting this,

original: śaśāṅkādayaḥ T /
analyzed: śaśāṅka ādayaḥ t
translated: the moon and so on,

original: bhavato T /
analyzed: bhavataḥ t
translated: of you,

original: senāvanādi T /
analyzed: senā vana ādi t
translated: the army, forest and so on,

original: svabhāvahetuvyākhyāyām
analyzed: svabhāva hetu vyākhyāyām
translated: in the explanation of the reason of nature,

original: dravyaparyāyānekāntavādakhaṇḍanam /
translated: the refutation of the theory of the substance and the successive being both.

original: āha ca
analyzed: āha ca
translated: And it is said:

original: dravyaparyāyarūpatvāt dvairūpyaṃvastunaḥkila /
analyzed: dravya paryāya rūpa tvāt dvairūpyam vastunaḥ kila
translated: The substance has two forms, due to being of the nature of substance and succession, it is said to have two forms.

original: tayor ekātmakatve 'pi bhedaḥsaṃjñādibhedataḥ// //🔽indriyajñānanirbhāsi vasturūpaṃhi gocaraḥ/
analyzed: tayoḥ eka ātmaka tve pi bhedaḥ saṃjñā ādi bhedataḥ  indriya jñāna nirbhāsi vastu rūpam hi gocaraḥ
translated: Even though they are of the same nature, there is a difference due to the difference in names and so on.

original: śabdānāṃnaiva /
analyzed: śabdānām na eva
translated: The form of the substance that appears in sensory cognition is indeed the object of words.🔽It is not so.

original: tat kena saṃjñābhedād vibhinnatā// //
analyzed: tat kena saṃjñā bhedāt vibhinna tā
translated: By what is the difference due to the difference in names?

original: paramārthaikatānatva' T / / ityādivacanāt tathā/
translated: Thus, due to statements such as 'being one-pointed in the ultimate truth' and so on.

original: śabdenāvyāpṛtākṣasya buddhāv apratibhāsanāt // //
analyzed: śabdena avyāpṛta akṣasya apratibhāsanāt
translated: Because they do not appear in the cognition of one whose eyes are not affected by the word.

original: arthasya / dṛṣṭāv iva tacchabdāḥkalpitagocarāḥ/
analyzed: arthasya dṛṣṭau iva tad śabdāḥ kalpita gocarāḥ
translated: The words are the objects of imagination, like the seen object.

original: kalpitasyaiva tadbhedaḥ saṃjñābhedād bhaved yadi // //
analyzed: kalpitasya eva saṃjñā bhedāt bhavet yadi
translated: If the difference of the imagined itself were due to the difference of names,

original: p / / vyāvṛttibhedaḥkāścit syād /🔽vastuno na kathaṃcanaS / / /
analyzed: syāt  vastunaḥ na kathaṃcana
translated: there would be a difference of exclusion in some cases.🔽But never of the real thing.

original: saṃkhyābhedo 'pi naivānyo mato vacanabhedataḥ// //
analyzed: saṃkhyā bhedaḥ na eva anyaḥ mataḥ vacana bhedataḥ
translated: The difference of number also is not considered to be different from the difference of words.

original: tato'pi kalpitasyaiva kathañcit syād vibhinnatā/
analyzed: kalpitasya eva kathañcid syāt vibhinna tā
translated: Therefore, the difference of the imagined itself might somehow be due to that.

original: yeṣāṃ vastuvaśāvāca'PV / ityāder na tu vastunaḥ // //
analyzed: ityādeḥ na tu
translated: For those who say that the word is dependent on the real thing, but not of the real thing.

original: bheda eva viśīryeta tadekāvyatirakataḥ// //🔽p / /abhedasyāparityāge bhedaḥsyāt kalpanākṛtaḥ/
analyzed: bhedaḥ eva viśīryeta tad eka a vyatirakataḥ  bhedaḥ syāt kalpanā kṛtaḥ
translated: The difference itself would be destroyed by the non-difference of that.🔽If the non-difference is not abandoned, the difference would be due to imagination.

original: tasyā'vitathabhāve vāsyād abhede mṛṣārthatā// //🔽anyonyābhāvarūpāṇām aparābhāvahetukaḥ/
analyzed: vā āsyāt abhede mṛṣārtha tā  anyonya abhāva rūpāṇām apara abhāva hetukaḥ
translated: If that were not false, there would be non-difference, and the meaning would be false.

original: ekabhāvo yatas tasmān naikasya syād dvirūpatā// //🔽tasya bhedo 'pi tābhyāṃced yadi yenātmanāca te /
analyzed: eka bhāvaḥ yatas tasmāt na ekasya syāt dvi rūpa tā  tasya bhedaḥ tābhyām ced yadi yena ātmanā ca te
translated: The single entity is caused by the other absence, which has the form of mutual absence. Therefore, one thing cannot have two forms.

original: dharmīdharmas tadanyaśca yadi bhedas tadātmanā// //
analyzed: dharmī dharmaḥ tad anyaḥ ca yadi bhedaḥ tadā ātmanā
translated: If its difference from those two were also by that same nature, then the property, the property-possessor, and that which is different from it would be by that same nature.

original: bheda evātha tatrāpi tebhyo 'nyaḥparikalpyate /
analyzed: bhedaḥ eva atha tatra api tebhyaḥ
translated: If difference itself is imagined to be different from those [substance and quality],

original: teṣām abhedasiddhyarthaṃprasaṅgaḥpūrvavad bhavet // //
analyzed: teṣām abheda siddhi artham prasaṅgaḥ pūrvavat bhavet
translated: then the same consequence would occur as before, in order to establish their non-difference.

original: dharmitvaṃtasya caivaṃsyāt tattantratvāt tadanyayoḥ/
analyzed: dharmi tvam tasya ca evam syāt tad tantra tvāt tad anyayoḥ
translated: And that [difference] would have the nature of a property-possessor, because the other two [substance and quality] depend on it.

original: atravaiśeṣikamatam āśaṅkyāha anyad eva ityādi /
analyzed: atra vaiśeṣika matam āśaṅkya āha anyat eva ityādi
translated: Here, anticipating the Vaiśeṣika view, he says If it is something else and so on.

original: saṃsthānaṃ hy avayavasanniveśa ucyate /
analyzed: saṃsthānam hi avayava sanniveśaḥ ucyate
translated: For configuration is said to be the arrangement of parts.

original: sa ca saṃyogalakṣaṇatvād guṇarūpaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca saṃyoga lakṣaṇa tvāt guṇa rūpaḥ
translated: And that is of the nature of a quality, because it is characterized by conjunction.

original: tato mṛddravyād asyānyatvaṃ S / / asaṃkīrṇasvabhāvatvāt/
analyzed: tatas mṛd dravyāt asya anya tvam dravya guṇayoḥ
translated: Therefore, it is different from the substance clay, because of its unmixed nature.

original: tena yadi mṛtpiṇḍasya mṛdātmatāyāṃ vyāpāraḥ kulālasya tatsaṃsthānaviśeṣe kathyate /
analyzed: tena yadi mṛd piṇḍasya mṛd ātma tāyām vyāpāraḥ kulālasya tat saṃsthāna viśeṣe kathyate
translated: If it is said that the potter's function lies in the configuration of that [pot], which is different from the clay-substance,

original: tadā tayor atyantabhedāt kāraṇānekatvāt kāryānekatvaṃ prāptam iti /
analyzed: tadā tayoḥ atyanta bhedāt kāraṇa aneka tvāt kārya aneka tvam prāptam iti
translated: then, because of the absolute difference between those two [clay and configuration], the plurality of effects would follow from the plurality of causes.

original: siddhāntavādy āha uktam atra iti /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha uktam atra iti
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says This has been stated [in the previous verse].

original: mṛtsaṃsthānayoḥ svabhāvabhede dūṣaṇam uktam p / / mṛtsaṃsthānayor aparasparātmatayā ityādikam iti na saṃsthānasya mṛddravyād anyatvam
analyzed: mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ svabhāva bhede dūṣaṇam uktam mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ aparaspara ātmatayā ityādikam iti na saṃsthānasya mṛd dravyāt anya tvam
translated: The fault in the difference of nature between clay and configuration has been stated [in the previous verse], beginning with Because clay and configuration do not have the nature of each other, etc. Therefore, configuration is not different from the clay-substance.

original: tato mṛtpiṇḍopādānāhitātiśayena tatkāryakṣaṇasahakāriṇā kulālena tadupādānopakṛtātmanā
analyzed: tatas mṛd piṇḍa upādāna āhita atiśayena tad kārya kṣaṇa sahakāriṇā kulālena tad upādāna upakṛta ātmanā
translated: Then, by the potter, who has added to himself an excellence by taking up a lump of clay, and who is a contributory cause of the moment of that effect, and by the lump of clay, which has been rendered helpful to that material cause,

original: tatkāryakṣaṇasahakāriṇā mṛtpiṇḍena ca pratyekaṃ sakalam eva mṛtsaṃsthānātmakaṃ kāryaṃ
analyzed: tad kārya kṣaṇa sahakāriṇā mṛd piṇḍena ca pratyekam sakalam eva mṛd saṃsthāna ātmakam kāryam
translated: each individual effect consisting of clay and shape is produced.

original: kriyata iti na kāraṇānekatve 'py anekatvam asya /
analyzed: kriyate iti na kāraṇa aneka tve pi aneka tvam asya
translated: Thus, even when the cause is multiple, it does not have multiplicity.

original: atraivopacayahetum āha api ca T / /
analyzed: atra eva upacaya hetum āha api ca
translated: Here itself, he states the reason for the increase: Moreover, that...

original: ityādi / yat tad ghaṭagataṃ saṃsthānaṃ yadi tata mṛdo bhinnaṃsyāt tadā kulālaḥ pṛthag eva kim iti na karoti / /
analyzed: ityādi yat tat ghaṭa gatam saṃsthānam yadi tata mṛdaḥ bhinnam syāt tadā kulālaḥ pṛthak eva kim iti na karoti
translated: If that shape belonging to the pot were different from the clay, then why does the potter not make it separately?

original: na hi bhinnānām āvaśyakam apṛthakkaraṇam /
analyzed: na hi bhinnānām āvaśyakam apṛthakkaraṇam
translated: For it is not necessary that what is different should not be made separately.

original: kulālaś cānvayavyatirekābhyāṃ tasya saṃsthānasya guṇātmanaḥ kāraṇatayā gamyata iti sa pṛthag api tat kāryāt /
analyzed: kulālaḥ ca anvaya vyatirekābhyām tasya saṃsthānasya guṇa ātmanaḥ kāraṇatayā gamyate iti sa pṛthak api tat kāryāt
translated: And the potter is understood by positive and negative concomitance to be the cause of that shape, which has the nature of a quality. Therefore, he is separate even from that effect.

original: para āha guṇasyetiādi /
analyzed: paraḥ āha
translated: The opponent says: The quality... and so on.

original: dravyāśrayya'guṇavān saṃyogavibhāgeṣv akāraṇam anapekṣa VaiSū / / iti guṇalakṣaṇāt sarvadā S / / guṇo dravyapratantraḥ /
analyzed: saṃyoga vibhāgeṣu akāraṇam iti guṇa lakṣaṇāt sarvadā s guṇaḥ dravya pratantraḥ
translated: Because of the definition of quality: A quality is dependent on a substance, is not a quality, is not a cause of conjunction and disjunction, and is independent. Therefore, a quality is always dependent on a substance.

original: sa kathaṃ kadācit pṛthak kriyeta / /
analyzed: sa katham kadācid pṛthak kriyeta
translated: How could it ever be made separately?

original: vaiśeṣika evabauddhīyaṃcodyam āśaṅkyāha tatsaṃsthāna ityādi /
analyzed: vaiśeṣike eva bauddhīyam codyam āśaṅkya āha tad saṃsthāne ityādi
translated: Anticipating an objection from a Vaisheshika, he says in that shape etc.

original: yadi svabhāvenaiva tasya guṇātmanaḥ saṃsthānasya kriyāvad guṇavad VaiSū / / ityādivacanād ādhārasvabhāvaṃ tat mṛddravyaṃ /
analyzed: yadi svabhāvena eva tasya guṇa ātmanaḥ saṃsthānasya kriyāvat guṇavat iti ādi vacanāt ādhāra svabhāvam tat mṛd dravyam
translated: If that shape, which is by nature an attribute, has the nature of a substratum, like action and quality, as stated in the beginning of the Vaisheshika sutras, then that clay substance has the nature of a substratum.

original: saṃsthānaṃ vā tathāvidhaṃ kapālādheyātmakaṃ tadā kim iti kulālavyāpāram apekṣate / /
analyzed: saṃsthānam vā tathāvidham kapāla ādheya ātmakam tadā kim iti kulāla vyāpāram apekṣate
translated: Or if the shape is of that kind, having the nature of supporting the pot, then why does it depend on the potter's activity?

original: svata eva kiṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: svatas eva kim na bhavati
translated: Why does it not happen by itself?

original: iti codakābhiprayaḥ /
analyzed: iti ca udaka abhiprayaḥ
translated: This is the intention of the objector.

original: evaṃ codyam āśaṅkyavaiśeṣikaḥparihāram āha na /
analyzed: evam codyam āśaṅkya vaiśeṣikaḥ parihāram āha na
translated: Thus, anticipating this objection, the Vaisheshika gives the answer No.

original: tataḥ ityādi /
analyzed: tatas ityādi
translated: He says from that etc.

original: yat tat mṛddravyaṃ pṛthuvudhnodarādyākāraṃ ca saṃsthānaṃ tayor yaḥ sambandha ādhārādheyalakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: yat tat mṛd dravyam pṛthu vudhna udara ādi ākāram ca saṃsthānam tayoḥ yaḥ sambandhaḥ ādhāra ādheya lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The relation between that clay substance and the shape having the form of a broad base and belly, which is characterized by the relation of support and supported,

original: tatra yā yogyatā tāṃ dvayam apy etat kulālād yataḥ pratilabhate tasmāt kulālam apekṣate
analyzed: tatra yā yogyatā tām dvayam api etat kulālāt yatas pratilabhate tasmāt kulālam apekṣate
translated: the fitness for that, both of these obtain from the potter. Therefore, it depends on the potter.

original: kulālānapekṣāyāṃ doṣam āha anyathā yadi tayoḥ parasparasambandhayogyatāyāṃ kulālāpekṣā
analyzed: kulāla anapekṣāyām doṣam āha anyathā yadi tayoḥ paraspara sambandha yogya tāyām kulāla apekṣā
translated: In the absence of dependence on the potter, he states the fault. Otherwise, if there is no dependence on the potter in the fitness for mutual relation between the two,

original: na syāt tadā svabhāvata eva mṛtpiṇḍasya T / / tathāvidhasaṃsthānasambandhayogyatvaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na syāt tadā svabhāvataḥ eva mṛd piṇḍasya t tathāvidha saṃsthāna sambandha yogya tvam bhavet
translated: then at that time, the lump of clay would by its very nature have the capacity to be connected with such a shape.

original: tasmiṃś ca sati vastuna eva tatsaṃsthānasambandhayogyatālakṣaṇā dharmatā 'stīti kulālasannidheḥ prāg api saṃsthānaviśeṣeṇa sambandhaḥ syād
analyzed: tasmin ca sati vastunaḥ eva tad saṃsthāna sambandha yogyatā lakṣaṇā dharmatā sti iti kulāla sannidheḥ prāk api saṃsthāna viśeṣeṇa sambandhaḥ syāt
translated: And when that exists, the nature of the entity itself is the characteristic of the capacity to be connected with that shape, so even before the potter's presence, there would be a connection with a particular shape.

original: dravyasaṃsthānayor yathākāryasvabhāvatvāt T /
analyzed: dravya saṃsthānayoḥ yathā kārya svabhāva tvāt
translated: Because the substance and shape are of the nature of an effect.

original: p / / / dravyaguṇayor abhedasyopapādanam /
translated: The explanation of the non-difference between substance and quality.

original: siddhāntavādy āha evam ityādi /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha evam ityādi
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says Thus and so on.

original: yadi S / / parasparasambandhayogyatāyāṃ kulālam apekṣate evaṃ tarhi sāyogyatāmṛddravyasya kulālād bhavati itiāpannam /
analyzed: yadi s paraspara sambandha yogya tāyām kulālam apekṣate evam tarhi sa ayogya tā mṛd dravyasya kulālāt bhavati
translated: If in the capacity for mutual connection it depends on the potter, then in that case the capacity of the clay substance comes from the potter, so it is implied.

original: na ca anayoḥ mṛddravyayogyatayoḥ svabhāvasya bhedaḥ nānātvam /🔽yadi hi syāt tadā yogyatāyāḥ dravyāt pṛthakkaraṇaṃ prāgvat prasajyeta /
analyzed: na ca anayoḥ mṛd dravya yogyatayoḥ svabhāvasya bhedaḥ nānātvam  yadi hi syāt tadā yogyatāyāḥ dravyāt pṛthakkaraṇam prāgvat prasajyeta
translated: And there is no difference, no plurality, in the nature of these two, the clay substance and its capacity.🔽For if there were, then the separation of the capacity from the substance would be implied, as before.

original: atha yogyatāyā api yogyapāratantryād apṛthaksiddhiṃ brūyāt tadā tasyā api vastudharmatayaiva
analyzed: atha yogya tāyāḥ api yogya pāratantryāt apṛthak siddhim brūyāt tadā tasyāḥ api vastu dharma tayā eva
translated: Or if one were to say that even the capacity is established as inseparable due to its dependence on the capable, then in that case, that also, by being the property of an entity, would be inseparable from the entity.

original: prāg api samāveśo mā bhūd iti dravyeṇa saha sambandhayogyatāyā anyā yogyatā kulālād bhavatīty eṣṭavyā /🔽sā 'pi pṛthakkaraṇaprasaṅgāt dravyād bhinnasvabhāvā nopagantavyā /
analyzed: prāk api samāveśaḥ mā bhūt iti dravyeṇa saha sambandha yogyatāyāḥ anyā yogyatā kulālāt bhavati iti eṣṭavyā  sā pi pṛthakkaraṇa prasaṅgāt dravyāt bhinna svabhāvā na upagantavyā
translated: In order to avoid the possibility of the contact taking place even before the contact, it has to be admitted that the capacity of the clay to be in contact with the potter is different from the clay itself.🔽But this capacity also cannot be admitted to be of a different nature from the clay, because in that case, it would have to be regarded as a distinct entity by itself.

original: pṛthakkaraṇaprasaṅge vā punaḥ sa eva parihāraḥ tadīyaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthakkaraṇa prasaṅge vā punar saḥ eva parihāraḥ tadīyaḥ
translated: And if it is urged that the capacity is a distinct entity, then the same answer is available as before.

original: punas tad evottaram /
analyzed: punar tat eva uttaram
translated: And again, the same answer is available.

original: ity anavasthāprasaṅgād avaśyam abhinnasvabhāvatā kapālātmamamṛddravyayogyatayor abhyupagantavyā /
analyzed: iti anavasthā prasaṅgāt avaśyam abhinna svabhāva tā kapāla ātma ma mṛd dravya yogya tayoḥ abhyupagantavyā
translated: Thus, because of the contingence of an infinite regress, it has to be admitted that the capacity of the clay to be in contact with the pot is of the same nature as the clay itself.

original: kim evaṃ sati siddhaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kim evam sati siddham bhavati
translated: What is it that becomes established by this?

original: ity ata āha asti tāvat ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha asti tāvat ityādi
translated: To this he says: ‘There is, etc. etc.’.

original: mṛtpiṇḍakulālābhyāṃ🔽kapāladravyasya S / / saṃyogaviśeṣasambandhayogyasyārambhāt yadaikasvabhāvatve 'py ekasyānekapratyayopādheyaviśeṣatā tadā siddhaḥ āsmākīnaḥ
analyzed: mṛd piṇḍa kulālābhyām  kapāla dravyasya saṃyoga viśeṣa sambandha yogyasya ārambhāt yadā eka svabhāva tve pi ekasya aneka pratyaya upādheya viśeṣa tā tadā siddhaḥ āsmākīnaḥ
translated: From the clay and the potter,🔽the pot, which is capable of being in contact with a particular conjunction, is produced. When, even though of the same nature, it has several peculiarities imposed upon it by several causes, then our view becomes established.

original: pakṣaḥ /
analyzed: pakṣaḥ
translated: Our view being that the clay and the pot are of the same nature.

original: tataś ca kim asmākaṃ mṛtsaṃsthānayor ekasvabhāvatvasādhanāya atinirbbandhanena / /
analyzed: tatas ca kim asmākam mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ eka svabhāva tva sādhanāya ati nirbbandhanena
translated: What is the use for us of establishing the sameness of nature between the clay and the pot? What is the use of this excessive insistence?

original: T / / yadi yogyatām apy āśrityānekapratyayajanyatve 'py ekatvāt nānātvaprasaṅgābhāvaḥ sidhyati kāryasya /
analyzed: api āśritya
translated: If [the effect] is established as one even when it is produced by many conditions, taking into account [the effect's] suitability, then the problem of [the effect] being many is resolved.

original: na kiñcid dravyaguṇavādanirākaraṇeneha prayojanam /
analyzed: na kiñcid dravya guṇa vāda nirākaraṇena iha prayojanam
translated: There is no purpose in refuting the doctrine of substance and quality here.

original: anyatraiva tannirākaraṇasya kṛtatvād ity abhiprāyaḥ /🔽nirbandhagrahaṇena ca mṛtsaṃsthānayor aparasparātmatayā saṃsthānamṛtsvabhāvaviśeṣābhyāṃ tayor apratibhāsanaprasaṅgāt ity anayopapattyā sādhitam
analyzed: anyatra eva tad nirākaraṇasya kṛta tvāt iti abhiprāyaḥ  nirbandha grahaṇena ca mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ aparaspara ātma tayā saṃsthāna mṛd svabhāva viśeṣābhyām tayoḥ a pratibhāsana prasaṅgāt iti anayā upapattyā sādhitam
translated: The intention is that [the refutation] has already been done elsewhere.

original: evānayor ekatvam /
analyzed: eva anayoḥ eka tvam
translated: And by the word 'insistence', [it is shown that] the oneness of these two [substance and quality] is established by this reasoning, because if [substance and quality] were not of the nature of each other, like clay and shape, then [substance and quality] would not appear as specific natures of each other.

original: yuktyantarāṇāṃ sambhave 'pi tadabhidhānalakṣaṇo nirbbandho na kriyate /
analyzed: yukti antarāṇām sambhave tad abhidhāna lakṣaṇaḥ nirbbandhaḥ na kriyate
translated: Even when other reasons are possible, an insistence characterized by stating them is not done.

original: prakṛtasiddher anyathā 'pi bhāvād ity ācaṣṭe /
analyzed: prakṛta siddheḥ anyathā pi bhāvāt iti ācaṣṭe
translated: [The author] says that [the effect] exists in another way also, because the intended [purpose] is accomplished.

original: ity upapannam T /
analyzed: iti upapannam t
translated: Thus it is reasonable.

original: sāmagrībhede kāryabhedasya kāraṇabhede 'pi ca kāryasyaikyasyopasaṃhāraḥ /
translated: The difference of effects due to the difference of collections [of causes] and the unity of effects even when there is a difference of causes are concluded.

original: tad evaṃ sāmagrībhedāt S / / sāmagryantarajanyebhyo bhedaḥ sahakāriṇām anekatve
analyzed: tat evam sāmagrī bhedāt s sāmagrī antara janyebhyaḥ bhedaḥ sahakāriṇām aneka tve
translated: Thus, in this way, there is a difference from those produced by other collections [of causes] due to the difference in collections [of causes]. When there are many cooperating [causes],

original: 'pi ca kāryasyaikatvam aviruddham iti pratipādya p / / upasaṃharann āha tena
analyzed: ca kāryasya eka tvam aviruddham iti pratipādya upasaṃharan āha tena
translated: And moreover, the oneness of the effect is not contradictory. Having taught this, he concludes with Therefore...

original: sahakāriṇaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: sahakāriṇaḥ ityādi
translated: and so on.

original: yena pratyayāntarapracaye tadvikalasāmagryāḥ sāmagryantaraṃ sampadyate /
analyzed: yena pratyaya antara pracaye tad vikala sāmagryāḥ sāmagrī antaram sampadyate
translated: By which, when there is an accumulation of other conditions, the incomplete collection becomes a different collection.

original: tac ca pūrvasāmagrījanyād bhinnaṃ kāryāntaram eva janayati /
analyzed: tat ca pūrva sāmagrī janyāt bhinnam kārya antaram eva janayati
translated: And that produces a different effect, distinct from what is produced by the previous collection.

original: ekasāmagrīvyapadeśaviṣayāṇāṃ ca sahakāriṇām anekatve 'py anekasyaikakriyāvirodhābhāvāt
analyzed: eka sāmagrī vyapadeśa viṣayāṇām ca sahakāriṇām aneka tve pi anekasya eka kriyā virodha abhāvāt
translated: And even when there are many co-operators that are the objects of the designation of a single collection, there is no contradiction in many performing a single action.

original: tadanvayavyatirekānuvidhāyinaś ca kāryasyaikasya darśanāt svabhāvata ekatvaṃ sādhitam🔽tena kāraṇena sahakaraṇaśīlā ekasāmagryantarggatāḥ pratyayāḥ sāmagryantaraiḥ
analyzed: tad anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyinaḥ ca kāryasya ekasya darśanāt svabhāvataḥ eka tvam sādhitam  tena kāraṇena sahakaraṇa śīlāḥ eka sāmagrī antarggatāḥ pratyayāḥ sāmagrī antaraiḥ
translated: And because an effect that conforms with their presence and absence is seen to be single, its oneness is established by nature.

original: saha naikopayogaviṣayāḥ eka upayogasya viṣayo yeṣāṃ te na bhavanti /
analyzed: saha na eka upayoga viṣayāḥ ekaḥ upayogasya viṣayaḥ yeṣām te na bhavanti
translated: For that reason, the conditions that have the nature of co-operating together, included within a single collection, are not the objects of a single use together with other collections. Those that are not the objects of which there is a single use.

original: sāmagryantarair eva saha bhinnopayogāviṣayatvasya nyāyabalāt pratīteḥ /
analyzed: sāmagrī antaraiḥ eva saha bhinna upayoga aviṣaya tvasya nyāya balāt pratīteḥ
translated: Because it is understood by the force of reasoning that they have different uses together with other collections.

original: anena yat prāg vikalpitaṃ yadi kāraṇaśabdena sāmagrī bhaṇyate tadā tadbhedād asty evātatsāmagrījanyebhyaḥ kāryasya bheda iti kim ucyate
analyzed: anena yat prāk vikalpitam yadi kāraṇa śabdena sāmagrī bhaṇyate tadā tad bhedāt asti eva a tad sāmagrī janyebhyaḥ kāryasya bhedaḥ iti kim ucyate
translated: By this (verse), what was previously imagined is concluded: If the collection is referred to by the word 'cause', then due to the difference in that, there is indeed a difference in the effect from what is not produced by that collection. What is said?

original: na kāraṇabhedād bhedaḥ T / / syāt' iti etad nigamitam/
analyzed: na kāraṇa bhedāt bhedaḥ syāt iti etat udāharaṇa upadarśitam
translated: It is concluded that the difference is not due to the difference in causes.

original: atha kāraṇaśabdena sāmagrīvyapadeśaviṣayāḥ sahakāriṇa ucyante tadā tadbhedād anekatvalakṣaṇāt kāryasyānekatvalakṣaṇo bhedo neṣyata eva /
analyzed: atha kāraṇa śabdena sāmagrī vyapadeśa viṣayāḥ sahakāriṇaḥ ucyante tadā tad bhedāt anekatva lakṣaṇāt kāryasya anekatva lakṣaṇaḥ bhedaḥ na iṣyate eva
translated: If, on the other hand, the word 'cause' refers to the auxiliaries that are the subject of the designation 'collection', then the difference of the effect, characterized by multiplicity, is not accepted due to the difference in that, characterized by multiplicity.

original: anekasyaikakriyāvirodhābhāvāt /
analyzed: anekasya eka kriyā virodha abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction in the activity of the many being one,

original: ekasyānekata utpattidarśanāc ceti mṛtsaṃsthānayor ekātmakatopadarśitaṃ S / /
analyzed: ekasya anekataḥ utpatti darśanāt ca iti mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ eka ātmaka tā upadarśitam
translated: and because the production of the one from the many is seen. Thus, it is shown that the clay and the shape have the same nature.

original: nigamayati kāryasvabhāvasya' mṛtsaṃthānātmana ekatve 'pi' nānātvābhāve 'pi vastutaḥ'
analyzed: nigamayati kārya svabhāvasya mṛd saṃthāna ātmanaḥ eka tve pi nānātva abhāve pi vastutaḥ
translated: He concludes: Even though the nature of the effect, which is the clay and the shape, is one, even in the absence of multiplicity, in reality,

original: paramārthataḥ kalpanābuddhau mṛtsaṃsthānayor bhinnayor iva pratibhāsane 'pīti /
analyzed: paramārthataḥ kalpanā buddhau mṛd saṃsthānayoḥ bhinnayoḥ iva pratibhāsane
translated: in the conceptual cognition, even though the clay and the shape appear as different, as if they were different.

original: evam udāharaṇe sāmagrībhedāt kāryāṇāṃ bhedo naikasāmagrīviṣayapratyayabhedād anekatvaṃ
analyzed: evam udāharaṇe sāmagrī bhedāt kāryāṇām bhedaḥ na eka sāmagrī viṣaya pratyaya bhedāt aneka tvam
translated: Thus, in the example, the difference of the effects is due to the difference in the collection, not the multiplicity due to the difference in the cognitions having the same collection as their object.

original: kāryasyeti pratipādya prakṛte cakṣurādau yojayann āha yathāihodāharaṇe kāraṇabhedaḥ
analyzed: kāryasya iti pratipādya prakṛte cakṣuḥ ādau yojayan āha yathā iha udāharaṇe kāraṇa bhedaḥ
translated: Having stated the object, and connecting it with the present context of the eye etc., he says just as in this example, there is a difference in the causes.

original: sāmagrībhedaḥ kulālavikalamṛtpiṇḍatatsahitasūtrādhikasāmagrītritayalakṣaṇo bhinneṣu'
analyzed: sāmagrī bhedaḥ kulāla vikala mṛd piṇḍa tad sahita sūtra adhika sāmagrī tritaya lakṣaṇaḥ bhinneṣu
translated: The difference in the collection, characterized by the three collections of the potter, the incomplete clay lump, and the excess of thread, is in the different

original: nānāsvabhāveṣu viśeṣeṣu'iṣṭakādicakrāvibhaktaghaṭa tadvibhaktaghaṭalakṣaṇeṣūpayogān
analyzed: nānā svabhāveṣu tad vibhakta ghaṭa lakṣaṇeṣu upayogān
translated: particulars having different natures, characterized by the pot not divided by the wheel etc. and the pot divided by it, due to their application.

original: naikakāryaḥ kintu bhinnakārya eva /
analyzed: na eka kāryaḥ kintu bhinna kāryaḥ eva
translated: It is not of one effect, but of different effects.

original: tathā tenaiva prakāreṇa cakṣurādibhyo vijñānasyotpattau sāmagryantarāt sāmagrīlakṣaṇakāraṇabhedo 'nekakārya ity unneyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā tena eva prakāreṇa cakṣuḥ ādibhyaḥ vijñānasya utpattau sāmagrī antarāt sāmagrī lakṣaṇa kāraṇa bhedaḥ neka kāryaḥ iti unneyaḥ
translated: In the same way, in the arising of consciousness from the eye etc., the difference in the causes characterized by the collection, which is characterized by a different collection, should be understood as having many effects.

original: p / / etad eva vibhajann āha tathāhi ityādi /
analyzed: eva   āha
translated: Dividing this very [point], he says Thus, etc.

original: yā cakṣūr uparahitā samanantarapratyayākhyavijñānalakṣaṇā pratyayāntarasāpekṣā sāmagrī /
analyzed: yā cakṣūḥ uparahitā samanantara pratyaya ākhya vijñāna lakṣaṇā pratyaya antara sāpekṣā sāmagrī
translated: And that collection, which is devoid of the eye, and is dependent on other conditions, characterized by the consciousness called the immediately preceding condition,

original: tato vijñānasya T / / vikalpakasyetarasya vā tadupādeyatvena yā bodharūpatopalabdhā sā cakṣurvijñānasyāpi bhavati /
analyzed: tatas vijñānasya t vikalpakasya itarasya vā tad upādeya tvena yā bodha rūpa tā upalabdhā sā cakṣuḥ vijñānasya api bhavati
