translated: from that, of the consciousness, whether discriminating or other, that is obtained in the form of awareness as something to be taken up, that also belongs to eye-consciousness.

original: tasyaiva cakṣurvijñānasya /🔽kidṛśasya / /
analyzed: tasya eva cakṣuḥ vijñānasya 🔽kidṛśasya
translated: And of that very eye-consciousness.🔽What kind [of eye-consciousness]?

original: upalambhātmanaḥsato bhavataḥ jāyamānasya tadaiva tadekakāryapratiniyatasya cakṣurindriyasya
analyzed: upalambha ātmanaḥ sataḥ bhavataḥ jāyamānasya tadā eva tad eka kārya pratiniyatasya cakṣuḥ indriyasya
translated: If it were to exist with the nature of apprehension, being born, and at that very time, and of the eye faculty, which is restricted to that one effect,

original: sannidhānāt S / / samanantarapratyayopādānopakṛtāt tato rūpagrahaṇapratiniyamo
analyzed: sannidhānāt s samanantara pratyaya upādāna upakṛtāt tatas rūpa grahaṇa pratiniyamaḥ
translated: due to the presence of the immediately preceding condition, which is assisted by the appropriating [condition], there would be restriction to the apprehension of form from that [eye faculty].

original: rūpākāratāpratiniyamaḥ /
analyzed: rūpa ākāra tā pratiniyamaḥ
translated: There would be restriction to the form aspect.

original: śabdādyākāravivekavata evaṃva
analyzed: śabda ādi ākāra vivekavataḥ
translated: And in the same way, [there would be restriction] for the consciousness that is distinguished from the aspects of sound and so on.

original: kāryasya cakṣuḥsahitasamanantarapratyayasāmagryāḥ janakatvād /
translated: Because the collection of the immediately preceding condition along with the eye is the producer of that effect.

original: viṣayād viṣayādhikātsamanantarapratyayād indriyāc ca tena viṣayeṇa tulyarūpatā
analyzed: viṣayāt indriyāt ca tena viṣayeṇa tulya rūpa tā
translated: From the object, which is superior to the object, from the immediately preceding condition, and from the sense faculty, there is the same form as that object.

original: na kevalaiva rūpapratibhāsitā bhrāntavijñānasyeveti viṣayendriyamanaskāralakṣaṇasāmagrīkāryam evaṃ pradarśitam /🔽tad anyad ekadvayajanyaṃ tu kāryaṃ
analyzed: na kevalā eva rūpa pratibhāsi tā bhrānta vijñānasya iva iti viṣaya indriya manaskāra lakṣaṇa sāmagrī kāryam evam pradarśitam  tat anyat eka dvaya janyam tu kāryam
translated: The appearance as form is not merely like in the case of a deluded consciousness. Thus the effect characterized by the collection of object, sense faculty, and attention is demonstrated in this way.

original: svayam abhyūhyam /
analyzed: svayam abhyūhyam
translated: That which is produced by one or two [conditions] other than that should be inferred by oneself.

original: atrābhinnatve 'pi vastutaḥ kāryasya cakṣurvijñānalakṣaṇasya kāraṇānāṃ viṣayendriyamanaskārāṇāṃ
analyzed: atra abhinna tve vastutas kāryasya cakṣuḥ vijñāna lakṣaṇasya kāraṇānām viṣaya indriya manaskārāṇām
translated: Here, even though the effect is non-different in reality, the causes, which are the object, sense faculty, and attention,

original: bhinnebhyaḥ svabhāvebhyaḥ kevalānām eṣāṃ yaḥ svabhāvas tato bhinnā evātajjanyebhyovidhiśenyebhyo 'pi viśe
analyzed: bhinnebhyaḥ svabhāvebhyaḥ kevalānām eṣām yaḥ svabhāvaḥ tatas bhinnā viśe
translated: The nature of these [causes] when they are separate is indeed different from that which produces them, and also different from that which does not produce them.

original: ṣā bodharūpatādilakṣanā bhavanti /
analyzed: ṣā bodha rūpa tā ādi lakṣanāḥ bhavanti
translated: The distinctions, such as having the nature of cognition, arise.

original: atajjanyāpekṣayācaikātmakā api bahutvena nirdiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: api bahutvena nirdiṣṭāḥ
translated: And even though they are of one nature in relation to what is not produced by that, they are indicated as many.

original: yata evam iti tasmāt na kāraṇabhede 'pi /
analyzed: yatas evam iti tasmāt na kāraṇa bhede pi
translated: And because this is so, therefore, even in the difference of causes,

original: S / / yathaikasāmagryantarggatapratyayabhede 'py abhedo naivaṃ sāmagrīlakṣaṇakāraṇabhede 'py abhedaḥ sāmagryantarasjanyebhyaḥ kāryaviśeṣasya
analyzed: yathā eka sāmagrī antarggata pratyaya bhede pi abhedaḥ na evam sāmagrī lakṣaṇa kāraṇa bhede pi abhedaḥ sāmagrī antaraḥ janyebhyaḥ kārya viśeṣasya  /
translated: just as there is no difference even in the difference of conditions included within the same assemblage, so too there is no difference even in the difference of causes characterized by the assemblage. The specific effect produced by a different assemblage

original: viśiṣṭasya kāryasyeti /
analyzed: viśiṣṭasya kāryasya iti
translated: is a distinguished effect.

original: tena yaducyate T / / yadi sahakāriṇāṃ bhede 'py abhinnaṃ kāryaṃ bhavati sāmagrībhede 'py abhinnam astu /
analyzed: tena yat ucyate t yadi sahakāriṇām bhede pi abhinnam kāryam bhavati sāmagrī bhede pi abhinnam astu
translated: Therefore, what is said - if the effect is the same even in the difference of cooperating factors, let it be the same even in the difference of assemblages.

original: atha sāmagrībhedād bhinnaṃ bhavati sahakāribhedād api kim iti bhinnaṃ na bhavati viśeṣābhāvāt /
analyzed: atha sāmagrī bhedāt bhinnam bhavati sahakāri bhedāt api kim iti bhinnam na bhavati viśeṣa abhāvāt
translated: But if it becomes different due to the difference of assemblages, why does it not become different even due to the difference of cooperating factors, due to the absence of distinction?

original: ' iti tadapāstaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: iti tat apāstam bhavati
translated: This is refuted.

original: tathā hi parasparopasarppaṇādyāśrayāt pratyayaviśeṣād ekakāryoddeśenetaretarasantānopakārāc ca sahakāriṇāṃ pratiniyataśaktīnām udayād ekaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi paraspara upasarppaṇa ādi āśrayāt pratyaya viśeṣāt eka kārya uddeśena itaretara santāna upakārāt ca sahakāriṇām pratiniyata śaktīnām udayāt ekam
translated: For thus, from the mutual dependence of the arising of the other, from the special conditions, and from the mutual benefit of the series for the sake of a single effect, the co-operating factors with restricted power arise, and from that one🔽effect is produced. But for another aggregate, the production of another effect is from other causes, which are the basis for the power that arises, because of the difference in nature of the entities. So how can

original: p / / sāmagryantarasya tu kāryāntaraprabhavaśaktinibandhanebhyo hetvantarebhyaḥ svabhāvabhedavato bhāvād bhinnakāryaprasūtir iti kuto
analyzed: sāmagrī antarasya tu kārya antara prabhava śakti nibandhanebhyaḥ hetu antarebhyaḥ svabhāva bhedavataḥ bhāvāt bhinna kārya prasūtiḥ iti kutas
translated: it be said that the effect is produced from the aggregate?

original: ṇopadarśanāt niga T /🔽viṣayeṣu T /
analyzed: ṇa upadarśanāt niga t  viṣayeṣu t
translated: Because it is shown by the example of the lamp-flame.

original: eva T /🔽dhikārāt T /
analyzed: eva t  dhikārāt t
translated: In the case of objects, it is the same.

original: eva tajja T /🔽ato janakāpekṣayā T /🔽kāryaṃ na jāyate T /
analyzed: eva tajja t  atas janaka apekṣayā t  kāryam na jāyate
translated: In the same way, it is the same.🔽Because of the authority, it is the same.🔽Therefore, it is produced from that.🔽Therefore, the effect is not produced in dependence on the producer.

original: janakatvam evādhāratvaṃ na tu sthāpakatvam /
translated: Producer itself is the basis, not the supporter.

original: nanu ca sarvaṃ kāryaṃ sādhāraṃyathā upādāyarūpam /
analyzed: nanu ca sarvam kāryam upādāya rūpam
translated: But is not every effect based, like the derivative form?

original: tad dhi bhūtebhyo tāny evāśrayataiti bhavadbhir iṣyate /
analyzed: tat hi bhūtebhyaḥ jāyamānam tāni bhavadbhiḥ iṣyate
translated: For that is accepted by you as depending on the elements, because it depends on them.

original: tathā 'nyad api vijñānādikaṃ kāryam /
analyzed: tathā nyat api vijñāna ādikam kāryam
translated: In the same way, other effects like consciousness are also like that.

original: ato 'nenāpi kiñcit kāraṇam āśrayaṇīyam /
analyzed: atas nena api kiñcid kāraṇam āśrayaṇīyam
translated: Therefore, something must be accepted as the cause of that also.

original: tasya ca kāraṇasya pūrvaṃ janakatvaṃ paścāt S / / kāryaṃ pratyādhārabhāva eva /
analyzed: tasya ca kāraṇasya pūrvam janaka tvam paścāt kāryam pratyādhāra bhāvaḥ eva
translated: And for that cause, the state of being a basis for the effect is only after the state of being a producer, not before.

original: na jananam /
analyzed: na jananam
translated: Not the production.

original: tatas tatsvabhāvasya jananād ity anekāntaḥ tadavastha evety ata āha ta evaite ye 'nantaram uktāḥ kāraṇaśaktibhedāḥ kāraṇānāṃ śaktiviśeṣāḥ
analyzed: tatas tad svabhāvasya jananāt iti anekāntaḥ tad avasthaḥ eva iti atas āha te eva ete ye nantaram uktāḥ kāraṇa śakti bhedāḥ kāraṇānām śakti viśeṣāḥ
translated: Therefore, because of the production of that nature, there is an inconclusive reason. Since the situation remains the same, he says: Those very distinctions in the power of causes that were just mentioned, the specific powers of causes,

original: kīdṛśāḥ / yathāsvaṃ yeṣāṃ kāraṇaśaktibhedānāṃ sahakārilakṣaṇānāṃ yadātmīyaṃ sāmagryantarajanyāt
analyzed: kīdṛśāḥ yathāsvam yeṣām kāraṇa śakti bhedānām sahakāri lakṣaṇānām yat ātmīyam sāmagrī antara janyāt
translated: What are they like? Those distinctions in the power of causes, which have the characteristic of cooperating factors, whose own specific effect is produced from a different collection,

original: prativiśiṣṭaṃ kāryaṃ tasya janane 'vyavadheyā vyavadhātuṃ T / / pratibandhum
analyzed: prativiśiṣṭam kāryam tasya janane vyavadheyāḥ vyavadhātum pratibandhum
translated: In the production of that, the power is incapable of being obstructed, of being hindered.

original: aśakyā śaktir yeṣāṃ tadbhāvastayā avyavadheyaśaktitayā avaśyaṃ kāryakāriśaktitayā
analyzed: aśakyā śaktiḥ yeṣām avyavadheya śakti tayā avaśyam kārya kāri śakti tayā
translated: By that, by the state of having that power that cannot be obstructed, by the power that necessarily produces an effect,

original: pratyupasthitāḥ udyuktāḥ santaḥ sāmagrīkāryasya ekapratyayajanitasya
analyzed: pratyupasthitāḥ udyuktāḥ santaḥ sāmagrī kāryasya eka pratyaya janitasya kasyacid
translated: Being present, being engaged, the effect of the collection, which is produced by a single condition,

original: abhāvātsarvaṃ sāmagryā eva kāryam iti kṛtvā sāmagrīkāryasya svabhāvasthityāśraya ity ucyante /
analyzed: sāmagryāḥ eva kāryam iti kṛtvā sāmagrī kāryasya svabhāva sthiti āśrayaḥ iti ucyante
translated: Since it does not exist, considering that everything is the effect of the collection, the effect of the collection is said to be the basis for the existence of its own nature.

original: kasmāt punar avyavadheyaśaktitā /
analyzed: kasmāt punar avyavadheya śakti tā
translated: Why, again, is the power incapable of being obstructed?

original: kṣaṇikatvāt /
analyzed: kṣaṇika tvāt
translated: Because of momentariness.

original: na hi kṣaṇikasya śaktiḥ pratibandhuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: na hi kṣaṇikasya śaktiḥ pratibandhum śakyate
translated: For the power of a momentary [entity] cannot be obstructed.

original: yāvatpratibandhako vyāpriyate tāvat kṣaṇikasya svakāryaṃ kṛtvaiva nirodhāt /
analyzed: svabhāva antara utpādane vyāpriyate tāvat kṣaṇikasya sva kāryam kṛtvā eva nirodhāt
translated: Because as long as the obstructive [factor] operates, the momentary [entity] performs its own function and then ceases.

original: kathaṃ punar asamānakālaṃ kāraṇam ādhāro yujyate /
analyzed: katham punar asamāna kālam kāraṇam ādhāraḥ yujyate
translated: How can a cause that is not simultaneous be a support?

original: ity ata āha tathāhi ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha tathā hi ityādi
translated: To explain this, he says Thus, because...

original: yasmāt tat vijñānalakṣaṇaṃ kāryaṃ tebhyaḥ cakṣurādibhyaḥ samastabhyo bodharūpatayā
analyzed: yasmāt tat vijñāna lakṣaṇam kāryam tebhyaḥ cakṣuḥ ādibhyaḥ samastabhyaḥ bodha rūpa tayā
translated: Because that effect characterized as consciousness is from all those eyes, etc., in the form of awareness,

original: tadanyasmāt tadajanyāt S / / prativiśiṣṭasvabhāvam ekaṃ khaṇḍaśaḥ kāryasyānutpādād
analyzed: tad anyasmāt tad ajanyāt prativiśiṣṭa svabhāvam ekam khaṇḍaśas kāryasya anutpādāt
translated: it is distinguished from that which is not produced from them, having a single nature without parts, because the effect is not produced in parts.

original: ekaikasmāt sakalasyaiva bhāvād ekaṃ jātam /
analyzed: ekaikasmāt sakalasya eva bhāvāt ekam jātam
translated: It is produced as one, because the whole exists in each part.

original: tasmāt te ādhārā ucyante /🔽na hi janakād anya evopakārakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt te ādhārāḥ ucyante  na hi janakāt anyaḥ evā upakārakaḥ
translated: Therefore, they are called supports.🔽For a helper is none other than a producer.

original: na cānupakāraka p / / ādhāraḥ /
analyzed: na ca an upakāraka ādhāraḥ
translated: And a non-helper is not a support.

original: atiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of over-extension.

original: tato bhinnakālasyādhārabhāvo na virudhyate /
analyzed: tatas bhinna kālasya ādhāra bhāvaḥ na virudhyate
translated: Therefore, the state of being a support for something of a different time is not contradictory.

original: yad api bhūtānām upādāyarūpaṃ pratyāśrayatvamucyate tad api svadeśasyāsya janakatvam eveti na kiñcit prāg janakaṃ bhūtvā paścāt
analyzed: yat api bhūtānām upādāya rūpam tat api sva deśasya asya janaka tvam eva iti na kiñcid prāk janakam bhūtvā paścāt sthāpaka tām
translated: And that which is called the state of being a basis for the derivative form of the elements is just the production of this [derivative form] in its own place. Therefore, nothing becomes a producer first and then a support later.

original: yato 'nekāntaḥ syād iti /
analyzed: yatas na ikāntaḥ syāt iti
translated: From which there would be an indeterminate [state].

original: sādhanādhāram T /
analyzed: sādhana ādhāram t
translated: The support of the means of knowledge.

original: mānam anyam evāśrayate T /
analyzed: mānam anyam eva āśrayate t
translated: It resorts to another pride.

original: svabhāvas T /
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ t
translated: It is the nature of that.

original: kvacid apy abhāvāt T /
analyzed: kvacid api abhāvāt t
translated: Because it does not exist anywhere.

original: ntaram āśritya yā T /
analyzed: ntaram āśritya yā t
translated: Resorting to another, that which is

original: pravṛttitvaṃ T /
translated: engaged is that.

original: sthāpanāhetur bhavati T /
analyzed: sthāpanā hetuḥ bhavati
translated: It becomes the reason for establishing that.

original: atiśayotpādanaṃ na sahakāritvaṃ kintu ekārthakāritvam /
translated: The production of superiority is not the state of being a cooperating cause, but rather the state of performing the same function.

original: punar anyathā tatsvabhāvasya jananād ity anekāntodbhāvanaṃ parasyāśaṅkyāha apratirodhaśaktikeṣu
analyzed: punar anyathā tad svabhāvasya jananāt iti anekānta udbhāvanam parasya āśaṅkya āha a pratirodha śaktikeṣu
translated: Because it produces that nature in another way, the opponent's raising of the possibility of inconclusiveness is suspected, and he says: In those whose power is unobstructed,

original: avidyamānaḥ pratirodhaḥ pratibandho yasyāḥ śakteḥ sā yeṣām T / / apratirodhaśaktikatvaṃ
analyzed: a vidyamānaḥ pratirodhaḥ pratibandhaḥ yasyāḥ śakteḥ sā yeṣām a pratirodha śaktika tvam
translated: that power which has no obstruction, i.e., no hindrance, is the power of those. The state of having unobstructed power

original: cānantarakāryatvāt /
analyzed: ca anantara kārya tvāt
translated: is due to being the immediately preceding cause.

original: ye hy utpannāḥ kālakṣepeṇa kāryaṃ kurvanti teṣāṃ syād api śaktipratibandho /
analyzed: ye hi utpannāḥ kāla kṣepeṇa kāryam kurvanti teṣām syāt api śakti pratibandho
translated: For those that arise and perform their function after a lapse of time, there could be obstruction of their power.

original: na tu ya udayānantaram eva kāryaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: na tu ye udaya anantaram eva kāryam kurvanti
translated: But not for those that perform their function immediately after arising.

original: anena kṣaṇakṣayiṇām upaghātakābhāvam āha /🔽anugrāhakaviraham apy āha anādheyaviśeṣeṣu /
analyzed: anena kṣaṇa kṣayiṇām upaghātaka abhāvam āha      api āha
translated: By this, he states the absence of a destroyer for those that perish moment by moment.🔽He also states the absence of a benefactor, saying in those without anything to be added.

original: tac cānādheyaviśeṣatvaṃ kṣaṇikeṣu ity anenāha /
analyzed: tat ca anādheya viśeṣa tvam kṣaṇikeṣu iti anena āha
translated: And that state of having nothing to be added, he says by this in momentary things.

original: na hi kṣaṇikānāṃ viśeṣa ādhātuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: na hi kṣaṇikānām viśeṣaḥ ādhātum śakyate
translated: For momentary things, it is not possible to add anything.

original: viśeṣādhāyakena tatsahabhāvinā tadanantaraṃ tadutpādanāt /
analyzed: viśeṣa ādhāyakena tad sahabhāvinā tad anantaram tad utpādanāt
translated: because it produces that immediately after, along with that which brings about the special quality.

original: tadā S / / ca tasya nirodhāt /
analyzed: tadā s ca tasya nirodhāt
translated: And at that time, because of the cessation of that.

original: teṣv evaṃvidheṣu pratyayeṣu parasparaṃkaḥsahakārārthaḥ yena sahakāriṇa ucyante / /
analyzed: teṣu evaṃvidheṣu pratyayeṣu parasparaṃkaḥ sahakāra arthaḥ yena sahakāriṇaḥ ucyante
translated: In these kinds of conditions, what is the mutual cooperative purpose by which they are called cooperators?

original: nanv anādheyaviśeṣatvenaiva sahakāritvābhāvaḥ pratipādita iti kim artham idam apratirodhaśaktikeṣv iti / /🔽na hi śaktipratirodhakaḥ
analyzed: nanu anādheya viśeṣa tvena eva sahakāri tva abhāvaḥ pratipāditaḥ iti kim artham idam a pratirodha śaktikeṣu iti  na hi śakti pratirodhakaḥ
translated: But isn't it explained that there is no cooperative action just because there is no addition of a special quality? So why is this said: in those whose power is unobstructed?

original: sahakārī bhaṇyate /
analyzed: sahakārī bhaṇyate
translated: For a cooperator is not said to be an obstruction to power.

original: satyam /
analyzed: satyam
translated: True,

original: sarvathā tu tatrākiñcitkaratvajñāpanārtham etad uktam /
analyzed: sarvathā tu tatra akiñcitkara tva jñāpana artham etat uktam
translated: but this is said in order to show that it does nothing at all in that case.

original: śaktipratibandhakāpanayanena copakāritvakalpanāṃ sahakāriṇāṃ nirasyati /
analyzed: śakti pratibandhaka apanayanena ca upakāri tva kalpanām sahakāriṇām nirasyati
translated: And by removing the obstruction to power, he rejects the idea that cooperators help by removing the obstruction to power.

original: tasmād atiśayādhāyinaḥ sahakāriṇo 'sambhavāt kṣaṇikānāṃ svahetumātrapratibaddham eva janakatvam /
analyzed: tasmāt atiśaya ādhāyinaḥ sahakāriṇaḥ sambhavāt kṣaṇikānām sva hetu mātra pratibaddham eva janaka tvam
translated: Therefore, since cooperators that bring about a special quality are impossible, the causal nature of momentary things is bound only by their own cause.

original: tac caivaṃ vidhaṃ sarvadā 'sti /
analyzed: tat ca evaṃvidham sarvadā sti
translated: And that of this kind always exists.

original: na ca kevalā janayantīti tatsvabhāvasya jananād ity anekānta eveti manyate /
analyzed: na ca kevalāḥ janayanti iti tad svabhāvasya jananāt iti anekāntaḥ eva iti manyate
translated: And since they do not produce when alone, he thinks that the reason because of the production of that nature is inconclusive.

original: etat pariharati na vai naiva atiśayotpādanaṃsahakriyā yatas tadabhāvāt sahakāriṇo na syuḥ /
analyzed: etat pariharati na vai na eva yatas tad abhāvāt sahakāriṇaḥ na syuḥ
translated: He answers this: No, there is no production of excess, because of which, due to its absence, the auxiliaries would not be.

original: kva punar sahakriyā pratiyayānāṃ na bhavati / /
analyzed: kva punar atiśaya utpādanam sahakriyā na bhavati
translated: Where then is the non-existence of the notion of cooperation of the auxiliaries?

original: sarvatra /
analyzed: sarvatra
translated: Everywhere.

original: na hi kvacid api sahabhāvinām atiśayotpādanalakṣaṇāT / / sahakriyā p / / sambhavati /
analyzed: na hi kvacid api sahabhāvinām   sahakriyā sambhavati
translated: For nowhere is there cooperation in the form of producing an excess in the co-existent auxiliaries.

original: kā tarhi sahakriyā /
analyzed: kā tarhi sahakriyā
translated: Then what is cooperation?

original: ity āha ekārthakaraṇam ekakāryaniṣpādanaṃ yad bahūnām /
analyzed: iti āha eka artha karaṇam eka kārya niṣpādanam yat
translated: He says: The performance of one purpose, the accomplishment of one effect, by many.

original: api sambhāvanāyām /
analyzed: sambhāvanāyām
translated: Even in the case of possibility.

original: S / / nyāyabalād evaṃvidhām eva sarvatra sahakriyāṃ sambhāvayāmaḥ / nānyām iti /
analyzed: nyāya balāt evaṃvidhām eva sarvatra sahakriyām sambhāvayāmaḥ na anyām iti
translated: By the force of reasoning, we accept only such cooperation everywhere, and not any other.

original: atrodāharaṇam yathāantyasya anantarāṅkurādikāryasya kāraṇakalāpasya pratyayasāmagryā iti /🔽yopādānam T /
analyzed: atra udāharaṇam yathā antyasya anantara aṅkura ādi kāryasya kāraṇa kalāpasya pratyaya sāmagryāḥ iti  ya upādānam t
translated: Here is an example: Like the totality of conditions for the final group of causes of the effect beginning with the sprout.🔽That which is the material cause.

original: yopādāna T /🔽ekakāryakāritvam eva mukhyaṃ sahakāritvam itarat tu gauṇam /
analyzed: ya upādāna t
translated: That which is the material cause.🔽The primary cooperation is the performance of one effect only, while the other is secondary.

original: syād etat aupacārikam etat sahakāritvam /
analyzed: syāt etat aupacārikam etat sahakāri tvam
translated: This may be said: This cooperation is figurative.

original: atiśayotpādanam eva tu mukhyam ity ata āha tad eva ekakāryakāraṇalakṣaṇaṃ mukhyaṃsahakāritvam nātiśayotpādanalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: atiśaya utpādanam eva tu mukhyam iti atas āha tat eva eka kārya kāraṇa lakṣaṇam mukhyam sahakāri tvam na atiśaya utpādana lakṣaṇam
translated: But the production of a special effect is primary. Therefore, he says that the primary cooperation is that which has the characteristic of being the cause and effect of a single effect, not that which has the characteristic of producing a special effect.

original: tasyaiva gauṇatvāt /
analyzed: tasya eva gauṇa tvāt
translated: Because that [primary cooperation] is secondary.

original: etac cottaratra vakṣyate /
analyzed: etat ca uttaratra vakṣyate
translated: And this will be explained later.

original: kuta etat / ity āha tasyaiva anyasya vivakṣitakāryaṃ prati kāraṇatvāt /
analyzed: kutas etat iti āha tasya eva anyasya vivakṣita kāryam prati kāraṇa tvāt
translated: Why is this? He says: Because that [primary cooperation] alone is the cause with respect to the effect that is intended by another [cooperation].

original: kāraṇasya ca sahakārivyapadeśaḥ nākāraṇasya /
analyzed: kāraṇasya ca sahakāri vyapadeśaḥ na akāraṇasya
translated: And a cause is called a cooperating cause, not a non-cause.

original: yataḥ saha yugapat sarvantaḥ sahakāriṇa ucyante /
analyzed: yatas saha yugapad sarvantaḥ sahakāriṇaḥ ucyante
translated: Because all the cooperating causes are said to be together, simultaneously.

original: antyaś ca kāraṇakalāpa evaṃvidha iti /
analyzed: antyaḥ ca kāraṇa kalāpaḥ evaṃvidhaḥ iti
translated: And the final set of causes is of this kind.

original: yathā cāntyasyaikārthakāraṇaṃ sahakāritvam evaṃ pūrvasyāpi kāraṇakalāpasyottarottaraviśiṣṭakṣaṇāntarārambhiṇa ity avaseyam /
analyzed: yathā ca antyasya ekārtha kāraṇam sahakāri tvam evam pūrvasya api kāraṇa kalāpasya uttara uttara viśiṣṭa kṣaṇa antara ārambhiṇaḥ iti avaseyam
translated: And just as the final [set of causes] has cooperation in producing a single effect, so too the preceding set of causes, which produces the subsequent moments that are progressively more special, should be understood to have cooperation.

original: antyasyodāharaṇatayā nirddeśāt /🔽tasmāt sarvaṃ kāryam aṅkurādikaṃ viśeṣalakṣaṇaṃ vā 'nekapratyayajanyam iti /
analyzed: antyasya udāharaṇa tayā nirddeśāt  tasmāt sarvam kāryam aṅkura ādikam viśeṣa lakṣaṇam vā neka pratyaya janyam iti
translated: Because the final [set of causes] is indicated as an example.🔽Therefore, all effects such as sprouts and so on, or those characterized by special features, are produced by many conditions.

original: sarvatraikārthakriyaiva copacīyamānāpacīyamānakāryakāriṇaḥ kāraṇakalāpasya sahakāritvam /
analyzed: sarvatra eka artha kriyā eva ca upacīyamāna apacīyamāna kārya kāriṇaḥ kāraṇa kalāpasya sahakāri tvam
translated: And everywhere, the cooperation of a set of causes that produces effects that are either increasing or decreasing is the single activity for a single purpose.

original: na viśeṣotpādanam iti /
analyzed: na viśeṣa utpādanam iti
translated: [The answer is:] There is no production of a special property.

original: syād etat ekārthakaraṇam api tatra S / / sahakāritvam astu atiśayotpādanalakṣaṇam
analyzed: syāt etat eka artha karaṇam api tatra s sahakāri tvam astu atiśaya utpādana lakṣaṇam
translated: This may be said: Even the performance of the same purpose there may be the nature of an auxiliary, which is characterized by the production of a special property.

original: apīty ata āha tatra ca kṣaṇe 'ntye viśeṣasya karttum aśakyatvāt nātiśayotpādanam api sahakāritvam /
analyzed: api iti atas āha tatra ca kṣaṇe ntye viśeṣasya karttum aśakya tvāt na atiśaya utpādanam api sahakāri tvam
translated: Even so, he says: And because in the last moment it is impossible to produce a special property, the nature of an auxiliary is not even the production of a special property.

original: kuto viśeṣasya T / / karttum aśakyatvam /
analyzed: kutas viśeṣasya t karttum aśakya tvam
translated: Why is it impossible to produce a special property there?

original: ity ata āha ekasya anaṃśasya svabhāvasyāvivekāt /
analyzed: iti atas āha ekasya an aṃśasya svabhāvasya avivekāt
translated: For this reason he says: Because a partless own nature cannot be distinguished.

original: na hi tatra ayam anāhitātiśayo bhāgaḥ svahetubhyo jātaḥ /
analyzed: na hi tatra ayam anāhita atiśayaḥ bhāgaḥ sva hetubhyaḥ jātaḥ
translated: For there is no distinction here: This part is produced from its own causes without an added special property,

original: ayaṃ tu sahakāribhir āhitātiśayaḥ' iti viveko 'sti /
analyzed: ayam tu sahakāribhiḥ āhita atiśayaḥ iti
translated: but this one has an added special property by the auxiliaries.

original: yadi nāmāvivekaḥ /
analyzed: yadi nāma avivekaḥ
translated: If there is no distinction,

original: viśeṣas tu kim iti na kriyate /
analyzed: viśeṣaḥ tu kim iti na kriyate
translated: why is a special property not produced?

original: ity ata āha svabhāvāntarotpattilakṣaṇatvād viśeṣotpatteḥ /
analyzed: iti atas āha svabhāva antara utpatti lakṣaṇa tvāt viśeṣa utpatteḥ
translated: For this reason he says: Because the production of a special property is characterized by the production of a different own nature.

original: nirbhāge ca kutaḥ svabhāvāntarasya vyavasthā / /
analyzed: nirbhāge ca kutas svabhāva antarasya vyavasthā
translated: And in what is partless, how can a different own nature be established?

original: syānmatam bhinnasvabhāva evāntyasya viśeṣo 'stu ity ata āha bhāvāntara ityādi /
analyzed: syāt matam bhinna svabhāvaḥ eva antyasya viśeṣaḥ stu iti atas āha bhāva antare ityādi
translated: The view may be that a different own nature itself may be the special property of the last [moment], for this reason he says a different existence, etc.

original: yadi bhāvāntaralakṣaṇo viśeṣo p / / bhavet tadā tasyāntyatvam eva hīyeta /🔽hīyenāṃhīyatāṃ
analyzed: yadi bhāva antara lakṣaṇaḥ viśeṣaḥ bhavet tadā tasya antya tvam eva hīyeta  hīyena aṃhīyatām
translated: If the difference were characterized by another entity, then its finality would be lost.

original: ko doṣaḥ / iti cet /
analyzed: kaḥ doṣaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is lost, what is the fault?

original: tataśca anantyatvāt na sākṣāt kāraṇaṃsyāt /
analyzed: tatas ca anantya tvāt na sākṣāt kāraṇam syāt
translated: If that is so, then because it is not final, it would not be a direct cause.

original: yata evaṃ tasmān na kāraṇasya mukhyasya sahakāribhyaḥ sakāśādviśeṣasyotpattiḥ ity ekārthakriyaiva sahakāritvam iti /
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt na kāraṇasya mukhyasya sahakāribhyaḥ iti eka artha kriyā eva sahakāri tvam iti
translated: Since it is so, therefore the difference of the primary cause does not arise from the cooperating factors. Thus cooperation is the performance of the same effect.

original: nanv asatyāṃ sahakāribhyo viśeṣotpattau kāryajanane sāmarthyam eṣāṃ na yujyata ity ata S / / āha te samarthāh ityādi /
analyzed: nanu asatyām sahakāribhyaḥ viśeṣa utpattau kārya janane sāmarthyam eṣām na yujyate iti atas āha te ityādi
translated: If the arising of difference from the cooperating factors does not exist, then their ability to produce the effect is not reasonable. Therefore he says they are able and so on.

original: yadi hi te svabhāvenāsamarthā utpadyeran tadaiṣāṃ sahakāribhyaḥ sāmarthyotpattir abhyupagamyeta /
analyzed: yadi hi te svabhāvena asamarthāḥ utpadyeran tadā eṣām sahakāribhyaḥ sāmarthya utpattiḥ abhyupagamyeta
translated: If they were to arise as inherently unable, then their ability would be accepted to arise from the cooperating factors.

original: yāvatā te 'ntyāḥsvabhāvenaiva samarthāḥpratyayāḥsahitājāyante /
analyzed: yāvatā te ntyāḥ svabhāvena eva samarthāḥ pratyayāḥ sahitāḥ jāyante kṣaṇa mātra vilambinaḥ
translated: However, those final conditions arise as inherently able, when combined.

original: yeṣāmekakṣaṇaniyatatvāt tataḥ prāk paścāt pṛthak tv abhāvo nāsti /
analyzed: tatas prāk paścāt pṛthak tu abhāvaḥ na asti
translated: Since they are restricted to a single moment, before and after that there is no separate existence.

original: yebhyaścānantaram eva kāryam utpadyate na kālāntareṇa tatra teṣv evaṃvidheṣu ekārthakriyaiva sahakāritvam nātiśayotpādanalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: yebhyaḥ ca anantaram eva kāryam utpadyate na kāla antareṇa tatra teṣu evaṃvidheṣu eka artha kriyā eva sahakāri tvam na atiśaya utpādana lakṣaṇam
translated: And those immediately after which the effect arises, not after an interval, in those of that kind, the cooperation is just the performance of the same purpose, not the production of an excess, because the production of an excess is impossible.

original: svabhāvataḥ sāmarthyasya T / / bhāvavirodhāt /
analyzed: svabhāvataḥ sāmarthyasya t bhāva virodhāt
translated: Because it is contradictory for an existent to have the power by its own nature.

original: parasparataś cānabhyupagamāt samarthasya janmaivāyuktam iti manvānaḥ paraḥ āha samarthaḥkutaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: parasparataḥ ca anabhyupagamāt samarthasya janma eva ayuktam iti manvānaḥ paraḥ āha samarthaḥ kutas ityādi
translated: And because of mutual non-acceptance, the production of the capable is not proper. Thinking this, the opponent says How can the capable... and so on.

original: siddhāntavādy āha svakāraṇebhyaḥ iti /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha sva kāraṇebhyaḥ iti
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says from its own causes.

original: paramatāpekṣayā tu svabhāvata ity uktam /
analyzed: paramatā apekṣayā tu svabhāvataḥ iti uktam
translated: But in relation to the opponent's view, it is said by its own nature.

original: paro atyantasya hy utpannasya
analyzed: paras hi atyantasya hi utpannasya
translated: For what is absolutely produced,

original: kāraṇasya sahakāribhyaḥ sāmarthyam icchatīti tanniṣedhaparaṃsvabhāvata iti vacanam /
analyzed: sahakāribhyaḥ sāmarthyam icchati iti iti vacanam
translated: the opponent wishes for the power of the cause from the cooperating factors. Therefore, the statement by its own nature is for the purpose of refuting that.

original: na tu svabhāvataḥ kiñcij jāyate /
analyzed: na tu svabhāvataḥ kiñcid jāyate
translated: But nothing is produced by its own nature.

original: tasyāhetukatvaprasaṅgāt /🔽sākṣād T /
analyzed: tasya ahetuka tva prasaṅgāt  sākṣāt t
translated: Because it would follow that it has no cause.🔽Because of the direct dependence of their production on the cooperating factors,

original: lambino janmanas teṣāṃ T /
analyzed: lambinaḥ janmanaḥ teṣām t
translated: the production of those is from the cooperating factors.🔽Because of the direct dependence of their production on the cooperating factors,

original: hy utpādakasya T /🔽tanniṣedhāya paraṃ T /🔽kṣaṇikeṣv ekārthakriyāniyamasya yavasthāpanam /
analyzed: hi utpādakasya t  tad niṣedhāya param t
translated: the production of those is from the cooperating factors.🔽The establishment of the restriction to the performance of the same purpose for the momentary is for the purpose of refuting the opponent's view.

original: ekārthakriyāniyama eva kṣaṇikānām ayuktaḥ /
analyzed: eka artha kriyā niyamaḥ eva kṣaṇikānām ayuktaḥ
translated: The restriction to the performance of the same purpose is not proper for the momentary.

original: kevalānām apy aṃtyakṣaṇasarūpāṇāṃ darśanāt /
analyzed: kevalānām api antya kṣaṇa sarūpāṇām darśanāt
translated: Because we see that the final moments of the individual [causes] are similar [to the final moments of the combined causes].

original: tathā hi idam evaṃrūpaṃ naivaṃ ca' iti darśanādarśanābhyāṃ S / / vibhajyate /🔽tatra yādṛśāḥ kṣityādayas tadanyapratyayasannidhāv upalabhyante tādṛśā eva kevalā api /
analyzed: tathā hi idam evaṃrūpam na evam ca iti darśana adarśanābhyām s vibhajyate  tatra yādṛśāḥ kṣiti ādayaḥ tad anya pratyaya sannidhau upalabhyante tādṛśāḥ eva kevalāḥ api
translated: For thus, [the effect] is distinguished by seeing and not seeing [in the form]: This is of such a form, but not that.🔽For instance, earth and so on are perceived in the presence of other conditions as they are, even individually.

original: tatas tadanyasahitā iva kevalā api samartham aṅkurajanane svaṃ svaṃ kṣaṇāntaram ārabheran /
analyzed: tatas tad anya sahitāḥ iva kevalāḥ api samartham aṅkura janane svam svam kṣaṇa antaram ārabheran
translated: Therefore, like when combined with others, even individually they would produce their own subsequent moments capable of generating a sprout.

original: tataḥ kevalasyāpy aṅkurādijananasvābhāvyād ajananāc ca tatsvabhāvasya jananāt' ity
analyzed: tatas kevalasya api aṅkura ādi janana svābhāvyāt ajananāt ca tad svabhāvasya jananāt iti
translated: Therefore, because even the individual [causes] have the nature of generating a sprout, and because the non-producer has the nature of producing,

original: anekānta eveti manyamānaḥ para p / / āha tāni svakāraṇāni kṣitibījādīni enaṃ
analyzed: anekāntaḥ eva iti manyamānaḥ āha tāni sva kāraṇāni kṣiti bīja ādīni enam
translated: [the opponent] thinks that there is indeed an inconclusiveness [in our argument]. The opponent says: Those [causes], such as earth and seed, bring about this [effect]

original: samartham aparasya anyasya pratyayasya sannidhāna eva kiṃ kasmāt anayanti /
analyzed: samartham aparasya anyasya pratyayasya sannidhāne eva kim kasmāt anayanti
translated: capable [of producing the effect] only in the presence of another condition. Why?

original: na kevalāni /
analyzed: na kevalāni
translated: Not individually.

original: sahitānām eva sarvadā sambhavāt iti cet āha kadācit kasmiṃścit kāle anyathā'pi kevalā api syuḥ bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sahitānām eva sarvadā sambhavāt iti ced āha kadācid kasmiṃścid kāle anyathā api kevalāḥ api syuḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: If it is argued that it is because the combined [causes] are always possible, [the author] says: Sometimes, at some time, they might be individual [causes] in a different way.

original: tathā hi dṛśyanta evādhyātikabāhyāḥ kvacit kārye yādṛśā yatsahitāḥ tādṛśā eva tadrahitā
analyzed: tathā hi dṛśyante eva ādhyātika bāhyāḥ kvacid kārye yādṛśāḥ yad sahitāḥ tādṛśāḥ eva tad rahitā
translated: For indeed, the internal and external are seen to be sometimes in a certain effect just like that, even when not accompanied by that.

original: apīti / T / / janayan tu kevalā api sambhavantaḥ samartham / ko doṣaḥ /
analyzed: api iti t janayan tu kevalāḥ api sambhavantaḥ samartham kaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: If, generating even when alone, they are capable, what is the fault?

original: iti ced āha tataśca kevalānām api samarthajanakānāṃ sambhavāt eko 'pi na kevalam
analyzed: iti ced āha tatas ca kevalānām api samartha janakānām sambhavāt ekaḥ na kevalam
translated: If it is said so, he says: And therefore, even of those capable of generating alone, since they are possible, even one alone, not just many,

original: anekaḥ kvacid deśādau S / / samarthaḥ utpannaḥ kṣitibījādir aṅkurādikāryaṃ janayet
analyzed: anekaḥ kvacid deśa ādau s samarthaḥ utpannaḥ kṣiti bīja ādiḥ aṅkura ādi kāryam janayet
translated: in some place, etc., is capable of producing, having arisen, the effect such as a sprout, etc., like the earth, seed, etc.

original: yadi tatsvabhāvasyāvaśyaṃ janakatvam /
analyzed: yadi tad svabhāvasya avaśyam janaka tvam
translated: If the nature of that which necessarily generates is that,

original: na ca kevalo janayati tatsvabhāvasambhave 'pi tato 'nekānta iti paraḥ /
analyzed: na ca kevalaḥ janayati tad svabhāva sambhave tatas na ekāntaḥ iti paraḥ
translated: and the alone does not generate, even when the nature of that is possible, then there is inconclusiveness, says the opponent.

original: etat pariharann āha aparāpara ityādi /🔽aparaiś cāparaiś ca kuśūla tadapanetṛpuruṣaprayatnapiṭakādiprakṣepakṣetranayanaprakiraṇādibhiḥ
analyzed: etat pariharan āha apara aparaḥ ityādi  aparaiḥ ca aparaiḥ ca kuśūla tad apanetṛ puruṣa prayatna piṭaka ādi prakṣepa kṣetra nayana prakiraṇa ādibhiḥ
translated: Refuting this, he says by other and other and so on.🔽By other and other conditions such as the threshing floor, the effort of the man who removes it, the throwing in of the mortar, etc., the bringing to the field, the scattering, etc.,

original: pratyayair yo yogaḥtena kāraṇena pratikṣaṇaṃbhinnaśaktayo na kadācit pūrvāparakālabhāvina
analyzed: pratyayaiḥ yaḥ yogaḥ tena kāraṇena pratikṣaṇam bhinna śaktayaḥ na kadācid
translated: by that cause, the different potencies moment by moment, never at any time existing before or after,

original: ekaśaktayaḥ 'py abhinnaśaktitāyāmahetukatvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: eka śaktayaḥ apara apara pratyaya yoga lakṣaṇa hetu bhede pi
translated: Even though they have one power, if they have the same power, it would follow that they are without a cause.

original: anyatrāpi ca śāliyavabījādau śaktibhedasya hetubhedanibandhanatvāt /
analyzed: anyatra api ca śāli yava bīja ādau śakti bhedasya hetu bheda nibandhana tvāt
translated: And because the difference in power in other cases also, such as in rice, barley, seeds, etc., is based on a difference in causes.

original: saṃskārāḥ sametya sambhūya ca pratyayaiḥ kriyamāṇāḥ santanvantaḥ santānena bhavanto🔽yady api kutaścit sāmyād varṇena saṃsthānena anyena vā kenacitprakāreṇa sādṛśyād
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ sametya sambhūya ca pratyayaiḥ kriyamāṇāḥ santanvantaḥ santānena bhavantaḥ  yadi api kutaścid sāmyāt varṇena saṃsthānena anyena vā kenacid prakāreṇa sādṛśyāt
translated: The impressions, having come together and having been produced by the conditions, continuing in a series, existing in a continuum,

original: ekākāraparāmarśapratyayajananalakṣaṇāt samānaṃ rūpam eṣām iti sarūpāḥ sadṛśāḥ pratīyante
analyzed: eka ākāra parāmarśa pratyaya janana lakṣaṇāt samānam rūpam eṣām iti sarūpāḥ sadṛśāḥ pratīyante
translated: even though they are cognized as similar, as having the same form, by the cognition of a single aspect, due to some kind of similarity in color, shape, or any other way,

original: pratyabhijñāyante tathāpi kṛtrimakṛtrimāṇāṃ iva maṇimuktādīnām aparāparapratyayayogalakṣaṇasāmagrībhedād
analyzed: pratyabhijñāyante tathā api kṛtrima kṛtrimāṇām iva maṇi muktā ādīnām apara apara pratyaya yoga lakṣaṇa sāmagrī bhedāt
translated: and are recognized as the same, nevertheless, like artificial and natural gems, pearls, etc., due to the difference in the collection characterized by the connection with different conditions,

original: bhinna eva visadṛśa eva na pratyabhijñānavaśād abhinnaḥ tulyarūpa eṣāṃ bījādīnāṃ
analyzed: bhinnaḥ eva visadṛśaḥ eva na pratyabhijñāna vaśāt abhinnaḥ tulya rūpaḥ eṣām bīja ādīnām
translated: their nature is indeed different, dissimilar, not the same due to recognition, not the same in form.

original: svabhāvaḥ T / / yata evaṃ tena bhinnasvabhāvatvena bhinnaśaktitayā vā 'parāparasāmagrījanyatvena
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ yatas evam tena bhinna svabhāva tvena bhinna śakti tayā vā para apara sāmagrī janya tvena
translated: This is the nature of seeds, etc. Since it is so, therefore, due to having a different nature, having a different power, being produced by different collections,

original: kṣaṇānāṃ siddhayā kiñcid eva kṣitibījādikaṃ kasyacid eva kāryasyāṅkurādes p / /
analyzed: kṣaṇānām siddhayā kiñcid eva kṣiti bīja ādikam kasyacid eva kāryasya aṅkura ādeḥ
translated: And by the establishment of moments, only some thing like earth, seed, etc. is the cause of only some effect like a sprout, etc.

original: tajjananasamarthasya vā kāraṇam /
analyzed: tad janana samarthasya vā kāraṇam
translated: Or it is the cause of that which is capable of producing it.

original: na sarvaṃ sarvasya /
analyzed: na sarvam sarvasya
translated: Not everything of everything.

original: tathā ca vyagrāṇāṃ kṣitibījādinām aṅkurajananasvabhāvatā
analyzed: tathā ca vyagrāṇām kṣiti bīja ādinām aṅkura janana svabhāva tā
translated: And thus, the scattered things like earth, seed, etc. do not have the nature of producing a sprout,

original: samarthakṣaṇajananasvabhāvatā vā nāsty eveti tatsvabhāvasya jananād ajanakasya cātatsvabhāvatvād
analyzed: samartha kṣaṇa janana svabhāva tā vā nā asti evā iti tad svabhāvasya jananāt ajanakasya ca a tad svabhāva tvāt
translated: Or the nature of producing a moment capable of producing it. Therefore, because of producing what has that nature, and because what does not produce does not have that nature,

original: ity atra nānekāntaḥ yato yo yatsvabhāvaḥ sa svahetor evotpadyamānaḥ tādṛśo bhavati
analyzed: iti atra na anekāntaḥ yatas yaḥ yad svabhāvaḥ sa sva hetoḥ eva utpadyamānaḥ tādṛśaḥ bhavati
translated: there is no inconclusiveness here. Because whatever has such a nature, when produced from its own cause, becomes just that.

original: na punas tadbhave hetvantaram apekṣata ity atrānekāntaḥ syād iti /
analyzed: na punar tad bhave hetu antaram apekṣate iti atra anekāntaḥ syāt iti
translated: And it does not depend on another cause to become that. Thus there would be no inconclusiveness here.

original: pratyabhijñānasya ca sarūpatāviṣayasya sāmagrībhedād anumitabhinnaśaktisvabhāvatvena bādhyamānatayā prāmāṇyābhāvāt na tataḥ sarūpatāsiddhiḥ
analyzed: pratyabhijñānasya ca sarūpa tā viṣayasya sāmagrī bhedāt anumita bhinna śakti svabhāva tvena bādhyamāna tayā prāmāṇya abhāvāt na tatas sarūpa tā siddhiḥ
translated: And because recognition, which has the same form as its object, is contradicted by the inferred different potency and nature, and because it lacks validity, the establishment of the same form is not due to that.

original: kṣaṇakṣayiṇām iti /
analyzed: kṣaṇa kṣayiṇām iti
translated: And because of the destruction of moments, etc.

original: pūrvaṃ ca ata evānaeva ta
analyzed: pūrvam ca atas ta
translated: And before, it is not so for this very reason.

original: yor avasthayor vastubhedo niśceyaḥ' ityādinā S / / ekatvāviṣayaṃ pratyabhijñānaṃ nirastam /
translated: The non-difference of the two states of the object is to be ascertained and so on. The recognition which does not have oneness as its object has been refuted.

original: adhunā tu tulyasvabhāvatāviṣayam iti bhedaḥ /🔽etad api tatra aparāparotpatteḥ' ityanenoktam eva /🔽vipañcanārthaṃtu punaḥ iha upanyastam /
analyzed: adhunā tu tulya svabhāva tā viṣayam iti bhedaḥ  etat api tatra apara apara utpatteḥ eva  punar iha upanyastam
translated: But now [the recognition] has the same nature as its object, so it is different.🔽This too has been stated there by [the verse] because of the arising of another and another.🔽But it is presented here again for the sake of elaboration.

original: bhedepi bhinna T /🔽p / /🔽p / /
analyzed: bhede pi bhinna t  ro-0 ro-0
translated: Even in difference, the different [cognition] is the cause of the different [object].🔽[The cognition] is not the cause of the different [object].🔽[The cognition] is not the cause of the different [object].

original: viṣayanivedanārtham T /
analyzed: viṣaya nivedana artham
translated: For the sake of indicating the object, [the cognition] is the cause of the different [object].

original: kṣaṇikeṣu hetuphalabhāvavyavasthāyāḥ kathanam /
translated: The establishment of the relation of cause and effect in momentary [entities] is explained.

original: kiñcid eva kasyacit kāraṇam ity uktam tatra kiṃ kasya kāraṇam iti śakyaparicchedam apy ādhyātmikeṣu tāvad darśayann āha tatra ityādi
analyzed: kiñcid eva kasyacid kāraṇam iti uktam tatra kim kasya kāraṇam iti śakya paricchedam api ādhyātmikeṣu tāvat darśayan āha tatra ityādi
translated: It has been said that something is the cause of something, so what is the cause of what? Although it can be determined, he shows it in the internal [world] by saying there and so on.

original: tatra teṣu pratikṣaṇaṃ śaktisvabhāveṣu kṣaṇikeṣu bhāveṣu /
analyzed: tatra teṣu pratikṣaṇam śakti svabhāveṣu kṣaṇikeṣu bhāveṣu
translated: There, among those momentary entities that have the nature of power in every moment,

original: vyavadhānaṃ vyavadhīyate yena /
analyzed: vyavadhānam vyavadhīyate yena
translated: that by which there is obstruction is obstruction.

original: tadādir yeṣāṃ atidūrātyāsannatvādīnāṃ te 'vidyamānāyasmin deśe so 'vyavadhānādiḥ deśo yasya so 'vyavadhānādideśaḥ /
analyzed: tad ādiḥ yeṣām atidūra ati āsanna tva ādīnām te deśe saḥ vyavadhāna ādiḥ deśaḥ yasya saḥ vyavadhāna ādi deśaḥ
translated: Those that have that as their beginning, such as being too far away or too close, are non-existent in that place. That place which has no obstruction, etc., is the place without obstruction, etc.

original: T / / rūpam indriyaṃ cādī yasya manaskārādeḥ rūpendriyādiḥsa cāsau kāraṇakalāpaś ca sāmagrīlakṣaṇas tathoktaḥ /
analyzed: rūpam indriyam ca ādī yasya manaskāra ādeḥ sa ca asau kāraṇa kalāpaḥ ca sāmagrī lakṣaṇaḥ tathā uktaḥ
translated: The form, sense faculty, etc. of that mental activity, etc. are the form sense faculty, etc. And that is the collection of causes, characterized as a combination, which is so described.

original: avyavadhānādideśaś cāsau rūpendriyādikāraṇakalāpaś ca sa vijñānajanane samartho hetuḥ nānyaḥ /
analyzed: avyavadhāna ādi deśaḥ ca asau rūpa indriya ādi kāraṇa kalāpaḥ ca sa vijñāna janane samarthaḥ hetuḥ na anyaḥ
translated: And that collection of causes, such as the form sense faculty, which is in an unobstructed place, etc., is the cause capable of producing consciousness, not any other.

original: tadbhāva eva tasya bhāvāt /
analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ eva tasya bhāvāt
translated: Because it exists only when that exists.

original: anyabhāve 'pi cābhāvāt /
analyzed: anya bhāve pi ca abhāvāt
translated: And because it does not exist even when the other exists.🔽And because the determination of what is capable and what is not is based on this alone.

original: etanmātranibandhanatvāc ca samarthāsamarthavyavasthāyāḥ /
analyzed: etad mātra nibandhana tvāt ca samartha asamartha vyavasthāyāḥ
translated: That is, the mutual approach of those sense faculties, etc., their mutual coming together.🔽Due to the word etc., the removal of obstruction, etc. is also included.

original: yas teṣām indriyādīnāṃ parasparopasarppaṇasya anyonyaḍhaukanasya /🔽ādigrahaṇād vyavadhānāpanayanā / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: yaḥ teṣām indriya ādīnām paraspara upasarppaṇasya anyonya ḍhaukanasya  ādi grahaṇāt vyavadhāna apanayanā
translated: The mutual approach of those sense faculties, etc., their mutual coming together, the removal of obstruction, etc., the non-disappearance of the object, the presence of the object, the fitness of the mind, the non-defective sense faculty, the non-defective object - this is the collection of causes for the arising of consciousness.
