analyzed: s
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, this is a case where a monk is a maker of strife, quarrels, disputes, dissension, and issues in the Saṅgha.

original: sāmagryadhīnatvenāsaṃbhavād iti /
analyzed: sāmagrī adhīna tvena asaṃbhavāt iti
translated: because of the impossibility due to dependence on the assemblage.

original: p / / imam evaṃvidhaṃ S / / hetuphalabhāvapratiniyamaṃ niravadyamādhyātmakeṣu darśitam T / / anyatrāpy atidiśann āha anena 🔽nyāyena ityādi /
analyzed: imam evaṃvidham hetu phala bhāva pratiniyamam niravadyam ādhyātmakeṣu darśitam t anyatra api atidiśan āha anena  nyāyena ityādi
translated: This kind of restriction of cause and effect, which is faultless in the case of internal [phenomena], is shown. In order to extend this [principle] to other cases as well, he says by this method and so on.

original: yo 'yam anantaraṃ hetuphalabhāvapratiniyame nyāya uktaḥ so 'anyatrā 'pi sarvatra draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yam anantaram hetu phala bhāva pratiniyame nyāyaḥ uktaḥ saḥ anyatra pi sarvatra draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The method that was just stated regarding the restriction of cause and effect should be seen everywhere else as well.

original: sarvatreti vacanāt akṣaṇikeṣv api pratītir mmā bhūt ity āha pratikṣaṇam ityādi /
analyzed: sarvatra iti vacanāt akṣaṇikeṣu api pratītiḥ mmā bhūt iti āha pratikṣaṇam ityādi
translated: In order to prevent the understanding that [this method applies] everywhere, he says moment by moment and so on.

original: yāḥ kṣaṇe kṣaṇe 'nyāś cānyāś ca svabhāvabhedānvayinyaḥ śaktayo bhavanti tatrāyam ekārthakriyāpratiniyamaḥ sahakāriṇāṃ draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ kṣaṇe kṣaṇe nyāḥ ca anyāḥ ca svabhāva bheda anvayinyaḥ śaktayaḥ bhavanti tatra ayam eka artha kriyā pratiniyamaḥ sahakāriṇām draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The powers that are different from moment to moment, which are related to the distinctions in nature, there this restriction of the same effect for the cooperating factors should be seen.

original: na tu ye sthiraikasvabhāvā bhāvāḥ paraiḥ kalpyante teṣv api /🔽sthairyaṃ santānāśrayeṇāpi vyapadiśyetety ekagrahaṇam /
analyzed: na tu ye sthira eka svabhāvāḥ bhāvāḥ paraiḥ kalpyante teṣu api  sthairyam santāna āśrayeṇa api vyapadiśyeta iti eka grahaṇam
translated: But not in those things which are imagined by others to have a permanent, single nature.🔽The word 'single' is used because stability is also described in terms of a continuum.

original: kṣaṇe 'py ekatvam astīti sthiragrahaṇam /
analyzed: kṣaṇe pi eka tvam asti iti sthira grahaṇam
translated: Even in a moment, there is unity, so the word 'permanent' is used.

original: avyavadhīyamānā T /
analyzed: a vyavadhīyamānā t
translated: When it is not interrupted,

original: satpe T /
analyzed: sa t pe t
translated: when it exists,

original: akṣaṇike ekārthakriyākāritvasyābhāvaḥ /
translated: in the non-momentary, there is no performance of a single effect.

original: kasmāt punaḥ sthiraikasvabhāveṣu neṣyate /
analyzed: kasmāt punar sthira eka svabhāveṣu na iṣyate
translated: Why is it not accepted in things with a permanent, single nature?

original: ity āha svabhāva ityādi /
analyzed: iti āha svabhāvaḥ ityādi
translated: He says 'the nature' and so on.

original: kāmaṃ bhāvaḥ svayaṃ na bhavet /
analyzed: kāmam bhāvaḥ svayam na bhavet
translated: Let it be that an existent does not itself exist.

original: na tu svata eva svabhāvasyānyathātvaṃ sambhavati /
analyzed: na tu svatas eva svabhāvasya anyathātvam sambhavati
translated: But it is not possible for the nature to be otherwise by itself.

original: tataś ca sthiraḥ padārtho yadi kāryotpādanasamarthasvabhāvaḥ tato 'syākriyā nopapadyata iti sarvadaiva kuryāt /
analyzed: tatas ca sthiraḥ padārthaḥ yadi kārya utpādana samartha svabhāvaḥ syā kriyā na upapadyate iti sarvadā eva kuryāt
translated: And from that, if a stable thing has a nature capable of producing an effect, then its non-action is not possible, so it would always produce.

original: athāsamarthasvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: atha asamartha svabhāvaḥ
translated: But if the nature is incapable,

original: tadāpi kriyā 'nupapannā /
analyzed: tadā api kriyā nupapannā
translated: then action is not possible.

original: sarvadaiva na kuryād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sarvadā eva na kuryāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The point is that it would never produce.

original: yat tu kadācit karoti kadācin na S / / ity etan na labhyate /
analyzed: yat tu kadācid karoti kadācid na s iti etat na labhyate
translated: But when it sometimes produces and sometimes not, this is not possible.

original: tataś cākṣaṇikānāṃ tatkāryakriyāsamarthasvabhāvatve sahitāsahitāvasthayor ekarūpatvāt🔽kevalānām api tatkāryakriyāprasaṅgena kuta ekārthakriyāpratiniyamalakṣaṇaṃ T / /
analyzed: tatas ca akṣaṇikānām tad kārya kriyā samartha svabhāva tve sahita asahita avasthayoḥ eka rūpa tvāt  kevalānām api tad kārya kriyā prasaṅgena kutas eka artha kriyā pratiniyama lakṣaṇam
translated: And then, if the momentary [things] have a nature capable of producing that effect, then in the state of being associated or not associated, [they] have the same form.🔽Therefore, even the isolated [things] would produce that effect. Hence, how could there be the nature of restriction to a single effect, which is the characteristic of the cooperative [cause]?

original: sahakāritvaṃ sambhavet / /
analyzed: sahakāri tvam sambhavet
translated: How could there be the possibility of the cooperative [cause]?

original: atra para āha anyasahitaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: atra paraḥ āha anya sahitaḥ ityādi
translated: Here, the opponent says when associated with others, etc.

original: yady api kevalasyāpy akṣaṇikasya samarthaḥ svabhāvaḥ tathāpi anyasahitaḥ karoti na kevalaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api kevalasya api akṣaṇikasya samarthaḥ svabhāvaḥ tathā api anya sahitaḥ karoti na kevalaḥ
translated: Even though the nature of the isolated momentary [thing] is capable, still when associated with others it produces, not when isolated.

original: ayam api hy asya svabhāvaḥ yad anyasahitena svakāryaṃ karttavyam na samarthasvabhāvenāpi satā kevalena' iti /
analyzed: ayam api hi asya svabhāvaḥ yat anya sahitena sva kāryam karttavyam na samartha svabhāvena api satā kevalena iti
translated: This is also its nature: that its own effect should be produced when associated with others, not by the isolated one, even though it has a capable nature.

original: siddhāntavādy āha kiṃkevalasya ityādi /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha kiṃkevalasya ityādi
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says why is the isolated one, etc.

original: anyasahitenaiva svakāryaṃ karttavyaṃ na kevalena ity etat kevalasyāsamarthasvabhāvatve yujyate nānyatheti manyamānasya praśnaḥ /
analyzed: anya sahitena eva sva kāryam karttavyam na kevalena iti etat kevalasya asamartha svabhāva tve yujyate na anyathā iti manyamānasya praśnaḥ
translated: The question is for one who thinks that this, namely that the own effect should be produced only when associated with others, not when isolated, is proper when the isolated one has an incapable nature, not otherwise.

original: paras tv anavagatābhiprāya āha samartha iti /
analyzed: paraḥ tu anavagata abhiprāyaḥ āha samarthaḥ iti
translated: But the opponent, not understanding the intention, says capable, etc.

original: kevalasyāpy akṣaṇikasya samartha eva p / / svabhāvaḥ anyathā 'syākṣaṇikataiva hīyeteti /
analyzed: kevalasya api akṣaṇikasya samarthaḥ eva svabhāvaḥ anyathā syā akṣaṇika tā eva hīyeta iti
translated: For the nature of the mere momentary [entity] is only capable [of producing an effect], otherwise its momentariness would be lost.

original: siddhāntavādy āha kin na karoti iti /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha kim na karoti iti
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: Why does it not produce [the effect]?

original: na hi samarthasyākriyā /
analyzed: na hi samarthasya akriyā
translated: For the capable [entity] does not not produce [the effect].

original: sahitasyāvasthāyām iva yujyata iti sahitasyaiva kriyām icchatā kevalasyāsamarthasvabhāvataivopagantavyā /
analyzed: sahitasya avasthāyām iva yujyate iti sahitasya eva kriyām icchatā kevalasya asamartha svabhāva tā evā upagantavyā
translated: Just as it is not proper in the case of an assemblage [of causes and conditions], therefore one who desires the production of an effect only by an assemblage [of causes and conditions] must accept that the mere [entity] has an incapable nature.

original: atha matam kevalasya yadi śiraś chidyate tathāpi na karotīty ata āha akurvan ityādi /
analyzed: atha matam kevalasya yadi śiraḥ chidyate tathā api na karoti iti atas āha akurvan ityādi
translated: But if it is thought that even if the head of the mere [entity] is cut off, it still does not produce [the effect], then [the proponent of the established doctrine] says not producing and so on.

original: kāryānumeyaṃ hi sāmarthyaṃ na ca kevalasya kadācid api kāryakriyā 'stīti kathaṃ sāmarthyaṃ kalpyate / /
analyzed: kārya anumeyam hi sāmarthyam na ca kevalasya kadācid api kārya kriyā sti iti katham sāmarthyam kalpyate
translated: For capability is inferred from the effect, and the mere [entity] never produces an effect, so how can capability be imagined?

original: nāyaṃ niyamaḥ yat samarthasvabhāvenāvaśyam eva kāryaṃ karttavyam /
analyzed: na ayam niyamaḥ yat samartha svabhāvena avaśyam eva kāryam karttavyam
translated: This is not a rule: that an effect must necessarily be produced by a capable nature.

original: anyathā 'pi darśanāt iti manyamāna S / / āha paraḥ kuvindādayaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: anyathā pi darśanāt iti manyamāna s āha paraḥ kuvinda ādayaḥ ityādi
translated: Thinking that it is seen otherwise, the opponent says the weaver and so on and so on.

original: siddhāntavādyapasann āha krīḍanaśīlaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: āha krīḍana śīlaḥ ityādi
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine replies the playful one and so on.

original: devānāṃpriyaḥ ṛjuḥ mūrkho vā T / / sukhasaṃvardhitatvāt ramaṇasvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: devānāṃpriyaḥ ṛjuḥ mūrkhaḥ vā sukha saṃvardhita tvāt ramaṇa svabhāvaḥ
translated: The beloved of the gods, whether honest or foolish, is naturally playful because of being well-cared-for.

original: krīḍanaṃ bāladharmaḥ /
analyzed: krīḍanam bāla dharmaḥ
translated: Play is the dharma of children.

original: tatsādharmyeṇa prajñāvaikalyaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: tad sādharmyeṇa prajñā vaikalyam darśayati
translated: By that similarity, he shows the lack of wisdom.

original: sukhaidhitatvena śāstreṣv anabhiyogam /
analyzed: sukha edhita tvena śāstreṣu an abhiyogam
translated: By being heated by pleasure, there is no application to the scriptures.

original: yo hy anabhiyukto durvuddhiś ca sa kṛtam api vastu vismaraṇaprakṛtitvāt punaḥ punaḥ kārayatīti punaḥ pratividhāpayati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi anabhiyuktaḥ durvuddhiḥ ca sa kṛtam api vastu vismaraṇa prakṛti tvāt punar punar kārayati iti punar pratividhāpayati
translated: For one who is not applied and has bad understanding, even if the thing is done, he makes it done again and again due to the nature of forgetting, thus he makes it done again.

original: kva punar etat prativihitam /
analyzed: kva punar etat prativihitam
translated: Where is this refuted?

original: ity āha tathāhi ityādi /🔽bījādivad anekāntaḥ' ityanena prastāvena nirlloṭhitam evaitat /
analyzed: iti āha tathā hi ityādi  bīja ādi vat anekāntaḥ prastāvena nirlloṭhitam eva etat
translated: Thus he says Thus, etc.🔽This has been explained by the topic The non-existence of the effect is not established, because of the non-existence of the cause, like the non-existence of the seed, etc.

original: tad evam akṣaṇikasya samarthasvabhāvatve kāryakriyāsvabhāvatvavirodhātkevalasyākriyā'nupapanneti
analyzed: tat evam akṣaṇikasya samartha svabhāva tve sahitasya eva
translated: Thus, if the momentary has the nature of being able, because of the contradiction of having the nature of producing an effect, mere non-action is not possible.

original: pratipādyopasaṃharann āha tasmāt tatsvabhāvasya kāryakriyāsamarthasya anyathātvāsambhāmbha
analyzed: pratipādya upasaṃharan āha tasmāt tad svabhāvasya kārya kriyā samarthasya
translated: Having taught this, he concludes: Therefore, because of the impossibility of a change in the nature of that which is able to produce an effect,

original: vāt asamarthatvābhāvāttaddharmaṇaḥ kāryakriyādharmaṇaḥ tathābhāvaḥ kāryakriyā antyāvasthāvat sahitāvasthāyām iva anivāryaḥ /
analyzed: kadācid kāryakriyā dharmaṇaḥ tathābhāvaḥ kāryakriyā antya avasthāvat sahita avasthāyām iva anivāryaḥ
translated: because of the absence of inability, the existence of that which has the nature of producing an effect, the production of an effect is unavoidable, like the final state, in the state of being together.

original: p / /🔽syaivaikakārya T /
analyzed: ro-0 sya eva eka kārya
translated: The same single effect.

original: sya kriyā T /
analyzed: sya kriyā t
translated: The action of that.

original: cid apy asam T /
analyzed: cit api asam t
translated: Even if it is not capable.

original: mīmāṃsakasaṃmatasya bhāvasvabhāvarūpasāmarthyasya nirāsaḥ /
translated: The refutation of the capability in the form of the nature of an entity accepted by the Mīmāṃsakas.

original: syānmatam kevalo 'yam akṣaṇiko 'samartha eva /
analyzed: syāt matam kevalaḥ yam samarthaḥ eva
translated: It may be thought: This momentary thing, being alone, is indeed incapable.

original: tataḥ kevalo na S / / karoti /
analyzed: tatas kevalaḥ na s karoti
translated: Therefore, alone it does not produce.

original: sahitāvasthāyāṃ tv asya sāmarthyaṃ sahakāribhyo jāyate /🔽tataḥ sahita eva karotīty ata āha antyāvasthāyāṃsāmarthyotpattau kīdṛśasya prāg
analyzed: sahita avasthāyām tu asya sāmarthyam sahakāribhyaḥ jāyate  tatas sahitaḥ eva karoti iti atas āha antya avasthāyām sāmarthya utpattau kīdṛśasya prāk
translated: But its capability arises from the auxiliaries in the state of conjunction.🔽Therefore, it produces only when in conjunction. To this he says: In the arising of capability in the final state, what kind of capability arises for that which was previously

original: asamarthasya sataḥ tasya sāmarthyasya yasya tadupajāyate tatsvabhāvatvemīmāṃsakādibhir iṣyamāṇe /
analyzed: asamarthasya sataḥ tasya sāmarthyasya yasya tat upajāyate iṣyamāṇe
translated: incapable, which is produced from that? If that nature is accepted by the Mīmāṃsakas and others,

original: na hi samarthyasya sāmarthyasyaca svabhāvabhedo 'bhimataḥ /
analyzed: na hi teṣām samarthyasya svabhāva bhedaḥ bhimataḥ
translated: for they do not consider there to be a difference in nature between capability and the capable.

original: kathañcit tadbhede 'pi tatsvabhāvatayaiva pratīyamānatvād iti te manyante /
analyzed: kathañcid tad bhede pi tad svabhāva tayā eva pratīyamāna tvāt iti te manyante
translated: Even if there is some difference, they think it is perceived as having that nature.

original: apūrvotpattir eva sā T / / apūrvasyaiva vastunaḥ sā utpattir yā tatsvabhāvasya sāmarthyasya /
analyzed: apūrva utpattiḥ eva sā apūrvasya eva vastunaḥ sā utpattiḥ yā tad svabhāvasya sāmarthyasya
translated: That is the arising of the previously non-existent. That arising is of the previously non-existent entity, which has the nature of capability.

original: na hy ekasvabhāvatve sāmarthyam evāpūrvam upajātaṃ na samarthaḥ iti yuktam /
analyzed: na hi eka svabhāva tve sāmarthyam eva apūrvam upajātam na samarthaḥ iti yuktam
translated: For it is not reasonable that in having the same nature, only capability arises as the previously non-existent, not the capable.

original: tayoḥ svabhāvabhedaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: tayoḥ svabhāva bheda prasaṅgāt
translated: because it would follow that they have different natures.

original: viruddhadharmādhyāsasya bhedalakṣaṇatvāt /
analyzed: viruddha dharma adhyāsasya bheda lakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Because the superimposition of contradictory properties is the characteristic of difference.

original: nanu pratīyamāne eva sāmarthyatadvator utpattyanupattī ekasvabhāvatā ca kathaṃ nihnotuṃ śakyate / iti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu pratīyamāne eva sāmarthya tadvatoḥ utpatti anupattī eka svabhāva tā ca katham nihnotum śakyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that when they are cognized, their being produced and not being produced, and their being of one nature, how can they be denied by implication? No.

original: apramāṇena pratīteḥ /
analyzed: a pramāṇena pratīteḥ
translated: Because they are cognized by non-valid cognition.

original: anyathā pratītyanusāriṇā bhavatā dvicandrādayo 'pi na nihnotavyāḥ /
analyzed: anyathā pratīti anusāriṇā bhavatā dvi candra ādayaḥ na nihnotavyāḥ
translated: Otherwise, you, who follow what is cognized, should not deny even the two moons and so on.

original: bādhakapramāṇasambhavāt te 'pahnūyanta iti cet /
analyzed: bādhaka pramāṇa sambhavāt te pahnūyante iti ced
translated: If it is argued that they are denied because of the possibility of a contradicting valid cognition,

original: ihāpi vastuna ekasvabhāvasyotpattyanupattī parasparaviruddhe bādhike kiṃ neṣyete / /
analyzed: iha api vastunaḥ eka svabhāvasya utpatti anupattī paraspara viruddhe bādhike kim neṣyete
translated: then why are the contradicting and mutually exclusive production and non-production of the one nature of an existent not accepted here?

original: vyavasthitasyaiva vajropalāder ddharmiṇaḥ S / / tatsvabhāvaṃ sāmarthyam utpannam iti ca pūrvāparakālayor apratibhāsamānavivekaḥ kathaṃ 🔽pratīyāt / /
analyzed: vyavasthitasya eva vajropala ādeḥ tad svabhāvam sāmarthyam utpannam iti ca pūrva apara kālayoḥ apratibhāsamāna vivekaḥ katham  pratīyāt
translated: How could one cognize the existence of the capacity as the nature of a fixed thing like a diamond, which does not appear separately in the earlier and later times?

original: vijñānādikāryasyānutpattiyaugapadyodayaprasaṅgāt cakṣurādisānnidhye prāg asat tat sāmarthyam utpannaṃ kramavac ceti niścaya iti cet /
analyzed: vijñāna ādi kāryasya anutpatti yaugapadya udaya prasaṅgāt cakṣuḥ ādi sānnidhye prāk asat tat sāmarthyam utpannam kramavat ca iti niścayaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is ascertained that the capacity, which was non-existent before the presence of the eye and so on, is produced in sequence because of the non-production and simultaneous arising of the effect like consciousness and so on,

original: yady evam ekākāratayā pūrvāparakālayor adhivi
analyzed: yadi evam eka ākāra tayā pūrva apara kālayoḥ adhivi
translated: If so, then the object of cognition would be one and the same in both the earlier and later moments, and the cognition would be non-different.

original: kṛtaṃ pratyabhijñānam upajāyamānam apūrvasāmarthyapratibhāsaviviktopalādigrāhyapy anumānād arthāpattito vā bādhām anubhavan na pramāṇam
analyzed: kṛtam pratyabhijñānam upajāyamānam anumānāt arthāpattitaḥ vā bādhām anubhavan na pramāṇam
translated: If that is so, then the recognition that arises from the superimposition of the same form on the earlier and later times, even though it apprehends a rock etc. devoid of the appearance of a new capacity, would not be a valid means of knowledge, experiencing contradiction either from inference or from presumption.

original: ity upagataṃ syāt /🔽tathā / utpattyanutpattyor ekasvabhāvatāyāṃ virodhāt samarthasyaivāpūrvasyotpattiḥsadṛśāpabhāvagrahakṛtaś
analyzed: iti upagatam syāt  tathā utpatti anutpattyoḥ eka svabhāva tāyām virodhāt
translated: Thus it would be admitted.

original: cārvāgdarśanānām ekatvavibhramo lūnapunarjjāteṣv iva keśanakhādiṣv iti kiṃ neṣyate / /
analyzed: cāru āgdarśanānām eka tva vibhramaḥ lūna punar jāteṣu iva keśa nakha ādiṣu iti kim nā iṣyate
translated: Similarly, since there is a contradiction in the identity of the nature of what has arisen and what has not arisen, the arising of only a new capable [entity] is accepted. And the illusion of unity in the appearances of the beautiful is due to the apprehension of a similar non-existent [entity], like in the case of hair, nails, etc. that are cut and grow back. Why is this not accepted?

original: teṣāṃ sāmarthyasyāsāma T /
analyzed: teṣām t
translated: Because their capacity is not capable of that.

original: rahita
analyzed: rahita
translated: Devoid of that.

original: syaivānanubhūtapūrva T /
analyzed: t
translated: Of what has not been experienced before.

original: naiyāyikābhimatasya bhāvāsvabhāvarūpasāmarthyasya nirāsaḥ /🔽atha sāmarthyaṃ sahakāripratyayasānnidhyalakṣaṇam evety atatsvabhāvam iti nāpūrvotpattiprasaṅga
analyzed: atha sāmarthyam sahakāri pratyaya sānnidhya lakṣaṇam eva iti a tad svabhāvam iti na apūrva utpatti prasaṅga
translated: The refutation of the capacity that is the nature of an entity as accepted by the Naiyāyikas.🔽Now, if the Naiyāyikas and others think that capacity is merely the presence of cooperating conditions, and therefore it is not of that nature, so there is no consequence of the arising of the new [entity],

original: T / / itinaiyāyikādayo manyeran atrāha atatsvabhāvatve sāmarthyasyeṣyamāṇe
analyzed: t iti naiyāyika ādayaḥ manyeran atra āha atatsvabhāva tve sāmarthyasya iṣyamāṇe
translated: [the author] says this: When capacity is accepted as not being of that nature,

original: sa padārthaḥprāg iva tadrūpāparityāgāt paścād apy akāraka eva /
analyzed: sa bīja ādiḥ iva tad rūpa aparityāgāt paścāt api akārakaḥ eva
translated: That entity, like before, due to not abandoning that form, is not a cause later on either.

original: p / / kutaḥ / /
analyzed: p kutas
translated: Why?

original: sāmarthyam ity ākhyā yasya padārthāntarasya sahakāripratyayasānnidhyalakṣaṇasya sa evātiśayaśabdavācya itinaiyāyikair abhyupagamāt /
analyzed: sāmarthyam iti ākhyā yasya padārtha antarasya sahakāri pratyaya sānnidhya lakṣaṇasya saḥ eva atiśaya śabda vācyaḥ iti naiyāyikaiḥ abhyupagamāt
translated: Because Naiyāyikas accept that the designation capability refers to that other entity characterized by the presence of cooperating conditions, which is what is denoted by the word excess.

original: tata eva tadbhāvabhāvitvena kāryotpatteḥ /🔽te 'pi sahakāriṇaḥ pratyayāḥ yady akṣaṇikāḥ teṣv apy evaṃ S / / prasaṅgo 'nivārita eveti kṣaṇikataivaikārthakriyāpratiniyamalakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: tatas eva tad bhāva bhāvi tvena kārya utpatteḥ  te sahakāriṇaḥ pratyayāḥ yadi akṣaṇikāḥ teṣu api evam prasaṅgaḥ nivāritaḥ eva iti kṣaṇika tā eva eka artha kriyā pratiniyama lakṣaṇam
translated: Because the arising of the effect is due to that very thing.

original: sahakāritvam icchato 'bhyupeyā /
analyzed: sahakāri tvam icchataḥ bhyupeyā
translated: And if those cooperating conditions are not momentary, then the same unwanted consequence applies to them as well, and cannot be avoided. Therefore, those who desire the characteristic of being restricted to performing a single purpose must accept momentariness.

original: punar apy akṣaṇikānām ekārthakriyāpratiniyamaṃ nirākartum upacayahetum āha api ca ityādi /
analyzed: punar api akṣaṇikānām eka artha kriyā pratiniyamam nirākartum upacaya hetum āha api ca ityādi
translated: Again, in order to refute the restriction of non-momentary things to performing a single purpose, he states the reason for accumulation, beginning with Moreover.

original: yo 'sāv akṣaṇiko bhāvaḥ sakaleṣu sahakāriṣu svakāryaṃ karotītīṣyate /
analyzed: yaḥ sau akṣaṇikaḥ bhāvaḥ sakaleṣu sahakāriṣu sva kāryam karoti iti iṣyate
translated: That non-momentary entity is accepted as performing its own effect when all the cooperating conditions are complete.

original: sa tadaiva tāvat kasmāt karoti / /
analyzed: sa tadā eva tāvat kasmāt karoti
translated: Why does it perform [its effect] at that very time?

original: yena hi kāraṇena tatkāryakriyāsvabhāvatvena tadā karoti tenenai
analyzed: yena hi kāraṇena tad kārya kriyā svabhāva tvena tadā karoti
translated: Because of the reason by which it performs at that time due to having the nature of performing its effect, by that very reason

original: va sthirasvabhāvatvāt prāg api kuryāt /
analyzed: sthira svabhāva tvāt prāk api kuryāt
translated: because of its stable nature, it would produce even before.

original: tataḥ kuto 'syaikārthakriyāpratiniyamaḥ / iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sya eka artha kriyā pratiniyamaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Then how can there be restriction of its activity to a single object? This is the idea.

original: kācānyāmṛgyate yuktiḥyathātad dṛśyate tathā iti sarvatreyam apratihatā yuktir iti manyamānaḥkumārilaḥprāha kurvan dṛṣṭaḥ ityādi /🔽yatas kāryaṃ kurvamn
analyzed: kā ca anyā mṛgyate yuktiḥ yathā tat dṛśyate tathā iti sarvatra iyam apratihatā yuktiḥ iti manyamānaḥ kumārilaḥ prāha kurvan dṛṣṭaḥ ityādi  yatas tadā eva kāryam
translated: Another reason is sought. The reasoning that it acts as it is seen is unobstructed everywhere. Thinking this, Kumārila says It is seen acting... and so on.🔽Because it is seen by me acting on an effect,

original: dṛṣṭo mayā tena darśanabalena karotīti brūmaḥ /
analyzed: mayā tena darśana balena karoti iti brūmaḥ
translated: by the power of that seeing, we say it acts.

original: atrānyayopapattyā T / / 'bhihitayā /
analyzed: kim atra anyayā upapattyā
translated: Here, the other party's position is stated.

original: prāk tat kurvan na dṛṣṭaḥ tena na karotīty ekārthakriyāpratiniyamaḥ sidhyati akṣaṇikānām apīti /
analyzed: prāk tat kurvan na dṛṣṭaḥ tena na karoti iti eka artha kriyā pratiniyamaḥ sidhyati akṣaṇikānām api iti
translated: It is not seen acting before, therefore it does not act. Thus the restriction of activity to a single object is established even for non-momentary things.

original: bhāvo hi kāryaṃ karoti tajjananasvabhāvatayā na darśanabalenādṛṣṭasyāpi svakāryakaraṇāt ato nedam uttaraṃ sambadhyata ity upahasann āha
analyzed: bhāvaḥ hi kāryam karoti tad janana svabhāva tayā na darśana balena adṛṣṭasya api sva kārya karaṇāt atas na idam uttaram sambadhyate iti upahasan āha  /
translated: For an existent produces an effect by its nature of producing it, not by the power of being seen, because even what is not seen produces its own effect. Therefore this answer is not relevant. Mocking this, he says

original: aho mahāsāmarthyam ityādi /
analyzed: aho mahā sāmarthyam ityādi
translated: Oh, what great power! and so on.

original: mahāprabhāvasya bhavato mahāsāmarthyaṃ darśanam /
analyzed: mahā prabhāvasya bhavataḥ mahā sāmarthyam darśanam
translated: Your great power is the seeing of one of great influence.

original: yasmād etad bhāvān kāryakaraṇasvabhāvavikalān api yadi kāryakaraṇasvabhāvatvād bhāvāḥ kāryaṃ kuryuḥ tadaitad evottaraṃ kiṃ noktam /
analyzed: yasmāt etat bhāvān kārya karaṇa svabhāva vikalān api yadi kārya karaṇa svabhāva tvāt bhāvāḥ kāryam kuryuḥ tadā etat eva uttaram kim na uktam
translated: Because if these things, even though devoid of the nature of effects and instruments, were to produce effects by virtue of having the nature of effects and instruments, then why was this very reply not given?

original: yataḥ S / / kāryakaraṇe darśanam uttarīkṛtam iti kṛtvā svabhāvamātreṇa ātmasattāmātreṇa
analyzed: yatas s kārya karaṇe darśanam uttarīkṛtam iti kṛtvā svabhāva mātreṇa ātma sattā mātreṇa
translated: Since the perception of effects and instruments was made the reply, by mere nature, by mere existence of the self,

original: nānāprākāreṣu vyāpāreṣu niyuṅkte tat kathaṃ mahāsāmarthyaṃ na syāt / /
analyzed: nānā prākāreṣu vyāpāreṣu niyuṅkte tat katham mahā sāmarthyam na syāt
translated: it engages in various kinds of activities. How could it not have great power?

original: na cātra me kācid akṣamākintu yadi nāma kiñcit kāranaṃ kathañcid anādṛtasya🔽vā vyākṣiptasya vā atrabhavata iti pūjāvacanam p / / darśanasya viṣayatām atikrāmet
analyzed: na ca atra me kācid yadi nāma kiñcid kāranam kathañcid an ādṛtasya  vā vyākṣiptasya vai atrabhavataḥ iti pūjā vacanam p darśanasya viṣaya tām atikrāmet
translated: And I have no disagreement here. But if for some reason, if something were to transcend the state of being an object of your perception,

original: tadā hanta iti dainyodbhāvanam etat /
analyzed: tadā hanta iti dainya udbhāvanam etat
translated: then this is an expression of distress.

original: aprasavo dharmo 'sya tad idam aprasavadharmakaṃ tato 'petasantānaṃ syād iti iyam asmākaṃ cintā cittaṃ dunoti /
analyzed: a prasavaḥ tat idam a prasava dharmakam syāt iti iyam asmākam cintā cittam dunoti
translated: This has the property of non-production. Therefore, this has the property of non-production. It would be devoid of continuity. This is our thought. It pains our mind.

original: para āha na vai vayam ityādi /
analyzed: paraḥ āha na vai vayam ityādi
translated: The opponent says We do not accept and so on.

original: naiva vayaṃ kāryakaraṇasvabhāvarahitānāṃ bhāvānām asmad darśanavaśāt kāṛyakriyāṃbrūmaḥ /
analyzed: na eva vayam kārya karaṇa svabhāva rahitānām bhāvānām asmat darśana vaśāt kāṛya kriyām brūmaḥ
translated: We do not say that things devoid of the nature of cause and effect perform their function due to our view.

original: kintu svabhāvenaiva te bhāvāḥ tatkāryakaraṇasvabhāvāḥ /
analyzed: kintu svabhāvena eva te bhāvāḥ tad kārya karaṇa svabhāvāḥ
translated: But those things themselves have the nature of performing that function.

original: tataḥ svakāryaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: tatas sva kāryam kurvanti
translated: Therefore, they perform their own function.

original: tān taete kārakasvabhāvā iti /
analyzed: tān kāraka svabhāvāḥ iti
translated: Those are of the nature of performing that function.

original: darśanasya hi yathāvasthitavastuvijñāne vyāpāraḥ /🔽nāvidyādya
analyzed: darśanasya hi yathā avasthita vastu vijñāne vyāpāraḥ  na avidyā adya
translated: For perception has the function of cognizing things as they are.

original: mānasvabhāvakriyāyām iti/
analyzed: māna svabhāva kriyāyām iti
translated: Not in the function of the nature of ignorance, etc.

original: siddhāntavādy āha satyam /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha satyam
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: True,

original: idam apy asti /
analyzed: idam api asti
translated: this also exists.

original: kiṃ vayaṃ nyāyānurāgitayā nyāyyaṃ T / / vacanam upalakṣayāmaḥ /
analyzed: kim vayam nyāya anurāgi tayā nyāyyam t vacanam upalakṣayāmaḥ
translated: Do we, out of love for logic, notice logical statements?

original: uta bhavān eva sarvadā nyāyyavacanarahito 'pi kathañcin nyāyyam uktavān iti sañjātaparitoṣaḥ pṛcchati kiṃ tad /
analyzed: uta bhavān eva sarvadā nyāyya vacana rahitaḥ api kathañcid nyāyyam uktavān iti sañjāta paritoṣaḥ pṛcchati kim tat
translated: Or has the revered one, even though always devoid of logical statements, somehow spoken logically? Having become satisfied, he asks: What is that?

original: ity āha svabhāvas teṣāṃ bhāvānāṃ kāryakriyādharmā kāryakaraṇadharmā tena kāraṇena
analyzed: iti āha svabhāvaḥ teṣām bhāvānām kārya kriyā dharmā kārya karaṇa dharmā tena kāraṇena
translated: He says: The nature of those things is the property of performing their function, the property of producing their effect. For that reason,

original: samastāh samagrāḥ pratyayāḥ sahakāriṇo yeṣāṃ teṣām akṛtvā kāryaṃ nopekṣāpattiḥ naudāsīny
analyzed: samastāḥ samagrāḥ pratyayāḥ sahakāriṇaḥ yeṣām teṣām a kṛtvā kāryam na upekṣā āpattiḥ na audāsīnī
translated: those whose conditions, i.e., cooperative causes, are complete, i.e., assembled, do not attain indifference, i.e., neutrality, without performing their function.

original: apratipattiḥ iti satyam idam apy asti bhavato nyāyyaṃ vacanam iti /
analyzed: apratipattiḥ iti satyam idam api asti bhavataḥ nyāyyam vacanam iti
translated: The reply is: There is no production. This statement of yours is also true and reasonable.

original: kintu idam asi praṣṭavyaḥ S / / so 'kṣepakriyādharmāsvabhāvaḥkiṃteṣāṃtadaivāntyāvasathāyāṃ samagrāvasthāyāṃ yadanantaraṃ kāryam utpadyate
analyzed: kintu idam asi praṣṭavyaḥ  s saḥ kṣepa kriyā dharma asvabhāvaḥ kim teṣām tadā eva antya āvasathāyām samagra avasthāyām yat anantaram kāryam utpadyate  /
translated: But this should be asked: Is that which has the nature of producing an effect, when it is in the final stage of completeness, at that very moment when the effect arises after it,

original: tadaiva utpannaḥ /
analyzed: tadā eva utpannaḥ
translated: is it produced then?

original: āhosvit prāg api parasparavirahāvasthāyām api āsīt / /
analyzed: āhosvit prāk api paraspara viraha avasthāyām api āsīt
translated: Or was it even before, in the state of mutual absence?

original: tatra tadaivotpanne tatsvabhāvatve 'pūrvotpattir eva /
analyzed: tatra tadā eva utpanne tad svabhāva tve pūrva utpattiḥ eva
translated: If it is produced then, and has that nature, then it is the production of something that did not exist before.

original: atatsvabhāvatve so 'kāraka eveti prāguktadoṣabhayāt para āha āsīt /
analyzed: atatsvabhāva tve saḥ kārakaḥ eva iti prāk ukta doṣa bhayāt paraḥ āha āsīt
translated: If it does not have that nature, then it is indeed inactive. Fearing the previously stated fault, the opponent says it existed.

original: kutaḥ / pracyutaś ca utpannaś ca pracyutotpannaḥ /🔽tasya pratiṣedhaḥ apracyuto 'nutpannaḥ sthira ekaḥ svabhāvo yeṣāṃ bhāvānāṃ teṣāṃ kasmiṃścit kāle kasyacit svabhāvasya tatropalabdhasya abhāvavirodhāt
analyzed: kutas pracyutaḥ ca utpannaḥ ca  tasya pratiṣedhaḥ a pracyutaḥ n utpannaḥ sthiraḥ ekaḥ svabhāvaḥ yeṣām bhāvānām teṣām kasmiṃścid kāle kasyacid svabhāvasya tatra upalabdhasya abhāva virodhāt
translated: From what? The one who has fallen away and arisen is the fallen and arisen.🔽The negation of that is the non-fallen, non-arisen, stable, single nature of those entities. Because the non-existence of any one of those natures that are perceived at any time is contradictory.

original: kṣaṇikeṣv eva hy ekadā dṛṣṭaḥ svabhāvo 'nyadā na bhavet tadā tasyānyatvāt /
analyzed: kṣaṇikeṣu eva hi ekadā dṛṣṭaḥ svabhāvaḥ nyadā na bhavet tadā tasya anya tvāt
translated: For in momentary things alone, a nature seen at one time would not exist at another time, because at that time it would be different from that.

original: nāpracyutānutpannapūrvāpararūpeṣu sthireṣu bhāveṣv iti /
analyzed: na apracyuta anutpanna pūrva apara rūpeṣu sthireṣu bhāveṣu iti
translated: Not in things that are not fallen away, not arisen, not having a previous or subsequent form, and are stable.

original: p / / atrāha tat kim idānīm ityādi /
analyzed: atra āha tat kim idānīm ityādi
translated: Here it is said: What then is this? and so on.

original: syānmatam naivedam anena vākyena sadṛśam asmad vākyam ity āha ko vā'sya ityādi /
analyzed: syāt matam na eva idam anena vākyena sadṛśam asmat vākyam iti āha kaḥ vā asya ityādi
translated: The view may be that this statement is not similar to our statement. It is said: Or what is the meaning of this? and so on.

original: yady etad anena tulyaṃ T / / na bhavati tadā sakalasahakāryavasthāyāḥprāg
analyzed: yadi etat anena tulyam t na bhavati tadā
translated: If this is not the same as that, then even before the state of all the cooperating factors,

original: api ayam akṣepakriyāsvabhāvaḥ avilamvitakāryakaraṇasvabhāvaḥ kāryaṃca na karotīty
analyzed: api ayam akṣepa kriyā svabhāvaḥ avilambita kārya karaṇa svabhāvaḥ kāryam ca na karoti iti
translated: this has the nature of non-delayed action, the nature of producing the effect without delay, and it does not produce the effect.

original: asya bhāṣitasyārtho vaktavya iti /
analyzed: asya bhāṣitasya arthaḥ vaktavyaḥ iti
translated: The meaning of this statement must be stated.

original: naiyāyikās tu manyante bhāvānāṃ sahakārisannidhānāsannidhānāpekṣayā kārakākārakasvabhāvavyavasthā /
analyzed: naiyāyikāḥ tu manyante bhāvānām sahakāri sannidhāna asannidhāna apekṣayā kāraka akāraka svabhāva vyavasthā
translated: But the Naiyāyikas think that the determination of the nature of an agent and non-agent of things depends on the presence or absence of cooperating factors,

original: na svabhāvataḥ /
analyzed: na svabhāvataḥ
translated: not by their own nature.

original: tenāyam apracyutotpannasthiraikasvabhāvatve 'pi S / / na prāg api svakāryajananasvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tena ayam apracyuta utpanna sthira eka svabhāva tve pi s na prāk api sva kārya janana svabhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, even though this [action] has a single nature that is not fallen away, not arisen, and is stable, it does not have the nature of producing its own effect before [the presence of cooperating factors].

original: kintu sannihitasakalasahakāripratyaya eveti /
analyzed: kintu sannihita sakala sahakāri pratyayaḥ eva iti
translated: But it has the nature of producing its own effect only when the cooperating conditions are present.

original: tanmatam āśaṅkamāna āha sahitaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: tad matam āśaṅkamānaḥ āha sahitaḥ ityādi
translated: Suspecting that view, it is said: When accompanied and so on.

original: etan nirasyati anyas tarhi ityādi /
analyzed: etat nirasyati anyaḥ tarhi ityādi
translated: This is refuted by Then it is something else and so on.

original: yadi nāma sahitasya svakāryajananasvabhāvatā /
analyzed: yadi nāma sahitasya sva kārya janana svabhāva tā
translated: If the nature of producing its own effect belongs to the combined [factors],

original: kevalasya ca tadviparītarūpatā /
analyzed: kevalasya ca tad viparīta rūpa tā
translated: and the nature of being the opposite of that belongs to the individual [factors],

original: anyatvaṃ tu kasmād bhavati /
analyzed: anya tvam tu kasmāt bhavati
translated: why does [the effect] become different [from the combined factors]?

original: ity ata āha svabhāvabheda ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha svabhāva bhedaḥ ityādi
translated: To explain this, he says the difference in nature and so on.

original: svabhāvabheda eva hi bhāvabhedasya lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: svabhāva bhedaḥ eva hi bhāva bhedasya lakṣaṇam
translated: For the difference in existence is characterized precisely by the difference in nature.

original: sa cet tatkāryajanakājanakarūpatayā bhidyate /
analyzed: sa ced tad kārya janaka ajanaka rūpa tayā bhidyate
translated: If that [difference in nature] is divided into the form of producing or not producing that effect,

original: śāliyavabījādīnām iva kathaṃ iva bhāvabhedo na syāt / /
analyzed: śāli yava bīja ādīnām iva katham iva bhāva bhedaḥ na syāt
translated: how can there not be a difference in existence, like in the case of rice, barley, seeds, and so on?

original: na hi svabhāvād anyo bhāvaḥ yatas tadbhede 'pi na bhidyeta /
analyzed: na hi svabhāvāt anyaḥ bhāvaḥ yatas tad bhede na bhidyeta
translated: For existence is not different from nature, from which it would not be different even when that [nature] is different.

original: niḥsvabhāvatāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: niḥsvabhāva tā prasaṅgāt
translated: Because [existence] would follow as being without nature.

original: nanu coktaṃ svato janakājanakasvabhāvatāvirahāt pratyayāntarabhāvādyapekṣatvāt janakājanakarūpatāyās tadbhede 'pi kuto bhāvabhedaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca uktam svatas janaka ajanaka svabhāva tā virahāt pratyaya antara bhāva ādi apekṣa tvāt janaka ajanaka rūpa tāyāḥ tad bhede pi kutas bhāva bheda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: But wasn't it said that because of the absence of a nature that produces or does not produce from itself, and because of depending on other conditions, the form of producing or not producing depends on that [nature], so how can there be the consequence of a difference in existence even when that [nature] is different?

original: tasyāparāpekṣasvabhāvabhedalakṣaṇatvātity ata āha na hi sa sāhitye 'pi ityādi /
analyzed: atas āha na hi sa sāhitye pi ityādi
translated: Because that [nature] is characterized by the difference in nature that depends on another. To explain this, he says For that [nature] does not depend on the combination and so on.

original: tadaitad uttaraṃ bhāvatkaṃ sambadhyetayadi bhāvo yo 'sau paraḥ sahakāritvābhimataḥ T / / sannidhīyate tadrūpeṇa karttā syāt na svarūpeṇa
analyzed: tadā etat uttaram bhāvatkam bhāvaḥ sau paraḥ sahakāri tva abhimataḥ sannidhīyate tad rūpeṇa karttā syāt na sva rūpeṇa
translated: Then this answer would be connected with your [view]: if that entity which is considered to be the supreme cooperating [cause] is present, it would be the agent in that form, not in its own form.

original: na caitad asti /
analyzed: na ca etat asti
translated: And this is not so.

original: tathābhāve hi paramārthataḥ sa eva paraḥkarttā syāt /🔽tatra tu kartṛtvavyapadeśaḥ S / / kalpanānirmita eva bhavet /
analyzed: tathā abhāve hi paramārthataḥ saḥ eva syāt  tatra tu kartṛ tva vyapadeśaḥ kalpanā nirmitaḥ eva bhavet
translated: For if it were so, then in reality that very supreme [cause] would be the agent.🔽But there the designation of agency would be merely created by imagination.

original: na ca kalpanānuvidhāyin yo 'rthakriyāḥ /
analyzed: na ca kalpanā anuvidhāyin yaḥ ṛthakriyāḥ
translated: And the effect does not conform to imagination.

original: na hi māṇavako dahanopacārād ādhīyate pāke /
analyzed: na hi māṇavakaḥ dahana upacārāt ādhīyate pāke
translated: For a boy is not taught cooking by the figurative use of the word 'fire'.

original: tataś ca nāsyānupakāriṇo bhāvam apekṣeta kāryam iti tadrahitebhya eva p / / sahakāribhyo bhavet /
analyzed: tatas ca na asya anupakāriṇaḥ bhāvam apekṣeta kāryam iti tad rahitebhyaḥ eva sahakāribhyaḥ bhavet
translated: And therefore the effect would not depend on the existence of that [boy] who is not a helper. It would arise only from the cooperating [causes] devoid of that [boy].

original: yad vā tebhyo 'pi na bhavet /
analyzed: yat vā tebhyaḥ pi na bhavet
translated: Or it would not arise even from them.

original: teṣām api pararūpeṇa kartṛtve svayam akārakatvāt /
analyzed: teṣām api para rūpeṇa kartṛ tve svayam akāraka tvāt
translated: Because even they, if they are agents in the form of the other [cause], are themselves non-agents.

original: tataḥ sarveṣām evaṃ svayam akārakatve pararūpeṇāpy akārakatvāt sarvathā kārakocheda eveti na kiñcit
analyzed: tatas sarveṣām evam svayam akāraka tve para rūpeṇa api akāraka tvāt sarvathā kāraka ucchedaḥ eva iti na kiñcid
translated: Therefore, if all of them are themselves non-agents in this way, then because they are non-agents in the form of the other [cause] as well, there is complete cessation of agency. Thus nothing

original: kutaścit jāyeta /
analyzed: kutaścid jāyeta
translated: would arise from anything.

original: tasmāt svarūpeṇaiva bhāvaḥ svakāryasya karttā na pararūpeṇeti nāsyottarasyāvakāśaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sva rūpeṇa eva bhāvaḥ sva kāryasya karttā na para rūpeṇa iti na asya uttarasya avakāśaḥ
translated: Therefore, an existent is the producer of its effect by its own nature, not by another nature. Thus, there is no scope for this reply.

original: tato 'nyaḥ sahito 'nyaś ca kevalaḥ ity etad avicalam eveti /🔽atha yena svarūpeṇāyaṃ janakas tad asya sahitāsahitāvasthayoḥ sarvadā 'sti tadā svarūpaṃ
analyzed: tatas nyaḥ sahitaḥ nyaḥ ca kevalaḥ iti etat avicalam eva iti  atha yena sva rūpeṇa ayam janakaḥ tat asya sahita asahita avasthayoḥ sarvadā sti tadā sva rūpam
translated: Therefore, it is unshakable that it is different when associated and different when not associated.🔽Now, if the nature by which this [existent] is a producer exists for it in both the associated and unassociated states at all times, then that nature

original: ca svakāryajanakam asya sthirasvabhāvasya prāg api sahitāvasthāyās tad eva yatsahitāvasthāyām
analyzed: ca sva kārya janakam asya sthira svabhāvasya prāk api sahita avasthāyāḥ tat eva yat sahita avasthāyām
translated: and the nature of producing its effect of this stable existent is the same before as in the associated state.

original: akṣepakriyāsvabhāvam iti tasmāt na kathaṃcit kāryakriyāvirāmaḥ /
analyzed: akṣepa kriyā svabhāvam iti tasmāt na kathaṃcid kārya kriyā virāmaḥ
translated: It has the nature of non-deferring action in the associated state. Therefore, there is no cessation of the production of an effect in any way.

original: athavā kadācit paro brūyāt svahetubhir evāyaṃ pratyayāntarāpekṣaḥ T / / svakāryajananasvabhāvo janita iti kevalo na karoti /
analyzed: athavā kadācid paraḥ brūyāt sva hetubhiḥ eva ayam pratyaya antara apekṣaḥ sva kārya janana svabhāvaḥ janitaḥ iti kevalaḥ na karoti
translated: Or, someone might say at some point that this [existent] is produced by its own causes as dependent on other conditions with the nature of producing its own effect, so it does not produce when alone.

original: na cāsya sahitāsahitāvasthayoḥ svabhāvabhedaḥ /
analyzed: na ca asya sahita asahita avasthayoḥ svabhāva bhedaḥ
translated: And there is no difference in the nature of this [existent] in the associated and unassociated states.

original: pratyayāntarāpekṣasvakāryajananasvabhāvatāyāḥ S / / sarvadā bhāvāt ity ata āha na hi sa sāhitye 'pi ityādi /
analyzed: pratyaya antara apekṣa sva kārya janana svabhāva tāyāḥ sarvadā bhāvāt iti atas āha na hi sa sāhitye pi ityādi
translated: Because the nature of producing its own effect dependent on other conditions always exists for it. Therefore, he says Even when associated, it is not a producer. etc.

original: svarūpeṇaivāsya kartṛtvāt tasya ca prāg api bhāvāt pratyayāntarāpekṣāyāś ca tato labhyasyātmātiśayasyābhāvenāyogāt upakāralakṣaṇatvād asya /
analyzed: sva rūpeṇa evā asya kartṛ tvāt tasya ca prāk api bhāvāt pratyaya antara apekṣāyāḥ ca tatas labhyasya ātma atiśayasya abhāvena ayogāt upakāra lakṣaṇa tvāt asya
translated: Because it is the agent by its own nature, and because it exists even before that, and because the dependence on other conditions is not proper, since the excess of self, which is obtained from that, does not exist, because this [dependence] is characterized by benefit.

original: anyathā 'tiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyathā tiprasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be an overextension [of the definition].

original: kevalasya kāryakaraṇam anivāryam iti akurvataḥ kathaṃ sahitāvasthāyā na bhedaḥ syāt / iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: kevalasya kārya karaṇam anivāryam iti akurvataḥ katham sahita avasthāyāḥ na bhedaḥ syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The mere [agent] is not excluded from producing the effect and the instrument. If it does not produce [the effect and instrument], how can there be no difference between the state of being combined and the state of not being combined? This is the idea.

original: pratyayāntarāpekṣasvakāryakaraṇasvabhāva ity api pararūpeṇākārasya
analyzed: pratyaya antara apekṣa sva kārya karaṇa svabhāvaḥ iti api para rūpeṇa ākārasya
translated: Even if it is said that the nature of the agent is dependent on other conditions and produces its own effect, the meaning is that

original: pratyayāntarasannidhānopalakṣitakāle kārakatvaṃ na prāg ity ayam arthaḥ /
analyzed: pratyaya antara sannidhāna upalakṣita kāle kāraka tvam na prāk iti ayam arthaḥ
translated: the action of producing [the effect] is at a time characterized by the presence of other conditions, not before that.

original: tataś ca kadācit kāryakriyāsvabhāvo na sarvadā iti bruvatā kathaṃ sarvadā kāryajananasvabhāvatā 'syoktā bhavati / /
analyzed: tatas ca kadācid kārya kriyā svabhāvaḥ na sarvadā iti bruvatā katham sarvadā kārya janana svabhāva tā syā uktā bhavati
translated: And therefore, by saying that the nature of producing the effect is sometimes [present] and not always, how can it be said that it always has the nature of producing the effect?

original: nanv evaṃ svabhāvabheda evāsya tadatatkālayoḥ samarthitaḥ syāt /
analyzed: nanu evam svabhāva bhedaḥ eva asya tad a tad kālayoḥ samarthitaḥ syāt
translated: But if it is so, then the difference in its nature at that time and at another time would be established.

original: tasmān nākṣaṇikānām ekārthakriyāpratiniyamalakṣaṇaṃ sahakāritvam iti sthitam /
analyzed: tasmāt na ākṣaṇikānām eka artha kriyā pratiniyama lakṣaṇam sahakāri tvam iti sthitam
translated: Therefore, it is established that for non-momentary [things], the quality of being a cooperating cause, which is characterized by being restricted to producing one effect, does not exist.

original: paraḥ āpādayann āha yasyāpi ityādi subodham /
analyzed: paraḥ samāna doṣatām āpādayan yasya api ityādi su bodham
translated: The opponent says something else, which is easily understood.

original: yadi nāma kṣaṇikas tathāpi kinna bhavati /
analyzed: yadi nāma kṣaṇikaḥ tathā api kin na bhavati
translated: Even if it is momentary, what does not happen?

original: ity āha uktaṃyādṛśasya sahakāribhir apṛthagbhāvinaḥ kriyā /
analyzed: iti āha uktam yādṛśasya sahakāribhiḥ apṛthak bhāvinaḥ kriyā
translated: It is said: The kind of thing that does not exist separately from its auxiliaries, whose action is said to be the production of an effect,

original: tep / / samarthā S / / eva svabhāvato 'ntyāḥ pratyayāḥ saha jāyante kṣaṇikā yeṣāṃ T / / prākpaścātpṛthagbhāvo nāsti' ity
analyzed: samarthā eva svabhāvataḥ ntyāḥ pratyayāḥ saha jāyante kṣaṇikāḥ yeṣām t prāk paścāt pṛthagbhāvaḥ na asti iti
translated: those final conditions that are capable of producing it are born together with it, which are momentary, for whom there is no existence before, after, or separately.

original: atra /
analyzed: atra
translated: This is said.

original: sa katham ekakṣaṇabhāvī ekasminn evāntye kṣaṇe bhavanaśilaḥ anyathābhavet antyakṣaṇāt prāk paścāt pṛthag vā bhavet /
analyzed: sa katham eka kṣaṇa bhāvī ekasmin eva antye kṣaṇe bhavana śilaḥ anyathā bhavet antya kṣaṇāt prāk paścāt pṛthak vā bhavet
translated: How can it, existing in one moment, having the nature of existing only in the final moment, be otherwise? It would exist before, after, or separately from the final moment.🔽And that which exists otherwise, that very thing existing in the final moment, does not have the nature of projecting action. This consequence stated in the non-momentary position

original: yaścā anyathā bhavati sa evāntyakṣaṇabhāvī 'kṣepakriyādharmāna bhavatīti nāyam akṣaṇikapakṣoditaḥ prasaṅgaḥkṣaṇikapakṣe
analyzed: anyathā bhavati saḥ eva antya kṣaṇa bhāvī sahakāri santāna upakṛta svabhāvaḥ bhavati iti na ayam akṣaṇika pakṣa uditaḥ
translated: is not in the momentary position.

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: How could it be?

original: kārakākārakayoḥ ityādi /
analyzed: kāraka akārakayoḥ ityādi
translated: Of the active and inactive... etc.

original: kārako 'ntyaḥ akārakas tadanyaḥ tayor yaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa bhinno 'pi bhedāvivakṣayaikatvenoktaḥ /
analyzed: kārakaḥ ntyaḥ akārakaḥ tad anyaḥ tayoḥ yaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa bhinnaḥ api bheda avivakṣayā ekatvena uktaḥ
translated: The active is the final, the inactive is the other, their nature, though different, is said to be the same without intending a difference.

original: tathā kārakasya
analyzed: tathā kārakasya
translated: Similarly, the cause🔽of the active

original: yo hetur upāntyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hetuḥ upāntyaḥ
translated: is the penultimate.

original: akārakasyāpi yo hetus tadanyaḥ sa bhinno 'py abhedavivakṣayaivaikatvenoktaḥ /🔽tena kārakākārakayor yau svabhāvau tayor ekatra dharmiṇi virodhāt /
analyzed: akārakasya api yaḥ hetuḥ tad anyaḥ sa bhinnaḥ pi abheda vivakṣayā evā ekatvena uktaḥ  tena kāraka akārakayoḥ yau svabhāvau tayoḥ ekatra dharmiṇi virodhāt
translated: Even for one who is not an agent, the cause that is different from that is said to be one by the mere intention to express non-difference, although it is different.🔽Therefore, since the two natures of the agent and the non-agent are contradictory in one substratum,

original: tathā tayoḥ svabhāvayor janakau yau hetū ekaḥ kārakasvabhāvajanako 'nyaś cākārakasvabhāvajanakaḥ tayor apy ekatra dharmiṇi virodhāt /
analyzed: tathā tayoḥ svabhāvayoḥ janakau yau hetū ekaḥ kāraka svabhāva janakaḥ ca a kāraka svabhāva janakaḥ tayoḥ api ekatra dharmiṇi virodhāt
translated: and likewise, since the two causes that produce those two natures - one that produces the nature of the agent and the other that produces the nature of the non-agent - are also contradictory in one substratum,

original: anyatve sati /
analyzed: anya tve sati
translated: if they were different,

original: akārakasvabhāvajanakahetor utpannasyākārakasya svabhāvasyānyatvāt yaśca bhavati sa eva na bhavatīti nāyaṃprasaṅga iti /

translated: The cooperating cause, which is characterized by the performance of the same effect, is everywhere, and nowhere is the production of an excess possible.

original: yatra tu santānopakāreṇa pūrvapūrvapratyayebhyo viśiṣṭaviśiṣṭatarottarottarakṣaṇajananena
analyzed: yatra tu santāna upakāreṇa pūrva pūrva pratyayebhyaḥ viśiṣṭa viśiṣṭatara uttara uttara kṣaṇa jananena
translated: But where the entities become co-operators in the production of the intended effect by assisting the continuum, by generating more and more distinguished moments from the previous conditions,

original: bhāvāḥ sahakāriṇo vivakṣitakāryasya hetutāṃ pratipadyante yathā taṇḍulādibhya odanādijanmani dahanodakādayaḥ /
analyzed: bhāvāḥ sahakāriṇaḥ vivakṣita kāryasya hetutām pratipadyante yathā taṇḍula ādibhyaḥ odana ādi janmani dahana udaka ādayaḥ
translated: like fire, water, etc. in the production of rice, etc. from rice grains,

original: bījādibhyaś cāṅkurādijanmani pṛthivyādayaḥ tatra viśeṣotpādane pratyayānāṃ sahakriyocyate loke /🔽santānāśrayeṇa pūrvakṣaṇebhyodvitīyādiviśiṣṭakṣaṇalakṣaṇaṃ santānākhyaṃ kāryam āśṛśri
analyzed: bīja ādibhyaḥ ca aṅkura ādi janmani pṛthivī ādayaḥ tatra viśeṣa utpādane pratyayānām sahakriyā ucyate loke  santāna āśrayeṇa santāna ākhyam kāryam āśṛśri
translated: and earth, etc. in the production of sprouts, etc. from seeds, there the co-operation of the conditions in the production of the distinguished [effect] is spoken of in the world.🔽Relying on the continuum, the effect called continuum, characterized by the distinguished moments beginning with the second, is produced from the previous moments.

original: tya T / / pūrvottarakṣaṇayor ekatvādhyavasāyena tasyaivāyam atiśaya iti na dravyāśrayeṇa /
analyzed: pūrva uttara kṣaṇayoḥ eka tva adhyavasāyena tasya eva ayam atiśayaḥ iti na dravya āśrayeṇa
translated: Considering the identity of the previous and subsequent moments, this is an enhancement of that [continuum], not based on a substance.

original: aupacārikam eva na tu pāramārthikam
analyzed: aupacārikam eva na tu pāramārthikam
translated: It is merely figurative, not real.

original: pūrvapūrvakṣaṇebhyas tu S / / svahetupariṇāmopanidhidharmabhya uttarottaraviśeṣotpattau
analyzed: pūrva pūrva kṣaṇebhyaḥ tu sva hetu pariṇāma upanidhi dharmabhyaḥ uttara uttara viśeṣa utpattau
translated: But in the production of the progressively distinguished [effect] from the previous moments, which are the inherent properties of the transformation of their own causes,

original: pūrvakāraṇakalāpasyaikārthakriyālakṣaṇam eva tatra paramārthataḥ sahakāritvam iti
translated: the characteristic of the collection of previous causes as co-operators there is truly the performance of a single effect.

original: na kācit kṣatir iti /
analyzed: na kācid kṣatiḥ iti
translated: Thus there is no harm at all.

original: kasmād dravyāśrayeṇātiśayotpādanaṃ neṣyate / /
analyzed: kasmāt dravya āśrayeṇa atiśaya utpādanam na iṣyate
translated: Why is it not accepted that a special quality is produced in dependence on a substance?

original: kṣaṇike dravye vastuni viśeṣasyānutpatteḥ tasyānantarakṣaṇabhāvarūpatvād /
analyzed: kṣaṇike dravye vastuni viśeṣasya anutpatteḥ tasya anantara kṣaṇa bhāva rūpa tvāt
translated: Because in a momentary substance, a thing, a special quality does not arise, because it has the nature of existing in the next moment.

original: yadi tarhi kṣaṇike taṇḍulādidravye viśeṣo notpadyate /
analyzed: yadi tarhi kṣaṇike taṇḍula ādi dravye viśeṣaḥ na utpadyate
translated: If then a special quality does not arise in a momentary substance like rice grains,

original: anantaram apy asau mā bhūt /
analyzed: anantaram api asau mā bhūt
translated: let it not exist immediately after either.

original: tato yathā parasparato viśeṣamanāsādayanto 'pi kṣaṇikāḥ sahitā eva kurvanti na kevalāḥ /
analyzed: tatas yathā parasparataḥ viśeṣam an āsādayantaḥ pi kṣaṇikāḥ sahitāḥ eva kurvanti na kevalāḥ
translated: Therefore, just as momentary [causes] together produce [an effect] without attaining a special quality from each other, not individually,

original: evam akṣaṇikā api /
analyzed: evam akṣaṇikāḥ api
translated: so also non-momentary [causes].

original: tenaiṣām ekārthakriyālakṣaṇam eva sahakāritvaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena eṣām eka artha kriyā lakṣaṇam eva sahakāri tvam bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus their co-operation will consist precisely in the performance of one effect.

original: na ca śakyaṃ vaktum yo yasya prāg akārakaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa paścād apīti /
analyzed: na ca śakyam vaktum yaḥ yasya prāk akārakaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa paścāt api iti
translated: And it cannot be said that a nature which was previously non-productive remains so afterwards.

original: tathā hi prabhāsvarād apavarakaṃ praviṣṭasyendriyam arthapratipattim akurvad api paścāt kurvāṇam upalabhyate / tad uktam 🔽na hi praviṣṭamātrāṇām uṣṇād garbhagṛhādiṣu /
analyzed: tathā hi prabhāsvarāt apavarakam praviṣṭasya indriyam artha pratipattim akurvat api paścāt kurvāṇam upalabhyate tat uktam  na hi praviṣṭa mātrāṇām uṣṇāt garbhagṛha ādiṣu
translated: For thus, when one enters from a bright place into a dark room, although the sense organ does not produce the cognition of an object at first, it is observed to do so later. This is stated:🔽For those who have just entered from a bright place into a hot room,

original: arthāna pratibhāntīti gṛhyante nendriyaiḥpunaḥ//
analyzed: pratibhānti iti gṛhyante na indriyaiḥ punar
translated: the objects do not appear, and are not apprehended again by the sense organs.

original: ŚlV pratyakṣa iti /
analyzed: ślu pratyakṣaḥ iti
translated: [The opponent says:] It is perception.🔽[The author replies:]

original: ata āha na hi taṇḍulādīnām ityādi /
analyzed: atas āha na hi taṇḍula ādīnām ityādi
translated: Therefore, he says: For rice grains and so on, etc.

original: viśeṣānutpattau sannidhānasyāpy asannidhānatulyatvāt S / / dahanādibhāve 'pi taṇḍulādibhyo naudanajanma syāt /
analyzed: viśeṣa anutpattau sannidhānasya api asannidhāna tulya tvāt dahana ādi bhāve pi taṇḍula ādibhyaḥ na odana janma syāt
translated: When a special [quality] does not arise, even proximity is the same as non-proximity. Even when there is the state of burning, etc., rice grains and so on would not produce cooked rice.

original: T / / tathā prabhāsvarād apavarakaṃ praviṣṭasya yadīndriyaṃ svopakāribhyo 'tiśayaṃ krameṇa na pratipadyate tadā prāg iva paścād apy arthapratipattiṃ
analyzed: t tathā prabhāsvarāt apavarakam praviṣṭasya yadi indriyam sva upakāribhyaḥ tiśayam krameṇa na pratipadyate tadā prāk iva paścāt api artha pratipattim
translated: Similarly, for one who enters a dark room from a bright place, if the sense faculty does not gradually acquire superiority over its own benefactors, then it would not produce the cognition of an object afterwards, just as before.

original: naiva janayet /
analyzed: na eva janayet
translated: It would not produce it at all.

original: p / / tasmād yad asambhavi kāryaṃ yatra dṛśyate tasya tato 'nyatvam eva /
analyzed: tasmāt yat asambhavi kāryam yatra dṛśyate tasya tatas eva
translated: Therefore, that which has an impossible effect, when seen there, is simply different from that.

original: śālibījād iva kodravabījasyeti niratiśayād anyatvam eva sātiśayatayā tatkāryakāriṇa iti /
analyzed: śāli bījāt iva kodrava bījasya iti niratiśayāt anya tvam eva sa atiśaya tayā tad kārya kāriṇaḥ iti
translated: Like the kodrava seed from a rice seed. Thus, the difference from the unsurpassed is simply the production of that effect with superiority.

original: evaṃ tāvad yatra sahakāribhyaḥ krameṇa kāryaṃ bhavati tatrātiśayotpādanalakṣaṇam aupacārikaṃ sahakāritvam ekārthakriyālakṣaṇam eva tu mukhyaṃ
analyzed: evam tāvat yatra sahakāribhyaḥ krameṇa kāryam bhavati tatra atiśaya utpādana lakṣaṇam aupacārikam sahakāri tvam eka artha kriyā lakṣaṇam eva tu mukhyam
translated: Thus, first, where the effect arises gradually from the auxiliaries, there the figurative auxiliary character consisting of the production of superiority is indeed primary, but the character of the performance of the same purpose is primary.

original: tatrāpīti pratipāditam /
analyzed: tatra api iti pratipāditam
translated: There also, it has been shown.

original: yatra tv akṣepeṇaivārthasannidhimātreṇa sahakāriṇaḥ kāryaṃ kurvanti kiṃ tatrāpi santānāśrayam atiśayotpādanam asti /
analyzed: yatra tu akṣepeṇa eva artha sannidhi mātreṇa sahakāriṇaḥ kāryam kurvanti kim tatra api santāna āśrayam atiśaya utpādanam asti
translated: But where [the causes] produce the effect merely by the presence of the object without any delay, is there also the production of a special [property] based on a continuum?

original: ity ata āha akṣepakāriṣu ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha akṣepa kāriṣu ityādi
translated: To this he says in the case of those that act without delay, etc.

original: ye hy avyavadhānādideśā indriyādayaḥ svahetubhyo jātās teṣv avilambitakāriṣu na viśeṣotpattiḥ parasparataḥ sambhavati /
analyzed: ye hi avyavadhāna ādi deśāḥ indriya ādayaḥ sva hetubhyaḥ jātāḥ teṣu avilambita kāriṣu na viśeṣa utpattiḥ parasparataḥ sambhavati
translated: Those sense faculties, etc., which are in a place without obstruction, etc., and are produced from their own causes, when they act without delay, the production of a special [property] from each other is not possible.

original: kṣaṇikatvāt' ity uktaṃ S / / prāk /
analyzed: kṣaṇika tvāt iti uktam s prāk
translated: Because of momentariness, it was said before.

original: yadi na viśeṣotpattiḥ tadā kathaṃ nirviśeṣā jñānasya kāraṇī bhavanti /
analyzed: yadi na viśeṣa utpattiḥ tadā katham nirviśeṣāḥ jñānasya kāraṇī bhavanti
translated: If there is no production of a special [property], then how do they become the causes of cognition without a special [property]?

original: ity ata āha tatra yathāsvaṃ yasya ye ātmīyāḥ pratyayāḥ taiḥ /🔽parasparopasarppaṇavyavadhānādivirahāderāśrayabhūtair ye jātāḥ yogyaś cāsāv atyāsannatvātiviprakarṣavirahād
analyzed: iti atas āha tatra yathāsvam yasya ye ātmīyāḥ pratyayāḥ taiḥ  paraspara upasarppaṇa vyavadhāna ādi viraha ādeḥ āśraya bhūtaiḥ ye jātāḥ yogyaḥ ca asau ati āsanna tva ati viprakarṣa virahāt
translated: To this he says there, each one by its own, i.e., by its own conditions.

original: deśaś ca sa ādir yasyāvyavahitadeśādeḥ tatrāvasthānam avasthā yeṣāṃ te saha svabhāvaniṣpattyā
analyzed: deśaḥ ca saḥ ādiḥ yasya avyavahita deśa ādeḥ tatra avasthānam avasthā yeṣām te saha svabhāva niṣpattyā
translated: By those [conditions] which are the basis, due to the absence of mutual contact, obstruction, etc., and being fit, and that place which is the beginning of that which is not obstructed, etc., the existence there, the state of those [conditions] together with the accomplishment of their own nature,

original: T / / svabhāvaniṣpattir vidyataity eva kṛtvā jṇānahetutāṃpratipadyante
analyzed: t svabhāva niṣpattiḥ eva kṛtvā jṇāna hetu tām pratipadyante
translated: They attain the causal nature of knowledge by considering that the accomplishment of their own nature exists.

original: tatra kiṃ parasparato viśeṣotpattyā prārthitayā / /
analyzed: tatra kim parasparataḥ viśeṣa utpattyā prārthitayā
translated: There, is the difference sought to be produced from each other?

original: yadi hi svahetubhya eva parasparopasarppaṇādyāśrebhyaḥ svakāryajananakṣamā yogyadeśādyavasthānalakṣaṇaviśeṣayogino notpadyeran /
analyzed: yadi hi sva hetubhyaḥ eva sva kārya janana kṣamāḥ yogya deśa ādi avasthāna lakṣaṇa viśeṣa yoginaḥ na utpadyeran
translated: For if they would not be produced from their own causes themselves, which are capable of producing their own effects in dependence on mutual contact and so on, endowed with the characteristic of suitability in terms of place and so on,

original: tadaiṣāṃ parasparato viśeṣotpattiḥ prārthyeta /
analyzed: tadā eṣām parasparataḥ viśeṣa utpattiḥ prārthyeta
translated: then the production of difference from each other would be sought for them.

original: na tu svahetubhya eva tathāvidhānām utpattau /
analyzed: na tu sva hetubhyaḥ eva tathāvidhānām utpattau
translated: But not in the production of just such [effects] from their own causes.

original: yata evam iti tasmāt tatra teṣu akṣepakāriṣv indriyādiṣu ekārthakriyaiva mukhyaṃ sahakāritvaṃ na santānāśrayeṇa
analyzed: yatas evam iti tasmāt tatra teṣu akṣepa kāriṣu indriya ādiṣu eka artha kriyā eva mukhyam sahakāri tvam na santāna āśrayeṇa
translated: Since this is so, therefore, in that case, in those non-intermittent sense faculties and so on, the primary cooperation is only the performance of a single purpose, not the secondary [cooperation] characterized by the production of a special [effect] based on a continuum.

original: S / / vyavasthāpyamānam atiśayotpādanalakṣaṇaṃ gauṇam iti /
analyzed: vyavasthāpyamānam atiśaya utpādana lakṣaṇam gauṇam iti
translated: [This is] because it is being established.

original: atha viśeṣotpādanalakṣaṇaṃ sahakāritvaṃ kathaṃ na vyavasthāpyate / /
analyzed: atha viśeṣa utpādana lakṣaṇam sahakāri tvam katham na vyavasthāpyate
translated: Or, if the cooperation characterized by the production of a special [effect] is not established, how is it not established?

original: tad api hi loke pratītatvād vyavasthāpanīyam evety ata āha yatra tu kārye nāvyavadhānādideśopanipātamātreṇaivendriyādaya iva sahakāriṇaḥ
analyzed: tat api hi loke pratīta tvāt vyavasthāpanīyam eva iti atas āha yatra tu kārye na avyavadhāna ādi deśa upanipāta mātreṇa eva indriya ādayaḥ iva sahakāriṇaḥ
translated: That too must be established because it is well-known in the world. Therefore, he says: But where the sense faculties, etc. are only co-operators by merely coming into contact with the object without any obstruction, etc.

original: pratyayatāṃ pratipadyante /🔽kintu p / / vivakṣitakāryotpādānuguṇaṃ pratikṣaṇaṃ prakṛṣyamāṇaṃ viśeṣam utpādayantaḥ
analyzed: pratyaya tām pratipadyante  kintu vivakṣita kārya utpāda anuguṇam pratikṣaṇam prakṛṣyamāṇam viśeṣam utpādayantaḥ
translated: That too, because it is well-known in the world, must certainly be established. Therefore he says: But where, in the production of an effect, the auxiliaries, like the sense faculties, etc., become conditions merely by the mere presence in the immediate vicinity of the place,🔽not by producing a special quality moment by moment that is conducive to the production of the intended effect,

original: tatra kālakṣepabhāvini kārye karttavye hetusantāno 'parāparakṣaṇabhāvalakṣaṇa ātmātiśayāsādanārthaṃ
analyzed: tatra kāla kṣepa bhāvini kārye karttavye hetu santānaḥ para apara kṣaṇa bhāva lakṣaṇaḥ ātma atiśaya āsādana artham
translated: the series of causes, in the matter to be done that occurs at a later time, in order to attain the special nature characterized by the existence of moment after moment,

original: sahakārīṇi pratyayāntarāṇy apekṣate /
analyzed: sahakārīṇi pratyaya antarāṇi apekṣate
translated: requires other conditions as auxiliaries.

original: na tu tatsamānakālaḥ kāraṇakṣaṇa iti /
analyzed: na tu tad samāna kālaḥ kāraṇa kṣaṇaḥ iti
translated: But not the momentary cause that is simultaneous with it.🔽Therefore, from those other causes, the attainment of a different nature characterized by a succession of special qualities conducive to the production of the effect,

original: tatas tebhyaḥ kāraṇāntarebhyaḥ svabhāvāntarasya kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣaparamparālakṣaṇasya pratilabhyaḥ santānasyaikatvenādhimuktasyocyate loke
analyzed: tatas tebhyaḥ kāraṇa antarebhyaḥ svabhāva antarasya kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa paramparā lakṣaṇasya pratilabhyaḥ santānasya ekatvena adhimuktasya ucyate loke
translated: in the case of one who is devoted to the unity of the series, it is said in the world

original: paramārthas tu tatrāpi pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ pratyayakalāpa uttarottarakāryotpādānuguṇe T / / viśiṣṭakṣaṇe pratiniyata ity ekārthakriyālakṣaṇam
analyzed: paramārthaḥ tu tatra api pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ pratyaya kalāpaḥ uttara uttara kārya utpāda anuguṇe t viśiṣṭa kṣaṇe pratiniyataḥ iti ekārtha kriyā lakṣaṇam
translated: But the ultimate truth is that even there, the preceding group of conditions is determined for each particular moment that is favorable for the production of the succeeding effect. Thus, the characteristic of performing a single action

original: eva sahakāritvam
analyzed: eva sahakāri tvam
translated: is itself the nature of being a cooperating factor.

original: anubhavati /
analyzed: anubhavati
translated: [The mind] experiences.

original: kathām punaḥ svabhāvāntarapratilambhas teṣām /
analyzed: kathām punar svabhāva antara pratilambhaḥ teṣām
translated: But how do they attain a different nature?

original: yataḥ krameṇa kāryaṃ nirvarttayantīty ata āha tatra svarasataḥ ityādi /
analyzed: yatas krameṇa kāryam nirvarttayanti iti atas āha tatra svarasataḥ ityādi
translated: From which [they] perform the effect in sequence. Therefore, he says there, naturally and so on.

original: tatra tasmin hetusantāne ye hetava upādānakāraṇākhyāḥ ye ca pratyayāḥ sahakārisaṃjñitās
analyzed: tatra tasmin hetu santāne ye hetavaḥ upādāna kāraṇa ākhyāḥ ye ca pratyayāḥ sahakāri saṃjñitāḥ
translated: There, in that causal continuum, the causes that are called material causes and the conditions that are called cooperating factors,

original: teṣāṃ ye pūrve S / / prathama upanipātakṣaṇāḥ teṣāṃ vināśahetvanapekṣitayā svarasato🔽nivṛttau satyāṃ tebhya eva svarasato nivarttamānebhyaḥ prathamakṣaṇebhyaḥ kāryotpādānuguṇena
analyzed: teṣām ye pūrve prathamaḥ upanipāta kṣaṇāḥ teṣām vināśa hetu anapekṣi tayā  nivṛttau satyām tebhyaḥ eva svarasataḥ nivarttamānebhyaḥ prathama kṣaṇebhyaḥ kārya utpāda anuguṇena
translated: of those, the earlier ones, the first moments of conjunction, due to the cessation by their own nature without requiring a cause of destruction,

original: viśeṣeṇa viśiṣṭasya kṣaṇasyotpattiḥ tebhyo 'nuguṇataraviśeṣavatāṃ tṛtīyakṣaṇānāṃ
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa viśiṣṭasya kṣaṇasya utpattiḥ tebhyaḥ nuguṇatara viśeṣavatām tṛtīya kṣaṇānām
translated: when that is true, from those very ones ceasing by their own nature, from the first moments, the arising of a moment distinguished by a particularity favorable for the production of the effect. From those [arises] the third moments having a particularity more favorable than that.

original: tebhyonuguṇatamaviśeṣavatāṃ caturthakṣaṇānām /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ anuguṇatama viśeṣavatām caturtha kṣaṇānām
translated: From those [arises] the fourth moments having a particularity most favorable.

original: evaṃ yāvad atyantātiśayavānantyaḥ kāraṇakalāpo jātaḥ tataḥ kāryasyotpattiḥ ity evaṃ sahakāribhyaḥ svabhāvāntarapratilambhaḥ /
analyzed: evam yāvat atyanta atiśayavān antyaḥ kāraṇa kalāpaḥ jātaḥ tatas kāryasya utpattiḥ iti evam sahakāribhyaḥ svabhāva antara pratilambhaḥ
translated: In the same way, up to the final moment, the collection of causes becomes extremely special. Then the effect arises. Thus, the acquisition of a different nature is from the cooperating causes.

original: kṣepavatī ca kāryotpattir iti /
analyzed: kṣepavatī ca kārya utpattiḥ iti
translated: And the arising of the effect is delayed.

original: atra paraś codayann āha sahakāriṇaḥ saha karaṇaśīlāt kāraṇāt /
analyzed: atra paraḥ codayan āha sahakāriṇaḥ saha karaṇa śīlāt kāraṇāt
translated: Here, the opponent raises an objection, saying: The cooperating causes are from a cause that has the nature of cooperating.

original: jātāv ekavacanam /
analyzed: jātau ekavacanam
translated: The singular is used for the arising.

original: yat samutpannaviśeṣam anantaroktena prakāreṇa kāraṇaṃ antyasāmagrīkṣaṇalakṣaṇaṃ tato🔽'ṅkurādikāryotpattau iṣyamāṇāyāṃ tasyaiva viśeṣasyādyasya kāryotpādanānuguṇasya yaḥ
