translated: If you think this,

original: atrāpi sarvam uktam uttaram /🔽tathā hi saṃhatāsaṃhatāvasthayor nirviśeṣā eva kṣaṇakṣayiṇo bhāvā iti taducyate tat kiṃ tāvad viśeṣamātrāpekṣayā /
analyzed: atra api sarvam uktam uttaram  tathā hi saṃhata asaṃhata avasthayoḥ nirviśeṣāḥ eva kṣaṇa kṣayiṇaḥ bhāvāḥ iti tat ucyate tat kim tāvat viśeṣa mātra apekṣayā
translated: here too all the answers have been given.🔽For thus it is said: Are things that perish moment by moment, which are without any difference in the states of being combined or not combined, dependent on that specific property alone?

original: āhosvit T / / kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣajanakaviśeṣāpekṣayā /
analyzed: āhosvit t kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa janaka viśeṣa apekṣayā
translated: Or are they dependent on a specific property that produces a specific property conducive to the production of the effect?

original: yadi prācyo vikalpaḥ tad ayuktam /🔽na hi kācid viśeṣamātrarahitā 'vasthā S / / sambhavati /
analyzed: yadi prācyaḥ vikalpaḥ tat ayuktam  na hi kācid viśeṣa mātra rahitā vasthā sambhavati
translated: If the former alternative is accepted, that is not correct.🔽For a state that is completely devoid of specific properties is not possible.

original: sarvadā 'parāparapratyayayoganibandhanasyāparāparaviśeṣasya bhāvāt /
analyzed: sarvadā para apara pratyaya yoga nibandhanasya apara apara viśeṣasya bhāvāt
translated: Because a specific property that is dependent on the connection with other and other conditions at other and other times is always present.

original: na hi kadācit kiṃcid ekam eva /
analyzed: na hi kadācid kiṃcid ekam eva
translated: For nothing is ever just one thing.

original: ādhāracchāyātapavātaśītāder yathāsambhavaṃ bhāvāt /
analyzed: ādhāra chāyā ātapa vāta śīta ādeḥ yathāsambhavam bhāvāt
translated: Because of the existence of support, shadow, heat, wind, cold, etc. as possible.

original: na ca tabhāve 'pi tat tādṛśam eva /
analyzed: na ca ta bhāve tat tādṛśam eva
translated: And even when they exist, it is not the same.

original: kāraṇabhedāt /
analyzed: kāraṇa bhedāt
translated: Because of the difference in causes.

original: etāvat tu syāt kaścid viśeṣaḥ kvacit kārye 'nuguṇo na sarvaḥ sarvatreti /
analyzed: etāvat tu syāt kaścid viśeṣaḥ kvacid kārye nuguṇaḥ na sarvaḥ sarvatra iti
translated: This much may be the case: some difference is favorable to some effect, not all to all.

original: etac ca prāg evoktam iti darśayann āha pratikṣaṇam aparāparaiḥpratyayaiḥ iti /
analyzed: etat ca prāk eva uktam iti darśayan āha pratikṣaṇam apara aparaiḥ pratyayaiḥ iti
translated: And this has already been stated before. Showing this, he says: due to other and other conditions every moment.

original: aparāparapratyayayogena pratikṣaṇaṃ bhinnaśaktayaḥ saṃskārāḥ santanvanto yady api kutaścit sāmyāt sarūpāḥ pratīyante /
analyzed: apara apara pratyaya yogena pratikṣaṇam bhinna śaktayaḥ saṃskārāḥ santanvantaḥ yadi api kutaścid sāmyāt sarūpāḥ pratīyante
translated: Although the formations, having different potencies every moment due to the connection with other and other conditions, are continuous, they are cognized as similar due to some kind of similarity.

original: tathāpi bhinna evaiṣāṃ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api bhinnaḥ eva eṣām svabhāvaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, their nature is indeed different.

original: tena kiñcid eva kasyacit kāraṇam'iti /
analyzed: tena kiñcid eva kasyacid
translated: Therefore, only something is the cause of something.

original: kṣaṇikeṣu p / / bhāveṣv aparāparotpatter aikyābhāvāt'iti cātra saṃkṣiptataram uktam /
analyzed: kṣaṇikeṣu bhāveṣu apara apara utpatteḥ ca atra saṃkṣiptataram uktam
translated: And in this context, it has been stated more concisely: In momentary things, due to the arising of other and other, there is no unity.

original: evaṃ ca nāsmākaṃ punaḥ punar vacana' ity atra dviḥ punargrahaṇaṃ yujyate /
analyzed: evam ca na asmākam punar punar vacane iti atra dvis punargrahaṇam yujyate
translated: And thus, the repetition of again and again in the statement And thus, there is no repetition for us is appropriate.

original: yathā yena prakāreṇa bhāvasantāne viśeṣasyotpattiḥ tad apy uktam
analyzed: yathā yena prakāreṇa bhāva santāne viśeṣasya utpattiḥ tat api uktam
translated: And thus, the arising of the distinction in the continuum of things in that way has also been stated:

original: tatra svarasataḥ pūrvakṣaṇanirodhe tebhya eva viśiṣṭakṣaṇotpādād viśeṣotpattiḥ'iti /
analyzed: tatra svarasataḥ pūrva kṣaṇa nirodhe tebhyaḥ eva viśiṣṭa kṣaṇa utpādāt
translated: There, by the intrinsic nature, from the cessation of the previous moment, the production of a particular moment from those [causes] itself is the production of a particular [effect].

original: atha kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣajanakaviśeṣāpekṣayā prāgvat prathamasamparkkabhājaḥ parasparato nirviśeṣā ity abhimataṃ tad apy ayuktam /
analyzed: atha kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa janaka viśeṣa apekṣayā prāgvat prathama samparkka bhājaḥ parasparataḥ nirviśeṣāḥ iti abhimatam tat api ayuktam
translated: If it is accepted that [the causes] are without any particular [effect] among themselves, as before, in relation to the particular [effect] that produces a particular [effect] that is suitable for the production of the effect, that is also incorrect.

original: yataḥ kāryotpādānuguṇasya viśeṣasya janakāḥ S / / kṣitibījādayaḥ kīdṛśāḥ ye T / / vyavadhānādirahitatvenopanipātinaḥ /
analyzed: yatas kārya utpāda anuguṇasya viśeṣasya janakāḥ kṣiti bīja ādayaḥ kīdṛśāḥ ye t vyavadhāna ādi rahita tvena upanipātinaḥ
translated: Because what produces the particular [effect] that is suitable for the production of the effect, such as the earth and seed, etc., are of what kind? They are those that are present without obstruction, etc.

original: tadbhāva eva tasya bhāvāt etāvanmātranibandhanatvāc ca vyakavyavasthāyāḥ/
analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ eva tasya bhāvāt etāvat mātra nibandhana tvāt ca janakam
translated: Because the existence of that [particular] itself is the existence of that [effect], and because the determination of the particular [effect] is based on just that much.

original: te ca tathāvidhāḥ sarvadā na bhavantī kathaṃ pṛthag api kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣārambha eṣāṃ syāt /
analyzed: te ca tathāvidhāḥ sarvadā na katham pṛthak api kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa ārambhaḥ eṣām syāt
translated: And those [causes] are not always of that kind. How could they produce a particular [effect] that is suitable for the production of the effect, even if they are separate?

original: yataḥ kevalānām api kāryakriyā prasajyeta tad darśayati yogyo deśo yeṣāṃ te yogyadeśāḥ /
analyzed: yatas kevalānām api kārya kriyā prasajyeta tat darśayati yogyaḥ deśaḥ yeṣām te yogyadeśāḥ
translated: Because the production of an effect by the individual [causes] alone would follow. He shows that [by saying]: Those that have a suitable place are the ones with a suitable place.

original: tadbhāvo yogyadeśatā /
analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ yogya deśa tā
translated: The existence of that [suitable place] is the suitability of place.

original: sā ādir yeṣāṃ avyavahitadeśatvādīnām avasthābhedānāṃ te tathoktāḥ /
analyzed: sā ādiḥ yeṣām avyavahita deśa tva ādīnām avasthā bhedānām te tathā uktāḥ
translated: Those that have that as the beginning, of the states that are without obstruction, etc., are said to be like that.

original: te ca te avasthābhedāś ca tathoktāḥ /
analyzed: te ca te avasthā bhedāḥ ca tathā uktāḥ
translated: And those are the different states.

original: yogyadeśatāatādya🔽vyavahitadeśatādayo ye avasthāviśeṣāḥ
analyzed: yogya deśa tā ata adya  vyavahita deśa tā ādayaḥ ye avasthā viśeṣāḥ
translated: The state of being in a suitable place, etc.🔽The particular states of the earth, seed, etc., which arise as being in an unobstructed place, etc.,

original: kṣitibījādīnām upajāyante te kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣalakṣaṇakāryakaraṇaśīlāḥ /
analyzed: kṣiti bīja ādīnām upajāyante te kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa lakṣaṇa kārya karaṇa śīlāḥ
translated: are inclined to produce effects that are characterized by special qualities conducive to the production of effects.

original: naivaṃvidhāḥ sarvadā bījādaya iti katham eṣāṃ pṛthag api tathāvidhaviśeṣārambhaḥ syāt / /
analyzed: na evaṃvidhāḥ sarvadā bīja ādayaḥ iti katham eṣām pṛthak api tathāvidha viśeṣa ārambhaḥ syāt
translated: Since seeds, etc., are not always of such a kind, how could they produce such a special effect even when separate?

original: etad api prāg evoktam tatra yo 'vyavadhānādideśo rūpendriyādikalāpaḥ sa vijñānajanane samartho hetuḥ'iti vacanāt /
analyzed: etat api prāk eva uktam tatra yaḥ vyavadhāna ādi deśaḥ rūpa indriya ādi kalāpaḥ sa vijñāna janane samarthaḥ vacanāt
translated: This has already been stated earlier, because it is said there that the group of unobstructed, etc., places such as the form faculty, etc., is the cause capable of producing consciousness.

original: tasya codāharaṇamātratvāt /
analyzed: tasya ca udāharaṇa mātra tvāt
translated: And because that [statement] is merely an example.

original: ihāpi tatra yo 'vyavadhānādideśaḥ kṣitibījādikalāpaḥ sa kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣajanane samartho hetur iti pratīyata eva /
analyzed: iha api tatra yaḥ vyavadhāna ādi deśaḥ kṣiti bīja ādi kalāpaḥ sa kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa janane samarthaḥ hetuḥ iti pratīyate eva
translated: Here also, it is understood that the group of earth, seed, etc., in an unobstructed place, etc., is the cause capable of producing the special qualities conducive to the production of the effect.

original: sa ca S / / tathāvidho viśeṣaḥ sarvadā na bhavati /
analyzed: sa ca tathāvidhaḥ viśeṣaḥ sarvadā na bhavati
translated: And that special quality of that kind does not always exist.

original: tajjanakasya hetor abhāvāt /
analyzed: tad janakasya hetoḥ abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no cause that produces it.

original: parasparopasarppaṇādyāśrayasyaiva T / / pratyayaviśeṣasya taddhetutvāt /
analyzed: paraspara upasarppaṇa ādi āśrayasya eva t pratyaya viśeṣasya tad hetu tvāt
translated: Because only that particular condition which depends on mutual contact, etc., is the cause of that [special quality], since it is the cause of that [special quality].

original: etad api pūrvam evoktam ity āha teṣāṃ ca kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣajanane viśeṣavatāṃ
analyzed: etat api pūrvam eva uktam iti āha teṣām ca kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa janane viśeṣavatām
translated: This too has been said before. He says: And in the production of a particular effect, those with particularities

original: yata utpattis tad apy uktam asakṛd eva yas teṣāṃ parasparopasarppaṇādyāśrayaḥ pratyayaviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: yatas utpattiḥ tat api uktam asakṛt eva yaḥ teṣām paraspara upasarppaṇa ādi āśrayaḥ pratyaya viśeṣaḥ
translated: from which there is origination, that too has been said again and again: 'That which is the basis for their mutual contact and so on, that particular condition,

original: sa taddhetujanane samartho hetuḥ'iti /
analyzed: sa tad hetu janane samarthaḥ
translated: is the cause capable of producing that cause.'

original: tathā yathāsvaṃ pratyayaiḥ parasparopasarppaṇāśrayair
analyzed: tathā yathāsvam pratyayaiḥ paraspara upasarppaṇa āśrayaiḥ
translated: Similarly, by their own conditions, which are the basis for mutual contact,

original: ye p / / yogyadeśādyavasthā jātās te saha svabhāvaniṣpattyā jñānahetutāṃ pratipadyanta'ity anena /
analyzed: ye p yogya deśa ādi avasthāḥ jātāḥ te saha svabhāva niṣpattyā jñāna hetu tām anena
translated: those that have arisen in a suitable place and so on, together with the accomplishment of their own nature, become the cause of knowledge,' by this.

original: ihāpi gamyamānatvāt /
analyzed: iha api gamyamāna tvāt
translated: Here too, because it is to be understood.

original: tato yady apy eṣāṃ parasparato 'nupapatterviśeṣo na bhavati /
analyzed: tatas yadi api eṣām parasparataḥ na bhavati
translated: Therefore, although these do not have a particularity due to their mutual non-establishment,

original: svahetukṛtas tu kena vāryate / /
analyzed: sva hetu kṛtaḥ tu kena vāryate
translated: but that produced by their own cause, who can prevent it?

original: na ca svahetuta eva sañjātaviśeṣāṇāṃ bhāve parasparatas tadāśaṃsā /
analyzed: na ca sva hetutaḥ eva sañjāta viśeṣāṇām bhāve parasparataḥ tad āśaṃsā
translated: And when things have arisen with particularities from their own causes, there is no hope for them from each other.

original: yataḥ parasparato viśeṣāyogaḥpratipādyamānaḥ śobheta /
analyzed: yatas parasparataḥ śobheta
translated: From which the impossibility of particularities from each other, when demonstrated, would be beautiful.

original: teṣāṃ ca kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣajanakānāṃ pratyayānāṃ pratyekaṃ sāmarthye 'pi khaṇḍaśaḥ kāryotpādāyogāt sakalasyaiva pratyekaṃ karaṇāt /
analyzed: teṣām ca kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa janakānām pratyayānām pratyekam sāmarthye khaṇḍaśas kārya utpāda ayogāt sakalasya eva pratyekam karaṇāt
translated: And although each of those conditions, which produce the particularities conducive to the production of their effects, has the capacity, still, because it is impossible for the effect to be produced in parts, the whole [set of conditions] produces each [part of the effect] individually.

original: yathā kevalānām akriyā kartṛviśeṣasyāvyavadhānādideśakṣitibījādikalāpasya pṛthag
analyzed: yathā kevalānām akriyā kartṛ viśeṣasya avyavadhāna ādi deśa kṣiti bīja ādi kalāpasya pṛthak
translated: Just as the individual [conditions] do not produce [the effect], because there is no entity that is capable individually, even though the collection of earth, seed, etc., which is not obstructed by a special agent, etc., in a particular place, etc.,

original: ekaikasya samarthasya bhāvasyābhāvād ity etad apy asakṛd evoktam teṣāṃ ca na pūrvaṃ🔽na paścāt na pṛthagbhāva iti samarthānāpi S / / pūrvāparapṛthagbhāvabhāvino
analyzed: ekaikasya samarthasya bhāvasya abhāvāt iti etat api asakṛt eva uktam teṣām ca na pūrvam  na paścāt na pṛthagbhāve iti
translated: And because it has been said many times that those [conditions] do not exist before, after, or separately, even though they are capable,

original: doṣā nopalīyante' ityādivacanāt /🔽tatas tathāvidhaviśeṣasya svopādānamātranibandhanasyānabhyupagamena T / / kevalānām
analyzed: doṣāḥ na upalīyante ityādi vacanāt  tatas tathāvidha viśeṣasya sva upādāna mātra nibandhanasya anabhyupagamena t kevalānām
translated: the faults that would arise from the existence of a prior, posterior, or separate [existence] do not attach [to the doctrine of momentariness], as stated [in the Abhidharmakośa].🔽Therefore, because such a particularity is not accepted as having only its own material cause as its basis, it is not possible for the individual [conditions] to produce the effect.

original: aprasaṅgāt kutaḥ kāryotpādānuguṇaviśeṣārambhadvārakaṃ kāryam api syād iti / /
analyzed: aprasaṅgāt kutas kārya utpāda anuguṇa viśeṣa ārambha dvārakam kāryam api syāt iti
translated: How then could there be an effect that arises through the door of producing a particularity conducive to the production of the effect?

original: kutaḥ punar ayaṃ kāmacāro labhyate yadaṅkurādikāryaṃ sahakāriṇaḥ parasparasya kāryotpādānuguṇāṃ viśeṣaparamparāṃ janayantaḥ kurvanti /
analyzed: kutas punar ayam kāmacāraḥ labhyate yat aṅkura ādi kāryam sahakāriṇaḥ parasparasya kārya utpāda anuguṇām viśeṣa paramparām janayantaḥ kurvanti
translated: But how is this freedom of action obtained, that the auxiliaries, producing a series of distinctions conducive to the production of the effect, do it?

original: kāryotpādānuguṇaṃ tu viśeṣaṃ vyavadhānādirahitadeśopanipātamātreṇetyata āha kāryadvaividhyaṃca yasmāt tasmād evaṃvibhajyate /
analyzed: kārya utpāda anuguṇam tu viśeṣam āha kārya dvaividhyam ca yasmāt tasmāt evam vibhajyate
translated: But the distinction conducive to the production of the effect is produced merely by the conjunction of the place free from obstruction, etc. Therefore he says: And because there are two kinds of effects, therefore it is divided like this.

original: kathaṃ dvaividhyaṃ kāryāṇām iti /🔽ata āha sahakāribhir avyavadhānādideśair anantaraṃ sañjanitāḥ parasparasya prāgavasthāpekṣaviśiṣṭakṣaṇabhāvalakṣaṇā
analyzed: katham dvaividhyam kāryāṇām iti  atas āha sahakāribhiḥ avyavadhāna ādi deśaiḥ anantaram sañjanitāḥ parasparasya prāc avasthā apekṣa viśiṣṭa kṣaṇa bhāva lakṣaṇā
translated: How are there two kinds of effects?🔽Therefore he says: Those distinctions characterized by the existence of moments distinguished by depending on the previous state, which are produced immediately by the auxiliaries whose place is free from obstruction, etc.,

original: ye viśeṣās tatparamparayā uttarottaraviśiṣṭaviśiṣṭatarādikṣaṇabhāvarūpayā utpattir
analyzed: ye viśeṣāḥ tad paramparayā uttara uttara viśiṣṭa viśiṣṭatara ādi kṣaṇa bhāva rūpayā utpattiḥ
translated: The arising in the form of moments distinguished by being more and more distinguished by that series of them,

original: ddharmo yasya tadātmakam ekaṃ kāryam /
analyzed: d dharmaḥ yasya tad ātmakam ekam kāryam
translated: That which has the nature of that is one kind of effect.

original: anyac ca tadviparītaṃ yat sahakārisannidhimātreṇa bhavati na parasparakṛtāṃ viśeṣaparamparām apekṣate /
analyzed: anyat ca tad viparītam yat sahakāri sannidhi mātreṇa bhavati na paraspara kṛtām viśeṣa paramparām apekṣate
translated: And the other is the opposite of that, which arises merely by the presence of the auxiliaries, not depending on a series of distinctions produced by each other.

original: atrodāharaṇam aṅkurādivat /
analyzed: atra udāharaṇam aṅkura ādi vat
translated: Here the example is like a sprout, etc.

original: ādigrahaṇād /
analyzed: ādi grahaṇāt odana ādi vat
translated: By the word etc.

original: tathā 'kṣepeṇakaraṇaśīlaṃ yadindriyaṃ S / / tadvijñānādivac ca /🔽prabhāsvarād apavarakapraviṣṭendriyanirāsārthaṃ
analyzed: tathā yat indriyam tat vijñāna ādi vat ca
translated: Similarly, if the sense organ is of the nature of throwing out, like consciousness etc.

original: caitad viśeṣaṇam /
analyzed: ca etat viśeṣaṇam
translated: This qualification is for the purpose of excluding the sense organ that has entered a dark room from a bright place.

original: kuta etad / iti cet p / / kāryakāraṇayoḥ svabhāvabhedāt /
analyzed: kutas etat iti ced kārya kāraṇayoḥ svabhāva bhedāt
translated: If it is asked why this is so, it is because the nature of cause and effect is different.

original: kiṃcid dhi kāryaṃ kāraṇasāmagrīsannidhimātrajanyasvabhāvam /
analyzed: kiṃcid hi kāryam kāraṇa sāmagrī sannidhi mātra janya svabhāvam
translated: For some effect has a nature that is produced merely by the presence of the assemblage of causes.

original: tad anyat tu tatpariṇāmāpekṣam iti /
analyzed: tat anyat tu tad pariṇāma apekṣam iti
translated: But another depends on the transformation of that.

original: kāraṇam api kiñcit T / / svasannidhimātreṇa kāryajananasvabhāvaṃ svakāraṇebhya eva bhavati /
analyzed: kāraṇam api kiñcid t sva sannidhi mātreṇa kārya janana svabhāvam sva kāraṇebhyaḥ eva bhavati
translated: And some cause has a nature that produces an effect merely by its own presence, and it comes about only from its own causes.

original: yena parasparakṛtāṃ viśeṣaparamparāṃ svakāryakaraṇe nāpekṣate /
analyzed: yena paraspara kṛtām viśeṣa paramparām sva kārya karaṇe na apekṣate
translated: By which it does not depend on a series of mutual modifications in producing its own effect.

original: anyat tu tadviparītasvabhāvam /
analyzed: anyat tu tad viparīta svabhāvam
translated: But another has a nature that is the opposite of that.

original: yathā kiñcid eva śālyaṅkurajananasvabhāvam /
analyzed: yathā kiñcid eva śāli aṅkura janana svabhāvam
translated: For example, something has the nature of producing a rice sprout.

original: tadviparītaṃ cāparam /
analyzed: tad viparītam ca aparam
translated: And something else has a nature that is the opposite of that.

original: śālyaṅkuraś ca tadbījajanyasvabhāvo na yavādibījajanyasvabhāva iti na bhāvānāṃ svahetubalāyātāḥ pramāṇādhigatāḥ svābhāvāḥ paryanuyojyāḥ /

original: tatra yena nyāyena kṣaṇikānāṃ hetuphalasvabhāvaḥ tasyākṣaṇikeṣv asambhavaṃ pratipādayituṃ
analyzed: tatra yena nyāyena kṣaṇikānām hetu phala svabhāvaḥ tasya akṣaṇikeṣu asambhavam pratipādayitum
translated: There, in order to demonstrate the impossibility of the nature of cause and effect for momentary things in non-momentary things, by that method,

original: prāsaṅgikaṃ yad upakrāntaṃ tat parisamāpayya prakṛtam anubadhnann āha tasmād yo yadātmā ityādi /🔽yadi svabhāvenāsthitidharmaṇo bhāvasya S / / na nāśakāraṇaiḥ prayojanaṃ svabhāvena sthitidharmaṇo bhaviṣyatīty ata āha sthitidharmaṇo
analyzed: prāsaṅgikam yat upakrāntam tat parisamāpayya prakṛtam anubadhnan āha tasmāt yaḥ yad ātmā ityādi  yadi svabhāvena asthiti dharmaṇaḥ bhāvasya na nāśa kāraṇaiḥ prayojanam svabhāvena sthiti dharmaṇaḥ bhaviṣyati iti atas āha sthiti dharmaṇaḥ
translated: having completed what was begun incidentally, continuing the main topic, he says Therefore, for that which has such a nature... and so on.

original: 'pi ityādi /
analyzed: pi ityādi
translated: If there is no purpose for the causes of destruction of an existent whose nature is non-endurance, it will be for one whose nature is endurance. Therefore he says For one whose nature is endurance... and so on.

original: sthitidharmaṇo 'pi hi naiva nāśakāraṇaiḥ kiñcit prayojanam /
analyzed: sthiti dharmaṇaḥ hi na eva nāśa kāraṇaiḥ kiñcid prayojanam
translated: For one whose nature is endurance, there is no purpose at all for the causes of destruction.

original: tasya svahetubhyaḥ samupajāto yaḥ sthiraḥ svabhāvaḥ p / / tadanyathātvasyāsthirātmatāpatteḥ kenacit karttum aśakyatvāt /
analyzed: tasya sva hetubhyaḥ samupajātaḥ yaḥ sthiraḥ svabhāvaḥ tad anyathātvasya asthira ātma tā āpatteḥ kenacid karttum aśakya tvāt
translated: For that stable nature which is produced from its own causes, it is not possible for anyone to make it attain an unstable nature, by changing it.

original: kāmaṃ hi bhāvāḥ svayaṃ na bhaveyuḥ / na
analyzed: kāmam hi bhāvāḥ svayam na bhaveyuḥ na
translated: Indeed, existents may not exist by themselves,

original: tu santa eva svaṃ svabhāvaṃ parityajanti /
analyzed: tu santaḥ eva svam svabhāvam parityajanti
translated: but they do not abandon their own nature while existing.

original: atha sthitidharmaṇo 'py anyathātvapratipattir iṣyate tadā 'nyathātvapratipattau vā tatsvabhāva eva sthitidharmaiva na syāt /
analyzed: atha sthiti dharmaṇaḥ u pi anyathātva pratipattiḥ iṣyate tadā nyathātva pratipattau vā tad svabhāvaḥ eva sthiti dharmā eva na syāt
translated: But if it is accepted that there is a change in the nature of that which has the property of enduring, then, in the case of change in nature, it would not have the nature of enduring.

original: ātmabhūtasyāsthitidharmaṇaḥ svabhāvasya paścāt sambhave prāg apy abhāvaāyogāt /🔽na hi tadātamanas tasmiṃsmin
analyzed: ātma bhūtasya a sthiti dharmaṇaḥ svabhāvasya paścāt sambhave prāk api abhāva āyogāt  na hi tadā tamanaḥ tasmin smin
translated: Because it is not possible that the nature of a thing which has the property of non-enduring should exist later, since it would not have existed previously.

original: sannihite kadācidabhāvo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: sannihite kadācid abhāvaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: For it is not proper that a thing which is present at that time should ever be non-existent when it is present.

original: atatsvabhāvatāprasaṅgāt viruddhadharmādhyāsasya bhedalakṣaṇatvāt' ity uktam /
analyzed: atatsvabhāva tā prasaṅgāt viruddha dharma adhyāsasya bheda lakṣaṇa tvāt iti uktam
translated: Because it would follow that it would not have that nature, since the characteristic of difference is the superimposition of contradictory properties, as has been said.

original: tathā ca sati pūrva eva vikalpaḥ svabhāvenāsthitidharmā bhāva iti /
analyzed: tathā ca sati pūrvaḥ eva vikalpaḥ svabhāvena asthiti dharmā bhāvaḥ iti
translated: And if that is so, then the first alternative is that an existent thing has the nature of non-enduring by itself.

original: tatra ca pūrvavikalpe prāg evoktaṃ dūṣaṇaṃ vināśahetor vaiyarthyam iti /
analyzed: tatra ca pūrva vikalpe prāk eva uktam dūṣaṇam vināśa hetoḥ vaiyarthyam iti
translated: And in that first alternative, the previously stated fault has been said, namely, the futility of the cause of destruction.

original: athāsau sthirasvabhāva eva /
analyzed: atha asau sthira svabhāvaḥ eva
translated: But if that has a stable nature,

original: kevalam asyāsthirasvabhāvatā prāg asati vināśahetor upajāyate /
analyzed: kevalam asya asthira svabhāva tā prāk asati vināśa hetoḥ upajāyate
translated: then only its nature of non-enduring, which did not exist previously, arises due to the cause of destruction.

original: anyathā nivṛttyayogād ity ata āha yaśca parasmāt nāśahetoḥ sthitidharmaṇaḥ S / / sataḥ anyathābhāvaḥ asthitidharmatālakṣaṇo bhavati /
analyzed: anyathā nivṛtti ayogāt iti atas āha yaḥ ca parasmāt nāśa hetoḥ sthiti dharmaṇaḥ s sataḥ anyathābhāvaḥ asthiti dharma tā lakṣaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: Otherwise, because it would be impossible for it to cease, he says: And that which is a different state from what exists with the nature of endurance due to another cause of destruction has the characteristic of the nature of non-endurance.

original: sa pūrvakāt sthitidharmaṇaḥ svahetusamudbhūtāt svabhāvāt aparaḥ anyaḥ svabhāvas tasmin niṣpanne paścāj janyatvād bhinnahetukatvāc ca kathaṃtasya 🔽svabhāvaḥ syāt / /
analyzed: sa pūrvakāt sthiti dharmaṇaḥ sva hetu samudbhūtāt svabhāvāt aparaḥ anyaḥ svabhāvaḥ tasmin niṣpanne paścāt janya tvāt bhinna hetuka tvāt ca katham tasya  / svabhāvaḥ syāt
translated: That other nature, which is different from the previous one that arises from its own cause, is produced later when that [previous nature] is accomplished, and because it has a different cause, how can it be🔽its nature?

original: tadātmatayā pratibhāsanād iti cet /
analyzed: tad ātma tayā pratibhāsanāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it appears as if it were its nature,

original: sārūpyād alakṣitavivekasya tathā pratibhāsanaṃ syāt yady asau T / / pūrvasvabhāve saty evānyato bhavet /
analyzed: sārūpyāt alakṣita vivekasya tathā pratibhāsanam syāt yadi asau pūrva svabhāve sati evā anyatas bhavet
translated: it would appear that way due to similarity, without distinguishing [the two], if it were to be from another when the previous nature exists.

original: anyathā virodhaḥ kathaṃ parihriyeta / /
analyzed: anyathā virodhaḥ katham parihriyeta
translated: Otherwise, how can the contradiction be avoided?

original: bhavatv aparaḥ svabhāva iti cet /
analyzed: bhavatu aparaḥ svabhāvaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is accepted that there is another nature,

original: yaś cāparaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa kathaṃ tasya / /
analyzed: yaḥ ca aparaḥ svabhāvaḥ sa katham tasya
translated: how can that other nature be of that [previous nature]?

original: na hy anyo 'nyasya svabhāvo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na hi anyaḥ nyasya svabhāvaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: For it is not logical for one thing to be the nature of another,

original: atiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: because of the absurdity [of the consequence].

original: yo 'paraḥ svabhāvaḥ sa kim iti tasya na bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ paraḥ svabhāvaḥ sa kim iti tasya na bhavati
translated: Why is that other nature not of that [previous nature]?

original: ity ata āha svabhāvabheda ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha svabhāva bhedaḥ ityādi
translated: Therefore, he says the difference in nature, etc.

original: bhavatu vastvantaram eva tadaparasvabhāvatayā ko doṣaḥ /
analyzed: bhavatu vastu antaram eva tad apara svabhāva tayā kaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: Let it be that it is a different thing, what is the fault in its being of a different nature?

original: ity ata āha tathāca vastvantaratve sati vināśahetor upajāyamānasya svabhāvasya
analyzed: iti atas āha tathā ca vastu antara tve sati vināśa hetoḥ upajāyamānasya svabhāvasya
translated: To this he says: And thus, if it is a different thing, the nature that arises from the cause of destruction

original: pūrvako bhāvaḥ svahetubhyo yaḥ sthitidharmā S / / jātaḥ so 'cyutidharme sthito
analyzed: pūrvakaḥ bhāvaḥ sva hetubhyaḥ yaḥ sthiti dharmā jātaḥ saḥ cyuti dharme sthitaḥ
translated: The previous entity, which is produced from its own causes with the nature of remaining, remains with the nature of not falling away.

original: nivṛttibhāṅ na bhavati /
analyzed: nivṛtti bhāj na bhavati
translated: It does not become subject to cessation.

original: vināśahetor vastvantarotpattau vyāpṛtatvād iti na tasya sthitidharmaṇo 'nyathābhāvo nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: vināśa hetoḥ vastu antara utpattau vyāpṛta tvāt iti na tasya sthiti dharmaṇaḥ nyathābhāvaḥ nivṛttiḥ
translated: Because the cause of destruction is occupied in producing a different thing, there is no change or cessation of that which has the nature of remaining.

original: na hi mudgarāder vastvantarasya bhāve 'parasya nivṛttir yuktā /
analyzed: na hi mudgara ādeḥ vastu antarasya bhāve parasya nivṛttiḥ yuktā
translated: For when another thing like a hammer exists, it is not proper for another to cease.

original: atiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the great absurdity.

original: tadupamarddena tadutpattau ca prāg eva proktam /
analyzed: tad upamarddena tad utpattau ca prāk eva proktam
translated: And it has been said before that it arises by suppressing that.

original: p / / nanu ca dṛśyata eva kaṭhinādirūpasya tāmrāder agnyāder vināśahetor dravādisvabhāvāntarotpattiḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca dṛśyate eva kaṭhina ādi rūpasya tāmra ādeḥ agni ādeḥ vināśa hetoḥ drava ādi svabhāva antara utpattiḥ
translated: But the change of nature of copper and so on, which have the form of hardness and so on, is seen to arise from the cause of destruction like fire and so on.

original: na ca pūrvakasya pracyutidharmatā ity ata āha etena anantaroktena kaṭhinādīnām
analyzed: na ca pūrvakasya pracyuti dharma tā iti atas āha etena anantara uktena kaṭhina ādīnām
translated: And the previous one does not have the nature of falling away. To this he says: By this, which has just been stated, the hardness and so on of copper and so on, which have the nature of remaining, are not destroyed by the cause of destruction.

original: ādiśabdād tāmrasuvarṇādīnāmagniśītavātādibhyo dravatvakaṭhinatvādisvabhāvāntarotpattir
analyzed: ādi śabdāt drava ādīnām drava tva kaṭhina tva ādi svabhāva antara utpattiḥ
translated: By the word 'ādi' (beginning with), the production of a different nature such as fluidity, solidity, etc. from fire, cold, wind, etc. of copper, gold, etc.

original: vyavasthitarūpasya tāmrādeḥ pratyuktā pratyākhyātā /
analyzed: vyavasthita rūpasya tāmra ādeḥ pratyuktā pratyākhyātā
translated: is refuted, denied, of copper, etc. which have a fixed form.

original: tulyadūṣaṇatvāt /
analyzed: tulya dūṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Because of the same fault.

original: kathaṃ tarhi svabhāvāntarotpattiḥ pūrvasya cāpracyutidharme sthitasyābhāvo T / / yuktaḥ /
analyzed: katham tarhi svabhāva antara utpattiḥ pūrvasya ca a pracyuti dharme sthitasya abhāvaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: How then is the production of a different nature and the absence of the previous, which remains with the nature of not falling away, proper?

original: ity āha tatrāpi kaṭhinādirūpe tāmrādau pūrvakasya kaṭhinadravādirūpasya svarasanirodhitvāt vināśahetvayogena /
analyzed: iti āha tatra api kaṭhina ādi rūpe tāmra ādau pūrvakasya kaṭhina drava ādi rūpasya svarasa nirodhi tvāt vināśa hetu ayogena
translated: He says: Even there, in the copper, etc. which have the form of solidity, etc., the previous form of solidity, fluidity, etc. ceases by its own nature, due to the absence of a cause of destruction.

original: vināśe sati agnyādeḥ ādigrahaṇāj jalaniṣekaśītavātādeḥ /🔽sahakāriṇaḥ parasparopasarppaṇādyāśraya pratyayaviśeṣopajātātiśayād upādānāc ca yat tat kaṭhinādirūpaṃ tāmrādi svarasato virudhyate /
analyzed: vināśe sati agni ādeḥ ādi grahaṇāt jala niṣeka śīta vāta ādeḥ  sahakāriṇaḥ paraspara upasarppaṇa ādi āśraya pratyaya viśeṣa upajāta atiśayāt upādānāt ca yat tat kaṭhina ādi rūpam tāmra ādi svarasataḥ virudhyate
translated: When there is destruction, by the word 'ādi' (beginning with), of fire, etc., by the word 'ādi' (beginning with), of water sprinkling, cold wind, etc.🔽The copper, etc. which have the form of solidity, etc. are opposed by their own nature from the excess produced by the special conditions that arise from the mutual contact, etc. of the cooperating causes, and from the material cause.

original: tata eva upādānakāraṇād agnyādisahakārikāraṇopādānapratyayopajātaviśeṣād apara eva anya eva dravakaṭhinādisvabhāvo dravagrahaṇasyopalakṣaṇatvāt /
analyzed: tatas eva upādāna kāraṇāt agni ādi sahakāri kāraṇa upādāna pratyaya upajāta viśeṣāt aparaḥ eva anyaḥ eva drava kaṭhina ādi svabhāvaḥ drava grahaṇasya upalakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: From that very material cause, by the special arising of the cooperating cause of fire, etc. and the special conditions produced by the material cause, another, a different nature of fluidity, solidity, etc. is grasped by the word 'fluidity' as an indication.

original: S / / utpanno na tu pūrvakam eva kaṭhinadravādirūpaṃ tāmrādi vyavasthitātmakaṃ dravakaṭhinādisvabhāvena pariṇatam iti /
analyzed: utpannaḥ na tu pūrvakam eva kaṭhina drava ādi rūpam tāmra ādi vyavasthita ātmakam drava kaṭhina ādi svabhāvena pariṇatam iti
translated: It is not that the copper, etc., which previously existed with a definite nature as hard or liquid, etc., has undergone a transformation into the nature of liquid or hard, etc.

original: atra para āha kenoktaṃ yathā sthitidharmaṇaḥ sato asthitisvabhāvotpattistato vināśaḥ' iti /
analyzed: atra paraḥ āha kena uktam yathā sthiti dharmaṇaḥ sataḥ vināśa hetoḥ vināśaḥ iti
translated: Here, the opponent says: Who has said that the arising of a nature of non-existence from that which exists with the nature of persistence is destruction?

original: yena yaś ca parasmād anyathābhāvaḥ so 'paraḥ svabhāvaḥ' ityādy ucyate /
analyzed: yena yaḥ ca parasmāt anyathābhāvaḥ saḥ paraḥ svabhāvaḥ ityādi ucyate
translated: By whom and how is it said that any otherness from another is another nature?

original: kintu sa svayaṃ sthitidharmaiva svahetubhir janito nāsyāsthirasvabhāvatā vināśahetor upajāyate /
analyzed: kintu sa svayam sthiti dharmā eva sva hetubhiḥ janitaḥ na asya asthira svabhāva tā vināśa hetoḥ upajāyate
translated: But that [thing] itself, which has the nature of persistence, is produced by its own causes. Its nature of non-persistence is not produced by the cause of destruction.

original: kathaṃ jñāyate yathā svahetubhiḥ T / / svabhāvena sthitidharmaiva janitaḥ' iti / /
analyzed: katham jñāyate yathā sva hetubhiḥ svabhāvena sthiti dharmā eva janitaḥ iti
translated: How is it known that it is produced by its own causes with the nature of persistence?

original: vināśahetor agnyāder asambhave avasthānāt /
analyzed: vināśa hetoḥ agni ādeḥ asambhave avasthānāt
translated: Because it persists when the cause of destruction, such as fire, is absent.

original: yadi svabhāvenāsthitidharmā svahetor jātaḥ syāt tadā tadasambhave 'pi nāvatiṣṭheta /
analyzed: yadi svabhāvena asthiti dharmā sva hetoḥ jātaḥ syāt tadā tad asambhave na avatiṣṭheta
translated: If it were produced by its own cause with the nature of non-persistence, then it would not persist even when that [cause of destruction] is absent.

original: tasya svabhāvena sthitidharmaṇaḥ svahetubhir evāyam aparaḥ svabhāvo niyamito yaduta parasmāt virodhino 'gnyāder vināśaḥsvayaṃbhavatīti /
analyzed: tasya svabhāvena sthiti dharmaṇaḥ sva hetubhiḥ eva ayam aparaḥ svabhāvaḥ niyamitaḥ yat uta parasmāt virodhinaḥ gni ādeḥ vināśaḥ svayam bhavati iti
translated: For that which naturally has the property of enduring, this other nature is restricted by its own causes, namely, that destruction occurs from itself, from a contradictory cause such as fire.

original: parasmād iti karmaṇi lyaplope pañcamī paramapekṣya ity arthaḥ /🔽svahetubhir evāyaṃ / niyamitasvabhāvo jāto yathā tvayā virodhinam apekṣya svayaṃ nirvava
analyzed: parasmāt iti karmaṇi lyap lope pañcamī param apekṣyaḥ iti arthaḥ  sva hetubhiḥ eva ayam niyamita svabhāvaḥ jātaḥ yathā tvayā virodhinam apekṣya svayam
translated: The genitive case in from another is in the fifth case with elision of the verbal noun, meaning depending on another.

original: rttitavyam iti / tad uktam
analyzed: rttitavyam iti tat uktam
translated: This nature restricted by its own causes is produced, just as you say it must be produced by itself depending on a contradictory cause. That is stated:

original: svabhāvo 'pi sa tasyetthaṃyenāpekṣya nivarttate /
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ pi sa tasya ittham yena apekṣya nivarttate
translated: In the same way, its nature is such that it ceases depending on that.

original: virodhinaṃyathā'nyeṣāṃpravāho mudgarādikam // iti /
analyzed: virodhinam yathā anyeṣām pravāhaḥ mudgara ādikam iti
translated: Like the stream of others, a hammer and so on, is contradictory.

original: nanu yady asya vināśo virodhisannidhāne svayam eva bhavaty ahetukaḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: nanu yadi asya vināśaḥ virodhi sannidhāne svayam eva bhavati ahetukaḥ prāpnoti
translated: But if its destruction occurs by itself in the presence of a contradictory cause, it would be without a cause.

original: ahetoś ca deśakālasvabhāvaniyamo na yukta ity ata āha na ca naiva vināśo nāma vinaṃṣṭur aparaḥ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: ahetoḥ ca deśa kāla svabhāva niyamaḥ na yuktaḥ iti atas āha na ca nā eva vināśaḥ nāma vinaṃṣṭuḥ aparaḥ svabhāvaḥ
translated: And it is not proper for a cause-less thing to be restricted in terms of place, time, and nature. Therefore he says: Destruction is not a separate nature of the thing to be destroyed,

original: yato 'yaṃ doṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yatas yam doṣaḥ syāt
translated: from which this fault would arise.

original: kintu bhāvacyutir eva vināśaḥ /
analyzed: kintu bhāva cyutiḥ eva vināśaḥ
translated: But destruction is just the falling away of existence.

original: S / / tasyāś ca niḥsvabhāvatvād dhetumattā naiva yujyate /
analyzed: tasyāḥ ca niḥsvabhāva tvāt hetumat tā nā eva yujyate
translated: And because that [non-existence] is essenceless, it is not reasonable that it has a cause.

original: na hi sā tasya bhavati /
analyzed: na hi sā tasya bhavati
translated: For it does not exist for that [non-existence].

original: kevalam asau svayam eva na bhavati /
analyzed: kevalam asau svayam eva na bhavati
translated: It simply does not exist by itself.

original: tato bhavitur abhāvāt kasya hetumattopagamyate / /
analyzed: tatas bhavituḥ abhāvāt kasya hetumat tā upagamyate
translated: Therefore, since that which would exist does not exist, whose causal nature is accepted?

original: siddhāntavādy āha nedam anataroktaṃvikalpadvayam atikrāmati /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha na idam anatara uktam vikalpa dvayam atikrāmati
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: This does not go beyond the two alternatives just stated.

original: kīdṛśaṃ vikalpadvayam / /
analyzed: kīdṛśam vikalpa dvayam
translated: What are the two alternatives?

original: kiṃ nityo bhāvaḥ /' ityādi /
analyzed: kim nityaḥ bhāvaḥ ityādi
translated: Is an existent permanent? etc.

original: T / / nanu ca kālāntarasthitidharmatām upagacchato naiva nityavikalpasyāvakāśaḥ / na /
analyzed: nanu ca kāla antara sthiti dharma tām upagacchataḥ na eva nitya vikalpasya avakāśaḥ na
translated: But if one accepts the property of remaining for another time, there is no opportunity for the alternative of permanence. No.

original: tadupagame 'pi nityataivopagatā bhavati /
analyzed: tad upagame pi nityatā eva upagatā bhavati
translated: Even if one accepts that, permanence is still accepted.

original: tathā hi yady ayaṃ saṃvatsarasthitidharmā svahetubhir janitas tadā saṃvatsaraparisamāptau
analyzed: tathā hi yadi ayam saṃvatsara sthiti dharmā sva hetubhiḥ janitaḥ tadā saṃvatsara parisamāptau
translated: For example, if this [existent] is produced by its own causes with the property of remaining for a year, then at the end of the year

original: yo 'syādāv udayakāle saṃvatsarasthitidharmā svabhāvo yato 'yaṃ saṃvatsaraṃ sthitaḥ
analyzed: sya ādau udaya kāle saṃvatsara sthiti dharmā svabhāvaḥ yatas yam saṃvatsaram sthitaḥ
translated: that intrinsic nature which has the property of arising at the beginning with the property of remaining for a year, from which this [existent] remains for a year,

original: sa eva tadante 'pi /
analyzed: saḥ eva tad ante pi
translated: is precisely that at the end as well.
