translated: Now, if this non-apprehension of water itself, not being apprehended, generates the apprehension of the absence of water for someone, then for no one at all.

original: tad evāha tasya salilopalambhābhāvasya tato vā salilād anyasyānalādeḥ vijñānaṃ vā 'nyavastuni ity ata ātmano 'pariṇāmasya pṛthag avasthāpanāt /
analyzed: tat eva āha tasya salila upalambha abhāvasya tatas vā salilāt anyasya anala ādeḥ vijñānam vā iti atas pariṇāmasya pṛthak avasthāpanāt
translated: He says just that: The cognition of that absence of the apprehension of water, or of something else than that, such as fire, or of something else than the cognition, in another object, because the unchanging self is established separately.

original: tatrāpi tadaṅgīkaraṇe cātmano 'pariṇāmasya T / / tadātmakatvān na tato bhedena vyavasthāpyeta /🔽tataś ca kasyacid api S / / tasya tadanyasya vā 'pratipattāv api yady abhāvaḥ salilādeḥ pratīyate tadā svāpādyavasthāsv api salilādyabhāvaḥ
analyzed: tatra api tad aṅgīkaraṇe ca ātmanaḥ pariṇāmasya t tad ātmaka tvāt na tatas bhedena vyavasthāpyeta  tatas ca kasyacid api tasya tad anyasya vā pratipattau api yadi abhāvaḥ salila ādeḥ pratīyate tadā svāpa ādi avasthāsu api salila ādi abhāvaḥ
translated: And if that is accepted there too, then because of having the nature of that, it would not be established as different from that.

original: kiṃ na pratīyate / /
analyzed: kim na pratīyate
translated: And then, if the absence of water and so on is apprehended even when that or something else is not apprehended by anyone, then why is the absence of water and so on not apprehended even in the states of sleep and so on?

original: tadāpi tadabhāvaḥ pratīyetety etadvicāritampramāṇaviniścaye /
analyzed: tadā api tad abhāvaḥ pratīyeta iti etat vicāritam pramāṇa viniścaye
translated: Even then, the absence of that would be apprehended. This has been investigated in the Pramāṇaviniścaya.

original: tata evāvadhāraṇīyam /
analyzed: tatas eva avadhāraṇīyam
translated: It should be understood from there itself.

original: vyavadhānādigrahaṇena caitaddarśayaty anyavastuno 'pi anyatvaṃ tattulyayogyatārūpāpekṣam eva /
analyzed: vyavadhāna ādi grahaṇena ca etat darśayati anya vastunaḥ anya tvam eva
translated: And by mentioning obstruction and so on, he shows that the otherness of another object also depends on having the same capacity as that,

original: na tadanapekṣam upeyam /
analyzed: na tad anapekṣam upeyam
translated: and that it is not to be accepted without depending on that.

original: tathā cāsmad upavarṇitānupalabdhisiddhir iti /
analyzed: tathā ca asmat upavarṇita anupalabdhi siddhiḥ iti
translated: And in this way, the establishment of non-apprehension as described by us is accomplished.

original: yadā caivam uktena
analyzed: yadā ca evam uktena
translated: And thus the establishment of non-apprehension as described by us is [established].

original: prakāreṇānupalambhena salilābhāvapratītir na yujyate 'nalapratibhāsinaś ca jñānasya
analyzed: prakāreṇa anupalambhena salila abhāva pratītiḥ na yujyate nala pratibhāsinaḥ ca jñānasya
translated: And when in this way the cognition of the absence of water by non-apprehension as described [above] is not tenable, and the cognition appearing as fire

original: pratiniyatākāratā nābhyupagamyate tasmād ayam analadarśī pratipattā 'nalaṃ paśyann
analyzed: pratiniyata ākāra tā nā abhyupagamyate tasmāt ayam anala darśī pratipattā nalam paśyan
translated: is not accepted as having a specific form, therefore this cognizer who sees fire, even though seeing fire,

original: api saṅkīrṇarūpapratibhāsinā jñānena analo 'yaṃ na salilam iti nādhyavasyati anadhyavasyaṃś
analyzed: api saṅkīrṇa rūpa pratibhāsinā jñānena analaḥ yam na salilam iti na adhyavasyati an adhyavasyan
translated: does not ascertain that this is fire, not water, by a cognition in which the appearance of form is mixed. Not ascertaining [that],

original: ca salilarūpasyāpi pratibhāsanāt tadarthī na tiṣṭhet pravarteta nāpi pratiṣṭheta
analyzed: ca salila rūpasya api pratibhāsanāt tad arthī na tiṣṭhet pravarteta na api pratiṣṭheta
translated: because the form of water also appears, one who desires that [water] would not stand, would not engage, and would not rely [on that cognition].

original: salilārthī na pravarteta /
analyzed: salila arthī na pravarteta
translated: One who desires water would not engage [in approaching that place].

original: tathā hi salilaṃ nāma tad ucyate yat sarvodanyāsantāpādyapanayanakṣamaṃsakalatadanyarūpāsaṅkīrṇapratiniyatākārajñānāvabhāsi /
analyzed: tathā hi salilam nāma tat ucyate yat
translated: For this is called water which is capable of removing all burning and so on of other things, and appears in a cognition with a specific form not mixed with the form of any other thing.

original: idaṃ tv anyad eva śabalarūpaṃ kim apy avabhāsata iti /
analyzed: idam tu anyat eva śabala rūpam kim api avabhāsate iti
translated: But this appears as some kind of mixed form.

original: p / / tataśca pravṛttinivṛttiyor viruddhayor yugapad anuṣṭhātum aśakyatvāt dustaraṃvyasanaṃpratipattuḥsyāt /
analyzed: tatas ca pravṛtti nivṛttiyoḥ viruddhayoḥ yugapad anuṣṭhātum aśakya tvāt dustaram vyasanam pratipattuḥ syāt
translated: And then, because it is impossible to perform simultaneously the two contradictory actions of engaging in and desisting from [an action], the practitioner would be in a difficult and dangerous situation.

original: atra parasya S / / vacanāvakāśam āśaṅkyāha tata eva ityādi /
analyzed: atra parasya s vacana avakāśam āśaṅkya āha tatas eva ityādi
translated: Here, suspecting an opportunity for the opponent to speak, he says For that very reason and so on.

original: na mayā T / / salilopalambhanivṛttimātrāt tuccharūpāt tadabhāvagatir ucyate /
analyzed: na mayā salila upalambha nivṛtti mātrāt tuccha rūpāt tad abhāva gatiḥ ucyate
translated: I do not say that the cognition of the absence of water is from the mere cessation of the perception of water, which is a trifling matter.

original: yathoktadoṣaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: yathā ukta doṣa prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the occurrence of the aforementioned faults.🔽But from that very seeing of only one fire, there is the cognition of the absence of another water that does not appear there, or the cognition of another object.

original: kin tu yad etad ekasya kevalasyānalasya darśanaṃ tata evānyasya tatrāpratibhāsamānasya salilasyābhāvagatir bhavati vijñānaṃ vā 'nyavastuni 🔽iti vacanāt /
analyzed: kin tu yat etat ekasya kevalasya analasya darśanam tatas eva anyasya tatra apratibhāsamānasya salilasya abhāva gatiḥ bhavati vijñānam vā  iti vacanāt
translated: Because of the statement the cognition of another object.

original: siddhāntavādy āha katham ekam ityādi /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha katham ekam ityādi
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says How is one and so on.

original: kena punaḥ sāmarthyena tadekadarśanam anyābhāvaṃpratyāyayati / /
analyzed: kena punar sāmarthyena tat eka darśanam anya abhāvam pratyāyayati
translated: By what power, moreover, does that seeing of one thing make one understand the absence of another?

original: tathā hi tasmin dṛśyamāne tadevāstīty avagacchatu /
analyzed: tathā hi tasmin dṛśyamāne tat eva asti iti avagacchatu
translated: For thus, when that is being seen, let him understand that only that exists.

original: tadanyat tu nāstīti kim iti pratyetīti /
analyzed: tad anyat tu na asti iti kim iti pratyeti iti
translated: But how does he ascertain that the other does not exist?

original: tasyaiva paridṛśyamānasyānalādeḥ kevalasya salilāsaṃsṛṣṭarūpasya darśanād analajñāne pratibhāsanāt salilaṃ nāsti iti niścayaḥ sañjāyate /
analyzed: tasya eva paridṛśyamānasya anala ādeḥ kevalasya salila asaṃsṛṣṭa rūpasya darśanāt anala jñāne pratibhāsanāt salilam na asti iti niścayaḥ sañjāyate
translated: Because only the visible fire, whose form is not mixed with water, is seen, and because it appears in the cognition of fire, the ascertainment arises that water is not there.

original: tathā hi anala iva salilam api yadi tatrābhāviṣyat tadapy analavad darśane pratyabhāsiṣyata tayoḥ svajñānaṃ pratyaviśiṣṭatvād yogyatāyā
analyzed: tathā hi analaḥ iva salilam api yadi tatra abhāviṣyat tat api anala vat darśane pratyabhāsiṣyata tayoḥ sva jñānam prati a viśiṣṭa tvāt yogya tāyāḥ
translated: For if water, like fire, would have existed there, it too would have appeared in the cognition, like fire, because of the non-difference of suitability in relation to their cognition.

original: naikasya pratibhāso yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na ekasya pratibhāsaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: The appearance of one is not tenable.

original: tasmād ekapratibhāsanam anyābhāvanāntarīyakaṃ ity anyābhāve tato jñānam utpadyate anyavastuni ca vijñānaṃ nāstīti jñānaṃ janayati /
analyzed: tasmāt eka pratibhāsanam anya abhāva nāntarīyakam iti anya abhāve tatas jñānam utpadyate anya vastuni ca vijñānam na asti iti jñānam janayati
translated: Therefore, the appearance of one thing is invariably concomitant with the absence of another. Thus, the cognition of the absence of another arises from that. And the cognition of the absence of another thing generates the cognition that there is no cognition of that other thing.

original: tathā 'nyad vastu pararūpāsaṃkīrṇasvabhāvatayaiva tathocyate /
analyzed: tathā vastu para rūpa asaṃkīrṇa svabhāva tayā eva tathā ucyate
translated: Similarly, another thing is said to be like that itself by virtue of its own nature being unmixed with the form of another.

original: tadrūpatayaivaca tajjñānam anyatpratiyad evaṃ vyapadiśyate 'nyathātadayogādity anyapratipattir eva tadabhāvavikalpahetur
analyzed: tat jñānam evam vyapadiśyate anya pratipattiḥ eva tad abhāva vikalpa hetuḥ
translated: And the cognition of that is said to be of that form itself, because it is not tenable otherwise. Thus, the cognition of another is the cause of the conception of the absence of that.

original: iti siddhāntavādy āha
analyzed: iti siddhāntavādī āha
translated: Thus, the proponent of the established conclusion says:

original: idam eva ityādi /
analyzed: idam eva ityādi
translated: This very... and so on.

original: nanv asmābhir idam eva prāg abhihitaṃ tayoḥsatoḥnaikarūpaniyatāpratipattiḥ asambhavāt ity ādibhir vacanaiḥ /
analyzed: nanu asmābhiḥ idam eva prāk abhihitam tayoḥ satoḥ na eka rūpa niyata apratipattiḥ iti ādibhiḥ vacanaiḥ
translated: But this very thing has been stated by us previously, by such statements as, “The apprehension of the two as restricted to one form is not possible, because it is impossible,” etc.

original: tato yad evānyāsaṃsarggiṇaḥ kevalasya T / / pratibhāsanaṃ tad eva tadanyābhāvasyāpi /
analyzed: tatas yat eva anya a saṃsarggiṇaḥ kevalasya t pratibhāsanam tat eva tad anya abhāvasya api
translated: Therefore, that very appearance of the isolated one, which is not associated with another, is also of the absence of that other.

original: tasyaiva kevalasya tadanyābhāvātmakatvād anyasya cābhāvāṃśasya nirastatvāt /
analyzed: tasya eva kevalasya tad anya abhāva ātmaka tvāt anyasya ca abhāva aṃśasya nirasta tvāt
translated: Because that very isolated one has the nature of the absence of that other, and because the part of the absence of another has been refuted.

original: tataḥ pratyakṣāvabhāsitatvāt tadabhāvasya tadbalāt pāścātyaṃ vyavahārapravartanarūpaṃ nāstitājñānaṃ p / / vikalpakam ājāyate /
analyzed: tatas pratyakṣa avabhāsita tvāt tad abhāvasya tad balāt pāścātyam vyavahāra pravartana rūpam nāstitā jñānam vikalpakam ājāyate
translated: Therefore, because the absence is illuminated by perception, the subsequent knowledge of non-existence, which consists in the engagement in activity, arises as a determinative cognition by its power.

original: na tu tenāpratipannaṃ kiñcid avagamyate /
analyzed: na tu tena apratipannam kiñcid avagamyate
translated: But nothing that is not apprehended by that is understood.

original: yatas tadanyavastuni vijñānaṃ pratyakṣātmakam apy anavagate tadanyābhāve jñānaṃ janayat pṛthag abhāvapramāṇatayā vyavasthāpyeta /
analyzed: yatas tad anya vastuni vijñānam pratyakṣa ātmakam api anavagate tad anya abhāve jñānam janayat pṛthak abhāva pramāṇa tayā vyavasthāpyeta
translated: Because that cognition of another object, even though having the nature of perception, would be established as a separate means of knowing absence if it generated the knowledge of the absence of that other when not yet known.

original: tathā hi tadanyākāraśūnya eva tadekajñānākāraḥ saṃvedyate /
analyzed: tathā hi tad anya ākāra śūnyaḥ eva tad eka jñāna ākāraḥ saṃvedyate
translated: For in this way, the form of that other is indeed empty, and the form of the cognition of that alone is experienced.

original: tatas tatsaṃvedanam eva tadabhāvasaṃvedanam /
analyzed: tatas tad saṃvedanam eva tad abhāva saṃvedanam
translated: Therefore, the experience of that is itself the experience of the absence of that.

original: na hi vikalpajñānasyāpi tadākāraśūnyarūpasaṃvedanād anyat tadabhāvasaṃvedanaṃ nāma /
analyzed: na hi vikalpa jñānasya api tad ākāra śūnya rūpa saṃvedanāt anyat tad abhāva saṃvedanam nāma
translated: For, when a conceptual cognition is aware of a form devoid of that [blue], there is nothing else called the awareness of its absence [apart from the awareness of the form].

original: kevalam asya vikalparūpataivātiricyate /
analyzed: kevalam asya vikalpa rūpa tā eva atiricyate
translated: Only its conceptual nature is in excess.

original: tato yathā nirvikalpajñānāvasite kvacid
analyzed: tatas yathā nirvikalpa jñāna avasite kvacid
translated: Therefore, just as in something ascertained by non-conceptual cognition,

original: anale analo 'trāsti iti pāścātyo vikalpo vyavahārapravartanamātraṃ na tataḥ pṛthak pramāṇaṃ yathoktaṃ prāk /
analyzed: anale iti pāścātyaḥ vikalpaḥ vyavahāra pravartana mātram na tatas pṛthak pramāṇam yathā uktam prāk
translated: the subsequent conceptual cognition fire exists here merely initiates usage, it is not a separate means of knowledge apart from that, as stated earlier.

original: tathā nāstitājñānam api vikalpakaṃ tatphaladvāreṇa vā 'nyavastuvijñānaṃ na pratyakṣāt pṛthag abhāvākhyaṃ S / / pramāṇam iti /
analyzed: tathā nāstitā jñānam api vikalpakam tad phala dvāreṇa vā nya vastu vijñānam na pratyakṣāt pṛthak abhāva ākhyam pramāṇam iti
translated: Similarly, the cognition of non-existence is conceptual, or the cognition of another thing through its effect, it is not a separate means of knowledge called non-existence apart from perception.

original: tasmād yad evāsmābhir abhihitaṃ tadanyābhāvapratītiṃ prati /
analyzed: tasmāt yat eva asmābhiḥ abhihitam tat anya abhāva pratītim prati
translated: Therefore, what we have said is that [non-existence] is for the cognition of the absence of something else,

original: tad eva tvayā 'py abhidhīyata iti kasmāt puruṣam ivābhāti yatas tadanabhyupagamena pṛthagabhāvākhyaṃ pramāṇam abhyupagatam ity upahasati /
analyzed: tat eva tvayā pi abhidhīyate iti kasmāt puruṣam iva ābhāti yatas tad anabhyupagamena pṛthak abhāva ākhyam pramāṇam abhyupagatam iti upahasati
translated: and that is what you also say. Why then does it appear as if to a person, since a separate means of knowledge called non-existence is accepted without accepting that? He ridicules [the opponent].

original: tathā hy agaty edānīṃ tvayocyate na madhyasthatayā anyathedam eva kiṃ na pūrvam evābhihitam /
analyzed: tathā hi agatyā idānīm tvayā ucyate na madhyastha tayā anyathā idam eva kim na pūrvam eva abhihitam
translated: For now, having come, you say this, not as a neutral observer. Otherwise, why was this not stated earlier?

original: yata ālajālābhidhānena ''tmā parikleśita T / / ity upasaṃharann āha tasmāt tīrādarśineva ityādi /
analyzed: yatas āla jāla abhidhānena iti upasaṃharan āha tasmāt tīra ādarśiṇā iva ityādi
translated: For, concluding with the words the self is tormented by the net of doubts, he says Therefore, like one who sees the shore...

original: yathā kila vahanārūḍhair vaṇigbhiḥ śakunirmucyate api nāma tīraṃ drakṣyatīti /
analyzed: yathā kila vahana ārūḍhaiḥ vaṇigbhiḥ śakuniḥ mucyate api nāma tīram drakṣyati iti
translated: For, it is said, merchants on a ship release a bird, thinking Perhaps it will see the shore.

original: sa yadā sarvataḥ paryaṭaṃstīraṃ nāsādayati tadā vahanam evāgacchati tadvad etad api draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: sa yadā sarvatas paryaṭan tīram na āsādayati tadā vahanam eva āgacchati tadvat etat api draṣṭavyam
translated: When it flies around in all directions and does not find the shore, it returns to the ship. This should be seen in the same way.

original: yataś cāvaśyābhyupagamanīyo 'yaṃ pakṣas tasmān na kiñcid anayā 'vidyamānapratiṣṭhānayā🔽diśaḥ pratipattyā prayojanam /🔽tad evaṃ parasyānyabhāvatadabhāvayor liṅgaliṅgibhāvam icchataḥ sambandhābhāvādasāv🔽ayuktaḥ iti pratipādite pareṇa asati sambandhe 'nyabhāvagatyā 'pi tadabhāvagatir
analyzed: yatas ca avaśya abhyupagamanīyaḥ yam pakṣaḥ tasmāt na kiñcid anayā vidyamāna pratiṣṭhānayā  diśaḥ pratipattyā prayojanam  tat evam parasya anya bhāva tad abhāvayoḥ liṅga liṅgi bhāvam icchataḥ  ayuktaḥ iti pratipādite pareṇa asati sambandhe pi tad abhāva gatiḥ
translated: And since this position must necessarily be accepted, therefore there is no purpose in this direction of inquiry, which has no established basis.🔽And thus, for the opponent who wishes for the relation of probans and probandum between the presence of another and the absence of that [thing], because there is no relation, that [relation] is

original: na syāt iti codite na vai kutaścit sambandhād ity ādy abhihitam /
analyzed: na syāt iti ca udite na vai kutaścid sambandhāt iti ādi abhihitam
translated: improper. Having established this, when the opponent objects that if there is no relation, the cognition of the absence of that [thing] cannot occur even through the cognition of the presence of another, [the author] says It is not from any relation... and so on.

original: tataḥ anyabhāva eva tadabhāvo 'nyabhāvagatir eva ca tadabhāvagatiḥ iti prasādhayatākumārilaparikalpitaḥ
analyzed: tatas anya bhāvaḥ eva tad abhāvaḥ nyabhāva gatiḥ eva ca tad abhāva gatiḥ iti prasādhayatā a kumārila parikalpitaḥ
translated: Thus, the non-existence of one thing is itself the existence of another, and the cognition of the existence of another is itself the cognition of the non-existence of that [other thing].🔽

original: kasyacid abhāvaniścayārtham abhāvapramāṇavādaḥ prasaṅgato nirastaḥ samprati tu
analyzed: kasyacid abhāva niścaya artham abhāva pramāṇa vādaḥ prasaṅgataḥ nirastaḥ samprati tu
translated: Therefore, the non-existence of something is just the existence of something else, and the ascertainment of the non-existence of something is just the ascertainment of the existence of something else. Thus, the theory of the means of knowledge of non-existence, which was refuted incidentally for the purpose of ascertaining the non-existence of something by Akṣapāda, is now refuted again.

original: p / / vastvasaṅkarasiddhiśca tatprāmāṇyasamāśritā
analyzed: vastu asaṅkara siddhiḥ ca tad prāmāṇya samāśritā
translated: The establishment of the non-confusion of entities also depends on the validity of that [means of knowledge of non-existence].

original: ŚlV abhāva /
analyzed: ślu abhāva c
translated: [The means of knowledge of non-existence] is not a means of knowledge.

original: ity etad āhatya nirākartuṃ S / / pūrvapakṣam utthāpayann āha yady ekaparicchedād eva ityādi /
analyzed: iti etat āhatya nirākartum s pūrvapakṣam utthāpayan āha yadi eka paricchedāt eva ityādi
translated: In order to refute this completely, raising the prima facie view, he says If the exclusion of another is established from the ascertainment of one alone, etc.

original: yadi hi ekasya kevalasya paricchedād anyasya vyavacchedaḥpratiṣedhaḥ sidhyati tadā sarvasyā asyā
analyzed: yadi hi ekasya kevalasya paricchedāt anyasya vyavacchedaḥ pratiṣedhaḥ sidhyati tadā sarvasyāḥ asyāḥ
translated: For if the exclusion, i.e., negation, of another is established from the ascertainment of one alone, then the establishment of the non-existence of everything else

original: nyasyā 'viśeṣeṇaiva tatra deśe yatrāsāv ekaḥ paridṛśyate tatrābhāvasiddhir bhavet /
analyzed: nyasyā viśeṣeṇa eva tatra deśe yatra asau ekaḥ paridṛśyate tatra abhāva siddhiḥ bhavet
translated: would occur without any distinction in that place where that one is seen.

original: na tu viśeṣaparigraheṇa T / / tulyā svajñānajananaṃ prati yogyāvasthā yasya tasyaiveti /
analyzed: na tu viśeṣa parigraheṇa t tulyā sva jñāna jananam prati yogya avasthā yasya tasya eva iti
translated: But not by specifying it, i.e., by specifying the particular object, because only that which is in a state capable of producing its own cognition equally [is cognized].

original: tathā hi asau yathā tulyayogyatārūpapadārthaviviktarūpa upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi asau yathā tulya yogyatā rūpa padārtha vivikta rūpaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For it is thus that it is perceived as distinct from objects having a form capable of equal suitability.

original: tadekākārapratiniyamāt tajjñānasya /
analyzed: tad eka ākāra pratiniyamāt tad jñānasya
translated: Because the cognition is restricted to that one form.

original: tathā tadatulyayogyatārūpapadārthaviviktātmako 'pi /
analyzed: tathā tad atulya yogyatā rūpa padārtha vivikta ātmakaḥ pi
translated: And in the same way, it has a nature that is distinguished from objects that have a dissimilar capacity.

original: tataś ca tadviviktākāratayā tadanyābhāvasādhane viśeṣābhāvāt pradeśarūpajñānaṃ ghaṭābhāvam iva rasādyabhāvam api sādhayet /
analyzed: tatas ca tad vivikta ākāra tayā tad anya abhāva sādhane viśeṣa abhāvāt pradeśa rūpa jñānam ghaṭa abhāvam iva rasa ādi abhāvam api sādhayet
translated: And therefore, because there is no distinction in establishing the absence of something else through the form that is distinguished from that, the cognition in the form of a limited region would establish the absence of taste, etc., just as it does the absence of a pot.

original: na vā ghaṭābhāvam apīti /
analyzed: na vā ghaṭa abhāvam api iti
translated: Or it would not even establish the absence of a pot.

original: kiñ ca / yad etad upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasyānupalabdhir abhāvasādhanī iti viśeṣaṇam uktaṃ tac ca na vaktavyam /
analyzed: kim ca yat etat upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya anupalabdhiḥ abhāva sādhanī iti viśeṣaṇam uktam tat ca na vaktavyam
translated: Moreover, the qualification that is stated, namely, the non-apprehension of what is fit to be apprehended establishes absence, should not be stated.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: yato ye 'py anupalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptās teṣām api tatra deśe tadekākāratayā jñānasya vyavacchedo bhavaty eva /
analyzed: yatas ye pi anupalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptāḥ teṣām api tatra deśe tad eka ākāra tayā jñānasya vyavacchedaḥ bhavati eva
translated: Because even for those that are not fit to be apprehended, the cognition of that one form in that place does indeed occur as an exclusion.

original: tathā hi yathopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptās tadekākāravati jñāne na pratibhāsante tataś
analyzed: tathā hi yathā upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptāḥ tad eka ākāravati jñāne na pratibhāsante tatas
translated: For just as those that are fit to be apprehended do not appear in the cognition that has that one form, and

original: ca vyavacchidyante S / / tathā 'nupalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptā apīti kim upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasya🔽ity anena viśeṣaṇeneti /
analyzed: ca vyavacchidyante tathā nupalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptāḥ api iti kim upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya 🔽iti anena viśeṣaṇena iti
translated: therefore are excluded, in the same way, those that are not fit to be apprehended are also. So what is the use of the qualification of what is fit to be apprehended?

original: evaṃ pūrvapakṣe vyavasthite yadi tadanyavyavacchedaḥ tataḥ pṛthakkaraṇam anyatvena vyavasthāpanam abhimataṃ tadabhyupagamyata eva /
analyzed: evam pūrvapakṣe vyavasthite yadi tad anya vyavacchedaḥ tatas pṛthakkaraṇam anyatvena vyavasthāpanam abhimatam tat abhyupagamyate eva
translated: Thus, when the prima facie view is established in this way, if the exclusion of what is different from that is intended, then the establishment as different by separate treatment is indeed accepted.

original: atha taddeśakālayor abhāvaḥ /
analyzed: atha tad deśa kālayoḥ abhāvaḥ
translated: But if it is the non-existence of that in that place and time,

original: tad ayuktam /
analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: that is not correct.

original: sidhyati /
analyzed: sidhyati

original: tatas tadartham api nābhāvapramāṇakalpanā yukteti /
analyzed: tatas tad artham api na abhāva pramāṇa kalpanā yuktā iti
translated: Therefore, even for that purpose, the postulation of a means of knowing non-existence is not appropriate.

original: atha matam sarvasyāparidṛṣṭasya dṛśyamānād anyatayā vyāptiṃ naiva pratyakṣaṃ sādhayati tat kutas tṛtīyarāśyabhāvaḥ pratyakṣata eva syāt /
analyzed: atha matam sarvasya a paridṛṣṭasya dṛśyamānāt anya tayā vyāptim na eva pratyakṣam sādhayati tat kutas tṛtīya rāśi abhāvaḥ pratyakṣataḥ eva syāt
translated: But if it is thought that perception does not establish the pervasion of all that is not perceived by being other than what is being perceived, then how could the non-existence of a third category be from perception itself?

original: yato 'bhāvaprāmāṇyakalpanā vyarthā bhaved ity ata āha tasya tṛtīyarāśitayā kalpyamānasya
analyzed: yatas bhāva prāmāṇya kalpanā vyarthā bhavet iti atas āha tasya tṛtīya rāśi tayā kalpyamānasya
translated: Since the postulation of the validity of non-existence would be pointless. Therefore it is said: of that which is imagined as a third category,

original: tato dṛṣṭād anyatayā vyaptyabhāve tena pratyakṣeṇa tato 'rthāt svaviṣayasya
analyzed: tatas dṛṣṭāt anya tayā vyapti abhāve tena pratyakṣeṇa rthāt sva viṣayasya
translated: if there is no pervasion by being other than that which is seen, then by that perception, from that object,

original: avyavacchedād apṛthakkaraṇāt /
analyzed: a vyavacchedāt a pṛthakkaraṇāt
translated: because its own object is not excluded, because it is not separated.

original: tadarthasya ca rāśyantaratvena kalpyamānasya svaviṣayād avyavacchedāt apṛthakkaraṇāt punar api bhāvasya svaviṣayasyāparicchedaprasaṅgāt /🔽T / / sa hi tadviṣayaḥ sakalapararūpāsaṃkīrṇātmā yadi tenātmanā na paricchinnaḥ kathaṃ tena tasya paricchedaḥ / /
analyzed: tad arthasya ca rāśi antara tvena kalpyamānasya sva viṣayāt avyavacchedāt apṛthakkaraṇāt punar api bhāvasya sva viṣayasya apariccheda prasaṅgāt  sa hi tad viṣayaḥ sakala para rūpa asaṃkīrṇa ātmā yadi tena ātmanā na paricchinnaḥ katham tena tasya paricchedaḥ
translated: And because that which is imagined as a separate mass of that [object] is not distinguished from its own object, because it is not separated, there is again the consequence of the non-apprehension of the existent which is its own object.🔽For that [object] which has that [object] as its domain, if it is not delimited in that form, how can it be delimited by that [object]?

original: tenātmanā paricchede vā kathaṃ sarvasya tadanyatayā vyāptyasādhanam /
analyzed: tena ātmanā paricchede vā katham sarvasya tad anya tayā vyāpti asādhanam
translated: Or if it is delimited in that form, how can it be established that everything is pervaded by being other than that?

original: anyathāikasyāpi tadanyatvaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: anyathā ekasya api tad anya tvam na syāt
translated: Otherwise, even one would not be other than that.

original: nimittasya samānatvād iti /
analyzed: nimittasya samāna tvāt iti
translated: Because the reason is the same.

original: yata evaṃ tasmāt kvacid vastuni pramāṇaṃ p / / pratyakṣādikaṃ S / / pravṛttaṃ tadvastu
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt kvacid vastuni pramāṇam pratyakṣa ādikam pravṛttam tat vastu
translated: Since it is so, therefore, in some object, the means of knowledge such as perception, etc., which is engaged,

original: pratiniyatenātmanā paricchinatti /
analyzed: pratiniyatena ātmanā paricchinatti
translated: delimits that object with a particular nature.

original: tato 'nyat tadrūpavikalaṃ vyavacchinatti /
analyzed: tatas tad rūpa vikalam vyavacchinatti
translated: It distinguishes what is different from that as lacking that form.

original: tadanyatvena vyavasthāpanāt /
analyzed: tad anya tvena vyavasthāpanāt
translated: Because it is established as being other than that.

original: tṛtīyasya ca tattvānyatvabahirbhūtasya prakārasyābhāvaṃ sūcayati /
analyzed: tṛtīyasya ca tattva anyatva bahis bhūtasya prakārasya abhāvam sūcayati
translated: And it indicates the absence of a third kind which is external to being that or other.

original: sarvasyānyatayā vyāptisādhanāt /
analyzed: sarvasya anya tayā vyāpti sādhanāt
translated: Because it establishes that everything is pervaded by being other than that.

original: tadviruddhasyavā sarvavastuno dvaividhyasya sādhanād iti /
analyzed: sarva vastunaḥ dvaividhyasya sādhanāt iti
translated: Or, because of the establishment of the duality of all things which is contrary to that.🔽Thus, this activity of a single means of knowledge, as just described, is summarized and

original: evam ekasya pramāṇasya vyāpāra eṣo 'nantarokta iti tam evopasaṃhṛtya sukhapratipattaye
analyzed: evam ekasya pramāṇasya vyāpāraḥ eṣaḥ nantara uktaḥ iti tam eva upasaṃhṛtya sukha pratipattaye
translated: displayed for easy understanding.

original: darśayannāha tathāhi kvacid vastuni pramāṇaṃ pratyakṣādi pravṛttaṃ tad eva vastu
analyzed: darśayan āha tathā hi kvacid vastuni pramāṇam pratyakṣa ādi pravṛttam tat eva vastu
translated: Thus, when a means of knowledge such as perception operates on a certain object, it distinguishes that very object

original: tadanyasmāt pararūpād vyavacchinatti tataḥ pṛthakkaroti tadasaṃkīrṇarūpatayā pratipadyate /
analyzed: tat anyasmāt para rūpāt vyavacchinatti tatas pṛthakkaroti tat asaṃkīrṇa rūpa tayā pratipadyate
translated: from other forms, separates it, and cognizes it as a form free from admixture.

original: paramārthatas tasya tadrūpatvāt yathāvastu ca pratyakṣeṇa rūpānukārāt /
analyzed: paramārthataḥ tasya tad rūpa tvāt yathāvastu ca pratyakṣeṇa rūpa anukārāt
translated: Because in reality it has that form, and because perception conforms to the form of the object as it is.

original: kim iti pararūpād vyavacchinatti / /
analyzed: kim iti para rūpāt vyavacchinatti
translated: Why does it distinguish it from other forms?

original: tasyaiva pararūpavikalasyaikarūpasya paricchedāt /
analyzed: tasya eva para rūpa vikalasya eka rūpasya paricchedāt
translated: Because it determines that very form which is devoid of other forms.

original: tathā tad anyad eva ca tasmād dṛśyamānād anyad eva ca vyavacchinatti /
analyzed: tathā tat anyat eva ca tasmāt dṛśyamānāt anyat eva ca vyavacchinatti
translated: Similarly, it distinguishes that which is different from that, which is seen, from that which is different.

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

original: tasmāt T / / svaviṣayāt /
analyzed: tasmāt t sva viṣayāt
translated: Because of that, from its own object.

original: na kevalaṃ svaviṣayaṃ parato vyavacchinatti /
analyzed: na kevalam sva viṣayam paratas vyavacchinatti
translated: It does not only distinguish its own object from others.

original: param api svaviṣayād iti /
analyzed: param api sva viṣayāt iti
translated: It also distinguishes the other from its own object.

original: kuta etad / /
analyzed: kutas etat
translated: How is that known?

original: anyasya pararūpasya tatra svālambane 'paricchedād avaśyam evāparicchinnasya S / / paricchinnād anyatvaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: anyasya para rūpasya tatra sva ālambane paricchedāt avaśyam eva aparicchinnasya paricchinnāt anya tvam bhavati
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of another form there, in that object, the non-apprehended form must necessarily be different from the apprehended form.

original: yata evam ataḥ tad eva pramāṇam ekavastuparicchedakaṃ prakārāntarābhāvaṃ sādhayati /
analyzed: yatas evam atas tat eva pramāṇam eka vastu paricchedakam prakāra antara abhāvam sādhayati
translated: Since this is so, therefore that very means of knowledge, which apprehends one thing, establishes the absence of another mode.

original: nābhāvākhyam /
analyzed: na abhāva ākhyam
translated: Not by the means of knowledge called non-existence.

original: kuta etat / /
analyzed: kutas etat
translated: How is this known?

original: tasmiṃ dṛśyamāne🔽vastuni dṛṣṭatadanyatvena tasyānyasya tatrāparicchidyamānasyānyatvaṃ tadanyatvaṃ dṛṣṭāt tadanyatvaṃ dṛṣṭatadanyatvaṃ tena sarvasya tadvyatiriktasya
analyzed: tasmin dṛśyamāne  vastuni dṛṣṭa tad anya tvena tasya anyasya tatra aparicchidyamānasya anya tvam tad anya tvam dṛṣṭāt tad anya tvam dṛṣṭa tad anya tvam tena sarvasya tad vyatiriktasya
translated: When that is seen,

original: vyavasthāpanān na apanena a
analyzed: vyavasthāpanāt na apanena a
translated: in that visible thing, by seeing its difference from that, the difference of that other thing which is not being apprehended there, that difference from that is difference from that, difference from what is seen. By that, because of the establishment of everything different from it, it is not denied.

original: tad anyasyaiva ca yad anyan na bhavati puro 'vasthitaṃ sakalaparabhāvavyāvṛttaṃ tasyaiva tattvena dṛśyamānaprakāratayā vyavasthāpanād iti /
analyzed: tat anyasya eva ca yat anyat na bhavati puras vasthitam sakala para bhāva vyāvṛttam tasya eva tattvena dṛśyamāna prakāra tayā vyavasthāpanāt iti
translated: And because of the establishment of that very thing which is not different from that, which is present in front, excluded from all other existence, by the mode of being seen as that,

original: amum eva nyāyam anyatrāpy atidiśann āha etena kramākramādayaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: amum eva nyāyam anyatra api atidiśan āha etena kramākrama ādayaḥ ityādi
translated: Directing this very principle elsewhere also, he says By this, sequence, non-sequence, etc. and so on.

original: etena anantaroktena nyāyena pratiniyataikapadārtharūpānukāriṇī buddhir upajāyamānā
analyzed: etena anantara uktena nyāyena pratiniyata eka padārtha rūpa anukāriṇī buddhiḥ upajāyamānā
translated: By this method just explained, the cognition that arises, conforming to a particular object,

original: tadviparītarūpaṃ sarvaṃ svaviṣayād vyavacchindatī dvairāśyaṃ tṛtīyaprakārābhāvaṃ
analyzed: tad viparīta rūpam sarvam sva viṣayāt vyavacchindatī dvairāśyam tṛtīya prakāra abhāvam
translated: determining everything of a contrary nature as distinct from its own object, establishes the duality and the absence of a third category.

original: ca sādhayatītiye kecid anyonyavyavacchedarūpāḥ kramākramanityānityādayaḥ te vyākhyātāḥ /
analyzed: ca kecid anyonya vyavaccheda rūpāḥ kramākrama nitya anitya ādayaḥ te vyākhyātāḥ
translated: Some say that mutually exclusive forms such as sequential and non-sequential, eternal and non-eternal, etc. are explained by this.

original: p / / tathā hi kāryasya kramamananyasahāyatāṃ pratiyaty eva buddhis tasyākramaṃ kāryāntarasāhityaṃ T / / tataḥ pṛthakkaroti /
analyzed: tathā hi kāryasya kramam ananya sahāya tām pratiyatī eva buddhiḥ tasya akramam kārya antara sāhityam t tatas pṛthakkaroti
translated: For instance, the cognition, perceiving the sequential nature of an effect as not aided by anything else, distinguishes it from the non-sequential nature, aided by another effect.

original: tataḥ kramākramatayā dvaitasiddheḥ tṛtīyasya prakārasya sambhavo nirasto bhavati /
analyzed: tatas kramākrama tayā dvaita siddheḥ tṛtīyasya prakārasya sambhavaḥ nirastaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, since duality is established by sequential and non-sequential natures, the possibility of a third category is refuted.

original: kramabhāvavyatirekiṇaḥ sarvasya kāryajanmanaḥ tadanyatayā dvitīyaprakāratayā 'vasthānāt /
analyzed: krama bhāva vyatirekiṇaḥ sarvasya kārya janmanaḥ tad anya tayā dvitīya prakāra tayā avasthānāt
translated: Because all the arising of effects, except for sequential existence, remains as a second category, other than that.

original: evam udayānantaradhvaṃsitā S / / kṣaṇikatocyata iti pratīyatī vyavasthāpanākāla
analyzed: evam udaya anantara dhvaṃsi tā kṣaṇika tā ucyate iti
translated: Thus, it is understood that the destruction immediately after arising is called momentariness. The cognition that establishes this

original: eva buddhis tadviparītarūpatāyāḥ svaviṣayād apākaraṇāt tato 'nyatvena prakārāntare
analyzed: eva buddhiḥ tad viparīta rūpa tāyāḥ sva viṣayāt apākaraṇāt tatas nyatvena prakāra antare
translated: Thus, the cognition is the exclusion of that which is contrary to its form, because it sets aside its own object as being different from that, as being a different mode.

original: 'vasthāpanād rāśyantarābhāvaiti /🔽tad evam ekapramāṇanibandhanām asāṅkaryasiddhiṃ pratipādyopasaṃharayann āha tad
analyzed: vasthāpanāt  tat evam eka pramāṇa nibandhanām asāṅkarya siddhim pratipādya upasaṃharayan āha tat
translated: It is the absence of another class.🔽Having thus shown the establishment of non-mixture to be based on a single means of knowledge, he concludes by saying that.

original: evam uktena nyāyena ekasya pratiniyatātmana upalambhāt tasyopalabhyamānasya yas tato🔽'nyas tattulyayogyatārūpas tadviparīto vā tadrūpavikalas tadātmano vyavacchedaḥ pṛthakkaraṇaṃ
analyzed: evam uktena nyāyena ekasya pratiniyata ātmanaḥ upalambhāt tasya upalabhyamānasya yaḥ  tad tulya yogyatā rūpaḥ tad viparītaḥ vā tad rūpa vikalaḥ tad ātmanaḥ vyavacchedaḥ pṛthakkaraṇam
translated: Thus, by the method stated, because of the apprehension of a single, restricted self, of that which is being apprehended, that exclusion, the separation, of that from what is other than it,

original: tasyopalabhyamānasyānupalabhyamānasvabhāvād rūpāntareṇa pratibhāsanāt /
analyzed: tasya upalabhyamānasya an upalabhyamāna svabhāvāt rūpa antareṇa pratibhāsanāt
translated: which is of a similar capacity, which is contrary to it, or which is deficient in that form, is due to the appearance of that which is being apprehended in a form other than its own nature, which is not being apprehended.

original: tathā tasya svaviṣayasya tadanyātmatāyā bhāvapradhānatvān nirdeśasya vyavacchedo bhavati asāṅkaryaṃ sidhyati /
analyzed: tathā tasya sva viṣayasya tad anya ātmatāyāḥ bhāva pradhāna tvāt nirdeśasya vyavacchedaḥ bhavati asāṅkaryam sidhyati
translated: Thus, there is the exclusion, the establishment of non-mixture, of that own object, of the state of being other than that, because of the predominance of the abstract noun in the expression.

original: tad yady etad aviśeṣaṇānyasya sarvasya tatrābhāvasiddhiḥ syād ity atrābhimataṃ tadā siddhasādhanam /
analyzed: tat yadi etat aviśeṣaṇa anyasya sarvasya tatra abhāva siddhiḥ syāt iti atra abhimatam tadā siddha sādhanam
translated: If it is intended here that the establishment of the absence of everything else there would be without qualification, then the proof is superfluous.

original: yataḥ sarvam aviśeṣeṇaiva tad ekākārayā budhyā tadrūpavikalaṃ svaviṣayād avacchidyate /
analyzed: yatas sarvam aviśeṣeṇa eva tat eka ākārayā budhyā tad rūpa vikalam sva viṣayāt avacchidyate
translated: Because everything, without distinction, is excluded from its own object by that cognition of a single form, which is devoid of that form.

original: sarvasyānyarūpasya tatrāpratibhāsanāt /
analyzed: sarvasya anya rūpasya tatra apratibhāsanāt
translated: Because all other forms do not appear there.

original: atha taddeśakālayor abhāvaḥ sarvasya T / /S / / tadviparītarūpasya vyavacchedo🔽'bhimataḥ sa na yukta iti darśayati na taddeśakālayoḥ yatrāsau pratiniyatātmā🔽sakalatrailokyavilakṣaṇaḥ padārtha upalabhyate tatra sarvasyānyasya bhāvasya tattulyayogyatārūpasyetarasya
analyzed: atha tad deśa kālayoḥ abhāvaḥ sarvasya t tad viparīta rūpasya  bhimataḥ sa na yuktaḥ iti darśayati na tad deśa kālayoḥ yatra asau pratiniyata ātmā  sakala trailokya vilakṣaṇaḥ padārthaḥ upalabhyate tatra sarvasya anyasya bhāvasya tad tulya yogyatā rūpasya itarasya
translated: If the absence of everything in that place and time is intended to be the exclusion of that which is contrary to it,🔽he shows that that is not proper: The exclusion of everything else there, which is similar in fitness, or different, is not possible, because of the impossibility of the cognition restricted to that single form, when that cause is present.

original: vā vyavacchedaḥ pratiṣedhaḥ /
analyzed: vā vyavacchedaḥ pratiṣedhaḥ
translated: The exclusion, the negation, of everything else there, which is similar in fitness, or different, is not possible, because of the impossibility of the cognition restricted to that single form, when that cause is present.

original: yena hi kāraṇena tattulyayogyatārūpasya tatrāpratibhāsamānasya pratiṣedhas tasmin
analyzed: yena hi kāraṇena tad tulya yogya tā rūpasya tatra apratibhāsamānasya pratiṣedhaḥ tasmin
translated: That cause is the non-apprehension of that which is similar in fitness, which is the basis of the indication of its negation, because of the impossibility of the cognition restricted to that single form when that is present.

original: sati tad ekarūpaniyatāyāḥ pratipatter asaṃbhavāt tadabhāvanāntarīyikā bhavantī
analyzed: sati tat eka rūpa niyatāyāḥ pratipatteḥ asaṃbhavāt sā bhavantī
translated: Being invariably concomitant with its absence,

original: tatpratiṣedhaṃgamayatīti tatkāraṇam anupalabdhilakṣaṇaprāpte tadatulyayogyatārūpe
analyzed: tad kāraṇam anupalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpte tad atulya yogya tā rūpe
translated: it conveys the negation of that. That which is similar in fitness is not apprehended there by that cause.

original: ca na sambhavatīti kathaṃ tadabhāvaḥ sidhyet /
analyzed: ca na sambhavati iti katham tad abhāvaḥ sidhyet
translated: and that is not possible, how can its non-existence be established?

original: p / / etad evopasaṃharann āha tasmād atadātmā ca sarvas tadviparītarūpas🔽tadekākārayā buddhyā prasādhitaḥ syāt taddeśakālaśca tasya pratibhāsamānasya yau
analyzed: etat eva upasaṃharan āha tasmāt a tad ātmā ca sarvaḥ tad viparīta rūpaḥ  tad eka ākārayā buddhyā prasādhitaḥ syāt tad deśa kālaḥ ca tasya pratibhāsamānasya yau
translated: Concluding this very point, he says: Therefore, everything that is not of that nature, having a form contrary to that,🔽would be established by a cognition having that single form, and would have that place and time.

original: deśakālau tau yasya / sa ca syāt /
analyzed: deśa kālau tau yasya sa ca syāt
translated: Those two, place and time, which are of that which appears, belong to it.

original: kiṃvat / /
analyzed: kiṃvat
translated: What is it like?

original: rasarūpādivad iti /
analyzed: rasa rūpa ādi vat iti
translated: Like taste, form, etc.

original: na hi rūpapratibhāsinā jñānena tadrūpavikalasya rasasya svaviṣayāt pṛthakkaraṇe 'pi tad asāṃkaryasādhane 'pi taddeśakālayor abhāvaḥ S / / 🔽sidhyati /
analyzed: na hi rūpa pratibhāsinā jñānena tad rūpa vikalasya rasasya sva viṣayāt pṛthakkaraṇe tat asāṃkarya sādhane tad deśa kālayoḥ abhāvaḥ  sidhyati
translated: For when a cognition appearing as form separates taste, which is devoid of that form, from its own object, and even establishes it as unmixed, its non-existence in that place and time is not established.

original: tataś ca kathaṃ sarvasyātulyayogyāvasthasyāpi tatrābhāvaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tatas ca katham sarvasya atulya yogya avasthasya api tatra abhāvaḥ syāt
translated: How then could there be non-existence of everything, even of that which is of a different state and capacity, in that [cognition]?

original: upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasyeti viśeṣaṇaṃ vā nocyeta /
analyzed: upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya iti viśeṣaṇam vā na ucyeta
translated: Or the qualification of that which is perceptible would not be stated.

original: yata evaṃ tasmāt kvacit kadācit kasyacid abhāvasiddhir yathoktād evānupalambhād upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptasya T / / tattulyayogyatārūpopalambhātmanaś
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt kvacid kadācid kasyacid abhāva siddhiḥ yathā uktāt eva anupalambhāt upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptasya t tad tulya yogyatā rūpa upalambha ātmanaḥ
translated: Since it is so, therefore, the establishment of non-existence of something somewhere sometimes is only from non-apprehension as stated, of that which is perceptible, of that which is of the nature of apprehension having a form of equal capacity,

original: cety evaṃrūpāt /
analyzed: ca iti evaṃrūpāt
translated: and of that [object].

original: na tu sāmānyena yathā ''huḥpare
analyzed: na tu sāmānyena yathā huḥ pare
translated: But not in general, as others say.

original: pramāṇapañcakaṃyatra vasturūpe na jāyate /
translated: Where the form of an object is not produced by the five means of valid knowledge,

original: vastusattāvabodhārthe tatrābhāvapramāṇatā//
analyzed: vastu sattā avabodha arthe tatra abhāva pramāṇa tā
translated: for the purpose of knowing the existence of an object, there is the means of valid knowledge of non-existence.

original: ŚlV abhāva / TS / iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: [This is] the definition of non-existence.

original: na hy anupalabdhilakṣaṇaprāpte pramāṇapañcakāpravṛttāv api tadabhāvaḥ sidhyati /
analyzed: na hi anupalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpte pramāṇa pañcaka apravṛttau api tad abhāvaḥ sidhyati
translated: For even when the five means of valid knowledge do not operate with regard to what is perceptible, the non-existence of that is not established.

original: saty api tasmin svabhāvādiviprakarṣeṇa pramāṇapañcakāpravṛttisambhavād iti /
analyzed: sati api tasmin svabhāva ādi viprakarṣeṇa pramāṇa pañcaka apravṛtti sambhavāt iti
translated: Even when that [perceptibility] exists, the non-operation of the five means of valid knowledge is possible due to remoteness in nature, etc.

original: tad evaṃ prāsaṅgikaṃ parisamāpayya yad uktaṃpareṇa sa evānyabhāvas tadviṣayā copalabdhiḥ
analyzed: tat evam prāsaṅgikam parisamāpayya yat uktam pareṇa saḥ eva anya bhāvaḥ tad viṣayā ca upalabdhiḥ
translated: Having thus concluded the incidental [discussion], regarding what was said by the opponent - that very other existence and the perception having that as its object

original: tadabhāvasya kiṃ na sādhanamiti tatrānyabhāvasya tadabhāvaṃ prati liṅgatve
analyzed: tad abhāvasya kim na tatra anya bhāvasya tad abhāvam prati liṅga tve
translated: are not the proof of that non-existence - there, when the other existence as the mark with regard to that non-existence is refuted,

original: niraste tadviṣayāyā upalabdher nirākurvann āha anyabhāvaviṣayetyādi /
analyzed: niraste tad viṣayāyāḥ upalabdheḥ nirākurvan āha anya bhāva viṣaya ityādi
translated: refuting the perception having that as its object, he says having the other existence as its object... etc.

original: yat punar uktam anyabhāvaviṣayopalabdhis tadabhāvasya kinna sādhanamiti sā tadabhāvasya sādhikeṣṭaivāsmākam /
analyzed: yat punar uktam anya bhāva viṣaya upalabdhiḥ tad abhāvasya kin na sā tad abhāvasya sādhikā iṣṭā eva asmākam
translated: And what was said again - why is the perception having the other existence as its object not the proof of that non-existence? - that is indeed accepted by us as the proof of that non-existence.

original: S / / na tu liṅgatvena yathoktavānasi /
analyzed: na tu liṅga tvena yathā uktavān asi
translated: But not as the mark, as you have stated.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: yataḥ tatrāpy anyabhāvaviṣayāyāmupalabdhāv 'bhāvasya pṛthag anyabhāvāt sādhyatve kalpyamāne sambandhābhāvasya tadabhāvena tulyatvāt /
analyzed: yatas tatra api bhāvasya pṛthak anya bhāvāt sādhya tve kalpyamāne sambandha abhāvasya tad abhāvena tulya tvāt
translated: Because, even there, in the case of the apprehension which has the existence of something else for its object, if the non-existence is supposed to be the probandum, separate from the existence of something else, then, because the absence of relation is the same as that absence.

original: na hi tasyā api anyabhāvarūpāyāḥ tadabhāvena kaścid ekārthasamavāyādirūpaḥ sambandho 'stīti /
analyzed: na hi tasyāḥ api anya bhāva rūpāyāḥ tad abhāvena kaścid ekārtha samavāya ādi rūpaḥ sambandhaḥ sti iti
translated: For, that also, which has the form of the existence of something else, does not have any relation, such as inherence in the same object, etc., with that absence.

original: apṛthak siddher ity asyāpi tulyatāṃ darśayann āha liṅgāvirbhāvetyādi /
analyzed: apṛthak siddheḥ iti asya api tulya tām darśayan āha liṅga āvirbhāva ityādi
translated: In order to show that this also is similar to the [argument] 'because of non-establishment as separate', he says 'when the mark', etc.

original: yeyam anyabhāvaviṣayā upalabdhir lliṅgatayocyate tasyās p / / tadviviktapradeśākārāyā T / / āvirbhāvakāla eva pratītikāla
analyzed: yā iyam anya bhāva viṣayā upalabdhiḥ lliṅgatayā ucyate tasyāḥ āvirbhāva kāle eva janma kāle pratīti kāla
translated: That apprehension which is said to be the mark, having the existence of something else for its object, at the time of the manifestation of that, at the time of the appearance

original: evavā tadabhāvasiddheś ca /🔽tathā hi tatpratibhāsaviviktānyabhāvapratibhāsabuddhisaṃvedanam eva tadabhāvasaṃvedanam iti /
analyzed: tad abhāva siddheḥ ca  tathā hi tad pratibhāsa vivikta anya bhāva pratibhāsa buddhi saṃvedanam eva tad abhāva saṃvedanam iti
translated: of the form of the place devoid of that, there is the establishment of the absence of that.🔽Because, the experience of the cognition which appears as the existence of something else, separated from the appearance of that, is itself the experience of the absence of that.🔽He establishes that very [fact] by saying 'for, the cognizer, having understood the existence of that which is separated from it', etc.

original: tad eva sādhayati na hy anyasya tadviviktasya bhāvaṃ pratipadya pratipattā punar
analyzed: tat eva sādhayati na hi anyasya tad viviktasya bhāvam pratipadya pratipattā punar
translated: For, the cognizer, having understood the existence of that which is separated from it, does not again

original: uttarakālaṃ tatpratipatter anyabhāvapratipattes tadabhāvenānyavyatirekau prasādhya
analyzed: uttarakālam tad pratipatteḥ anya bhāva pratipatteḥ tad abhāvena anya vyatirekau prasādhya
translated: afterwards understand the existence of that, by establishing the positive and negative concomitance with that absence of the understanding of the existence of something else.

original: pratibindhasādhakena pramāṇena tadabhāvaṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: pratibindha sādhakena pramāṇena tad abhāvam pratipadyate
translated: One understands the non-existence of that by a valid means of knowledge that establishes the absence.

original: kiṃ tarhi / /
analyzed: kim tarhi
translated: What then?

original: tadanyaṃ tadviviktarūpaṃ pratipadyamāna eva tasya 'bhāvaṃpratipadyate /
analyzed: tad anyam tad vivikta rūpam pratipadyamānaḥ eva tasya pratiyoginaḥ
translated: One who understands only that which is distinct from that, the form devoid of that, understands the non-existence of that.

original: tasyaiva tadabhāvātmakatvāt /
analyzed: tasya eva tad abhāva ātmaka tvāt
translated: Because that itself has the nature of the non-existence of that.

original: tathā hi saghaṭapradeśāsaṃkīrṇarūpasya S / / kevalapradeśasya darśanam eva ghaṭābhāvadarśanam /
analyzed: tathā hi sa ghaṭa pradeśa asaṃkīrṇa rūpasya kevala pradeśasya darśanam eva ghaṭa abhāva darśanam
translated: For thus, the mere region devoid of the form mixed with the region with a pot is indeed the seeing of the absence of the pot.

original: na hi ghaṭo 'tra nāsti ghaṭavānayaṃ na bhavati saghaṭād anyaḥ ity arthabhedaḥ
analyzed: na hi ghaṭaḥ na asti ghaṭavān ayam na bhavati sa ghaṭāt anyaḥ iti artha bhedaḥ
translated: There is no difference in meaning in the statements The pot does not exist here and This does not have a pot or This is different from that which has a pot.

original: kaścit / tataḥ saghaṭād anyatayā kevalapradeśasya darśanam eva ghaṭābhāvadarśanam iti /
analyzed: kaścid tatas sa ghaṭāt anya tayā kevala pradeśasya darśanam eva ghaṭa abhāva darśanam iti
translated: Therefore, the mere seeing of the region devoid of a pot as different from that which has a pot is indeed the seeing of the absence of the pot.

original: ghaṭo 'tra nāstīti jñānaṃ gṛhītagrāhitayā smṛtir eveti /
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ tra na asti iti jñānam gṛhīta grāhi tayā smṛtiḥ eva iti
translated: The knowledge The pot does not exist here is mere memory because it grasps what has already been grasped.

original: kathaṃ jñāyata iti cet /🔽darśanānantaram anvayavyatirekasādhanalakṣaṇena vyavadhānena vinā idam ghaṭaviviktaṃ
analyzed: katham jñāyate iti ced  darśana anantaram anvaya vyatireka sādhana lakṣaṇena vyavadhānena vinā idam ghaṭa viviktam
translated: If it is asked how this is known,

original: pradeśavastv asti idaṃ tu ghaṭavastu nāsti iti pāścātyena vikalpadvayena vyavasthāpanāt /
analyzed: pradeśa vastu asti idam tu ghaṭa vastu na asti iti pāścātyena vikalpa dvayena
translated: it is because immediately after seeing, without the obstruction characterized by the establishment of positive and negative concomitance, the later pair of conceptual distinctions establishes: This is the existent entity of the region devoid of a pot, but this is the non-existent entity of the pot.

original: tato nānvayavyatirekānusaraṇam atrāstīti T / / /
analyzed: tatas na anvaya vyatireka anusaraṇam atra asti iti
translated: Therefore, there is no following of positive and negative concomitance here.

original: kiñ ca dṛṣṭāntarāsiddhe svātmanyabhāvaviṣayopalabdhis sādhanaṃ/
analyzed: kim ca dṛṣṭānta ra asiddhe sva ātmani abhāva viṣaya upalabdhiḥ tad abhāvasya
translated: Moreover, the perception of non-existence as the object of one's own self, which is not established by any other means, is the proof.

original: tad eva vyatirekamukhena darśayati tac ca tasya ityādi /
analyzed: tat eva vyatireka mukhena darśayati tat ca tasya ityādi
translated: He shows that very [proof] by way of the negative concomitance, beginning with and that [in the verse].

original: ihāpy asty evānvaya iti cet /
analyzed: iha api asti eva anvayaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the positive concomitance exists here [in the case of the absence of a jar],

original: āha na hy evaṃśakyam ityādi /
analyzed: āha na hi evaṃśakyam ityādi
translated: he says But it is not possible to show it in this way, etc.

original: kasmān na śakyaṃ darśayitum / /
analyzed: kasmāt na śakyam darśayitum
translated: Why is it not possible to show [the positive concomitance]?

original: tad ekopalabdheḥ tasyaikasyānanyasaṃsarggiṇo yopalabdhir viśeṣarūpā tasyāḥ kvacid apy anyatrābhāvāt /
analyzed: tat eka upalabdheḥ tasya ekasya ananya saṃsarggiṇaḥ yā upalabdhiḥ viśeṣa rūpā tasyāḥ kvacid api anyatra abhāvāt
translated: Because of the perception of that [jar] alone. The perception of that [jar] alone, which is not associated with anything else, is in the form of a particular [perception]. Because it does not exist anywhere else.

original: atha tadviviktopalabdhisāmānyaṃ hetur ucyate yatra yatra ghaṭaviviktabhūtalopalabdhis
analyzed: atha tad vivikta upalabdhi sāmānyam hetuḥ ucyate yatra yatra ghaṭa vivikta bhū tala upalabdhiḥ
translated: If the general perception of that [jar] as distinguished is stated as the reason, then wherever there is the perception of the ground distinguished from the jar,

original: tatra S / / tatra ghaṭābhāvo yathā pūrvānubhūte ghaṭavivikte pradeśa ity āha🔽sāmānyena pradarśane kriyamāṇe dṛṣṭānte 'pi pūrvānubhūtaghaṭavivikte pradeśe ghaṭābhāvasya
analyzed: tatra tatra ghaṭa abhāvaḥ yathā pūrva anubhūte ghaṭa vivikte pradeśe iti āha  sāmānyena pradarśane kriyamāṇe dṛṣṭānte pi pūrva anubhūta ghaṭa vivikte pradeśe ghaṭa abhāvasya
translated: there is the absence of the jar. As in the previously experienced place distinguished from the jar, he says:🔽When the example is shown in a general way, there is no other means of valid knowledge such as perception, etc. to establish the absence of the jar in the previously experienced place distinguished from the jar,

original: prasādhakaṃ pratyakṣādikaṃ pramāṇāntaram anyabhāvaviṣayopalabdher nāsti /
analyzed: prasādhakam pratyakṣa ādikam pramāṇa antaram anya bhāva viṣaya upalabdheḥ na asti
translated: except for the perception of the existence of something else.

original: kiṃ tu saiva tadanyabhāvopalabdhiḥ sādhyadharmasya tadabhāvalakṣaṇasya p / / sādhikā /
analyzed: kim tu sā eva tad anya bhāva upalabdhiḥ sādhya dharmasya tad abhāva lakṣaṇasya sādhikā
translated: But that very perception of the existence of something else is what proves the absence of that [object], which is the property to be established.

original: sā ca yathā sādhyadharmiṇi tadabhāvasiddhaye dṛṣṭāntam apekṣate tathā
analyzed: sā ca yathā sādhya dharmiṇi tad abhāva siddhaye dṛṣṭāntam apekṣate tathā
translated: And just as that [perception of the existence of something else] requires an example in order to establish the absence of that [object] in the subject,

original: dṛṣṭānte 'pi /
analyzed: dṛṣṭānte pi
translated: so too in the example.

original: tathā / tatrāpi tadanyatrāpītyanavasthā dṛṣṭāntānām iti /
analyzed: tathā tatra api tad anyatra api iti anavasthā dṛṣṭāntānām iti
translated: In the same way, there would be an infinite regress of examples, since it would be necessary to find another example for that [perception of the existence of something else] in the example.

original: anavasthāyāṃ cāpratipattiḥ sarvatra tadabhāvasya /
analyzed: anavasthāyām ca apratipattiḥ sarvatra tad abhāvasya
translated: And in an infinite regress, there would be no understanding of the absence of that [object] anywhere.

original: yata evaṃ tasmān na kutaścil lliṅgāt tadanyabhāvāt tadupalabdher vā tadabhāvasiddhir iti /
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt na kutaścid lliṅgāt tad anya bhāvāt tad upalabdheḥ vā tad abhāva siddhiḥ iti
translated: Since this is so, therefore the absence of that [object] is not established from any inferential mark, from the existence of something else, or from the perception of that [existence of something else].

original: yadi tadanyabhāvas tadabhāvaṃ na sādhayati /
analyzed: yadi tad anya bhāvaḥ tad abhāvam na sādhayati
translated: If the existence of something else does not establish the absence of that [object],

original: kiṃ lliṅgatayā T / / sādhayati /
analyzed: kim punar l liṅga tayā t
translated: what inferential mark does it establish as the absence of that [object]?

original: ity ata āha so 'nyabhāvaḥ pratyakṣalakṣaṇena pratyakṣasyaiva vivakṣitopalambhād anyatvenānupalambhatvāt /
analyzed: iti atas āha saḥ nyabhāvaḥ pratyakṣa lakṣaṇena pratyakṣasya eva vivakṣita upalambhāt anya tvena anupalambha tvāt
translated: For this reason, he says: That existence of something else, being established by the characteristic of perception, would establish the usage of non-existence by that [perception] which is characterized as non-existence, because it is not perceived as different from the intended perception.

original: tallakṣaṇenānupalambhena siddhaḥ sann abhāvavyavahāraṃ sādhayet /
analyzed: tad lakṣaṇena anupalambhena siddhaḥ san abhāva vyavahāram sādhayet
translated: Being established by the characteristic of non-existence, it would establish the usage of non-existence.

original: kva punar asāv abhāvavyavahāraṃ sādhayet / /
analyzed: kva punar asau abhāva vyavahāram sādhayet
translated: But where would it establish that usage of non-existence?

original: mūḍhapratipattau sādhyāyāṃ /
analyzed: mūḍha pratipattau sādhyāyām
translated: In the case of the establishment of the understanding of the ignorant.

original: yas tv amūḍho S / / viṣayapratipattau viṣayiṇaṃ smaraty eva tasyābhāvavyavahāraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ tu amūḍhaḥ viṣaya pratipattau viṣayiṇam smarati eva tasya abhāva vyavahāraḥ
translated: But one who is not deluded, who remembers the cognizer even when cognizing objects, for him the convention of non-existence

original: pratyakṣanibandhana eveti na tatrānupalabdher liṅgateti sucarccitam evānyatretīhālaṃ prasaṅgeneti /
analyzed: pratyakṣa nibandhanaḥ evā iti na tatra anupalabdheḥ liṅga tā iti su carccitam eva anyatra iti iha alam prasaṅgena iti
translated: is based on perception itself. Therefore, non-apprehension is not the inferential mark in that case. This has been well-discussed elsewhere. So let us stop digressing here.

original: pūrvakṣaṇenaivayenādhyavasīyamānaḥ
analyzed: pūrva kṣaṇena evayena adhyavasīyamānaḥ
translated: The absence of a cause, which is being ascertained by the previous moment itself,

original: anyabhāvo 'nupalambhena siddho yaḥ sa katham anupalabdhiḥ / ity āha
analyzed: anya bhāvaḥ siddhaḥ yaḥ sa katham anupalabdhiḥ iti āha
translated: how can that other existence which is established by non-apprehension be non-apprehension? He says:

original: anupalabdhiṃ tridhā vibhajya tadvivecanam /
translated: having divided non-apprehension into three, the discrimination of that.

original: tad evam anupalabdher aśeṣavipratipattinirākaraṇena svarūpam avasthāpya prabhedanirddeśārtham āha seyaṃyatoktātridhā'nupalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: tat evam anupalabdheḥ aśeṣa vipratipatti nirākaraṇena svarūpam avasthāpya prabheda nirddeśa artham āha sā iyam yatā uktā tridhā anupalabdhiḥ
translated: Thus, having established the nature of non-apprehension by removing all misconceptions, in order to explain its types, it is said: This non-apprehension is said to be threefold.

original: katham / /
analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: siddhe tatprasādhakena pramāṇena kāryakāraṇabhāve sati kāraṇasyānupalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: siddhe tad prasādhakena pramāṇena kārya kāraṇa bhāve sati kāraṇasya anupalabdhiḥ
translated: When the relation of cause and effect is established by the pramāṇa that proves it, there is non-apprehension of the cause.

original: kīdṛśasya / /
analyzed: kīdṛśasya
translated: Of what kind?

original: siddhābhāvasya /
analyzed: siddha abhāvasya
translated: Of an established absence.

original: tathā / vyāpyavyāpakabhāvasiddhau satyāṃ tatprasādhanapramāṇabalenaiva siddhābhāvasyaiva vyāpakasya nānyasya vyāpakānupalabdher evāsiddhatāprasaṅgād
analyzed: tathā vyāpya vyāpaka bhāva siddhau satyām tad prasādhana pramāṇa balena eva siddha abhāvasya eva vyāpakasya na anyasya vyāpaka anupalabdheḥ eva asiddha tā prasaṅgāt
translated: Similarly, when the relation of the pervaded and pervader is established, only the absence that is established by the power of the pramāṇa that proves it, and only the pervader, not any other, is [pervaded]. This is because the non-apprehension of the pervader would lead to the undesirable consequence of being unestablished.

original: yathoktā svabhāvānupalabdhiś ceti /
analyzed: yathā uktā svabhāva anupalabdhiḥ ca iti
translated: And the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature as stated.

original: evaṃ trividhā 'nupalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: evam trividhā nupalabdhiḥ
translated: Thus, non-apprehension is of three kinds.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ kāraṇavyāpakayor abhāvavyavahāraḥ sidhyati yatas tayoḥ siddhābhāvatocyata
analyzed: katham punar kāraṇa vyāpakayoḥ abhāva vyavahāraḥ sidhyati yatas tayoḥ siddha abhāva tā ucyata
translated: But how is the usage of absence established for the cause and the pervader, from which it is said that their absence is established?

original: T / / ity āha tatra kāraṇavyāpakayor api na kevalaṃ yasya sākṣād abhāvavyavahāraḥ sādhyate /
analyzed: t iti āha tatra kāraṇa vyāpakayoḥ api na kevalam yasya sākṣāt abhāva vyavahāraḥ sādhyate
translated: It is said: There, the usage of absence is not only directly established for the cause and the pervader.

original: svabhāvānupalabdhau svabhāvasyāsadvyavahārasya siddhir anyasya tadviviktasya bhāvasiddhir yā saivāsadvyavahārasiddhihetutvād evam ucyate /
analyzed: svabhāva anupalabdhau svabhāvasya asat vyavahārasya siddhiḥ anyasya tad viviktasya bhāva siddhiḥ yā sā eva asat vyavahāra siddhi hetu tvāt evam ucyate
translated: In the non-apprehension of the own-being, the establishment of the non-existence of the own-being, and the establishment of the existence of the other which is distinguished from it, that itself is said to be the establishment of the convention of non-existence, because it is the cause of the establishment of the convention of non-existence.

original: S / / sa kāraṇavyāpakābhāvaḥ tathāsiddho
analyzed: sa kāraṇa vyāpaka abhāvaḥ tathā asiddhaḥ
translated: The non-existence of the cause and the pervader is thus established.

original: 'nyabhāvasiddhyā pratyakṣarūpayā siddho 'bhāvavyavahāraḥ kāryavyāpyayoḥ pratiṣedhyayoḥ /
analyzed: nyabhāva siddhyā pratyakṣa rūpayā siddhaḥ bhāva vyavahāraḥ kārya vyāpyayoḥ pratiṣedhyayoḥ
translated: The convention of non-existence is established by the direct perception-like establishment of the existence of the other, of the effect and the pervaded which are to be negated.

original: yadā 'nayor virūpaviṣayatayā p / / saviśeṣāṇām upalabdhir na sidhyati tadā'bhāvam abhāvavyavahāraṃvāsādhayati /
analyzed: yadā nayoḥ virūpa viṣaya tayā sa viśeṣāṇām upalabdhiḥ na sidhyati tadā abhāvam abhāva vyavahāram vā a sādhayati
translated: When the apprehension of these with specific features is not established due to their dissimilar objects, then it establishes non-existence or the convention of non-existence.

original: samuccayārtho vāśabdaḥ /
analyzed: samuccaya arthaḥ vā śabdaḥ
translated: The word 'or' has the meaning of combination.

original: atha kiṃ svabhāvānupalabdhāv apy abhāvo liṅgatayā sādhyata ity āha svabhāvānupalabdhau tu ityādi /
analyzed: atha kim svabhāva anupalabdhau api abhāvaḥ liṅgatayā sādhyate iti āha svabhāva anupalabdhau tu ityādi
translated: Now, if in the non-apprehension of the own-being, non-existence is also established as the reason, he says: But in the non-apprehension of the own-being... and so on.

original: abhāvavyavahāra eva /
analyzed: abhāva vyavahāraḥ eva
translated: Only the convention of non-existence.

original: nābhāvo 'pi tasya pratyakṣasiddhatvāt /
analyzed: na abhāvaḥ pi tasya pratyakṣa siddha tvāt
translated: Not even non-existence, because that is established by direct perception.

original: atra parasya vacanāvakāśam āśaṅkyāha yadi tarhi kāraṇavyāpakau siddho 'sadvyavahāro yayoḥ tau santau /
analyzed: atra parasya vacana avakāśam āśaṅkya āha yadi tarhi kāraṇa vyāpakau siddhaḥ sat vyavahāraḥ yayoḥ tau santau
translated: Here, suspecting an opportunity for the opponent to speak, he says: If then the convention of non-existence is established for those two, the cause and the pervader, when they exist,

original: kena / /
analyzed: kena
translated: by what?

original: tadanyasya karaṇavyāpakaviviktasya bhāvasya siddhir yā pratyakṣātmikā tadrūpayā 'nupalabdhyā /
analyzed: tad anyasya karaṇa vyāpaka viviktasya bhāvasya siddhiḥ yā pratyakṣa ātmikā tad rūpayā nupalabdhyā
translated: The establishment of an entity that is distinct from the pervader of the instrument, which has the nature of perception, is by that kind of non-apprehension.

original: anyasya kāryasya vyāpyasya vā 'bhāvam abhāvavyavahāraṃ ca sādhayataḥ /
analyzed: anyasya kāryasya vyāpyasya vā bhāvam abhāva vyavahāram ca sādhayataḥ
translated: Which establishes the absence of another effect or pervaded entity, and the usage of non-existence.

original: sā cānyabhāvopalabdhis tayoḥ kāraṇavyāpakayor upalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptāv eva satyām
analyzed: sā ca anya bhāva upalabdhiḥ tayoḥ kāraṇa vyāpakayoḥ upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāptau eva satyām
translated: And that apprehension of another's existence establishes the usage of non-existence only when the cause and the pervader are both present and fit to be apprehended by the characteristic of apprehension,

original: asadvyavahārasya sādhikā nānyathā ity evam iṣyamāṇe T / /S / / sati kathaṃ
analyzed: asat vyavahārasya sādhikā na anyathā iti evam iṣyamāṇe t
translated: not otherwise. When this is accepted, then how is it that

original: tayoḥ kāraṇavyāpakānupalabdhyoḥ parokṣe 'rthe viṣaye prayogaḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ kāraṇa vyāpaka anupalabdhyoḥ parokṣe rthe viṣaye prayogaḥ
translated: the usage of the non-apprehension of the cause and the pervader is in regard to an object that is not directly perceived?

original: yadā kāryasvabhāvahetvor vyatirekaprayogaḥ kriyate yatra yatrāgnir nāsti tatra tatra dhūmo 'pi nāsti /
analyzed: yadā kārya svabhāva hetvoḥ vyatireka prayogaḥ kriyate yatra yatra agniḥ na asti tatra tatra na asti
translated: When the negative usage of the effect and the essential property is made, where there is no fire, there is no smoke either.

original: tathā yatra yatra vṛkṣo nāsti kṣaṇikatā vā tatra tatra śiṃśapā nāsti sattvaṃ vā ity aśeṣapadārthaparigraheṇa vyatirekaprayoge sati /
analyzed: tathā yatra yatra vṛkṣaḥ na asti kṣaṇika tā vā tatra tatra śiṃśapā na asti sattvam vā iti aśeṣa padārtha parigraheṇa vyatireka prayoge sati
translated: Similarly, where there is no tree or momentariness, there is no śiṃśapā or existence. When the negative usage is made by including all entities without exception,

original: na hi tadāgnivṛkṣavyatiriktāḥ sarve 'rthāḥ pratyakṣatākṣā
analyzed: na hi tadā agni vṛkṣa vyatiriktāḥ sarve rthāḥ pratyakṣa tā akṣā
translated: for all entities except fire and tree are not directly perceived

original: akṣaṇikatā vā /
analyzed: akṣaṇika tā vā
translated: or are not momentary.

original: tataś ca kathaṃ
analyzed: tatas ca katham
translated: And how then

original: tadviviktopalabdhilakṣaṇānupalabdhiḥpratiyogino nopalabdhilakṣaṇaprāptatā siddhā / /
analyzed: na upalabdhi lakṣaṇa prāpta tā siddhā
translated: is the non-apprehension characterized by the apprehension of its absence established for the counter-correlate?

original: tathā ca katham aśeṣopasaṃhāreṇa vyāptyā kāryasvabhāvahetvor vyatirekaḥ sidhyet / /
analyzed: tathā ca katham aśeṣa upasaṃhāreṇa vyāptyā kārya svabhāva hetvoḥ vyatirekaḥ sidhyet
translated: And how, then, would the vyatireka of the effect and nature reasons be established by pervasion with the inclusion of all cases?

original: tadasiddhau vā katham anayor ggamakatvam / /
analyzed: tad asiddhau vā katham anayoḥ ggamaka tvam
translated: Or, if that is not established, how can these two be the means of valid knowledge?

original: tasmāt kvacid adarśanamātrād eva vyatireka eṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt kvacid adarśana mātrāt eva vyatirekaḥ eṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, in some cases, vyatireka should be accepted just from mere non-apprehension,

original: kvacic ca darśanamātrād anvayaḥ /
analyzed: kvacid ca darśana mātrāt anvayaḥ
translated: and in some cases, anvaya should be accepted just from mere apprehension.

original: tathā ca pratibandhaghoṣaṇā 'narthiketi manyate paraḥ /🔽siddhāntavādy āha naiva parokṣe 'rthe kāraṇavyāpakānupalabdhyoḥ prayogo S / /a
analyzed: tathā ca pratibandha ghoṣaṇā narthikā iti manyate paraḥ  siddhāntavādī āha na eva parokṣe rthe kāraṇa vyāpaka anupalabdhyoḥ
translated: And thus, the other party thinks that proclaiming the relation is pointless.🔽The proponent of the established conclusion says: The use of the non-apprehension of the cause and the non-apprehension of the pervader is not in the case of an imperceptible object.

original: vyatirekopadarśanakāle pramāṇatayā kāraṇasya vyāpakasya vā 'nupalabdhiḥ pramāṇabhūtā naiva prayujyate /
analyzed: vyatireka upadarśana kāle pramāṇa tayā kāraṇasya vyāpakasya vā nupalabdhiḥ pramāṇa bhūtā nā eva prayujyate
translated: At the time of showing the vyatireka, the non-apprehension of the cause or the pervader as a means of valid knowledge is not used as a means of valid knowledge.

original: kasmāt / /
analyzed: kasmāt
translated: Why is that?

original: liṅgasya kāraṇavyāpakānupalabdhilakṣaṇasya tadabhāvalakṣaṇasya vā aniścayāt tadanupalabdhyoḥ sandeharūpatvāt tadabhāvasya ca T / / sandigdhatvāt
analyzed: liṅgasya kāraṇa vyāpaka anupalabdhi lakṣaṇasya tad abhāva lakṣaṇasya vā aniścayāt tad anupalabdhyoḥ sandeha rūpa tvāt tad abhāvasya ca t sandigdha tvāt
translated: Because the reason characterized by the non-apprehension of the cause or the pervader, or characterized by the absence of that, is uncertain. The non-apprehension of that has the form of doubt, and the absence of that is doubtful.

original: kathaṃ tarhi tadā 'nayoḥ prayoga iṣyate /
analyzed: katham tarhi tadā nayoḥ prayogaḥ iṣyate
translated: How then is the employment of these two [types of non-apprehension] accepted?

original: ity āha kevalam ityādi /
analyzed: iti āha kevalam ityādi
translated: To this he says merely and so on.

original: kāraṇavyāpakayor hi p / / kāryakāraṇabhāvaprasādhakena pūrvoktena pramāṇena
analyzed: kāraṇa vyāpakayoḥ hi p kārya kāraṇa bhāva prasādhakena pūrva uktena pramāṇena
translated: For when the relation of cause and effect and the relation of pervader and pervaded have been established by the previously mentioned means of valid knowledge that proves the relation of cause and effect

original: vyāpyavyāpakabhāvasādhakena ca tadutpattilakṣaṇe tādātmyalakṣaṇe ca sambandhe sādhite🔽siddhasambandhayor yady abhāvo yatra yatrābhāvaḥ syāt parasyāpi kāryasya vyāpyasya
analyzed: vyāpya vyāpaka bhāva sādhakena ca tad utpatti lakṣaṇe tādātmya lakṣaṇe ca sambandhe sādhite  siddha sambandhayoḥ yadi abhāvaḥ yatra yatra abhāvaḥ syāt parasya api kāryasya vyāpyasya
translated: and by the means of valid knowledge that proves the relation of pervader and pervaded, which has the characteristic of origination from that [pervader] and the characteristic of identity [with the pervader],

original: vā 'vaśyaṃ niyamenābhāvo 'nyathā 'hetukatvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: vā vaśyam niyamena abhāvaḥ nyathā hetuka tva prasaṅgāt
translated: if there is non-existence of the related [entities], then wherever there is non-existence, there must necessarily also be non-existence of the other effect or pervaded [entity], otherwise it would follow that [the cause or pervader] would be without a cause.

original: niḥsvabhāvatāprasaṅgāc ca /
analyzed: niḥsvabhāva tā prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And it would follow that [the effect or pervaded] would be without an intrinsic nature.

original: taddvāreṇa pratibandhaprasādhake pramāṇe smṛtiḥ kathaṃ nāma
translated: How then could there be memory of the means of valid knowledge that proves the relation through that [means of valid knowledge that proves the relation of cause and effect or pervader and pervaded]?

original: syād ity etasyārthasya darśanārtham ete kāraṇavyāpakānupalabdhī prayujyeta iti /
analyzed: syāt iti etasya arthasya darśana artham ete kāraṇa vyāpakā anupalabdhī prayujyeta iti
translated: For the purpose of showing this meaning, these non-apprehensions of cause and pervader are employed.

original: darśanādarśanabalena tu sādhane yatraivaikadarśane paro dṛṣṭo 'darśane vā na dṛṣṭaḥ tatraiva tasya bhāvo 'bhāvo vā bhavatu sarvatra tu kasmād 🔽bhavati / /
analyzed: darśana adarśana balena tu sādhane yatra eva eka darśane paraḥ dṛṣṭaḥ darśane vā na dṛṣṭaḥ tatra eva tasya bhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ vā bhavatu sarvatra tu kasmāt 🔽bhavati
translated: But when proving by the power of seeing and not seeing, let there be existence or non-existence of the other [entity] only where it is seen or not seen in one seeing or not seeing, but why is it everywhere?

original: na hy apratibaddhātmanāṃ gavāśvādīnāṃ kvacit tathābhāvadarśane 'pi sarvatra tathābhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: na hi apratibaddha ātmanām gavāśva ādīnām kvacid tathābhāva darśane sarvatra tathābhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: For cows, horses, etc., which are not related to each other, even though their existence in a certain way is seen in one place, it does not exist in that way everywhere.

original: puruṣasya tu sarvadā kvacid ekabhāvābhāvayor aparasya S / / bhāvābhāvadarśanaṃ yadṛcchāsaṃvādaḥ sambhāvyeta asati pratibandhe / tathā
analyzed: puruṣasya tu sarvadā kvacid eka bhāva abhāvayoḥ aparasya bhāva abhāva darśanam yadṛcchā saṃvādaḥ sambhāvyeta asati pratibandhe tathā
translated: But in the case of a person, the seeing of the existence and non-existence of one thing in a certain way at all times and in some places, and the non-existence of the other, could be a coincidence, if there is no relation.

original: deśādibhedādṛṛṣyante bhinnādravyeṣuśaktayaḥ/
analyzed: deśa ādi bhedāt ṛṛṣyante bhinnā dravya iṣu śaktayaḥ
translated: The potencies of different substances are observed to be different due to differences in place, etc.

original: pramāṇasiddhe saty avaśyam eva yatra yatra kāryaṃ tatra tatra kāraṇam /
analyzed: pramāṇa siddhe sati avaśyam eva yatra yatra kāryam tatra tatra kāraṇam
translated: When it is established by valid means of knowledge, then the cause must exist wherever there is the effect.

original: yatra yatra tadabhāvaḥ tatra tatra ca kāryasyāpy abhāvo 'nyathā kāraṇam antareṇa kāryasya bhāve tasyāhetutaiva syāt /
analyzed: yatra yatra tad abhāvaḥ tatra tatra ca kāryasya api abhāvaḥ nyathā kāraṇam antareṇa kāryasya bhāve tasya ahetutā eva syāt
translated: Wherever there is the absence of that, there must be the absence of the effect as well. Otherwise, if the effect existed without the cause, it would not be the cause of that.

original: tataś ca nityaṃ sattvādiprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca nityam sattva ādi prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And then there would be the undesirable consequence of its eternal existence, etc.

original: tathā yatra yatra yatsvabhāvas tatra tatra tadbhāvaḥanyathā tasya nairātmyam🔽eva syād iti vyāptyaivānvayavyatirekopadarśane pratibandhaḥ khyāpayituṃ śakyate nānyatheti
analyzed: tathā yatra yatra yad svabhāvaḥ tatra tatra tasya nairātmyam  eva syāt iti vyāptyā eva anvaya vyatireka upadarśane pratibandhaḥ khyāpayitum śakyate na anyathā iti
translated: Similarly, wherever there is a certain nature, there must be that existence. Otherwise, it would be without self-nature.

original: prāg eva vistarato vipañcitam /
analyzed: prāk eva vistarataḥ vipañcitam
translated: Thus, the relation can be shown by the pervasion itself, which demonstrates the positive and negative concomitance, and not otherwise. This has been discussed in detail earlier.

original: agnivṛkṣa
analyzed: agnivṛkṣa
translated: Fire-tree

original: tatsvabhāvaḥ T /
analyzed: tad svabhāvaḥ t
translated: That is its nature.

original: hetos trairūpyatraividhyayor hetvābhāsatvasya copasaṃhāraḥ /
translated: The summary of the three forms and three types of the reason, and of the fallacious reasons.

original: evaṃ kāraysvabhāvānupalabdhilakṣaṇe eva pakṣadharme tatsādhakapramāṇasadbhāvād anvayavyatirekasadbhāvo
analyzed: evam eva pakṣa dharme tad sādhaka pramāṇa sadbhāvāt
translated: Thus, in the case of the non-apprehension characterized by the nature and effect of the reason, which is only the property of the subject, the existence of the means of knowledge that establishes it, the existence of the positive and negative concomitance,

original: nānyatreti pratipādyopasaṃharann p / / āha iti eṣa eva S / / svabhāvakāryānupalabdhilakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: na anyatra iti pratipādya upasaṃharan āha iti eṣaḥ eva s svabhāva kārya anupalabdhi lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: is in that, not elsewhere. Having taught this, the author concludes. He says: This very [reason] characterized by the nature, effect, and non-apprehension of the reason,

original: pakṣadharmo 'nvayavyatirekavān pratibandhasadbhāvāt /
translated: is the property of the subject, has positive and negative concomitance, because of the existence of the relation.

original: yataś cānvayavyatirekavān pratibandhaprasādhakapramāṇasadbhāvād uktena nyāyena iti tasmāt tadaṃśena vyāpto 'nvayavyatirekaniścayenaiva tadaṃśavyāpter
analyzed: yatas ca anvaya vyatirekavān pratibandha prasādhaka pramāṇa sadbhāvāt uktena nyāyena iti tasmāt tad aṃśena vyāptaḥ nvaya vyatireka niścayena eva tad aṃśa vyāpteḥ
