translated: And because it has positive and negative concomitance, due to the existence of the means of knowledge that establishes the relation, by the stated method, therefore, it is pervaded by that part, because the ascertainment of the pervasion by that part is by the ascertainment of the positive and negative concomitance itself,

original: niścayād yathoktaṃ prāk /🔽T / / tataś ca tadaṃśavyāptivacanāt trilakṣaṇa eva trirūpa eva trividha eva
analyzed: niścayāt yathā uktam prāk  t tatas ca tad aṃśa vyāpti vacanāt tri lakṣaṇaḥ eva tri rūpaḥ eva trividhaḥ eva
translated: as stated earlier.🔽And from that, because of the statement of the pervasion by that part, only the reason with three characteristics, with three forms, with three types,

original: hetur ggamako nānyalakṣaṇo 'nyo vā yathoktatrairūpyasadbhāve rūpāntarasya vaiyarthyāt
analyzed: hetuḥ ggamakaḥ na anya lakṣaṇaḥ nyaḥ vā yathā ukta trairūpya sadbhāve rūpa antarasya vaiyarthyāt
translated: is the means of knowledge, not one with a different characteristic or a different [type], because if the stated three forms exist, another form is useless.

original: yathoktatrairūpyābhāve ca rūpāntarakalpanāyām apy avyabhicārābhāvenāgamakatvāt /
analyzed: yathā ukta trairūpya abhāve ca rūpa antara kalpanāyām api avyabhicāra abhāvena āgamaka tvāt
translated: And when there is no three-fold form as stated, even if another form is imagined, it cannot prove because there is no invariable concomitance.🔽He shows why only the three-fold reason with three characteristics is the probans, not one with other characteristics or a different one. He says: Because of the invariable concomitance with its own probandum.

original: kasmāt trilakṣāṇa eva trividha eva hetur ggamako nānyalakṣaṇo 'nyo veti darśayati svasādhyadharmāvyabhicārād iti trilakṣaṇasyaiva svasādhyadharmāvyabhicārāt
analyzed: kasmāt eva trividhaḥ eva hetuḥ ggamakaḥ na anya lakṣaṇaḥ nyaḥ vā iti darśayati sva sādhya dharma avyabhicārāt iti tri lakṣaṇasya eva sva sādhya dharma avyabhicārāt
translated: Only one with three characteristics has the invariable concomitance with its own probandum.

original: svasādhyadharmāvyabhicāra eva ca gamakatvam iti rūpāntarakalpanā vyarthā /
analyzed: sva sādhya dharma avyabhicāraḥ eva ca gamaka tvam iti rūpa antara kalpanā vyarthā
translated: And only the invariable concomitance with its own probandum is the proving. Therefore, imagining another form is useless.

original: pratibandhanibandhanānvayavyatirekāpagame ca rūpāntarakalpanāyām api svasādhyadharmāvyabhicārābhāvāt /
analyzed: pratibandha nibandhana anvaya vyatireka apagame ca rūpa antara kalpanāyām api sva sādhya dharma avyabhicāra abhāvāt
translated: And when the positive and negative concomitances based on the relation are absent, even if another form is imagined, there is no invariable concomitance with its own probandum.

original: tad anena tridhaiva sa ity asya trilakṣaṇa eva sa hetur avinābhāvasya svasādhyadharmāvyabhicārasya
analyzed: tat anena tridhā eva saḥ iti asya tri lakṣaṇaḥ eva sa hetuḥ avinābhāvasya sva sādhya dharma avyabhicārasya
translated: By this, he shows that the reason with three characteristics alone is the probans, because the invariable concomitance with its own probandum

original: niyamād avaśyan tayā sadbhāvāt S / / pratibandhanimittatadaṃśavyāptyanabhyupagegame
analyzed: niyamāt tayā sadbhāvāt
translated: is necessarily always present. When the relation and the pervasion of that part are not accepted,

original: ca rūpāntarakalpanāyām api hetvābhāsās tato 'pare yathoktatrilakṣaṇād apare rūpāntarayogitayā
analyzed: ca rūpa antara kalpanāyām api hetvābhāsāḥ pare yathā ukta tri lakṣaṇāt apare rūpa antara yogitayā
translated: even if another form is imagined, there are fallacious reasons other than that, which have a different form than the one with the stated three characteristics.

original: vikalpyamānā hetvābhāsā T / / avinābhāvasya svasādhyadharmāvyabhicārasya teṣv🔽abhāvād ity aparo 'rtho darśita iti /
analyzed: vikalpyamānāḥ hetvābhāsāḥ t avinābhāvasya sva sādhya dharma avyabhicārasya teṣu  abhāvāt iti aparaḥ rthaḥ darśitaḥ iti
translated: The fallacious reasons are being considered.🔽The meaning shown is that they are not reasons because of the absence of invariable concomitance, i.e., the non-deviation of their own probandum property, in them.

original: sadbhāvāt asyaiva svabhāvakāryānupalabdhilakṣaṇāśrayaṇās padatvāt T /
analyzed: sadbhāvāt asya eva svabhāva kārya anupalabdhi lakṣaṇa āśrayaṇāḥ pada tvāt
translated: Because of the existence of this, i.e., because of the reliance on the characteristics of non-apprehension of existence, nature, and effect, they are not reasons.

original: hetulakṣaṇe 'dhikarūpavādināṃ nirāsaḥ /
translated: The refutation of those who assert additional forms in the definition of the reason.

original: yaduktaṃ trilakṣaṇa eva hetur nānyalakṣaṇaḥ iti tatra pareṣāṃ vipratipattiṃ darśayann āha ṣaḍlakṣaṇo hetur ity aparenaiyāyikamīmāṃsakādayo 🔽manyante /
analyzed: yat uktam tri lakṣaṇaḥ eva hetuḥ na anya lakṣaṇaḥ iti tatra pareṣām vipratipattim darśayan āha ṣaṣ lakṣaṇaḥ hetuḥ iti apare naiyāyika mīmāṃsaka ādayaḥ  manyante
translated: What was said, that the reason has only three characteristics and not others, there, showing the disagreement of others, he says Others, such as the Naiyāyikas and Mīmāṃsakas, think that the reason has six characteristics.

original: kāni punaḥ ṣaḍrūpāṇi hetos tair iṣyaṃte /
analyzed: kāni punar ṣaṣ rūpāṇi hetoḥ taiḥ iṣyante
translated: What are the six forms of the reason that they accept?

original: ity āha trīṇi caitāni pakṣadharmānvayavyatirekākhyāni /
analyzed: iti āha trīṇi ca etāni pakṣa dharma anvaya vyatireka ākhyāni
translated: Thus he says: These three are called the property of the subject, positive concomitance, and negative concomitance.

original: tathā 'bādhitaviṣayatvaṃ caturthaṃ rūpam /
analyzed: tathā bādhita viṣaya tvam caturtham rūpam
translated: And the fourth form is having an unobstructed object.

original: abādhitaḥ pramāṇenānirākṛto viṣayaḥ sādhyadharmalakṣaṇo yasya sa tathoktaḥ tasya bhāvaḥ tattvam aparaṃ rūpam /
analyzed: abādhitaḥ pramāṇena anirākṛtaḥ viṣayaḥ sādhya dharma lakṣaṇaḥ yasya sa tathā uktaḥ tasya bhāvaḥ tattvam aparam rūpam
translated: He who has an unobstructed, i.e., uncontradicted by a valid means of knowledge, object characterized by the probandum property is said to be so. The existence of that is another form.

original: tathā vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvaṃ rūpāntaraṃ /
analyzed: tathā vivakṣita eka saṃkhya tvam rūpa antaram
translated: Similarly, the state of being intended as a single number is another form.

original: ekā saṃkhyā yasya p / / hetudravyasya tadekasaṃkhyaṃ vivakṣitam ekasaṃkhyaṃ hetudravyam āśrayatvena yasya hetusāmānyasya tadvivakṣitaikasaṃkhyaṃ
analyzed: ekā saṃkhyā yasya hetu dravyasya tat eka saṃkhyam vivakṣitam eka saṃkhyam hetu dravyam āśraya tvena yasya hetu sāmānyasya tat vivakṣita eka saṃkhyam
translated: That which has one number, i.e., one, of the causal substance is intended as having one number. That which has the causal substance having one number as its basis, of that universal cause, that is intended as having one number.

original: tadbhāvo 'paraṃ rūpam /
analyzed: tad bhāvaḥ param rūpam
translated: That state is another form.

original: yady ekasaṃkhyāvyavacchinnāyāṃ pratiheturahitāyāṃ hetuvyaktau hetutvaṃ bhavati tadā gamakatvaṃ na tu pratihetusahitāyām api🔽S / / yadi viruddhāvyabhicāryaparaṃ
analyzed: yadi eka saṃkhyā vyavacchinnāyām prati hetu rahitāyām hetu vyaktau hetu tvam bhavati tadā gamaka tvam na tu prati hetu sahitāyām api dvi saṃkhyā yuktāyām
translated: If causality exists in the individual cause which is distinguished by the number one and is devoid of counter-reason, then there is the quality of being an indicator, but not when it is accompanied by a counter-reason.

original: hetvantaraṃ nopadarśyata iti yāvat /
analyzed: hetvantaram na upadarśyate iti yāvat
translated: If another reason that is contradictory and non-deviating is not shown, that is, up to this point.

original: tathā jñānatvaṃ ca jñānaviṣayatvaṃ ca /
analyzed: tathā jñāna tvam ca jñāna viṣaya tvam ca
translated: Similarly, being a cognition and being the object of cognition.

original: na hy ajñāto hetuḥ svasattāmātreṇa gamako yuktaḥ T / / iti /
analyzed: na hi ajñātaḥ hetuḥ sva sattā mātreṇa gamakaḥ yuktaḥ iti
translated: For a reason that is not known cannot be considered to be an indicator merely by its own existence. Thus.

original: tatraiteṣu rūpāntareṣu yad etad abādhitaviṣayatvaṃ nāma tat tāvat pratibandhanibandhanānvayavyatirekātmakā 'vinābhāvasambhave sati tataḥ pṛthag 🔽anyallakṣaṇaṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: tatra eteṣu rūpa antareṣu yat etat abādhita viṣaya tvam nāma tat tāvat pratibandha nibandhana anvaya vyatireka ātmakāḥ vinābhāva sambhave sati tatas pṛthak  anyat lakṣaṇam na bhavati
translated: Among these forms, that which is called having an unobstructed object, that is, as long as invariable concomitance in the form of positive and negative concomitance based on the relation is possible, it is not a separate characteristic apart from that.

original: tadātmakaṃ tu tadvacanenaivoktam iti na vaktavyam iti /
analyzed: tad ātmakam tu tad vacanena eva uktam iti na vaktavyam iti
translated: But it has that as its nature, and is stated by the statement of that itself, so it need not be stated.

original: kasmāt pṛthag lakṣaṇaṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: kasmāt pṛthak lakṣaṇam na bhavati
translated: Why is there no separate characteristic?

original: bādhāyā avinābhāvasya ca virodhād iti /
analyzed: bādhāyāḥ avinābhāvasya ca virodhāt iti
translated: Because contradiction is impossible between non-apprehension and invariable concomitance.

original: tathā hi saty apy avinābhāve yathokte bādhāsambhavaṃ manyamānair abādhitaviṣayatvaṃ rūpāntaram ucyate /
analyzed: tathā hi sati api avinābhāve yathā ukte bādhā sambhavam manyamānaiḥ abādhita viṣaya tvam rūpa antaram ucyate
translated: For thus, even when invariable concomitance as stated exists, those who think that non-apprehension is possible say that the form of the reason is that it has an unobstructed object.

original: sā ceyaṃ tatsambhāvanā na sambhavati /
analyzed: sā ca iyam tad sambhāvanā na sambhavati
translated: And this possibility of that [non-apprehension] does not exist.

original: bādhāyā avinābhāvena virodhāt sahānavasthānalakṣaṇāt /
analyzed: bādhāyāḥ avinābhāvena virodhāt saha anavasthāna lakṣaṇāt
translated: Because contradiction is impossible between non-apprehension and invariable concomitance, which is characterized by not co-existing together.

original: tam eva virodhaṃ sādhayann āha avinābhāvo hi ityādi /🔽saty eva hi sādhyadharme bhāvo hetor avinābhāva ucyate /
analyzed: tam eva virodham sādhayan āha avinābhāvaḥ hi ityādi  sati eva hi sādhya dharme bhāvaḥ hetoḥ avinābhāvaḥ ucyate
translated: Establishing that very contradiction, he says Invariable concomitance, indeed... and so on.🔽For when the property to be proved exists, the presence of the reason is called invariable concomitance.

original: pramāṇabādhā tu tasminnasati /
analyzed: pramāṇa bādhā tu tasmin asati
translated: But when it does not exist, there is contradiction by a valid cognition.

original: yadi hi saty eva tasmiṃs tadabhāvaviṣayaṃ pramāṇaṃ pravartteta tadā 'sya bhrāntatvād apramāṇataiva syāt
analyzed: yadi hi sati eva tasmin tad abhāva viṣayam pramāṇam pravartteta tadā sya bhrānta tvāt apramāṇa tā eva syāt
translated: For if a valid cognition having the absence of that as its object would operate when that [property to be proved] exists, then it would be mistaken and would not be a valid cognition.

original: iti kuto bādhā / /
analyzed: iti kutas bādhā
translated: So how could there be contradiction?

original: tataḥ sa hetuḥ tallakṣaṇaḥ sādhyāvinābhāvī dharmiṇi syāt /
analyzed: tatas sa hetuḥ tad lakṣaṇaḥ sādhya avinābhāvī dharmiṇi syāt
translated: Therefore, that reason having that characteristic would be invariably concomitant with the property to be proved in the subject.

original: atra ca sādhyadharmaḥkathaṃna bhavet /
analyzed: atra ca sādhya dharmaḥ katham na bhavet
translated: And how could the property to be proved not exist here?

original: yato S / / bādhāvakāśaḥ syāt /
analyzed: bādhā avakāśaḥ syāt
translated: From which there could be an occasion for contradiction.

original: tasmād avinābhāvasya pramāṇabādhāyāś ca sahānavasthānam avinābhāvenopasthāpitasya
analyzed: tasmāt avinābhāvasya pramāṇa bādhāyāḥ ca saha anavasthānam avinābhāvena upasthāpitasya
translated: Therefore, invariable concomitance and the contradiction of a means of valid knowledge cannot coexist.

original: dharmiṇi sādhyadharmabhāvasya pramāṇabādhopasthāpitasya ca tadabhāvasya parasparaparihārasthitilakṣaṇatayā
analyzed: dharmiṇi sādhya dharma bhāvasya pramāṇa bādhā upasthāpitasya ca tad abhāvasya paraspara parihāra sthiti lakṣaṇa tayā
translated: The existence of the probandum property, which is established by invariable concomitance, and the non-existence of that, which is established by the contradiction of a means of valid knowledge, are mutually exclusive,

original: virodhenaikatra dharmiṇy asambhavād iti /
analyzed: virodhena ekatra dharmiṇi asambhavāt iti
translated: because of their incompatibility, they cannot exist together in one substratum.

original: tam eva virodhaṃ saṣṭīkartuṃ paropahāsavyājenāha pratyakṣānumāne hi ityādi /
analyzed: tam eva virodham saṣṭīkartum para upahāsa vyājena āha pratyakṣa anumāne hi ityādi
translated: In order to demonstrate that very incompatibility, under the pretext of ridiculing the opponent, he says For, perception and inference... and so on.

original: sādhyadharmaṃ hi bādhamāne pratyakṣānumāne /
analyzed: sādhya dharmam hi bādhamāne pratyakṣa anumāne
translated: For, when perception and inference contradict the probandum property,

original: taṃgrīvāyāṃgṛhītvā T / / dharmiṇaḥ svāśrayāt niṣkāsayataḥ/
analyzed: taṃgrīvāyām gṛhītvā t dharmiṇaḥ sva āśrayāt
translated: they seize it by the neck and expel it from the substratum, its basis.

original: tasmiṃś ca sādhyadharme saty eva tadavinābhāvitvād dhetur bhavaṃs taṃ p / /
analyzed: tasmin ca sādhya dharme sati eva tad avinābhāvi tvāt hetuḥ bhavan tam
translated: And when that probandum property exists, the reason, because of its invariable concomitance with that, being present,

original: sādhyadharmaṃ niṣkāsyamānaṃ gale gṛhītvā haṭhāt tatraiva dharmiṇyavasthāpayatīti
analyzed: sādhya dharmam niṣkāsyamānam gale gṛhītvā haṭhāt tatra eva dharmiṇī avasthāpayati iti
translated: seizes that probandum property being expelled by the neck and forcibly establishes it right there in the substratum.

original: paraṃ prakṛṣṭaṃ vata bhāvānāṃ sādhyadharmalakṣaṇānāmasvāsthyaṃ vartate /
analyzed: param prakṛṣṭam vata bhāvānām sādhya dharma lakṣaṇānām asvāsthyam vartate
translated: Oh, what an extreme instability of things characterized by the probandum property there is!

original: tathā hi yantradvayaniyantritānāṃ nirucchvāsitayā maraṇam eva prāptam iti /
analyzed: tathā hi yantra dvaya niyantritānām nirucchvāsi tayā maraṇam eva prāptam iti
translated: For, in this way, they would have died from suffocation, being restrained by two machines.

original: paro bādhā 'vinābhāvayor viṣayabhedād avirodhaṃ darśayann āha anyatra sādhyadharmiṇaṃ parihṛtya dṛṣṭāntadharmiṇi sādhyadharmeṇāvinābhāvī
analyzed: paraḥ bādhā vinābhāvayoḥ viṣaya bhedāt avirodham darśayan āha anyatra sādhya dharmiṇam parihṛtya dṛṣṭānta dharmiṇi sādhya dharmeṇa avinābhāvī  /
translated: The opponent shows that contradiction between sublation and invariable concomitance is not present, because their domains are different, by saying: The reason, which is invariably concomitant with the property to be proved, is in the example-subject, avoiding the subject of the property to be proved,

original: hetur na punaḥ sādhyadharmiṇy eva /
analyzed: hetuḥ na punar sādhya dharmiṇī eva
translated: but not in the subject of the property to be proved itself.

original: tataḥ S / / kuto bādhā 'vinābhāvayor virodho 'nyatra bādhayā sādhyadharmābhāvasādhanād anyatra ca hetunā tadbhāvasādhanāt /🔽tathā caivaṃvidhe saty api avinābhāve bādhāsambhavād abādhitaviṣayatvasya rūpāntarasya sambhava iti /
analyzed: tatas kutas bādhā vinābhāvayoḥ virodhaḥ nyatra bādhayā sādhya dharma abhāva sādhanāt anyatra ca hetunā tad bhāva sādhanāt  tathā ca evaṃvidhe sati api avinābhāve bādhā asambhavāt abādhita viṣaya tvasya rūpa antarasya sambhavaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, how can there be contradiction between sublation and invariable concomitance? Because sublation establishes the absence of the property to be proved elsewhere, and the reason establishes its presence elsewhere.🔽And in this way, even when there is such invariable concomitance, since sublation is possible, the existence of another form, having a domain that is not sublated, is possible.

original: evaṃvidhāvinābhāvopagame saty apy abādhitaviṣayatvādike rūpantare hetvābhāsās tato
analyzed: evaṃvidha avinābhāva upagame sati api abādhita viṣaya tva ādike rūpa antare hetvābhāsāḥ
translated: Even when such invariable concomitance is accepted, the fallacies of a reason, such as having a domain that is not sublated, are different from that,

original: 'pare rūpāntarasambhavina ity āpāditāṃ hetvābhāsatāṃ vivarītuṃ paropahāsapūrvakam
analyzed: pare rūpa antara sambhavinaḥ iti āpāditām hetvābhāsa tām vivarītum para upahāsa pūrvakam
translated: because another form is possible. In order to elaborate on the fallacies of a reason that have been implied, the opponent, beginning with a taunt,

original: āha tat kim ayaṃ sādhyadharmī tapasvī varākaḥ śaḍḍhṇḍha
analyzed: āha tat kim ayam sādhya dharmī tapasvī varākaḥ śaḍḍhṇḍha
translated: says: Is this poor, wretched subject of the property to be proved a fool, a blockhead,🔽a simpleton, a dunce, a dullard, a simple fellow, a dunce, a blockhead, a fool, a simpleton, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a blockhead, a

original: m udvāhya tasmin sādhyadharmasādhanaśāktivikalaṃ T / / hetuṃ pariṇāyya sādhyadharmalakṣaṇaṃ putraṃmṛgayate / /
analyzed: udvāhya tasmin sādhya dharma sādhana śākti vikalam hetum pariṇāyya sādhya dharma lakṣaṇam putram mṛgayate
translated: Having married him, he seeks a son, the property to be established, in the form of a reason, which is devoid of the power to establish the property to be established.

original: etad eva vyanakti yasya hetor ddharmiṇy asaty api sādhyadharme bhāva iṣyate /
analyzed: etat eva vyanakti yasya hetoḥ asati api sādhya dharme bhāvaḥ iṣyate
translated: He explains this very thing: Of what reason, even when the property to be established is absent in the subject, existence is accepted.

original: sādhyadharmiṇo 'nyatrāvinābhāvopagamāt /
analyzed: sādhya dharmiṇaḥ nyatra avinābhāva upagamāt
translated: Because the invariable concomitance with something other than the subject having the property to be established is accepted.

original: taṃ tathāvidhaṃ sādhyadharmiṇy upadarśya kathaṃ dharmī sādhyadharmavān ity ucyate / /
analyzed: tam tathāvidham sādhya dharmiṇi upadarśya katham dharmī sādhya dharmavān iti ucyate
translated: Having shown that of such a kind in the subject having the property to be established, how is it said that the subject has the property to be established?

original: na hy 'mbhastvasyasamudrelavaṇatvenāvinābhave 'pi tadvyatirikte 'mbhasi lavaṇatayā sādhyatveneṣṭe 'mbhastvabhāve 'pi lavaṇatvasiddhir
analyzed: na hi tad vyatirikte mbhasi lavaṇa tayā sādhya tvena iṣṭe mbhas tu abhāve pi lavaṇa tva siddhiḥ
translated: For even though saltiness is invariably concomitant with waterness in the ocean, when saltiness is desired to be established as the property to be established in water other than that, even in the absence of waterness, saltiness is not established.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: parasya vacanāvakāśam āśaṅkhyāha ata eva ityādi /
analyzed: parasya vacana avakāśam āśaṅkhya āha atas eva ityādi
translated: Fearing an opportunity for the opponent to speak, he says For this very reason and so on.

original: etad eva vivṛnoti syād etad bhavato matam /
analyzed: etat eva vivṛnoti syāt etat bhavataḥ matam
translated: He explains this very thing: This might be your opinion.

original: yata eva hetur anyathā 'pi sādhyadharmam antareṇāpi dharmiṇi bhaved ambhastvādiṣu tathādarśanāt /
analyzed: yatas eva hetuḥ anyathā sādhya dharmam antareṇa api dharmiṇi bhavet ambhaḥ tva ādiṣu tathā darśanāt
translated: Just because the reason could exist in the subject even otherwise, without the property to be established, as is seen in the case of waterness and so on.

original: sādhyadharmiparihāreṇa cāvinābhāopagamāt ata eva kāraṇāt pramāṇābhyām abādhitadharmā dharmīty ucyate /
analyzed: sādhya dharmi parihāreṇa ca avinābhā upagamāt atas eva kāraṇāt pramāṇābhyām abādhita dharmā dharmī iti ucyate
translated: And because the invariable concomitance is accepted as being separate from the subject to be proved, for this very reason it is said that the subject has a property that is not contradicted by the two means of valid knowledge.

original: yadi p / / pratyakṣānumānābhyāṃ sādhyadharmiṇi s / / hetor viṣayaḥ sādhyadharmo na bādhyate yathā 'mbhastvasya lavaṇatvam /
analyzed: yadi p pratyakṣa anumānābhyām sādhya dharmiṇi hetoḥ viṣayaḥ sādhya dharmaḥ na bādhyate yathā mbhaḥ tvasya lavaṇa tvam
translated: If the property to be proved of the reason is not contradicted in the subject to be proved by perception and inference, like the saltiness of water,

original: tadā tasya gamakatvam /
analyzed: tadā tasya gamaka tvam
translated: then it is an indicator.

original: nānyatheti /
analyzed: na anyathā iti
translated: Not otherwise.

original: tato 'nyatrāvinābhāvamātreṇa sādhyasiddher anabhyupagamāt na yathokto doṣa iti /
analyzed: tatas nyatra avinābhāva mātreṇa sādhya siddheḥ anabhyupagamāt na yathā uktaḥ doṣaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, because the establishment of the probandum is not accepted merely through invariable concomitance elsewhere, there is no fault as stated.

original: siddhāntavādy āha tat kim idānīṃ T / / yadā hetor dharmiṇy avinābhāvitānabhyupagamāt
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha tat kim idānīm yadā hetoḥ dharmiṇī avinābhāvita anabhyupagamāt
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: Then what is this? When the establishment of the probandum is not accepted due to the invariable concomitance of the reason in the subject,

original: sādhyasiddher abhāvāt tatsiddhaye rūpāntaram abādhitaviṣayatvam ucyate tadā hetor
analyzed: sādhya siddheḥ abhāvāt tad siddhaye rūpa antaram abādhita viṣaya tvam ucyate tadā hetoḥ
translated: and in order to establish that, another form called having an unobstructed object is stated, then the reason

original: na kiñcit sāmarthyam /
analyzed: na kiñcid sāmarthyam
translated: has no capacity at all.

original: kasmāt / abādhayaiva hetum antareṇāpi sādhyasiddheḥ akiñcitkara eva hetuḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt abādhayā eva hetum antareṇa api sādhya siddheḥ akiñcitkaraḥ eva hetuḥ
translated: Why? Because the probandum is established even without the reason, just by the non-contradiction, the reason is indeed useless.

original: tathā hy atra kalpanādvaiyam bādhakapramāṇavṛttau sādhyābhāvo niyato vā syād / aniyato vā / /
analyzed: tathā hi atra kalpanā dvaiyam bādhaka pramāṇa vṛttau sādhya abhāvaḥ niyataḥ vā syāt aniyataḥ vā
translated: For in this case, there are two possibilities: when a contradicting means of valid knowledge operates, the absence of the probandum would either be certain or uncertain.

original: tatra yadi pūrvo vikalpas tadā sādhyābhāvo hi bādhakapramāṇasya vṛttau niyataḥ /
analyzed: tatra yadi pūrvaḥ vikalpaḥ tadā sādhya abhāvaḥ hi bādhaka pramāṇasya vṛttau niyataḥ
translated: If the first alternative is accepted, then the absence of the probandum is invariably concomitant with the operation of the sublating means of knowledge.

original: tadaiva bhāvāt tadabhāve cābhāvād iti /
analyzed: tadā eva bhāvāt tad abhāve ca abhāvāt iti
translated: Because it exists only when that exists, and does not exist when that does not exist.

original: tasmād abādhāyāṃ bādhakapramāṇavṛttyabhāve tanniyatasya sādhyābhāvasyāpy abhāvāt sādhyasiddheḥ bhavaty eveti vyartha eva hetur iti nopanyasanīya 🔽eva /
analyzed: tasmāt abādhāyām bādhaka pramāṇa vṛtti abhāve tad niyatasya sādhya abhāvasya api abhāvāt sādhya siddheḥ bhavati eva iti vyarthaḥ eva hetuḥ iti na upanyasanīya  eva
translated: Therefore, in the absence of non-sublation, in the absence of the operation of the sublating means of knowledge, the absence of the probandum, which is invariably concomitant with that, also does not exist. Thus, since the probandum is established, the probans is indeed useless and should not be stated at all.

original: tataḥ kasyābādhitaviṣayatvaṃ rūpāntaraṇ bhavet / /
analyzed: tatas kasya abādhita viṣaya tvam bhavet
translated: Then, when would the uncontradicted object become a different form?

original: syān matam mā bhūd bādhakapramāṇavṛttyabhāve hetoḥ sāmarthyam /🔽yadā tu sādhyasya bādhakaṃ pramāṇaṃ dharmiṇi varttate tadā hetoḥ sādhyasādhane
analyzed: syāt matam mā bhūt bādhaka pramāṇa vṛtti abhāve hetoḥ sāmarthyam  yadā tu sādhyasya bādhakam pramāṇam dharmiṇi varttate tadā hetoḥ sādhya sādhane
translated: It may be argued: Let there be no efficacy of the probans in the absence of the operation of the sublating means of knowledge.

original: sāmarthyaṃ bhaviṣyatīty ata S / / āha bādhāyām api iti /
analyzed: sāmarthyam bhaviṣyati iti atas s āha bādhāyām api iti
translated: But when the sublating means of knowledge of the probandum operates on the subject, then the probans will have the efficacy to prove the probandum. Therefore, it is said: Even in the case of contradiction...

original: yadi bādhakaṃ pramāṇaṃ varttate tadā tena sādhyābhāvasya dharmiṇi sādhanāt punar
analyzed: yadi bādhakam pramāṇam varttate tadā tena sādhya abhāvasya dharmiṇi sādhanāt punar
translated: If the sublating means of knowledge operates, then it proves the absence of the probandum on the subject.

original: brahnaṇāpi tadbhāvasya karttum aśakyatvāt kim aṅga śaṣṭhena hetunetikutaḥ
analyzed: brahnaṇā api tad bhāvasya karttum aśakya tvāt kim aṅga punar śaṣṭhena
translated: Again, even by the probans, it cannot be made to exist. How much less by the sixth probans? Therefore,

original: sādhanasya hetoḥ sāmarthyam / /
analyzed: sādhanasya hetoḥ sāmarthyam
translated: The capacity of the reason, which is the proof, is this.

original: ata T / / eva hi bhavadbhir abādhitaviṣayatvaṃ rūpāntaram ucyata iti /🔽atha bādhakapramāṇavṛttau sādhyābhāvo na niyataḥ tadabhāve 'pibhāvād iti dvitīyaḥ
analyzed: atas t eva hi bhavadbhiḥ abādhita viṣaya tvam rūpa antaram ucyate iti  atha bādhaka pramāṇa vṛttau sādhya abhāvaḥ na niyataḥ tad abhāve iti dvitīyaḥ
translated: Therefore, this very thing is said by you to be a different form, non-contradiction.

original: pakṣa iṣyate tad apy abādhāyāḥ sāmarthyaviraha iti darśayann āha aniyame bādhakapramāṇavṛttau
analyzed: pakṣaḥ iṣyate tat api abādhāyāḥ sāmarthya virahe iti darśayan āha aniyame bādhaka pramāṇa vṛttau
translated: If, on the other hand, the second alternative is accepted, that the absence of the probandum is not certain when there is the occurrence of a contradicting proof, because it exists even in its absence, then that also shows the absence of the capacity of non-contradiction.

original: sādhyābhāvasyeṣyamāṇe satīdam āpatitam /
analyzed: sādhya abhāvasya iṣyamāṇe sati idam āpatitam
translated: He says: In the absence of certainty, when there is the occurrence of a contradicting proof,🔽if the absence of the probandum is accepted, this follows:

original: na ca bādhakaṃ pramāṇaṃ syāt sādhyābhāvasya ca sambhavaḥ iti na sādhyasādhane sāmarthyam abādhāyāḥ satyām api sādhyābhāvasya smbhavād iti
analyzed: na ca bādhakam pramāṇam syāt sādhya abhāvasya ca sambhavaḥ iti na sādhya sādhane sāmarthyam abādhāyāḥ satyām api sādhya abhāvasya iti
translated: And there would be no contradicting proof, and the absence of the probandum would be possible. Thus, even when there is non-contradiction, there is no capacity of the proof to prove the probandum, because the absence of the probandum is possible.

original: tadyogino 'pi hetvābhāsataiveti /
analyzed: tad yoginaḥ u pi hetvābhāsa tā evā iti
translated: Therefore, even if it is connected with that, it is still a fallacious reason.

original: yad uktam abādhayaiva sādhyasiddher vyartho hetuḥ iti tatrānyathārtham abādhāyā darśayan hetusāmarthyaṃ pratipādayann āhaparaḥ na bādhāyā
analyzed: yat uktam abādhayā eva sādhya siddheḥ vyarthaḥ hetuḥ iti tatra anyathā artham abādhāyāḥ darśayan hetu sāmarthyam pratipādayan āha paraḥ na bādhāyāḥ
translated: Regarding what was said, that the reason is useless because the probandum is established by non-contradiction alone, there, showing the meaning of non-contradiction in another way, the opponent demonstrates the capacity of the reason, saying: Non-contradiction is not

original: abhāvo samābādhā 'bhimatā /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ samābādhāḥ bhimatā
translated: the absence of contradiction, but what is intended is non-apprehension of contradiction.

original: kiṃ tarhi / /
analyzed: kim tarhi
translated: What then?

original: bādhāyā anupalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: bādhāyāḥ anupalabdhiḥ
translated: It is the non-apprehension of contradiction.

original: sā ca tadanupalabdhiḥ puruṣasya śaktivaikalyāt kvacid deśādau bādhāyā sambhave 'pi syāt /🔽tato bādhā 'nupalabdhimātreṇa sadhyasiddher abhāvāt tatsiddhye 'vaśyaṃ S / /
analyzed: sā ca tad anupalabdhiḥ puruṣasya śakti vaikalyāt kvacid deśa ādau syāt  tatas bādhā anupalabdhi mātreṇa sadhya siddheḥ abhāvāt tad siddhye vaśyam
translated: And that non-apprehension of that [absence of contradiction] could occur for a person due to a deficiency in capacity, even if there is a possibility of contradiction in some place, etc.

original: hetur abhidhānīya iti sa hetuprayogasya viṣayaḥ / tadā hi hetuḥ svasādhyaṃ sādhayan
analyzed: hetuḥ abhidhānīyaḥ iti sa hetu prayogasya viṣayaḥ tadā hi hetuḥ sva sādhyam sādhayan
translated: Therefore, since the probandum is not established merely by the non-apprehension of contradiction, for its establishment, a reason must necessarily be stated. Thus, that is the object of the use of a reason. For when a reason establishes its own probandum,

original: katham asamarthaḥ syād iti /
analyzed: katham asamarthaḥ syāt iti
translated: how could it be incapable?

original: siddhāntavādy āha kiṃ nu vai hetur bādhāyā yā upalabdhis tasyāḥ bibheti na punar
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha kim nu vai hetuḥ bādhāyāḥ yā upalabdhiḥ tasyāḥ bibheti na punar
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: But does the reason fear the apprehension of contradiction? Or rather,

original: bbādhāyā yena bādhāṃ sambhavantīm apy anādṛtya tadanupalabdhau satyāṃ prayoktavya iṣṭo bhavataḥ /
analyzed: yena bādhām sambhavantīm api an ādṛtya tad anupalabdhau satyām prayoktavyaḥ iṣṭaḥ bhavataḥ
translated: of contradiction, by which, disregarding the possibility of contradiction, it should be employed when there is the non-apprehension of that [contradiction], as desired by you?

original: kadācitparo brūyāt kiṃ kariṣyati vidyamānā'pi bādhā tapasvinī /
analyzed: kadācid paraḥ brūyāt kim kariṣyati vidyamānā api bādhā tapasvinī
translated: Sometimes an opponent might say: What will the existing but miserable contradiction do?

original: T / / tadupalabdhir eva rākṣasī /
analyzed: t tad upalabdhiḥ eva rākṣasī
translated: The apprehension of that [contradiction] itself is a demoness.

original: tasmāt tata eva hetor bhayaṃ tadabhāve hetuḥ prayoktavya evety ata āha sa tarhi ityādi /
analyzed: tasmāt tatas eva hetoḥ bhayam tad abhāve hetuḥ prayoktavyaḥ eva iti atas āha sa tarhi ityādi
translated: Therefore, the fear is only from that [apprehension of contradiction]. When it is absent, the reason should certainly be employed. Thus, [the proponent of the established doctrine] says But then... and so on.

original: evaṃ tarhi paramārthena bādhā kim asti nāstīty etadanapekṣya bādhāyā anupalabdhau satyāṃ prayoktavya iti kākvā pṛcchati /
analyzed: evam tarhi paramārthena bādhā kim asti na asti iti etat an apekṣya bādhāyāḥ anupalabdhau satyām prayoktavyaḥ iti kākvā pṛcchati
translated: If so, then, disregarding whether there is or is not obstruction in the ultimate sense, he asks rhetorically, When should it be employed in the absence of the non-apprehension of obstruction?

original: kadācit paro brūyāt uktam evaitat kim arthaṃ pṛccyate /
analyzed: kadācid paraḥ brūyāt  uktam eva etat kim artham pṛccyate
translated: Sometimes the opponent might say, This has already been stated. Why is it being asked?

original: ity āha kim arthaṃprayujyata iti /
analyzed: iti āha kim arthaṃprayujyate iti
translated: Thus he says, For what purpose is it employed?

original: bādhā 'nupalambhe 'pi tatsambhave sādhyasdhanāyogād ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: bādhā anupalambhe tad sambhave sādhya sdhana ayogāt iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The idea is that even in the absence of obstruction, its possibility is not proper for the establishment of the probandum.

original: paro 'navagatābhiprāya āha sādhyasiddhyartham iti bādhakapratyayābhāve prāmāṇyasyeṣṭatvāt tataḥ sādhyasiddhir avirūddhaiveti manyate /🔽siddhāntavādī satyāṃ bādhāyāṃ tadanupalambhe 'pi sādhyasiddhim asambhāvayan pṛcchati sa kiṃkvacid ityādi /
analyzed: paraḥ navagata abhiprāyaḥ āha sādhya siddhi artham iti bādhaka pratyaya abhāve prāmāṇyasya iṣṭa tvāt tatas sādhya siddhiḥ avirūddhā evā iti manyate  siddhānta vādī satyām bādhāyām tad anupalambhe sādhya siddhim asambhāvayan pṛcchati sa kim kvacid ityādi
translated: The opponent, whose intention is not understood, says, For the sake of establishing the probandum, thinking that when there is no cognition of obstruction, authoritativeness is accepted, and therefore the establishment of the probandum is not contradicted.🔽The proponent of the established conclusion, not considering the establishment of the probandum even in the absence of the apprehension of obstruction when there is obstruction, asks, When is it employed? and so on.

original: kiṃ S / / punar asau hetuḥ satyām api bādhāyāṃ sādhyaṃ sādhayed iti sambhavyate bhavatā yenāsyā bādhāyā abhāva viniścayaṃ prati yatno
analyzed: kim punar asau hetuḥ satyām api bādhāyām sādhyam sādhayet iti sambhavyate bhavatā yena asyāḥ bādhāyāḥ abhāva viniścayam prati
translated: But how is it possible that this reason would establish the probandum even when there is obstruction, for which you make an effort to ascertain the absence of that obstruction,

original: hetuś ca prayujyata iti /
analyzed: hetuḥ ca prayujyate iti
translated: and employ the reason?

original: evam etat iti cet /
analyzed: evam etat iti ced
translated: If you say This is so,

original: tathā satyām api bādhāyāṃ sādhyasādhanasāmarthyopagame saty abādhitaviṣayatvaṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: tathā satyām api bādhāyām sādhya sādhana sāmarthya upagame sati abādhita viṣaya tvam na bhavati
translated: And even when there is contradiction, if the capacity of the reason to prove the probandum is accepted, then the subject is not unaffected.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: bādhāyām api satyām asya hetoḥ sāmarthyāt sāmarthyopagamāt /🔽tad dhi hetor lakṣaṇam ucyate yena vinā sādhyaṃ na sādhayed iti /
analyzed: bādhāyām api satyām asya hetoḥ sāmarthyāt sāmarthya upagamāt  tat hi hetoḥ lakṣaṇam ucyate yena vinā sādhyam na sādhayet iti
translated: Because even when there is contradiction, the capacity of this reason is accepted.🔽For that is said to be the characteristic of a reason by which it cannot prove the probandum without it.

original: p / / syan matam anupalabhyamānabādhatvaṃ hetulakṣaṇaṃ T / / paramārthena /
translated: If it is thought that the characteristic of a reason is being unobstructed when not perceived, that is in reality,

original: nābādhitaviṣayatvam ity ata āha tathāca ityādi /
analyzed: na abādhita viṣayatvam iti atas āha tathā ca ityādi
translated: not having an unaffected subject. Therefore he says And so on and so forth.

original: evaṃ sati bādhāyāḥ sadbhāvasambhave 'pi tām abhyupagamya tadanupalambhamātreṇa hetoḥ prayogaḥ prāptaḥ /
analyzed: evam sati bādhāyāḥ sadbhāva sambhave tām abhyupagamya tad anupalambha mātreṇa hetoḥ prayogaḥ prāptaḥ
translated: In this case, even if the existence of contradiction is possible, the use of the reason is obtained merely by not perceiving it, accepting it.

original: yadi hi bādhām abhyupagamya hetuprayogo nābhimataḥ syāt tadā 'nupalambhamātreṇa bādhāyāṃ
analyzed: yadi hi bādhām abhyupagamya hetu prayogaḥ na abhimataḥ syāt tadā nupalambha mātreṇa bādhāyām
translated: For if the use of the reason by accepting contradiction were not intended, then by mere non-perception,

original: saṃśayāt satām api keśāñcit kathañcidanupalambhasambhavāt saṃśayitasya hetuprayoge
analyzed: saṃśayāt satām api keśān cit kathañcid anupalambha sambhavāt saṃśayitasya hetu prayoge
translated: because of doubt about contradiction, even if they exist, it is possible for some to be perceived in some way, so engagement in the use of the reason by one who doubts

original: pravṛttir eva na yujyeta /
analyzed: pravṛttiḥ eva na yujyeta
translated: is not reasonable.

original: tasmād yo yatsaṃśaye 'pi pravartate sa tasya bhāvapakṣam abhyupetyaiva pravarttate /
analyzed: tasmāt yaḥ yad saṃśaye pravartate sa tasya bhāva pakṣam abhyupetya eva pravarttate
translated: Therefore, one who engages in an inquiry about something does so only after accepting the possibility of its existence.

original: tathā ca yathā bādhānupalabdhau tām abhyupagamya hetuḥ prayujyate tathā tadupalabdhāv api prayujyatām /
analyzed: tathā ca yathā bādhā anupalabdhau tām abhyupagamya hetuḥ prayujyate tathā tad upalabdhau api prayujyatām
translated: And just as the reason is used when there is no perception of contradiction, assuming that, in the same way, it should be used even when there is perception of it.

original: bādhāyāḥ sadbhāvābhyupagame sati tadupalambhānupalambhayor viśeṣābhāvād iti nānupalabhyamānabādhatvam
analyzed: bādhāyāḥ sadbhāva abhyupagame sati tad upalambha anupalambhayoḥ viśeṣa abhāvāt iti na anupalabhyamāna bādha tvam
translated: Because there is no difference between the perception and non-perception of contradiction, if the existence of contradiction is accepted. Thus, the definition of the reason as not having a contradiction that is not perceived

original: api S / / hetulakṣaṇaṃ yujyata iti kuto bādhakapratyayavirahe 'py asati pratibandhe🔽prāmāṇyasya sambhava iti /
analyzed: api hetu lakṣaṇam yujyate iti kutas bādhaka pratyaya virahe pi asati pratibandhe  prāmāṇyasya sambhavaḥ iti
translated: is not appropriate. So how can there be validity even in the absence of a contradictory cognition, if there is no connection?

original: parasya vacanāvakāśam āśaṅkhyāha na bādhāyām ityādi /🔽naiva hi bādhāyāṃ satyāṃ hetoḥ sāmarthyam iṣyate tat kathaṃ tadupalambhe 'pi prayogaḥ syāt / /
analyzed: parasya vacana avakāśam āśaṅkhya āha na bādhāyām ityādi  na eva hi bādhāyām satyām hetoḥ sāmarthyam iṣyate tat katham tad upalambhe pi prayogaḥ syāt
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine, anticipating an opportunity for the opponent to speak, says not in the case of contradiction, etc.🔽For indeed, when there is contradiction, the capacity of the reason is not accepted. So how could it be used even when that is perceived?

original: siddhāntavādy āha yady evaṃ bādhāyāṃ satyāṃ hetur asamartho yadīṣyate tadā 'nirṇīto adhāyā asaṃbhavo yasya hetoḥ sa tathāvidhaḥ prayogaṃbādhā
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha yadi evam bādhāyām satyām hetuḥ asamarthaḥ yadi iṣyate tadā nirṇītaḥ asaṃbhavaḥ yasya hetoḥ sa tathāvidhaḥ prayogaṃbādhā
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: If it is accepted that the reason is incapable when there is contradiction, then how could there be use of a reason of that kind, which has an undetermined or impossible contradiction?

original: 'nupalambhamātreṇa nārhati /
analyzed: na arhati
translated: [The opponent:] It is not proper [to conclude that the reason is unestablished] merely on the ground of non-apprehension.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: Why is that?

original: mā bhūd bādhāyāḥ sambhasvapakṣe prayuktasyāpi hetoḥ sādhyasiddhau iti/
analyzed: mā bhūt bādhāyāḥ prayuktasya api hetoḥ sādhya siddhau asāmarthyam
translated: [The opponent:] In order to avoid the possibility of contradiction in the case of a reason employed even when the possibility of contradiction exists, [we must conclude that the reason is unestablished].

original: T / / pūrvapakṣavādy āha bādhānupalambhe sati bādhāyā ābhāvātsadupalambhakapratyayābhāvesaty
analyzed: āha
translated: [The proponent:] If you think that when there is non-apprehension of contradiction, there is absence of contradiction, and in the absence of the conditions that apprehend the existent,

original: avaśyam arthānām asattvād dhetoḥ sāmathyam iti cen manyase siddhāntavādy āha kim
analyzed: avaśyam arthānām asattvāt hetoḥ sāmathyam iti ced manyase siddhāntavādī āha kim
translated: the reason must necessarily have the capacity [to prove the probandum], because the objects are necessarily non-existent, [the proponent] says: What?

original: upalambho bādhām ityādi /
analyzed: upalambhaḥ bādhām ityādi
translated: [The proponent:] The apprehension, etc.

original: upalambho hy arthānāṃ kāryaṃ /🔽na ca kāryaṃ kāraṇaṃ vyāpnoti /
analyzed: upalambhaḥ hi arthānām kāryam  na ca kāryam kāraṇam vyāpnoti
translated: For the apprehension of objects is the effect [of the objects].🔽And an effect does not pervade its cause.

original: na hy 'vaśyaṃ kāraṇāni kāryavanti bhavanti /
analyzed: na hi vaśyam kāraṇāni kāryavanti bhavanti
translated: For causes are not necessarily endowed with effects.

original: tat katham avyāpakasyopalambhasya
analyzed: tat katham a vyāpakasya upalambhasya
translated: So how can the absence of contradiction,

original: nivṛttau bādhāyā nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: nivṛttau bādhāyāḥ nivṛttiḥ
translated: when there is the cessation of apprehension, which is not a pervader [of contradiction],

original: yato hetor bbādhāyāḥ sambhavakṛtam asāmarthyaṃ na sambhaved iti /
analyzed: yatas hetoḥ bbādhāyāḥ sambhava kṛtam asāmarthyam na sambhavet iti
translated: be due to the fact that the reason does not have the capacity to prove the probandum because of the possibility of contradiction?

original: etac ca parair apīṣyata eva /
analyzed: etat ca paraiḥ api iṣyate eva
translated: And this is accepted even by the opponents.

original: S / / pramāṇatayopagatasyāpy udayakāle 'nupalabdhabādhasya p / / kālāntareṇa bādhakapratyayotpāde saty aprāmāṇyopagamāt /
analyzed: pramāṇa tayā upagatasya api udaya kāle nupalabdha bādhasya kāla antareṇa bādhaka pratyaya utpāde sati aprāmāṇya upagamāt
translated: Because even that which is accepted as a means of valid knowledge is accepted as invalid when a contradictory cognition arises at a later time, even though it was not contradicted at the time of its own arising.

original: athāvyāpakasyāpy upalambhasya ivṛttau bādhā nivarttate
analyzed: atha avyāpakasya api upalambhasya bādhā nivarttate
translated: Now, if the non-apprehension, even though not all-pervading, is admitted, the annulment is set aside.

original: nivarttate hi mithyātvaṃdośājānādayatnataḥ// ŚlV Sū /
analyzed: nivarttate hi mithyātvam dośa a jānāt ayatnataḥ
translated: For, the falsity is set aside by the mere non-apprehension of the defects, without any effort.

original: iti anenaiva nyāyena jñānanivṛttyā bādhānivṛtter ity āha tathāpi vyartho hetuḥ /
analyzed: iti anena eva nyāyena jñāna nivṛttyā bādhā nivṛtteḥ iti āha tathā api vyarthaḥ hetuḥ
translated: By this very reasoning, the annulment is set aside by the cessation of the cognition. Thus, he says, Even then, the reason is useless.

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: bādhānupalambhād eva hetupayogarahitāt sādhyasiddheḥ /
analyzed: bādhā anupalambhāt eva hetu upayoga rahitāt sādhya siddheḥ
translated: Because the establishment of the probandum is accomplished by the mere non-apprehension of the annulment, which is devoid of the use of a reason.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: anupalambhe bādhāyā asambhavāt /
analyzed: anupalambhe bādhāyāḥ asambhavāt
translated: Because in the absence of apprehension, there is no possibility of annulment.

original: tathā hi yatra bādhāyā anupalambhas tatra paramārthata eva sā na vidyata iti manyase /
analyzed: tathā hi yatra bādhāyāḥ anupalambhaḥ tatra paramārthataḥ eva sā na vidyate iti manyase
translated: For, indeed, you think that where there is no apprehension of annulment, it does not exist in reality.

original: yatra cāsau paramārthato nāsti /
analyzed: yatra ca asau paramārthataḥ na asti
translated: And where it does not exist in reality,

original: tatra sādhyadharmasyābhāvo 'pi paramārthenaiva T / / nāsti /
analyzed: tatra sādhya dharmasya abhāvaḥ pi paramārthena eva na asti
translated: there the absence of the probandum property also does not exist in reality.

original: anyathā paramārthena bādhāyā abhāvāyogāt / tataś ca sādhyadharmasyābhāvābhāve sati bhāva iti bhavanmatya sādhyapratīter vyarthatā hetor iti /
analyzed: anyathā paramārthena bādhāyāḥ abhāva ayogāt tatas ca sādhya dharmasya abhāva abhāve sati bhāvaḥ iti bhavat matya sādhya pratīteḥ vyartha tā hetoḥ iti
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible for the annulment to be absent in reality. And then, when there is the absence of the absence of the probandum property, the establishment of the probandum is useless, as you think, because of the reason.

original: atha mā bhūd yuktivirodha iti nopalambhanivṛttau bādhānivṛttir iṣyate /
analyzed: atha mā bhūt yukti virodhaḥ iti nā upalambha nivṛttau bādhā nivṛttiḥ iṣyate
translated: Now, lest there be contradiction with reasoning, the non-cessation of annulment is not accepted upon the cessation of apprehension.

original: tatrāha upalambhasya nivṛttāv api satyāṃ bādhāyā anivṛttāv iṣyamāṇāyāṃ tadavasthaṃ
analyzed: tatra āha upalambhasya nivṛttau api satyām bādhāyāḥ anivṛttau iṣyamāṇāyām tad avastham
translated: In response to this, even if the apprehension of the object of negation is removed, if the contradiction is not removed, the reason remains in the same state.

original: hetor asāmarthyam yadavasthaṃ bādhopalambha iti hetor aprayoga iti kasyābādhitaviṣayatvaṃ
analyzed: hetoḥ asāmarthyam yad avastham bādhā upalambhaḥ iti hetoḥ aprayogaḥ iti kasya abādhita viṣaya tvam
translated: Since the contradiction is apprehended in the same state, the reason is not used. Whose unobstructed object

original: S / / rūpāntaraṃ syāt / /
analyzed: rūpa antaram syāt
translated: could be a different form?

original: etad evopasaṃharann āha tasmāt svasādhya ityādi / yata evaṃ vyāptya hetoḥ sarvatra
analyzed: etat eva upasaṃharan āha tasmāt sva sādhye ityādi yatas evam vyāptya hetoḥ sarvatra
translated: Concluding this very point, he says therefore, in its own probandum and so on. Since the pervasion of the reason is thus, in accepting the invariable concomitance of the probandum everywhere,

original: sādhyenāvinābhāvābhyupagame bahirvyāptaviṣayamāṇāyāṃ vaiyarthyaṃ hetuprayogasyāpadyate
analyzed: sādhyena avinābhāva abhyupagame bahis vyāpta viṣayamāṇāyām vaiyarthyam hetu prayogasya āpadyate
translated: if the pervasion outside the locus is accepted, the use of the reason becomes pointless.

original: tasmāt svasādhyabhāvābhāvābhyāṃanyathā'pi svasādhyabhāve 'py abhavan na 'bhāve 'pi
analyzed: tasmāt sva sādhya bhāva abhāvābhyām anyathā api sva sādhya bhāve pi abhavat na bhāve pi
translated: Therefore, the reason, even if it exists in a different way than its own probandum, does not exist when the probandum exists,

original: ca bhavan hetur dharmiṇi kiñcit sādhyaṃ na bhāvayati na sādhayati na vibhāvayati
analyzed: ca bhavan hetuḥ dharmiṇi kiñcid sādhyam na bhāvayati na sādhayati na vibhāvayati
translated: and it exists even when it does not exist. The reason does not produce, establish, or manifest any probandum in the subject.

original: tadviparītaṃ na niṣedhayati iti tasya vidhipratiṣedhāvakurvata upakṣepaḥ prayogo
analyzed: tad viparītam na niṣedhayati iti tasya vidhi pratiṣedhau akurvataḥ upakṣepaḥ
translated: It does not negate the opposite of that. The statement, the use, of that which does not perform affirmation or negation🔽is

original: na samarthaḥ ity avaśyaṃ hetuprayogam icchatā svasādhyāvinābhāvaḥ sarvatra hetor abhyupagantavyaḥ /
analyzed: na samarthaḥ iti avaśyam hetu prayogam icchatā sva sādhya avinābhāvaḥ sarvatra hetoḥ abhyupagantavyaḥ
translated: When one necessarily desires to employ a reason, one must accept that the reason is invariably concomitant with the probandum everywhere.

original: sa ca pratibandhanibandhanaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca pratibandha nibandhanaḥ
translated: And that is based on a relation of invariable concomitance.

original: eṣa ca darśanādarśanamātrāyatto yathoktaṃ prak /
analyzed: eṣa ca darśana adarśana mātra āyattaḥ yathā uktam prak
translated: And this is dependent on mere perception and non-perception, as stated earlier.

original: tasmiṃś cābhyupagate bādhāvinābhāvayor virodhaḥ T / / siddha ity upasaṃharann āha tan na ityādi /
analyzed: tasmin ca abhyupagate bādhā avinābhāvayoḥ virodhaḥ siddhaḥ iti upasaṃharan āha tat naḥ ityādi
translated: And when that is accepted, the contradiction between non-apprehension and invariable concomitance is established. Concluding this, he says That is not so and so on.

original: yata evaṃ tena kāraṇenābādhā rūpāntaraṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: yatas evam tena kāraṇena ābādhā rūpa antaram na bhavati
translated: Since it is so, therefore non-apprehension is not a different form.

original: yadi nāma bādhāvinābhāvayoḥ sahāvasthānābhāvād avinābhāve p / / saty abādhā gamyate rūpāntaraṃ tu kim iti na bhavati /
analyzed: yadi nāma bādhā avinābhāvayoḥ saha avasthāna abhāvāt avinābhāve sati abādhā gamyate rūpa antaram tu kim iti na bhavati
translated: Even if non-apprehension is understood to be present when there is invariable concomitance due to the absence of co-existence of apprehension and non-apprehension, why is a different form not accepted?

original: iti / ata āha tan nāma ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha tat nāma ityādi
translated: To this, he says That is so and so on.

original: tad dhi tasmād viśeṣaṇāntaraṃ bhaved vastusthitayā /
analyzed: tat hi tasmāt viśeṣaṇa antaram bhavet vastu sthitayā
translated: That would be a different qualifier from that, according to the real state of things.

original: S / / lakṣaṇakāraiś ca rūpāntaratvenopādānam arhati yasya viśeṣaṇasya bhave 'pi yasyāparasyābhāvaḥ syāt /
analyzed: lakṣaṇa kāraiḥ ca rūpa antara tvena upādānam arhati yasya viśeṣaṇasya bhave yasya aparasya abhāvaḥ syāt
translated: And the author of the definition deserves to accept a different form as a qualifier, for which there would be absence of another even when there is existence.

original: yataḥ svabhāve vyabhicāre ca viśeṣaṇaviśeśyabhāvo na sambhava eva kevale /
analyzed: yatas svabhāve vyabhicāre ca viśeṣaṇa viśeśya bhāvaḥ na sambhave eva kevale
translated: Because when there is deviation from the nature, the relation of qualifier and qualified is not possible at all in the mere [reason].

original: udāharaṇam āha tad yathā ityādi /🔽saty api hi śrāvaṇatvādeḥ sapakṣe bhāvo nāsti /
analyzed: udāharaṇam āha tat yathā ityādi  sati api hi śrāvaṇa tva ādeḥ sapakṣe bhāvaḥ na asti
translated: He gives an example, beginning with For example.🔽Even though audibility, etc. exists in the similar instance, it is not present.

original: saty api ca cākśuṣatvādeḥ sapakṣe bhāve sādhyadharmiṇi śabde sambandho nāsti /
analyzed: sati api ca cākśuṣa tva ādeḥ sapakṣe bhāve sādhya dharmiṇi śabde sambandhaḥ na asti
translated: And even though visibility, etc. exists in the similar instance, it is not related to the subject of the probandum, sound.

original: tato 'nyoḥ sambavavyabhicārayor bhāvād viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvo lakṣaṇāntaratvena copādānam/
analyzed: tatas nyoḥ bhāvāt viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvaḥ lakṣaṇa antara tvena
translated: Therefore, since deviation is possible for the other two, the relation of qualifier and qualified is stated as a separate characteristic.

original: ihā 'py evaṃ bhaviṣyatīti ced āha na caitad anantaroditam abādhāyā avinābhāve sati sambhavati /
analyzed: iha a pi evam bhaviṣyati iti ced āha na ca etat anantara uditam abādhāyāḥ avinābhāve sati sambhavati
translated: If it is argued that it will be the same here too, he says that this, which was just mentioned, is not possible for non-contradiction when there is invariable concomitance.

original: saty avinābhāve niyamenābādhāyāḥ sambhavād vyabhicārābhāvāt kuto viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvo
analyzed: sati avinābhāve niyamena ābādhāyāḥ sambhavāt vyabhicāra abhāvāt kutas viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvaḥ
translated: When there is invariable concomitance, non-contradiction is necessarily possible. Since there is no deviation, how can the relation of qualifier and qualified

original: lakṣaṇāntaratvena copādānamarhati /
analyzed: lakṣaṇa antara tvena
translated: deserve to be stated as a separate characteristic?

original: iti na hetoḥ sādhyāvinābhāvino viruddhasya ca sādhyaviparyayāvinābhāvino viṣaye bādhā sambhavati /
analyzed: iti na hetoḥ sādhya avinābhāvinaḥ viruddhasya ca sādhya viparyaya avinābhāvinaḥ viṣaye bādhā sambhavati
translated: Thus, contradiction is not possible in the domain of the reason which is invariably concomitant with the probandum, or of the contradictory which is invariably concomitant with the negation of the probandum.

original: uktena prakāreṇa viparyaye samyagghetur evāviṣaye tu prayogād dhetvābhāsa ucyate /
analyzed: uktena prakāreṇa viparyaye samyak hetuḥ evā aviṣaye tu prayogāt hetvābhāsaḥ ucyate
translated: The correct reason, in the manner stated, is only in the case of non-deviation. But in the case of an object that is not within the scope of the reason, it is called a fallacious reason due to the application of the reason.

original: yata evam iti tasmān na tadabhāvo bādhāvirahaḥ T / / pṛthagavinābhāvād anvayavyatirekātmano 'nayor hetuviruddhayor lakṣaṇāntaratvena vācyaḥ /
analyzed: yatas evam iti tasmāt na tad abhāvaḥ bādhā virahaḥ pṛthak avinābhāvāt anvaya vyatireka ātmanaḥ nayoḥ hetu viruddhayoḥ lakṣaṇa antara tvena vācyaḥ
translated: Since this is so, therefore the absence of that, i.e., the absence of contradiction, should not be stated separately as a distinct characteristic of these two, the reason and the contradictory reason, which consist of positive and negative concomitance, apart from non-deviation.

original: S / / vyabhicārābhāvena rūpāntaratvāyogāt /
analyzed: vyabhicāra abhāvena rūpa antara tva ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible for it to be a different form due to the absence of deviation.

original: yataś cāvinābhāve sati bādhā na sambhavati virodhāt /
analyzed: yatas ca avinābhāve sati bādhā na sambhavati virodhāt
translated: And since, when there is non-deviation, contradiction is not possible due to incompatibility.

original: tasmād dhetor yathoktalakṣaṇasya prayoge sati gamyārthāyā api pratijñāyā doṣāṇāṃ pratyakṣaviruddhādīnāṃ sambhavo nāsti /
analyzed: tasmāt hetoḥ yathā ukta lakṣaṇasya prayoge sati gamya arthāyāḥ api pratijñāyāḥ doṣāṇām pratyakṣa viruddha ādīnām sambhavaḥ na asti
translated: Therefore, when the reason, which has the stated characteristic, is used, even though the proposition to be inferred is stated, there is no possibility of faults such as contradiction with perception.

original: hetulakṣaṇenaiva teṣāṃ nirastatvāt /
analyzed: hetu lakṣaṇena eva teṣām nirasta tvāt
translated: Because they have already been refuted by the characteristic of the reason itself.

original: tat kathaṃ bādhāviraho heto rūpāntaram ucyate /
analyzed: tat katham bādhā virahaḥ hetoḥ rūpa antaram ucyate
translated: So how can the absence of contradiction be stated as a distinct form of the reason?

original: asambhavināṃ ca teṣāṃ upavarṇanaṃ niṣphalam ākūtam/
analyzed: asambhavinām ca teṣām upavarṇanam niṣphalam iti
translated: And it is fruitless to describe what is impossible.

original: kevalāyāḥ prayoge 'sti sambhava iti cet /
analyzed: kevalāyāḥ prayoge sti sambhavaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is possible when only the proposition is used,

original: āha nāpi ityādi /
analyzed: āha na api ityādi
translated: [the author] says not even and so on.

original: hetuprayoge hy asati kevalā pratijñaiva na prayujyate /
analyzed: hetu prayoge hi asati kevalā pratijñā eva na prayujyate
translated: For when the use of the reason is absent, only the proposition is not used by itself.

original: hetuviṣayatvena tadabhyupagamāt /
analyzed: hetu viṣaya tvena tad abhyupagamāt
translated: Because they accept it as the subject of the reason.

original: tataś caśāstrakārair na pratijñādoṣāḥ pratyakṣaviruddhādayo vācyā iti /
analyzed: tatas ca śāstra kāraiḥ na pratijñā doṣāḥ pratyakṣa viruddha ādayaḥ vācyāḥ iti
translated: And therefore the authors of treatises should not state the faults of the thesis, such as contradiction with perception, etc.

original: diṅnāgapādais tu p / / sādhyāsādhyaviparyayeṇavipratipattidarśanād aprayogārhasyāpi pakṣasya lakṣaṇavidhāne nyāyaprāptam evāpakṣatva
analyzed: diṅnāga pādaiḥ tu a prayoga arhasya api pakṣasya lakṣaṇa vidhāne nyāya prāptam
translated: But by the feet of Dignāga, since the contradiction is shown by the reversal of the probandum and the non-probandum, even a subject that is not fit for application, when the definition of a subject is stated, it is logically obtained that it is not a subject.

original: na nitvaṃ ni
analyzed: na ni tvam ni
translated: It is not a thesis.

original: rākṛtapadena pramāṇaviruddhasyākhyānam /
analyzed: rākṛta padena pramāṇa viruddhasya ākhyānam
translated: By the word refuted, what is contradicted by a means of valid knowledge is stated.

original: na tv atiprasaktaṃ pakṣalakṣaṇam vyavacchinnam /
analyzed: na tu atiprasaktam pakṣa lakṣaṇam vyavacchinnam
translated: But the definition of a thesis, which is too broad, is not distinguished.

original: sandigdhasyaiva sādhyatvāt /
analyzed: sandigdhasya eva sādhya tvāt
translated: Because only what is doubtful is to be proved.

original: pramāṇabādhite sādhakapramāṇāvṛtter iti /
analyzed: pramāṇa bādhite sādhaka pramāṇa āvṛtteḥ iti
translated: Because a means of valid knowledge that proves it does not operate when it is contradicted by a means of valid knowledge.

original: tad evam abādhitaviṣayatvaṃ nirākṛtya rūpāntaraṃ nirākurvann āha etena avinābhāve
analyzed: tat evam abādhita viṣaya tvam nirākṛtya rūpa antaram nirākurvan āha etena avinābhāve
translated: Having thus refuted the uncontradicted object, he refutes another form, saying By this, when there is invariable concomitance,

original: sati bādhāyā T / / asambhavadarśanena ekasaṃkhyāvivakṣā'pi viruddhāvyabhicāridoṣavipakṣeṇocyamānā
analyzed: sati asambhava darśanena eka saṃkhyā vivakṣā api viruddha avyabhicāri doṣa vipakṣeṇa ucyamānā
translated: the impossibility of contradiction is shown. By mentioning the number one, even when stated by the opposite of the fault of contradictory inconclusiveness,

original: pratyuktā pratyākhyātā /
analyzed: pratyuktā pratyākhyātā
translated: it is refuted, it is rejected.

original: paraḥpṛcchati katham iti kena prakāreṇa yathā bādhāvinābhāvayoḥ sahānavasthānaṃ tathā pratihetvavinābhāvayor api /
analyzed: paraḥ pṛcchati katham iti kena prakāreṇa yathā bādhā avinābhāvayoḥ saha anavasthānam tathā prati hetu avinābhāvayoḥ api
translated: The opponent asks: How? In what way is the coexistence of contradiction and invariable concomitance like that of the counter-reason and invariable concomitance?

original: yenaikasaṃkhyāvivakṣā tadvad eva pratyākhyāyeta iti /
analyzed: yena eka saṃkhyā vivakṣā tadvat eva pratyākhyāyeta iti
translated: By which [coexistence] the intention of the number one would be rejected in the same way.

original: siddhāntavādī sāmyaṃ darśayannāha eka ityādi /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī sāmyam ekaḥ ityādi
translated: The proponent of the established conclusion, showing the similarity, says one and so on.

original: eko hi hetur lakṣaṇayuktaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ hi hetuḥ lakṣaṇa yuktaḥ
translated: For one reason having the characteristic,

original: svasādhyāvyabhicārī kathaṃ bhavati / /
analyzed: sva sādhya avyabhicārī katham bhavati
translated: how can it be non-deviating from its own probandum?

original: yadi svasādhyabhāva eva bhavet /
analyzed: yadi sva sādhya bhāvaḥ eva bhavet
translated: If it were to exist only when its own probandum exists.

original: anyathā tallakṣaṇam avinābhāvo nāma hīyeta /
analyzed: anyathā tad lakṣaṇam avinābhāvaḥ nāma hīyeta
translated: Otherwise, that characteristic called invariable concomitance would be lost.

original: atraiva dharmiṇi sa tallakṣaṇa eko bhavati tatraiva dharmiṇi tasmād anyo 'pi pratihetur viruddhastena hetulakṣaṇayuktaḥ kathaṃ bhavati / /
analyzed: atra eva dharmiṇi sa tad lakṣaṇaḥ ekaḥ bhavati tatra eva dharmiṇi tasmāt anyaḥ pi pratihetuḥ viruddhaḥ tena hetu lakṣaṇa yuktaḥ katham bhavati
translated: Here, on this same property-possessor, it becomes one having that characteristic. On that same property-possessor, how can another counter-reason, which is contradictory and endowed with the characteristic of a reason, exist?

original: ekasya yat sādhyaṃtadbādhakasya tadviruddhasyāparasya dharmasya bhāva
analyzed: ekasya hetoḥ yat tad viruddhasya aparasya dharmasya bhāva
translated: The existence of the property to be negated by one [reason] is the existence of another property contradictory to it.🔽Because of invariable concomitance, not non-existence, it is similar to contradiction in the possibility of contradiction.

original: eva nābhāve bhāvād avinābhāvād iti bādhayā samānaṃ bādhāsambhavena samānaḥ pratihetur
analyzed: eva na abhāve bhāvāt avinābhāvāt iti bādhayā samānam bādhā sambhavena samānaḥ pratihetuḥ
translated: The counter-reason is similar to that.

original: iti S / / nirasta iti /
analyzed: iti s nirastaḥ iti
translated: Thus it is refuted.

original: atraiva dūṣaṇāntaram abhidhātuṃ vikalpayann āha api ca ityādi /
analyzed: atra eva dūṣaṇa antaram abhidhātum vikalpayan āha api ca ityādi
translated: In order to state another fault right here, [Dharmakīrti] imagines [the opponent's position] and says Moreover... etc.

original: vastutaḥ paramārthato yasya pratihetur na sambhavati kim asau samyagjñānasya
analyzed: vastutas paramārthataḥ yasya pratihetuḥ na sambhavati kim asau samyak jñānasya
translated: If for someone there is no possible counter-reason in reality, in the ultimate sense, is he accepted as the cause of correct knowledge,

original: viparyayasya vopanyastasādhyaviparītajñānasya vā hetur iṣṭo T / / yato vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvaṃ tallakṣaṇam ucyate /
analyzed: viparyayasya vā upanyasta sādhya viparīta jñānasya vā hetuḥ yatas vivakṣita eka saṃkhya tvam tat lakṣaṇam ucyate
translated: of error, or of the knowledge that is contrary to the thesis that is being presented? Because the definition of that is stated to be the intended oneness.

original: āhosvid yasya pratihetus tatsādhyaviparītasādhako na pradarśitaḥ paramārthataḥ sann apīti /
analyzed: āhosvit yasya pratihetuḥ tad sādhya viparīta sādhakaḥ na pradarśitaḥ paramārthataḥ san api iti
translated: Or is it that for whom the counter-reason, which is the proof of the opposite of what is to be proven by that [reason], is not shown, even though it exists in reality?

original: paro doṣam apaśyann āha kiñcataḥ ityādi /
analyzed: paraḥ doṣam a paśyan āha kiñcatas ityādi
translated: The opponent, not seeing a fault, says And what follows from this? etc.

original: yadi nāma pūrvo vikalpa uttaro vā tataḥ ko doṣaḥ / iti/
analyzed: yadi nāma pūrvaḥ vikalpaḥ uttaraḥ vā tatas kaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: If the former alternative or the latter is the case, what is the fault?

original: p / / siddhāntavādy āha yady asambhavan pratihetur yasya sa samyagjñānādihetur iṣyate /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha yadi asambhavān pratihetuḥ yasya sa samyak jñāna ādi hetuḥ iṣyate
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: If it is accepted that for whom there is an impossible counter-reason, he is the cause of correct knowledge etc.,

original: tadā 'lakṣaṇam etad vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvam /
analyzed: tadā lakṣaṇam etat vivakṣita eka saṃkhyatvam
translated: then this definition is not intended, namely oneness.

original: kasmāt / aśakyo niścayo yasya vastuto 'sambhavat pratihetutvasya sa tathoktaḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt aśakyaḥ niścayaḥ yasya sambhavat pratihetu tvasya sa tathā uktaḥ
translated: Why? Because the ascertainment of him who, in reality, has an impossible counter-reason is said to be impossible.

original: paramatāpekṣayā caitad ucyate /
analyzed: paramatā apekṣayā ca etat ucyate
translated: And this is said in relation to the highest [truth].

original: paro hi darśanādarśanābhyām asaty api pratibandhe 'vinābhāvam icchati /
analyzed: paraḥ hi darśana adarśanābhyām asati api pratibandhe vinābhāvam icchati
translated: For the opponent wishes to establish invariable concomitance even in the absence of a relation of invariable concomitance through perception and non-perception.

original: paro hi darśanādarśanābhyām asaty api pratibandhe 'vinābhāvam icchati /
analyzed: paraḥ hi darśana adarśanābhyām asati api pratibandhe vinābhāvam icchati
translated: For the opponent wishes to establish invariable concomitance even in the absence of a relation of invariable concomitance through perception and non-perception.

original: tatas tasya pratihetor evaṃvidhasya sambhavo 'sti /
analyzed: tatas tasya pratihetoḥ evaṃvidhasya sambhavaḥ asti
translated: Therefore, there is a possibility of such a counter-reason for him.

original: sa cānupalabhyamāno 'pi kadācit syād iti vastutas tadabhāvo niścīyate /
analyzed: sa ca anupalabhyamānaḥ pi kadācid syāt iti vastutas tad abhāvaḥ niścīyate
translated: And that, even though not perceived, might sometimes be, so in reality its absence is not ascertained.

original: pratibandhanibandhanāvinābhāvavādināṃ tv asmākaṃ S / / pratihetvasambhavaḥ suniścita eva /
analyzed: pratibandha nibandhana avinābhāva vādinām tu asmākam prati hetu asambhavaḥ su niścitaḥ eva
translated: But for us, who maintain invariable concomitance based on a relation, the impossibility of a counter-reason is certainly well-established.

original: na hi tādātmyatadutpattilakṣaṇe pratibandhe pramāṇataḥ siddhe tannimittāvinābhāvitayā
analyzed: na hi tādātmya tad utpatti lakṣaṇe pratibandhe pramāṇataḥ siddhe tad nimitta avinābhāvi tayā
translated: For when the relation characterized by identity and origination is established by a means of valid knowledge, then the invariable concomitance based on that cause

original: ekena hetuna svasādhye sādhite punas tatraiva dharmiṇi tallakṣaṇasya T / / tadviruddhārthasādhakasya
analyzed: ekena hetuna sva sādhye sādhite punar tatra eva dharmiṇi tad lakṣaṇasya t tad viruddha artha sādhakasya
translated: is ascertained. And when one reason has established its probandum, then in that same subject, the possibility of a counter-reason having that same characteristic, which establishes a meaning contrary to that,

original: pratihetoḥ sambhavaḥ śaṅkhyate /
analyzed: pratihetoḥ sambhavaḥ śaṅkhyate
translated: is suspected.

original: bhāvānāṃ viruddhasvabhāvadvayāyogād /
analyzed: bhāvānām viruddha svabhāva dvaya ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible for entities to have two contradictory natures.

original: viruddhadharmasādhakasambhave ca tasyaiva
analyzed: viruddha dharma sādhaka sambhave ca tasya eva
translated: And when there is the possibility of establishing contradictory properties, then that very

original: svasādhyāvinābhāvinaḥ prathamasya tatra pramāṇato bhāvasiddhyayogād iti /🔽syān matam yadi nāma prastutaḥ pratihetvasambhavo 'smābhir niścetum aśakyas tathāpy asambhavat pratihetutvaṃ vivakṣittaikasaṃkhyatvapratipāditaṃ
analyzed: sva sādhya avinābhāvinaḥ prathamasya tatra pramāṇataḥ bhāva siddhi ayogāt iti  syāt matam yadi nāma prastutaḥ smābhiḥ niścetum aśakyaḥ tathā api asambhavat prati hetu tvam
translated: because the first [reason] which is invariably concomitant with its own probandum cannot be established as existent by a means of valid knowledge in that [case].

original: hetulakṣaṇaṃ kasmān na bhavati /
analyzed: hetu lakṣaṇam kasmāt na bhavati
translated: It might be thought: Even if we are unable to ascertain the impossibility of a counter-reason in the present case, why should the definition of a reason not be stated as having the property of being of a kind where a counter-reason is impossible, which is indicated by the word 'one'?

original: ity āha na hy aniścitātmanaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: iti āha na hi aniścita ātmanaḥ ityādi
translated: To this he says For an uncertain thing cannot be a defining property, etc.

original: pratipādako yo dharmo hetos tasyāniścitasvabhāvasya yasmāt tallakṣaṇatvaṃ pratipādakadharmatā na bhavati /
analyzed: pratipādakaḥ yaḥ dharmaḥ hetoḥ tasya aniścita svabhāvasya yasmāt tad lakṣaṇa tvam pratipādaka dharma tā na bhavati
translated: Because for a reason whose nature is uncertain, that property which is stated as its defining property cannot be a defining property.

original: yathā saṃdigdhasya pakṣadharmatvasyeti pūrvakasya sādhanam /
analyzed: yathā saṃdigdhasya pakṣa dharma tvasya iti pūrvakasya sādhanam
translated: Just as for a doubtful property of the subject, this is the proof of the previous [statement].

original: nāpi sandigdhaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ yasya sa hetur bhavatīti na kaściddhetur bhaved iti hetvabhāvo S / / vā ity asya samarthanam /
analyzed: na api sandigdham lakṣaṇam yasya sa hetuḥ bhavati iti na kaścid hetuḥ bhavet iti vā iti asya samarthanam
translated: Nor can a reason be one whose defining property is doubtful, so that no reason would exist at all. This is the support for the statement then there would be no reason.

original: tataś ca hetvābhāsās tato 'pi ity atrāpi yojitam iti /
analyzed: tatas ca hetvābhāsāḥ iti atra api yojitam iti
translated: And therefore it is also applied in the statement then fallacious reasons would also be [non-reasons].

original: syān matam yasya pratiyogī dṛśyate tasyaiva pratihetubhāvāt ahetutvaṃ bhavatu /
analyzed: syāt matam yasya pratiyogī dṛśyate tasya eva pratihetu bhāvāt ahetu tvam bhavatu
translated: It may be argued that only that which has a perceptible counter-example can be a reason, and that which does not have a perceptible counter-example is in fact an impossible counter-reason.

original: yasya tu pratiyogī hetur na dṛśyate sa vastuta evāsambhavat pratihetuḥ /
analyzed: yasya tu pratiyogī hetuḥ na dṛśyate sa vastutas evā asambhavat pratihetuḥ
translated: For one whose counter-example is not seen, that is indeed a truly impossible counter-reason.

original: na hi tatra vastutaḥ pratihetusambhavaḥ śaṅkyate /🔽bādhakapratyayam antareṇa bādhāśaṅkāyā ayogāt / tad uktam
analyzed: na hi tatra vastutas prati hetu sambhavaḥ śaṅkyate  bādhaka pratyayam antareṇa bādhā śaṅkāyāḥ ayogāt tat uktam
translated: For there, the possibility of a counter-reason is not suspected in reality.🔽Because without a contradictory cognition, the suspicion of contradiction is not appropriate. That has been stated:

original: bādhājñāne tv anutpanne nāśaṅkāniṣpramāṇikā iti /
analyzed: bādhā jñāne tu anutpanne na āśaṅkā niṣpramāṇikā iti
translated: But when the knowledge of contradiction is not produced, the suspicion is baseless.

original: p / / ata āha tulye lakṣaṇe hi ityādi /
analyzed: atas āha tulye lakṣaṇe hi ityādi
translated: Therefore it is said: For, when the defining characteristic is the same... etc.

original: śaṅyamānapratihetunā tulyaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ darśanādarśanamātranimittāvinābhāvarūpaṃ yasya🔽tasmin dṛṣṭaḥ pratiyoginaḥ T / / pratihetor bbādhakasya sambhava sa yeśām api
analyzed: śaṅyamāna pratihetunā tulyam lakṣaṇam darśana adarśana mātra nimitta avinābhāva rūpam yasya  tasmin dṛṣṭaḥ pratiyoginaḥ pratihetoḥ sambhava sa api
translated: For one whose defining characteristic is the same as that of the suspected counter-reason, which is merely based on seeing and not seeing, in the form of invariable concomitance,🔽when a contradictory counter-reason, which is a refutation, is seen in that, it produces suspicion regarding the possibility of a counter-reason even in those

original: tattulyalakṣaṇānāṃ pratiyogī na dṛśyate teṣv api śaṅkāṃ pratihetusambhavaviṣayām utpādayati /
analyzed: tad tulya lakṣaṇānām pratiyogī na dṛśyate teṣu api śaṅkām prati hetu sambhava viṣayām utpādayati
translated: whose defining characteristic is the same as that, in whom a counter-example is not seen.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: adṛṣṭapratiyogino dṛṣṭapratiyogino viśeṣābhāvāt /
analyzed: adṛṣṭa pratiyoginaḥ dṛṣṭa pratiyoginaḥ viśeṣa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no difference between one whose counter-example is not seen and one whose counter-example is seen.

original: na hi tasyetareṇa kaścidviśeṣo 'sti /
analyzed: na hi tasya itareṇa kaścid viśeṣaḥ sti
translated: For there is no difference between that and the other.

original: yatas tatsambhavo na śaṅkyeta /
analyzed: yatas tad sambhavaḥ na śaṅkyeta
translated: Because the possibility of that [non-perception] is not suspected.

original: puruṣaśaktivaikalyādinā tu tadadarśanaṃsambhāvyeteti kim ucyate nāśaṅkā niḥpraṣpramāṇikā iti /
analyzed: puruṣa śakti vaikalya ādinā tu kim ucyate na āśaṅkā iti
translated: But the non-perception due to the deficiency of human power, etc., is conceivable. So what is said? That suspicion is groundless.

original: atha viśeṣaḥ pratibandhalakṣaṇo 'vinābhāvaniścāyako dṛṣṭapratihetor adṛṣṭapratiyogina iṣyate yataḥ pratiyogisambhavāśaṅkā 'stam upaiti /
analyzed: atha viśeṣaḥ pratibandha lakṣaṇaḥ vinābhāva niścāyakaḥ dṛṣṭa pratihetoḥ adṛṣṭa pratiyoginaḥ iṣyate yatas pratiyogi sambhava āśaṅkā stam upaiti
translated: Now, if a specific characteristic, which is the defining characteristic of invariable concomitance, is accepted for a seen counter-reason, which has an unseen counter-object, from which the doubt of the possibility of a counter-object ceases.

original: S / / tadā sati vā viśeṣe sa viśeṣo hetor lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: tadā sati vā viśeṣe sa viśeṣaḥ hetoḥ lakṣaṇam
translated: Then, if there is a specific characteristic, that specific characteristic is the defining characteristic of the reason.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: yatas tato viśeṣād dhetur ekāntena niścayena nirastapratipakṣas tathāvidhe dharmiṇi pratihetvasambhavāt
analyzed: yatas tatas viśeṣāt hetuḥ ekāntena niścayena nirasta pratipakṣaḥ tathāvidhe dharmiṇi prati hetu asambhavāt
translated: Because from that specific characteristic, the reason is ascertained with absolute certainty, with the counter-argument excluded, in that particular subject, due to the impossibility of a counter-reason.

original: svasādhyaṃ niścāyayatīti /
analyzed: sva sādhyam niścāyayati iti
translated: It ascertains its own conclusion.

original: yas tathāvidho na bhavati tadviśeṣavirahāt dṛṣṭapratihetuḥ so 'tallakṣaṇo na hetuḥ syāt /
analyzed: yaḥ tathāvidhaḥ na bhavati tad viśeṣa virahāt dṛṣṭa pratihetuḥ saḥ tad lakṣaṇaḥ na hetuḥ syāt
translated: And if it is not of that kind, due to the absence of that specific characteristic, that seen counter-reason, which lacks that characteristic, would not be a reason.

original: tathā ca yadi nāmā 'hetau pratihetur dṛṣṭo /
analyzed: tathā ca yadi nāmā hetau pratihetuḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: And in that case, if a counter-reason is seen in a non-reason,

original: hetoḥ kim āyātam /
analyzed: hetoḥ kim āyātam
translated: what has happened to the reason?

original: yena tannivṛttaye tatraikasaṃkhyāvivakśā kriyate /
analyzed: yena tad nivṛttaye tatra eka saṃkhyā vivakśā kriyate
translated: By what [means] is the number one excluded in that [case], in order to exclude that [counter-reason]?

original: yathoktāvinābhāvavacanenaiva tannivṛtter ity āha tathāca hetau tadviśeṣayogini pratihetvasambhave sati vyarthā niṣprayojanam ekasaṃkhyāvivakṣeti
analyzed: yathā ukta avinābhāva vacanena eva tad nivṛtteḥ iti āha tathā ca hetau tad viśeṣa yogini prati hetu asambhave sati vyarthā niṣprayojanam eka saṃkhyā vivakṣā iti
translated: By the statement of the invariable concomitance as stated, that [incompatibility] is excluded. Thus he says: And in that case, when there is no counter-reason in the reason that possesses that special property, the mention of the number one is pointless, without purpose.

original: T / / yathoktaviśeṣāṅgīkaraṇe tallakṣaṇasya pratihetor asambhavāt kasyaikasaṃkhyāvivakṣayā vyavacchedaḥ kriyate /
translated: When the special property as stated is accepted, since there is no counter-reason that has that definition, whose exclusion is made by the mention of the number one?

original: yato 'sya kāryakatvaṃ syād iti /
analyzed: yatas sya kāryaka tvam syāt iti
translated: From which there would be its effect.

original: viruddhāvyabhicāriṇaś ca hetvābhāsasya vyavacchedārtham ekasaṃkhyāvivakṣā hetulakṣaṇe kriyate /
analyzed: viruddha avyabhicāriṇaḥ ca hetvābhāsasya vyavaccheda artham eka saṃkhyā vivakṣā hetu lakṣaṇe kriyate
translated: And the mention of the number one is made in the definition of the reason in order to exclude the fallacious reason that is incompatible but non-deviating.

original: vastuto 'sambhavat pratihetutvasiddhye ca pratibandhalakṣaṇe viśeṣe hetāv iṣyamāṇe viruddhāvyabhicāry api hetvābhāso na S / / bhavati
analyzed: ca pratibandha lakṣaṇe viśeṣe hetau iṣyamāṇe viruddha avyabhicārī api hetvābhāsaḥ na bhavati
translated: And when the special property that is the characteristic of the restriction is accepted in the reason, even the fallacious reason that is incompatible but non-deviating does not occur.

original: tato vyavacchedyābhāvāt kim ekasaṃkhyāvivakṣayā /
analyzed: tatas vyavacchedya abhāvāt kim eka saṃkhyā vivakṣayā
translated: Therefore, since there is nothing to be excluded, what is the use of mentioning the number one?

original: iti darśayann āha ataḥ pratibandhalakṣaṇaviśeṣopagamāt viruddhāvyabhicāriṇo hetvābhāsasya yallakṣaṇaṃtad dhīyeta na sambhavet /
analyzed: iti darśayan āha atas pratibandha lakṣaṇa viśeṣa upagamāt viruddha avyabhicāriṇaḥ hetvābhāsasya yat lakṣaṇam tat dhīyeta na sambhavet
translated: Showing this, he says: Therefore, since the special property that is the characteristic of the restriction is accepted, the definition of the fallacious reason that is incompatible but non-deviating would be eliminated, it would not occur.

original: kiṃ punas tadviruddhāvyabhicāriṇo lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: kim punar tad viruddha avyabhicāriṇaḥ lakṣaṇam
translated: What, again, is the definition of the contradictory-non-pervasion?
