original: ity āha svalakṣaṇa ityādi /🔽hetor yadātmīyaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ tadyuktayor hetvor p / /ekatra dharmiṇi virodhena
analyzed: iti āha sva lakṣaṇe ityādi  hetoḥ yat ātmīyam lakṣaṇam tad yuktayoḥ hetvoḥ dharmiṇi virodhena
translated: He says: In the case of the own characteristic, etc.🔽When the two reasons, which are connected with the characteristic of the reason, are in contradiction with each other,

original: parasparaviruddhasādhyasādhakatvenopanipāte sati viruddhāvyabhicārīti viruddhāvyabhicāriṇo lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: paraspara viruddha sādhya sādhaka tvena upanipāte sati viruddha avyabhicāri iti viruddha avyabhicāriṇaḥ lakṣaṇam
translated: and when they come together as proving and disproving the same probandum, then it is the contradictory-non-pervasion. This is the definition of the contradictory-non-pervasion.

original: na ca tat pratibandhāṅgīkaraṇe sati sambhavati /🔽na hi tādātmyatadutpattibhyāṃ svasādhyapratibandhavaty ekatra hetau kvaciddharmiṇi saṃbhavati dvitīyas tallakṣaṇas tatraiva hetuḥ sambhavet /
analyzed: na ca tat pratibandha aṅgīkaraṇe sati sambhavati  na hi tādātmya tad utpattibhyām sva sādhya pratibandhavati ekatra hetau kvacid dharmiṇi saṃbhavati dvitīyaḥ tad lakṣaṇaḥ tatra eva hetuḥ sambhavet
translated: And that is not possible when the relation is accepted.🔽For when one reason, which has the relation with its own probandum through identity or origination, is possible in a certain substratum, a second reason with that same characteristic cannot be possible there.

original: T / / bhāvānāṃ viruddhasvabhāvadvayāsambhavāt /
translated: Because two mutually contradictory natures cannot exist in things.

original: viruddhadharmādhyāsasya bhedalakṣaṇatvāt /
analyzed: viruddha dharma adhyāsasya bheda lakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Because the superimposition of contradictory properties is the characteristic of difference.

original: tadavyabhicāriṇo hetor dvitīyasya tatra kutaḥ sambhavāvakāśa iti /
analyzed: tad avyabhicāriṇaḥ hetoḥ dvitīyasya tatra kutas sambhava avakāśaḥ iti
translated: So where is the possibility of a second reason, which is non-deviating from that, being possible there?

original: nanu yadi tathāvidhaviśeṣasambhave S / / sati viruddhāvyabhicārilakṣaṇaṃ hīyate /
analyzed: nanu yadi tathāvidha viśeṣa sambhave sati viruddha avyabhicāri lakṣaṇam hīyate
translated: But if such a particular is possible, then the definition of the contradictory-non-pervasion is lost.

original: ekasaṃkhyāvivakṣā vā vyārthā /
analyzed: eka saṃkhyā vivakṣā vā
translated: Or the expression of the number one is meaningless.

original: tathāpi naiva hetvabhāvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api nā eva hetu abhāva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Even so, there is no non-existence of the reason.

original: tat kim uktaṃ hetvabhāvo vety ata āha na ca naiva tasya viśeṣasya pratibandhalakṣaṇasya /
analyzed: tat kim uktam hetu abhāvaḥ vā iti atas āha na ca nā eva tasya viśeṣasya pratibandha lakṣaṇasya
translated: Then what is said, that there is non-existence of the reason? To this he says: No, there is not at all of that special characteristic of the relation.

original: yato vastuto 'sambhavat pratihetutvaṃ niścīyate /🔽svarūpaṃ tādātmyatadutpattilakṣaṇaṃ nirddeśyate bhavadbhiḥ yathā 'smābhir nirdiṣṭaṃ ydrūpaṃ pratītya pratipadya pratiyoginaḥ sambhavāsambhavāu
analyzed: yatas sambhavat pratihetu tvam niścīyate  svarūpam tādātmya tad utpatti lakṣaṇam nirddeśyate bhavadbhiḥ yathā smābhiḥ nirdiṣṭam pratītya pratipadya pratiyoginaḥ sambhava asambhavau
translated: From which the impossibility of a counter-reason is ascertained.

original: utpaśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: utpaśyāmaḥ
translated: The nature which is characterized by identity and origination is indicated by you as indicated by us, by which form, having understood, we see the possibility and impossibility of the counter-entity.

original: yatra sa viśeṣo nāsti tatra pratiyoginaḥ sambhavaḥ kalpita āgamāśraye 'numāne /
analyzed: yatra sa viśeṣaḥ nā asti tatra pratiyoginaḥ sambhavaḥ kalpitaḥ āgama āśraye numāne
translated: Where that special characteristic does not exist, there the possibility of the counter-entity is imagined in inference based on scripture.

original: yatra tv asti sa viśeṣo vastubalapravṛtte 'numāne tatra pratiyogino 'sambhava iti
analyzed: yatra tu asti sa viśeṣaḥ vastu bala pravṛtte numāne tatra sambhavaḥ iti
translated: But where that special characteristic exists, in inference proceeding by the power of reality, there is the impossibility of the counter-entity.

original: yata evaṃ tasmān nāsty eva bhavatāṃ sa viśeṣaḥ bhavadbhir na jñāyata eva sa viśeṣa
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt na asti eva bhavatām sa viśeṣaḥ bhavadbhiḥ na jñāyate eva sa viśeṣa
translated: Since it is so, therefore that special characteristic does not exist for you at all. You do not know that special characteristic at all.

original: tasmātsarvatra yatrāpi pratiyogī na dṛśyate tatrāpi ṣāṅkyā pratiyogiviṣayayā bhavitavyam /
analyzed: iti   yatra api pratiyogī na dṛśyate tatra api ṣāṅkyā pratiyogi viṣayayā bhavitavyam
translated: Therefore, everywhere, even where the counter-entity is not seen, there also there must be doubt regarding the counter-entity.

original: tām eva śaṅkhāṃ draḍhyann āha
analyzed: tām eva śaṅkhām draḍhyan āha
translated: Strengthening that very doubt, he says:

original: dṛṣṭapratihetor api ityādi /🔽yasyāpi S / / hi pratihetur dṛṣṭas tasyāpi prāk pratiyogidarśanād itareṇa sarvakālam🔽adṛṣṭapratiyoginā kaścid viśeṣo lakṣyate T / / yaddarśanāj jñāyeta atra pratiyogī
analyzed: dṛṣṭa pratihetoḥ api ityādi  yasya api hi pratihetuḥ dṛṣṭaḥ tasya api prāk pratiyogi darśanāt itareṇa sarvakālam  adṛṣṭa pratiyoginā kaścid viśeṣaḥ lakṣyate t yad darśanāt jñāyeta atra pratiyogī
translated: Even in the case of a seen counter-reason, etc.

original: sambhavati nyānyatra iti darśanādarśanamātranibandhanayor anvayavyatirekayoḥ sarvatra samānatvāt /
analyzed: iti darśana adarśana mātra nibandhanayoḥ anvaya vyatirekayoḥ sarvatra samāna tvāt
translated: Even for one who has seen a counter-reason, before seeing the counter-correlate, for the other, who has never seen the counter-correlate, some distinction is observed, by seeing which it would be known that the counter-correlate is possible here, not elsewhere. Because seeing and not seeing are equally present everywhere, being based merely on seeing and not seeing.

original: tathāpi paścāt tatra pratiyogī dṛṣṭa iti sarvatra tattulyalakṣaṇe pratiyogisadbhāvaśaṅkā na vivarttata iti /
analyzed: tathā api paścāt tatra pratiyogī dṛṣṭaḥ iti sarvatra tad tulya lakṣaṇe pratiyogi sadbhāva śaṅkā na vivarttate iti
translated: Still, later, when the counter-correlate is seen there, the doubt of the existence of the counter-correlate does not arise everywhere in what has similar characteristics.

original: syān matam yeṣu pratiyogī sambhavati teṣvaśyam eva kadācid asāv upalabhyate /
analyzed: syāt matam yeṣu pratiyogī sambhavati teṣu aśyam eva kadācid asau upalabhyate
translated: It may be thought: In those where the counter-correlate is possible, it is certainly perceived at some time.

original: yeṣu tu puruṣāyuṣeṇāpi nopalabhyate trṣv asau p / / nāsty eva /
analyzed: yeṣu tu puruṣa āyuṣeṇa api na upalabhyate asau na asti eva
translated: But in those where it is not perceived even in a human lifetime, it does not exist at all.

original: tataḥ sa tathāvidho hetur bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas sa tathāvidhaḥ hetuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, that of such a kind will be the reason.

original: tat kathaṃ hetvabhāvo 'smākam /
analyzed: tat katham hetu abhāvaḥ smākam
translated: How then is there absence of reason for us?

original: ity ata āha na ca ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha na ca ityādi
translated: To this he says And it is not, etc.

original: yeṣām api hi pratihetuḥ sambhavati teṣām api naiva sarvadā tasya pratihetor upalabdhiḥ pratipattṛṛṇām /
analyzed: yeṣām api hi pratihetuḥ sambhavati teṣām api nā eva sarvadā tasya pratihetoḥ upalabdhiḥ pratipattṛṇām
translated: Even in the case of those [reasons] for which a counter-reason is possible, the comprehenders do not always perceive that counter-reason.

original: na hy asarvadarśinām upalabdhiḥ sarvabhāvasattāṃ vyāpnoti /
analyzed: na hi asarva darśinām upalabdhiḥ sarva bhāva sattām vyāpnoti
translated: For the perception of those who do not see everything does not pervade the existence of all things.

original: pratibandhavaikalyasadbhāvāt /🔽nanu ca yatra sarvadaiva pratipatrāttrā
analyzed: pratibandha vaikalya sadbhāvāt  nanu ca yatra sarvadā eva
translated: Because there is a deficiency in the restriction.

original: pratiyogī na dṛśyate tatra tadāśaṅkā S / / kathaṃ kriyate / / tathā cāha
analyzed: pratiyogī na dṛśyate tatra tad āśaṅkā katham kriyate tathā ca āha
translated: But how is that doubt created in the case where the counter-correlate is never seen by the comprehenders?

original: bādhadhājñāne tv anutpanne nāśaṅkāniṣpramāṇikā iti /
analyzed: tu anutpanne na āśaṅkā niṣpramāṇikāḥ iti
translated: And thus he says: But when the cognition of contradiction has not arisen, the doubt is groundless.

original: tathā 'param
analyzed: tathā param
translated: Similarly, another [says]:

original: śiṣyaparamparayākumārilotpādāt prāgdṛṣṭapratiyogiṣūpanyasteṣu /
analyzed: śiṣya paramparayā ā kumārila utpādāt prāk dṛṣṭa pratiyogiṣu upanyasteṣu
translated: From the time of Kumārila's birth, the counter-correlates that were seen were presented [to him].

original: tenaiva prajñātiśayaśāktinā pratihetava utprekṣitāḥ tatas taddarśanāt yāvaj jīvaṃ adṛṣṭapratihetuṣv api tadāśaṅkā nivarttate /
analyzed: tena eva prajñā atiśaya śāktinā pratihetavaḥ utprekṣitāḥ tatas tad darśanāt yāvajjīvam adṛṣṭa pratihetuṣu api tad āśaṅkā nivarttate
translated: By that very one with the power of superior wisdom, the counter-reasons were imagined. Then, from seeing that, even in the case of those counter-reasons that were not seen all one's life, the doubt about them is removed.

original: tataḥ katham āśaṅkā niṣpramāṇikocyate / /
analyzed: tatas katham āśaṅkā niṣpramāṇikā ucyate
translated: How then is it said that the doubt is groundless?

original: tulyalakṣaṇe hi ityādikam api pratiyogisambhavāśaṅkākāraṇam uktam eva /
analyzed: tulya lakṣaṇe hi ityādikam api pratiyogi sambhava āśaṅkā kāraṇam uktam eva
translated: And the cause of the doubt about the possibility of a counter-correlate, such as in what has similar characteristics, etc., has been stated.

original: na ca pratiyogisambhavam āśaṅkamānas tannimittasaṃbhavāt utprekṣeta hi ityādyākrośamātrea nivarttayituṃ śakyate /
analyzed: na ca pratiyogi sambhavam āśaṅkamānaḥ tad nimitta saṃbhavāt utprekṣeta hi nivarttayitum śakyate
translated: And one who suspects the possibility of a counter-correlate cannot infer on the basis of the possibility of that cause. For mere accusation like you are not to be trusted cannot be refuted.

original: tenāsyapratiyogyāśaṅkāpanodakṣaṃ kiñcit kāraṇam abhidhānīyam yathā 'smābhir
analyzed: kiñcid kāraṇam abhidhānīyam yathā smābhiḥ
translated: Therefore, some reason must be stated by him to remove the suspicion of a counter-correlate, as we have stated.

original: abhihitaṃ svabhāvahetor viparyaye bādhakapramāṇavaśād ātmyaniścaye saty anvayavyatirekayos tatra nirṇaya /
analyzed: abhihitam svabhāva hetoḥ viparyaye bādhaka pramāṇa vaśāt ātmya niścaye sati anvaya vyatirekayoḥ tatra nirṇaya
translated: For the reason based on nature, when the ascertainment of the nature is due to the force of the proving means that contradicts it, the determination of the positive and negative concomitance is there.

original: S / / kāryahetau ca yathoktapratyakṣānupalambhataḥ kāryakāraṇasiddhes tanniścaya iti /
analyzed: kārya hetau ca yathā ukta pratyakṣa anupalambhataḥ kārya kāraṇa siddheḥ tad niścayaḥ iti
translated: And in the case of the reason based on effect, the ascertainment is from the ascertainment of the cause and effect by the perception and non-apprehension as stated.

original: yata evaṃ sarvatra pratiyogyāśaṅkā na nivarttate bhavad darśane tena kāraṇāniścayaḥ pratiyoginaḥ sambhavayoḥ iha pratiyogī sambhavati iha
analyzed: yatas evam sarvatra pratiyogi āśaṅkā na nivarttate bhavat darśane tena kāraṇa aniścayaḥ pratiyoginaḥ sambhavayoḥ iha pratiyogī sambhavati iha
translated: Since thus the suspicion of a counter-correlate is not removed everywhere in your view, therefore the reason is uncertain due to the possibility of a counter-correlate. Here the counter-correlate is possible, but

original: tu na sambhavati ity evaṃrūpa
analyzed: tu na sambhavati iti evaṃrūpaḥ iti
translated: here it is not possible. In this form,

original: tasmādvastuto 'sambhavat pratihetutvaṃ p / / yallakṣaṇam hetoḥ T / / tasyāniścitatvād ekasaṃkhyāvivakśāv ādināṃ na kaściddhetuḥ 🔽syāt /
analyzed: sambhavat pratihetutvam hetoḥ t tasya aniścita tvāt eka saṃkhyā vivakśau ādinām na kaścid hetuḥ 🔽syāt
translated: Therefore, the reason which has the characteristic of being incapable of being contradicted in reality, that is uncertain. Therefore, due to the absence of the specification of the number one etc., there would be no reason at all.

original: na hy aniścitalakṣaṇo hetur bhavatīty upasaṃhāra iti /
analyzed: na hi aniścita lakṣaṇaḥ hetuḥ bhavati iti upasaṃhāraḥ iti
translated: For a reason is not one whose characteristic is not ascertained. This is the conclusion.

original: tad evaṃ kiṃ yo vastuto 'sambhavatpratihetuḥ sa samyagjñānaviparyayahetur iṣṭaḥ
analyzed: tat evam kim yaḥ vastutas sambhavat pratihetuḥ sa samyak jñāna viparyaya hetuḥ iṣṭaḥ
translated: Thus, is it accepted that one who is actually without a counter-reason is the cause of the reversal of correct knowledge?

original: iti amuṃ vikalpaṃ nirākṛtya dvitīyaṃ vikalpaṃ nirācikīrṣur āha athāpradarśitapratihetuḥ
analyzed: iti amum vikalpam nirākṛtya dvitīyam vikalpam nirācikīrṣuḥ āha atha apradarśita pratihetuḥ
translated: Having refuted this alternative, wishing to refute the second alternative, he says: If it is accepted that one who does not show a counter-reason

original: samyagjñānaviviparyayahetur iṣṭa iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: samyak jñāna viviparyaya hetuḥ iṣṭaḥ iti sambandhaḥ
translated: is the cause of the reversal of correct knowledge, this is the connection.

original: ayaṃ ca pakṣaḥ kiladiṅnāgācāryasyāpy abhimata iti para upadarśayann āha yathāha diṅnāgācāryaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca pakṣaḥ kila diṅnāga ācāryasya api abhimataḥ iti paraḥ upadarśayan āha yathā āha diṅnāga ācāryaḥ
translated: And this position is also accepted by the teacher Diṅnāga, thus the opponent shows:

original: kim āha / yadātarhi ityādi /
analyzed: kim āha yadā tarhi ityādi
translated: What does he say? He says when... and so on.

original: śrāvaṇatvasya hi na kathañcidvyavacchedahetutvam iti diṅnāgācāryeṇokte pareṇābhihitam🔽yadātarhivaiyākāraṇaḥśabdatvaṃsāmānyaviśeṣaṃnityam abhyupagacchati tadā'yaṃśrāvaṇatvalakṣaṇaḥpakṣadharmaḥhetur eva syāt /
analyzed: śrāvaṇa tvasya hi na kathañcid vyavaccheda hetu tvam iti diṅnāga ācāryeṇa ukte pareṇa abhihitam  yadā tarhi vaiyākāraṇaḥ śabda tvam sāmānya viśeṣam nityam abhyupagacchati tadā ayam śrāvaṇa tva lakṣaṇaḥ pakṣa dharmaḥ hetuḥ eva syāt
translated: For audibility is never the cause of exclusion, thus it was said by the teacher Diṅnāga. When this was said by the opponent, it was said:🔽When one accepts the universal property of sound, which is not a cause, as eternal, then this reason characterized by audibility, which is a property of the subject, would be just a reason.

original: nityaḥśabdaḥśrāvaṇatvātśabdatvavat ity evaṃ pareṇokte satyācāryeṇoktam yady atraśabdākhye
analyzed: nityaḥ śabdaḥ śrāvaṇa tvāt śabda tva vat iti evam pareṇa ukte sati ācāryeṇa uktam yadi atraśabda ākhye
translated: Sound is eternal because it is audible, like sound, thus when this was said by the opponent, the teacher said: If here in the case of what is called sound,

original: dharmiṇy anityatvahetuṃkṛtakatvaprayatnānantarīyakatvādilakṣaṇaṃ kaścidvaiśeṣikādir🔽na darśayet tadā'yam pradarśitapratihetur hetur
analyzed: dharmiṇī anitya tva hetuṃkṛtaka tva prayatna ānantarīyaka tva ādi lakṣaṇam kaścid vaiśeṣika ādiḥ  na tadā ayam pradarśita pratihetuḥ hetuḥ
translated: If someone like a Vaisheshika does not show the property-possessor characterized by the reason impermanence, such as being produced, being a product, being subsequent to an effort, etc.,

original: eva bhavet iti /
analyzed: eva bhavet iti
translated: then this exhibited counter-reason would be a reason.

original: tad evamācāryāpadaiḥsākṣitve datte mujam utkṣipya śāstrakāraḥ pūtkurvannāha idānīmityādi /
analyzed: tat datte mujam utkṣipya śāstra kāraḥ idam
translated: Thus, having given the teacher's word as a witness, the author of the treatise, raising his eyebrows, says now and so on, in order to praise.

original: hyācāryasyāpyetad abhimatam iti T / / kaiścidvyākhyāyate tadidaṃsumahadvyasanam āyatam gurubhir abhihitatvād aprakāśyam /
analyzed: yadā abhimatam iti t kaiścid vyākhyāyate āyatam gurubhiḥ abhihita tvāt aprakāśyam
translated: This is explained by some as follows: This is the very great misfortune, extended, that is not to be revealed because it is stated by the teachers.

original: na hi gurūṇāṃ doṣaḥ prakāśayituṃ yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na hi gurūṇām doṣaḥ prakāśayitum yuktaḥ
translated: For it is not proper to reveal the faults of the teachers.

original: nyāyam anupālayadbhiḥ asaṃvaraṇīyam apracchādanīyam /
analyzed: nyāyam anupālayadbhiḥ asaṃvaraṇīyam apracchādanīyam
translated: By those who follow the logic, it is not to be concealed, not to be covered up.

original: tat kiṃ gurūndūṣayāma uta apy upekṣāmaheity apy aśakyamiti kaṣṭataraṃvyasanaṃkatham nirvoḍhuṃśakyeta / /
analyzed: tat kim uta nyāyam api ubhayam api kaṣṭataram vyasanam katham nirvoḍhum śakyeta
translated: So how can this most difficult misfortune be borne?

original: na kathaṃcid iti /
analyzed: na kathaṃcid iti
translated: Not in any way.

original: kaḥ punar atra doṣo yenedaṃ kaṣṭataram ity āha sa tāvad ayaṃ śrāvaṇatvalakṣaṇo
analyzed: kaḥ punar atra doṣaḥ yena idam kaṣṭataram iti āha sa tāvat ayam śrāvaṇa tva lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: What is the fault here, by which this is more difficult? He says: This characteristic of audibility, which is the reason for the non-eternality of sound, is not established.

original: hetur vastuni śabdādīni tattvamnityatvaṃ tatprakṛtīni tadātmakāni
analyzed: hetuḥ vastuni śabda ādīni tad prakṛtīni tad ātmakāni
translated: The reason is the entity, sound etc. The truth is eternality, those are its nature, those are its essence.

original: kṛtvā S / / tacchrāvaṇatvaṃ pramāṇaṃ yeṣāṃ
analyzed: kṛtvā tat śrāvaṇa tvam pramāṇam yeṣām
translated: Having done so, the audibility of that is the means of knowledge for those🔽persons, such as Mīmāṃsakas and grammarians, etc., having connected them with

original: puruṣāṇāṃmīmāṃsakavaiyākaraṇadīnāṃ tān p / / abhyudayena svarggeṇa niḥśreyasena cāpavarggeṇa yojayitvā /
analyzed: puruṣāṇām mīmāṃsaka vaiyākaraṇa dīnām tān abhyudayena svarggeṇa niḥśreyasena ca apavarggeṇa yojayitvā
translated: prosperity, heaven, and with the highest good, liberation.

original: tathā hi vastutattvaṃ yāvan kleśān na prajahāti tāvat svargamāsādayati /
analyzed: tathā hi vastu tattvam yāvan kleśān na prajahāti tāvat svargam āsādayati
translated: For thus, as long as one does not abandon the afflictions, one attains heaven,

original: kleśāṃs tu prajahan nirvāṇaparāyaṇo bhavati /
analyzed: kleśān tu prajahan nirvāṇa parāyaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: but abandoning the afflictions, one becomes intent on nirvana.

original: athavā śabdanityatvapratītau vedaprāmāṇyāt tadvahitāgnihotrānuṣṭhānātsvarggo vedāntaniṣevaṇād apavarggaḥ /
analyzed: athavā śabda nitya tva pratītau veda prāmāṇyāt vedānta niṣevaṇāt apavarggaḥ
translated: Or, from the establishment of the eternality of sound, from the authoritativeness of the Veda, from the performance of the Agnihotra enjoined by it, there is heaven, and from the study of the Vedanta, there is liberation.

original: punar uttarakālaṃ pratibhāvatā prajñājātīyenavaiśeṣikādinā puruṣeṇa hetvantarasya
analyzed: punar uttara kālam prajñā jātīyena vaiśeṣika ādinā puruṣeṇa
translated: Again, later, by a person who is intelligent, who has the nature of wisdom, such as a Vaiśeṣika, by showing a counter-reason

original: T / / pratihetoḥ nidarśanena yad asya nityatvasādhanasāmarthya pratihetvanupadarśanesatyāsīt
analyzed: t pratihetoḥ nidarśanena yat asya nitya tva sādhana sāmarthya
translated: for the capacity of that to establish eternality, which existed when the counter-reason was not shown,

original: tadupadarśanenautkīlitam apanītam iti /
analyzed: apanītam iti
translated: that is removed, that is taken away, by showing it.

original: tāni vastūni nityatvasampadaḥ pracyāvya /
analyzed: tāni vastūni nitya tva sampadaḥ pracyāvya
translated: Those entities are removed from the possession of eternality.

original: tāṃś ca tatpramāṇakānpuruṣān svarggāpavarggasampadaḥ pracyāvya śrāvaṇatvalakṣaṇo hetuḥ śaktivaikalyāt paritrātum aśakto bhraṣṭarājya iva
analyzed: tān ca svargga apavargga sampadaḥ pracyāvya śrāvaṇa tva lakṣaṇaḥ hetuḥ śakti vaikalyāt paritrātum aśaktaḥ bhraṣṭa rājyaḥ iva
translated: And having deprived those men, whose validity is based on that (scripture), of the wealth of heaven and final beatitude, the reason in the form of being heard, being unable to save (them) due to lack of power, is like a king who has lost his kingdom.

original: rājā tapovanaṃ gacchati
analyzed: rājā tapovanam gacchati
translated: And having deprived those men, whose validity is based on that (scripture), of the wealth of heaven and final beatitude, the reason characterized by being heard, being unable to save (them) due to lack of power, goes to the penance grove like a king who has lost his kingdom,🔽saying, It is by my own misdeeds (that this has happened).

original: svair eva duścaritairiti kim atra vayaṃ brūmaḥ / /
analyzed: svaiḥ eva kim atra vayam brūmaḥ
translated: What do we say in this matter?

original: tad evam upahasyaitasmin pakṣe S / / doṣam upadarśayann āha puruṣapratibhā ityādi /
analyzed: tat evam upahasya etasmin pakṣe s doṣam upadarśayan āha puruṣa pratibhā ityādi
translated: Thus, having ridiculed this view, pointing out the fault, he says the power of the person and so on.

original: yadā hy apradarśitapratihetur hetur iṣyate tadā puruṣapratibhākṛtaṃ sādhanatvam abhyupagataṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yadā hi apradarśita pratihetuḥ hetuḥ iṣyate tadā puruṣa pratibhā kṛtam sādhana tvam abhyupagatam bhavati
translated: When a reason is accepted as being one for which a counter-reason is not shown, then the state of being a proof is accepted as being due to the power of the person.

original: tataś ca vastuto na kiñcit sādhanam asādhanaṃ vā prāptam /
analyzed: tatas ca vastutas na kiñcid sādhanam asādhanam vā prāptam
translated: And therefore, nothing is actually obtained as a proof or non-proof.

original: tathā hi yadā pratihetur nopadarśyate tadā sādhanam /
analyzed: tathā hi yadā pratihetuḥ na upadarśyate tadā sādhanam
translated: For example, when a counter-reason is not shown, then it is a proof.

original: yadā tūpadarśyate tadā na sādhanam iti puruṣapratibhākṛtaṃ sādhanatvam āyātam iti /
analyzed: yadā tu upadarśyate tadā na sādhanam iti puruṣa pratibhā kṛtam sādhana tvam āyātam iti
translated: But when it is shown, then it is not a proof. Thus, the state of being a proof comes to be due to the power of the person.

original: api ca apradarśitapratihetor hetor hetutve 'ṅgīkriyamāṇe vikalpadvayam kiṃ paramārthato hetus taddharmabhāvī /
analyzed: api ca apradarśita pratihetoḥ hetoḥ hetu tve ṅgīkriyamāṇe vikalpa dvayam kim paramārthataḥ hetuḥ tad dharma bhāvī
translated: Moreover, when a reason for which a counter-reason is not shown is accepted as being a reason, there are two alternatives. Is the reason in reality one that has the property to be proved,🔽or is it one that does not have the property to be proved?

original: utā 'taddharmabhāvīti / /
analyzed: uta ā tad dharma bhāvi iti
translated: And also because it has the nature of that [property to be established].

original: tatrādyaṃ vikalpam adhikṛtyāha sa ca hetur yo 'sau prathamaṃ upādīyate /
analyzed: tatra ādyam vikalpam adhikṛtya āha sa ca hetuḥ yaḥ sau prathamam upādīyate
translated: Regarding the first alternative, it is said: That reason which is first taken up,

original: sa yadi svabhāvataḥ eva tasmin sādhyadharme satyeva bhavati ity evaṃśīlo 'smad upavarṇitapratibandhopagamāt
analyzed: sa yadi svabhāvataḥ eva tasmin sādhya dharme sati eva bhavati iti evaṃśīlaḥ smat upavarṇita pratibandha upagamāt
translated: if it has the nature of only occurring when that property to be established is present, in such a way that it has that nature, due to accepting the restriction described by us,

original: T / / yadīṣyate tadākatham anyathākriyeta hetvantareṇātaddharmabhāvī kathaṃ kriyate / /
analyzed: t yadi iṣyate tadā akatham anyathā kriyeta hetu antareṇa a tad dharma bhāvī katham kriyate
translated: if that is accepted, then how could it be made otherwise by another reason? How could one having the nature of not having that [property to be established] be made?

original: na kathañcit /
analyzed: na kathañcid
translated: In no way at all.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: vastūnāṃ S / / hetulakṣaṇānāṃ yaḥ svabhāvaḥ saty eva sādhyadharme bhavanātmakaḥ
analyzed: vastūnām s hetu lakṣaṇānām yaḥ svabhāvaḥ sati eva sādhya dharme bhavana ātmakaḥ
translated: The nature of things that have the characteristic of reasons is such that they occur only when the property to be established is present.

original: tadanyathābhāvasya tadviparyayasya abhāvād ubhayoś ca svasādhyadharmāvinābhāvitve
analyzed: tad anyathābhāvasya tad viparyayasya abhāvāt ubhayoḥ ca sva sādhya dharma avinābhāvi tve
translated: Because the other state, which is the opposite of that, does not exist, and because both have the nature of not being absent from their own property to be established,

original: p / / svabhāvata eva dharmiṇy ekatra tayor bhāve viruddāv ubhau svabhāvāv ekasya syātām /
analyzed: svabhāvataḥ eva dharmiṇī ekatra tayoḥ bhāve viruddau ubhau svabhāvau ekasya syātām
translated: if they exist in one substratum by their own nature, then both of those contradictory natures would belong to one [thing].

original: na caikasya viruddhau svabhāvau sambhavataḥ /
analyzed: na ca ekasya viruddhau svabhāvau sambhavataḥ
translated: And two contradictory natures cannot belong to one [thing].

original: viruddhadharmādhyāsena tasyaikatvahāniprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: viruddha dharma adhyāsena tasya ekatva hāni prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if contradictory properties are superimposed, it would follow that it loses its oneness.

original: atha dvitīyo vikalpas tadā ataddharmabhāvīca
analyzed: atha dvitīyaḥ vikalpaḥ
translated: If the second alternative is accepted, then [the reason] would not have the property of the probandum,

original: asaty api sādhyadharme bhavanaśīlaḥ pratibandhānabhyupagamāt katham anyadā'pi apradarśitapratihetvavasthāyām api sādhanaṃkasyacit / /
analyzed: asati api sādhya dharme bhavana śīlaḥ pratibandha anabhyupagamāt katham anyadā api apradarśita prati hetu avasthāyām api sādhanam kasyacid
translated: and would be prone to occur even in the absence of the property to be proved, because the restriction [of the reason to the presence of the probandum] is not accepted. How then can the proof ever be valid, even when the counter-example is not shown?

original: naiva tadāpi sādhanam /
analyzed: na eva tadā api sādhanam
translated: It is not a proof even then.

original: na kevalaṃ pradarśitapratihetvavasthāyām iti /
analyzed: na kevalam pradarśita prati hetu avasthāyām iti
translated: Not only when the counter-example is shown.

original: upasaṃharann āha tasmāt savabhāvataḥ ityādi /
analyzed: upasaṃharan āha tasmāt sava bhāvataḥ ityādi
translated: Concluding, he says Therefore, by its own nature... and so on.

original: yata evaṃ bhāvānāṃ svabhāvo 'nyathā kartuṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: yatas evam bhāvānām svabhāvaḥ nyathā kartum na śakyate
translated: Since the nature of things cannot be made otherwise in this way,

original: viruddhobhayasvabhāvaś caiko na sambhavati tasmāt paramārthataḥ svena svena S / / /
analyzed: viruddha ubhaya svabhāvaḥ ca ekaḥ na sambhavati tasmāt paramārthataḥ svena svena
translated: and one cannot have a nature that is both contradictory and non-contradictory, therefore in reality, by its own nature, the reason is not inconclusive.🔽The effect and nature reasons, which are inseparable from the probandum as stated, have a characteristic that

original: sādhyenāvinābhāvinor yathoktalakṣaṇayoḥ T / / kāryasvabhāvahetvoḥ tallakṣaṇasya
analyzed: sādhyena avinābhāvinoḥ yathā ukta lakṣaṇayoḥ t kārya svabhāva hetvoḥ tad lakṣaṇasya
translated: is the characteristic of being an effect or nature reason.

original: kāryasvabhāvalakṣaṇasya pratihetor asambhavād alakṣaṇam ekasaṃkhyāvivakṣā vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvaṃ
analyzed: kārya svabhāva lakṣaṇasya pratihetoḥ asambhavāt alakṣaṇam eka saṃkhyā vivakṣā vivakṣita eka saṃkhya tvam
translated: Because a counter-reason with that characteristic is impossible, the specification of a single number is not intended. The intended specification of a single number

original: lakṣaṇam na bhavati /
analyzed: lakṣaṇam na bhavati
translated: is not a characteristic.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: ity āha vyavacchedyābhāvād iti /
analyzed: iti āha vyavacchedya abhāvāt iti
translated: He says because there is nothing to be excluded.

original: pratihetur hi vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvasya vyavacchedyo varṇyate /
analyzed: pratihetuḥ hi vivakṣita eka saṃkhya tvasya vyavacchedyaḥ varṇyate
translated: For the counter-reason is described as what is to be excluded from the intended singularity of the reason.

original: sa ca pratihetuḥ svalakṣaṇayuktayoḥ kāryasvabhāvayor na bhavaty eveti kathaṃ taddhetulakṣaṇaṃ syād iti /
analyzed: sa ca pratihetuḥ sva lakṣaṇa yuktayoḥ kārya svabhāvayoḥ na bhavati eva iti katham tat hetu lakṣaṇam syāt iti
translated: And that counter-reason does not occur for the two, effect and nature, which are endowed with their own characteristics. So how could it be the characteristic of a reason?

original: tad evam anayor dvayo rūpayor yaḥ sambhavo yathoktāvinābhāvā 'sambhave satīti rūpāntaropagame 'pi hetvābhāsataiveti hetvābhāsās tato 'para
analyzed: tat evam anayoḥ dvayoḥ rūpayoḥ yaḥ sambhavaḥ yathā ukta avinābhāvā sambhave sati iti rūpa antara upagame hetvābhāsa tā eva iti hetvābhāsāḥ
translated: Thus, when there is the possibility of these two forms, as stated, in the absence of invariable concomitance, even when another form is accepted, it is still a fallacious reason. Therefore, fallacious reasons are not other than those.

original: iti ity asyārtho vivṛta iti /
analyzed: iti iti asya arthaḥ vivṛtaḥ iti
translated: Thus, the meaning of this [verse] has been explained.

original: jñātatvanirākaraṇāyāha jñānaṃpunaḥ ityādi /
analyzed: jñāta tva nirākaraṇāya āha jñānam punar ityādi
translated: In order to refute the idea that [invariable concomitance] is known, he says knowledge, etc.

original: abādhitaviṣayatvaṃ vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvaṃ ca kāryasvabhāvahetvor evāvinābhāve sati🔽bādhāpratihetvor asambhavāt vyavacchedyābhāvatvena saty api liṅgadharmatve tallakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: abādhita viṣaya tvam vivakṣita eka saṃkhya tvam ca kārya svabhāva hetvoḥ eva avinābhāve sati  bādhā pratihetvoḥ asambhavāt vyavacchedya abhāva tvena sati api liṅga dharma tve tat lakṣaṇam
translated: The fact that the object is not contradicted and the intended singularity belong only to effect and nature reasons when there is invariable concomitance,

original: na bhavatīty uktam /
analyzed: na bhavati iti uktam
translated: because contradiction and counter-reasons are impossible. Even though [effect and nature reasons] have the property of being a logical reason due to the absence of what is to be excluded, it is said that they do not have that characteristic.

original: jñānaṃ tu jñātatvam /
analyzed: jñānam tu jñāta tvam
translated: But knowledge is being known.

original: tasyaiva S / / / bhāvapratyayenābhidhānāt /
analyzed: tasya eva s bhāva pratyayena abhidhānāt
translated: Because it is denoted by the suffix of existence.

original: tathā hi jñānaśabdapravṛttinimittaṃ jñātatvam ucyate /
analyzed: tathā hi jñāna śabda pravṛtti nimittam jñāta tvam ucyate
translated: For thus, being known is said to be the reason for the occurrence of the word knowledge.

original: tac ca jñānam eva /
analyzed: tat ca jñānam eva
translated: And that is knowledge itself.

original: tadutpāde sati jñāta iti vyavahārāt /
analyzed: tad utpāde sati jñātaḥ iti vyavahārāt
translated: Because when it is produced, there is the usage it is known.

original: na ca tat liṅgasyātmarūpam iti T / / kathaṃ liṅgalakṣaṇaṃ bhaviṣyati / /
analyzed: na ca tat liṅgasya ātma rūpam iti t katham liṅga lakṣaṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: And since that is not the form of the inferential mark, how can it be the characteristic of the inferential mark?

original: yady api vikalpapratibhāsī sāmanyākāro liṅgatayā 'vasthāpyate tathāpi na jñānasya liṅgadharmatā /
analyzed: yadi api vikalpa pratibhāsī sāmanya ākāraḥ liṅga tayā avasthāpyate tathā api na jñānasya liṅga dharma tā
translated: Even though the universal form that appears in conceptual cognition is established as the inferential mark, still the inferential mark is not a property of knowledge.

original: na hy asau svatantra eva liṅgam /
analyzed: na hi asau svatantraḥ eva liṅgam
translated: For that is not an independent inferential mark by itself.

original: yad āha vikalpabhedāna p / / svatantrāṇām anvarthāśrayaṇāt tatkalpitaviṣayāda'rthapratipattāv anarthapratilambha eva syāt 🔽iti /
analyzed: yat āha svatantrāṇām anvartha āśrayaṇāt anartha pratilambhaḥ eva syāt  iti
translated: As it is said, due to the difference in conceptual cognitions, independent of external objects, if one were to rely on them, then in the cognition of an object imagined by those [conceptual cognitions], one would only obtain a non-existent object.

original: tamād bāhyavastūpādānasyaivāsya liṅgatā 'vasthāpyate /
analyzed: bāhya vastu upādānasya eva asya liṅga tā avasthāpyate
translated: Therefore, it is established that this [knowledge] is the inferential mark only of the external object that is the material cause.

original: sādhyasādhanasaṃkalpe🔽vastudarśanahāneḥsvalakṣaṇasya kvacidananvayāc ca taddharmatām eva tv anusmaranto
analyzed: sādhya sādhana saṃkalpe  kvacid ananvayāt ca tad dharma tām eva tu
translated: In the conception of what is to be established and the means of establishment,🔽because of the loss of the perception of the real thing and because the individual characteristic is not related to anything, the conceptual cognitions, remembering only the property of that [real thing],

original: vikalpā nānaikavyatirekānsaṃdarśayanto vastuni paramparayā pratibandhād avisaṃvādakāḥ
analyzed: vikalpāḥ vastuni paramparayā pratibandhāt avisaṃvādakāḥ
translated: displaying the one, the many, and the absence [of the inferential mark], are non-deceptive with regard to the real thing through an indirect relation.

original: kāryādiliṅgavyapadeśanibandhanaṃ cety uktaprāyam /
analyzed: kārya ādi liṅga vyapadeśa nibandhanam ca iti ukta prāyam
translated: And the basis for the designation of the inferential mark as effect, etc. has been stated almost completely.

original: na ca tasya kāryāder ātmarūpaṃ S / / / jñātam /
analyzed: na ca tasya kārya ādeḥ ātma rūpam jñātam
translated: And the form of the effect etc. is not known to it.

original: vikalpāvabhāsī ca sāmānyākāro naiva vikalpasyātmabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: vikalpa avabhāsī ca sāmānya ākāraḥ na eva vikalpasya ātma bhūtaḥ
translated: And the universal form that appears in conceptual cognition is not the self of conceptual cognition.

original: tasya nīrūpasya vasturūpavirodhāt /
analyzed: tasya nīrūpasya vastu rūpa virodhāt
translated: Because that formless [universal] is contradictory to the form of an entity.

original: tadrūpasya ca vikalpapratibimbacakrasya sāmānyātmatāvirahāt /
analyzed: tad rūpasya ca vikalpa pratibimba cakrasya sāmānya ātma tā virahāt
translated: And because that circle of reflections of conceptual cognition lacks the nature of a universal.

original: yasmād abāhyāsyāpi bāhyatayā vyavasitasyānanuyāyino 'py anuyāyitayā sāmānyāmakatvaṃ tathātve cāsya vikalparūpatayā kutaḥ / yadā ''ha
analyzed: yasmāt bāhya tayā vyavasitasya ananuyāyinaḥ u pi anuyāyi tayā tathātve ca asya vikalpa rūpa tayā kutas yadā ha
translated: Because even though it is not external, it is determined as external, and even though it is not continuous, it is taken as continuous, it has the nature of a universal. And if it were so, how could it be the form of conceptual cognition? When [Dharmakīrti] says:

original: jñānād avyatiriktaṃca katham arthāntaraṃvrajet / //
analyzed: jñānāt avyatiriktam ca katham artha antaram vrajet
translated: How can it, which is not different from cognition, become an object?

original: tasmān mithyāvabhāso 'yam artheṣv ekātmatāgrahaḥ/
analyzed: tasmāt mithyā avabhāsaḥ yam artheṣu eka ātma tā grahaḥ
translated: Therefore, this is a false appearance, the apprehension of oneness in objects.

original: PV / / iti /
analyzed: pu iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: na jñānasya liṅgadharmatā /
analyzed: na jñānasya liṅga dharma tā
translated: The form of cognition is not the property of an inferential mark.

original: etad eva sādhayann āha kiṃrūpād ityādi /🔽kim ātmakāt hetor anumeyo 'rtho jñātavyaḥ iti cintāyāṃ prakṛtāyāṃ pratipattuḥ puṃso
analyzed: etat eva sādhayan āha kiṃrūpāt ityādi  kim ātmakāt hetoḥ anumeyaḥ rthaḥ jñātavyaḥ iti cintāyām prakṛtāyām pratipattuḥ puṃsaḥ
translated: Establishing just this, he says What kind of... and so on.

original: yad avisaṃvādakaṃ liṅgaṃ tasya svarūpam abhidhīyate śāstrakāraiḥ T / / yasya
analyzed: yat avisaṃvādakam liṅgam tasya svarūpam abhidhīyate śāstra kāraiḥ yasya
translated: When the question is raised What kind of object is to be known through inference?, the authors of treatises state the nature of that inferential mark which is non-deceptive for the person who is to understand: that of which

original: rūpasya darśanādayaṃ pratipattā yatra tadrūpasambhavaḥ tat sādhanam tadrūpavikalam
analyzed: rūpasya darśanāt ayam pratipattā yatra tad rūpa sambhavaḥ tat sādhanam tad rūpa vikalam
translated: The non-means of knowledge is that which is devoid of that form.

original: asādhanam iti pravibhāgena vyavasthāpya yat tatra sādhanatvena vyavasthāpitaṃ tasyeṣṭārthasannidhānasampratyayāt🔽pravṛttim avalambate /
analyzed: asādhanam iti pravibhāgena vyavasthāpya yat tatra sādhana tvena vyavasthāpitam tasya iṣṭa artha sannidhāna sampratyayāt  pravṛttim avalambate
translated: Having thus determined the distinction, he relies on the engagement that arises from the conviction of the presence of the desired object in what has been established as the means of knowledge there.

original: tathā / etasmiṃś ca nyāye S / / / vyavasthite yad asya liṅgasyātmarūpaṃ tal lakṣaṇaṃ bhavitum arhati pakṣadharmādivat na tu yat pararūpam🔽syād etad jñātasya liṅgasya sādhakatvād yuktaiva sādhyasiddhyupayogino jñānasya liṅgalakṣaṇatety ata āha pratipattijanmani ityādi /🔽yady anumeyapratītijanmany upayujyate jñānam iti tanmātreṇa liṅgasya lakṣaṇam iṣyate tadā 'tiprasaṅgaḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: tathā etasmin ca nyāye vyavasthite yat asya liṅgasya ātma rūpam tat lakṣaṇam bhavitum arhati pakṣa dharma ādi vat na tu yat para rūpam  syāt etat jñātasya liṅgasya sādhaka tvāt yuktā eva sādhya siddhi upayoginaḥ jñānasya liṅga lakṣaṇa tā iti atas āha pratipatti janmani ityādi  yadi anumeya pratīti janmani upayujyate jñānam iti tad mātreṇa liṅgasya lakṣaṇam iṣyate tadā tiprasaṅgaḥ prāpnoti
translated: Similarly, when this principle is established, the form of the mark that belongs to it is fit to be the definition, like the property of the subject and so on, but not what is the form of the other.🔽This might be said: Since the known mark is the means of establishing, it is proper that the knowledge which is useful for the establishment of what is to be established should be the definition of the mark. To this he says in the production of the cognition and so on.🔽If the knowledge is considered to be the definition of the mark merely because it is useful in the production of the cognition of what is to be inferred, then there would be an overextension.

original: tam evāha evaṃpratipattijanmany upayogamātrāl liṅgalakṣaṇatve prameyasya arthasya
analyzed: tam eva āha evam pratipatti janmani upayoga mātrāt liṅga lakṣaṇa tve prameyasya arthasya
translated: He states that: If the definition of the mark were due to mere usefulness in the production of such a cognition, then the object of knowledge,

original: puruṣasya p / / pramātuḥ adi śabdāt saṃyogasamavāyādīnām ālokamanaskārādīnāṃ
analyzed: puruṣasya p pramātuḥ adi śabdāt saṃyoga samavāya ādīnām āloka manaskāra ādīnām
translated: Of the person, the cognizer, from the word 'ādi', of conjunction, inherence, etc., of light, attention, etc.

original: liṅgalakṣaṇatvaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: liṅga lakṣaṇa tvam bhavet
translated: For the person, the cognizer, from the word 'ādi', the characteristics of the inferential mark would be the conjunction, inherence, etc., and the light, attention, etc.

original: atra kāraṇam āha na hi teṣv api prameyādiṣu asatsu liṅgini jñānaṃ bhavatīti kṛtvā /
analyzed: atra kāraṇam āha na hi teṣu api prameya ādiṣu asatsu liṅgini jñānam bhavati iti kṛtvā
translated: Here, the reason is stated: because knowledge does not occur in those inferential objects, etc., when they are absent.

original: atra paro 'niṣṭam āpādayann āha niścitagrahaṇaṃtarhi ityādi /
analyzed: atra paraḥ niṣṭam āpādayan āha niścita grahaṇam tarhi ityādi
translated: Here, the opponent raises an undesirable consequence, saying Then, the use of the word 'definite'... and so on.

original: yadi pararūpatvāj jñānaṃ liṅgalakṣaṇaṃ na bhavati tadā ca yad etadācāryeṇa
analyzed: yadi para rūpa tvāt jñānam liṅga lakṣaṇam na bhavati tadā ca yat etat ācāryeṇa
translated: If knowledge is not the characteristic of the inferential mark because it is of the nature of the other, then the following statement by the teacher

original: anumeye 'rtha tattulye sadbhāvo nāstitā'sati /
analyzed: anumeye tad tulye sadbhāvaḥ nāstitā asati
translated: Existence in what is similar to the inferable object, and non-existence in what is dissimilar,

original: niściteti
analyzed: niścitā iti
translated: definite...

original: niścitagrahaṇaṃ kṛtaṃ bhavataś cābhimataṃ T / / tan na karttavyam /
analyzed: niścita grahaṇam kṛtam bhavataḥ ca abhimatam t tat na karttavyam
translated: would be made by you, but it should not be done.

original: tathā hi niścayo hi liṅgasya pararūpam eva /
analyzed: tathā hi niścayaḥ hi liṅgasya para rūpam eva
translated: For thus, definiteness is indeed of the nature of the other in the inferential mark.

original: sa cet tallakṣaṇam /
analyzed: sa ced tad lakṣaṇam
translated: And if that is its characteristic,

original: jñānaṃ kim iti neśyate yato niścayo vijñānam eva tadviśeṣatvād asyeti /
analyzed: jñānam kim iti nā īśyate yatas niścayaḥ vijñānam eva tad viśeṣa tvāt asya iti
translated: why is knowledge not accepted, since definiteness is indeed knowledge itself, because it is a particular of that?

original: siddhāntavāy āha na na karttavyaṃ kintu kartavyam eva tasya S / / niścitagrahaṇasya liṅgarūpapratipādanād anyārthatvāt /
analyzed: āha na na karttavyam kintu kartavyam eva tasya niścita grahaṇasya liṅga rūpa pratipādanāt anya artha tvāt
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says: It should not be done, but it should be done, because the use of the word 'definite' has a different purpose than to convey the form of the inferential mark.

original: tām evānyārthatāṃ darśayann āha sapakṣavipakṣayoḥ ityādi /
analyzed: tām eva anya artha tām darśayan āha sapakṣa vipakṣayoḥ ityādi
translated: In order to show that very other meaning, he says in the similar and dissimilar instances and so on.

original: pare hi sapakṣe darśanamātreṇāsapakṣe cādarśanamātrato gamakaṃ hetum icchanti /
analyzed: pare hi sapakṣe darśana mātreṇa a sapakṣe ca a darśana mātrataḥ gamakam hetum icchanti
translated: For others, a reason is convincing merely by being seen in the similar instance and not being seen in the dissimilar instance.

original: teṣāṃ naiva darśanamātreṇa sādhyasiddhau samartho hetur bhavatīti jñāpanārthaṃ niścitagrahaṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: teṣām na eva darśana mātreṇa sādhya siddhau samarthaḥ hetuḥ bhavati iti jñāpana artham niścita grahaṇam kṛtam
translated: In order to show that a reason is not capable of establishing the probandum merely by being seen, the word certain is used.

original: yataḥ sator vidyamānayor api darśanādarśanayor agamakatvaṃ hetor dṛśyate sa śyamaḥ /
analyzed: yatas satoḥ vidyamānayoḥ api darśana adarśanayoḥ agamaka tvam hetoḥ dṛśyate sa śyamaḥ
translated: Because even when the seeing and not seeing exist, the reason is seen to be unconvincing, as in he is dark.

original: tatputratvāt ityādau /🔽yata evaṃ tena kāraṇena sapakṣe bhāvena vipakṣe sarvatrābhāvaviśiṣṭenā 'sapakṣe ca
analyzed: tad putra tvāt ityādau  yatas evam tena kāraṇena sapakṣe bhāvena vipakṣe sarvatra abhāva viśiṣṭena ā sapakṣe ca
translated: Because he is the son of that person, and so on.

original: sarvatrābhāvena sapakṣe tādātmyatadutpattilakṣaṇabhāvaviśiṣṭena gamako hetur ity
analyzed: sarvatra abhāvena sapakṣe tādātmya tad utpatti lakṣaṇa bhāva viśiṣṭena gamakaḥ hetuḥ iti
translated: Since it is so, for that reason, by the existence in the similar instance and by the absence everywhere in the dissimilar instance, which is distinguished by the absence, and by the absence everywhere in the dissimilar instance, which is distinguished by the existence characterized by identity and origination in the similar instance, the reason is convincing.

original: asyārthasya jñāpanārthaṃ lakṣaṇavākye niścitagrahaṇaṃ kṛtaṃ boddhavyam /
analyzed: asya arthasya jñāpana artham lakṣaṇa vākye niścita grahaṇam kṛtam boddhavyam
translated: In order to show this meaning, the word certain should be understood to be used in the definition sentence.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati yāv eva sapakṣavipakṣayoḥ bhāvābhāvau pratibandhasādhakapramāṇavṛttyā niścitau tābhyām
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati yau eva sapakṣa vipakṣayoḥ bhāva abhāvau pratibandha sādhaka pramāṇa vṛttyā niścitau tābhyām
translated: This is what is said: The existence and non-existence in the similar and dissimilar instances, which are ascertained by the operation of the means of knowledge that establishes the relation,

original: eva hetur gamako bhavati /
analyzed: eva hetuḥ gamakaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, the reason becomes the indicator.

original: na tu yathākathañciddarśanamātreṇety asyārthasya S / / jñāpanāya niścitagrahaṇaṃ kṛtam iti /
analyzed: na tu yathā kathañcid darśana mātreṇa iti asya arthasya s jñāpanāya niścita grahaṇam kṛtam iti
translated: But not by mere seeing in any way. For the sake of making this meaning known, the word definite is used.

original: prakṛtam upasaṃharann āha tena ityādi /
analyzed: prakṛtam upasaṃharan āha tena ityādi
translated: Concluding the main point, he says therefore and so on.

original: yena viśiṣṭayor bhāvābhāvayor eva khyāpanāya niścitagrahaṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yena viśiṣṭayoḥ bhāva abhāvayoḥ eva khyāpanāya niścita grahaṇam kṛtam
translated: By which the definite mention is made for the sake of proclaiming only the presence and absence of the distinguished two.

original: na rūpāntarābhidhānāya /
analyzed: na rūpa antara abhidhānāya
translated: Not for the expression of another form.

original: anātmarūpasya T / / ca lakṣaṇatā na yujyate /
analyzed: anātma rūpasya t ca lakṣaṇa tā na yujyate
translated: The definition of that which is not the form of the self is not appropriate.

original: tena pararūpaṃ liṅgasya lakṣaṇaṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: tena para rūpam liṅgasya lakṣaṇam na bhavati
translated: Therefore, the form of the other is not the definition of the reason.

original: yataḥ tena jñānādinā pararūpeṇa liṅgasya na kiñcid rūpaviśeṣo 'bhidhīyata iti /
analyzed: yatas tena jñāna ādinā para rūpeṇa liṅgasya na kiñcid rūpa viśeṣaḥ abhidhīyate iti
translated: Because by that knowledge and so on, the form of the other, nothing particular about the form of the reason is expressed.

original: p / / nanu ca pare 'pi sapakṣavipakṣayor bhāvābhāvābhyāṃ gamakaṃ hetum icchanti /
analyzed: nanu ca pare pi sapakṣa vipakṣayoḥ bhāva abhāvābhyām gamakam hetum icchanti
translated: But don't the others also accept the reason that is an indicator by the presence and absence in the similar and dissimilar instances?

original: darśanādarśane tu tayor eva sādhake /
analyzed: darśana adarśane tu tayoḥ eva sādhake
translated: But seeing and not seeing are the establishers of those two.

original: tat kim arthaṃ niścitagrahaṇam /
analyzed: tat kim artham niścita grahaṇam
translated: Then why is the definite mention made for that purpose?

original: iti / ata āha tau hi ityādi /
analyzed: iti atas āha tau hi ityādi
translated: Therefore he says those two and so on.

original: yady api pare bhāvābhāvābhyām eva gamakaṃ hetum icchanti tathāpi sapakṣa eva bhāvo 'sapakṣe cābhāva eveti bhāvābhāvau darśanādarśanamātrato
analyzed: yadi api pare bhāva abhāvābhyām eva gamakam hetum icchanti tathā api sapakṣe eva sapakṣe ca abhāvaḥ eva iti bhāva abhāvau
translated: Even though the other party wishes to have a probans which is indicative by virtue of existence and non-existence, yet, the existence in similar instances and the non-existence in dissimilar instances are shown by mere seeing and not seeing.

original: vyavasthāpayanti /
analyzed: vyavasthāpayanti
translated: Although the others desire a reason that is a means of knowledge only through existence and non-existence, still they establish existence and non-existence as mere seeing and not seeing, that is, existence only in a similar instance and non-existence only in a dissimilar instance.

original: na ca tatas tau tathāvidhāu sidhyataḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatas tau tathāvidhau sidhyataḥ
translated: And those two are not established in that way from that [mere seeing and not seeing].

original: pratibandhavikalānām apy athānāṃ kvacid bhāvābhāvayoḥ kathañciddarśanādarśanasambhavāt /
analyzed: pratibandha vikalānām api kvacid bhāva abhāvayoḥ kathañcid darśana adarśana sambhavāt
translated: Because for some things lacking the relation [of universal concomitance], existence and non-existence are sometimes seen and sometimes not seen.

original: tasmād S / / yau hetoḥ sapakṣe eva bhāvo 'sapakṣe cābhāva eva ity evam ātmakau
analyzed: tasmāt s yau hetoḥ sapakṣe eva sapakṣe ca abhāve eva iti evam ātmakau
translated: Therefore, the existence and non-existence of a reason that have the nature of [existing] only in a similar instance and [not existing] only in a dissimilar instance,

original: bhāvābhāvau tau tadbhāvasya sādhakaṃ yat pramāṇaṇ tādātmyatadutpattisādhanaviṣayaṃ🔽tadvṛttyā boddhavyau /
analyzed: bhāva abhāvau tau tad bhāvasya sādhakam yat tādātmya tad utpatti sādhana viṣayam  tad vṛttyā boddhavyau
translated: those two are to be understood as the means of knowledge that establish the existence of that [reason] in terms of identity and origination.

original: kutaḥ / upāyāntarasyābhāvāt /🔽tadanabhyupagame hi hetoḥ sapakṣa eva bhāvaḥ sarveśāṃ hetumatāṃ bhāvānāṃ sādhyenānugamadarśane sati vipakṣe cābhāva eva sādhyavikalānāṃ sarvārthānāṃ
analyzed: kutas upāya antarasya abhāvāt  tad anabhyupagame hi hetoḥ sapakṣaḥ eva bhāvaḥ sarva īśām hetumatām bhāvānām sādhyena anugama darśane sati vipakṣe ca abhāvaḥ eva sādhya vikalānām sarva arthānām
translated: By what means? Because there is no other means.

original: hetuviviktānāṃ upalambhe sati syāt /
analyzed: hetu viviktānām upalambhe sati syāt
translated: For if that [identity and origination] is not accepted, then the existence of a reason only in a similar instance and the non-existence only in a dissimilar instance would be possible when all things that have a reason are seen to follow the probandum, and when all things lacking the probandum are apprehended as devoid of the reason.

original: na caitad asarvadarśinaḥ sambhavatīti /
analyzed: na ca etat a sarva darśinaḥ sambhavati iti
translated: And this is not possible for one who does not see everything.

original: yata upayāntaraṃ nāsti tena kāraṇena tayor viśiṣṭayor bhāvābhāvayoḥ pratipādanāya niścitaśabdaḥ prayukto lakṣāṇe lakṣaṇakāeṇeti /
analyzed: yatas na asti tena kāraṇena tayoḥ viśiṣṭayoḥ bhāva abhāvayoḥ pratipādanāya niścita śabdaḥ prayuktaḥ lakṣāṇe lakṣaṇa kāeṇa iti
translated: Since there is no other means, for the purpose of teaching those two specific existences and non-existences, the word 'niścita' (certain) is used in the definition by the author of the Lakṣaṇa (i.e. Dignāga).

original: nanu ca bhāvābhāvavacanamātrād eva pramāṇato niścayo labhyate anyathā tayor eva sattā na prasidhyed iti /
analyzed: nanu ca bhāva abhāva vacana mātrāt eva pramāṇataḥ niścayaḥ labhyate anyathā tayoḥ eva sattā na prasidhyet iti
translated: But certainty is obtained from mere statements of existence and non-existence through valid means of knowledge, otherwise their very existence would not be established.

original: ata āha yady api ityādi /
analyzed: atas āha yadi api ityādi
translated: Therefore he says: Even though, etc.

original: anumeye 'rtha tat tulya sadbhāvo nāstitā'sati /
analyzed: anumeye tad tulya sadbhāvaḥ nāstitā asati
translated: The existence of that in a similar object, and the non-existence in a dissimilar object,

original: ity anenaiva sapakṣāsapakṣayoḥ T / / bhāvābhāvavacanamātreṇa niścitagrahaṇanirapekṣeṇa tayor bhāvābhāvayor yat sādhanaṃ pramāṇaṃ tasya
analyzed: iti anena eva sapakṣa asapakṣayoḥ bhāva abhāva vacana mātreṇa niścita grahaṇa nirapekṣeṇa tayoḥ bhāva abhāvayoḥ yat sādhanam pramāṇam tasya
translated: by this alone, by mere statements of existence and non-existence in similar and dissimilar objects, without regard to the word 'niścita' (certain), the means of valid knowledge which is the proof of those two existences and non-existences,🔽its occurrence is implied.

original: vṛttir yady apy ākṣipyate /
analyzed: vṛttiḥ yadi api ākṣipyate
translated: Even though.

original: kathaṃ punar niścitagrahaṇam antareṇa bhāvābhāvavacanamātratas tadvṛtteḥ ākṣepaḥ /
analyzed: katham punar niścita grahaṇam antareṇa bhāva abhāva vacana mātrataḥ tad vṛtteḥ ākṣepaḥ
translated: But how is its occurrence implied by mere statements of existence and non-existence without the word 'niścita' (certain)?

original: ity āha anyathā yadi tatsādhanapramāṇavṛttir nākṣipyeta /
analyzed: iti āha anyathā yadi tad sādhana pramāṇa vṛttiḥ na ākṣipyeta
translated: To this he says: Otherwise, if the occurrence of that means of valid knowledge were not implied,

original: S / / tadā tayor eva sapakṣavipakṣayor eva bhāvābhāvayor yā sattā svarūpavyavasthā tasyā aprasiddheḥ /
analyzed: tadā tayoḥ eva sapakṣa vipakṣayoḥ eva bhāva abhāvayoḥ yā sattā svarūpa vyavasthā tasyāḥ aprasiddheḥ
translated: Then, because of the non-establishment of the existence, i.e., the nature, of those two, i.e., of existence and non-existence, which are only in similar and dissimilar instances.

original: kasmād aprasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt aprasiddhiḥ
translated: Why is there non-establishment?

original: ity āha jñānasya upalabdher yā sattā utpattiḥ tannibandhanatvāj jñeyasya bhāvābhāvalakṣaṇasya sattāvyavasthāyāḥ svarūpavyavasthiteḥ /
analyzed: iti āha jñānasya upalabdheḥ yā sattā utpattiḥ tad nibandhana tvāt jñeyasya bhāva abhāva lakṣaṇasya sattā vyavasthāyāḥ svarūpa vyavasthiteḥ
translated: He says: because the existence, i.e., the origination, of knowledge, i.e., of perception, is the basis of the existence, i.e., the nature, of the knowable, which is characterized by existence and non-existence.

original: na hy upalambham antareṇa svata evārthāḥ p / / sidhyanti /
analyzed: na hi upalambham antareṇa svatas eva arthāḥ sidhyanti
translated: For objects are not established by themselves without perception,

original: sarvasya sarvasiddhiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: sarvasya sarva siddhi prasaṅgāt
translated: because of the consequence that everything would be established for everyone.

original: tasmād idam evaṃrūpaṃ naivaṃrūpam iti tadākārajñānodayād eva vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tasmāt idam evaṃrūpam na evaṃrūpam iti tad ākāra jñāna udayāt eva vyavasthāpyate
translated: Therefore, it is determined only by the arising of the knowledge that has that form, that it is of this form and not of that form.

original: yata evaṃ tasmāt sarvatra śāstre loke vā jñeyasattāvyavasthaiva niścitagrahaṇaṃ vinā 'pi tatsādhanaṃ
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt sarvatra śāstre loke vā jñeya sattā vyavasthā eva niścita grahaṇam vinā tat sādhanam
translated: Since it is so, therefore, in all treatises or in the world, the establishment of the existence of the knowable itself, even without the definite use of the word 'only',

original: tatsattāsādhanaṃ pramāṇam ākarśati ākṣipatīti /
analyzed: tad sattā sādhanam pramāṇam ākarśati ākṣipati iti
translated: attracts, i.e., implies, the means of knowledge which is the proof of that existence.

original: kiñ ca / parārthatvāc ca śāstrapraṇayanasya tatsādhanapramāṇavṛttir ākṣipyata iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca parārtha tvāt ca śāstra praṇayanasya tad sādhana pramāṇa vṛttiḥ ākṣipyate iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Moreover, the connection is that because the composition of a treatise is for the sake of others, the functioning of the means of knowledge which is its proof is implied.

original: kīdṛśaṃ punas tacchāstrapraṇayanaṃ yat parārtharūpatayā svavyavasthāpitajñeyasattāsādhanaṃ pramāṇam ākṣipati /
analyzed: kīdṛśam punar tad śāstra praṇayanam yat parārtha rūpatayā sva vyavasthāpita jñeya sattā sādhanam pramāṇam ākṣipati
translated: What kind of composition of a treatise is that which, being in the form of another's purpose, contradicts the means of valid knowledge that establishes the existence of the object to be known as established by itself?

original: ity āha trirūpaṃliṅgaṃvaḥsaṃvādakaṃprāpakaṃ T / / vāñcitasyārthasyeti /
analyzed: iti āha  vāñcitasya arthasya iti
translated: Thus he says: The three-featured inferential mark is the means of valid knowledge that brings about the desired object in accordance with the treatise.

original: yadi nāmaivaṃrūpaṃ parārthaṃ śāstrapraṇayanaṃ tathāpi kathaṃ tat sādhanapramāṇavṛttim
analyzed: yadi nāma evaṃrūpam para artham śāstra praṇayanam tathā api katham tat sādhana pramāṇa vṛttim
translated: Even if the composition of a treatise for another's purpose is of this kind, how does it contradict the functioning of the means of valid knowledge that establishes it?

original: ākṣipatīty āha tadrūpaṃ tasya liṅgasya trirūpasya rūpaṃ svabhāvaṃ śāstroktaṃ ye
analyzed: ākṣipati iti āha tad rūpam tasya liṅgasya tri rūpasya rūpam svabhāvam śāstra uktam ye
translated: He says: The form of that, of the three-featured inferential mark, is the nature, the essence, as stated in the treatise, which

original: pratipattāro na vidanti /
analyzed: pratipattāraḥ na vidanti
translated: those who understand do not know.

original: na teśāṃ tatas trirūpāl liṅgāc chāstroktād vāñcite 'rthe pravṛttir bhavati /
analyzed: na tatas tri rūpāt liṅgāt śāstra uktāt vāñcite rthe pravṛttiḥ bhavati
translated: For them, the engagement in the desired object does not arise from that three-featured inferential mark stated in the treatise.

original: ajñātasyārthasya S / / jñāpakasya svasattāmātreṇa pravartakatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: ajñātasya arthasya jñāpakasya sva sattā mātreṇa pravartaka tva abhāvāt
translated: Because an unknown object, even if it is an indicator, does not cause engagement by its mere existence.

original: yata evam iti tasmāt paropalakṣaṇatvād eva pareṣāṃ jñāpakatvād eva pravarttake trirūpaliṅge jñānaṃ siddham iti yady api niścitagrahaṇam atiricyate
analyzed: yatas evam iti tasmāt para upalakṣaṇa tvāt eva pareṣām jñāpaka tvāt eva pravarttake trirūpa liṅge jñānam siddham iti yadi api niścita grahaṇam atiricyate
translated: Since this is so, therefore, because it is for the purpose of indicating to others, because it is for the purpose of making others understand, the knowledge of the three-featured inferential mark that causes engagement is established. Even though the use of the word certain is redundant,🔽nevertheless, those two

original: tathāpi tāv eva
analyzed: tathā api tau eva
translated: are

original: liṅgasya sapakṣāsapakṣayor bhāvābhāvau viśiṣṭau śastroktau sapakṣa eva bhāvo 'sapakṣe cābhāva eva ity evaṃrūpau kecinnaiyāyika prabhṛtayaḥ /
analyzed: liṅgasya sapakṣa asapakṣayoḥ bhāva abhāvau viśiṣṭau śastra uktau sapakṣe eva sapakṣe ca abhāvaḥ eva iti evaṃrūpau kecid naiyāyika prabhṛtayaḥ
translated: Some Naiyāyikas and others have stated the presence and absence of the inferential mark in similar and dissimilar instances to be specific, meaning that the presence is only in similar instances and the absence is only in dissimilar instances.

original: pare darśanādarśanamātreṇa ye darśanādarśane pratibandhasādhake na bhavataḥ 🔽tanmātreṇa vyavasthāpayanti yata eva iti tasmāt teṣāṃ vādināṃ niśedhārtho 'yaṃ
analyzed: pare darśana adarśana mātreṇa ye darśana adarśane pratibandha sādhake na bhavataḥ  tanmātreṇa vyavasthāpayanti yatas iti tasmāt teṣām vādinām niśedha arthaḥ yam
translated: Others, on the other hand, establish [the presence and absence of the inferential mark] merely by perception and non-perception, where perception and non-perception are not sufficient to establish the relation [between the inferential mark and the property to be inferred].

original: lakṣaṇe niścitaśabdaḥ prayuktaācāryeṇāsmābhiś cābhyupagata iti /
analyzed: lakṣaṇe niścita śabdaḥ prayuktaḥ ācāryeṇa asmābhiḥ ca abhyupagataḥ iti
translated: For that very reason, this [word] 'niścita' (certain) is used in the definition by the teacher [Dharmakīrti] and accepted by us, in order to refute the views of those [Naiyāyikas and others].

original: yadi tu paravipratipattiḥ na syāt tadā naivāsau prayujyeteti /
analyzed: yadi tu para vipratipattiḥ na syāt tadā na eva asau prayujyeta iti
translated: But if there were no disagreement with others, then it would not be used at all.

original: kim iti punar darśanādarśanābhyāṃ bhāvābhāvaviśayābhyāṃ sapakṣāsapakśayoḥ viśiṣṭau
analyzed: kim iti punar darśana a darśanābhyām bhāva abhāva viśayābhyām sapakṣa asapakśayoḥ viśiṣṭau
translated: Why then should the presence and absence, which are the objects of perception and non-perception, be specific in similar and dissimilar instances,

original: bhāvābhāvāv anvayavyatirekātmakau T / / neṣyeta ity āha sator api ityādi
analyzed: bhāva abhāvau anvaya vyatireka ātmakau iti āha satoḥ api ityādi
translated: and why should the presence and absence, which consist of positive and negative concomitance, not be accepted by you? He says:

original: saty api kvacit sapakṣe bhāvadarśane hetoḥ kvacic cāsapakṣe 'bhāvadarśane sa śyamaḥ /
analyzed: sati api kvacid sapakṣe bhāva darśane hetoḥ kvacid ca a sapakṣe bhāva darśane sa śyamaḥ
translated: Even though the presence of the reason is sometimes seen in similar instances and its absence is sometimes seen in dissimilar instances, that [reason] is not ascertained.

original: tatputratvāt ityādāv anvayavyatirekayoḥ saṃśayāt /
analyzed: tad putra tvāt ityādau anvaya vyatirekayoḥ saṃśayāt
translated: Because of the doubt regarding the positive and negative concomitance in the case of such statements as because of being its son.

original: tathā hi anvayo nāma sarvatra saty eva sādhye hetor p / / bhāvo vyāptyā cāsati sādhye hetor abhāvo vyatirekaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi anvayaḥ nāma sarvatra sati eva sādhye hetoḥ bhāvaḥ vyāptyā ca asati sādhye hetoḥ abhāvaḥ vyatirekaḥ
translated: For, positive concomitance is the presence of the reason everywhere where the probandum is present, and negative concomitance is the absence of the reason when the probandum is absent, by the relation of pervasion.

original: na ca kvacit sati sādhye S / / hetor bhāvadarśane 'pi tanmātreṇa tathābhāvaḥ sarvatra bhavati /
analyzed: na ca kvacid sati sādhye hetoḥ bhāva darśane tad mātreṇa tathābhāvaḥ sarvatra bhavati
translated: And even when the presence of the reason is seen in some cases where the probandum is present, it does not follow that it is so everywhere,

original: apratibaddhasvabhāvānāṃ sahabhāvaniyamā 'bhāvāt /
analyzed: apratibaddha svabhāvānām sahabhāva niyamāḥ bhāvāt
translated: because things whose nature is not restricted cannot be restricted to co-existence.

original: tathā kvacit sādhyābhimatasyābhāve saty abhāvadarśane 'pi hetoḥ sarvatra tadabhāve 'vaśyam abhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā kvacid sādhya abhimatasya abhāve sati abhāva darśane hetoḥ sarvatra tad abhāve vaśyam abhāvaḥ
translated: Similarly, even when the absence of the reason is seen in some cases where the probandum is absent, it does not necessarily follow that the reason is absent everywhere where the probandum is absent.

original: tadanāyat tasya tannivṛttau niyamena nivṛttyabhāvāt /
analyzed: tasya tad nivṛttau niyamena nivṛtti abhāvāt
translated: Because when it does not bring about that, there is no certainty of its cessation upon the cessation of that.

original: tasmāt pratibandhaprasādhakapramāṇavṛttyaiva yathoktau sapakṣāsapakṣayoḥ bhāvābhāvau sidhyataḥ nānyatheti vipratipattinirāsārtham eva niścitagrahaṇaṃ
analyzed: tasmāt pratibandha prasādhaka pramāṇa vṛttyā eva yathā uktau sapakṣa asapakṣayoḥ bhāva abhāvau sidhyataḥ na anyathā iti vipratipatti nirāsa artham eva niścita grahaṇam
translated: Therefore, the presence and absence in the similar and dissimilar instances as stated are established only by the operation of the means of knowledge that proves the restriction, not otherwise. Thus, the word certain is used only to remove disagreement.

original: kṛtam ity upadarśayann āha tasmāt ityādi /
analyzed: kṛtam iti upadarśayan āha tasmāt ityādi
translated: To show this, he says therefore and so on.

original: asmābhiḥ ityācāryakṛte niścitagrahaṇe 'nyatrāsmākam abhimatatvāt asmābhiḥ ity āha /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ iti ācārya kṛte niścita grahaṇe nyatra asmākam abhimata tvāt asmābhiḥ iti āha
translated: We means that when the word definite is used by the teacher, since it is not accepted by us elsewhere, he says by us.

original: tad evaṃ vipratipattinirāsārthaṃ niścitagrahaṇam /
analyzed: tat evam vipratipatti nirāsa artham niścita grahaṇam
translated: Thus, the word definite is used to refute disagreement.

original: asatyāṃ tu vipratipattau tan na kartavyam eveti pratipādya ata eva nyāyāt jñātatvaṃ rūpāntaraṃ na bhāvatīti T / / darśayann āha yato
analyzed: asatyām tu vipratipattau tat na kartavyam eva iti pratipādya atas eva nyāyāt jñāta tvam rūpa antaram na darśayan āha yatas
translated: But when there is no disagreement, it should not be used at all. Having shown this, he says that from that very reasoning, the knownness is not a separate form.

original: 'pi ityādi /
analyzed: pi ityādi
translated: He says yato api and so on.

original: pṛthag ataḥ iti pakṣadharmatvādes trairūpyāt /
analyzed: pṛthak atas iti pakṣa dharma tva ādeḥ trairūpyāt
translated: Distinct from that means from the three forms of the property of the subject and so on.

original: kutaḥ / /
analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: tenaiva trairūpyavacanenaiva tatsādhanapramāṇākṣepataḥ avagatatvāt pratipannatvād iti /
analyzed: tena eva trairūpya vacanena eva tad sādhana pramāṇa ākṣepataḥ avagata tvāt pratipanna tvāt iti
translated: Because it is understood, known, by the implication of the proof of that very statement of the three forms.

original: kiṃvat / upanayārthavat pakṣadharmatvāt iti /
analyzed: kiṃvat upanaya arthavat pakṣa dharma tvāt iti
translated: Like what? Like the meaning of the application, from the property of the subject.

original: yathā pakṣadharmatvavacanenaiva hetor upanayasyārtho 'vagatas tasya dharmiṇi hetoḥ sadbhāvapradarśanātmakatvāt /
analyzed: yathā pakṣa dharma tva vacanena eva hetoḥ upanayasya arthaḥ vagataḥ tasya dharmiṇi hetoḥ sadbhāva pradarśana ātmaka tvāt
translated: Just as by the statement of the property of the subject alone, the meaning of the application of the reason is understood, because its nature is to show the presence of the reason in the subject,

original: pakṣadharmavacanasya ca tadrūpatvāt tataḥ pṛthagupanayo S / / rūpāntaraṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: pakṣa dharma vacanasya ca tad rūpa tvāt tatas rūpa antaram na bhavati
translated: and because the statement of the property of the subject has that form, the application is not a separate form distinct from that.

original: tathā trairūpyāt jñānaṃ /
analyzed: tathā trairūpyāt jñānam
translated: In the same way, knowledge is from the three forms.

original: tadvacanenaivāvagatatvād iti /
analyzed: tad vacanena eva avagata tvāt iti
translated: because it is understood by that statement itself.

original: atra paro 'niṣṭam āpādayann āha anvayavyatirekayor api ityādi /🔽yadi trairūpyavacanenaiva sāmarthyāj jñānaṃ labhyata iti tat tataḥ pṛthag na vaktavyam hanta tarhi anvayāt pṛthag vyatireko na vaktavyaḥ vyatirekāc
analyzed: atra paraḥ niṣṭam āpādayan āha anvaya vyatirekayoḥ api ityādi  yadi trairūpya vacanena eva sāmarthyāt jñānam labhyate iti tat tatas pṛthak na vaktavyam hanta tarhi anvayāt pṛthak vyatirekaḥ na vaktavyaḥ vyatirekāt  /
translated: Here, the opponent, bringing about an undesirable consequence, says Even with regard to positive and negative concomitance, etc.🔽If knowledge is obtained by implication itself from the statement of the three aspects, then it should not be stated separately from that. Well then, negative concomitance should not be stated separately from positive concomitance, and

original: ca pṛthaganvayaḥ /
analyzed: ca pṛthak anvayaḥ
translated: positive concomitance should not be stated separately from negative concomitance.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam / /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: ekasyānvayasya vyatirekasya vā prayogād ubhayasya gateḥ /
analyzed: ekasya anvayasya vyatirekasya vā prayogāt ubhayasya gateḥ
translated: Because both are understood from the statement of one positive or negative concomitance.

original: kṛtaṃ ca tayoḥ pṛthagvacanaṃ /
analyzed: kṛtam ca tayoḥ pṛthak vacanam
translated: And the separate statement of those two has been made.

original: tathā jñātatvasyāpi trairūpyād gamyamānasyāpi pṛthagvacanaṃ karttavyam iti /
analyzed: tathā jñāta tvasya api trairūpyāt gamyamānasya api pṛthak vacanam karttavyam iti
translated: Similarly, even though knownness is understood from the three aspects, a separate statement of it should be made.

original: siddhāntavādy āha na /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha na
translated: The proponent of the established doctrine says No.

original: hetoḥ ityādi /
analyzed: hetoḥ ityādi
translated: Of the reason, etc.

original: nānvayavyatirekayor na pṛthaktvaṃ kintu bhinnarūpataiva /
analyzed: na anvaya vyatirekayoḥ na pṛthaktvam kintu bhinna rūpa tā eva
translated: There is no difference between positive and negative concomitance, but rather a difference in form.

original: tathā hi anvayo hetoḥ p / / sapakṣe bhāva ucyate /
analyzed: tathā hi anvayaḥ hetoḥ sapakṣe bhāvaḥ ucyate
translated: This is because positive concomitance is said to be the presence of the reason in similar instances.

original: vyatirekaḥ punar abhāvo 'sapakṣe /
analyzed: vyatirekaḥ punar sapakṣe
translated: Negative concomitance, on the other hand, is the absence in dissimilar instances.

original: na ca tau parasparam ākṣipataḥ T / / parasparam antarbhavato vidhipratiṣedharūpayor bhinnasvabhāvatvāt /
analyzed: na ca tau parasparam ākṣipataḥ parasparam antarbhavataḥ vidhi pratiṣedha rūpayoḥ bhinna svabhāva tvāt
translated: And they do not contradict each other, because they are included in each other, since the form of injunction and prohibition are of different natures.

original: na ca yo yato bhinnasvabhāvaḥ sa tatrāntarbhūto yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na ca yaḥ yatas bhinna svabhāvaḥ sa tatra antarbhūtaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: And it is not reasonable that what is of a different nature from something should be included in it.

original: nanu ca yady anvayavyatirekayor bhinnarūpatā kathaṃ tarhi trairūpaṃ liṅgam ucyate / /
analyzed: nanu ca yadi anvaya vyatirekayoḥ bhinna rūpa tā katham tarhi trairūpam liṅgam ucyate
translated: But if affirmation and negation have different forms, then how is the inferential mark said to have three aspects?

original: na hi parasparabhinnāv ātmānāv evāsya yujyate /
analyzed: na hi paraspara bhinnau ātmānau eva asya yujyate
translated: For it is not reasonable for it to have two natures that are mutually different.

original: svabhāvabhedalakṣaṇatvād vastubhedasya /
analyzed: svabhāva bheda lakṣaṇa tvāt vastu bhedasya
translated: Because the difference of entities is characterized by the difference of their natures.

original: naiṣa doṣaḥ /🔽yato yathā 'nvayavyatirekau S / / vyavasthāpyete na vā nayopyete tathā tayo
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ  yatas yathā nvaya vyatirekau vyavasthāpyete na vā nayā upyete tathā tayoḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: r anantarbhāva ucyate nānyathā /
analyzed: R anantarbhāvaḥ ucyate na anyathā
translated: Because affirmation and negation are established as they are, or not established as they are, in that way their non-inclusion is said, not otherwise.

original: kathaṃ caitau vavasthāpyete / /
analyzed: katham ca etau vavasthāpyete
translated: And how are these two established?

original: vyāvṛttikṛtaṃ bhedam upādāya /
analyzed: vyāvṛtti kṛtam bhedam upādāya
translated: By taking the difference made by exclusion.

original: tathā cānayor bhinnarūpataiva /
analyzed: tathā ca anayoḥ bhinna rūpatā eva
translated: And in that way, they themselves have a different form.

original: vyāvṛttibhede 'pi ca paramārthato bhedo nāstīty ekaṃ liṅgaṃ trirūpam ity ucyata iti /
analyzed: vyāvṛtti bhede ca paramārthataḥ bhedaḥ na asti iti ekam liṅgam trirūpam iti ucyate iti
translated: And even though there is a difference of exclusion, ultimately there is no difference, so it is said that the single inferential mark has three aspects.

original: kathaṃ tarhi prāguktamnānayor arthaḥ kaścid bhedaḥ /
analyzed: katham tarhi arthaḥ kaścid bhedaḥ
translated: But how then was it said before: There is no difference in meaning between these two.

original: anyatra prayogabhedād iti /
analyzed: anyatra prayoga bhedāt iti
translated: Except for the difference in the application.

original: ata āha ekaṃvākyam ityādi /
analyzed: atas āha ekaṃvākyam ityādi
translated: Therefore he says: A single sentence, etc.

original: anvayamukhena vyatirekamukheṇa vā prayuktam ekaṃ vākyam ubhayam anvayaṃ vyatirekaṃ ca bhinnalakṣaṇam eva gamayatīty ucyate 'smābhir naiko 'rthaḥ
analyzed: anvaya mukhena vyatireka mukheṇa vā prayuktam ekam vākyam ubhayam anvayam vyatirekam ca bhinna lakṣaṇam eva gamayati iti ucyate smābhiḥ na ekaḥ rthaḥ
translated: We say that a single sentence used either by the method of agreement or by the method of difference conveys both agreement and difference, which have different characteristics. We do not say that one meaning

original: svabhāvo dvitīyasyocyate /
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ dvitīyasya ucyate
translated: is stated as the nature of the second.

original: parasparabhinnayor evaikavākyārtharūpatvāt /
analyzed: paraspara bhinnayoḥ eva eka vākya artha rūpa tvāt
translated: Because only mutually different things can have the form of the meaning of a single sentence.

original: atra para āha natunu
analyzed: atra paras āha na tu nu
translated: Here the opponent says: But rather,

original: tatraiva ityādi /
analyzed: tatra eva ityādi
translated: in that very [sentence], etc.

original: ayam abhiprāyaḥ lakṣaṇavākyapratipāditāv anvayavyatirekāv āśritya parasparāntarbhāvaścodyate /
analyzed: ayam abhiprāyaḥ lakṣaṇa vākya pratipāditau anvaya vyatirekau āśritya paraspara antarbhāvaḥ codyate
translated: The intention is that the agreement and difference conveyed by the definitional sentence are relied upon, and their mutual inclusion is questioned.

original: sa ca vidyataeva /🔽tathā hi tatraiva bhāvaḥ ity atra lakṣaṇavākye tadarthatayātadabhāve 'bhāvo gamyate /
analyzed: sa ca  tathā hi tatra eva bhāvaḥ iti atra lakṣaṇa vākye bhāvaḥ gamyate
translated: And that does exist.🔽For in that very definitional sentence existence only when there is that, the non-existence in the absence of that is conveyed.

original: atadabhāve 'vaśyam abhāvaḥ iti T / / cātra tadbhāve bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: a tad abhāve vaśyam abhāvaḥ iti ca atra tad bhāve bhāvaḥ
translated: And in necessarily non-existence in the absence of that, the existence when there is that is conveyed.

original: na hy asati pratibandha ekābhāve 'parasyābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na hi asati pratibandhe eka abhāve parasya abhāvaḥ
translated: For without a connection, the non-existence of one thing does not imply the non-existence of another.

original: pratibandhaś ca tādātmyatadutpattibhyāṃ tadbhāve bhāvarūpa eva /
analyzed: pratibandhaḥ ca tādātmya tad utpattibhyām tad bhāve bhāva rūpaḥ eva
translated: And the connection is by identity and origination, which have the form of existence only when there is that.

original: tataś caikenaiva sapakṣāsapakṣyor bhāvābhāvapratipādakena S / / prativiśiṣṭena lakṣaṇavākyenobhayagater dvitīyavacanaṃ na karttavyam iti
analyzed: tatas ca ekena eva sapakṣa asapakṣyoḥ bhāva abhāva pratipādakena s prativiśiṣṭena lakṣaṇa vākyena ubhaya gateḥ dvitīya vacanam na karttavyam iti
translated: And then, by a single distinguishing characteristic statement that establishes the presence and absence in the similar and dissimilar instances, both [anvaya and vyatireka] are conveyed, so a second statement need not be made.

original: tathā caikavākyārthāntarbhāvād bhinnasvabhāvatā 'py anayor durllabhā /
analyzed: tathā ca eka vākya artha antarbhāvāt bhinna svabhāva tā pi anayoḥ durllabhā
translated: And thus, because they are included in the meaning of a single sentence, it is difficult to find a different nature for these two.

original: tataś ca yaduktam anvayavyatirekayor api tarhi na pṛthaktvam iti tat tadavastham eveti /
analyzed: tatas ca yat uktam anvaya vyatirekayoḥ api tarhi na pṛthaktvam iti tat tad avastham eva iti
translated: And therefore, what was said - that then there is no difference even between anvaya and vyatireka - remains just as it was.

original: p / / siddhāntavādy āha vacanam etad tatraiva bhāvaḥ ityādirūpam ubhayamākṣipati pratipādayati /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha vacanam etat tatra eva bhāvaḥ ityādi rūpam ubhayam ākṣipati pratipādayati
translated: The proponent of the established view says: This statement, in the form existence there itself and so on, implies both.

original: kutaḥ / /🔽sāmarthyād ubhayapratipādanaśaktasya / /🔽niyamas vyāpakasya sapakṣa eva bhāvo 'sapakṣe cābhāva eva iti sāvadhāraṇasya dvitīyākṣepanāntarīyakatvāt dvitīyapratipādananāntarīyakatvāt
analyzed: kutas  sāmarthyāt ubhaya pratipādana śaktasya  niyamaḥ vyāpakasya sapakṣe eva sapakṣe ca abhāvaḥ eva iti sa avadhāraṇasya dvitīya ākṣepa nāntarīyaka tvāt dvitīya pratipādana nāntarīyaka tvāt
translated: Why?🔽Because of the capacity to convey both, of that which has the power to convey both.🔽The restriction - that the all-pervading [property] exists only in the similar instance and is absent only in the dissimilar instance - is necessarily implied by the second statement, because it is necessarily implied by the conveyance of the second.
